     1: GitHub Actions publish workflow requires these secrets in the repository settings:
     2: 
     3: - `VSCE_TOKEN` — Personal Access Token for Visual Studio Marketplace (used by `@vscode/vsce publish`) 
     4: - `OPEN_VSX_TOKEN` — API token for Open VSX (optional)
     5: 
     6: To add secrets:
     7: 1. Go to your GitHub repository → Settings → Secrets and variables → Actions → New repository secret.
     8: 2. Add `VSCE_TOKEN` and `OPEN_VSX_TOKEN` values.
     9: 
    10: Trigger the workflow manually under Actions → Publish VS Code extension → Run workflow or push a tag `v*` to automatically run.
    11: 


============================
FILE: docs\HYBRID.md
============================
============================
     1: # CORTEX HYBRID — Neural Bus for QFLUSH
     2: 
     3: CORTEX Hybrid is the migration plan and runtime mode that allows QFLUSH to run both the legacy HTTP daemon and the new PNG-based internal bus (CORTEX) side-by-side.
     4: 
     5: ## Modes
     6: - `daemon` — legacy: start only the HTTP daemon (default legacy behavior).
     7: - `cortex` — start only the PNG bus (CORTEX) and SPYDER watcher; HTTP daemon disabled.
     8: - `hybrid` — start both CORTEX and the HTTP daemon (fallback). Default for smooth migration.
     9: 
    10: Control via environment variable:
    11: 
    12: ```bash
    13: export QFLUSH_MODE=hybrid  # or daemon / cortex
    14: ```
    15: 
    16: ## Files and folders
    17: - `.qflush/cortex/inbox/` — incoming PNG commands
    18: - `.qflush/cortex/outbox/` — outgoing PNG responses
    19: - `src/cortex/` — encoder, decoder, bus and CLI helpers
    20: - `src/core/qflush-mode.ts` — mode detection
    21: - `src/core/start-system.ts` — starts CORTEX and/or daemon depending on mode
    22: 
    23: ## How it works (overview)
    24: 1. CLI encodes a command into a compressed PNG (Brotli → RGB → OC8 checksum).
    25: 2. CLI writes PNG into `.qflush/cortex/inbox`.
    26: 3. SPYDER / CORTEX watcher decodes, executes the command, writes a response PNG to `.qflush/cortex/outbox`.
    27: 4. CLI reads response PNG and cleans up.
    28: 
    29: ## Migration plan
    30: Phase 1 — HYBRID (current)
    31: - Both systems active. Tests run in `cortex` mode by default.
    32: 
    33: Phase 2 — migrate endpoints to use `cortexSend(...)` (NPZ/BAT/JOKER/Rome)
    34: 
    35: Phase 3 — decommission HTTP daemon and remove middleware, tokens, HMAC, ports
    36: 
    37: Phase 4 — CORTEX-only: PNG bus becomes the official transport
    38: 
    39: ## Running locally
    40: - Build: `npm run build`
    41: - Start hybrid (in-process): `qflush daemon --no-detach` (will start systems per `QFLUSH_MODE`)
    42: - Start CORTEX only: `QFLUSH_MODE=cortex qflush daemon --no-detach`
    43: - Send a command: `qflush cortex "npz/sleep"`
    44: 
    45: ## CI
    46: `vitest.setup.js` forces `process.env.QFLUSH_MODE='cortex'` so tests run without starting the HTTP daemon.
    47: 
    48: ## Notes
    49: - OC8 provides payload integrity. No HMAC is required.
    50: - Replay protection is implemented in-memory in the decoder.
    51: - This is an experimental prototype; improve persistence and durable replay protection (e.g. Redis) if needed.
    52: 


============================
FILE: docs\IDEAS.md
============================
============================
     1: # IDEAS — Cortex / SPYDER Plan (from `ideas_packet.json`)
     2: 
     3: Source: `.qflush/incoming/json/ideas_packet.json` (id: `ideas-20251123-01`)
     4: 
     5: Summary
     6: -------
     7: This document converts the short ideas packet into a concrete implementation plan for QFLUSH / SPYDER / CORTEX. Each idea is mapped to a set of actions, files to touch, priority and testing suggestions. Implement in small, reviewable steps.
     8: 
     9: Table of Contents
    10: -----------------
    11: - CORTEX-DRIP
    12: - NPZ-GRAPH
    13: - OC8-LANG
    14: - QUANTUM-ROUTER
    15: - SPYDER-SOUND
    16: - SAVE-STATE
    17: - AUTO-PATCH
    18: - SPYDER-VISION
    19: - A11-KEY
    20: - FUNESTERIE-MAGIE
    21: - Cross-cutting: dedupe, archival, config, safety, tests
    22: - MVP implementation ordering
    23: 
    24: 1) CORTEX-DRIP
    25: --------------
    26: Purpose
    27: : lightweight event publishing for Cortex; a stream/log sink for events coming from router.
    28: 
    29: Concrete tasks
    30: - Add `src/cortex/emit.ts` with `cortexEmit(eventName, payload)` that appends to `.qflush/cortex/drip.log` and optionally emits an EventEmitter event.
    31: - Add router handler for `CORTEX-DRIP` that calls `cortexEmit`.
    32: 
    33: Files
    34: - `src/cortex/emit.ts` (new)
    35: - `src/cortex/router.ts` (update)
    36: - `.qflush/cortex/drip.log`
    37: 
    38: Priority: medium
    39: Tests: unit test router -> verifies `cortexEmit` writes log and event emitted.
    40: 
    41: 2) NPZ-GRAPH
    42: -----------
    43: Purpose
    44: : ingest packets to turn into NPZ/graph artifacts or trigger Rome linker.
    45: 
    46: Concrete tasks
    47: - Map `NPZ-GRAPH` packet to call `executeAction('npz.encode', { path })` or call `src/rome/linker` functions to recompute links and write `.qflush/rome-links.json`.
    48: - Add router/apply handler `applyNpzGraph`.
    49: 
    50: Files
    51: - `src/cortex/applyPacket.ts` (extend, already done in MVP)
    52: - tests: simulate packet -> check `.qflush/npz` index or `.qflush/rome-links.json` updated.
    53: 
    54: Priority: high
    55: 
    56: 3) OC8-LANG
    57: -----------
    58: Purpose
    59: : support OC8 canvas-language encoding (PNG with Brotli payload). Provide tools to encode/decode and docs.
    60: 
    61: Concrete tasks
    62: - Ensure `src/cortex/pngCodec.ts` supports red-curtain (R-only) and general RGBA decoding (already implemented heuristics).
    63: - Add `docs/CORTEX-PACKET.md` entry for OC8 and code snippets.
    64: - Add CLI helpers in `tools/` for quick decoding/encoding.
    65: 
    66: Priority: medium
    67: 
    68: 4) QUANTUM-ROUTER
    69: -----------------
    70: Purpose
    71: : dynamic, scored routing for Cortex packets. Allow routes to have `enabled`, `score`, and other metadata.
    72: 
    73: Concrete tasks
    74: - Extend `.qflush/cortex.routes.json` format: map action → `{ enabled: boolean, score: number }`.
    75: - Router consults this file and picks enabled handlers preferring higher score.
    76: - Provide API to update a route's score via a packet `cortex:routes` or `router:update`.
    77: 
    78: Priority: medium
    79: 
    80: 5) SPYDER-SOUND
    81: ---------------
    82: Purpose
    83: : audio/alert subsystem for SPYDER (log + optional webhook/emit).
    84: 
    85: Concrete tasks
    86: - Add a router handler `SPYDER-SOUND` that logs the event and optionally posts to configured webhook.
    87: 
    88: Priority: low
    89: 
    90: 6) SAVE-STATE
    91: -------------
    92: Purpose
    93: : snapshot the .qflush state and persist snapshots.
    94: 
    95: Concrete tasks
    96: - Implement `SAVE-STATE` handler that writes `.qflush/state.json` and timestamped snapshots in `.qflush/snapshots/`.
    97: - Allow optional payload to include additional state fields to merge.
    98: 
    99: Priority: high
   100: 
   101: 7) AUTO-PATCH
   102: -------------
   103: Purpose
   104: : safe automated patching of `.qflush/config.json` or other config files via a packet.
   105: 
   106: Concrete tasks
   107: - Implement `AUTO-PATCH` with dry-run mode and an approvals model.
   108: - Dry-run writes to `.qflush/patches/dryrun-<id>.json` and logs a summary.
   109: - Only when `approve: true` in payload or via CLI flag, apply the patch.
   110: - Safety: whitelist keys allowed to be patched by packets; log and audit every patch.
   111: 
   112: Priority: high (security-sensitive)
   113: 
   114: 8) SPYDER-VISION
   115: ----------------
   116: Purpose
   117: : image analysis pipeline for SPYDER that can process sent images and write outputs to graph.
   118: 
   119: Concrete tasks
   120: - Provide `src/cortex/vision.ts` to accept PNGs, decode payload, and create a `.qflush/spyder-vision.json` or inject into Rome engine.
   121: 
   122: Priority: medium
   123: 
   124: 9) A11-KEY
   125: ----------
   126: Purpose
   127: : persist A11 (local LLM service) credentials/config and optionally start the service.
   128: 
   129: Concrete tasks
   130: - Handler writes to `.qflush/a11.config.json` (respect local secrets policy), optionally support encrypted storage.
   131: - Optionally invoke `runA11('start')` when `start:true`.
   132: 
   133: Priority: medium
   134: 
   135: 10) FUNESTERIE-MAGIE
   136: --------------------
   137: Purpose
   138: : a catch-all for creative/experimental packets: playground actions logged to `.qflush/magic.log`.
   139: 
   140: Concrete tasks
   141: - Implement router handler that writes to `.qflush/magic.log` and stores a small record.
   142: 
   143: Priority: low
   144: 
   145: Cross-cutting features
   146: ----------------------
   147: - Deduplication: persist applied packet ids into `.qflush/spyder.cache.json` to avoid re-applying packets. (MVP implemented.)
   148: - Archival: move processed incoming files into `.qflush/processed/<YYYY-MM>/` after successfully applying them. (MVP implemented.)
   149: - Config-driven enablement: router must consult `.qflush/cortex.routes.json` to enable/disable route handlers at runtime.
   150: - Safety: `AUTO-PATCH` must require explicit approval; `apply` should have `--approve` flag for CLI application on sensitive operations.
   151: - Logging & audit: every applied packet should be recorded in `.qflush/cortex.last.json` and optionally appended to `.qflush/cortex.log`.
   152: - Tests: add Vitest tests for `pngCodec` round-trip, `applyPacket` handlers, and router dispatch.
   153: 
   154: MVP Implementation Order (recommended)
   155: -------------------------------------
   156: 1. Deduplication & archival (already implemented).  
   157: 2. SAVE-STATE (snapshot) and NPZ-GRAPH handler (already implemented).  
   158: 3. AUTO-PATCH dry-run + apply (basic implementation implemented).  
   159: 4. Make router consult cortex.routes.json and create route stubs for all names.  
   160: 5. Add CORTEX-DRIP emitter and SPYDER-VISION minimal pipeline.  
   161: 6. Add tests and docs.
   162: 
   163: How to proceed now
   164: -------------------
   165: - I can commit these changes incrementally and run tests.  
   166: - Confirm whether to:
   167:   - enable auto-apply of `cortex:routes` packets (current behavior writes `.qflush/cortex.routes.json`), and
   168:   - move applied JSONs to a dated archive folder (already being created for applied packets).  
   169: 
   170: If you confirm, I will:
   171: - create `docs/IDEAS.md` (this file), commit and push, and
   172: - implement remaining router stubs and config-driven enablement + tests (start doing step 4 and 5).
   173: 
   174: ---
   175: 
   176: Generated from ideas packet id `ideas-20251123-01` on `$(new Date().toISOString())`.
   177: 


============================
FILE: docs\LICENSING.md
============================
============================
     1: qflush Licensing (Gumroad)
     2: 
     3: Overview
     4: 
     5: This project integrates with Gumroad for license sales and verification. You can sell monthly or yearly licenses and validate keys using Gumroad's license API.
     6: 
     7: Recommended products on Gumroad:
     8: - qflush Monthly - €5/month
     9: - qflush Yearly - €39/year
    10: 
    11: Steps to configure
    12: 
    13: 1. Create products on Gumroad and enable license keys.
    14: 2. Obtain your Gumroad account token (Personal access token) or use public product id for verification.
    15: 3. Add token to your daemon or CI as environment variable `GUMROAD_TOKEN` (for server-side verify) or store securely in a file and set `GUMROAD_TOKEN_FILE`.
    16: 
    17: Daemon setup
    18: 
    19: - Run the daemon (recommended):
    20:   - Set `GUMROAD_TOKEN` and optionally `GUMROAD_PRODUCT_YEARLY` / `GUMROAD_PRODUCT_MONTHLY`.
    21:   - Start: `qflush daemon` or `node dist/daemon/qflushd.js`.
    22:   - The daemon exposes endpoints:
    23:     - `POST /license/activate` { key, product_id? }
    24:     - `GET /license/status` -> { license, valid }
    25: 
    26: VS Code extension flow
    27: 
    28: - The VS Code extension UI includes a License section in the panel:
    29:   - Paste the key in the License Key field and press Activate.
    30:   - The extension will call the daemon `POST /license/activate` and display the result.
    31:   - Use Show License Status to query `GET /license/status`.
    32: 
    33: CLI flow
    34: 
    35: - You can also activate using the CLI (suitable for headless installs):
    36:   - `GUMROAD_TOKEN=... qflush license activate <key>`
    37:   - `qflush license status` to view the saved local license
    38: 
    39: Audit and metrics
    40: 
    41: - The daemon writes a simple audit log by default to `./.qflush/license-activations.log` and exposes Prometheus counters:
    42:   - `qflush_license_activation_total`
    43:   - `qflush_license_activation_success_total`
    44:   - `qflush_license_activation_failure_total`
    45: 
    46: Local license storage
    47: 
    48: The CLI/daemon stores a local license record in `./.qflush/license.json`. You can override with `GUMROAD_LICENSE_PATH`.
    49: 
    50: Security
    51: 
    52: Do not hardcode your Gumroad token in client-side code. Use the daemon to keep tokens private. The extension communicates with the local daemon only.
    53: 
    54: ---
    55: 
    56: qflush licensing (local Gumroad verification)
    57: 
    58: Overview
    59: 
    60: qflush uses Gumroad to sell license keys. The recommended flow is local verification: the user pastes a license key into the app/extension which calls the local daemon to verify the key directly with Gumroad.
    61: 
    62: Simple local flow (recommended)
    63: 
    64: 1. User purchases a license on Gumroad and receives a license key.
    65: 2. User opens qflush (or the VS Code extension) and enters the license key.
    66: 3. The client calls the local daemon endpoint `POST /license/activate` with `{ key }`.
    67: 4. The daemon calls Gumroad's verify API, saves the license locally on success, and returns the result.
    68: 
    69: Why this is sufficient
    70: 
    71: - No public URL, tunnel, or webhook required for normal activation and verification.
    72: - Works fully offline for the app running on the user's machine (daemon contacts Gumroad to verify).
    73: 
    74: Daemon configuration
    75: 
    76: - Set `GUMROAD_TOKEN` and product IDs in the daemon environment (or `GUMROAD_TOKEN_FILE` and `GUMROAD_LICENSE_PATH` if preferred).
    77: - Default local license path: `./.qflush/license.json`.
    78: 
    79: Commands
    80: 
    81: - Activate (HTTP):
    82:   POST http://localhost:4500/license/activate
    83:   Body: { "key": "XXXX-XXXX-XXXX" }
    84: 
    85: - Status (HTTP):
    86:   GET http://localhost:4500/license/status
    87: 
    88: Notes about webhooks
    89: 
    90: - Webhooks are optional. They are useful to automatically revoke licenses on refunds or subscription cancellations.
    91: - This repository supports webhook handling, but it can be removed. The default simple flow does not require a webhook or public endpoint.
    92: 
    93: Security
    94: 
    95: - Do not commit `GUMROAD_TOKEN` to the repo. Use `.env`, environment variables, or a token file referenced by `GUMROAD_TOKEN_FILE`.
    96: - Audit log (activations) is at `./.qflush/license-activations.log`.
    97: 
    98: If you want the fully automated server-driven flow (webhooks + auto-disable), use a public endpoint (ngrok, domain, or server) and enable webhooks in Gumroad. Otherwise the local flow above is safest and simplest.
    99: 
   100:

FILE: docs\publish-secrets.md
============================
============================
     1: This repository's release publish workflow requires the following GitHub secrets to be set in the repository settings:
     2: 
     3: - `NPM_TOKEN` — npm auth token for publishing the package (if publishing to npm)
     4: - `VSCE_TOKEN` — Personal access token for Visual Studio Marketplace (optional, if using `vsce`)
     5: - `OPENVSX_TOKEN` — token for publishing to Open VSX (optional)
     6: - `AZURE_CREDENTIALS` — Azure service principal JSON if publishing to Azure DevOps (optional)
     7: 
     8: To set a secret:
     9: 1. Go to your GitHub repository -> Settings -> Secrets and variables -> Actions -> New repository secret.
    10: 2. Enter the secret name and value and save.
    11: 
    12: The provided workflow `.github/workflows/publish-on-release.yml` will run on GitHub `release` published events and will build and publish to npm. If you want marketplace or Open VSX publish, adapt the workflow to call `vsce` or `open-vsx-publisher` with the appropriate tokens.
    13:

FILE: docs\qflush-analysis.md
============================
============================
     1: QFLUSH — Repository Analysis
     2: 
     3: Status summary
     4: - Repository: `D:\qflush` (branch `release/3.1.0`)
     5: - Build: `npm run build` succeeded (TypeScript compile)
     6: - Tests: `npm test` (vitest) succeeded (12 tests passed)
     7: - Recent commit: `docs: add architecture,diagrams,copilot context` (created docs and copilot context)
     8: 
     9: Key components and locations
    10: - CLI / entry
    11:   - `src/index.ts` → CLI dispatcher, commands
    12:   - `bin/qflush` / `qflush.cmd` wrappers
    13: - Daemon
    14:   - `src/daemon/qflushd.ts` → express daemon, NPZ endpoints, Rome linker, optional Redis
    15:   - `dist/index.js` (built artifact)
    16: - Supervisor / process manager
    17:   - `@funeste38/bat` (dependency) used via `src/supervisor` and `tools` (BAT orchestrates processes)
    18: - Rome (index + engine + linker)
    19:   - `src/rome/*` → index-loader, engine, linker, events, executor
    20:   - Output stored in `.qflush/rome-index.json` and `.qflush/rome-links.json`
    21: - NPZ (router/admin)
    22:   - `src/utils/npz-*` and endpoints in `src/daemon/qflushd.ts`
    23:   - checksum endpoints: `/npz/checksum/*`
    24: - Nezlephant / envaptex / freeland
    25:   - External packages: `@funeste38/nezlephant`, `@funeste38/envaptex`, `@funeste38/freeland`
    26: - Optional Redis
    27:   - `ioredis` is a dependency; feature flag `QFLUSH_ENABLE_REDIS` controls usage in `src/daemon/qflushd.ts` (currently forced disabled in local edit)
    28: - Mapping feature
    29:   - `QFLUSH_ENABLE_MAPPING` and internal `FORCE_DISABLE_MAPPING` control automatic mapping; current build sets `FORCE_DISABLE_MAPPING = true` in `qflushd.ts` which disables mapping by default
    30: 
    31: Important files
    32: - `package.json` — scripts, dependencies, bin `qflush`
    33: - `src/daemon/qflushd.ts` — HTTP API, checksum store, rome endpoints, SSE
    34: - `src/index.ts` — CLI entry
    35: - `.qflush/*` — runtime state, logs, indexes, telemetry
    36: - `tools/installer.js` and `installers/` — local install and artifacts
    37: 
    38: Observations & recommendations
    39: 1. Optional services (Redis, mapping) are feature-flagged. Ensure CI and README document how to enable them. Local dev should keep Redis disabled.
    40: 2. Many large untracked or workspace files exist (VS snapshots, `.qflush` runtime data). Add or verify `.gitignore` to avoid committing volatile files.
    41: 3. Tests pass locally — good baseline for further changes. Run tests after any change to `src/rome/*` or `src/daemon/*`.
    42: 4. Consider centralizing feature flags and default config in a single module (e.g., `src/config.ts`) to avoid duplicated checks in code.
    43: 5. Keep `ioredis` optional at runtime by lazy-require and clear logging when disabled (current approach acceptable).
    44: 
    45: Next steps I can take
    46: - Generate a concise module dependency map (visual or textual).
    47: - Create a README section documenting feature flags and local dev setup.
    48: - Search for TODOs and FIXME comments to prioritize tech debt.
    49: 
    50:

FILE: docs\qflush-plan.md

============================
     1: # QFLUSH — PLAN CONCRET À EXÉCUTER
     2: 
     3: Objectif : stabiliser QFLUSH v3.1, intégrer le linker ROME, préparer le terrain A11/SPYDER.
     4: 
     5: Étape 1 — Stabilisation build / TS
     6: - Corriger imports cassés : ./chain/smartChain, ./daemon/qflushd(.js), ./commands/doctor, ./commands/compose, ./cli/help, ../utils/fetch.
     7: - Remplacer usages de `node` / `env` nus par process.env (ex: process.env.NODE_ENV).
     8: - S'assurer que tous les shebangs `#!/usr/bin/env node` sont en ligne 1 des fichiers .ts concernés.
     9: - Supprimer ou corriger les `declare module './...'` en noms non-relatifs (ex: 'src/rome/storage').
    10: - Laisser `// @ts-nocheck` sur les polyfills JS et exclure extensions/**/out/** dans tsconfig.
    11: - Vérifier que `npx tsc -p . --noEmit` ne renvoie aucune erreur.
    12: 
    13: Étape 2 — Intégration du linker ROME
    14: - Créer src/rome/linker.ts avec computeRomeLinks(...) et writeRomeLinks(...), utilisant loadRomeIndexFromDisk() et détectant les tokens [[token]] dans src/**.
    15: - Ajouter une commande src/commands/rome-links.ts qui appelle computeRomeLinks + writeRomeLinks et log le nombre de refs.
    16: - Brancher rome-links dans le router CLI (qflush rome:links).
    17: - Optionnel : sur onRomeIndexUpdated, relancer computeRomeLinks pour rafraîchir .qflush/rome-links.json.
    18: 
    19: Étape 3 — Pré-release 3.1
    20: - Mettre à jour README pour décrire QFLUSH v3.x (orchestrateur, daemon, NPZ, checksum, Copilot bridge, Rome linker).
    21: - Vérifier package.json (name, version, bin.qflush).
    22: - Générer un .tgz, tester une installation globale locale, puis tagguer v3.1.0.
    23: 
    24: Étape 4 — Hooks pour A11 / SPYDER (préparation)
    25: - Ajouter des clés A11 / SPYDER dans SERVICE_MAP (même si les modules ne sont pas encore publiés).
    26: - Ajouter des commandes placeholders qflush a11:status et qflush spyder:status qui renvoient un message "coming soon".
    27: - Documenter dans README la roadmap A11 (interface IA) et SPYDER (internet interne).
    28: 
    29: // Fin du plan QFLUSH.
    30:

FILE: docs\quick-start.md
============================
============================
     1: Quick start checklist — QFLUSH (local, NO-REDIS / NO-COPILOT)
     2: 
     3: This file contains a short checklist and copy-paste commands to get QFLUSH running locally in the "NO-REDIS / NO-COPILOT" safe mode used by this repo.
     4: 
     5: 1) Prepare environment
     6: - Copy example env and edit if needed:
     7:   - PowerShell:
     8:     Copy-Item .env.example .env; notepad .env
     9:   - Bash:
    10:     cp .env.example .env && ${EDITOR:-nano} .env
    11: 
    12: - Confirm the following variables are set to disable external services (recommended for dev):
    13:   QFLUSH_DISABLE_REDIS=1
    14:   QFLUSH_DISABLE_COPILOT=1
    15:   QFLUSH_TELEMETRY=0
    16: 
    17: 2) Install dependencies
    18: - npm ci --no-audit --no-fund
    19: 
    20: 3) Build
    21: - npm run build
    22: 
    23: 4) Run tests
    24: - npm test
    25: 
    26: 5) Start daemon (detached recommended)
    27: - Using CLI (detached by default):
    28:   qflush daemon
    29: - Using safe-run (detached):
    30:   qflush safe-run --detach daemon
    31: - Using the detach script via npm:
    32:   npm run detach -- node dist/index.js daemon --detached
    33: 
    34: 6) Quick API checks (after daemon started)
    35: - Store checksum:
    36:   curl -sS -X POST http://localhost:4500/npz/checksum/store -H 'Content-Type: application/json' -d '{"id":"t1","checksum":"abc"}'
    37: - Verify checksum:
    38:   curl -sS -X POST http://localhost:4500/npz/checksum/verify -H 'Content-Type: application/json' -d '{"id":"t1","checksum":"abc"}'
    39: - List checksums:
    40:   curl -sS http://localhost:4500/npz/checksum/list
    41: 
    42: 7) Useful scripts
    43: - Detach helper (Node): ./scripts/detach.js
    44: - POSIX watchdog: ./scripts/run-with-timeout.sh
    45: - PowerShell watchdog: ./scripts/run-with-timeout.ps1
    46: 
    47: 8) Re-enable Redis / Copilot (production)
    48: - To re-enable Redis, set REDIS_URL and remove/clear QFLUSH_DISABLE_REDIS.
    49: - To re-enable Copilot, provide `.qflush/copilot.json` with `enabled:true` and set HMAC/webhook envs.
    50: 
    51: 9) Cleanup helpers
    52: - If you need to force-reset the repo's runtime state:
    53:   - qflush purge
    54:   - npm run run:timeout -- 5 node dist/index.js purge
    55: 
    56: If you want, I can add these entries to `README.md` too.  
    57:

============================
FILE: docs\sysinternals.md
============================
============================
     1: # Utilitaires Sysinternals (PsSuspend) pour QFLUSH
     2: 
     3: Ce document explique comment installer PsSuspend (Sysinternals) et comment l'utiliser de façon sécurisée avec QFLUSH. Ne commite jamais de binaires dans le dépôt — préfère installer localement et référencer le chemin via une variable d'environnement.
     4: 
     5: ## Pourquoi PsSuspend ?
     6: - Permet de *suspendre* un processus sous Windows sans le tuer (utile pour "freezeAll").
     7: - QFLUSH essaie d'utiliser PsSuspend si disponible, sinon retombe sur `taskkill` (terminaison forcée).
     8: 
     9: ## Installation recommandée
    10: 1. Télécharge la suite Sysinternals depuis Microsoft :
    11:    - https://learn.microsoft.com/sysinternals/downloads/sysinternals-suite
    12: 2. Extrait `PsSuspend.exe` dans un dossier sur ta machine, par exemple `C:\tools\sysinternals`.
    13: 3. (Optionnel) Ajoute ce dossier à ton `PATH`, ou définis la variable d'environnement spécifique :
    14:    - PowerShell : `$env:QFLUSH_PSSUSPEND_PATH = 'C:\tools\sysinternals\PsSuspend.exe'`
    15:    - Bash : `export QFLUSH_PSSUSPEND_PATH='/c/tools/sysinternals/PsSuspend.exe'`
    16: 
    17: ## Utilisation avec QFLUSH
    18: - Si `QFLUSH_PSSUSPEND_PATH` est défini, QFLUSH l'utilisera pour suspendre/reprendre les processus.
    19: - Sinon QFLUSH cherchera `pssuspend` dans le `PATH`.
    20: - Si PsSuspend est indisponible, QFLUSH utilise `taskkill /F` en dernier recours.
    21: 
    22: ## Commandes de test (PowerShell)
    23: - Lancer Notepad : `Start-Process notepad`
    24: - Trouver son PID : `Get-Process notepad`
    25: - Suspendre manuellement (si PsSuspend installé) : `& 'C:\tools\sysinternals\PsSuspend.exe' <PID>`
    26: - Reprendre : `& 'C:\tools\sysinternals\PsSuspend.exe' -r <PID>`
    27: 
    28: ## Intégration dans QFLUSH
    29: - QFLUSH lit `QFLUSH_PSSUSPEND_PATH` si défini ; sinon `pssuspend` depuis le `PATH` est essayé.
    30: - Le code de `freezeAll` fait une tentative non bloquante et tombe sur `taskkill` si nécessaire.
    31: 
    32: ## Sécurité et bonnes pratiques
    33: - Ne commite jamais `PsSuspend.exe` ni d'autres binaires Sysinternals dans le dépôt.
    34: - Place les utilitaires dans un répertoire système (`C:\tools\sysinternals`) et documente leur chemin.
    35: - Exécute les commandes en tant qu'administrateur si tu as besoin de suspendre/reprendre des processus systèmes.
    36: 
    37: ## Si besoin d'aide
    38: Si tu veux, je peux :
    39: - ajouter un script de vérification qui signale si `QFLUSH_PSSUSPEND_PATH` est valide, ou
    40: - ajouter un exemple de configuration dans `README.md`.
    41: 
    42: 


============================
FILE: dump-all-and-rgba.ps1
============================
============================
     1: param(
     2:   [string]$Root = 'D:\qflush',
     3:   [string]$OutText = 'D:\qflush-code-dump.txt',
     4:   [string]$OutRaw = 'D:\qflush-code-dump.raw',
     5:   [string]$OutPng = 'D:\qflush-code-dump.png',
     6:   [int]$ImageWidth = 1024
     7: )
     8: 
     9: Write-Host "=== QFLUSH DUMP START ==="
    10: Write-Host "Root          : $Root"
    11: Write-Host "OutText       : $OutText"
    12: Write-Host "OutRaw        : $OutRaw"
    13: Write-Host "OutPng        : $OutPng"
    14: Write-Host "ImageWidth    : $ImageWidth"
    15: Write-Host ""
    16: 
    17: # 1) Validation du root
    18: if (-not (Test-Path -Path $Root)) {
    19:   Write-Error "Root path '$Root' not found."
    20:   exit 2
    21: }
    22: 
    23: # 2) Nettoyage des sorties précédentes
    24: foreach ($p in @($OutText, $OutRaw, $OutPng)) {
    25:   if (Test-Path $p) {
    26:     Write-Host "Removing previous output: $p"
    27:     Remove-Item $p -Force -ErrorAction SilentlyContinue
    28:   }
    29: }
    30: 
    31: # 3) Préparation writer UTF-8 sans BOM
    32: $utf8NoBOM = New-Object System.Text.UTF8Encoding($false)
    33: $fs = [System.IO.File]::Open(
    34:   $OutText,
    35:   [System.IO.FileMode]::Create,
    36:   [System.IO.FileAccess]::Write,
    37:   [System.IO.FileShare]::Read
    38: )
    39: $sw = New-Object System.IO.StreamWriter($fs, $utf8NoBOM)
    40: 
    41: # Extensions considérées comme "texte"
    42: $textExtensions = @(
    43:   '.ts', '.tsx', '.js', '.cjs', '.mjs',
    44:   '.json', '.yml', '.yaml', '.md',
    45:   '.ps1', '.psm1', '.psd1',
    46:   '.xml', '.txt', '.sh', '.bat',
    47:   '.c', '.cpp', '.h', '.hpp'
    48: )
    49: 
    50: # Dossiers à exclure
    51: $excludePatterns = @(
    52:   '\node_modules\',
    53:   '\dist\',
    54:   '\out\',
    55:   '\.git\',
    56:   '\coverage\',
    57:   '\.vscode\',
    58:   '\.idea\',
    59:   '\.vs\',
    60:   '\.qflush\cache\'
    61: )
    62: 
    63: function Test-ExcludedPath([string]$fullPath) {
    64:   foreach ($pat in $excludePatterns) {
    65:     if ($fullPath -like "*$pat*") { return $true }
    66:   }
    67:   return $false
    68: }
    69: 
    70: try {
    71:   # En-tête du dump
    72:   $now = (Get-Date).ToString("o")
    73:   $sw.WriteLine("qflush code dump generated: $now")
    74:   $sw.WriteLine()
    75: 
    76:   Write-Host "Scanning files under: $Root"
    77:   $files = Get-ChildItem -Path $Root -Recurse -File -Force -ErrorAction SilentlyContinue |
    78:     Where-Object { -not (Test-ExcludedPath $_.FullName) } |
    79:     Sort-Object FullName
    80: 
    81:   Write-Host ("Found {0} files after exclusions." -f $files.Count)
    82:   Write-Host ""
    83: 
    84:   foreach ($f in $files) {
    85:     try {
    86:       # Chemin relatif
    87:       $rel = $f.FullName
    88:       if ($rel.StartsWith($Root, [System.StringComparison]::InvariantCultureIgnoreCase)) {
    89:         $rel = $rel.Substring($Root.Length).TrimStart('\','/')
    90:       }
    91: 
    92:       Write-Host "Dumping file: $rel"
    93: 
    94:       $sep = '=' * 28
    95:       $sw.WriteLine($sep)
    96:       $sw.WriteLine("FILE: $rel")
    97:       $sw.WriteLine($sep)
    98:       $sw.WriteLine($sep)
    99: 
   100:       $ext = [System.IO.Path]::GetExtension($f.FullName).ToLowerInvariant()
   101:       $isTextExt = $textExtensions -contains $ext
   102: 
   103:       if ($isTextExt) {
   104:         # Lecture texte
   105:         $raw = $null
   106:         try {
   107:           $raw = Get-Content -LiteralPath $f.FullName -Raw -Encoding UTF8 -ErrorAction Stop
   108:         } catch {
   109:           $raw = $null
   110:         }
   111: 
   112:         if ($null -ne $raw) {
   113:           # Découper en lignes, écrire sans utiliser -f sur le contenu
   114:           $lines = $raw -split "`r?`n"
   115:           $ln = 1
   116:           foreach ($line in $lines) {
   117:             $prefix = "{0,6}: " -f $ln
   118:             $sw.WriteLine($prefix + $line)
   119:             $ln++
   120:           }
   121:         } else {
   122:           # Fallback binaire
   123:           $bytes = [System.IO.File]::ReadAllBytes($f.FullName)
   124:           $sw.WriteLine("[BINARY CONTENT - {0} bytes] (text read failed)" -f $bytes.Length)
   125:           for ($i = 0; $i -lt $bytes.Length; $i += 16) {
   126:             $end = [Math]::Min($i + 15, $bytes.Length - 1)
   127:             $slice = $bytes[$i..$end]
   128:             $hex = ($slice | ForEach-Object { $_.ToString('x2') }) -join ' '
   129:             $sw.WriteLine('{0,6}: {1}' -f (($i / 16) + 1), $hex)
   130:           }
   131:         }
   132:       } else {
   133:         # Lecture binaire pure
   134:         $bytes = [System.IO.File]::ReadAllBytes($f.FullName)
   135:         $sw.WriteLine("[BINARY CONTENT - {0} bytes]" -f $bytes.Length)
   136:         for ($i = 0; $i -lt $bytes.Length; $i += 16) {
   137:           $end = [Math]::Min($i + 15, $bytes.Length - 1)
   138:           $slice = $bytes[$i..$end]
   139:           $hex = ($slice | ForEach-Object { $_.ToString('x2') }) -join ' '
   140:           $sw.WriteLine('{0,6}: {1}' -f (($i / 16) + 1), $hex)
   141:         }
   142:       }
   143: 
   144:       $sw.WriteLine()
   145:       $sw.WriteLine()
   146:       $sw.Flush()
   147:     } catch {
   148:       # IMPORTANT : ne pas utiliser -f avec le message d'exception
   149:       $sw.WriteLine("[ERROR] Failed to include file: " + $f.FullName)
   150:       $sw.WriteLine("Reason: " + $_.Exception.Message)
   151:       $sw.WriteLine()
   152:       $sw.WriteLine()
   153:       $sw.Flush()
   154: 
   155:       Write-Warning "Failed to dump file: $($f.FullName) -> $($_.Exception.Message)"
   156:     }
   157:   }
   158: 
   159:   $completed = (Get-Date -Format o)
   160:   $sw.WriteLine("Completed: $completed")
   161:   $sw.Flush()
   162:   Write-Host "Text dump completed at: $completed"
   163: }
   164: finally {
   165:   $sw.Close()
   166:   $fs.Close()
   167: }
   168: 
   169: # 5) Conversion du texte → RAW RGBA → PNG (ImageMagick)
   170: Write-Host ""
   171: Write-Host "=== Building RAW / PNG from text dump ==="
   172: 
   173: try {
   174:   if (-not (Test-Path $OutText)) {
   175:     Write-Warning "Text dump not found at $OutText, aborting RAW/PNG generation."
   176:     return
   177:   }
   178: 
   179:   $textBytes = [System.IO.File]::ReadAllBytes($OutText)
   180:   $len = $textBytes.Length
   181:   Write-Host ("Text dump size: {0} bytes" -f $len)
   182: 
   183:   # Padding à multiple de 4 (RGBA)
   184:   $pad = (4 - ($len % 4)) % 4
   185:   if ($pad -gt 0) {
   186:     Write-Host ("Applying padding of {0} bytes to align to RGBA." -f $pad)
   187:     $new = New-Object byte[] ($len + $pad)
   188:     [System.Array]::Copy($textBytes, 0, $new, 0, $len)
   189:     $textBytes = $new
   190:     $len = $textBytes.Length
   191:   }
   192: 
   193:   [System.IO.File]::WriteAllBytes($OutRaw, $textBytes)
   194:   Write-Host "RAW RGBA bytes written to: $OutRaw (length=${len})"
   195: 
   196:   $pixels = [int]($len / 4)
   197:   $width = [int]$ImageWidth
   198:   if ($width -le 0) { $width = 1024 }
   199:   $height = [int][Math]::Ceiling($pixels / $width)
   200: 
   201:   Write-Host ("Image logical size: {0}x{1} pixels (pixels={2})" -f $width, $height, $pixels)
   202: 
   203:   # Ensure raw length matches width*height*4 by padding with zeros if necessary
   204:   $requiredBytes = $width * $height * 4
   205:   if ($len -lt $requiredBytes) {
   206:     $padNeeded = $requiredBytes - $len
   207:     Write-Host ("Padding raw file to {0} bytes (adding {1} zeros) to match image size" -f $requiredBytes, $padNeeded)
   208:     $newArr = New-Object byte[] $requiredBytes
   209:     [System.Array]::Copy($textBytes, 0, $newArr, 0, $len)
   210:     [System.IO.File]::WriteAllBytes($OutRaw, $newArr)
   211:     $len = $newArr.Length
   212:   }
   213: 
   214:   # Detect ImageMagick executable reliably
   215:   $magickExe = $null
   216:   try { $magickExe = (Get-Command magick -ErrorAction SilentlyContinue).Source } catch {}
   217:   if (-not $magickExe) {
   218:     try { $magickExe = (Get-Command convert -ErrorAction SilentlyContinue).Source } catch {}
   219:   }
   220: 
   221:   $useMagick = $false
   222:   $useConvert = $false
   223:   if ($magickExe) {
   224:     $exeName = (Split-Path $magickExe -Leaf).ToLower()
   225:     if ($exeName -eq 'magick' -or $exeName -eq 'magick.exe') {
   226:       $useMagick = $true
   227:     } else {
   228:       # candidate 'convert' found - ensure it's ImageMagick, not Windows convert
   229:       try {
   230:         $ver = & $magickExe -version 2>&1
   231:         if ($ver -and ($ver -join "`n") -match 'ImageMagick') { $useConvert = $true }
   232:       } catch {
   233:         $useConvert = $false
   234:       }
   235:     }
   236:   }
   237: 
   238:   if ($useMagick -or $useConvert) {
   239:     if ($useMagick) {
   240:       Write-Host "Using ImageMagick (magick) at: $magickExe"
   241:       # magick v7: magick -size WxH -depth 8 rgba:in.raw out.png
   242:       & $magickExe '-size' "${width}x${height}" '-depth' '8' ('rgba:' + $OutRaw) $OutPng
   243:     } else {
   244:       Write-Host "Using ImageMagick (convert) at: $magickExe"
   245:       & $magickExe '-size' "${width}x${height}" '-depth' '8' ('rgba:' + $OutRaw) $OutPng
   246:     }
   247: 
   248:     if (Test-Path $OutPng) {
   249:       Write-Host "✅ RGBA image written to: $OutPng (size=${width}x${height})"
   250:     } else {
   251:       Write-Warning "ImageMagick executed but $OutPng not found. Check logs above."
   252:     }
   253:   } else {
   254:     Write-Warning "ImageMagick not found in PATH or 'convert' is the Windows tool. Skipping PNG generation."
   255:     Write-Host "RAW RGBA written to $OutRaw."
   256:     Write-Host "Install ImageMagick and run manually:"
   257:     Write-Host "  magick -size ${width}x${height} -depth 8 rgba:`"$OutRaw`" `"$OutPng`""
   258:   }
   259: } catch {
   260:   Write-Warning "Failed to create RGBA raw/png: $($_.Exception.Message)"
   261: }
   262: 
   263: Write-Host "Text dump written to: $OutText"
   264: Write-Host "=== QFLUSH DUMP END ==="
   265: 


============================
FILE: dump-qflush-code.ps1
============================
============================
     1: $OutFile = Join-Path (Get-Location) 'qflush-code-dump.txt'
     2: 
     3: # Overwrite if exists
     4: if (Test-Path $OutFile) {
     5:     Remove-Item $OutFile -Force
     6: }
     7: 
     8: # Extensions to include (lowercase)
     9: $includeExts = @('.ts', '.tsx', '.js', '.cjs', '.mjs', '.json', '.yml', '.yaml', '.md', '.ps1')
    10: 
    11: # Directory name segments to exclude
    12: $excludeDirs = @('node_modules','dist','out','.git','.vscode','coverage')
    13: 
    14: # Special exclude path fragments
    15: $excludePathFragments = @('\.qflush\\cache','/.qflush/cache')
    16: 
    17: # Separator lines
    18: $sep = '=' * 28
    19: 
    20: # Helper: check if path contains any excluded directory segment
    21: function IsPathExcluded($fullPath) {
    22:     $norm = $fullPath -replace '/', '\\'  # normalize to backslashes
    23:     # quick fragment check
    24:     foreach ($frag in $excludePathFragments) {
    25:         $fragNorm = $frag -replace '/', '\\'
    26:         if ($norm -like "*$fragNorm*") { return $true }
    27:     }
    28:     # split into segments and check
    29:     $segments = $norm -split '\\+' | Where-Object { $_ -ne '' }
    30:     foreach ($seg in $segments) {
    31:         foreach ($d in $excludeDirs) {
    32:             if ($seg -ieq $d) { return $true }
    33:         }
    34:     }
    35:     return $false
    36: }
    37: 
    38: # Collect files
    39: $allFiles = Get-ChildItem -Recurse -File -Force -ErrorAction SilentlyContinue | Where-Object {
    40:     try {
    41:         # Compatible with Windows PowerShell (no '??' operator)
    42:         $ext = [IO.Path]::GetExtension($_.FullName)
    43:         if ($null -eq $ext) { $ext = '' }
    44:         $ext = $ext.ToLower()
    45:         if ($ext -eq '') { return $false }
    46:         if ($ext -eq '.log') { return $false }
    47:         if (-not ($includeExts -contains $ext)) { return $false }
    48:         if (IsPathExcluded($_.FullName)) { return $false }
    49:         return $true
    50:     } catch {
    51:         return $false
    52:     }
    53: }
    54: 
    55: # Sort for deterministic order
    56: $files = $allFiles | Sort-Object FullName
    57: 
    58: # Write header
    59: "qflush code dump generated: $(Get-Date -Format o)" | Out-File -FilePath $OutFile -Encoding utf8
    60: "" | Out-File -FilePath $OutFile -Encoding utf8 -Append
    61: 
    62: $cwd = (Get-Location).ProviderPath
    63: 
    64: foreach ($f in $files) {
    65:     try {
    66:         # compute relative path
    67:         $full = $f.FullName
    68:         if ($full.StartsWith($cwd, [System.StringComparison]::InvariantCultureIgnoreCase)) {
    69:             $rel = $full.Substring($cwd.Length)
    70:             # strip leading slashes/backslashes robustly
    71:             $rel = $rel -replace '^[\\/]+',''
    72:         } else {
    73:             $rel = $full
    74:         }
    75: 
    76:         # write separators and file header
    77:         $header1 = $sep
    78:         $header2 = "FILE: $rel"
    79:         $header3 = $sep
    80:         $header4 = $sep
    81:         $header1 | Out-File -FilePath $OutFile -Encoding utf8 -Append
    82:         $header2 | Out-File -FilePath $OutFile -Encoding utf8 -Append
    83:         $header3 | Out-File -FilePath $OutFile -Encoding utf8 -Append
    84:         $header4 | Out-File -FilePath $OutFile -Encoding utf8 -Append
    85: 
    86:         # read file content (try utf8 then fallback)
    87:         $content = $null
    88:         try {
    89:             $content = Get-Content -Raw -Encoding utf8 -ErrorAction Stop -LiteralPath $full
    90:         } catch {
    91:             try {
    92:                 $content = Get-Content -Raw -Encoding Default -ErrorAction Stop -LiteralPath $full
    93:             } catch {
    94:                 $content = Get-Content -Raw -ErrorAction SilentlyContinue -LiteralPath $full
    95:             }
    96:         }
    97: 
    98:         if ($null -eq $content) { $content = "" }
    99: 
   100:         # write raw content
   101:         Add-Content -LiteralPath $OutFile -Value $content -Encoding utf8
   102: 
   103:         # trailing newline for readability
   104:         "" | Out-File -FilePath $OutFile -Encoding utf8 -Append
   105:         "" | Out-File -FilePath $OutFile -Encoding utf8 -Append
   106:     } catch {
   107:         # continue on errors, but log minimal info to dump file
   108:         $errLine = "[ERROR] Failed to include file: $($f.FullName) - $($_.Exception.Message)"
   109:         $errLine | Out-File -FilePath $OutFile -Encoding utf8 -Append
   110:     }
   111: }
   112: 
   113: "Completed: $(Get-Date -Format o)" | Out-File -FilePath $OutFile -Encoding utf8 -Append
   114:

value but never used.","line":145,"column":17,"nodeType":"Identifier","messageId":"unusedVar","endLine":145,"endColumn":22}],"suppressedMessages":[],"errorCount":0,"fatalErrorCount":0,"warningCount":5,"fixableErrorCount":0,"fixableWarningCount":0,"source":"import { detectModules } from \"../utils/detect\";\r\nimport logger from \"../utils/logger\";\r\nimport { spawnSafe, ensurePackageInstalled, pathExists, rebuildInstructionsFor } from \"../utils/exec\";\r\nimport { resolvePaths, SERVICE_MAP } from \"../utils/paths\";\r\nimport { qflushOptions } from \"../chain/smartChain\";\r\nimport { resolvePackagePath, readPackageJson } from \"../utils/package\";\r\nimport { startProcess } from \"../supervisor\";\r\nimport { waitForService } from \"../utils/health\";\r\nimport { runCustomsCheck, hasBlockingIssues, ModuleDescriptor } from \"../utils/npz-customs\";\r\nimport npz from \"../utils/npz\";\r\n\r\nexport async function runStart(opts?: qflushOptions) {\r\n  logger.info(\"qflush: starting modules...\");\r\n  const detected = opts?.detected || (await detectModules());\r\n  const paths = resolvePaths(detected);\r\n\r\n  const services = opts?.services && opts.services.length ? opts.services : Object.keys(SERVICE_MAP);\r\n  const flags = opts?.flags || {};\r\n\r\n  const waitForStart = Boolean(flags[\"wait\"] || flags[\"--wait\"] || false);\r\n  const doRestart = Boolean(flags[\"restart\"] || flags[\"--restart\"] || flags[\"force\"] || false);\r\n  const maxRestarts = typeof flags[\"restartCount\"] === \"number\" ? (flags[\"restartCount\"] as number) : 3;\r\n\r\n  const procs: Promise<void>[] = [];\r\n\r\n  async function startWithCustoms(modName: string) {\r\n    const p = (opts?.modulePaths && opts.modulePaths[modName]) || paths[modName];\r\n    const pkg = SERVICE_MAP[modName] && SERVICE_MAP[modName].pkg;\r\n\r\n    const modDesc: ModuleDescriptor = { name: modName, pkg, cwd: p || process.cwd() };\r\n\r\n    // run customs\r\n    const report = await runCustomsCheck(modDesc);\r\n    if (hasBlockingIssues(report)) {\r\n      logger.warn(`supervisor: ${modName} blocked at customs, not starting.`);\r\n      return;\r\n    }\r\n\r\n    // if an explicit path is provided, prefer to run it directly\r\n    if (p) {\r\n      try {\r\n        const pkgJson = readPackageJson(p);\r\n        if (pkgJson && pkgJson.bin) {\r\n          const binEntry = typeof pkgJson.bin === \"string\" ? pkgJson.bin : Object.values(pkgJson.bin)[0];\r\n          const binPath = require(\"path\").join(p, binEntry);\r\n          const runCmd = pathExists(binPath) && binPath.endsWith('.js') ? { cmd: process.execPath, args: [binPath], cwd: p } : { cmd: binPath, args: [], cwd: p };\r\n          logger.info(`Launching ${modName} -> ${runCmd.cmd} ${runCmd.args.join(\" \")}`);\r\n          startProcess(modName, runCmd.cmd, runCmd.args, { cwd: runCmd.cwd });\r\n          return;\r\n        }\r\n      } catch (e) {\r\n        logger.warn(`Failed to run local path for ${modName}: ${e}`);\r\n      }\r\n    }\r\n\r\n    // otherwise, use NPZ resolver as primary\r\n    if (pkg) {\r\n      const resolved = npz.npzResolve(pkg, { cwd: p || process.cwd() });\r\n      if (!resolved || resolved.gate === 'fail') {\r\n        logger.warn(`${modName} path and package not found or NPZ failed to resolve, skipping`);\r\n        return;\r\n      }\r\n\r\n      if (resolved.gate === 'dlx') {\r\n        const ok = ensurePackageInstalled(pkg);\r\n        if (!ok) {\r\n          logger.warn(`${modName} not found and failed to install ${pkg}, skipping`);\r\n          return;\r\n        }\r\n      }\r\n\r\n      const runCmd = { cmd: resolved.cmd as string, args: resolved.args || [], cwd: resolved.cwd };\r\n      logger.info(`Launching ${modName} -> ${runCmd.cmd} ${runCmd.args.join(\" \")}`);\r\n      startProcess(modName, runCmd.cmd, runCmd.args, { cwd: runCmd.cwd });\r\n      return;\r\n    }\r\n\r\n    logger.warn(`${modName} has no runnable entry, skipping`);\r\n  }\r\n\r\n  for (const mod of services) {\r\n    const promise = (async () => {\r\n      // Use enhanced master flow which handles missing local bins and robust spawn\r\n      const p = (opts?.modulePaths && opts.modulePaths[mod]) || paths[mod];\r\n      const pkg = SERVICE_MAP[mod] && SERVICE_MAP[mod].pkg;\r\n\r\n      // resolve package path (local node_modules or provided path)\r\n      let pkgPath = p;\r\n      if (!pkgPath && pkg) pkgPath = resolvePackagePath(pkg);\r\n\r\n      if (!pkgPath && pkg) {\r\n        const ok = ensurePackageInstalled(pkg);\r\n        if (!ok) {\r\n          logger.warn(`${mod} not found and failed to install ${pkg}, skipping`);\r\n          return;\r\n        }\r\n        pkgPath = resolvePackagePath(pkg);\r\n      }\r\n\r\n      if (!pkgPath) {\r\n        // fallback to customs+npz flow\r\n        await startWithCustoms(mod);\r\n        return;\r\n      }\r\n\r\n      const pkgJson = readPackageJson(pkgPath);\r\n\r\n      // choose how to run: package bin if present, else npz resolver\r\n      let runCmd: { cmd: string; args: string[]; cwd?: string } | null = null;\r\n      if (pkgJson && pkgJson.bin) {\r\n        const binEntry = typeof pkgJson.bin === \"string\" ? pkgJson.bin : Object.values(pkgJson.bin)[0];\r\n        const binPath = require(\"path\").join(pkgPath, binEntry);\r\n\r\n        // prefer running via node when bin is a JS file inside package\r\n        if (binPath.endsWith(\".js\") && pathExists(binPath)) {\r\n          runCmd = { cmd: process.execPath, args: [binPath], cwd: pkgPath };\r\n        } else if (pathExists(binPath)) {\r\n          runCmd = { cmd: binPath, args: [], cwd: pkgPath };\r\n        } else {\r\n          logger.warn(`${mod} bin entry not found at ${binPath}. ${rebuildInstructionsFor(pkgPath)}`);\r\n          return;\r\n        }\r\n      } else if (pkg) {\r\n        // fallback to npz resolver\r\n        const resolved = npz.npzResolve(pkg, { cwd: pkgPath });\r\n        if (!resolved || resolved.gate === 'fail') {\r\n          logger.warn(`${mod} has no runnable entry, skipping`);\r\n          return;\r\n        }\r\n        runCmd = { cmd: resolved.cmd as string, args: resolved.args || [], cwd: resolved.cwd };\r\n      }\r\n\r\n      if (!runCmd) {\r\n        logger.warn(`${mod} has no runnable entry, skipping`);\r\n        return;\r\n      }\r\n\r\n      const restarts = 0;\r\n\r\n      const spawnOnce = (): Promise<void> => {\r\n        return new Promise((resolve) => {\r\n          logger.info(`Launching ${mod} -> ${runCmd!.cmd} ${runCmd!.args.join(\" \")}`);\r\n\r\n          // use supervisor to manage and persist process\r\n          const child = startProcess(mod, runCmd!.cmd, runCmd!.args, { cwd: runCmd!.cwd });\r\n\r\n          if (waitForStart) {\r\n            // try to wait for a health endpoint if provided in flags\r\n            const svcUrl = flags[\"health-url\"] || flags[\"health\"];\r\n            const svcPort = flags[\"health-port\"] || undefined;\r\n            if (svcUrl) {\r\n              waitForService(svcUrl as string, svcPort as any).then((ok) => {\r\n                if (ok) logger.success(`${mod} passed health check`);\r\n                else logger.warn(`${mod} failed health check`);\r\n                resolve();\r\n              });\r\n            } else {\r\n              // wait for spawn via PID persistence\r\n              setTimeout(() => {\r\n                logger.info(`${mod} started (delayed wait).`);\r\n                resolve();\r\n              }, 2000);\r\n            }\r\n          } else {\r\n            resolve();\r\n          }\r\n\r\n          // child exit handled by supervisor\r\n        });\r\n      };\r\n\r\n      // start the first time and optionally wait\r\n      await spawnOnce();\r\n\r\n      // restart logic handled by supervisor-level events, keep simple here\r\n    })();\r\n    procs.push(promise);\r\n  }\r\n\r\n  await Promise.all(procs);\r\n\r\n  logger.success(\"qflush: start sequence initiated for selected modules\");\r\n}\r\n","usedDeprecatedRules":[]},{"filePath":"D:\\qflush\\src\\compose\\fclParser.ts","messages":[],"suppressedMessages":[],"errorCount":0,"fatalErrorCount":0,"warningCount":0,"fixableErrorCount":0,"fixableWarningCount":0,"usedDeprecatedRules":[]},{"filePath":"D:\\qflush\\src\\compose\\parser.ts","messages":[],"suppressedMessages":[],"errorCount":0,"fatalErrorCount":0,"warningCount":0,"fixableErrorCount":0,"fixableWarningCount":0,"usedDeprecatedRules":[]},{"filePath":"D:\\qflush\\src\\daemon\\qflushd.ts","messages":[{"ruleId":"@typescript-eslint/no-unused-vars","severity":1,"message":"'removed' is assigned a value but never used.","line":124,"column":9,"nodeType":"Identifier","messageId":"unusedVar","endLine":124,"endColumn":16}],"suppressedMessages":[],"errorCount":0,"fatalErrorCount":0,"warningCount":1,"fixableErrorCount":0,"fixableWarningCount":0,"source":"import 'dotenv/config';\r\nconst express = require('express');\r\nconst fs = require('fs');\r\nconst path = require('path');\r\n\r\n// optional Redis support\r\nlet Redis: any = null;\r\nlet redisClient: any = null;\r\nconst REDIS_URL = process.env.REDIS_URL || process.env.QFLUSH_REDIS_URL || '';\r\nif (REDIS_URL) {\r\n  try {\r\n    // require lazily so repo doesn't force dependency\r\n    // eslint-disable-next-line @typescript-eslint/no-var-requires\r\n    Redis = require('ioredis');\r\n    redisClient = new Redis(REDIS_URL);\r\n    // best-effort connect\r\n    redisClient.on('error', (err: any) => {\r\n      console.warn('qflush: redis error', String(err));\r\n      redisClient = null;\r\n    });\r\n  } catch (e) {\r\n    // ignore if ioredis not installed\r\n    redisClient = null;\r\n  }\r\n}\r\n\r\n// try to import gumroad helper if present\r\nlet gumroad: any = null;\r\ntry {\r\n  // eslint-disable-next-line @typescript-eslint/no-var-requires\r\n  gumroad = require('../utils/gumroad-license');\r\n} catch (e) {\r\n  // ignore if not available\r\n}\r\n\r\nconst PORT = process.env.QFLUSHD_PORT ? Number(process.env.QFLUSHD_PORT) : 4500;\r\nconst AUDIT_DIR = path.join(process.cwd(), '.qflush');\r\nconst AUDIT_LOG = path.join(AUDIT_DIR, 'license-activations.log');\r\n\r\nfunction ensureAuditDir() {\r\n  try {\r\n    if (!fs.existsSync(AUDIT_DIR)) fs.mkdirSync(AUDIT_DIR, { recursive: true });\r\n  } catch (e) {\r\n    // ignore\r\n  }\r\n}\r\n\r\nfunction audit(line: any) {\r\n  try {\r\n    ensureAuditDir();\r\n    fs.appendFileSync(AUDIT_LOG, (typeof line === 'string' ? line : JSON.stringify(line)) + '\\n', 'utf8');\r\n  } catch (e) {\r\n    // ignore\r\n  }\r\n}\r\n\r\nconst app = express();\r\napp.use(express.json());\r\n\r\n// --- One-time checksum cache ---\r\n// If Redis is configured, use Redis keys with TTL and a sorted set index for listing. Otherwise fallback to in-memory Map.\r\nconst CHECKSUM_DEFAULT_TTL_MS = Number(process.env.QFLUSH_CHECKSUM_TTL_MS) || 60 * 1000; // 60 seconds default\r\n\r\n// in-memory fallback store\r\ntype ChecksumEntry = { checksum: string; expiresAt: number };\r\nconst checksumCache = new Map<string, ChecksumEntry>();\r\n\r\n// Redis key helpers\r\nconst REDIS_KEY_PREFIX = 'qflush:npz:checksum:';\r\nconst REDIS_INDEX_KEY = 'qflush:npz:checksum:ids';\r\n\r\nasync function redisStore(id: string, checksum: string, ttlMs: number) {\r\n  if (!redisClient) return false;\r\n  const key = REDIS_KEY_PREFIX + id;\r\n  const expiresAt = Date.now() + ttlMs;\r\n  // set key with PX TTL\r\n  await redisClient.set(key, checksum, 'PX', ttlMs);\r\n  // add to sorted set with score = expiresAt\r\n  await redisClient.zadd(REDIS_INDEX_KEY, expiresAt, id);\r\n  return true;\r\n}\r\n\r\nasync function redisGet(id: string) {\r\n  if (!redisClient) return null;\r\n  const key = REDIS_KEY_PREFIX + id;\r\n  const val = await redisClient.get(key);\r\n  if (!val) return null;\r\n  // obtain TTL to compute expiresAt\r\n  const ttlMs = await redisClient.pttl(key);\r\n  const expiresAt = Date.now() + (ttlMs > 0 ? ttlMs : 0);\r\n  return { checksum: val, expiresAt };\r\n}\r\n\r\nasync function redisDelete(id: string) {\r\n  if (!redisClient) return false;\r\n  const key = REDIS_KEY_PREFIX + id;\r\n  await redisClient.del(key);\r\n  await redisClient.zrem(REDIS_INDEX_KEY, id);\r\n  return true;\r\n}\r\n\r\nasync function redisList() {\r\n  if (!redisClient) return [] as { id: string; expiresAt: number }[];\r\n  // remove expired ids from index\r\n  const now = Date.now();\r\n  await redisClient.zremrangebyscore(REDIS_INDEX_KEY, 0, now - 1);\r\n  const items = await redisClient.zrangebyscore(REDIS_INDEX_KEY, now, '+inf', 'WITHSCORES');\r\n  // zrangebyscore with WITHSCORES returns [id, score, id, score, ...]\r\n  const results: { id: string; expiresAt: number }[] = [];\r\n  for (let i = 0; i < items.length; i += 2) {\r\n    const id = items[i];\r\n    const score = Number(items[i + 1]);\r\n    results.push({ id, expiresAt: score });\r\n  }\r\n  return results;\r\n}\r\n\r\nasync function redisClear() {\r\n  if (!redisClient) return 0;\r\n  const ids = await redisClient.zrange(REDIS_INDEX_KEY, 0, -1);\r\n  if (ids.length === 0) return 0;\r\n  const keys = ids.map((id: string) => REDIS_KEY_PREFIX + id);\r\n  await redisClient.del(...keys);\r\n  const removed = await redisClient.del(REDIS_INDEX_KEY);\r\n  return ids.length;\r\n}\r\n\r\nfunction cleanupChecksumCache() {\r\n  const now = Date.now();\r\n  for (const [key, entry] of checksumCache.entries()) {\r\n    if (entry.expiresAt <= now) checksumCache.delete(key);\r\n  }\r\n}\r\n// run cleanup periodically for memory fallback\r\nsetInterval(cleanupChecksumCache, 30 * 1000).unref();\r\n\r\n// store checksum: POST /npz/checksum/store { id, checksum, ttlMs? }\r\napp.post('/npz/checksum/store', async (req: any, res: any) => {\r\n  const { id, checksum, ttlMs } = req.body || {};\r\n  if (!id || !checksum) return res.status(400).json({ success: false, error: 'missing id or checksum' });\r\n  const ttl = typeof ttlMs === 'number' && ttlMs > 0 ? ttlMs : CHECKSUM_DEFAULT_TTL_MS;\r\n  if (redisClient) {\r\n    try {\r\n      await redisStore(String(id), String(checksum), ttl);\r\n      audit({ t: Date.now(), event: 'checksum_stored_redis', id: String(id) });\r\n      return res.json({ success: true, id: String(id), ttlMs: ttl, backend: 'redis' });\r\n    } catch (e) {\r\n      // fallback to in-memory\r\n    }\r\n  }\r\n  checksumCache.set(String(id), { checksum: String(checksum), expiresAt: Date.now() + ttl });\r\n  audit({ t: Date.now(), event: 'checksum_stored_mem', id: String(id) });\r\n  return res.json({ success: true, id: String(id), ttlMs: ttl, backend: 'memory' });\r\n});\r\n\r\n// verify checksum: POST /npz/checksum/verify { id, checksum }\r\n// if verified, remove from cache (one-time) and return success\r\napp.post('/npz/checksum/verify', async (req: any, res: any) => {\r\n  const { id, checksum } = req.body || {};\r\n  if (!id || !checksum) return res.status(400).json({ success: false, error: 'missing id or checksum' });\r\n\r\n  if (redisClient) {\r\n    try {\r\n      const rec = await redisGet(String(id));\r\n      if (!rec) return res.status(404).json({ success: false, error: 'checksum not found or expired' });\r\n      if (rec.checksum !== String(checksum)) {\r\n        audit({ t: Date.now(), event: 'checksum_mismatch_redis', id: String(id), provided: String(checksum), expected: rec.checksum });\r\n        return res.status(400).json({ success: false, error: 'checksum mismatch' });\r\n      }\r\n      await redisDelete(String(id));\r\n      audit({ t: Date.now(), event: 'checksum_verified_redis', id: String(id) });\r\n      return res.json({ success: true, id: String(id), backend: 'redis' });\r\n    } catch (e) {\r\n      // fallback to memory\r\n    }\r\n  }\r\n\r\n  const entry = checksumCache.get(String(id));\r\n  if (!entry) return res.status(404).json({ success: false, error: 'checksum not found or expired' });\r\n  if (entry.checksum !== String(checksum)) {\r\n    audit({ t: Date.now(), event: 'checksum_mismatch_mem', id: String(id), provided: String(checksum), expected: entry.checksum });\r\n    return res.status(400).json({ success: false, error: 'checksum mismatch' });\r\n  }\r\n  // match: remove and return success\r\n  checksumCache.delete(String(id));\r\n  audit({ t: Date.now(), event: 'checksum_verified_mem', id: String(id) });\r\n  return res.json({ success: true, id: String(id), backend: 'memory' });\r\n});\r\n\r\n// list checksums: GET /npz/checksum/list\r\napp.get('/npz/checksum/list', async (_req: any, res: any) => {\r\n  if (redisClient) {\r\n    try {\r\n      const items = await redisList();\r\n      const now = Date.now();\r\n      const result = items.map((it: any) => ({ id: it.id, expiresInMs: Math.max(0, it.expiresAt - now) }));\r\n      return res.json({ success: true, count: result.length, items: result, backend: 'redis' });\r\n    } catch (e) {\r\n      // fallback\r\n    }\r\n  }\r\n  const now = Date.now();\r\n  const results: { id: string; expiresInMs: number }[] = [];\r\n  for (const [id, entry] of checksumCache.entries()) {\r\n    results.push({ id, expiresInMs: Math.max(0, entry.expiresAt - now) });\r\n  }\r\n  return res.json({ success: true, count: results.length, items: results, backend: 'memory' });\r\n});\r\n\r\n// clear checksums: DELETE /npz/checksum/clear\r\napp.delete('/npz/checksum/clear', async (_req: any, res: any) => {\r\n  if (redisClient) {\r\n    try {\r\n      const cleared = await redisClear();\r\n      audit({ t: Date.now(), event: 'checksum_cleared_redis', cleared });\r\n      return res.json({ success: true, cleared, backend: 'redis' });\r\n    } catch (e) {\r\n      // fallback\r\n    }\r\n  }\r\n  const cleared = checksumCache.size;\r\n  checksumCache.clear();\r\n  audit({ t: Date.now(), event: 'checksum_cleared_mem', cleared });\r\n  return res.json({ success: true, cleared, backend: 'memory' });\r\n});\r\n\r\napp.post('/license/activate', async (req: any, res: any) => {\r\n  const { key, key.replace(/.(?=.{4})/g, '*'), product_id });\r\n\r\n  if (!gumroad || typeof gumroad.activateLicense !== 'function') {\r\n    return res.status(501).json({ success: false, error: 'gumroad helper not available on daemon' });\r\n  }\r\n\r\n  const token = process.env.GUMROAD_TOKEN || '';\r\n  const pid = product_id || process.env.GUMROAD_PRODUCT_ID || process.env.GUMROAD_PRODUCT_YEARLY || process.env.GUMROAD_PRODUCT_MONTHLY || '';\r\n\r\n  try {\r\n    const rec = await gumroad.activateLicense(pid, key, token);\r\n    audit({ t: Date.now(), action: 'activate_success', key: success: true, license: rec, valid: rec ? gumroad.isLicenseValid(rec) : false });\r\n});\r\n\r\n// public webhook endpoint suggested: /qflush/license/webhook\r\napp.post('/qflush/license/webhook', checksumCacheSize: checksumCache.size, redis: !!redisClient });\r\n});\r\n\r\n// expose npz pourparler endpoints\r\ntry {\r\n  // eslint-disable-next-line @typescript-eslint/no-var-requires\r\n  const pourparler = require('../utils/npz-pourparler');\r\n\r\n  app.post('/npz/pourparler', (req: any, res: any) => {\r\n    try {\r\n      const body = req.body || {};\r\n      const action = body.action || 'color'; // default action\r\n      const text = String(body.text || '');\r\n\r\n      if (action === 'encode') {\r\n        const enc = pourparler.encodeAscii4(text);\r\n        return res.json({ success: true, encoded: enc });\r\n      }\r\n\r\n      if (action === 'color') {\r\n        const colored = pourparler.colorizeAscii4(text);\r\n        return res.json({ success: true, colored });\r\n      }\r\n\r\n      if (action === 'start') {\r\n        const s = pourparler.startSession(body.systemPrompt || '');\r\n        return res.json({ success: true, session: s });\r\n      }\r\n\r\n      if (action === 'send') {\r\n        if (!body.sessionId) return res.status(400).json({ success: false, error: 'sessionId missing' });\r\n        const m = pourparler.sendMessage(body.sessionId, body.role || 'user', String(body.text || ''));\r\n        return res.json({ success: true, message: m });\r\n      }\r\n\r\n      if (action === 'history') {\r\n        if (!body.sessionId) return res.status(400).json({ success: false, error: 'sessionId missing' });\r\n        const h = pourparler.getHistory(body.sessionId);\r\n        return res.json({ success: true, history: h });\r\n      }\r\n\r\n      if (action === 'end') {\r\n        if (!body.sessionId) return res.status(400).json({ success: false, error: 'sessionId missing' });\r\n        const ok = pourparler.endSession(body.sessionId);\r\n        return res.json({ success: true, ended: ok });\r\n      }\r\n\r\n      if (action === 'checksum') {\r\n        try {\r\n          const cssPath = path.join(process.cwd(), 'extensions', 'vscode-npz', 'pourparler-checksum.css');\r\n            if (fs.existsSync(cssPath)) {\r\n            const content = fs.readFileSync(cssPath, 'utf8');\r\n            // extract the checksum value\r\n            const m = content.match(/--npz-pourparler-checksum:\\s*'([a-f0-9]+)'/i);\r\n            const checksum = m ? m[1] : null;\r\n            return res.json({ success: true, checksum, path: cssPath });\r\n          }\r\n          return res.status(404).json({ success: false, error: 'css not found' });\r\n        } catch (err) {\r\n          return res.status(500).json({ success: false, error: String(err) });\r\n        }\r\n      }\r\n\r\n      return res.status(400).json({ success: false, error: 'unknown action' });\r\n    } catch (e: any) {\r\n      return res.status(500).json({ success: false, error: String(e) });\r\n    }\r\n  });\r\n} catch (e) {\r\n  // ignore if module not present\r\n}\r\n\r\napp.listen(PORT, () => {\r\n  console.log(`qflush running on Utilities for Nezlephant color palette and helpers\r\n// Base color shorthand '0c8' -> #00cc88\r\n\r\nexport const NEZLEPHANT = {\r\n  baseHex: '#00cc88', // shorthand 0c8\r\n  jokerHex: '#ff00cc', // Joker accent (magenta-pink)\r\n  neutralHex: '#0f1724', // dark neutral\r\n  whiteHex: '#ffffff',\r\n  blackHex: '#000000',\r\n};\r\n\r\nfunction clamp(v: number, a = 0, b = 255) {\r\n  return Math.max(a, Math.min(b, Math.round(v)));\r\n}\r\n\r\nexport function hexToRgb(hex: string): { r: number; g: number; b: number } {\r\n  const h = hex.replace('#', '');\r\n  if (h.length === 3) {\r\n    const r = parseInt(h[0] + h[0], 16);\r\n    const g = parseInt(h[1] + h[1], 16);\r\n    const b = parseInt(h[2] + h[2], 16);\r\n    return { r, g, b };\r\n  }\r\n  const r = parseInt(h.slice(0, 2), 16);\r\n  const g = parseInt(h.slice(2, 4), 16);\r\n  const b = parseInt(h.slice(4, 6), 16);\r\n  return { r, g, b };\r\n}\r\n\r\nexport function rgbToHex(r: number, g: number, b: number): string {\r\n  return `#${[r, g, b].map((n) => clamp(n).toString(16).padStart(2, '0')).join('')}`;\r\n}\r\n\r\nexport function rgba(hex: string, alpha = 1): string {\r\n  const { r, g, b } = hexToRgb(hex);\r\n  return `rgba(${r}, ${g}, ${b}, ${alpha})`;\r\n}\r\n\r\nexport function lighten(hex: string, percent = 0.1): string {\r\n  const { r, g, b } = hexToRgb(hex);\r\n  const nr = clamp(r + (255 - r) * percent);\r\n  const ng = clamp(g + (255 - g) * percent);\r\n  const nb = clamp(b + (255 - b) * percent);\r\n  return rgbToHex(nr, ng, nb);\r\n}\r\n\r\nexport function darken(hex: string, percent = 0.1): string {\r\n  const { r, g, b } = hexToRgb(hex);\r\n  const nr = clamp(r * (1 - percent));\r\n  const ng = clamp(g * (1 - percent));\r\n  const nb = clamp(b * (1 - percent));\r\n  return rgbToHex(nr, ng, nb);\r\n}\r\n\r\nexport function relativeLuminance(hex: string): number {\r\n  const { r, g, b } = hexToRgb(hex);\r\n  const srgb = [r / 255, g / 255, b / 255].map((c) => (c <= 0.03928 ? c / 12.92 : Math.pow((c + 0.055) / 1.055, 2.4)));\r\n  return 0.2126 * srgb[0] + 0.7152 * srgb[1] + 0.0722 * srgb[2];\r\n}\r\n\r\nexport function contrastRatio(hexA: string, hexB: string): number {\r\n  const L1 = relativeLuminance(hexA) + 0.05;\r\n  const L2 = relativeLuminance(hexB) + 0.05;\r\n  return Math.max(L1, L2) / Math.min(L1, L2);\r\n}\r\n\r\nexport function readableTextColor(backgroundHex: string, prefer = NEZLEPHANT.whiteHex): string {\r\n  // return white or black depending on contrast\r\n  const whiteContrast = contrastRatio(backgroundHex, NEZLEPHANT.whiteHex);\r\n  const blackContrast = contrastRatio(backgroundHex, NEZLEPHANT.blackHex);\r\n  return whiteContrast >= blackContrast ? NEZLEPHANT.whiteHex : NEZLEPHANT.blackHex;\r\n}\r\n\r\nexport function cssVariables(prefix = 'nez') {\r\n  const base = NEZLEPHANT.baseHex;\r\n  const j = NEZLEPHANT.jokerHex;\r\n  return `:root {\\n  --${prefix}-base: ${base};\\n  --${prefix}-base-90: ${rgba(base, 0.9)};\\n  --${prefix}-base-80: ${rgba(base, 0.8)};\\n  --${prefix}-base-60: ${rgba(base, 0.6)};\\n  --${prefix}-base-30: ${rgba(base, 0.3)};\\n  --${prefix}-light: ${lighten(base, 0.18)};\\n  --${prefix}-dark: ${darken(base, 0.18)};\\n  --${prefix}-joker: ${j};\\n  --${prefix}-bg: ${NEZLEPHANT.neutralHex};\\n  --${prefix}-text: ${readableTextColor(NEZLEPHANT.neutralHex)};\\n}`;\r\n}\r\n\r\n// Terminal ANSI truecolor helpers (supports modern terminals)\r\nexport function ansiFg(hex: string): string {\r\n  const { r, g, b } = hexToRgb(hex);\r\n  return `\\x1b[38;2;${r};${g};${b}m`;\r\n}\r\nexport function ansiBg(hex: string): string {\r\n  const { r, g, b } = hexToRgb(hex);\r\n  return `\\x1b[48;2;${r};${g};${b}m`;\r\n}\r\nexport const ansiReset = '\\x1b[0m';\r\n\r\n// Preset styled log helpers for Joker + Nezlephant\r\nexport function styledLog(title: string, msg: string, opts?: { accent?: 'joker' | 'base' | 'neutral' }) {\r\n  const accent = opts?.accent === 'joker' ? NEZLEPHANT.jokerHex : opts?.accent === 'neutral' ? NEZLEPHANT.neutralHex : NEZLEPHANT.baseHex;\r\n  const bg = ansiBg(darken(accent, 0.15));\r\n  const fg = ansiFg(readableTextColor(darken(accent, 0.15)));\r\n  const accentFg = ansiFg(accent);\r\n  process.stdout.write(`${bg}${fg} [${title}] ${ansiReset} ${accentFg}${msg}${ansiReset}\\n`);\r\n}\r\n\r\nexport default {\r\n  NEZLEPHANT,\r\n  hexToRgb,\r\n  rgbToHex,\r\n  rgba,\r\n  lighten,\r\n  darken,\r\n  readableTextColor,\r\n  cssVariables,\r\n  ansiFg,\r\n  ansiBg,\r\n  ansiReset,\r\n  styledLog,\r\n};\r\n","usedDeprecatedRules":[]},{"filePath":"D:\\qflush\\src\\utils\\detect.ts","messages":[{"ruleId":"@typescript-eslint/no-unused-vars","severity":1,"message":"'err' is defined but never used. detectModules() {\r\n  const out: Record<string, any> = {};\r\n  for (const name of Object.keys(SERVICE_MAP))\r\n    out[name] = { running: false, installed: false, path: undefined, bin: undefined Promise<void>((resolve) => {\r\n    exec(process.platform === \"win32\" ? \"tasklist\" : \"ps aux\", (err, stdout) => {\r\n      if (err) {\r\n        logger.warn(`Failed to list processes: http from 'http';\r\nimport net from 'net';\r\nimport { logger } from './logger';\r\n\r\nexport async function httpProbe(url: string, timeout = 2000): Promise<boolean> {\r\n  return new Promise((resolve) => {\r\n    const req = http.get(url, (res) => {\r\n      res.resume();\r\n      resolve(Boolean(res.statusCode && res.statusCode < 400));\r\n    });\r\n    req.on('error', () => resolve(false));\r\n    req.setTimeout(timeout, () => {\r\n      req.destroy();\r\n      resolve(false);\r\n    });\r\n  });\r\n}\r\n\r\nexport async function tcpProbe(host: string, port: number, timeout = 2000): Promise<boolean> {\r\n  return new Promise((resolve) => {\r\n    const s = new net.Socket();\r\n    let done = false;\r\n    s.setTimeout(timeout);\r\n    s.on('connect', () => {\r\n      done = true;\r\n      s.destroy();\r\n      resolve(true);\r\n    });\r\n    s.on('error', () => { if (!done) { done = true; resolve(false); } });\r\n    s.on('timeout', () => { if (!done) { done = true; s.destroy(); resolve(false); } });\r\n    s.connect(port, host);\r\n  });\r\n}\r\n\r\nexport async function waitForService(urlOrHost: string, port?: number, timeout = 5000) {\r\n  const start = Date.now();\r\n  while (Date.now() - start < timeout) {\r\n    let ok = false;\r\n    if (typeof port === 'number') {\r\n      ok = await tcpProbe(urlOrHost, port, 1000);\r\n    } else if (urlOrHost.startsWith('http')) {\r\n      ok = await httpProbe(urlOrHost, 1000);\r\n    }\r\n    if (ok) return true;\r\n    await new Promise((r) => setTimeout(r, 500));\r\n  }\r\n  return { getNpzNamespace } from './npz-config';\r\nimport fs from 'fs';\r\nimport path from 'path';\r\nimport logger from './logger';\r\nimport { Lane } from './npz-router';\r\n\r\nconst NS = getNpzNamespace();\r\nconst ENGINE_FILE = path.join(process.cwd(), '.qflush', `${NS}-npz-engine.json`);\r\n\r\ntype ScoreRecord = {\r\n  laneId: number;\r\n  score: number; // lower is better\r\n  lastSuccess?: number;\r\n  lastFailure?: number;\r\n};\r\n\r\ntype EngineStore = Record<number, ScoreRecord>;\r\n\r\nlet store: EngineStore = {};\r\n\r\n// decay parameters\r\nconst DECAY_INTERVAL_MS = 60 * 1000; // every minute\r\nconst DECAY_FACTOR = 0.9; // multiply score by this every decay interval (towards 0)\r\n\r\nfunction ensureDir() {\r\n  const dir = path.dirname(ENGINE_FILE);\r\n  if (!fs.existsSync(dir)) fs.mkdirSync(dir, { recursive: true });\r\n}\r\n\r\nfunction load() {\r\n  try {\r\n    if (fs.existsSync(ENGINE_FILE)) {\r\n      const raw = fs.readFileSync(ENGINE_FILE, 'utf8');\r\n      store = JSON.parse(raw) as EngineStore;\r\n    }\r\n  } catch (e) {\r\n    store = {};\r\n  }\r\n}\r\n\r\nfunction persist() {\r\n  try {\r\n    ensureDir();\r\n    fs.writeFileSync(ENGINE_FILE, JSON.stringify(store, null, 2), 'utf8');\r\n  } catch (e) {}\r\n}\r\n\r\nfunction applyDecay() {\r\n  const now = Date.now();\r\n  let changed = false;\r\n  for (const k of Object.keys(store)) {\r\n    const id = Number(k);\r\n    const rec = store[id];\r\n    if (!rec) continue;\r\n    // compute how many intervals since lastSuccess/lastFailure (use lastFailure as activity reference)\r\n    const ref = rec.lastFailure || rec.lastSuccess || now;\r\n    const intervals = Math.floor((now - ref) / DECAY_INTERVAL_MS);\r\n    if (intervals <= 0) continue;\r\n    const factor = Math.pow(DECAY_FACTOR, intervals);\r\n    const newScore = rec.score * factor;\r\n    if (Math.abs(newScore - rec.score) > 1e-6) {\r\n      rec.score = newScore;\r\n      changed = true;\r\n    }\r\n  }\r\n  if (changed) persist();\r\n}\r\n\r\nload();\r\n\r\n// schedule periodic decay in-memory (best-effort)\r\nsetInterval(() => {\r\n  try { applyDecay(); } catch (e) {}\r\n}, DECAY_INTERVAL_MS);\r\n\r\n/**\r\n * Adjust lane score.\r\n * delta: positive increases penalty (worse), negative decreases (better).\r\n * latencyMs: optional latency observed to weight the delta.\r\n */\r\nexport function scoreLane(laneId: number, delta: number, latencyMs?: number) {\r\n  let rec = store[laneId];\r\n  if (!rec) rec = { laneId, score: 0 };\r\n  // weight delta by latency (if provided): normalized over 1000ms\r\n  let weight = 1;\r\n  if (latencyMs && latencyMs > 0) weight += Math.min(5, latencyMs / 1000); // cap weight\r\n  rec.score = (rec.score || 0) + delta * weight;\r\n  if (delta < 0) rec.lastSuccess = Date.now();\r\n  if (delta > 0) rec.lastFailure = Date.now();\r\n  store[laneId] = rec;\r\n  persist();\r\n}\r\n\r\nexport function getLaneScore(laneId: number) {\r\n  const rec = store[laneId];\r\n  if (!rec) return 0;\r\n  // apply decay relative to now on read (non-persistent)\r\n  const now = Date.now();\r\n  const ref = rec.lastFailure || rec.lastSuccess || now;\r\n  const intervals = Math.floor((now - ref) / DECAY_INTERVAL_MS);\r\n  const factor = Math.pow(DECAY_FACTOR, intervals);\r\n  return rec.score * factor;\r\n}\r\n\r\nexport function orderLanesByScore(lanes: Lane[]) {\r\n  // return copy sorted by score asc\r\n  const out = lanes.slice();\r\n  out.sort((a, b) => getLaneScore(a.id) - getLaneScore(b.id));\r\n  return out;\r\n}\r\n\r\nexport function resetScores() {\r\n  store = {};\r\n  persist();\r\n}\r\n\r\nexport function getStore() {\r\n  return store;\r\n}\r\n\r\nexport default { scoreLane, getLaneScore, orderLanesByScore, resetScores, getStore crypto from 'crypto';\r\n\r\ntype Message = { id: string; role: 'user' | 'assistant' | 'system'; text: string; t: number };\r\n\r\ntype Session = { id: string; messages: Message[]; createdAt: number };\r\n\r\nconst SESSIONS: Map<string, Session> = new Map();\r\n\r\nfunction id() { return Math.random().toString(36).slice(2,10); }\r\n\r\nexport function startSession(systemPrompt = ''): Session {\r\n  const sid = 's_' + id();\r\n  const s: Session = { id: sid, messages: [], createdAt: Date.now() };\r\n  if (systemPrompt) s.messages.push({ id: 'm_' + id(), role: 'system', text: systemPrompt, t: Date.now() });\r\n  SESSIONS.set(sid, s);\r\n  return s;\r\n}\r\n\r\nexport function sendMessage(sessionId: string, role: 'user' | 'assistant' | 'system', text: string) {\r\n  const s = SESSIONS.get(sessionId);\r\n  if (!s) throw new Error('session not found');\r\n  const m: Message = { id: 'm_' + id(), role, text, t: Date.now() };\r\n  s.messages.push(m);\r\n  return endSession(sessionId: string) {\r\n  return SESSIONS.delete(sessionId);\r\n}\r\n\r\n// --- New: ASCII 4-byte encoding + colorize helpers ---\r\n\r\nfunction md5First4BytesHex(ch: string): string {\r\n  // return first 4 bytes (8 hex chars) of md5 of the char\r\n  const h = crypto.createHash('md5').update(ch).digest('hex');\r\n  return h.slice(0, 8);\r\n}\r\n\r\nexport function encodeAscii4(text: string): { ch: string; hex4: string }[] {\r\n  const out: { ch: string; hex4: string }[] = [];\r\n  for (const ch of text) {\r\n    out.push({ ch, hex4: md5First4BytesHex(ch) });\r\n  }\r\n  return out;\r\n}\r\n\r\nfunction hexToRgb(hex: string) {\r\n  const h = hex.replace('#', '');\r\n  const r = parseInt(h.slice(0, 2), 16);\r\n  const g = parseInt(h.slice(2, 4), 16);\r\n  const b = parseInt(h.slice(4, 6), 16);\r\n  return { r, g, b };\r\n}\r\n\r\nfunction byteToColor(b: number) {\r\n  // map single byte [0..255] to a color by expanding into RGB via simple transform\r\n  const r = (b * 3) % 256;\r\n  const g = (b * 7) % 256;\r\n  const b2 = (b * 13) % 256;\r\n  return { r, g, b: b2 };\r\n}\r\n\r\nexport function colorizeAscii4(text: string): string {\r\n  // returns ANSI colored string: for each char produce a colored block based on its 4-byte hex\r\n  const parts: string[] = [];\r\n  for (const ch of text) {\r\n    const hex4 = md5First4BytesHex(ch); // 8 hex chars\r\n    // split into 4 bytes\r\n    const bytes: number[] = [];\r\n    for (let i = 0; i < 8; i += 2) bytes.push(parseInt(hex4.slice(i, i+2), 16));\r\n    // pick a representative color from bytes\r\n    const col = byteToColor(bytes[0]);\r\n    const ansi = `\\x1b[48;2;${col.r};${col.g};${col.b}m\\x1b[38;2;0;0;0m ${ch} \\x1b[0m`;\r\n    parts.push(ansi);\r\n  }\r\n  return parts.join('');\r\n}\r\n\r\nexport default { startSession, sendMessage, getHistory, endSession, encodeAscii4, colorizeAscii4 };\r\n","usedDeprecatedRules":[]},{"filePath":"D:\\qflush\\src\\utils\\npz-router.ts","messages":[{"ruleId":"@typescript-eslint/no-unused-vars","severity":1,"message":"'lanes' is assigned a value but
