fs from 'fs';\r\nimport path from 'path';\r\nimport { performance } from 'perf_hooks';\r\nimport logger from './logger';\r\nimport client from 'prom-client';\r\nimport { getNpzNamespace } from './npz-config';\r\nimport engine from './npz-engine';\r\n\r\nconst NS = getNpzNamespace();\r\n\r\nexport type Lane = { id: number; name: string; url: string };\r\n\r\nexport const DEFAULT_LANES: Lane[] = [\r\n  { id: 0, name: 'primary', url: 'https://api.primary.local' },\r\n  { id: 1, name: 'backup-fast', url: 'https://fast.api.local' },\r\n  { id: 2, name: 'backup-slow', url: 'https://slow.api.local' },\r\n];\r\n\r\nconst STORE_FILE = path.join(process.cwd(), '.qflush', `${NS}-npz-lanes.json`);\r\nconst DEFAULT_TIMEOUT = 3000; // ms\r\nconst PREFERRED_TTL = 24 * 3600 * 1000; // 24h\r\n\r\n// Circuit breaker settings\r\nconst FAIL_THRESHOLD = 3; // failures\r\nconst FAIL_WINDOW_MS = 60 * 1000; // 1m\r\nconst COOLDOWN_MS = 5 * 60 * 1000; // 5m\r\n\r\ntype Store = Record<string, { laneId: number; ts: number }>;\r\n\r\ntype CircuitState = {\r\n  failures: number;\r\n  firstFailureTs?: number;\r\n  trippedUntil?: number;\r\n};\r\n\r\nconst circuit: Map<string, Map<number, CircuitState>> = new Map(); // host -> laneId -> state\r\n\r\n// Prometheus metrics\r\nconst laneSuccess = new client.Counter({ name: `${NS}_lane_success_total`, help: 'NPZ lane successes', labelNames: ['host', 'lane', 'namespace'] });\r\nconst laneFailure = new client.Counter({ name: `${NS}_lane_failure_total`, help: 'NPZ lane failures', labelNames: ['host', 'lane', 'namespace'] });\r\n\r\nfunction ensureStoreDir() {\r\n  const dir = path.dirname(STORE_FILE);\r\n  if (!fs.existsSync(dir)) fs.mkdirSync(dir, { recursive: true });\r\n}\r\n\r\nfunction readStore(): Store {\r\n  try {\r\n    if (!fs.existsSync(STORE_FILE)) return {};\r\n    const raw = fs.readFileSync(STORE_FILE, 'utf8');\r\n    return JSON.parse(raw) as Store;\r\n  } catch (err) {\r\n    logger.warn(`npz-router: failed to read store ${err}`);\r\n    return {};\r\n  }\r\n}\r\n\r\nfunction writeStore(s: Store) {\r\n  try {\r\n    ensureStoreDir();\r\n    fs.writeFileSync(STORE_FILE, JSON.stringify(s, null, 2), 'utf8');\r\n  } catch (err) {\r\n    logger.warn(`npz-router: failed to write store ${err}`);\r\n  }\r\n}\r\n\r\nexport function getPreferredLane(host: string): number | null {\r\n  const s = readStore();\r\n  const entry = s[host];\r\n  if (!entry) return null;\r\n  if (Date.now() - entry.ts > PREFERRED_TTL) return null;\r\n  return entry.laneId;\r\n}\r\n\r\nexport function setPreferredLane(host: string, laneId: number) {\r\n  const s = readStore();\r\n  s[host] = { laneId, ts: Date.now() };\r\n  writeStore(s);\r\n}\r\n\r\nexport function lanesForHost(host: string, lanes: Lane[] = DEFAULT_LANES): Lane[] {\r\n  const pref = getPreferredLane(host);\r\n  // first let engine reorder by score\r\n  const ordered = engine.orderLanesByScore(lanes);\r\n  // then apply preferred lane override\r\n  if (pref === null) return ordered.slice();\r\n  const idx = ordered.findIndex((l) => l.id === pref);\r\n  if (idx <= 0) return ordered.slice();\r\n  const res = [ordered[idx], ...ordered.slice(0, idx), ...ordered.slice(idx + 1)];\r\n  return res;\r\n}\r\n\r\n// Circuit breaker helpers\r\nfunction getCircuitMapForHost(host: string) {\r\n  let m = circuit.get(host);\r\n  if (!m) {\r\n    m = new Map();\r\n    circuit.set(host, m);\r\n  }\r\n  return m;\r\n}\r\n\r\nexport function recordFailure(host: string, laneId: number, latencyMs?: number) {\r\n  const m = getCircuitMapForHost(host);\r\n  const now = Date.now();\r\n  const st = m.get(laneId) || { failures: 0 };\r\n  if (!st.firstFailureTs || now - (st.firstFailureTs || 0) > FAIL_WINDOW_MS) {\r\n    st.failures = 1;\r\n    st.firstFailureTs = now;\r\n  } else {\r\n    st.failures = (st.failures || 0) + 1;\r\n  }\r\n  if (st.failures >= FAIL_THRESHOLD) {\r\n    st.trippedUntil = now + COOLDOWN_MS;\r\n    logger.warn(`npz-router: lane ${laneId} for ${host} tripped until ${new Date(st.trippedUntil)}`);\r\n  }\r\n  m.set(laneId, st);\r\n  try { laneFailure.inc({ host, lane: String(laneId), namespace: NS } as any); } catch {}\r\n  try { engine.scoreLane(laneId, 1, latencyMs); } catch {}\r\n}\r\n\r\nexport function recordSuccess(host: string, laneId: number, latencyMs?: number) {\r\n  const m = getCircuitMapForHost(host);\r\n  m.delete(laneId);\r\n  try { laneSuccess.inc({ host, lane: String(laneId), namespace: NS } as any); } catch {}\r\n  try { engine.scoreLane(laneId, -1, latencyMs); } catch {}\r\n}\r\n\r\nexport function isLaneTripped(host: string, laneId: number): boolean {\r\n  const m = circuit.get(host);\r\n  if (!m) return false;\r\n  const st = m.get(laneId);\r\n  if (!st) return false;\r\n  if (st.trippedUntil && Date.now() < st.trippedUntil) return true;\r\n  // cooldown passed\r\n  if (st.trippedUntil && Date.now() >= st.trippedUntil) {\r\n    m.delete(laneId);\r\n    return false;\r\n  }\r\n  return false;\r\n}\r\n\r\n// lightweight fetch wrapper that returns {status, headers, body, durationMs}\r\nasync function tryFetch(fullUrl: string, options: any = {}, timeout = DEFAULT_TIMEOUT) {\r\n  const controller = typeof AbortController !== 'undefined' ? new AbortController() : null;\r\n  const signalOpt = controller ? { signal: controller.signal } : {};\r\n  const opts = { method: options.method || 'GET', headers: options.headers || {}, body: options.body, ...signalOpt };\r\n  let timer: NodeJS.Timeout | null = null;\r\n  const start = performance.now();\r\n  if (controller) timer = setTimeout(() => controller.abort(), timeout);\r\n  try {\r\n    // prefer global fetch\r\n    let ff: any = (globalThis as any).fetch;\r\n    if (!ff) {\r\n      try {\r\n        // eslint-disable-next-line @typescript-eslint/no-var-requires\r\n        ff = require('undici').fetch;\r\n      } catch (e) {\r\n        throw new Error('No fetch available (install undici or use Node 18+)');\r\n      }\r\n    }\r\n    const res = await ff(fullUrl, opts);\r\n    const text = await res.text();\r\n    if (timer) clearTimeout(timer);\r\n    const duration = Math.max(0, Math.round(performance.now() - start));\r\n    return { ok: true, status: res.status, headers: res.headers, body: text, durationMs: duration };\r\n  } catch (err: any) {\r\n    if (timer) clearTimeout(timer);\r\n    const duration = Math.max(0, Math.round(performance.now() - start));\r\n    return { ok: false, error: err, durationMs: duration };\r\n  }\r\n}\r\n\r\nexport type NpzRequest = { method?: string; url: string; headers?: Record<string, string>; body?: any; timeout?: number };\r\nexport type NpzResponse = { status?: number; headers?: any; body?: string; error?: any; gate?: string; laneId?: number; durationMs?: number };\r\n\r\nexport async function npzRoute(req: NpzRequest, lanes: Lane[] = DEFAULT_LANES): Promise<NpzResponse> {\r\n  try {\r\n    const urlObj = new URL(req.url);\r\n    const host = urlObj.host;\r\n    const ordered = lanesForHost(host) as Lane[];\r\n\r\n    // attempt primary\r\n    const primary = ordered[0];\r\n    const primaryUrl = req.url.replace(urlObj.origin, primary.url);\r\n    const timeout = req.timeout || DEFAULT_TIMEOUT;\r\n\r\n    logger.nez('NPZ', `attempting primary lane ${primary.name} -> ${primaryUrl}`);\r\n    const t0 = await tryFetch(primaryUrl, { method: req.method, headers: req.headers, body: req.body }, timeout);\r\n\r\n    if (t0.ok && t0.status && t0.status < 500) {\r\n      logger.nez('NPZ', `primary succeeded (${primary.name})`);\r\n      setPreferredLane(host, primary.id);\r\n      recordSuccess(host, primary.id, t0.durationMs);\r\n      return { status: t0.status, headers: t0.headers, body: t0.body, gate: 'primary', laneId: primary.id, durationMs: t0.durationMs };\r\n    }\r\n\r\n    // primary failed -> try fallback(s)\r\n    logger.warn(`[NPZ] primary failed for ${primary.name}, running fallbacks`);\r\n    recordFailure(host, primary.id, t0.durationMs);\r\n\r\n    for (let i = 1; i < ordered.length; i++) {\r\n      const lane = ordered[i];\r\n      const laneUrl = req.url.replace(urlObj.origin, lane.url);\r\n      logger.nez('NPZ', `trying fallback lane ${lane.name} -> ${laneUrl}`);\r\n      const res = await tryFetch(laneUrl, { method: req.method, headers: req.headers, body: req.body }, timeout);\r\n      if (res.ok && res.status && res.status < 500) {\r\n        logger.nez('NPZ', `fallback lane ${lane.name} succeeded`);\r\n        // set preferred to fallback for next time\r\n        setPreferredLane(host, lane.id);\r\n        recordSuccess(host, lane.id, res.durationMs);\r\n\r\n        // replay primary with an extra header (T2)\r\n        const replayHeaders = Object.assign({}, req.headers || {});\r\n        replayHeaders['X-NPZ-FALLBACK'] = '1';\r\n        const replayUrl = primaryUrl;\r\n        logger.nez('NPZ', `replaying primary (${primary.name}) with fallback header`);\r\n        const replay = await tryFetch(replayUrl, { method: req.method, headers: replayHeaders, body: req.body }, timeout);\r\n        if (replay.ok && replay.status && replay.status < 500) {\r\n          logger.nez('NPZ', `replayed primary succeeded after fallback`);\r\n          return { status: replay.status, headers: replay.headers, body: replay.body, gate: 'replay', laneId: primary.id, durationMs: replay.durationMs };\r\n        }\r\n\r\n        // if replay failed, return fallback result\r\n        return { status: res.status, headers: res.headers, body: res.body, gate: 'fallback', laneId: lane.id, durationMs: res.durationMs };\r\n      } else {\r\n        recordFailure(host, lane.id, res.durationMs);\r\n      }\r\n    }\r\n\r\n    // if all failed, return primary error or generic\r\n    logger.warn('[NPZ] all lanes failed');\r\n    if (t0 && !t0.ok) return { error: t0.error, gate: 'fail', durationMs: t0.durationMs };\r\n    return { status: t0.status, body: t0.body, gate: 'fail', durationMs: t0.durationMs };\r\n  } catch (err) {\r\n    return { error: err, gate: 'error' };\r\n  }\r\n}\r\n\r\nexport function getCircuitState(host: string) {\r\n  const m = circuit.get(host);\r\n  if (!m) return {} as Record<number, CircuitState>;\r\n  const out: Record<number, CircuitState> = {};\r\n  for (const [k, v] of m.entries()) out[k] = v;\r\n  return out;\r\n}\r\n\r\nexport default { DEFAULT_LANES, npzRoute, getPreferredLane, setPreferredLane, lanesForHost, recordFailure, recordSuccess, isLaneTripped, getCircuitState };\r\n","usedDeprecatedRules":[]},{"filePath":"D:\\qflush\\src\\utils\\npz-store-redis.ts","messages":[],"suppressedMessages":[],"errorCount":0,"fatalErrorCount":0,"warningCount":0,"fixableErrorCount":0,"fixableWarningCount":0,"usedDeprecatedRules":[]},{"filePath":"D:\\qflush\\src\\utils\\npz-store.ts","messages":[],"suppressedMessages":[],"errorCount":0,"fatalErrorCount":0,"warningCount":0,"fixableErrorCount":0,"fixableWarningCount":0,"usedDeprecatedRules":[]},{"filePath":"D:\\qflush\\src\\utils\\npz.ts","messages":[],"suppressedMessages":[],"errorCount":0,"fatalErrorCount":0,"warningCount":0,"fixableErrorCount":0,"fixableWarningCount":0,"usedDeprecatedRules":[]},{"filePath":"D:\\qflush\\src\\utils\\package.ts","messages":[],"suppressedMessages":[],"errorCount":0,"fatalErrorCount":0,"warningCount":0,"fixableErrorCount":0,"fixableWarningCount":0,"usedDeprecatedRules":[]},{"filePath":"D:\\qflush\\src\\utils\\paths.ts","messages":[],"suppressedMessages":[],"errorCount":0,"fatalErrorCount":0,"warningCount":0,"fixableErrorCount":0,"fixableWarningCount":0,"usedDeprecatedRules":[]},{"filePath":"D:\\qflush\\src\\utils\\tokens.ts","messages":[],"suppressedMessages":[],"errorCount":0,"fatalErrorCount":0,"warningCount":0,"fixableErrorCount":0,"fixableWarningCount":0,"usedDeprecatedRules":[]}]

============================
FILE: examples\rome-workspace\README.md
============================
============================
     1: Minimal example workspace used by CI to satisfy tools that expect a workspace folder (Rome).
     2: 
     3: This folder intentionally contains an empty package.json and a simple lockfile to allow `npm ci` to succeed in CI runs that initialize workspaces.
     4:

============================
FILE: extensions\visual-studio-npz\README.md
============================
============================
     1: NPZ Visual - Visual Studio extension skeleton
     2: 
     3: This folder contains a minimal Visual Studio VSIX project that hosts a WebView2-powered Tool Window to display the NPZ panel (the same UI used by the VS Code extension).
     4: 
     5: How to build and install using Visual Studio (Community) on Windows:
     6: 
     7: 1. Open a Developer Command Prompt for VS 2022 or use the full devenv path.
     8: 2. Build the VSIX project via MSBuild or devenv.exe:
     9:    - Using devenv.exe:
    10:      "C:\Program Files\Microsoft Visual Studio\18\Community\Common7\IDE\devenv.exe" /build Release "extensions\visual-studio-npz\NPZVsix\NPZVsix.csproj"
    11:    - Or open the solution in Visual Studio and press F5 to debug/install.
    12: 3. The produced `.vsix` will be in the `bin\Release` folder. Install via Extensions -> Manage Extensions -> Install from VSIX.
    13: 
    14: Notes:
    15: - The Tool Window loads `resources\panel.html` by default. You can change it to point at `http://localhost:4500` (NPZ daemon) to fetch dynamic data.
    16: - WebView2 runtime may be required on the target machine.
    17:

     1: {
     2:   "name": "qflush",
     3:   "displayName": "QFlush Extension",
     4:   "publisher": "funesterie",
     5:   "version": "3.1.1",

     7:     "vscode": "^1.106.0"
     8:   },

    11:     "vscode:prepublish": "npm run build",
    12:     "build": "tsc -p ./",
    13:     "package": "npx vsce package",
    14:     "prestart": "node -e \"require('./src/polyfill-file.js')\""
    15:   },
    16:   "devDependencies": {
    17:     "@types/node": "^24.10.1",
    18:     "@types/vscode": "^1.106.1",
    19:     "typescript": "^5.9.3",
    20:     "vsce": "^2.15.0",
    21:     "vitest": "^1.3.0"
    22:   },
    23:   "description": "Visualize NPZ engine scores and manage lanes from VS Code.",
    24:   "icon": "icon.png",
    25:   "repository": {
    26:     "type": "git",
    27:     "url": "https://github.com/jEFFLEZ/qflush.git"
    28:   },
    29:   "license": "MIT",
    30:   "contributes": {
    31:     "commands": [
    32:       {
    33:         "command": "qflush.openPanel",
    34:         "title": "QFlush: Open Panel"
    35:       },
    36:       {
    37:         "command": "qflush.showLicenseStatus",
    38:         "title": "QFlush: Show License Status"
    39:       }
    40:     ],
    41:     "configuration": {
    42:       "type": "object",

    45:         "qflush.daemonUrl": {
    46:           "type": "string",
    47:           "default": "http://localhost:4500",
    48:           "description": "URL of the NPZ daemon (including protocol and port)"
    49:         },
    50:         "qflush.adminToken": {
    51:           "type": "string",
    52:           "default": "changeme",
    53:           "description": "Admin token to call NPZ admin endpoints"
    54:         }
    55:       }
    56:     }
    57:   }
    58: }
    59: 
    60:

============================
FILE: extensions\vscode-npz\README.md
============================
============================
     1: # Qflush – NPZ Visual
     2: 
     3: Qflush Visual est l’extension officielle pour visualiser et contrôler le moteur Qflush / NPZ depuis VS Code / VSCodium / Theia.
     4: 
     5: ## Fonctionnalités
     6: 
     7: - Visualisation des scores NPZ en temps réel
     8: - Panel HTML interactif
     9: - Commandes : `qflush.openPanel`, `qflush.showLicenseStatus`
    10: - Intégration avec le daemon Qflush local (`http://localhost:4500`)
    11: - Préparation pour activation licence Gumroad
    12: 
    13: ## Installation
    14: 
    15: - Installer Qflush (npm) :
    16: 
    17: ```sh
    18: npm i -g @funeste38/qflush
    19: ```
    20: 
    21: - Lancer le daemon :
    22: 
    23: ```
    24: qflush daemon
    25: ```
    26: 
    27: - Depuis VSCodium, installer l’extension Qflush depuis Open VSX.
    28: 
    29: ## Commands
    30: 
    31: - `qflush.openPanel` – Ouvre le panneau NPZ Scores
    32: - `qflush.showLicenseStatus` – Affiche l’état de la licence
    33: 
    34: ## Licence
    35: MIT – © Funesterie
    36:

    43: // import Rome tag utilities
    44: const rome_tag_1 = require("@rome/rome-tag");
    45: const TRIAL_DAYS = 14;
    46: function isTrialExpired(context) {
    47:     const started = context.globalState.get('qflush.trialStarted');
    48:     if (!started)
    49:         return false; // start on first use
    50:     const now = Date.now();
    51:     return now - started > TRIAL_DAYS * 24 * 3600 * 1000;
    52: }
    53: function ensureTrialStarted(context) {
    54:     const started = context.globalState.get('qflush.trialStarted');
    55:     if (!started)
    56:         context.globalState.update('qflush.trialStarted', Date.now());
    57: }
    58: function postJson(urlStr, body) {
    59:     return new Promise((resolve, reject) => {
    60:         try {
    61:             const url = new URL(urlStr);
    62:             const data = JSON.stringify(body || {});
    63:             const opts = {
    64:                 hostname: url.hostname,
    65:                 port: url.port || (url.protocol === 'https:' ? 443 : 80),
    66:                 path: url.pathname + (url.search || ''),
    67:                 method: 'POST',
    68:                 headers: {
    69:                     'Content-Type': 'application/json',
    70:                     'Content-Length': Buffer.byteLength(data),
    71:                 },
    72:             };
    73:             const lib = url.protocol === 'https:' ? https : http;
    74:             const req = lib.request(opts, (res) => {
    75:                 let raw = '';
    76:                 res.setEncoding('utf8');
    77:                 res.on('data', (chunk) => (raw += chunk));
    78:                 res.on('end', () => {
    79:                     try {
    80:                         const parsed = raw ? JSON.parse(raw) : {};
    81:                         if (res.statusCode && res.statusCode >= 200 && res.statusCode < 300)
    82:                             resolve(parsed);
    83:                         else
    84:                             reject(new Error(parsed && parsed.error ? parsed.error : `HTTP ${res.statusCode}`));
    85:                     }
    86:                     catch (e) {
    87:                         reject(e);
    88:                     }
    89:                 });
    90:             });
    91:             req.on('error', (err) => reject(err));
    92:             req.write(data);
    93:             req.end();
    94:         }
    95:         catch (e) {
    96:             reject(e);
    97:         }
    98:     });
    99: }
   100: function getJson(urlStr) {
   101:     return new Promise((resolve, reject) => {
   102:         try {
   103:             const url = new URL(urlStr);
   104:             const lib = url.protocol === 'https:' ? https : http;
   105:             const req = lib.get(urlStr, (res) => {
   106:                 let raw = '';
   107:                 res.setEncoding('utf8');
   108:                 res.on('data', (chunk) => (raw += chunk));
   109:                 res.on('end', () => {
   110:                     try {
   111:                         const parsed = raw ? JSON.parse(raw) : {};
   112:                         if (res.statusCode && res.statusCode >= 200 && res.statusCode < 300)
   113:                             resolve(parsed);
   114:                         else
   115:                             reject(new Error(parsed && parsed.error ? parsed.error : `HTTP ${res.statusCode}`));
   116:                     }
   117:                     catch (e) {
   118:                         reject(e);
   119:                     }
   120:                 });
   121:             });
   122:             req.on('error', (err) => reject(err));
   123:         }
   124:         catch (e) {
   125:             reject(e);
   126:         }
   127:     });
   128: }
   129: async function saveRomeIndexRecord(record) {
   130:     try {
   131:         const root = process.cwd();
   132:         const dir = path.join(root, '.qflush');
   133:         if (!fs.existsSync(dir))
   134:             fs.mkdirSync(dir, { recursive: true });
   135:         const idxFile = path.join(dir, 'rome-index.json');
   136:         let idx = {};
   137:         if (fs.existsSync(idxFile)) {
   138:             try {
   139:                 idx = JSON.parse(fs.readFileSync(idxFile, 'utf8') || '{}');
   140:             }
   141:             catch {
   142:                 idx = {};
   143:             }
   144:         }
   145:         // normalize path and build canonical record using shared module
   146:         const relPath = (0, rome_tag_1.normalizeRomePath)(record.path);
   147:         const rec = (0, rome_tag_1.makeRomeTagRecord)({ type: record.type, path: relPath });
   148:         idx[rec.path] = rec;
   149:         fs.writeFileSync(idxFile, JSON.stringify(idx, null, 2), 'utf8');
   150:         return { success: true, record: idx[rec.path] };
   151:     }
   152:     catch (e) {
   153:         return { success: false, error: String(e) };
   154:     }
   155: }
   156: function activate(context) {
   157:     ensureTrialStarted(context);
   158:     const openDisposable = vscode.commands.registerCommand('qflush.openPanel', () => {
   159:         if (isTrialExpired(context)) {
   160:             vscode.window.showInformationMessage('QFlush trial expired. Click to purchase a license.', 'Purchase', 'Enter Key').then((v) => {
   161:                 if (v === 'Purchase')
   162:                     vscode.env.openExternal(vscode.Uri.parse('https://gumroad.com/l/your-product'));
   163:                 if (v === 'Enter Key')
   164:                     vscode.commands.executeCommand('qflush.enterLicense');
   165:             });
   166:             return;
   167:         }
   168:         const panel = vscode.window.createWebviewPanel('qflushPanel', 'QFlush', vscode.ViewColumn.One, {
   169:             enableScripts: true,
   170:             localResourceRoots: [vscode.Uri.file(path.join(context.extensionPath, 'src'))],
   171:         });
   172:         const htmlPath = path.join(context.extensionPath, 'src', 'panel.html');
   173:         let html = '';
   174:         try {
   175:             html = fs.readFileSync(htmlPath, 'utf8');
   176:         }
   177:         catch (e) {
   178:             html = `<html><body><pre>panel.html not found at ${htmlPath}</pre></body></html>`;
   179:         }
   180:         panel.webview.html = html;
   181:         const cfg = vscode.workspace.getConfiguration('qflush');
   182:         const daemonUrl = cfg.get('daemonUrl') || 'http://localhost:4500';
   183:         const token = cfg.get('adminToken') || '';
   184:         // Send config to webview securely via postMessage
   185:         panel.webview.postMessage({ type: 'config', daemonUrl, token });
   186:         // Handle messages from the webview
   187:         panel.webview.onDidReceiveMessage(async (message) => {
   188:             if (message && message.type === 'saveConfig') {
   189:                 const cfg = vscode.workspace.getConfiguration('qflush');
   190:                 await cfg.update('daemonUrl', message.daemonUrl, vscode.ConfigurationTarget.Global);
   191:                 await cfg.update('adminToken', message.token, vscode.ConfigurationTarget.Global);
   192:                 panel.webview.postMessage({ type: 'saved', info: 'Configuration saved' });
   193:             }
   194:         }, undefined, context.subscriptions);
   195:     });
   196:     const openPourparler = vscode.commands.registerCommand('qflush.openPourparler', () => {
   197:         const panel = vscode.window.createWebviewPanel('qflushPourparler', 'Pourparler', vscode.ViewColumn.One, { enableScripts: true, localResourceRoots: [vscode.Uri.file(path.join(context.extensionPath, 'src'))] });
   198:         const htmlPath = path.join(context.extensionPath, 'src', 'pourparler-web.html');
   199:         let html = '';
   200:         try {
   201:             html = fs.readFileSync(htmlPath, 'utf8');
   202:         }
   203:         catch (e) {
   204:             html = `<html><body><pre>pourparler-web.html not found at ${htmlPath}</pre></body></html>`;
   205:         }
   206:         panel.webview.html = html;
   207:         panel.webview.onDidReceiveMessage(async (msg) => {
   208:             try {
   209:                 if (msg && msg.type === 'export') {
   210:                     const destUri = await vscode.window.showSaveDialog({ defaultUri: vscode.Uri.file(path.join(process.cwd(), msg.filename)), filters: { 'Images': ['png', 'svg'] } });
   211:                     if (!destUri)
   212:                         return;
   213:                     if (msg.format === 'svg') {
   214:                         fs.writeFileSync(destUri.fsPath, msg.data, 'utf8');
   215:                     }
   216:                     else if (msg.format === 'png') {
   217:                         // data url -> binary
   218:                         const base64 = msg.data.split(',')[1];
   219:                         const buf = Buffer.from(base64, 'base64');
   220:                         fs.writeFileSync(destUri.fsPath, buf);
   221:                     }
   222:                     vscode.window.showInformationMessage(`Exported ${msg.filename}`);
   223:                 }
   224:                 // new messages from pourparler webview
   225:                 if (msg && msg.type === 'npzList') {
   226:                     const cfg = vscode.workspace.getConfiguration('qflush');
   227:                     const daemonUrl = cfg.get('daemonUrl') || 'http://localhost:4500';
   228:                     try {
   229:                         const data = await getJson(`${daemonUrl.replace(/\/$/, '')}/npz/checksum/list`);
   230:                         panel.webview.postMessage({ type: 'npzListResult', data });
   231:                     }
   232:                     catch (e) {
   233:                         panel.webview.postMessage({ type: 'npzListResult', data: { success: false, error: String(e) } });
   234:                     }
   235:                 }
   236:                 if (msg && msg.type === 'npzClear') {
   237:                     const cfg = vscode.workspace.getConfiguration('qflush');
   238:                     const daemonUrl = cfg.get('daemonUrl') || 'http://localhost:4500';
   239:                     try {
   240:                         const resp = await fetch(`${daemonUrl.replace(/\/$/, '')}/npz/checksum/clear`, { method: 'DELETE' });
   241:                         const j = await resp.json();
   242:                         panel.webview.postMessage({ type: 'npzClearResult', data: j });
   243:                     }
   244:                     catch (e) {
   245:                         panel.webview.postMessage({ type: 'npzClearResult', data: { success: false, error: String(e) } });
   246:                     }
   247:                 }
   248:                 if (msg && msg.type === 'npzIndexTag') {
   249:                     const rec = msg.payload;
   250:                     const r = await saveRomeIndexRecord({ path: rec.path, type: rec.type, tag: rec.tag });
   251:                     panel.webview.postMessage(Object.assign({ type: 'npzIndexTagResult' }, r));
   252:                 }
   253:             }
   254:             catch (e) {
   255:                 vscode.window.showErrorMessage('Extension message handler failed: ' + String(e));
   256:             }
   257:         }, undefined, context.subscriptions);
   258:     });
   259:     const enterLicense = vscode.commands.registerCommand('qflush.enterLicense', async () => {
   260:         const key = await vscode.window.showInputBox({ prompt: 'Enter your QFlush license key' });
   261:         if (!key)
   262:             return;
   263:         const cfg = vscode.workspace.getConfiguration('qflush');
   264:         const daemonUrl = cfg.get('daemonUrl') || 'http://localhost:4500';
   265:         const activateUrl = `${daemonUrl.replace(/\/$/, '')}/license/activate`;
   266:         const progressOptions = { location: vscode.ProgressLocation.Notification, title: 'Activating QFlush license...', cancellable: false };
   267:         try {
   268:             await vscode.window.withProgress(progressOptions, async () => {
   269:                 const res = await postJson(activateUrl, { key });
   270:                 // store license info locally in extension globalState
   271:                 await context.globalState.update('qflush.licenseKey', key);
   272:                 await context.globalState.update('qflush.licenseInfo', res.license || res);
   273:                 vscode.window.showInformationMessage('License activated successfully. Thanks!');
   274:             });
   275:         }
   276:         catch (err) {
   277:             vscode.window.showErrorMessage(`License activation failed: ${err && err.message ? err.message : String(err)}`);
   278:         }
   279:     });
   280:     const showStatus = vscode.commands.registerCommand('qflush.showLicenseStatus', async () => {
   281:         const cfg = vscode.workspace.getConfiguration('qflush');
   282:         const daemonUrl = cfg.get('daemonUrl') || 'http://localhost:4500';
   283:         const statusUrl = `${daemonUrl.replace(/\/$/, '')}/license/status`;
   284:         try {
   285:             const res = await getJson(statusUrl);
   286:             if (!res || !res.success) {
   287:                 vscode.window.showInformationMessage('No license information available');
   288:                 return;
   289:             }
   290:             const lic = res.license;
   291:             if (!lic) {
   292:                 vscode.window.showInformationMessage('No local license installed');
   293:                 return;
   294:             }
   295:             const exp = lic.expiresAt ? new Date(lic.expiresAt).toLocaleString() : 'never (subscription)';
   296:             vscode.window.showInformationMessage(`License: ${lic.key} product=${lic.product_id} expires=${exp} valid=${res.valid}`);
   297:         }
   298:         catch (err) {
   299:             vscode.window.showErrorMessage(`Failed to fetch status: ${err && err.message ? err.message : String(err)}`);
   300:         }
   301:     });
   302:     const openTelemetry = vscode.commands.registerCommand('qflush.openTelemetry', () => {
   303:         const panel = vscode.window.createWebviewPanel('qflushTelemetry', 'QFlush Telemetry', vscode.ViewColumn.Two, { enableScripts: true, localResourceRoots: [vscode.Uri.file(path.join(context.extensionPath, 'src'))] });
   304:         const htmlPath = path.join(context.extensionPath, 'src', 'telemetry-view.html');
   305:         let html = '';
   306:         try {
   307:             html = fs.readFileSync(htmlPath, 'utf8');
   308:         }
   309:         catch (e) {
   310:             html = `<html><body><pre>telemetry-view.html not found at ${htmlPath}</pre></body></html>`;
   311:         }
   312:         panel.webview.html = html;
   313:     });
   314:     context.subscriptions.push(openDisposable, openPourparler, enterLicense, showStatus, openTelemetry);
   315: }
   316: function deactivate() { }
   317: 


============================
FILE: extensions\vscode-npz\src\extension.ts
============================
============================
     1: import * as vscode from 'vscode';
     2: import * as path from 'path';
     3: import * as fs from 'fs';
     4: import * as http from 'http';
     5: import * as https from 'https';
     6: 
     7: // import Rome tag utilities
     8: import { makeRomeTagRecord, RomeIndex, normalizeRomePath } from '@rome/rome-tag';
     9: 
    10: const TRIAL_DAYS = 14;
    11: 
    12: function isTrialExpired(context: vscode.ExtensionContext): boolean {
    13:   const started = context.globalState.get<number>('qflush.trialStarted');
    14:   if (!started) return false; // start on first use
    15:   const now = Date.now();
    16:   return now - started > TRIAL_DAYS * 24 * 3600 * 1000;
    17: }
    18: 
    19: function ensureTrialStarted(context: vscode.ExtensionContext) {
    20:   const started = context.globalState.get<number>('qflush.trialStarted');
    21:   if (!started) context.globalState.update('qflush.trialStarted', Date.now());
    22: }
    23: 
    24: function postJson(urlStr: string, body: any): Promise<any> {
    25:   return new Promise((resolve, reject) => {
    26:     try {
    27:       const url = new URL(urlStr);
    28:       const data = JSON.stringify(body || {});
    29:       const opts: any = {
    30:         hostname: url.hostname,
    31:         port: url.port || (url.protocol === 'https:' ? 443 : 80),
    32:         path: url.pathname + (url.search || ''),
    33:         method: 'POST',
    34:         headers: {
    35:           'Content-Type': 'application/json',
    36:           'Content-Length': Buffer.byteLength(data),
    37:         },
    38:       };
    39:       const lib = url.protocol === 'https:' ? https : http;
    40:       const req = lib.request(opts, (res) => {
    41:         let raw = '';
    42:         res.setEncoding('utf8');
    43:         res.on('data', (chunk) => (raw += chunk));
    44:         res.on('end', () => {
    45:           try {
    46:             const parsed = raw ? JSON.parse(raw) : {};
    47:             if (res.statusCode && res.statusCode >= 200 && res.statusCode < 300) resolve(parsed);
    48:             else reject(new Error(parsed && parsed.error ? parsed.error : `HTTP ${res.statusCode}`));
    49:           } catch (e) {
    50:             reject(e);
    51:           }
    52:         });
    53:       });
    54:       req.on('error', (err) => reject(err));
    55:       req.write(data);
    56:       req.end();
    57:     } catch (e) {
    58:       reject(e);
    59:     }
    60:   });
    61: }
    62: 
    63: function getJson(urlStr: string): Promise<any> {
    64:   return new Promise((resolve, reject) => {
    65:     try {
    66:       const url = new URL(urlStr);
    67:       const lib = url.protocol === 'https:' ? https : http;
    68:       const req = lib.get(urlStr, (res) => {
    69:         let raw = '';
    70:         res.setEncoding('utf8');
    71:         res.on('data', (chunk) => (raw += chunk));
    72:         res.on('end', () => {
    73:           try {
    74:             const parsed = raw ? JSON.parse(raw) : {};
    75:             if (res.statusCode && res.statusCode >= 200 && res.statusCode < 300) resolve(parsed);
    76:             else reject(new Error(parsed && parsed.error ? parsed.error : `HTTP ${res.statusCode}`));
    77:           } catch (e) {
    78:             reject(e);
    79:           }
    80:         });
    81:       });
    82:       req.on('error', (err) => reject(err));
    83:     } catch (e) {
    84:       reject(e);
    85:     }
    86:   });
    87: }
    88: 
    89: async function saveRomeIndexRecord(record: { path: string; type: string; tag?: string }) {
    90:   try {
    91:     const root = process.cwd();
    92:     const dir = path.join(root, '.qflush');
    93:     if (!fs.existsSync(dir)) fs.mkdirSync(dir, { recursive: true });
    94:     const idxFile = path.join(dir, 'rome-index.json');
    95:     let idx: RomeIndex = {};
    96:     if (fs.existsSync(idxFile)) {
    97:       try { idx = JSON.parse(fs.readFileSync(idxFile, 'utf8') || '{}'); } catch { idx = {}; }
    98:     }
    99: 
   100:     // normalize path and build canonical record using shared module
   101:     const relPath = normalizeRomePath(record.path);
   102:     const rec = makeRomeTagRecord({ type: record.type, path: relPath });
   103:     idx[rec.path] = rec;
   104: 
   105:     fs.writeFileSync(idxFile, JSON.stringify(idx, null, 2), 'utf8');
   106:     return { success: true, record: idx[rec.path] };
   107:   } catch (e) {
   108:     return { success: false, error: String(e) };
   109:   }
   110: }
   111: 
   112: export function activate(context: vscode.ExtensionContext) {
   113:   ensureTrialStarted(context);
   114: 
   115:   const openDisposable = vscode.commands.registerCommand('qflush.openPanel', () => {
   116:     if (isTrialExpired(context)) {
   117:       vscode.window.showInformationMessage('QFlush trial expired. Click to purchase a license.', 'Purchase', 'Enter Key').then((v) => {
   118:         if (v === 'Purchase') vscode.env.openExternal(vscode.Uri.parse('https://gumroad.com/l/your-product'));
   119:         if (v === 'Enter Key') vscode.commands.executeCommand('qflush.enterLicense');
   120:       });
   121:       return;
   122:     }
   123: 
   124:     const panel = vscode.window.createWebviewPanel(
   125:       'qflushPanel',
   126:       'QFlush',
   127:       vscode.ViewColumn.One,
   128:       {
   129:         enableScripts: true,
   130:         localResourceRoots: [vscode.Uri.file(path.join(context.extensionPath, 'src'))],
   131:       }
   132:     );
   133: 
   134:     const htmlPath = path.join(context.extensionPath, 'src', 'panel.html');
   135:     let html = '';
   136:     try {
   137:       html = fs.readFileSync(htmlPath, 'utf8');
   138:     } catch (e) {
   139:       html = `<html><body><pre>panel.html not found at ${htmlPath}</pre></body></html>`;
   140:     }
   141: 
   142:     panel.webview.html = html;
   143: 
   144:     const cfg = vscode.workspace.getConfiguration('qflush');
   145:     const daemonUrl = cfg.get<string>('daemonUrl') || 'http://localhost:4500';
   146:     const token = cfg.get<string>('adminToken') || '';
   147: 
   148:     // Send config to webview securely via postMessage
   149:     panel.webview.postMessage({ type: 'config', daemonUrl, token });
   150: 
   151:     // Handle messages from the webview
   152:     panel.webview.onDidReceiveMessage(
   153:       async (message) => {
   154:         if (message && message.type === 'saveConfig') {
   155:           const cfg = vscode.workspace.getConfiguration('qflush');
   156:           await cfg.update('daemonUrl', message.daemonUrl, vscode.ConfigurationTarget.Global);
   157:           await cfg.update('adminToken', message.token, vscode.ConfigurationTarget.Global);
   158:           panel.webview.postMessage({ type: 'saved', info: 'Configuration saved' });
   159:         }
   160:       },
   161:       undefined,
   162:       context.subscriptions
   163:     );
   164:   });
   165: 
   166:   const openPourparler = vscode.commands.registerCommand('qflush.openPourparler', () => {
   167:     const panel = vscode.window.createWebviewPanel('qflushPourparler', 'Pourparler', vscode.ViewColumn.One, { enableScripts: true, localResourceRoots: [vscode.Uri.file(path.join(context.extensionPath, 'src'))] });
   168:     const htmlPath = path.join(context.extensionPath, 'src', 'pourparler-web.html');
   169:     let html = '';
   170:     try { html = fs.readFileSync(htmlPath, 'utf8'); } catch (e) { html = `<html><body><pre>pourparler-web.html not found at ${htmlPath}</pre></body></html>`; }
   171:     panel.webview.html = html;
   172: 
   173:     panel.webview.onDidReceiveMessage(async (msg) => {
   174:       try {
   175:         if (msg && msg.type === 'export') {
   176:           const destUri = await vscode.window.showSaveDialog({ defaultUri: vscode.Uri.file(path.join(process.cwd(), msg.filename)), filters: { 'Images': ['png','svg'] } });
   177:           if (!destUri) return;
   178:           if (msg.format === 'svg') {
   179:             fs.writeFileSync(destUri.fsPath, msg.data, 'utf8');
   180:           } else if (msg.format === 'png') {
   181:             // data url -> binary
   182:             const base64 = msg.data.split(',')[1];
   183:             const buf = Buffer.from(base64, 'base64');
   184:             fs.writeFileSync(destUri.fsPath, buf);
   185:           }
   186:           vscode.window.showInformationMessage(`Exported ${msg.filename}`);
   187:         }
   188: 
   189:         // new messages from pourparler webview
   190:         if (msg && msg.type === 'npzList') {
   191:           const cfg = vscode.workspace.getConfiguration('qflush');
   192:           const daemonUrl = cfg.get<string>('daemonUrl') || 'http://localhost:4500';
   193:           try {
   194:             const data = await getJson(`${daemonUrl.replace(/\/$/, '')}/npz/checksum/list`);
   195:             panel.webview.postMessage({ type: 'npzListResult', data });
   196:           } catch (e) {
   197:             panel.webview.postMessage({ type: 'npzListResult', data: { success: false, error: String(e) } });
   198:           }
   199:         }
   200: 
   201:         if (msg && msg.type === 'npzClear') {
   202:           const cfg = vscode.workspace.getConfiguration('qflush');
   203:           const daemonUrl = cfg.get<string>('daemonUrl') || 'http://localhost:4500';
   204:           try {
   205:             const resp = await fetch(`${daemonUrl.replace(/\/$/, '')}/npz/checksum/clear`, { method: 'DELETE' });
   206:             const j = await resp.json();
   207:             panel.webview.postMessage({ type: 'npzClearResult', data: j });
   208:           } catch (e) {
   209:             panel.webview.postMessage({ type: 'npzClearResult', data: { success: false, error: String(e) } });
   210:           }
   211:         }
   212: 
   213:         if (msg && msg.type === 'npzIndexTag') {
   214:           const rec = msg.payload;
   215:           const r = await saveRomeIndexRecord({ path: rec.path, type: rec.type, tag: rec.tag });
   216:           panel.webview.postMessage(Object.assign({ type: 'npzIndexTagResult' }, r));
   217:         }
   218:       } catch (e) {
   219:         vscode.window.showErrorMessage('Extension message handler failed: ' + String(e));
   220:       }
   221:     }, undefined, context.subscriptions);
   222:   });
   223: 
   224:   const enterLicense = vscode.commands.registerCommand('qflush.enterLicense', async () => {
   225:     const key = await vscode.window.showInputBox({ prompt: 'Enter your QFlush license key' });
   226:     if (!key) return;
   227: 
   228:     const cfg = vscode.workspace.getConfiguration('qflush');
   229:     const daemonUrl = cfg.get<string>('daemonUrl') || 'http://localhost:4500';
   230:     const activateUrl = `${daemonUrl.replace(/\/$/, '')}/license/activate`;
   231: 
   232:     const progressOptions: vscode.ProgressOptions = { location: vscode.ProgressLocation.Notification, title: 'Activating QFlush license...', cancellable: false };
   233:     try {
   234:       await vscode.window.withProgress(progressOptions, async () => {
   235:         const res = await postJson(activateUrl, { key });
   236:         // store license info locally in extension globalState
   237:         await context.globalState.update('qflush.licenseKey', key);
   238:         await context.globalState.update('qflush.licenseInfo', res.license || res);
   239:         vscode.window.showInformationMessage('License activated successfully. Thanks!');
   240:       });
   241:     } catch (err: any) {
   242:         vscode.window.showErrorMessage(`License activation failed: ${err && err.message ? err.message : String(err)}`);
   243:     }
   244:   });
   245: 
   246:   const showStatus = vscode.commands.registerCommand('qflush.showLicenseStatus', async () => {
   247:     const cfg = vscode.workspace.getConfiguration('qflush');
   248:     const daemonUrl = cfg.get<string>('daemonUrl') || 'http://localhost:4500';
   249:     const statusUrl = `${daemonUrl.replace(/\/$/, '')}/license/status`;
   250:     try {
   251:       const res = await getJson(statusUrl);
   252:       if (!res || !res.success) {
   253:         vscode.window.showInformationMessage('No license information available');
   254:         return;
   255:       }
   256:       const lic = res.license;
   257:       if (!lic) {
   258:         vscode.window.showInformationMessage('No local license installed');
   259:         return;
   260:       }
   261:       const exp = lic.expiresAt ? new Date(lic.expiresAt).toLocaleString() : 'never (subscription)';
   262:       vscode.window.showInformationMessage(`License: ${lic.key} product=${lic.product_id} expires=${exp} valid=${res.valid}`);
   263:     } catch (err: any) {
   264:       vscode.window.showErrorMessage(`Failed to fetch status: ${err && err.message ? err.message : String(err)}`);
   265:     }
   266:   });
   267: 
   268:   const openTelemetry = vscode.commands.registerCommand('qflush.openTelemetry', () => {
   269:     const panel = vscode.window.createWebviewPanel('qflushTelemetry', 'QFlush Telemetry', vscode.ViewColumn.Two, { enableScripts: true, localResourceRoots: [vscode.Uri.file(path.join(context.extensionPath, 'src'))] });
   270:     const htmlPath = path.join(context.extensionPath, 'src', 'telemetry-view.html');
   271:     let html = '';
   272:     try { html = fs.readFileSync(htmlPath, 'utf8'); } catch (e) { html = `<html><body><pre>telemetry-view.html not found at ${htmlPath}</pre></body></html>`; }
   273:     panel.webview.html = html;
   274:   });
   275: 
   276:   context.subscriptions.push(openDisposable, openPourparler, enterLicense, showStatus, openTelemetry);
   277: }
   278: 
   279: export function deactivate() {}
   280:

FILE: extensions\vscode-npz\src\polyfill-file.js

     1: // Polyfill minimal File/Blob for Node environments when libraries expect browser globals
     2: if (typeof globalThis.File === 'undefined') {
     3:   globalThis.File = class File extends Uint8Array {
     4:     constructor(parts = [], name = 'file', options = {}) {
     5:       // naive implementation: store data as concatenated string/Uint8Array
     6:       const chunks = parts.map(p => typeof p === 'string' ? Buffer.from(p) : Buffer.from(p));
     7:       const buf = Buffer.concat(chunks);
     8:       super(buf);
     9:       this.name = name;
    10:       this.lastModified = options.lastModified || Date.now();
    11:       this.size = buf.length;
    12:       this.type = options.type || '';
    13:     }
    14:     text() { return Promise.resolve(Buffer.from(this).toString('utf8')); }
    15:     arrayBuffer() { return Promise.resolve(Uint8Array.from(this).buffer); }
    16:     stream() { throw new Error('stream() not implemented'); }
    17:   };
    18: }
    19: if (typeof globalThis.Blob === 'undefined') {
    20:   globalThis.Blob = class Blob extends Uint8Array {
    21:     constructor(parts = [], options = {}) {
    22:       const chunks = parts.map(p => typeof p === 'string' ? Buffer.from(p) : Buffer.from(p));
    23:       const buf = Buffer.concat(chunks);
    24:       super(buf);
    25:       this.size = buf.length;
    26:       this.type = options.type || '';
    27:     }
    28:     text() { return Promise.resolve(Buffer.from(this).toString('utf8')); }
    29:     arrayBuffer() { return Promise.resolve(Uint8Array.from(this).buffer); }
    30:   };
    31: }
    32:

============================
FILE: FUNESTERIE-ARCHITECTURE.md
============================
============================
     1: FUNESTERIE — Architecture & Vision
     2: 
     3: Objectif
     4: --------
     5: Créer un écosystème modulaire et évolutif où chaque couche a une responsabilité unique et communique via interfaces claires : QFLUSH (orchestrateur), ROME (moteur logique / indexeur), NPZ (router / admin), BAT (process manager), Nezlephant/OC8 (stockage caché), A11 (interface IA), SPYDER (futur moteur neuronal).
     6: 
     7: Sommaire des composants
     8: -----------------------
     9: 
    10: 1) QFLUSH — Orchestrateur
    11: - CLI + daemon HTTP.
    12: - Commandes principales : `start`, `kill`, `purge`, `inspect`, `config`, `daemon`.
    13: - Supervise les modules, expose NPZ/Rome endpoints, centralise la config et le SmartChain pipeline.
    14: 
    15: 2) BAT — Process Manager
    16: - Spawn / stop / restart / status.
    17: - Détache les services (non bloquant), persiste état dans `.qflush/services.json`, logs dans `.qflush/logs/`.
    18: - Strictement process management — pas de router ni logique.
    19: 
    20: 3) NPZ (Joker) — Router & Admin
    21: - Router et diagnostics pour les modules.
    22: - Endpoints exposés par le daemon : checksums, rome-index, rome-links, resolve, SSE stream.
    23: - CLI : `qflush npz:inspect`, `qflush npz:scores`.
    24: - Stockage : fallback mémoire/fichiers; Redis optionnel (opt‑in via `QFLUSH_ENABLE_REDIS`).
    25: 
    26: 4) ROME — Index, Engine, Logic, Linker
    27: - Indexation des sources annotées (`ROME-TAG`) → `.qflush/rome-index.json`.
    28: - Engine évalue l’index et émet des actions (computeEngineActionsSafe).
    29: - Logic rules (déclaratives) déclenchent actions à la change.
    30: - Linker (v3.1): scan `[[token]]`, résout cibles, génère `.qflush/rome-links.json`, fournit résolution HTTP et SSE.
    31: 
    32: 5) Nezlephant / OC8 — Stockage caché RGBA
    33: - Encodage/décodage de blobs (PNG / RGBA / OC8).
    34: - Usage pour secrets (`nez:<file>`), configs, payloads.
    35: - Intégration via `envapt-nezlephant`.
    36: 
    37: 6) A11 — Interface IA (prévu)
    38: - Proxy/local LLM connector (Ollama/OpenAI/Gemini).
    39: - Orchestration d’appels IA pour augmentation des règles NPZ/ROME.
    40: 
    41: 7) SPYDER — Futur moteur neuronal
    42: - Architecture envisagée : graph de « neurones » (.ner), snapshots, routage d’état → réponses.
    43: - Intégration future avec A11 et NPZ.
    44: 
    45: Le Mapping (principes)
    46: ----------------------
    47: - Ordre de priorité strict pour la résolution des chemins :
    48:   1. Chemin explicite fourni
    49:   2. Chemin détecté (detectModules)
    50:   3. Chemin local candidate
    51:   4. Résolution via node_modules/package
    52:   5. Fallback NPZ (optionnel)
    53: - Early-exit : si un chemin est valide → ne pas ré-interpréter.
    54: 
    55: Daemon (qflushd)
    56: -----------------
    57: - Expose les endpoints NPZ et Rome.
    58: - Supervise engineHistory et telemetry (Copilot Bridge).
    59: - SSE stream pour rome-links & telemetry.
    60: - Audit log, option Redis.
    61: 
    62: Copilot Bridge
    63: --------------
    64: - Envoie événements/règles/télémetry vers l’extension VS et services IA.
    65: - Fournit un canal bidirectionnel (notifications → actions).
    66: 
    67: Principes d’exploitation & Dev
    68: ------------------------------
    69: - En dev : garder Redis désactivé (fallback mémoire).
    70: - Activer mapping uniquement quand nécessaire (`QFLUSH_ENABLE_MAPPING=1`).
    71: - Démarrer le daemon détaché pour éviter d’ouvrir fichiers dans l’IDE (`qflush daemon --detached`).
    72: 
    73: Fichiers utiles
    74: ---------------
    75: - `.qflush/rome-index.json` — Rome index
    76: - `.qflush/rome-links.json` — linker output
    77: - `.qflush/services.json` & `.qflush/logs/` — BAT state & logs
    78: 
    79: Next steps recommandés
    80: ----------------------
    81: - Ajouter ce doc au README (done).
    82: - Générer un diagramme SVG/PNG et l’ajouter dans `docs/`.
    83: - Créer `copilot-context.md` (très court) pour fournir le résumé à Copilot.
    84: - Intégrer tests unitaires pour NPZ encoder / checksum / linker.
    85: 
    86: Notes
    87: -----
    88: - SPYDER et A11 sont des objectifs long terme. Pour l’instant conserver les noms est acceptable ; implémentations futures clarifieront les responsabilités.
    89: 
    90: 
    91:

FILE: GIT_PUSH.txt
============================
============================
     1: To push your changes to a remote repository:
     2: 
     3: 1) Create a remote (GitHub) repository.
     4: 2) Add remote locally:
     5:    git remote add origin git@github.com:<user>/<repo>.git
     6: 3) Push branch:
     7:    git push -u origin master
     8: 
     9: If you need an HTTPS remote:
    10:    git remote add origin https://github.com/<user>/<repo>.git
    11:    git push -u origin master
    12:

============================
FILE: installers\install-qflush.ps1
============================
============================
     1: <#
     2: PowerShell installer for QFLUSH
     3: Supports:
     4:  - user install (default): copies package to %APPDATA% and adds to PATH for current user
     5:  - system install: copies package to C:\Program Files\Funesterie\QFlush and adds to system PATH (requires elevation)
     6:  - npm global install: runs `npm install -g @funeste38/qflush` if package is published
     7: 
     8: Usage:
     9:  .\install-qflush.ps1 -Mode user
    10:  .\install-qflush.ps1 -Mode system
    11:  .\install-qflush.ps1 -Mode npm
    12: #>
    13: param(
    14:     [ValidateSet('user','system','npm')]
    15:     [string]$Mode = 'user'
    16: )
    17: 
    18: function Add-PathUser {
    19:     param([string]$dir)
    20:     $current = [Environment]::GetEnvironmentVariable('PATH', 'User')
    21:     if ($current -notlike "*${dir}*") {
    22:         [Environment]::SetEnvironmentVariable('PATH', "$current;$dir", 'User')
    23:         Write-Host "Added $dir to user PATH"
    24:     } else {
    25:         Write-Host "$dir already in user PATH"
    26:     }
    27: }
    28: 
    29: function Add-PathMachine {
    30:     param([string]$dir)
    31:     $current = [Environment]::GetEnvironmentVariable('PATH', 'Machine')
    32:     if ($current -notlike "*${dir}*") {
    33:         [Environment]::SetEnvironmentVariable('PATH', "$current;$dir", 'Machine')
    34:         Write-Host "Added $dir to machine PATH"
    35:     } else {
    36:         Write-Host "$dir already in machine PATH"
    37:     }
    38: }
    39: 
    40: if ($Mode -eq 'npm') {
    41:     Write-Host "Installing via npm global..."
    42:     npm install -g @funeste38/qflush
    43:     exit $?
    44: }
    45: 
    46: # assume script run from repo root or from extracted package
    47: $scriptDir = Split-Path -Parent $MyInvocation.MyCommand.Definition
    48: $source = Join-Path $scriptDir '..' 'dist'
    49: 
    50: if ($Mode -eq 'user') {
    51:     $dest = Join-Path $env:APPDATA 'Funeste38\QFlush'
    52:     New-Item -ItemType Directory -Path $dest -Force | Out-Null
    53:     Copy-Item -Path "$scriptDir\..\dist\*" -Destination $dest -Recurse -Force
    54:     Add-PathUser -dir $dest
    55:     Write-Host "Installed QFLUSH to $dest (user)"
    56:     exit 0
    57: }
    58: 
    59: if ($Mode -eq 'system') {
    60:     if (-not ([Security.Principal.WindowsPrincipal][Security.Principal.WindowsIdentity]::GetCurrent()).IsInRole([Security.Principal.WindowsBuiltInRole]::Administrator)) {
    61:         Write-Error "System install requires elevation. Run PowerShell as Administrator."
    62:         exit 1
    63:     }
    64:     $dest = 'C:\Program Files\Funesterie\QFlush'
    65:     New-Item -ItemType Directory -Path $dest -Force | Out-Null
    66:     Copy-Item -Path "$scriptDir\..\dist\*" -Destination $dest -Recurse -Force
    67:     Add-PathMachine -dir $dest
    68:     Write-Host "Installed QFLUSH to $dest (system)"
    69:     exit 0
    70: }
    71: 


============================
FILE: installers\install-qflushd.ps1
============================
============================
     1: # PowerShell installer for qflushd (Windows service wrapper)
     2: # This is an example; for production use consider NSSM or sc.exe wrapper.
     3: 
     4: Write-Host "This script downloads qflush and registers qflushd as a scheduled task or service."
     5: Write-Host "Manual step: create a Windows service pointing to 'node dist/daemon/qflushd.js' using nssm or sc.exe."
     6: 
     7: # Example using nssm (assuming nssm.exe is available):
     8: # nssm install qflushd "C:\Program Files\nodejs\node.exe" "C:\path\to\qflush\dist\daemon\qflushd.js"
     9: 
    10: Write-Host "Install instructions provided."


============================
FILE: installers\NE-LINER.txt
============================
============================
     1: NE-LINER — Corrected one‑liner & notes (FR)
     2: 
     3: But / Purpose
     4: -----------
     5: Court rappel et one‑liner corrigé pour installer / démarrer `qflush` sans confusion avec `qflush`.
     6: 
     7: One‑liner PowerShell (installe et exécute l'installateur officiel pour `qflush`):
     8: 
     9:   iwr -useb https://funeste38.org/install-qflush.ps1 | iex
    10: 
    11: Remarques importantes
    12: ---------------------
    13: - Nom correct du binaire : `qflush` (pas `qflush`).
    14: - Le shim `%APPDATA%\\npm\\qflush.cmd` / `qflush.ps1` doit appeler le wrapper JS ou `dist/index.js`.
    15:   - Pour la version, le shim doit appeler de façon sûre :
    16:     node "<path-to-package>/package.json" via un petit wrapper JS ou `node -e "try{console.log(require('...').version)}catch(e){console.log('unknown')}"`.
    17:   - Préférence: utiliser un `qflush-cli.js` wrapper (évite les problèmes d'échappement avec `node -e`).
    18: 
    19: Vérifications après installation
    20: --------------------------------
    21: 1. Vérifier que le package global existe :
    22:    npm root -g
    23:    (cherchez `@funeste38/qflush` sous ce chemin)
    24: 
    25: 2. Vérifier que les shims sont présents dans :
    26:    %APPDATA%\\npm
    27:    - qflush.cmd
    28:    - qflush.ps1
    29:    - qflush-cli.js (wrapper recommandé)
    30: 
    31: 3. Vérifier le PATH utilisateur inclut `%APPDATA%\\npm` :
    32:    [Environment]::GetEnvironmentVariable('PATH','User')
    33:    Si absent : setx PATH "$([Environment]::GetEnvironmentVariable('PATH','User'));%APPDATA%\\npm" puis fermer/réouvrir le shell.
    34: 
    35: 4. Tester :
    36:    & "%APPDATA%\\npm\\qflush.cmd" --version
    37:    qflush --version   (après rouverture du terminal)
    38: 
    39: Index / fichiers écrits
    40: -----------------------
    41: - L'index Rome est lu depuis `.qflush/rome-index.json` dans la racine du workspace.
    42: - S'assurer que rien d'autre n'ouvre l'index automatiquement (mapping guarded by QFLUSH_ENABLE_MAPPING or FORCE_DISABLE_MAPPING).
    43: 
    44: Modifications appliquées
    45: -----------------------
    46: J'ai corrigé les scripts et docs suivants pour utiliser le nom `qflush` et chemins cohérents :
    47: - `installers/ONE-LINER.txt` (one-liner now references `install-qflush.ps1`)
    48: - `installers/install-all.ps1` (uses `QFlush` naming, destination folder `Funeste38\QFlush`)
    49: - `installers/install-qflush.ps1` (messages updated to `qflush`, package name `@funeste38/qflush`)
    50: - `installers/install-qflushd.ps1` (messages updated to `qflushd`)
    51: - Created wrapper/shims: `%APPDATA%\\npm\\qflush-cli.js`, `qflush.cmd`, `qflush.ps1` when repairing installation.
    52: 
    53: Notes pour devs
    54: ---------------
    55: - Éviter d'utiliser `node -e` avec des chemins Windows bruts dans les shims ; préférer un wrapper JS.
    56: - Si un autre binaire `qflush` existe, désinstallez le pour éviter collision :
    57:   npm uninstall -g @funeste38/qflush
    58: 
    59: Si tu veux que je renomme physiquement les scripts `install-qflush.ps1` → `install-qflush.ps1` et `install-qflushd.ps1` → `install-qflushd.ps1`, dis‑le et je le ferai (cela créera de nouveaux files and update references).
    60: 
    61: 
    62:

============================
FILE: installers\README-install.md
============================
============================
     1: # QFLUSH Installer
     2: 
     3: This folder contains a PowerShell installer `install-qflush.ps1` that can:
     4: 
     5: - Install QFLUSH for the current user (default) by copying compiled `dist` files to `%APPDATA%\Funeste38\QFlush` and adding the folder to user PATH.
     6: - Install QFLUSH system-wide (requires Administrator) by copying to `C:\Program Files\Funesterie\QFlush` and adding to machine PATH.
     7: - Install via npm global if the package is published: `install-qflush.ps1 -Mode npm`.
     8: 
     9: Usage examples:
    10: 
    11: PowerShell (current user):
    12: PS> .\install-qflush.ps1 -Mode user
    13: 
    14: PowerShell (system/admin):
    15: PS> Start-Process powershell -Verb runAs -ArgumentList '-NoProfile -ExecutionPolicy Bypass -File "install-qflush.ps1" -Mode system'
    16: 
    17: NPM global install (requires published package):
    18: PS> .\install-qflush.ps1 -Mode npm
    19: 
    20: ## Notes
    21: 
    22: Use `qflush --help` after installation to list available commands.
    23:

     1: FUNESTERIE LICENSE AGREEMENT (FCL 1.0)
     2: Last updated: 2025
     3: 
     4: Copyright © Funesterie™
     5: 
     6: FCL — Funesterie Config Language, including its syntax, grammar,
     7: structure, naming, examples, documentation, and all associated 
     8: materials, is proprietary software fully owned by Funesterie™.
     9: 
    10: By using, copying, distributing or integrating FCL, you agree to the
    11: terms of this license.
    12: 
    13: 1. Definitions
    14: --------------
    15: “FCL” refers to the Funesterie Config Language, the syntax, the grammar,
    16: its specification, examples, reference documentation, and official tools.
    17: 
    18: “Personal Use” means individual usage for hobby, testing, learning, or
    19: non-commercial open-source projects, with no revenue involved.
    20: 
    21: “Commercial Use” includes any use within a business, company, paid app,
    22: SaaS product, or any revenue-generating activity.
    23: 
    24: 2. Rights granted
    25: -----------------
    26: Personal Use: free, unlimited, no registration required.
    27: 
    28: Commercial Use: requires an active Funesterie™ Commercial License.
    29: Without such license, all commercial usage is strictly prohibited.
    30: 
    31: 3. Restrictions
    32: ---------------
    33: • You may NOT fork, rename, copy, or rebrand the FCL format.
    34: • You may NOT create competing formats based on FCL.
    35: • You may NOT redistribute modified versions of FCL.
    36: • You may NOT remove or replace the Funesterie™ branding.
    37: • You may NOT reverse-engineer paid tools, SDKs or parsers.
    38: • You may NOT integrate FCL in commercial products without a license.
    39: 
    40: 4. Ownership
    41: ------------
    42: FCL remains the sole intellectual property of Funesterie™. 
    43: No rights are transferred except those specified above.
    44: 
    45: 5. Termination
    46: --------------
    47: Any violation terminates all granted rights. 
    48: Funesterie™ may pursue legal action for unauthorized commercial use.
    49:

    55: See THIRD_PARTY_LICENSES.txt for details.

============================
FILE: netlify\functions\gumroad-webhook.js
============================
============================
     1: const fetch = require('node-fetch');
     2: 
     3: exports.handler = async function(event, context) {
     4:   try {
     5:     const body = event.body ? JSON.parse(event.body) : {};
     6:     // optional: verify signature if you have one
     7:     // forward to the local daemon if DAEMON_URL is set, otherwise process here
     8:     const daemonUrl = process.env.DAEMON_URL || '';
     9:     if (daemonUrl) {
    10:       const url = `${daemonUrl.replace(/\/$/, '')}/qflush/license/webhook`;
    11:       await fetch(url, { method: 'POST', headers: { 'Content-Type': 'application/json' }, body: JSON.stringify(body) });
    12:       return { statusCode: 200, body: JSON.stringify({ ok: true, forwarded: url }) };
    13:     }
    14:     // example local processing: check refund
    15:     const purchase = body.purchase || body.data || null;
    16:     let action = 'noop';
    17:     if (purchase) {
    18:       if (purchase.refunded || purchase.chargebacked) action = 'clear_license';
    19:       if (purchase.subscription_cancelled_at) action = 'cancel_subscription';
    20:     }
    21:     return { statusCode: 200, body: JSON.stringify({ ok: true, action }) };
    22:   } catch (err) {
    23:     return { statusCode: 500, body: JSON.stringify({ ok: false, error: String(err) }) };
    24:   }
    25: };
    26: 


============================
FILE: netlify\functions\token-exchange.js
============================
============================
     1: const fetch = require('node-fetch');
     2: 
     3: exports.handler = async function(event, context) {
     4:   try {
     5:     const tokenUrl = process.env.TOKEN_URL;
     6:     const clientId = process.env.APP_ID;
     7:     const clientSecret = process.env.APP_SECRET;
     8:     if (!tokenUrl || !clientId || !clientSecret) return { statusCode: 500, body: JSON.stringify({ ok:false, error:'missing config' }) };
     9: 
    10:     // perform client_credentials exchange
    11:     const params = new URLSearchParams();
    12:     params.append('grant_type', 'client_credentials');
    13: 
    14:     const res = await fetch(tokenUrl, {
    15:       method: 'POST',
    16:       headers: {
    17:         'Content-Type': 'application/x-www-form-urlencoded',
    18:         'Authorization': 'Basic ' + Buffer.from(clientId + ':' + clientSecret).toString('base64')
    19:       },
    20:       body: params.toString()
    21:     });
    22:     const json = await res.json();
    23:     // optionally store token in Netlify env (not possible from function), so return it to caller
    24:     return { statusCode: 200, body: JSON.stringify({ ok:true, token: json }) };
    25:   } catch (err) {
    26:     return { statusCode: 500, body: JSON.stringify({ ok:false, error:String(err) }) };
    27:   }
    28: };
    29:
