============================
FILE: qflush\src\supervisor\index.ts
============================
============================
     1: import { spawn } from 'child_process';
     2: import { writeFileSync, existsSync, mkdirSync, readFileSync, unlinkSync, createWriteStream } from 'fs';
     3: import { join } from 'path';
     4: import { logger } from '../utils/logger';
     5: 
     6: type ProcRecord = {
     7:   name: string;
     8:   pid: number;
     9:   cmd: string;
    10:   args: string[];
    11:   cwd?: string;
    12:   log?: string;
    13:   detached?: boolean;
    14: };
    15: 
    16: const STATE_DIR = join(process.cwd(), '.qflash');
    17: const LOGS_DIR = join(STATE_DIR, 'logs');
    18: const STATE_FILE = join(STATE_DIR, 'services.json');
    19: let procs: Record<string, ProcRecord> = {};
    20: 
    21: function ensureStateDir() {
    22:   if (!existsSync(STATE_DIR)) mkdirSync(STATE_DIR, { recursive: true });
    23:   if (!existsSync(LOGS_DIR)) mkdirSync(LOGS_DIR, { recursive: true });
    24: }
    25: 
    26: function persist() {
    27:   try {
    28:     ensureStateDir();
    29:     writeFileSync(STATE_FILE, JSON.stringify(procs, null, 2), 'utf8');
    30:   } catch (err) {
    31:     logger.warn(`Failed to persist supervisor state: ${err}`);
    32:   }
    33: }
    34: 
    35: function load() {
    36:   try {
    37:     if (existsSync(STATE_FILE)) {
    38:       const raw = readFileSync(STATE_FILE, 'utf8');
    39:       procs = JSON.parse(raw);
    40:     }
    41:   } catch (err) {
    42:     logger.warn(`Failed to load supervisor state: ${err}`);
    43:   }
    44: }
    45: 
    46: load();
    47: 
    48: export function listRunning() {
    49:   return Object.values(procs);
    50: }
    51: 
    52: export function startProcess(name: string, cmd: string, args: string[] = [], opts: any = {}) {
    53:   ensureStateDir();
    54:   logger.info(`supervisor: starting ${name} -> ${cmd} ${args.join(' ')}`);
    55: 
    56:   const logFile = opts.logPath || join(LOGS_DIR, `${name}.log`);
    57:   const outStream = createWriteStream(logFile, { flags: 'a' });
    58: 
    59:   const spawnOpts: any = { cwd: opts.cwd || process.cwd(), shell: true };
    60: 
    61:   // decide stdio based on detached/background
    62:   if (opts.detached) {
    63:     spawnOpts.detached = true;
    64:     // ignore stdin, pipe stdout/stderr to log
    65:     spawnOpts.stdio = ['ignore', 'pipe', 'pipe'];
    66:   } else {
    67:     spawnOpts.stdio = ['ignore', 'pipe', 'pipe'];
    68:   }
    69: 
    70:   const child = spawn(cmd, args, spawnOpts);
    71: 
    72:   if (child.stdout) child.stdout.pipe(outStream);
    73:   if (child.stderr) child.stderr.pipe(outStream);
    74: 
    75:   child.on('error', (err) => logger.error(`supervisor: ${name} process error ${err.message}`));
    76:   child.on('exit', (code) => {
    77:     logger.warn(`supervisor: ${name} exited with ${code}`);
    78:     if (procs[name]) delete procs[name];
    79:     persist();
    80:   });
    81: 
    82:   // if detached, allow process to continue after this parent exits
    83:   if (spawnOpts.detached) {
    84:     try { child.unref(); } catch {}
    85:   }
    86: 
    87:   procs[name] = { name, pid: child.pid || -1, cmd, args, cwd: opts.cwd, log: logFile, detached: !!spawnOpts.detached };
    88:   persist();
    89:   return child;
    90: }
    91: 
    92: export function stopProcess(name: string) {
    93:   const entry = procs[name];
    94:   if (!entry) return false;
    95:   try {
    96:     process.kill(entry.pid, 'SIGTERM');
    97:     try { delete procs[name]; persist(); } catch {}
    98:     return true;
    99:   } catch (err) {
   100:     logger.warn(`supervisor: failed to kill ${name} pid=${entry.pid} (${err})`);
   101:     return false;
   102:   }
   103: }
   104: 
   105: export function stopAll() {
   106:   const names = Object.keys(procs);
   107:   for (const n of names) {
   108:     stopProcess(n);
   109:   }
   110:   try {
   111:     if (existsSync(STATE_FILE)) unlinkSync(STATE_FILE);
   112:   } catch {}
   113: }
   114: 
   115: export function clearState() {
   116:   procs = {};
   117:   try { if (existsSync(STATE_FILE)) unlinkSync(STATE_FILE); } catch {}
   118: }
   119: 


============================
FILE: qflush\src\tests\smartchain.test.ts
============================
============================
     1: import { buildPipeline } from "../chain/smartChain";
     2: 
     3: function assertEqual(a: any, b: any, msg?: string) {
     4:   if (JSON.stringify(a) !== JSON.stringify(b)) throw new Error(msg || `Assertion failed: ${JSON.stringify(a)} !== ${JSON.stringify(b)}`);
     5: }
     6: 
     7: function runTests() {
     8:   assertEqual(buildPipeline(["start"]).pipeline, ["detect","config","start"]);
     9:   assertEqual(buildPipeline(["kill","start"]).pipeline, ["kill","detect","config","start"]);
    10:   assertEqual(buildPipeline(["purge","start"]).pipeline, ["detect","config","purge","start"]);
    11:   assertEqual(buildPipeline(["config","start","detect"]).pipeline, ["detect","config","start"]);
    12:   assertEqual(buildPipeline(["exodia","start"]).pipeline, ["detect","config","start","exodia"]);
    13:   console.log("SmartChain tests passed");
    14: }
    15: 
    16: runTests();
    17:

============================
FILE: qflush\src\utils\detect.ts
============================
============================
     1: import { exec } from "child_process";
     2: import { logger } from "./logger";
     3: import { SERVICE_MAP } from "./paths";
     4: import { resolvePackagePath } from "./package";
     5: 
     6: export async function detectModules() {
     7:   const out: Record<string, any> = {};
     8:   for (const name of Object.keys(SERVICE_MAP))
     9:     out[name] = { running: false, installed: false, path: undefined, bin: undefined };
    10: 
    11:   for (const name of Object.keys(SERVICE_MAP)) {
    12:     try {
    13:       const pkgPath = resolvePackagePath(SERVICE_MAP[name].pkg);
    14:       if (pkgPath) {
    15:         out[name].installed = true;
    16:         out[name].path = pkgPath;
    17:         try {
    18:           const pkgJson = require(require('path').join(pkgPath, 'package.json'));
    19:           if (pkgJson && pkgJson.bin) {
    20:             out[name].bin = typeof pkgJson.bin === 'string' ? pkgJson.bin : Object.values(pkgJson.bin)[0];
    21:           }
    22:         } catch {}
    23:       }
    24:     } catch {}
    25:   }
    26: 
    27:   await new Promise<void>((resolve) => {
    28:     exec(process.platform === "win32" ? "tasklist" : "ps aux", (err, stdout) => {
    29:       if (err) {
    30:         logger.warn(`Failed to list processes: ${err.message}`);
    31:         return resolve();
    32:       }
    33:       const s = stdout.toString();
    34:       for (const name of Object.keys(SERVICE_MAP)) {
    35:         const regex = new RegExp(name, "i");
    36:         if (regex.test(s)) {
    37:           out[name].running = true;
    38:         }
    39:       }
    40:       resolve();
    41:     });
    42:   });
    43:   return out;
    44: }
    45: 
    46: export async function findAndKill() {
    47:   const names = Object.keys(SERVICE_MAP);
    48:   const killed: number[] = [];
    49:   for (const n of names) {
    50:     try {
    51:       if (process.platform === "win32") {
    52:         exec(`taskkill /IM ${n}.exe /F`, (err) => {});
    53:       } else {
    54:         exec(`pkill -f ${n}`, (err) => {});
    55:       }
    56:     } catch (err) {
    57:       // ignore
    58:     }
    59:   }
    60:   return killed;
    61: }
    62: 


============================
FILE: qflush\src\utils\exec.ts
============================
============================
     1: import { spawn } from "child_process";
     2: import { logger } from "./logger";
     3: import { unlinkSync, existsSync, rmSync } from "fs";
     4: import { execSync } from "child_process";
     5: 
     6: export function spawnSafe(command: string, args: string[] = [], opts: any = {}) {
     7:   try {
     8:     const proc = spawn(command, args, { stdio: "inherit", shell: true, ...opts });
     9:     proc.on("error", (err) => logger.error(`Process error: ${err.message}`));
    10:     return proc;
    11:   } catch (err: any) {
    12:     logger.error(`Failed to spawn ${command}: ${err.message}`);
    13:     throw err;
    14:   }
    15: }
    16: 
    17: export function rimrafSync(path: string) {
    18:   if (!path) return;
    19:   if (!existsSync(path)) return;
    20:   try {
    21:     rmSync(path, { recursive: true, force: true });
    22:   } catch (err) {
    23:     // fallback
    24:     try {
    25:       unlinkSync(path);
    26:     } catch {}
    27:   }
    28: }
    29: 
    30: export function isPackageInstalled(pkgName: string) {
    31:   try {
    32:     execSync(`npm ls ${pkgName} --depth=0`, { stdio: "ignore" });
    33:     return true;
    34:   } catch {
    35:     return false;
    36:   }
    37: }
    38: 
    39: export function ensurePackageInstalled(pkgName: string) {
    40:   if (isPackageInstalled(pkgName)) return true;
    41:   logger.info(`Installing missing package ${pkgName}...`);
    42:   try {
    43:     execSync(`npm install -g ${pkgName}`, { stdio: "inherit" });
    44:     return true;
    45:   } catch (err: any) {
    46:     logger.warn(`Failed to install ${pkgName}: ${err.message}`);
    47:     return false;
    48:   }
    49: }
    50: 
    51: // Helpers for CLI pre-launch checks
    52: export function pathExists(pathStr: string) {
    53:   return !!pathStr && existsSync(pathStr);
    54: }
    55: 
    56: export function rebuildInstructionsFor(pkgPath?: string) {
    57:   if (!pkgPath) return `Rebuild the package (cd <pkg> && npm install && npm run build && npm install -g .)`;
    58:   return `Rebuild the package:\n  cd ${pkgPath}\n  npm install\n  npm run build\n  npm install -g .`;
    59: }
    60: 


============================
FILE: qflush\src\utils\health.ts
============================
============================
     1: import http from 'http';
     2: import net from 'net';
     3: import { logger } from './logger';
     4: 
     5: export async function httpProbe(url: string, timeout = 2000): Promise<boolean> {
     6:   return new Promise((resolve) => {
     7:     const req = http.get(url, (res) => {
     8:       res.resume();
     9:       resolve(Boolean(res.statusCode && res.statusCode < 400));
    10:     });
    11:     req.on('error', () => resolve(false));
    12:     req.setTimeout(timeout, () => {
    13:       req.destroy();
    14:       resolve(false);
    15:     });
    16:   });
    17: }
    18: 
    19: export async function tcpProbe(host: string, port: number, timeout = 2000): Promise<boolean> {
    20:   return new Promise((resolve) => {
    21:     const s = new net.Socket();
    22:     let done = false;
    23:     s.setTimeout(timeout);
    24:     s.on('connect', () => {
    25:       done = true;
    26:       s.destroy();
    27:       resolve(true);
    28:     });
    29:     s.on('error', () => { if (!done) { done = true; resolve(false); } });
    30:     s.on('timeout', () => { if (!done) { done = true; s.destroy(); resolve(false); } });
    31:     s.connect(port, host);
    32:   });
    33: }
    34: 
    35: export async function waitForService(urlOrHost: string, port?: number, timeout = 5000) {
    36:   const start = Date.now();
    37:   while (Date.now() - start < timeout) {
    38:     let ok = false;
    39:     if (typeof port === 'number') {
    40:       ok = await tcpProbe(urlOrHost, port, 1000);
    41:     } else if (urlOrHost.startsWith('http')) {
    42:       ok = await httpProbe(urlOrHost, 1000);
    43:     }
    44:     if (ok) return true;
    45:     await new Promise((r) => setTimeout(r, 500));
    46:   }
    47:   return false;
    48: }
    49:

FILE: qflush\src\utils\logger.ts
============================

     1: export const logger = {
     2:   info: (msg: string) => console.log(`\x1b[36m[QFLASH]\x1b[0m ${msg}`),
     3:   warn: (msg: string) => console.log(`\x1b[33m[QFLASH]\x1b[0m ${msg}`),
     4:   error: (msg: string) => console.error(`\x1b[31m[QFLASH]\x1b[0m ${msg}`),
     5:   success: (msg: string) => console.log(`\x1b[32m[QFLASH]\x1b[0m ${msg}`),
     6: };
     7: 


============================
FILE: qflush\src\utils\package.ts
============================
============================
     1: import { join } from "path";
     2: import { existsSync } from "fs";
     3: import { readFileSync } from "fs";
     4: 
     5: export function resolvePackagePath(pkgName: string) {
     6:   try {
     7:     const resolved = require.resolve(pkgName);
     8:     // walk up to package root
     9:     let dir = resolved;
    10:     while (dir && !existsSync(join(dir, "package.json"))) {
    11:       const p = require("path").dirname(dir);
    12:       if (p === dir) break;
    13:       dir = p;
    14:     }
    15:     if (existsSync(join(dir, "package.json"))) return dir;
    16:   } catch {}
    17:   // fallback: node_modules path
    18:   const guess = join(process.cwd(), "node_modules", pkgName);
    19:   if (existsSync(join(guess, "package.json"))) return guess;
    20:   return undefined;
    21: }
    22: 
    23: export function readPackageJson(pkgPath: string) {
    24:   try {
    25:     const content = readFileSync(join(pkgPath, "package.json"), "utf8");
    26:     return JSON.parse(content);
    27:   } catch {
    28:     return null;
    29:   }
    30: }
    31: 


============================
FILE: qflush\src\utils\paths.ts
============================
============================
     1: import { existsSync } from "fs";
     2: import { join } from "path";
     3: 
     4: // Map service names to npm package names and local folder candidates
     5: export const SERVICE_MAP: Record<string, { pkg: string; candidates: string[] }> = {
     6:   rome: { pkg: "@funeste38/rome", candidates: ["./rome", "./Rome"] },
     7:   nezlephant: { pkg: "@funeste38/nezlephant", candidates: ["./nezlephant", "./Nezlephant"] },
     8:   envaptex: { pkg: "@funeste38/envaptex", candidates: ["./envaptex", "./Envaptex"] },
     9:   freeland: { pkg: "@funeste38/freeland", candidates: ["./freeland", "./Freeland"] },
    10:   bat: { pkg: "@funeste38/bat", candidates: ["./bat", "./BAT"] },
    11: };
    12: 
    13: export function resolvePaths(detected: any = {}) {
    14:   const out: Record<string, string | undefined> = {};
    15:   for (const key of Object.keys(SERVICE_MAP)) {
    16:     if (detected && detected[key] && detected[key].path) {
    17:       out[key] = detected[key].path;
    18:       continue;
    19:     }
    20:     const tries = SERVICE_MAP[key].candidates;
    21:     for (const t of tries) {
    22:       const p = join(process.cwd(), t);
    23:       if (existsSync(p)) {
    24:         out[key] = p;
    25:         break;
    26:       }
    27:     }
    28:   }
    29:   return out;
    30: }
    31: 


============================
FILE: qflush\src\utils\tokens.ts
============================
============================
     1: import { randomBytes } from "crypto";
     2: 
     3: export function generateToken(len = 24) {
     4:   return randomBytes(len).toString("hex");
     5: }
     6: 
     7: export function resolveTokens(existing: Record<string, any> = {}) {
     8:   const out: Record<string, string> = {};
     9:   for (const name of ["A-11", "SPYDER", "BAT", "KEYKEY", "NEZLEPHANT"]) {
    10:     out[name] = existing[name] || generateToken(12);
    11:   }
    12:   return out;
    13: }
    14:

FILE: qflush\tools\check-cli.js
============================
============================
     1: #!/usr/bin/env node
     2: const fs = require('fs');
     3: const path = require('path');
     4: const pkgPath = path.join(__dirname, '..', 'package.json');
     5: if (!fs.existsSync(pkgPath)) {
     6:   console.error('package.json not found');
     7:   process.exit(2);
     8: }
     9: const pkg = JSON.parse(fs.readFileSync(pkgPath, 'utf8'));
    10: const bin = pkg.bin && (typeof pkg.bin === 'string' ? pkg.bin : Object.values(pkg.bin)[0]);
    11: if (!bin) {
    12:   console.error('No bin entry in package.json');
    13:   process.exit(2);
    14: }
    15: const binPath = path.join(__dirname, '..', bin);
    16: if (!fs.existsSync(binPath)) {
    17:   console.error(`CLI entry missing: ${binPath}`);
    18:   console.error('Réparez en reconstruisant le paquet localement:');
    19:   console.error('  cd qflash');
    20:   console.error('  npm install');
    21:   console.error('  npm run build');
    22:   console.error('  npm install -g .');
    23:   process.exit(2);
    24: }
    25: console.log('CLI check OK:', binPath);
    26: process.exit(0);
    27:

     1: FUNESTERIE TRADEMARK POLICY
     2: 
     3: The following names are protected:
     4: - "Funesterie™"
     5: - "FCL"
     6: - "Funesterie Config Language"
     7: - The Funesterie logo and pirate branding
     8: 
     9: You may NOT:
    10: ✗ Use these names for your own products
    11: ✗ Publish tools named “FCL” or “Funesterie Something”
    12: ✗ Create domains including Funesterie/FCL
    13: ✗ Use branding without permission
    14: 
    15: You may:
    16: ✓ Mention Funesterie™ in documentation
    17: ✓ Say “supports FCL” if technically accurate
    18: ✓ Link to official Funesterie repositories
    19:

   161: ============================
   162: FILE: .github\PR_BODY.md
   163: ============================
   164: ============================
   165: This PR introduces a runtime-safe stub router for Cortex packets to avoid TypeScript resolution errors during build and provides a safe extension path.
   166: 
   167: Changes:
   168: - `src/cortex/router.ts`: runtime-safe router with guarded dynamic resolution and handlers for `npz-graph`, `drip`, `enable-spyder`, `vision`, `apply`, `save-state` and `auto-patch`.
   169: - `src/cortex/types.ts`: expanded `CortexPacket` transport fields used by `listener`.
   170: - `tsconfig.json`: restored to NodeNext `moduleResolution`.
   171: - Unit tests: `src/cortex/router.unit.spec.ts` plus helper `tools/run-tests-with-qflushd.js` to run tests that need `qflushd`.
   172: 
   173: Notes:
   174: - All tests pass locally when run via the included helper script.
   175: - Handlers use guarded imports; when the real modules are available you can replace guarded lookups with direct imports.
   176: - This change is intentionally conservative to keep the build healthy while enabling future feature work.
   177: 
   178: 
   179: 
   180: ============================
   181: FILE: .github\PR_BODY_CXPK.md
   182: ============================
   183: ============================
   184: This PR implements CXPK PNG encode/decode and adds flexible checksum support and safe local stubs to make the router/testing more robust.
   185: 
   186: Summary of changes
   187: - `src/cortex/pngCodec.ts`: CXPK encoder/decoder (header + Brotli payload mapped into RGBA pixels).
   188: - `src/cortex/pngCodec.spec.ts`, `src/cortex/pngCodec.more.spec.ts`: roundtrip tests (normal mode, red-curtain mode, multi-pixel payloads).
   189: - `src/utils/fileChecksum.ts`: `flexibleChecksumBuffer` / `flexibleChecksumFile` which detect PNG CXPK, Cortex binary packets, or fall back to text normalization (strip ROME-TAG) and compute XOR checksum over logical payload.
   190: - `src/daemon/qflushd.ts`: extended test daemon to compute checksums (`/npz/checksum/compute`) and accept `checksum: "__auto__"` with `path` for store/verify endpoints.
   191: - `src/stubs/*`: safe lightweight local stubs for `rome-executor`, `spyder`, and `cortex-emit` used by the router when real modules are absent.
   192: - `src/cortex/router.ts`: prefer local stubs when available; keep runtime-safe guarded resolution.
   193: 
   194: Motivation
   195: - Tests previously failed because checksum logic didn't handle multiple formats (text, PNG CXPK, cortex binary). The flexible checksum computes checksums on the decoded logical payload so verification is robust.
   196: - Local stubs and CXPK codec provide a reproducible test surface for CI and local development without depending on external services.
   197: 
   198: Notes
   199: - All tests passed locally when running the helper `tools/run-tests-with-qflushd.js`.
   200: - The runtime guards still allow replacing stubs with real modules when ready.
   201: 
   202: Please review and merge if acceptable.
   203: 
   204: 
   205: 
   206: ============================
   207: FILE: .github\README-open-vsx.md
   208: ============================
   209: ============================
   210: Open VSX publish setup
   211: 
   212: 1. In the Open VSX website sign the Publisher Agreement and create a Personal Access Token.
   213: 2. In your GitHub repository go to Settings → Secrets → Actions and add a new secret named `OPEN_VSX_TOKEN` with the token value.
   214: 3. Tag a release (e.g. `v3.0.1`) or push a tag matching `v*` to trigger the workflow.
   215: 
   216: Notes:
   217: - The workflow will build the extension and attempt to publish using `npx ovsx publish`.
   218: - If publishing fails, the package `.vsix` remains available in the workflow artifacts (you can modify the workflow to upload artifacts).
   219: 
   220: 
   221: 
   222: ============================
   223: FILE: .github\workflows\ci.yml
   224: ============================
   225: ============================
   226: name: CI
   227: 
   228: on:
   229:   workflow_dispatch:
   230:     inputs:
   231:       enable_supervisor:
   232:         description: "Set to '0' to enable supervisor in CI run, '1' to disable. Default disables supervisor."
   233:         default: '1'
   234:   push:
   235:     branches: [ master, main, 'fix/*' ]
   236:   pull_request:
   237:     branches: [ master, main ]
   238: 
   239: permissions:
   240:   contents: write
   241: 
   242: jobs:
   243:   build-and-test:
   244:     runs-on: ubuntu-latest
   245:     env:
   246:       QFLUSH_SKIP_GLOBAL_INSTALLS: '1'
   247:       # Enable embedded service manager and safe CI mode for plumbing tests
   248:       QFLUSH_EMBED_SERVICES: '1'
   249:       QFLUSH_SAFE_CI: '1'
   250:       QFLUSH_DISABLE_SUPERVISOR: '1'
   251:       QFLUSH_ENABLE_REDIS: '0'
   252:       QFLUSH_DISABLE_COPILOT: '1'
   253:       QFLUSH_TELEMETRY: '0'
   254:       # Provide test token to NPZ tests (populated from repo secret)
   255:       QFLUSH_TEST_TOKEN: ${{ secrets.ACTIONS_TOKEN }}
   256:       # Enable cortex bus during CI (set to '1' to start cortex bus)
   257:       QFLUSH_USE_CORTEX: '1'
   258:     steps:
   259:       - uses: actions/checkout@v4
   260:         with:
   261:           fetch-depth: 0
   262:           persist-credentials: true
   263:       - name: Configure git
   264:         run: |
   265:           git config --global user.email "actions@github.com"
   266:           git config --global user.name "github-actions"
   267:           git config --global --add safe.directory "${{ github.workspace }}"
   268:       - name: Use Node.js 20
   269:         uses: actions/setup-node@v4
   270:         with:
   271:           node-version: '20'
   272:       - name: Install dependencies
   273:         run: |
   274:           npm ci --no-audit --no-fund
   275:       - name: Fix alias imports (convert @utils/* → relative)
   276:         run: |
   277:           node tools/fix-utils-imports.js src/utils src/commands || true
   278:       - name: Build (tsc) and capture logs
   279:         run: |
   280:           npx tsc -p . --pretty false > tsc-output.log 2>&1 || (echo "tsc failed, printing log:" && sed -n '1,200p' tsc-output.log && exit 1)
   281:           echo "tsc succeeded"
   282:       - name: Build optional spyder
   283:         run: |
   284:           if [ -f spyder/package.json ]; then
   285:             echo "Building spyder (optional)..."
   286:             npm --prefix spyder run build || echo "spyder build failed or not present, continuing"
   287:           else
   288:             echo "No spyder package, skipping build"
   289:           fi
   290:       - name: Start Cortex bus (background)
   291:         if: env.QFLUSH_USE_CORTEX == '1'
   292:         run: |
   293:           # Start Cortex bus from built dist if present. If not present, attempt to build then retry.
   294:           if [ -f dist/cortex/bus.js ]; then
   295:             nohup node ./dist/cortex/bus.js > cortex.log 2>&1 & echo $! > cortex.pid
   296:             echo "CORTEX started, pid=$(cat cortex.pid)"
   297:           else
   298:             echo "dist/cortex/bus.js not found, attempting to build..."
   299:             npm run build || true
   300:             if [ -f dist/cortex/bus.js ]; then
   301:               nohup node ./dist/cortex/bus.js > cortex.log 2>&1 & echo $! > cortex.pid
   302:               echo "CORTEX started after build, pid=$(cat cortex.pid)"
   303:             else
   304:               echo "dist/cortex/bus.js still missing — attempting ts-node fallback"
   305:               # ts-node is available in devDependencies; use npx to run TypeScript directly
   306:               npx ts-node ./src/cortex/bus.ts > cortex.log 2>&1 & echo $! > cortex.pid
   307:               echo "CORTEX started via ts-node, pid=$(cat cortex.pid)"
   308:             fi
   309:           fi
   310:       - name: Show dist contents (diagnostic)
   311:         run: |
   312:           echo "dist tree:" && ls -la dist || echo "dist directory not present"
   313:       - name: Ensure .qflush config exists
   314:         run: |
   315:           mkdir -p .qflush
   316:           if [ ! -f .qflush/logic-config.json ]; then echo '{}' > .qflush/logic-config.json; fi
   317:           if [ ! -f .qflush/logic-vars.json ]; then echo '{}' > .qflush/logic-vars.json; fi
   318:       - name: Start qflush daemon (background)
   319:         env:
   320:           QFLUSHD_PORT: '43421'
   321:         run: |
   322:           nohup node ./dist/daemon/qflushd.js > qflushd.log 2>&1 & echo $! > qflushd.pid
   323:           npx wait-on -t 30000 http://localhost:${QFLUSHD_PORT}/npz/rome-index || true
   324:       - name: Start embedded services (test plumbing)
   325:         run: |
   326:           # start services via embedded service manager; SAFE_CI will skip actual starts but exercise plumbing
   327:           node dist/index.js start --services "bat,spyder,nezlephant,freeland" --verbose || true
   328:       - name: Run tests
   329:         env:
   330:           VITEST: "1"
   331:           QFLUSHD_PORT: '43421'
   332:           QFLUSH_ENABLE_REDIS: '0'
   333:           QFLUSH_SKIP_GLOBAL_INSTALLS: '1'
   334:         run: |
   335:           npm test
   336:       - name: Teardown qflush daemon
   337:         if: always()
   338:         run: |
   339:           if [ -f qflushd.pid ]; then kill $(cat qflushd.pid) || true; fi
   340:           if [ -f cortex.pid ]; then kill $(cat cortex.pid) || true; fi
   341:           tail -n 200 qflushd.log || true
   342: 
   343:   integration-dry-run:
   344:     needs: build-and-test
   345:     runs-on: ubuntu-latest
   346:     timeout-minutes: 60
   347:     env:
   348:       REDIS_URL: ''
   349:       QFLUSH_DISABLE_SUPERVISOR: '1'
   350:     steps:
   351:       - uses: actions/checkout@v4
   352:         with:
   353:           fetch-depth: 0
   354:           persist-credentials: true
   355:       - name: Use Node.js 20
   356:         uses: actions/setup-node@v4
   357:         with:
   358:           node-version: '20'
   359:       - name: Install dependencies
   360:         run: |
   361:           npm ci --no-audit --no-fund
   362:       - name: Build
   363:         run: |
   364:           npm run build
   365:       - name: Integration dry-run
   366:         run: |
   367:           node dist/index.js start --verbose --dry-run
   368: 
   369:   engine-dry-run:
   370:     needs: build-and-test
   371:     runs-on: ubuntu-latest
   372:     timeout-minutes: 20
   373:     env:
   374:       REDIS_URL: ''
   375:       QFLUSH_DISABLE_SUPERVISOR: '1'
   376:     steps:
   377:       - uses: actions/checkout@v4
   378:         with:
   379:           fetch-depth: 0

   381:       - name: Use Node.js

   383:         with:

   386:         run: npm ci --no-audit --no-fund

   507:

   509:   push:

   513:   build-and-test:
   514:     runs-on: ubuntu-latest
   515: 
   516:     env:
   517:       QFLUSH_EMBED_SERVICES: '1'
   518:       QFLUSH_SAFE_CI: '1'
   519:       QFLUSH_DISABLE_SUPERVISOR: '1'
   520:       QFLUSH_ENABLE_REDIS: '0'
   521:       QFLUSH_DISABLE_COPILOT: '1'
   522:       QFLUSH_TELEMETRY: '0'
   523: 
   524:     steps:
   525:       - name: Checkout repo
   526:         uses: actions/checkout@v4
   527: 
   528:       - name: Install dependencies
   529:         run: npm ci --no-audit --no-fund
   530: 
   531:       - name: Build dist
   532:         run: npm run build
   533: 
   534:       - name: Start embedded services (plomberie de test)
   535:         run: |
   536:           node dist/index.js start \
   537:             --services "bat,spyder,nezlephant,freeland" \
   538:             --verbose
   539: 
   540:       - name: Run tests
   541:         run: npm test
   542: 
   543: 
   544: 
   545: ============================
   546: FILE: .github\workflows\ci-with-supervisor.yml
   547: ============================
   548: ============================
   549: name: CI (with supervisor)
   550: 
   551: on:
   552:   push:
   553:   workflow_dispatch:
   554: 
   555: jobs:
   556:   build-test-and-start-services:
   557:     runs-on: ubuntu-latest
   558: 
   559:     env:
   560:       # Superviseur ACTIVÉ
   561:       QFLUSH_DISABLE_SUPERVISOR: '0'
   562:       QFLUSH_ENABLE_REDIS: '0'
   563:       QFLUSH_DISABLE_COPILOT: '1'
   564:       QFLUSH_TELEMETRY: '0'
   565: 
   566:     steps:
   567:       - name: Checkout repo
   568:         uses: actions/checkout@v4
   569: 
   570:       - name: Install dependencies
   571:         run: npm ci --no-audit --no-fund
   572: 
   573:       - name: Build dist
   574:         run: npm run build
   575: 
   576:       - name: Start qflush daemon
   577:         run: |
   578:           node dist/daemon/qflushd.js &
   579:           echo "Daemon started on port ${QFLUSHD_PORT:-4500}"
   580: 
   581:       - name: Start selected QFLUSH services
   582:         run: |
   583:           # Use canonical service names: 'bat' and 'spyder'
   584:           node dist/index.js start \
   585:             --services "bat,spyder,nezlephant,freeland" \
   586:             --verbose
   587: 
   588:       - name: Run tests
   589:         run: npm test

   592: 
   593: ============================
   594: FILE: .github\workflows\create-pr-from-branch.yml
   595: ============================
   596: ============================
   597: name: Create PR from branch
   598: 
   599: on:
   600:   workflow_dispatch:
   601:     inputs:
   602:       head_branch:
   603:         description: 'Branch name to create PR from'
   604:         required: true
   605:         default: 'feat/tools-encoders'
   606:       base_branch:
   607:         description: 'Target base branch'
   608:         required: true
   609:         default: 'main'
   610:       title:
   611:         description: 'PR title'
   612:         required: true
   613:         default: 'feat(tools): add encoders and css encoder/decoder'
   614:       body:
   615:         description: 'PR body'
   616:         required: false
   617:         default: 'Add tools: tools/rgba_brotli_oc8.py, tools/css_encode.js, tools/css_decode.js.'
   618: 
   619: jobs:
   620:   create-pr:
   621:     # prevent self-dispatch loops when workflow is invoked by GitHub Actions
   622:     if: "${{ github.actor != 'github-actions[bot]' }}"
   623:     runs-on: ubuntu-latest
   624:     steps:
   625:       - name: Create PR via REST API
   626:         env:
   627:           GH_TOKEN: ${{ secrets.ACTIONS_TOKEN }}
   628:           GITHUB_API_URL: https://api.github.com
   629:         run: |
   630:           if [ -z "$GH_TOKEN" ]; then
   631:             echo "ERROR: ACTIONS_TOKEN secret is not set in repository secrets." >&2
   632:             exit 1
   633:           fi
   634:           echo "Creating PR from '${{ github.event.inputs.head_branch }}' -> '${{ github.event.inputs.base_branch }}'"
   635:           payload=$(jq -n --arg title "${{ github.event.inputs.title }}" --arg head "${{ github.event.inputs.head_branch }}" --arg base "${{ github.event.inputs.base_branch }}" --arg body "${{ github.event.inputs.body }}" '{title:$title,head:$head,base:$base,body:$body}')
   636:           echo "$payload" | jq .
   637:           resp=$(curl -s -H "Authorization: Bearer $GH_TOKEN" -H "Accept: application/vnd.github+json" -H "User-Agent: qflush-bot" "$GITHUB_API_URL/repos/${{ github.repository }}/pulls" -d @-)
   638:           echo "$resp" | jq .
   639:           url=$(echo "$resp" | jq -r .html_url)
   640:           if [ "$url" = "null" ] || [ -z "$url" ]; then
   641:             echo "Failed to create PR; response above." >&2
   642:             exit 1
   643:           fi
   644:           echo "PR created: $url"
   645: 
   646: 
   647: 
   648: ============================
   649: FILE: .github\workflows\get-installation-token.yml
   650: ============================
   651: ============================
   652: name: Get GitHub App Installation Token
   653: 
   654: on:
   655:   workflow_dispatch:
   656: 
   657: permissions:
   658:   contents: read
   659: 
   660: jobs:
   661:   get-token:
   662:     runs-on: ubuntu-latest
   663:     steps:
   664:       - uses: actions/checkout@v4
   665:         with:
   666:           fetch-depth: 0
   667: 
   668:       - name: Use Node.js 20
   669:         uses: actions/setup-node@v4
   670:         with:
   671:           node-version: '20'
   672: 
   673:       - name: Install @octokit/auth-app
   674:         run: |
   675:           npm install @octokit/auth-app --no-audit --no-fund
   676: 
   677:       - name: Write private key to file (from secret)
   678:         env:
   679:           PRIVATE_KEY_PEM: ${{ secrets.PRIVATE_KEY_PEM }}
   680:         run: |
   681:           set -euo pipefail
   682:           printf '%s' "$PRIVATE_KEY_PEM" > private.pem
   683:           # trim surrounding quotes if any
   684:           sed -i "1s/^['\"]//;\$s/['\"]$//" private.pem || true
   685:           echo "Private key head:"; sed -n '1,5p' private.pem || true
   686: 
   687:           # If OpenSSH format, convert to PEM
   688:           if grep -q "BEGIN OPENSSH PRIVATE KEY" private.pem; then
   689:             echo "Detected OpenSSH private key — converting to PEM"
   690:             ssh-keygen -p -f private.pem -m PEM -N "" || true
   691:           fi
   692: 
   693:           # Fail if encrypted
   694:           if grep -q "ENCRYPTED" private.pem || grep -q "Proc-Type: 4,ENCRYPTED" private.pem; then
   695:             echo "ERROR: provided private key appears to be encrypted. Provide an unencrypted PEM or convert locally."
   696:             exit 1
   697:           fi
   698: 
   699:           # export path for helper
   700:           echo "GITHUB_PRIVATE_KEY_FILE=$(pwd)/private.pem" >> $GITHUB_ENV
   701: 
   702:       - name: Obtain installation token
   703:         id: get_token
   704:         env:
   705:           APP_ID: ${{ secrets.APP_ID }}
   706:           INSTALLATION_ID: ${{ secrets.INSTALLATION_ID }}
   707:           GITHUB_APP_ID: ${{ secrets.APP_ID }}
   708:           GITHUB_INSTALLATION_ID: ${{ secrets.INSTALLATION_ID }}
   709:           GITHUB_PRIVATE_KEY_FILE: ${{ env.GITHUB_PRIVATE_KEY_FILE }}
   710:         run: |
   711:           node tools/get-installation-token.js > token.txt
   712:           echo "::add-mask::$(cat token.txt)"
   713:           echo "token=$(cat token.txt)" >> $GITHUB_OUTPUT
   714: 
   715:       - name: Use installation token (list installation repositories)
   716:         if: success()
   717:         env:
   718:           INSTALL_TOKEN: ${{ steps.get_token.outputs.token }}
   719:         run: |
   720:           set -euo pipefail
   721:           # mask token in logs
   722:           echo "::add-mask::$INSTALL_TOKEN"
   723:           echo "Calling GitHub API with installation token..."
   724:           curl -s -H "Authorization: Bearer $INSTALL_TOKEN" -H "Accept: application/vnd.github+json" https://api.github.com/installation/repositories > installation-repos.json || true
   725:           echo "Wrote installation-repos.json (masked token)."
   726: 
   727:       - name: Upload token artifact
   728:         if: success()
   729:         uses: actions/upload-artifact@v4
   730:         with:
   731:           name: installation-token
   732:           path: |
   733:             token.txt
   734:             installation-repos.json
   735: 
   736:       - name: Show success
   737:         run: |
   738:           echo "Installation token obtained, API result and token uploaded as artifact (masked)."
   739: 
   740: 
   741: 
   742: ============================
   743: FILE: .github\workflows\netlify-deploy.yml
   744: ============================
   745: ============================
   746: name: Deploy to Netlify
   747: 
   748: on:
   749:   workflow_dispatch:
   750: 
   751: jobs:
   752:   build-and-deploy:
   753:     runs-on: ubuntu-latest
   754:     steps:
   755:       - name: Checkout
   756:         uses: actions/checkout@v4
   757:         with:
   758:           submodules: 'false'
   759: 
   760:       - name: Setup Node
   761:         uses: actions/setup-node@v4
   762:         with:
   763:           node-version: '18'
   764: 
   765:       - name: Install dependencies
   766:         run: |
   767:           npm ci
   768: 
   769:       - name: Build
   770:         run: |
   771:           npm run prebuild || true
   772:           npm run build
   773: 
   774:       - name: Install Netlify CLI
   775:         run: |
   776:           npm i -g netlify-cli
   777: 
   778:       - name: Deploy to Netlify
   779:         env:
   780:           NETLIFY_AUTH_TOKEN: ${{ secrets.NETLIFY_AUTH_TOKEN }}
   781:           NETLIFY_SITE_NAME: '"qflash-funesterie"  # suggested site name, will be adjusted'
   782:           NETLIFY_DEPLOY_DIR: "dist"
   783:         run: |
   784:           set -e
   785:           netlify sites:create --name "$NETLIFY_SITE_NAME" --json || true
   786:           SITE_ID=$(netlify sites:list --json | jq -r ".[] | select(.name==\"$NETLIFY_SITE_NAME\") | .id")
   787:           echo "SITE_ID=$SITE_ID"
   788:           netlify deploy --dir="$NETLIFY_DEPLOY_DIR" --prod --site=$SITE_ID
   789:           echo "Deployed to site $SITE_ID"
   790: 
   791: 
   792: 
   793: ============================
   794: FILE: .github\workflows\netlify-enable-https.yml
   795: ============================
   796: ============================
   797: name: Netlify Enable HTTPS
   798: 
   799: on:
   800:   workflow_dispatch:
   801: 
   802: jobs:
   803:   enable-https:
   804:     runs-on: ubuntu-latest
   805:     steps:
   806:       - name: Checkout
   807:         uses: actions/checkout@v4
   808: 
   809:       - name: Setup tools
   810:         run: |
   811:           sudo apt-get update && sudo apt-get install -y jq curl
   812:           npm i -g netlify-cli
   813: 
   814:       - name: Enable HTTPS (force SSL)
   815:         env:
   816:           NETLIFY_AUTH_TOKEN: ${{ secrets.NETLIFY_AUTH_TOKEN }}
   817:           NETLIFY_SITE_NAME: "qflash-funesterie"
   818:         run: |
   819:           set -e
   820:           SITE_ID=$(netlify sites:list --json | jq -r ".[] | select(.name==\"${NETLIFY_SITE_NAME}\") | .id")
   821:           if [ -z "$SITE_ID" ] || [ "$SITE_ID" = "null" ]; then
   822:             echo "Site not found: ${NETLIFY_SITE_NAME}"
   823:             exit 1
   824:           fi
   825:           echo "Found site: $SITE_ID"
   826:           # enable force_ssl via Netlify API
   827:           echo "Enabling force_ssl for site $SITE_ID"
   828:           curl -s -X PATCH "https://api.netlify.com/api/v1/sites/$SITE_ID" \
   829:             -H "Authorization: Bearer $NETLIFY_AUTH_TOKEN" \
   830:             -H "Content-Type: application/json" \
   831:             -d '{"force_ssl":true}' | jq .
   832:           echo "HTTPS (force SSL) enabled (request sent)."
   833: 
   834:       - name: Ensure domain alias
   835:         env:
   836:           NETLIFY_AUTH_TOKEN: ${{ secrets.NETLIFY_AUTH_TOKEN }}
   837:           NETLIFY_SITE_NAME: "qflash-funesterie"
   838:         run: |
   839:           set -e
   840:           SITE_ID=$(netlify sites:list --json | jq -r ".[] | select(.name==\"${NETLIFY_SITE_NAME}\") | .id")
   841:           DOMAIN="qflash.funesterie.pro"
   842:           # add domain alias if not present
   843:           EXISTS=$(netlify domains:list --site $SITE_ID --json | jq -r ".[] | select(.hostname==\"$DOMAIN\") | .id" || true)
   844:           if [ -z "$EXISTS" ]; then
   845:             echo "Adding domain $DOMAIN to site $SITE_ID"
   846:             netlify domains:add $DOMAIN --site $SITE_ID || true
   847:           else
   848:             echo "Domain $DOMAIN already added"
   849:           fi
   850:           # show domain status
   851:           netlify domains:list --site $SITE_ID --json | jq .
   852: 
   853: 
   854: 
   855: ============================
   856: FILE: .github\workflows\netlify-set-env.yml
   857: ============================
   858: ============================
   859: name: Configure Netlify Site Env
   860: 
   861: on:
   862:   workflow_dispatch:
   863: 
   864: jobs:
   865:   set-env:
   866:     runs-on: ubuntu-latest
   867:     steps:
   868:       - name: Checkout
   869:         uses: actions/checkout@v4
   870: 
   871:       - name: Setup tools
   872:         run: |
   873:           sudo apt-get update && sudo apt-get install -y jq
   874:           npm i -g netlify-cli
   875: 
   876:       - name: Find or create site
   877:         env:
   878:           NETLIFY_AUTH_TOKEN: ${{ secrets.NETLIFY_AUTH_TOKEN }}
   879:           NETLIFY_SITE_NAME: "qflash-funesterie"
   880:         run: |
   881:           set -e
   882:           # attempt to find site id by name
   883:           SITE_ID=$(netlify sites:list --json | jq -r ".[] | select(.name==\"${NETLIFY_SITE_NAME}\") | .id" )
   884:           if [ -z "$SITE_ID" ] || [ "$SITE_ID" = "null" ]; then
   885:             echo "site not found, creating"
   886:             netlify sites:create --name "${NETLIFY_SITE_NAME}" --json
   887:             SITE_ID=$(netlify sites:list --json | jq -r ".[] | select(.name==\"${NETLIFY_SITE_NAME}\") | .id" )
   888:           fi
   889:           echo "SITE_ID=$SITE_ID"
   890:           echo "SITE_ID=$SITE_ID" >> $GITHUB_OUTPUT
   891: 
   892:       - name: Set Netlify env vars
   893:         env:
   894:           NETLIFY_AUTH_TOKEN: ${{ secrets.NETLIFY_AUTH_TOKEN }}
   895:           SITE_ID: ${{ steps.find_or_create_site.outputs.SITE_ID || '' }}
   896:           APP_ID: ${{ secrets.APP_ID }}
   897:           APP_SECRET: ${{ secrets.APP_SECRET }}
   898:           GUMROAD_TOKEN: ${{ secrets.GUMROAD_TOKEN }}
   899:           GUMROAD_PRODUCT_ID: ${{ secrets.GUMROAD_PRODUCT_ID }}
   900:           DAEMON_URL: "https://qflash.funesterie.pro"
   901:         run: |
   902:           set -e
   903:           # fallback: read site id via name
   904:           if [ -z "$SITE_ID" ]; then
   905:             SITE_ID=$(netlify sites:list --json | jq -r ".[] | select(.name==\"qflash-funesterie\") | .id" )
   906:           fi
   907:           echo "Using site: $SITE_ID"
   908:           # helper to set if value exists
   909:           set_env_if() {
   910:             KEY=$1; VAL=$2; if [ -n "$VAL" ] && [ "$VAL" != "null" ]; then netlify env:set $KEY "$VAL" --site $SITE_ID; fi
   911:           }
   912:           set_env_if "APP_ID" "$APP_ID"
   913:           set_env_if "APP_SECRET" "$APP_SECRET"
   914:           set_env_if "GUMROAD_TOKEN" "$GUMROAD_TOKEN"
   915:           set_env_if "GUMROAD_PRODUCT_ID" "$GUMROAD_PRODUCT_ID"
   916:           set_env_if "DAEMON_URL" "$DAEMON_URL"
   917:           echo "Env vars set"
   918: 
   919:       - name: Output site info
   920:         env:
   921:           NETLIFY_AUTH_TOKEN: ${{ secrets.NETLIFY_AUTH_TOKEN }}
   922:         run: |
   923:           netlify sites:list --json | jq -r ".[] | select(.name==\"qflash-funesterie\") | {name:.name,id:.id,ssl:.ssl,custom_domain: .custom_domain,default_domain:.default_domain}" || true
   924: 
   925: 
   926: 
   927: ============================
   928: FILE: .github\workflows\publish.yml
   929: ============================
   930: ============================
   931: name: Publish Package
   932: 
   933: on:
   934:   push:
   935:     tags:
   936:       - 'v*.*.*'
   937: 
   938: jobs:
   939:   publish:
   940:     runs-on: ubuntu-latest
   941:     steps:
   942:       - uses: actions/checkout@v3
   943:       - uses: actions/setup-node@v4
   944:         with:
   945:           node-version: '18'
   946:           registry-url: 'https://registry.npmjs.org'
   947:       - name: Validate tokens
   948:         run: |
   949:           if [ -z "${{ secrets.NPM_TOKEN }}" ]; then echo "NPM_TOKEN is missing"; exit 1; fi
   950:           if [ -z "${{ secrets.GUMROAD_TOKEN }}" ]; then echo "Warning: GUMROAD_TOKEN is not set"; fi
   951:       - name: Install dependencies
   952:         run: |
   953:           npm ci --no-audit --no-fund
   954:       - name: Build
   955:         run: |
   956:           npm run build --if-present
   957:       - name: Publish
   958:         env:
   959:           NODE_AUTH_TOKEN: ${{ secrets.NPM_TOKEN }}
   960:         run: |
   961:           echo "//registry.npmjs.org/:_authToken=${NODE_AUTH_TOKEN}" > ~/.npmrc
   962:           npm publish --access public
   963: 
   964: 
   965: 
   966: ============================
   967: FILE: .github\workflows\publish-gumroad.yml
   968: ============================
   969: ============================
   970: name: Publish VSIX to Gumroad
   971: 
   972: on:
   973:   workflow_dispatch:
   974:   release:
   975:     types: [published]
   976: 
   977: jobs:
   978:   publish-gumroad:
   979:     runs-on: ubuntu-latest
   980:     steps:
   981:       - name: Checkout
   982:         uses: actions/checkout@v4
   983: 
   984:       - name: Setup Node
   985:         uses: actions/setup-node@v4
   986:         with:
   987:           node-version: '18'
   988: 
   989:       - name: Build extension
   990:         run: |
   991:           cd extensions/vscode-npz
   992:           npm ci --no-audit --no-fund
   993:           npm run build
   994:           npx vsce package --no-dependencies
   995: 
   996:       - name: Upload VSIX to Release
   997:         if: github.event_name == 'release'
   998:         run: |
   999:           gh release upload ${{ github.event.release.tag_name }} extensions/vscode-npz/*.vsix --clobber
  1000: 
  1001:       - name: Upload to Gumroad
  1002:         env:
  1003:           GUMROAD_TOKEN: ${{ secrets.GUMROAD_TOKEN }}
  1004:           GUMROAD_PRODUCT_ID: ${{ secrets.GUMROAD_PRODUCT_ID }}
  1005:         run: |
  1006:           VSIX=$(ls extensions/vscode-npz/*.vsix | head -n 1)
  1007:           if [ -z "$VSIX" ]; then echo "No VSIX found"; exit 1; fi
  1008:           echo "Uploading $VSIX to Gumroad product $GUMROAD_PRODUCT_ID"
  1009:           # Use curl to upload file to Gumroad (replace endpoint as needed)
  1010:           curl -s -X POST "https://api.gumroad.com/v2/products/$GUMROAD_PRODUCT_ID/attachments" \
  1011:             -F "access_token=$GUMROAD_TOKEN" \
  1012:             -F "file=@${VSIX}" \
  1013:             -F "name=qflash-vsix" \
  1014:             -F "description=VSIX for release ${{ github.ref }}" \
  1015:             -o /tmp/gumroad-upload.json
  1016:           cat /tmp/gumroad-upload.json
  1017: 
  1018: 
  1019: 
  1020: ============================
  1021: FILE: .github\workflows\publish-on-release.yml
  1022: ============================
  1023: ============================
  1024: name: Publish on Release
  1025: 
  1026: on:
  1027:   workflow_dispatch: {}
  1028:   release:
  1029:     types: [published]
  1030: 
  1031: jobs:
  1032:   CI:
  1033:     runs-on: ubuntu-latest
  1034:     steps:
  1035:       - uses: actions/checkout@v4
  1036:         with:
  1037:           submodules: false
  1038:       - run: echo "CI check placeholder"
  1039: 
  1040:   publish:
  1041:     needs: [CI]
  1042:     runs-on: ubuntu-latest
  1043:     steps:
  1044:       - uses: actions/checkout@v4
  1045:         with:
  1046:           submodules: false
  1047:       - name: Use Node.js
  1048:         uses: actions/setup-node@v4
  1049:         with:
  1050:           node-version: '20.18.1'
  1051:           registry-url: 'https://registry.npmjs.org'
  1052:       - name: Publish to npm
  1053:         env:
  1054:           NODE_AUTH_TOKEN: ${{ secrets.NPM_TOKEN }}
  1055:         run: |
  1056:           npm install --no-audit --no-fund
  1057:           npm run build
  1058:           npm publish --access public

  1062: ============================
  1063: FILE: .github\workflows\publish-open-vsx.yml
  1064: ============================
  1065: ============================
  1066: name: Publish to Open VSX
  1067: 
  1068: on:
  1069:   workflow_dispatch: {}
  1070:   release:
  1071:     types: [published]
  1072: 
  1073: jobs:
  1074:   publish-open-vsx:
  1075:     runs-on: ubuntu-latest
  1076:     env:
  1077:       OPEN_VSX_TOKEN: ${{ secrets.OPEN_VSX_TOKEN }}
  1078:       NODE_OPTIONS: "-r ${{ github.workspace }}/extensions/vscode-npz/src/polyfill-file.js"
  1079:     steps:
  1080:       - uses: actions/checkout@v4
  1081:         with:
  1082:           submodules: false
  1083:       - name: Setup Node
  1084:         uses: actions/setup-node@v4
  1085:         with:
  1086:           node-version: '20.18.1'
  1087:       - name: Validate token (warning only)
  1088:         run: |
  1089:           if [ -z "${OPEN_VSX_TOKEN}" ]; then echo "OPEN_VSX_TOKEN is not set - Open VSX publish will be skipped"; else echo "OPEN_VSX_TOKEN is set"; fi
  1090:       - name: Install dependencies
  1091:         run: |
  1092:           cd extensions/vscode-npz
  1093:           if [ -f package-lock.json ]; then npm ci; else npm install --no-audit --no-fund; fi
  1094:       - name: Package .vsix
  1095:         run: |
  1096:           cd extensions/vscode-npz
  1097:           npx @vscode/vsce package
  1098:       - name: Upload VSIX artifact for debugging
  1099:         uses: actions/upload-artifact@v4
  1100:         with:
  1101:           name: qflush-vsix
  1102:           path: extensions/vscode-npz/*.vsix
  1103:       - name: Publish to Open VSX (runtime)
  1104:         run: |
  1105:           cd extensions/vscode-npz
  1106:           if [ -z "${OPEN_VSX_TOKEN}" ]; then echo "OPEN_VSX_TOKEN missing - skip"; exit 0; fi
  1107:           npx ovsx publish *.vsix --pat $OPEN_VSX_TOKEN || echo 'Open VSX publish failed'
  1108: 
  1109: 
  1110:

  1124:     runs-on: ubuntu-latest
  1125:     steps:
  1126:       - name: Checkout
  1127:         uses: actions/checkout@v4
  1128: 
  1129:       - name: Setup Node
  1130:         uses: actions/setup-node@v4
  1131:         with:
  1132:           node-version: '18'
  1133: 
  1134:       - name: Install dependencies
  1135:         run: |
  1136:           cd extensions/vscode-npz
  1137:           npm ci
  1138: 
  1139:       - name: Build extension
  1140:         run: |
  1141:           cd extensions/vscode-npz
  1142:           npm run build
  1143: 
  1144:       - name: Publish to Open VSX
  1145:         env:
  1146:           OPEN_VSX_TOKEN: ${{ secrets.OPEN_VSX_TOKEN }}
  1147:         run: |
  1148:           cd extensions/vscode-npz
  1149:           npx ovsx publish --pat "$OPEN_VSX_TOKEN"

  1177:   push:

  1190:         with:
  1191:           node-version: '18'
  1192: 
  1193:       - name: Validate tokens
  1194:         run: |
  1195:           if [ -z "${{ secrets.VSCE_TOKEN }}" ]; then echo "VSCE_TOKEN is missing"; exit 1; fi

  1206:         run: |

  1208:           npx vsce publish --pat "$VSCE_TOKEN" || npx vsce package

  1212: ============================
  1213: FILE: .github\workflows\publish-vscode.yml
  1214: ============================
  1215: ============================
  1216: name: Publish VS Code extension
  1217: 
  1218: on:
  1219:   workflow_dispatch:
  1220:   push:
  1221:     tags:
  1222:       - 'v*'
  1223: 
  1224: jobs:
  1225:   build:
  1226:     runs-on: ubuntu-latest
  1227:     env:
  1228:       OPEN_VSX_TOKEN: ${{ secrets.OPEN_VSX_TOKEN }}
  1229:       VSCE_TOKEN: ${{ secrets.VSCE_TOKEN }}
  1230:       NODE_OPTIONS: "-r ${{ github.workspace }}/extensions/vscode-npz/src/polyfill-file.js"
  1231:     steps:
  1232:       - uses: actions/checkout@v4
  1233:       - name: Use Node.js
  1234:         uses: actions/setup-node@v4
  1235:         with:
  1236:           node-version: '20'
  1237:       - name: Install dependencies
  1238:         run: |
  1239:           cd extensions/vscode-npz
  1240:           if [ -f package-lock.json ]; then npm ci; else npm install --no-audit --no-fund; fi
  1241:       - name: Build extension
  1242:         run: |
  1243:           cd extensions/vscode-npz
  1244:           npm run build
  1245:       - name: Package .vsix
  1246:         run: |
  1247:           cd extensions/vscode-npz
  1248:           npx @vscode/vsce package
  1249:       - name: Publish to Open VSX (runtime check)
  1250:         run: |
  1251:           cd extensions/vscode-npz
  1252:           if [ -z "${OPEN_VSX_TOKEN}" ]; then echo "OPEN_VSX_TOKEN not set - skipping Open VSX publish"; exit 0; fi
  1253:           npx ovsx publish --pat "$OPEN_VSX_TOKEN" || echo 'Open VSX publish failed'
  1254:       - name: Publish to VS Marketplace (runtime check)
  1255:         run: |
  1256:           cd extensions/vscode-npz
  1257:           if [ -z "${VSCE_TOKEN}" ]; then echo "VSCE_TOKEN not set - skipping VS Marketplace publish"; exit 0; fi
  1258:           npx @vscode/vsce publish --pat "$VSCE_TOKEN" || echo 'VSCE publish failed'
  1259:

  1262: ============================
  1263: FILE: .github\workflows\publish-vscode-extension.yml
  1264: ============================
  1265: ============================
  1266: name: Publish VS Code Extension
  1267: 
  1268: on:
  1269:   push:
  1270:     tags:
  1271:       - 'v*'
  1272: 
  1273: jobs:
  1274:   publish:
  1275:     runs-on: ubuntu-latest
  1276:     steps:
  1277:       - uses: actions/checkout@v4
  1278:       - name: Setup Node
  1279:         uses: actions/setup-node@v4
  1280:         with:
  1281:           node-version: '18'
  1282:       - name: Validate tokens
  1283:         run: |
  1284:           if [ -z "${{ secrets.NPM_TOKEN }}" ]; then echo "NPM_TOKEN is missing"; exit 1; fi
  1285:           if [ -z "${{ secrets.VSCE_TOKEN }}" ]; then echo "VSCE_TOKEN is missing"; exit 1; fi
  1286:           if [ -z "${{ secrets.GUMROAD_TOKEN }}" ]; then echo "Warning: GUMROAD_TOKEN is not set"; fi
  1287:       - name: Install dependencies
  1288:         run: |
  1289:           cd extensions/vscode-npz
  1290:           npm ci --no-audit --no-fund
  1291:       - name: Build extension
  1292:         run: |
  1293:           cd extensions/vscode-npz
  1294:           npm run build
  1295:       - name: Package and publish
  1296:         env:
  1297:           VSCE_TOKEN: ${{ secrets.VSCE_TOKEN }}
  1298:         run: |
  1299:           cd extensions/vscode-npz
  1300:           npx vsce publish --pat $VSCE_TOKEN || npx vsce package

  1324: ============================
  1325: FILE: .github\workflows\publish-vs-marketplace.yml
  1326: ============================
  1327: ============================
  1328: name: Publish to Visual Studio Marketplace
  1329: 
  1330: on:
  1331:   workflow_dispatch: {}
  1332:   release:
  1333:     types: [published]
  1334: 
  1335: jobs:
  1336:   publish-vs-marketplace:
  1337:     runs-on: ubuntu-latest
  1338:     env:
  1339:       AZURE_PAT: ${{ secrets.AZURE_PAT }}
  1340:       NODE_OPTIONS: "-r ${{ github.workspace }}/extensions/vscode-npz/src/polyfill-file.js"
  1341:     steps:
  1342:       - uses: actions/checkout@v4
  1343:         with:
  1344:           submodules: false
  1345:       - name: Setup Node
  1346:         uses: actions/setup-node@v4
  1347:         with:
  1348:           node-version: '20.18.1'
  1349:       - name: Validate AZURE_PAT (warning)
  1350:         run: |
  1351:           if [ -z "${AZURE_PAT}" ]; then echo "AZURE_PAT is missing - Marketplace publish will be skipped"; else echo "AZURE_PAT is set"; fi
  1352:       - name: Install deps and build extension
  1353:         run: |
  1354:           cd extensions/vscode-npz
  1355:           if [ -f package-lock.json ]; then npm ci; else npm install --no-audit --no-fund; fi
  1356:           npm run build || true
  1357:       - name: Package VSIX
  1358:         run: |
  1359:           cd extensions/vscode-npz
  1360:           npx @vscode/vsce package
  1361:       - name: Upload VSIX artifact
  1362:         uses: actions/upload-artifact@v3
  1363:         with:
  1364:           name: qflush-vsix
  1365:           path: extensions/vscode-npz/*.vsix
  1366:       - name: Publish to Visual Studio Marketplace (runtime)
  1367:         run: |
  1368:           cd extensions/vscode-npz
  1369:           if [ -z "${AZURE_PAT}" ]; then echo "AZURE_PAT missing - skip"; exit 0; fi
  1370:           npx @vscode/vsce publish --pat $AZURE_PAT || echo 'VSCE publish failed'
  1371: 
  1372: 
  1373: 
  1374: ============================
  1375: FILE: .github\workflows\run-bridge.yml
  1376: ============================
  1377: ============================

  1379: 
  1380: on:
  1381:   workflow_dispatch:
  1382: 
  1383: jobs:
  1384:   run-bridge:
  1385:     runs-on: ubuntu-latest
  1386:     steps:

  1388:         uses: actions/checkout@v4

  1391:         uses: actions/setup-node@v4
  1392:         with:
  1393:           node-version: '20'
  1394: 
  1395:       - name: Install deps
  1396:         run: npm install
  1397: 
  1398:       - name: Run bridge
  1399:         env:
  1400:           OPENAI_API_KEY: ${{ secrets.OPENAI_API_KEY }}
  1401:         run: |
  1402:           npm run qflush:bridge
  1403: 
  1404:       - name: Upload bridge-out
  1405:         uses: actions/upload-artifact@v4
  1406:         with:
  1407:           name: bridge-out
  1408:           path: qflush/bridge-out.md

  1412: ============================
  1413: FILE: .github\workflows\upload-audit-on-failure.yml
  1414: ============================
  1415: ============================
  1416: name: Upload audit log on failure
  1417: 
  1418: on:
  1419:   workflow_run:
  1420:     workflows: ["Publish to Open VSX", "CI", "Publish Package"]
  1421:     types:
  1422:       - completed
  1423: 
  1424: jobs:
  1425:   upload-audit:
  1426:     if: ${{ github.event.workflow_run.conclusion == 'failure' }}
  1427:     runs-on: ubuntu-latest
  1428:     steps:
  1429:       - name: Checkout
  1430:         uses: actions/checkout@v4
  1431:       - name: Upload license audit log
  1432:         uses: actions/upload-artifact@v4
  1433:         with:
  1434:           name: license-audit-log
  1435:           path: './.qflash/license-activations.log'
  1436:           if-no-files-found: 'ignore'
  1437: 
  1438: 
  1439: 
  1440: ============================
  1441: FILE: .github\workflows\verify-secrets.yml
  1442: ============================
  1443: ============================
  1444: name: Verify Action Secrets
  1445: 
  1446: on:
  1447:   workflow_dispatch: {}
  1448: 
  1449: jobs:
  1450:   verify-secrets:
  1451:     runs-on: ubuntu-latest
  1452:     steps:
  1453:       - name: Checkout
  1454:         uses: actions/checkout@v4
  1455: 
  1456:       - name: Setup Node
  1457:         uses: actions/setup-node@v4
  1458:         with:
  1459:           node-version: '18'
  1460: 
  1461:       - name: Verify AZURE_PAT
  1462:         env:
  1463:           AZURE_PAT: ${{ secrets.AZURE_PAT }}
  1464:         run: |
  1465:           if [ -z "$AZURE_PAT" ]; then echo "AZURE_PAT: MISSING"; exit 1; fi
  1466:           echo "AZURE_PAT: set"
  1467:           echo "Testing Azure DevOps connectivity..."
  1468:           curl -sS -u :"$AZURE_PAT" https://dev.azure.com/funesterie/_apis/connectionData -o /tmp/az.json || true
  1469:           if grep -q "authenticatedUser" /tmp/az.json; then echo "AZURE_PAT: OK"; else echo "AZURE_PAT: FAILED (check scopes)"; fi
  1470: 
  1471:       - name: Verify VSCE_TOKEN
  1472:         env:
  1473:           VSCE_TOKEN: ${{ secrets.VSCE_TOKEN }}
  1474:         run: |
  1475:           if [ -z "$VSCE_TOKEN" ]; then echo "VSCE_TOKEN: MISSING"; exit 1; fi
  1476:           echo "VSCE_TOKEN: set"
  1477:           # basic check: call Azure DevOps REST with token
  1478:           curl -sS -u :"$VSCE_TOKEN" https://dev.azure.com/funesterie/_apis/connectionData -o /tmp/vsce.json || true
  1479:           if grep -q "authenticatedUser" /tmp/vsce.json; then echo "VSCE_TOKEN: OK"; else echo "VSCE_TOKEN: FAILED (check token/scopes)"; fi
  1480: 
  1481:       - name: Verify NPM_TOKEN
  1482:         env:
  1483:           NPM_TOKEN: ${{ secrets.NPM_TOKEN }}
  1484:         run: |
  1485:           if [ -z "$NPM_TOKEN" ]; then echo "NPM_TOKEN: MISSING"; exit 1; fi
  1486:           echo "NPM_TOKEN: set"
  1487:           curl -sS -H "Authorization: Bearer $NPM_TOKEN" https://registry.npmjs.org/-/whoami -o /tmp/npm.json || true
  1488:           if grep -q "username" /tmp/npm.json; then echo "NPM_TOKEN: OK"; else echo "NPM_TOKEN: FAILED"; fi
  1489: 
  1490:       - name: Verify OPEN_VSX_TOKEN
  1491:         env:
  1492:           OPEN_VSX_TOKEN: ${{ secrets.OPEN_VSX_TOKEN }}
  1493:         run: |
  1494:           if [ -z "$OPEN_VSX_TOKEN" ]; then echo "OPEN_VSX_TOKEN: MISSING"; exit 1; fi
  1495:           echo "OPEN_VSX_TOKEN: set"
  1496:           npm i -g @open-vsx/ovsx@1.0.3 >/dev/null 2>&1 || true
  1497:           if npx @open-vsx/ovsx whoami --pat "$OPEN_VSX_TOKEN" >/tmp/ovsx.out 2>&1; then echo "OPEN_VSX_TOKEN: OK"; else echo "OPEN_VSX_TOKEN: FAILED"; cat /tmp/ovsx.out || true; fi
  1498: 
  1499:       - name: Summary
  1500:         run: |
  1501:           echo "Verification complete. Check above step outputs for each token status."
  1502: 
  1503: 
  1504:

 13924: FILE: azure-pipelines.yml
 13925: ============================
 13926: ============================
 13927: # Starter pipeline
 13928: # Start with a minimal pipeline that you can customize to build and deploy your code.
 13929: # Add steps that build, run tests, deploy, and more:
 13930: # https://aka.ms/yaml
 13931: 
 13932: trigger:
 13933: - master
 13934: 
 13935: pool:
 13936:   vmImage: ubuntu-latest
 13937: 
 13938: steps:
 13939: - script: echo Hello, world!
 13940:   displayName: 'Run a one-line script'
 13941: 
 13942: - script: |
 13943:     echo Add other tasks to build, test, and deploy your project.
 13944:     echo See https://aka.ms/yaml
 13945:   displayName: 'Run a multi-line script'
 13946: 
 13947: 
 13948: 
 13949: ============================
 13950: FILE: bin\npz.ps1
 13951: ============================
 13952: ============================
 13953: param([string[]]$Args)
 13954: # Lightweight PowerShell launcher to run the qflush NPZ daemon without npm
 13955: $here = Split-Path -Parent $MyInvocation.MyCommand.Definition
 13956: Set-Location (Join-Path $here '..')
 13957: $node = $env:NODEJS_PATH -or 'node'
 13958: $exe = Get-Command $node -ErrorAction SilentlyContinue
 13959: if (-not $exe) {
 13960:   Write-Error "node executable not found. Update PATH or set NODEJS_PATH env var to the node binary."
 13961:   exit 1
 13962: }
 13963: 
 13964: # helper to run command in cwd
 13965: function Run-InCwd([string]$cwd, [string[]]$cmd) {
 13966:   Push-Location $cwd
 13967:   try { & $cmd } finally { Pop-Location }
 13968: }
 13969: 
 13970: if ($Args.Count -gt 0 -and $Args[0] -eq 'run' -and $Args[1] -eq 'qflush') {
 13971:   $cli = Join-Path (Get-Location) 'dist/cli.js'
 13972:   if (Test-Path $cli) {
 13973:     & $node $cli 'run' 'qflush' @($Args[2..($Args.Count-1)])
 13974:     exit $LASTEXITCODE
 13975:   } else {
 13976:     $script = Join-Path (Get-Location) 'dist/daemon/qflushd.js'
 13977:     & $node $script @($Args[2..($Args.Count-1)])
 13978:     exit $LASTEXITCODE
 13979:   }
 13980: }
 13981: 
 13982: # proxy commands: ci, install, build, test, package
 13983: $cmd = $Args[0]
 13984: if ($cmd -in @('ci','install','build','test','package')) {
 13985:   $target = Get-Location
 13986:   $remaining = $Args[1..($Args.Count-1)]
 13987:   for ($i=0;$i -lt $remaining.Count; $i++) {
 13988:     if ($remaining[$i] -like '--cwd*') {
 13989:       if ($remaining[$i] -like '--cwd=*') { $target = $remaining[$i].Split('=')[1] } else { $target = $remaining[$i+1]; $i++ }
 13990:     }
 13991:   }
 13992:   switch ($cmd) {
 13993:     'ci' { Run-InCwd $target @('npm','ci') }
 13994:     'install' { Run-InCwd $target @('npm','install','--no-audit','--no-fund') }
 13995:     'build' { Run-InCwd $target @('npm','run','build') }
 13996:     'test' { Run-InCwd $target @('npm','test') }
 13997:     'package' { Run-InCwd $target @('npm','run','package') }
 13998:   }
 13999:   exit $LASTEXITCODE
 14000: }
 14001: 
 14002: # default: run daemon
 14003: $script = Join-Path (Get-Location) 'dist/daemon/qflushd.js'
 14004: if (-not (Test-Path $script)) { Write-Error "Daemon script not found: $script"; exit 2 }
 14005: & $node $script @Args
 14006: 
 14007:

 14009: ============================
 14010: FILE: CHANGELOG.md
 14011: ============================
 14012: ============================
 14013: # Changelog
 14014: 
 14015: ## v3.0.3 — Release (2025-11-18)
 14016: 
 14017: Highlights:
 14018: 
 14019: - Rome Tag v1: shared module `src/rome/rome-tag.ts` and canonical tag algorithm (type|path → FNV-1a 24-bit)
 14020: - Pourparler UI: compute & persist Rome tags from VS Code webview
 14021: - VS Code extension: persist canonical records to `.qflush/rome-index.json`
 14022: - Linter: `tools/rome-lint.js` enforces `// ROME-TAG: 0xXXXXXX` with `--fix`
 14023: - Daemon: `GET /npz/rome-index` endpoint and index loader cache
 14024: - Tests: reliable integration tests for checksums and rome-index
 14025: - Docs: Rome index diagram, README and publishing guidance
 14026: 
 14027: Checksums
 14028: 
 14029: - funeste38-qflush-3.0.3.tgz — SHA256: AAB940267E13C613EB30564613EE40FBA31729DCF2BE01AE897C03C33DD079F8
 14030: 
 14031: Migration notes:
 14032: - The Rome tag algorithm is stable (v1) and computed from `type|path`. Existing tags inserted by the linter or extension will match.
 14033: - To adopt in CI, add `npm run lint:rome` as a workflow step to ensure tags remain consistent.
 14034: 
 14035: Security & CI:
 14036: - The release pipeline can publish to npm using `NPM_TOKEN` stored in repository secrets.
 14037:

 14041: ============================
 14042: FILE: copilot-context.md
 14043: ============================
 14044: ============================
 14045: QFLUSH / FUNESTERIE — Copilot Context (short)
 14046: 
 14047: - Project: @funeste38/qflush
 14048: - Version: 3.1.2
 14049: - Purpose: Orchestrator for Funesterie (start/stop/purge/inspect) + daemon exposing NPZ & ROME endpoints
 14050: - Key commands: `qflush start|kill|purge|inspect|config|rome:links`
 14051: - Daemon endpoints: `/npz/checksum/*`, `/npz/rome-index`, `/npz/rome-links*`
 14052: - Dev: `npm run build`, `npm test` (vitest)
 14053: - Notes: Redis optional; disable in dev via `QFLUSH_ENABLE_REDIS=0`.
 14054: 
 14055:
