 14063: 
 14064: ============================
 14065: FILE: docs\admin-deploy.md
 14066: ============================
 14067: ============================
 14068: Admin deployment steps for setting up a self-hosted agent and publishing the VS Code extension.
 14069: 
 14070: Prerequisites:
 14071: - Windows machine with admin rights and PowerShell (run as Administrator).
 14072: - Personal Access Token (PAT) with Marketplace publish and Agent Pools permissions.
 14073: 
 14074: Steps (copy/paste in an Administrator PowerShell):
 14075: 
 14076: # 1) Configure execution policy for the session
 14077: Set-ExecutionPolicy -Scope Process -ExecutionPolicy RemoteSigned
 14078: 
 14079: # 2) Create agent directory and download agent package (replace URL if newer)
 14080: $installDir = 'C:\azagent'
 14081: New-Item -ItemType Directory -Force -Path $installDir
 14082: cd $installDir
 14083: $agentUrl = 'https://vstsagentpackage.azureedge.net/agent/2.220.1/vsts-agent-win-x64-2.220.1.zip'
 14084: Invoke-WebRequest -Uri $agentUrl -OutFile agent.zip
 14085: Expand-Archive agent.zip -DestinationPath . -Force
 14086: Remove-Item agent.zip -Force
 14087: 
 14088: # 3) Configure the agent (replace <PAT> and pool name)
 14089: $pat = Read-Host -AsSecureString "Enter PAT (will not echo)"
 14090: $plain = [System.Runtime.InteropServices.Marshal]::PtrToStringBSTR([System.Runtime.InteropServices.Marshal]::SecureStringToBSTR($pat))
 14091: .\config.cmd --unattended --url "https://dev.azure.com/funesterie" --auth pat --token $plain --pool "self-hosted" --agent "qflush-agent" --acceptTeeEula
 14092: 
 14093: # 4) Install as a service
 14094: .\svc.sh install
 14095: .\svc.sh start
 14096: 
 14097: # 5) Verify agent online in Azure DevOps
 14098: # Go to Project settings -> Pipelines -> Agent pools -> self-hosted
 14099: 
 14100: # 6) Package and publish the VSIX (optional manual publish)
 14101: cd 'D:\qflush\extensions\vscode-npz'
 14102: npm install --no-audit --no-fund
 14103: npm run build
 14104: npx @vscode/vsce package
 14105: # publish (runs locally, PAT prompted)
 14106: $npat = Read-Host -AsSecureString "Enter PAT for publish"
 14107: $plainPublish = [System.Runtime.InteropServices.Marshal]::PtrToStringBSTR([System.Runtime.InteropServices.Marshal]::SecureStringToBSTR($npat))
 14108: npx tfx extension publish --manifest-globs vss-extension.json --publisher funesterie --token $plainPublish --service-url https://marketplace.visualstudio.com/
 14109: 
 14110: Notes:
 14111: - Keep your PAT secret. Do not paste it in chats.
 14112: - If you prefer CI publishing, ensure repository secrets `AZURE_PAT` or `VSCE_TOKEN` are set in GitHub.
 14113: 
 14114: 
 14115: 
 14116: ============================
 14117: FILE: docs\azure-publish-secrets.md
 14118: ============================
 14119: ============================
 14120: Azure DevOps Marketplace publish requires:
 14121: 
 14122: - `PUBLISHER_ID` (pipeline variable) — your publisher ID in Visual Studio Marketplace (the publisher name), e.g. `funesterie`.
 14123: - `AZURE_DEVOPS_EXT_PAT` (pipeline secret) — a Personal Access Token with Marketplace publish scope.
 14124: - `AGENT_POOL` (pipeline variable) — name of a self-hosted agent pool to use for the publish job. If not set, the job will fail when there is no hosted parallelism.
 14125: 
 14126: How to create a self-hosted agent pool and agent
 14127: 
 14128: 1. In Azure DevOps project -> Project settings -> Pipelines -> Agent pools -> New agent pool. Name it e.g. `self-hosted`.
 14129: 2. Click the pool -> New agent -> choose the OS of the machine where you'll run the agent (Linux/Windows).
 14130: 3. Follow the provided instructions to download and configure the agent on your machine. Example for Linux:
 14131:    - mkdir myagent && cd myagent
 14132:    - curl -O https://vstsagentpackage.azureedge.net/agent/2.218.1/vsts-agent-linux-x64-2.218.1.tar.gz
 14133:    - tar zxvf vsts-agent-*.tar.gz
 14134:    - ./config.sh --unattended --url https://dev.azure.com/<your_org> --auth pat --token <YOUR_PAT> --pool self-hosted --agent qflush-agent
 14135:    - sudo ./svc.sh install && sudo ./svc.sh start
 14136: 4. In the pipeline variables (Pipeline -> Edit -> Variables) add `AGENT_POOL=self-hosted` and mark `AZURE_DEVOPS_EXT_PAT` as secret.
 14137: 
 14138: Once the self-hosted agent is online, rerun the pipeline and the publish job will use the specified pool and avoid the hosted parallelism error.
 14139: 
 14140: The pipeline `.azure-pipelines/workflows/azure-publish.yml` expects `extensions/vscode-npz/vss-extension.json` to exist and `tfx-cli` to create and publish the VSIX.
 14141: 
 14142: 
 14143: 
 14144: ============================
 14145: FILE: docs\copilot-bridge.md
 14146: ============================
 14147: ============================
 14148: # Copilot Bridge — Telemetry & Security
 14149: 
 14150: This document describes the Copilot Bridge transport options, HMAC signing, and secure setup.
 14151: 
 14152: ## Config
 14153: Place `.qflush/copilot.json` with the following minimal keys:
 14154: 
 14155: ```json
 14156: {
 14157:   "enabled": true,
 14158:   "transports": ["file","webhook"],
 14159:   "webhookUrl": "https://copilot.example/api/telemetry",
 14160:   "hmacSecretEnv": "COPILOT_HMAC",
 14161:   "filePath": ".qflush/telemetry.json"
 14162: }
 14163: ```
 14164: 
 14165: ## HMAC signing
 14166: - Set a secret value in repository/host environment variable referenced by `hmacSecretEnv` (e.g. `COPILOT_HMAC`).
 14167: - The bridge will sign webhook payloads with `X-Copilot-Signature: sha256=<hex>` header.
 14168: 
 14169: Example verification (Node):
 14170: 
 14171: ```js
 14172: const crypto = require('crypto');
 14173: function verify(payload, headerSig, secret) {
 14174:   const expected = crypto.createHmac('sha256', secret).update(payload).digest('hex');
 14175:   return headerSig === `sha256=${expected}`;
 14176: }
 14177: ```
 14178: 
 14179: ## Endpoint auth
 14180: - Protect `/copilot/*` and `/npz/engine/*` endpoints by setting `QFLUSH_TOKEN` env var on the daemon.
 14181: - Include header `x-qflush-token: <TOKEN>` when calling these endpoints (CLI or extension).
 14182: 
 14183: ## Telemetry retention
 14184: - Telemetry is written to `.qflush/telemetry.json` and persisted into `.qflush/qflush.db` if sqlite is available.
 14185: - Rotate telemetry files daily in your ops scripts or configure archival.
 14186: 
 14187: ## Privacy
 14188: - Telemetry redacts environment variables and long file contents >4KB.
 14189: - Only enable telemetry for trusted networks or when webhook targets are under your control.
 14190: 
 14191: 
 14192: 
 14193: ============================
 14194: FILE: docs\COPILOT-CLI.md
 14195: ============================
 14196: ============================
 14197: GitHub Copilot CLI - quick start
 14198: 
 14199: Official page:
 14200: https://github.com/github/copilot-cli
 14201: 
 14202: What this doc does
 14203: - Points you to the official Copilot CLI repository for latest installers and docs.
 14204: - Provides a few safe, minimal next steps you can run locally to try Copilot CLI.
 14205: 
 14206: Install (official instructions may change)
 14207: 1. Open the official repo releases page and follow the installer for your platform:
 14208:    - https://github.com/github/copilot-cli/releases
 14209: 
 14210: 2. After installing the `copilot` binary, verify installation:
 14211: 
 14212:    copilot --version
 14213:    copilot --help
 14214: 
 14215: Authenticate
 14216: - Follow the interactive login command the CLI provides. Example (the actual subcommand may vary by release):
 14217: 
 14218:   copilot auth login
 14219: 
 14220: - If that specific subcommand doesn't exist for your version, run `copilot --help` and follow the authentication instructions shown by the tool or the README on the official repo.
 14221: 
 14222: Basic usage
 14223: - Once installed and authenticated you can try the interactive mode or run code generation commands. Example (replace with the exact commands for your release):
 14224: 
 14225:   copilot chat
 14226:   copilot code "write a function that reverses a string in JavaScript"
 14227: 
 14228: Security notes
 14229: - The Copilot CLI will open a browser window for OAuth; do not paste tokens into code or the repo.
 14230: - Use the official releases page to download installers; verify checksums if provided.
 14231: 
 14232: Integration ideas for this repository
 14233: - Use Copilot CLI locally to help prototype small code snippets or tests.
 14234: - Do NOT add your copilot auth token to repository files. Store any tokens in your OS credential manager or GitHub secrets when used in CI.
 14235: 
 14236: If you want, I can:
 14237: - add a helper script to open the official Copilot CLI repo page from this workspace, or
 14238: - add a short sample command file that demonstrates a few copilot-cli commands (non-authenticated examples).
 14239: 
 14240: Refer to the official repo for up-to-date, authoritative installation and usage instructions.
 14241: 
 14242: 
 14243: 
 14244: ============================
 14245: FILE: docs\CORTEX.md
 14246: ============================
 14247: ============================
 14248: CORTEX PNG Bus
 14249: 
 14250: Overview
 14251: 
 14252: CORTEX replaces the HTTP daemon transport with a file-backed PNG bus using Brotli-compressed payloads encoded into RGBA pixels (OC8 checksum). This enables offline CI-friendly transport and avoids ports/middleware.
 14253: 
 14254: Usage
 14255: 
 14256: - Start bus in-process: `qflush daemon --no-detach --use-cortex` or set `QFLUSH_USE_CORTEX=1`
 14257: - Send command: `qflush cortex "npz/sleep"`
 14258: 
 14259: Implementation details
 14260: 
 14261: - Inbox: `.qflush/cortex/inbox/`
 14262: - Outbox: `.qflush/cortex/outbox/`
 14263: - Encoder: `src/cortex/encoder.ts` (Brotli compress, map bytes to pixels, add OC8)
 14264: - Decoder: `src/cortex/decoder.ts` (extract pixels -> bytes -> Brotli decompress -> JSON)
 14265: - Bus: `src/cortex/bus.ts` watches inbox and dispatches commands to `execCommand`
 14266: - CLI helpers: `src/cortex/cli.ts` to send and wait for responses
 14267: 
 14268: Security
 14269: 
 14270: - OC8 (1 byte of sha256) is used as a lightweight integrity tag. For stronger security add HMAC using a shared secret.
 14271: 
 14272: Notes
 14273: 
 14274: - This is an experimental prototype. It runs alongside the existing daemon. Use `--use-cortex` to enable.
 14275: 
 14276: 
 14277: 
 14278: ============================
 14279: FILE: docs\CORTEX-PACKET.md
 14280: ============================
 14281: ============================
 14282: # CORTEX PACKET SPEC — v0 (Funesterie RFC-08)
 14283: 
 14284: This document summarizes the Cortex Packet format used by QFLUSH.
 14285: 
 14286: Principles
 14287: - Cortex packets are binary containers transported inside PNG RGB images.
 14288: - Format: `HEADER(16 bytes) + PAYLOAD` where PAYLOAD = `Brotli(compressed rawData) + CRC8`.
 14289: - All integer fields are big-endian.
 14290: 
 14291: Header (16 bytes)
 14292: - Offset 0..3  : `uint32 BE` totalLength = payloadLength + 16
 14293: - Offset 4..7  : `uint32 BE` payloadLength (compressed + crc)
 14294: - Offset 8     : `uint8`    flags (version + hints)
 14295: - Offset 9..15 : `uint8[7]` reserved (0x00)
 14296: 
 14297: Payload
 14298: - payload = brotli.compress(rawData, quality=11) || crc_byte
 14299: - crc_byte = CRC-8 OC8(polynomial=0x07, init=0x00)
 14300: 
 14301: PNG encapsulation
 14302: - full = header(16) + payload
 14303: - Pad `full` with 0x00 until len(full) % 3 == 0
 14304: - Pack into RGB triplets -> pixels
 14305: - Recommended max width: 4096
 14306: - Save as PNG `mode=RGB`, low compression for speed
 14307: 
 14308: Decoding steps
 14309: 1. Read PNG(s) in order and concatenate `Image.open(part).convert('RGB').tobytes()`
 14310: 2. Extract header = bytes[0:16]
 14311: 3. Parse header: `>I I B 7s` -> totalLength, payloadLength, flags, reserved
 14312: 4. payload = bytes[16:16+payloadLength]
 14313: 5. compressed = payload[:-1], crc_byte = payload[-1]
 14314: 6. Verify CRC via CRC-8 OC8
 14315: 7. Decompress via Brotli -> rawData
 14316: 
 14317: Notes
 14318: - Support RGBA by stripping alpha.
 14319: - For multi-part flows, use lexicographic order: `<prefix>_part00.png`, `<prefix>_part01.png`, ...
 14320: - Be cautious executing decoded binaries; treat payloads as data.
 14321: 
 14322: This doc is generated from the Funesterie minimal RFC used in the repository.
 14323: 
 14324: 
 14325: 
 14326: ============================
 14327: FILE: docs\FCL_README.md
 14328: ============================
 14329: ============================
 14330: Funesterie Config Language (FCL) - README
 14331: 
 14332: FCL is a small, human-friendly format to declare projects, services and pipelines for Funesterie.
 14333: 
 14334: Sections:
 14335: - `@project` global metadata (name, owner, defaultEnv)
 14336: - `@env <name>` environment variables and URLs
 14337: - `@service <name>` description of a launchable service (path, start command, port)
 14338: - `@pipeline <name>` ordered list of services to run together
 14339: 
 14340: Examples:
 14341: 
 14342: @project
 14343:   name = my-stack
 14344:   owner = alice
 14345: 
 14346: @env dev
 14347:   url = http://localhost:3000
 14348: 
 14349: @service api
 14350:   type = node
 14351:   path = apps/api
 14352:   start = pnpm dev:api
 14353:   port = 3000
 14354: 
 14355: @pipeline dev-all
 14356:   steps = ["api"]
 14357: 
 14358: Usage:
 14359: - Place `funesterie.fcl` in the repo root.
 14360: - `qflush compose up` will read `funesterie.fcl` if present and bring up declared services.
 14361: 
 14362: This README is minimal and the spec is intentionally small to keep portability.
 14363: 
 14364: 
 14365: 
 14366: 
 14367: ============================
 14368: FILE: docs\FCL_SPEC.md
 14369: ============================
 14370: ============================
 14371: Funesterie Config Language (FCL) - Short Spec
 14372: 
 14373: 1. File name: `funesterie.fcl`
 14374: 2. Sections start with `@section` optionally followed by a name: `@service api` or `@env dev`.
 14375: 3. Key-value syntax: `key = value` (strings or numbers).
 14376: 4. Lists use `[]` with comma-separated values: `steps = ["api", "web"]`.
 14377: 5. Comments start with `#` or `//` and extend to end-of-line.
 14378: 6. Supported sections: `@project`, `@env`, `@service`, `@pipeline`.
 14379: 7. `@service <name>` supports keys: `type`, `path`, `start`, `port`, `env`, `token`.
 14380: 8. `@pipeline <name>` supports keys: `description`, `steps` (list of service names).
 14381: 9. Values can be quoted strings or unquoted tokens (no complex expressions).
 14382: 10. FCL is intentionally minimal and designed to be parsed without heavy dependencies.
 14383: 
 14384: Example:
 14385: 
 14386: @service api
 14387:   type = node
 14388:   path = apps/api
 14389:   start = npm run dev
 14390:   port = 3000
 14391: 
 14392: @pipeline dev-all
 14393:   steps = ["api", "web"]
 14394: 
 14395: 
 14396: 
 14397: ============================
 14398: FILE: docs\github-publish-secrets.md
 14399: ============================
 14400: ============================
 14401: GitHub Actions publish workflow requires these secrets in the repository settings:
 14402: 
 14403: - `VSCE_TOKEN` — Personal Access Token for Visual Studio Marketplace (used by `@vscode/vsce publish`) 
 14404: - `OPEN_VSX_TOKEN` — API token for Open VSX (optional)
 14405: 
 14406: To add secrets:
 14407: 1. Go to your GitHub repository → Settings → Secrets and variables → Actions → New repository secret.
 14408: 2. Add `VSCE_TOKEN` and `OPEN_VSX_TOKEN` values.
 14409: 
 14410: Trigger the workflow manually under Actions → Publish VS Code extension → Run workflow or push a tag `v*` to automatically run.
 14411: 
 14412: 
 14413: 
 14414: ============================
 14415: FILE: docs\HYBRID.md
 14416: ============================
 14417: ============================
 14418: # CORTEX HYBRID — Neural Bus for QFLUSH
 14419: 
 14420: CORTEX Hybrid is the migration plan and runtime mode that allows QFLUSH to run both the legacy HTTP daemon and the new PNG-based internal bus (CORTEX) side-by-side.
 14421: 
 14422: ## Modes
 14423: - `daemon` — legacy: start only the HTTP daemon (default legacy behavior).
 14424: - `cortex` — start only the PNG bus (CORTEX) and SPYDER watcher; HTTP daemon disabled.
 14425: - `hybrid` — start both CORTEX and the HTTP daemon (fallback). Default for smooth migration.
 14426: 
 14427: Control via environment variable:
 14428: 
 14429: ```bash
 14430: export QFLUSH_MODE=hybrid  # or daemon / cortex
 14431: ```
 14432: 
 14433: ## Files and folders
 14434: - `.qflush/cortex/inbox/` — incoming PNG commands
 14435: - `.qflush/cortex/outbox/` — outgoing PNG responses
 14436: - `src/cortex/` — encoder, decoder, bus and CLI helpers
 14437: - `src/core/qflush-mode.ts` — mode detection
 14438: - `src/core/start-system.ts` — starts CORTEX and/or daemon depending on mode
 14439: 
 14440: ## How it works (overview)
 14441: 1. CLI encodes a command into a compressed PNG (Brotli → RGB → OC8 checksum).
 14442: 2. CLI writes PNG into `.qflush/cortex/inbox`.
 14443: 3. SPYDER / CORTEX watcher decodes, executes the command, writes a response PNG to `.qflush/cortex/outbox`.
 14444: 4. CLI reads response PNG and cleans up.
 14445: 
 14446: ## Migration plan
 14447: Phase 1 — HYBRID (current)
 14448: - Both systems active. Tests run in `cortex` mode by default.
 14449: 
 14450: Phase 2 — migrate endpoints to use `cortexSend(...)` (NPZ/BAT/JOKER/Rome)
 14451: 
 14452: Phase 3 — decommission HTTP daemon and remove middleware, tokens, HMAC, ports
 14453: 
 14454: Phase 4 — CORTEX-only: PNG bus becomes the official transport
 14455: 
 14456: ## Running locally
 14457: - Build: `npm run build`
 14458: - Start hybrid (in-process): `qflush daemon --no-detach` (will start systems per `QFLUSH_MODE`)
 14459: - Start CORTEX only: `QFLUSH_MODE=cortex qflush daemon --no-detach`
 14460: - Send a command: `qflush cortex "npz/sleep"`
 14461: 
 14462: ## CI
 14463: `vitest.setup.js` forces `process.env.QFLUSH_MODE='cortex'` so tests run without starting the HTTP daemon.
 14464: 
 14465: ## Notes
 14466: - OC8 provides payload integrity. No HMAC is required.
 14467: - Replay protection is implemented in-memory in the decoder.
 14468: - This is an experimental prototype; improve persistence and durable replay protection (e.g. Redis) if needed.
 14469: 
 14470: 
 14471: 
 14472: ============================
 14473: FILE: docs\IDEAS.md
 14474: ============================
 14475: ============================
 14476: # IDEAS — Cortex / SPYDER Plan (from `ideas_packet.json`)
 14477: 
 14478: Source: `.qflush/incoming/json/ideas_packet.json` (id: `ideas-20251123-01`)
 14479: 
 14480: Summary
 14481: -------
 14482: This document converts the short ideas packet into a concrete implementation plan for QFLUSH / SPYDER / CORTEX. Each idea is mapped to a set of actions, files to touch, priority and testing suggestions. Implement in small, reviewable steps.
 14483: 
 14484: Table of Contents
 14485: -----------------
 14486: - CORTEX-DRIP
 14487: - NPZ-GRAPH
 14488: - OC8-LANG
 14489: - QUANTUM-ROUTER
 14490: - SPYDER-SOUND
 14491: - SAVE-STATE
 14492: - AUTO-PATCH
 14493: - SPYDER-VISION
 14494: - A11-KEY
 14495: - FUNESTERIE-MAGIE
 14496: - Cross-cutting: dedupe, archival, config, safety, tests
 14497: - MVP implementation ordering
 14498: 
 14499: 1) CORTEX-DRIP
 14500: --------------
 14501: Purpose
 14502: : lightweight event publishing for Cortex; a stream/log sink for events coming from router.
 14503: 
 14504: Concrete tasks
 14505: - Add `src/cortex/emit.ts` with `cortexEmit(eventName, payload)` that appends to `.qflush/cortex/drip.log` and optionally emits an EventEmitter event.
 14506: - Add router handler for `CORTEX-DRIP` that calls `cortexEmit`.
 14507: 
 14508: Files
 14509: - `src/cortex/emit.ts` (new)
 14510: - `src/cortex/router.ts` (update)
 14511: - `.qflush/cortex/drip.log`
 14512: 
 14513: Priority: medium
 14514: Tests: unit test router -> verifies `cortexEmit` writes log and event emitted.
 14515: 
 14516: 2) NPZ-GRAPH
 14517: -----------
 14518: Purpose
 14519: : ingest packets to turn into NPZ/graph artifacts or trigger Rome linker.
 14520: 
 14521: Concrete tasks
 14522: - Map `NPZ-GRAPH` packet to call `executeAction('npz.encode', { path })` or call `src/rome/linker` functions to recompute links and write `.qflush/rome-links.json`.
 14523: - Add router/apply handler `applyNpzGraph`.
 14524: 
 14525: Files
 14526: - `src/cortex/applyPacket.ts` (extend, already done in MVP)
 14527: - tests: simulate packet -> check `.qflush/npz` index or `.qflush/rome-links.json` updated.
 14528: 
 14529: Priority: high
 14530: 
 14531: 3) OC8-LANG
 14532: -----------
 14533: Purpose
 14534: : support OC8 canvas-language encoding (PNG with Brotli payload). Provide tools to encode/decode and docs.
 14535: 
 14536: Concrete tasks
 14537: - Ensure `src/cortex/pngCodec.ts` supports red-curtain (R-only) and general RGBA decoding (already implemented heuristics).
 14538: - Add `docs/CORTEX-PACKET.md` entry for OC8 and code snippets.
 14539: - Add CLI helpers in `tools/` for quick decoding/encoding.
 14540: 
 14541: Priority: medium
 14542: 
 14543: 4) QUANTUM-ROUTER
 14544: -----------------
 14545: Purpose
 14546: : dynamic, scored routing for Cortex packets. Allow routes to have `enabled`, `score`, and other metadata.
 14547: 
 14548: Concrete tasks
 14549: - Extend `.qflush/cortex.routes.json` format: map action → `{ enabled: boolean, score: number }`.
 14550: - Router consults this file and picks enabled handlers preferring higher score.
 14551: - Provide API to update a route's score via a packet `cortex:routes` or `router:update`.
 14552: 
 14553: Priority: medium
 14554: 
 14555: 5) SPYDER-SOUND
 14556: ---------------
 14557: Purpose
 14558: : audio/alert subsystem for SPYDER (log + optional webhook/emit).
 14559: 
 14560: Concrete tasks
 14561: - Add a router handler `SPYDER-SOUND` that logs the event and optionally posts to configured webhook.
 14562: 
 14563: Priority: low
 14564: 
 14565: 6) SAVE-STATE
 14566: -------------
 14567: Purpose
 14568: : snapshot the .qflush state and persist snapshots.
 14569: 
 14570: Concrete tasks
 14571: - Implement `SAVE-STATE` handler that writes `.qflush/state.json` and timestamped snapshots in `.qflush/snapshots/`.
 14572: - Allow optional payload to include additional state fields to merge.
 14573: 
 14574: Priority: high
 14575: 
 14576: 7) AUTO-PATCH
 14577: -------------
 14578: Purpose
 14579: : safe automated patching of `.qflush/config.json` or other config files via a packet.
 14580: 
 14581: Concrete tasks
 14582: - Implement `AUTO-PATCH` with dry-run mode and an approvals model.
 14583: - Dry-run writes to `.qflush/patches/dryrun-<id>.json` and logs a summary.
 14584: - Only when `approve: true` in payload or via CLI flag, apply the patch.
 14585: - Safety: whitelist keys allowed to be patched by packets; log and audit every patch.
 14586: 
 14587: Priority: high (security-sensitive)
 14588: 
 14589: 8) SPYDER-VISION
 14590: ----------------
 14591: Purpose
 14592: : image analysis pipeline for SPYDER that can process sent images and write outputs to graph.
 14593: 
 14594: Concrete tasks
 14595: - Provide `src/cortex/vision.ts` to accept PNGs, decode payload, and create a `.qflush/spyder-vision.json` or inject into Rome engine.
 14596: 
 14597: Priority: medium
 14598: 
 14599: 9) A11-KEY
 14600: ----------
 14601: Purpose
 14602: : persist A11 (local LLM service) credentials/config and optionally start the service.
 14603: 
 14604: Concrete tasks
 14605: - Handler writes to `.qflush/a11.config.json` (respect local secrets policy), optionally support encrypted storage.
 14606: - Optionally invoke `runA11('start')` when `start:true`.
 14607: 
 14608: Priority: medium
 14609: 
 14610: 10) FUNESTERIE-MAGIE
 14611: --------------------
 14612: Purpose
 14613: : a catch-all for creative/experimental packets: playground actions logged to `.qflush/magic.log`.
 14614: 
 14615: Concrete tasks
 14616: - Implement router handler that writes to `.qflush/magic.log` and stores a small record.
 14617: 
 14618: Priority: low
 14619: 
 14620: Cross-cutting features
 14621: ----------------------
 14622: - Deduplication: persist applied packet ids into `.qflush/spyder.cache.json` to avoid re-applying packets. (MVP implemented.)
 14623: - Archival: move processed incoming files into `.qflush/processed/<YYYY-MM>/` after successfully applying them. (MVP implemented.)
 14624: - Config-driven enablement: router must consult `.qflush/cortex.routes.json` to enable/disable route handlers at runtime.
 14625: - Safety: `AUTO-PATCH` must require explicit approval; `apply` should have `--approve` flag for CLI application on sensitive operations.
 14626: - Logging & audit: every applied packet should be recorded in `.qflush/cortex.last.json` and optionally appended to `.qflush/cortex.log`.
 14627: - Tests: add Vitest tests for `pngCodec` round-trip, `applyPacket` handlers, and router dispatch.
 14628: 
 14629: MVP Implementation Order (recommended)
 14630: -------------------------------------
 14631: 1. Deduplication & archival (already implemented).  
 14632: 2. SAVE-STATE (snapshot) and NPZ-GRAPH handler (already implemented).  
 14633: 3. AUTO-PATCH dry-run + apply (basic implementation implemented).  
 14634: 4. Make router consult cortex.routes.json and create route stubs for all names.  
 14635: 5. Add CORTEX-DRIP emitter and SPYDER-VISION minimal pipeline.  
 14636: 6. Add tests and docs.
 14637: 
 14638: How to proceed now
 14639: -------------------
 14640: - I can commit these changes incrementally and run tests.  
 14641: - Confirm whether to:
 14642:   - enable auto-apply of `cortex:routes` packets (current behavior writes `.qflush/cortex.routes.json`), and
 14643:   - move applied JSONs to a dated archive folder (already being created for applied packets).  
 14644: 
 14645: If you confirm, I will:
 14646: - create `docs/IDEAS.md` (this file), commit and push, and
 14647: - implement remaining router stubs and config-driven enablement + tests (start doing step 4 and 5).
 14648: 
 14649: ---
 14650:

 14654: 
 14655: ============================
 14656: FILE: docs\LICENSING.md
 14657: ============================
 14658: ============================
 14659: qflush Licensing (Gumroad)
 14660: 
 14661: Overview
 14662: 
 14663: This project integrates with Gumroad for license sales and verification. You can sell monthly or yearly licenses and validate keys using Gumroad's license API.
 14664: 
 14665: Recommended products on Gumroad:
 14666: - qflush Monthly - €5/month
 14667: - qflush Yearly - €39/year
 14668: 
 14669: Steps to configure
 14670: 
 14671: 1. Create products on Gumroad and enable license keys.
 14672: 2. Obtain your Gumroad account token (Personal access token) or use public product id for verification.
 14673: 3. Add token to your daemon or CI as environment variable `GUMROAD_TOKEN` (for server-side verify) or store securely in a file and set `GUMROAD_TOKEN_FILE`.
 14674: 
 14675: Daemon setup
 14676: 
 14677: - Run the daemon (recommended):
 14678:   - Set `GUMROAD_TOKEN` and optionally `GUMROAD_PRODUCT_YEARLY` / `GUMROAD_PRODUCT_MONTHLY`.
 14679:   - Start: `qflush daemon` or `node dist/daemon/qflushd.js`.
 14680:   - The daemon exposes endpoints:
 14681:     - `POST /license/activate` { key, product_id? }
 14682:     - `GET /license/status` -> { license, valid }
 14683: 
 14684: VS Code extension flow
 14685: 
 14686: - The VS Code extension UI includes a License section in the panel:
 14687:   - Paste the key in the License Key field and press Activate.
 14688:   - The extension will call the daemon `POST /license/activate` and display the result.
 14689:   - Use Show License Status to query `GET /license/status`.
 14690: 
 14691: CLI flow
 14692: 
 14693: - You can also activate using the CLI (suitable for headless installs):
 14694:   - `GUMROAD_TOKEN=... qflush license activate <key>`
 14695:   - `qflush license status` to view the saved local license
 14696: 
 14697: Audit and metrics
 14698: 
 14699: - The daemon writes a simple audit log by default to `./.qflush/license-activations.log` and exposes Prometheus counters:
 14700:   - `qflush_license_activation_total`
 14701:   - `qflush_license_activation_success_total`
 14702:   - `qflush_license_activation_failure_total`
 14703: 
 14704: Local license storage
 14705: 
 14706: The CLI/daemon stores a local license record in `./.qflush/license.json`. You can override with `GUMROAD_LICENSE_PATH`.
 14707: 
 14708: Security
 14709: 
 14710: Do not hardcode your Gumroad token in client-side code. Use the daemon to keep tokens private. The extension communicates with the local daemon only.
 14711: 
 14712: ---
 14713: 
 14714: qflush licensing (local Gumroad verification)
 14715: 
 14716: Overview
 14717: 
 14718: qflush uses Gumroad to sell license keys. The recommended flow is local verification: the user pastes a license key into the app/extension which calls the local daemon to verify the key directly with Gumroad.
 14719: 
 14720: Simple local flow (recommended)
 14721: 
 14722: 1. User purchases a license on Gumroad and receives a license key.
 14723: 2. User opens qflush (or the VS Code extension) and enters the license key.
 14724: 3. The client calls the local daemon endpoint `POST /license/activate` with `{ key }`.
 14725: 4. The daemon calls Gumroad's verify API, saves the license locally on success, and returns the result.
 14726: 
 14727: Why this is sufficient
 14728: 
 14729: - No public URL, tunnel, or webhook required for normal activation and verification.
 14730: - Works fully offline for the app running on the user's machine (daemon contacts Gumroad to verify).
 14731: 
 14732: Daemon configuration
 14733: 
 14734: - Set `GUMROAD_TOKEN` and product IDs in the daemon environment (or `GUMROAD_TOKEN_FILE` and `GUMROAD_LICENSE_PATH` if preferred).
 14735: - Default local license path: `./.qflush/license.json`.
 14736: 
 14737: Commands
 14738: 
 14739: - Activate (HTTP):
 14740:   POST http://localhost:4500/license/activate
 14741:   Body: { "key": "XXXX-XXXX-XXXX" }
 14742: 
 14743: - Status (HTTP):
 14744:   GET http://localhost:4500/license/status
 14745: 
 14746: Notes about webhooks
 14747: 
 14748: - Webhooks are optional. They are useful to automatically revoke licenses on refunds or subscription cancellations.
 14749: - This repository supports webhook handling, but it can be removed. The default simple flow does not require a webhook or public endpoint.
 14750: 
 14751: Security
 14752: 
 14753: - Do not commit `GUMROAD_TOKEN` to the repo. Use `.env`, environment variables, or a token file referenced by `GUMROAD_TOKEN_FILE`.
 14754: - Audit log (activations) is at `./.qflush/license-activations.log`.
 14755: 
 14756: If you want the fully automated server-driven flow (webhooks + auto-disable), use a public endpoint (ngrok, domain, or server) and enable webhooks in Gumroad. Otherwise the local flow above is safest and simplest.
 14757: 
 14758: 
 14759:

 14761: ============================
 14762: FILE: docs\publish-secrets.md
 14763: ============================
 14764: ============================
 14765: This repository's release publish workflow requires the following GitHub secrets to be set in the repository settings:
 14766: 
 14767: - `NPM_TOKEN` — npm auth token for publishing the package (if publishing to npm)
 14768: - `VSCE_TOKEN` — Personal access token for Visual Studio Marketplace (optional, if using `vsce`)
 14769: - `OPENVSX_TOKEN` — token for publishing to Open VSX (optional)
 14770: - `AZURE_CREDENTIALS` — Azure service principal JSON if publishing to Azure DevOps (optional)
 14771: 
 14772: To set a secret:
 14773: 1. Go to your GitHub repository -> Settings -> Secrets and variables -> Actions -> New repository secret.
 14774: 2. Enter the secret name and value and save.
 14775: 
 14776: The provided workflow `.github/workflows/publish-on-release.yml` will run on GitHub `release` published events and will build and publish to npm. If you want marketplace or Open VSX publish, adapt the workflow to call `vsce` or `open-vsx-publisher` with the appropriate tokens.

 14780: ============================
 14781: FILE: docs\qflush-analysis.md
 14782: ============================
 14783: ============================
 14784: QFLUSH — Repository Analysis
 14785: 
 14786: Status summary
 14787: - Repository: `D:\qflush` (branch `release/3.1.0`)
 14788: - Build: `npm run build` succeeded (TypeScript compile)
 14789: - Tests: `npm test` (vitest) succeeded (12 tests passed)
 14790: - Recent commit: `docs: add architecture,diagrams,copilot context` (created docs and copilot context)
 14791: 
 14792: Key components and locations
 14793: - CLI / entry
 14794:   - `src/index.ts` → CLI dispatcher, commands
 14795:   - `bin/qflush` / `qflush.cmd` wrappers
 14796: - Daemon
 14797:   - `src/daemon/qflushd.ts` → express daemon, NPZ endpoints, Rome linker, optional Redis
 14798:   - `dist/index.js` (built artifact)
 14799: - Supervisor / process manager
 14800:   - `@funeste38/bat` (dependency) used via `src/supervisor` and `tools` (BAT orchestrates processes)
 14801: - Rome (index + engine + linker)
 14802:   - `src/rome/*` → index-loader, engine, linker, events, executor
 14803:   - Output stored in `.qflush/rome-index.json` and `.qflush/rome-links.json`
 14804: - NPZ (router/admin)
 14805:   - `src/utils/npz-*` and endpoints in `src/daemon/qflushd.ts`
 14806:   - checksum endpoints: `/npz/checksum/*`
 14807: - Nezlephant / envaptex / freeland
 14808:   - External packages: `@funeste38/nezlephant`, `@funeste38/envaptex`, `@funeste38/freeland`
 14809: - Optional Redis
 14810:   - `ioredis` is a dependency; feature flag `QFLUSH_ENABLE_REDIS` controls usage in `src/daemon/qflushd.ts` (currently forced disabled in local edit)
 14811: - Mapping feature
 14812:   - `QFLUSH_ENABLE_MAPPING` and internal `FORCE_DISABLE_MAPPING` control automatic mapping; current build sets `FORCE_DISABLE_MAPPING = true` in `qflushd.ts` which disables mapping by default
 14813: 
 14814: Important files
 14815: - `package.json` — scripts, dependencies, bin `qflush`
 14816: - `src/daemon/qflushd.ts` — HTTP API, checksum store, rome endpoints, SSE
 14817: - `src/index.ts` — CLI entry
 14818: - `.qflush/*` — runtime state, logs, indexes, telemetry
 14819: - `tools/installer.js` and `installers/` — local install and artifacts
 14820: 
 14821: Observations & recommendations
 14822: 1. Optional services (Redis, mapping) are feature-flagged. Ensure CI and README document how to enable them. Local dev should keep Redis disabled.
 14823: 2. Many large untracked or workspace files exist (VS snapshots, `.qflush` runtime data). Add or verify `.gitignore` to avoid committing volatile files.
 14824: 3. Tests pass locally — good baseline for further changes. Run tests after any change to `src/rome/*` or `src/daemon/*`.
 14825: 4. Consider centralizing feature flags and default config in a single module (e.g., `src/config.ts`) to avoid duplicated checks in code.
 14826: 5. Keep `ioredis` optional at runtime by lazy-require and clear logging when disabled (current approach acceptable).
 14827: 
 14828: Next steps I can take
 14829: - Generate a concise module dependency map (visual or textual).
 14830: - Create a README section documenting feature flags and local dev setup.
 14831: - Search for TODOs and FIXME comments to prioritize tech debt.
 14832:

 14836: ============================
 14837: FILE: docs\qflush-plan.md
 14838: ============================
 14839: ============================
 14840: # QFLUSH — PLAN CONCRET À EXÉCUTER
 14841: 
 14842: Objectif : stabiliser QFLUSH v3.1, intégrer le linker ROME, préparer le terrain A11/SPYDER.
 14843: 
 14844: Étape 1 — Stabilisation build / TS
 14845: - Corriger imports cassés : ./chain/smartChain, ./daemon/qflushd(.js), ./commands/doctor, ./commands/compose, ./cli/help, ../utils/fetch.
 14846: - Remplacer usages de `node` / `env` nus par process.env (ex: process.env.NODE_ENV).
 14847: - S'assurer que tous les shebangs `#!/usr/bin/env node` sont en ligne 1 des fichiers .ts concernés.
 14848: - Supprimer ou corriger les `declare module './...'` en noms non-relatifs (ex: 'src/rome/storage').
 14849: - Laisser `// @ts-nocheck` sur les polyfills JS et exclure extensions/**/out/** dans tsconfig.
 14850: - Vérifier que `npx tsc -p . --noEmit` ne renvoie aucune erreur.
 14851: 
 14852: Étape 2 — Intégration du linker ROME
 14853: - Créer src/rome/linker.ts avec computeRomeLinks(...) et writeRomeLinks(...), utilisant loadRomeIndexFromDisk() et détectant les tokens [[token]] dans src/**.
 14854: - Ajouter une commande src/commands/rome-links.ts qui appelle computeRomeLinks + writeRomeLinks et log le nombre de refs.
 14855: - Brancher rome-links dans le router CLI (qflush rome:links).
 14856: - Optionnel : sur onRomeIndexUpdated, relancer computeRomeLinks pour rafraîchir .qflush/rome-links.json.
 14857: 
 14858: Étape 3 — Pré-release 3.1
 14859: - Mettre à jour README pour décrire QFLUSH v3.x (orchestrateur, daemon, NPZ, checksum, Copilot bridge, Rome linker).
 14860: - Vérifier package.json (name, version, bin.qflush).
 14861: - Générer un .tgz, tester une installation globale locale, puis tagguer v3.1.0.
 14862: 
 14863: Étape 4 — Hooks pour A11 / SPYDER (préparation)
 14864: - Ajouter des clés A11 / SPYDER dans SERVICE_MAP (même si les modules ne sont pas encore publiés).
 14865: - Ajouter des commandes placeholders qflush a11:status et qflush spyder:status qui renvoient un message "coming soon".
 14866: - Documenter dans README la roadmap A11 (interface IA) et SPYDER (internet interne).
 14867: 
 14868: // Fin du plan QFLUSH.
 14869: 
 14870: 
 14871: 
 14872: ============================
 14873: FILE: docs\quick-start.md
 14874: ============================
 14875: ============================
 14876: Quick start checklist — QFLUSH (local, NO-REDIS / NO-COPILOT)
 14877: 
 14878: This file contains a short checklist and copy-paste commands to get QFLUSH running locally in the "NO-REDIS / NO-COPILOT" safe mode used by this repo.
 14879: 
 14880: 1) Prepare environment
 14881: - Copy example env and edit if needed:
 14882:   - PowerShell:
 14883:     Copy-Item .env.example .env; notepad .env
 14884:   - Bash:
 14885:     cp .env.example .env && ${EDITOR:-nano} .env
 14886: 
 14887: - Confirm the following variables are set to disable external services (recommended for dev):
 14888:   QFLUSH_DISABLE_REDIS=1
 14889:   QFLUSH_DISABLE_COPILOT=1
 14890:   QFLUSH_TELEMETRY=0
 14891: 
 14892: 2) Install dependencies
 14893: - npm ci --no-audit --no-fund
 14894: 
 14895: 3) Build
 14896: - npm run build
 14897: 
 14898: 4) Run tests
 14899: - npm test
 14900: 
 14901: 5) Start daemon (detached recommended)
 14902: - Using CLI (detached by default):
 14903:   qflush daemon
 14904: - Using safe-run (detached):
 14905:   qflush safe-run --detach daemon
 14906: - Using the detach script via npm:
 14907:   npm run detach -- node dist/index.js daemon --detached
 14908: 
 14909: 6) Quick API checks (after daemon started)
 14910: - Store checksum:
 14911:   curl -sS -X POST http://localhost:4500/npz/checksum/store -H 'Content-Type: application/json' -d '{"id":"t1","checksum":"abc"}'
 14912: - Verify checksum:
 14913:   curl -sS -X POST http://localhost:4500/npz/checksum/verify -H 'Content-Type: application/json' -d '{"id":"t1","checksum":"abc"}'
 14914: - List checksums:
 14915:   curl -sS http://localhost:4500/npz/checksum/list
 14916: 
 14917: 7) Useful scripts
 14918: - Detach helper (Node): ./scripts/detach.js
 14919: - POSIX watchdog: ./scripts/run-with-timeout.sh
 14920: - PowerShell watchdog: ./scripts/run-with-timeout.ps1
 14921: 
 14922: 8) Re-enable Redis / Copilot (production)
 14923: - To re-enable Redis, set REDIS_URL and remove/clear QFLUSH_DISABLE_REDIS.
 14924: - To re-enable Copilot, provide `.qflush/copilot.json` with `enabled:true` and set HMAC/webhook envs.
 14925: 
 14926: 9) Cleanup helpers
 14927: - If you need to force-reset the repo's runtime state:
 14928:   - qflush purge
 14929:   - npm run run:timeout -- 5 node dist/index.js purge
 14930: 
 14931: If you want, I can add these entries to `README.md` too.  
 14932: 
 14933: 
 14934: 
 14935: ============================
 14936: FILE: docs\sysinternals.md
 14937: ============================
 14938: ============================
 14939: # Utilitaires Sysinternals (PsSuspend) pour QFLUSH
 14940: 
 14941: Ce document explique comment installer PsSuspend (Sysinternals) et comment l'utiliser de façon sécurisée avec QFLUSH. Ne commite jamais de binaires dans le dépôt — préfère installer localement et référencer le chemin via une variable d'environnement.
 14942: 
 14943: ## Pourquoi PsSuspend ?
 14944: - Permet de *suspendre* un processus sous Windows sans le tuer (utile pour "freezeAll").
 14945: - QFLUSH essaie d'utiliser PsSuspend si disponible, sinon retombe sur `taskkill` (terminaison forcée).
 14946: 
 14947: ## Installation recommandée
 14948: 1. Télécharge la suite Sysinternals depuis Microsoft :
 14949:    - https://learn.microsoft.com/sysinternals/downloads/sysinternals-suite
 14950: 2. Extrait `PsSuspend.exe` dans un dossier sur ta machine, par exemple `C:\tools\sysinternals`.
 14951: 3. (Optionnel) Ajoute ce dossier à ton `PATH`, ou définis la variable d'environnement spécifique :
 14952:    - PowerShell : `$env:QFLUSH_PSSUSPEND_PATH = 'C:\tools\sysinternals\PsSuspend.exe'`
 14953:    - Bash : `export QFLUSH_PSSUSPEND_PATH='/c/tools/sysinternals/PsSuspend.exe'`
 14954: 
 14955: ## Utilisation avec QFLUSH
 14956: - Si `QFLUSH_PSSUSPEND_PATH` est défini, QFLUSH l'utilisera pour suspendre/reprendre les processus.
 14957: - Sinon QFLUSH cherchera `pssuspend` dans le `PATH`.
 14958: - Si PsSuspend est indisponible, QFLUSH utilise `taskkill /F` en dernier recours.
 14959: 
 14960: ## Commandes de test (PowerShell)
 14961: - Lancer Notepad : `Start-Process notepad`
 14962: - Trouver son PID : `Get-Process notepad`
 14963: - Suspendre manuellement (si PsSuspend installé) : `& 'C:\tools\sysinternals\PsSuspend.exe' <PID>`
 14964: - Reprendre : `& 'C:\tools\sysinternals\PsSuspend.exe' -r <PID>`
 14965: 
 14966: ## Intégration dans QFLUSH
 14967: - QFLUSH lit `QFLUSH_PSSUSPEND_PATH` si défini ; sinon `pssuspend` depuis le `PATH` est essayé.
 14968: - Le code de `freezeAll` fait une tentative non bloquante et tombe sur `taskkill` si nécessaire.
 14969: 
 14970: ## Sécurité et bonnes pratiques
 14971: - Ne commite jamais `PsSuspend.exe` ni d'autres binaires Sysinternals dans le dépôt.
 14972: - Place les utilitaires dans un répertoire système (`C:\tools\sysinternals`) et documente leur chemin.
 14973: - Exécute les commandes en tant qu'administrateur si tu as besoin de suspendre/reprendre des processus systèmes.
 14974: 
 14975: ## Si besoin d'aide
 14976: Si tu veux, je peux :
 14977: - ajouter un script de vérification qui signale si `QFLUSH_PSSUSPEND_PATH` est valide, ou
 14978: - ajouter un exemple de configuration dans `README.md`.
 14979: 
 14980: 
 14981: 
 14982: 
 14983: ============================
 14984: FILE: dump-all-and-rgba.ps1
 14985: ============================
 14986: ============================
 14987: param(
 14988:   [string]$Root = 'D:\qflush',
 14989:   [string]$OutText = 'D:\qflush-code-dump.txt',
 14990:   [string]$OutRaw = 'D:\qflush-code-dump.raw',
 14991:   [string]$OutPng = 'D:\qflush-code-dump.png',
 14992:   [int]$ImageWidth = 1024
 14993: )
 14994: 
 14995: Write-Host "=== QFLUSH DUMP START ==="
 14996: Write-Host "Root          : $Root"
 14997: Write-Host "OutText       : $OutText"
 14998: Write-Host "OutRaw        : $OutRaw"
 14999: Write-Host "OutPng        : $OutPng"
 15000: Write-Host "ImageWidth    : $ImageWidth"
 15001: Write-Host ""
 15002: 
 15003: # 1) Validation du root
 15004: if (-not (Test-Path -Path $Root)) {
 15005:   Write-Error "Root path '$Root' not found."
 15006:   exit 2
 15007: }
 15008: 
 15009: # 2) Nettoyage des sorties précédentes
 15010: foreach ($p in @($OutText, $OutRaw, $OutPng)) {
 15011:   if (Test-Path $p) {
 15012:     Write-Host "Removing previous output: $p"
 15013:     Remove-Item $p -Force -ErrorAction SilentlyContinue
 15014:   }
 15015: }
 15016: 
 15017: # 3) Préparation writer UTF-8 sans BOM
 15018: $utf8NoBOM = New-Object System.Text.UTF8Encoding($false)
 15019: $fs = [System.IO.File]::Open(
 15020:   $OutText,
 15021:   [System.IO.FileMode]::Create,
 15022:   [System.IO.FileAccess]::Write,
 15023:   [System.IO.FileShare]::Read
 15024: )
 15025: $sw = New-Object System.IO.StreamWriter($fs, $utf8NoBOM)
 15026: 
 15027: # Extensions considérées comme "texte"
 15028: $textExtensions = @(
 15029:   '.ts', '.tsx', '.js', '.cjs', '.mjs',
 15030:   '.json', '.yml', '.yaml', '.md',
 15031:   '.ps1', '.psm1', '.psd1',
 15032:   '.xml', '.txt', '.sh', '.bat',
 15033:   '.c', '.cpp', '.h', '.hpp'
 15034: )
 15035: 
 15036: # Dossiers à exclure
 15037: $excludePatterns = @(
 15038:   '\node_modules\',
 15039:   '\dist\',
 15040:   '\out\',
 15041:   '\.git\',
 15042:   '\coverage\',
 15043:   '\.vscode\',
 15044:   '\.idea\',
 15045:   '\.vs\',
 15046:   '\.qflush\cache\'
 15047: )
 15048: 
 15049: function Test-ExcludedPath([string]$fullPath) {
 15050:   foreach ($pat in $excludePatterns) {
 15051:     if ($fullPath -like "*$pat*") { return $true }
 15052:   }
 15053:   return $false
 15054: }
 15055: 
 15056: try {
 15057:   # En-tête du dump
 15058:   $now = (Get-Date).ToString("o")
 15059:   $sw.WriteLine("qflush code dump generated: $now")
 15060:   $sw.WriteLine()
 15061: 
 15062:   Write-Host "Scanning files under: $Root"
 15063:   $files = Get-ChildItem -Path $Root -Recurse -File -Force -ErrorAction SilentlyContinue |
 15064:     Where-Object { -not (Test-ExcludedPath $_.FullName) } |
 15065:     Sort-Object FullName
 15066: 
 15067:   Write-Host ("Found {0} files after exclusions." -f $files.Count)
 15068:   Write-Host ""
 15069: 
 15070:   foreach ($f in $files) {
 15071:     try {
 15072:       # Chemin relatif
 15073:       $rel = $f.FullName
 15074:       if ($rel.StartsWith($Root, [System.StringComparison]::InvariantCultureIgnoreCase)) {
 15075:         $rel = $rel.Substring($Root.Length).TrimStart('\','/')
 15076:       }
 15077: 
 15078:       Write-Host "Dumping file: $rel"
 15079: 
 15080:       $sep = '=' * 28
 15081:       $sw.WriteLine($sep)
 15082:       $sw.WriteLine("FILE: $rel")
 15083:       $sw.WriteLine($sep)
 15084:       $sw.WriteLine($sep)
 15085: 
 15086:       $ext = [System.IO.Path]::GetExtension($f.FullName).ToLowerInvariant()
 15087:       $isTextExt = $textExtensions -contains $ext
 15088: 
 15089:       if ($isTextExt) {
 15090:         # Lecture texte
 15091:         $raw = $null
 15092:         try {
 15093:           $raw = Get-Content -LiteralPath $f.FullName -Raw -Encoding UTF8 -ErrorAction Stop
 15094:         } catch {
 15095:           $raw = $null
 15096:         }
 15097: 
 15098:         if ($null -ne $raw) {
 15099:           # Découper en lignes, écrire sans utiliser -f sur le contenu
 15100:           $lines = $raw -split "`r?`n"
 15101:           $ln = 1
 15102:           foreach ($line in $lines) {
 15103:             $prefix = "{0,6}: " -f $ln
 15104:             $sw.WriteLine($prefix + $line)
 15105:             $ln++
 15106:           }
 15107:         } else {
 15108:           # Fallback binaire
 15109:           $bytes = [System.IO.File]::ReadAllBytes($f.FullName)
 15110:           $sw.WriteLine("[BINARY CONTENT - {0} bytes] (text read failed)" -f $bytes.Length)
 15111:           for ($i = 0; $i -lt $bytes.Length; $i += 16) {
 15112:             $end = [Math]::Min($i + 15, $bytes.Length - 1)
 15113:             $slice = $bytes[$i..$end]
 15114:             $hex = ($slice | ForEach-Object { $_.ToString('x2') }) -join ' '
 15115:             $sw.WriteLine('{0,6}: {1}' -f (($i / 16) + 1), $hex)
 15116:           }
 15117:         }
 15118:       } else {
 15119:         # Lecture binaire pure
 15120:         $bytes = [System.IO.File]::ReadAllBytes($f.FullName)
 15121:         $sw.WriteLine("[BINARY CONTENT - {0} bytes]" -f $bytes.Length)
 15122:         for ($i = 0; $i -lt $bytes.Length; $i += 16) {
 15123:           $end = [Math]::Min($i + 15, $bytes.Length - 1)
 15124:           $slice = $bytes[$i..$end]
 15125:           $hex = ($slice | ForEach-Object { $_.ToString('x2') }) -join ' '
 15126:           $sw.WriteLine('{0,6}: {1}' -f (($i / 16) + 1), $hex)
 15127:         }
 15128:       }
 15129: 
 15130:       $sw.WriteLine()
 15131:       $sw.WriteLine()
 15132:       $sw.Flush()
 15133:     } catch {
 15134:       # IMPORTANT : ne pas utiliser -f avec le message d'exception
 15135:       $sw.WriteLine("[ERROR] Failed to include file: " + $f.FullName)
 15136:       $sw.WriteLine("Reason: " + $_.Exception.Message)
 15137:       $sw.WriteLine()
 15138:       $sw.WriteLine()
 15139:       $sw.Flush()
 15140: 
 15141:       Write-Warning "Failed to dump file: $($f.FullName) -> $($_.Exception.Message)"
 15142:     }
 15143:   }
 15144: 
 15145:   $completed = (Get-Date -Format o)
 15146:   $sw.WriteLine("Completed: $completed")
 15147:   $sw.Flush()
 15148:   Write-Host "Text dump completed at: $completed"
 15149: }
 15150: finally {
 15151:   $sw.Close()
 15152:   $fs.Close()
 15153: }
 15154: 
 15155: # 5) Conversion du texte → RAW RGBA → PNG (ImageMagick)
 15156: Write-Host ""
 15157: Write-Host "=== Building RAW / PNG from text dump ==="
 15158: 
 15159: try {
 15160:   if (-not (Test-Path $OutText)) {
 15161:     Write-Warning "Text dump not found at $OutText, aborting RAW/PNG generation."
 15162:     return
 15163:   }
 15164: 
 15165:   $textBytes = [System.IO.File]::ReadAllBytes($OutText)
 15166:   $len = $textBytes.Length
 15167:   Write-Host ("Text dump size: {0} bytes" -f $len)
 15168: 
 15169:   # Padding à multiple de 4 (RGBA)
 15170:   $pad = (4 - ($len % 4)) % 4
 15171:   if ($pad -gt 0) {
 15172:     Write-Host ("Applying padding of {0} bytes to align to RGBA." -f $pad)
 15173:     $new = New-Object byte[] ($len + $pad)
 15174:     [System.Array]::Copy($textBytes, 0, $new, 0, $len)
 15175:     $textBytes = $new
 15176:     $len = $textBytes.Length
 15177:   }
 15178: 
 15179:   [System.IO.File]::WriteAllBytes($OutRaw, $textBytes)
 15180:   Write-Host "RAW RGBA bytes written to: $OutRaw (length=${len})"
 15181: 
 15182:   $pixels = [int]($len / 4)
 15183:   $width = [int]$ImageWidth
 15184:   if ($width -le 0) { $width = 1024 }
 15185:   $height = [int][Math]::Ceiling($pixels / $width)
 15186: 
 15187:   Write-Host ("Image logical size: {0}x{1} pixels (pixels={2})" -f $width, $height, $pixels)
 15188: 
 15189:   # Ensure raw length matches width*height*4 by padding with zeros if necessary
 15190:   $requiredBytes = $width * $height * 4
 15191:   if ($len -lt $requiredBytes) {
 15192:     $padNeeded = $requiredBytes - $len
 15193:     Write-Host ("Padding raw file to {0} bytes (adding {1} zeros) to match image size" -f $requiredBytes, $padNeeded)
 15194:     $newArr = New-Object byte[] $requiredBytes
 15195:     [System.Array]::Copy($textBytes, 0, $newArr, 0, $len)
 15196:     [System.IO.File]::WriteAllBytes($OutRaw, $newArr)
 15197:     $len = $newArr.Length
 15198:   }
 15199: 
 15200:   # Detect ImageMagick executable reliably
 15201:   $magickExe = $null
 15202:   try { $magickExe = (Get-Command magick -ErrorAction SilentlyContinue).Source } catch {}
 15203:   if (-not $magickExe) {
 15204:     try { $magickExe = (Get-Command convert -ErrorAction SilentlyContinue).Source } catch {}
 15205:   }
 15206: 
 15207:   $useMagick = $false
 15208:   $useConvert = $false
 15209:   if ($magickExe) {
 15210:     $exeName = (Split-Path $magickExe -Leaf).ToLower()
 15211:     if ($exeName -eq 'magick' -or $exeName -eq 'magick.exe') {
 15212:       $useMagick = $true
 15213:     } else {
 15214:       # candidate 'convert' found - ensure it's ImageMagick, not Windows convert
 15215:       try {
 15216:         $ver = & $magickExe -version 2>&1
 15217:         if ($ver -and ($ver -join "`n") -match 'ImageMagick') { $useConvert = $true }
 15218:       } catch {
 15219:         $useConvert = $false
 15220:       }
 15221:     }
 15222:   }
 15223: 
 15224:   if ($useMagick -or $useConvert) {
 15225:     if ($useMagick) {
 15226:       Write-Host "Using ImageMagick (magick) at: $magickExe"
 15227:       # magick v7: magick -size WxH -depth 8 rgba:in.raw out.png
 15228:       & $magickExe '-size' "${width}x${height}" '-depth' '8' ('rgba:' + $OutRaw) $OutPng
 15229:     } else {
 15230:       Write-Host "Using ImageMagick (convert) at: $magickExe"
 15231:       & $magickExe '-size' "${width}x${height}" '-depth' '8' ('rgba:' + $OutRaw) $OutPng
 15232:     }
 15233: 
 15234:     if (Test-Path $OutPng) {
 15235:       Write-Host "✅ RGBA image written to: $OutPng (size=${width}x${height})"
 15236:     } else {
 15237:       Write-Warning "ImageMagick executed but $OutPng not found. Check logs above."
 15238:     }
 15239:   } else {
 15240:     Write-Warning "ImageMagick not found in PATH or 'convert' is the Windows tool. Skipping PNG generation."
 15241:     Write-Host "RAW RGBA written to $OutRaw."
 15242:     Write-Host "Install ImageMagick and run manually:"
 15243:     Write-Host "  magick -size ${width}x${height} -depth 8 rgba:`"$OutRaw`" `"$OutPng`""
 15244:   }
 15245: } catch {
 15246:   Write-Warning "Failed to create RGBA raw/png: $($_.Exception.Message)"
 15247: }
 15248: 
 15249: Write-Host "Text dump written to: $OutText"
 15250: Write-Host "=== QFLUSH DUMP END ==="
 15251: 
 15252: 
 15253: 
 15254: ============================
 15255: FILE: dump-qflush-code.ps1
 15256: ============================
 15257: ============================
 15258: $OutFile = Join-Path (Get-Location) 'qflush-code-dump.txt'
 15259: 
 15260: # Overwrite if exists
 15261: if (Test-Path $OutFile) {
 15262:     Remove-Item $OutFile -Force
 15263: }
 15264: 
 15265: # Extensions to include (lowercase)
 15266: $includeExts = @('.ts', '.tsx', '.js', '.cjs', '.mjs', '.json', '.yml', '.yaml', '.md', '.ps1')
 15267: 
 15268: # Directory name segments to exclude
 15269: $excludeDirs = @('node_modules','dist','out','.git','.vscode','coverage')
 15270: 
 15271: # Special exclude path fragments
 15272: $excludePathFragments = @('\.qflush\\cache','/.qflush/cache')
 15273: 
 15274: # Separator lines
 15275: $sep = '=' * 28
 15276: 
 15277: # Helper: check if path contains any excluded directory segment
 15278: function IsPathExcluded($fullPath) {
 15279:     $norm = $fullPath -replace '/', '\\'  # normalize to backslashes
 15280:     # quick fragment check
 15281:     foreach ($frag in $excludePathFragments) {
 15282:         $fragNorm = $frag -replace '/', '\\'
 15283:         if ($norm -like "*$fragNorm*") { return $true }
 15284:     }
 15285:     # split into segments and check
 15286:     $segments = $norm -split '\\+' | Where-Object { $_ -ne '' }
 15287:     foreach ($seg in $segments) {
 15288:         foreach ($d in $excludeDirs) {
 15289:             if ($seg -ieq $d) { return $true }
 15290:         }
 15291:     }
 15292:     return $false
 15293: }
 15294: 
 15295: # Collect files
 15296: $allFiles = Get-ChildItem -Recurse -File -Force -ErrorAction SilentlyContinue | Where-Object {
 15297:     try {
 15298:         # Compatible with Windows PowerShell (no '??' operator)
 15299:         $ext = [IO.Path]::GetExtension($_.FullName)
 15300:         if ($null -eq $ext) { $ext = '' }
 15301:         $ext = $ext.ToLower()
 15302:         if ($ext -eq '') { return $false }
 15303:         if ($ext -eq '.log') { return $false }
 15304:         if (-not ($includeExts -contains $ext)) { return $false }
 15305:         if (IsPathExcluded($_.FullName)) { return $false }
 15306:         return $true
 15307:     } catch {
 15308:         return $false
 15309:     }
 15310: }
 15311: 
 15312: # Sort for deterministic order
 15313: $files = $allFiles | Sort-Object FullName
 15314: 
 15315: # Write header
 15316: "qflush code dump generated: $(Get-Date -Format o)" | Out-File -FilePath $OutFile -Encoding utf8
 15317: "" | Out-File -FilePath $OutFile -Encoding utf8 -Append
 15318: 
 15319: $cwd = (Get-Location).ProviderPath
 15320: 
 15321: foreach ($f in $files) {
 15322:     try {
 15323:         # compute relative path
 15324:         $full = $f.FullName
 15325:         if ($full.StartsWith($cwd, [System.StringComparison]::InvariantCultureIgnoreCase)) {
 15326:             $rel = $full.Substring($cwd.Length)
 15327:             # strip leading slashes/backslashes robustly
 15328:             $rel = $rel -replace '^[\\/]+',''
 15329:         } else {
 15330:             $rel = $full
 15331:         }
 15332: 
 15333:         # write separators and file header
 15334:         $header1 = $sep
 15335:         $header2 = "FILE: $rel"
 15336:         $header3 = $sep
 15337:         $header4 = $sep
 15338:         $header1 | Out-File -FilePath $OutFile -Encoding utf8 -Append
 15339:         $header2 | Out-File -FilePath $OutFile -Encoding utf8 -Append
 15340:         $header3 | Out-File -FilePath $OutFile -Encoding utf8 -Append
 15341:         $header4 | Out-File -FilePath $OutFile -Encoding utf8 -Append
 15342: 
 15343:         # read file content (try utf8 then fallback)
 15344:         $content = $null
 15345:         try {
 15346:             $content = Get-Content -Raw -Encoding utf8 -ErrorAction Stop -LiteralPath $full
 15347:         } catch {
 15348:             try {
 15349:                 $content = Get-Content -Raw -Encoding Default -ErrorAction Stop -LiteralPath $full
 15350:             } catch {
 15351:                 $content = Get-Content -Raw -ErrorAction SilentlyContinue -LiteralPath $full
 15352:             }
 15353:         }
 15354: 
 15355:         if ($null -eq $content) { $content = "" }
 15356: 
 15357:         # write raw content
 15358:         Add-Content -LiteralPath $OutFile -Value $content -Encoding utf8
 15359: 
 15360:         # trailing newline for readability
 15361:         "" | Out-File -FilePath $OutFile -Encoding utf8 -Append
 15362:         "" | Out-File -FilePath $OutFile -Encoding utf8 -Append
 15363:     } catch {
 15364:         # continue on errors, but log minimal info to dump file
 15365:         $errLine = "[ERROR] Failed to include file: $($f.FullName) - $($_.Exception.Message)"
 15366:         $errLine | Out-File -FilePath $OutFile -Encoding utf8 -Append
 15367:     }
 15368: }
 15369:

'dotenv/config';\r\nconst express = require('express');\r\nconst fs = require('fs');\r\nconst path = require('path');\r\n\r\n// optional Redis support\r\nlet Redis: any = null;\r\nlet redisClient: any Otherwise fallback to in-memory Map.\r\nconst CHECKSUM_DEFAULT_TTL_MS = Number(process.env.QFLUSH_CHECKSUM_TTL_MS) || 60 * 1000; // 60 seconds default\r\n\r\n// in-memory fallback store\r\ntype ChecksumEntry = { checksum: string; expiresAt: number };\r\nconst checksumCache = new Map<string, ChecksumEntry>();\r\n\r\n// Redis key helpers\r\nconst REDIS_KEY_PREFIX = 'qflush:npz:checksum:';\r\nconst REDIS_INDEX_KEY = 'qflush:npz:checksum:ids';\r\n\r\nasync function redisStore(id: string, checksum: string, ttlMs: number) {\r\n  if (!redisClient) return false;\r\n  const key = REDIS_KEY_PREFIX + id;\r\n  const expiresAt = Date.now() + ttlMs;\r\n  // set key with PX TTL\r\n  await redisClient.set(key, checksum, 'PX', ttlMs);\r\n  // add to sorted set with score = expiresAt\r\n  await redisClient.zadd(REDIS_INDEX_KEY, expiresAt, id);\r\n  return true;\r\n}\r\n\r\nasync function redisGet(id: string) {\r\n  if (!redisClient) return null;\r\n  const key = REDIS_KEY_PREFIX + id;\r\n  const val = await redisClient.get(key);\r\n  if (!val) return null;\r\n  // obtain TTL to compute expiresAt\r\n  const ttlMs = await redisClient.pttl(key);\r\n  const expiresAt = Date.now() + (ttlMs > 0 ? ttlMs : 0);\r\n  return { checksum: val, expiresAt };\r\n}\r\n\r\nasync function redisDelete(id: string) {\r\n  if (!redisClient) return false;\r\n  const key = REDIS_KEY_PREFIX + id;\r\n  await redisClient.del(key);\r\n  await redisClient.zrem(REDIS_INDEX_KEY, id);\r\n  return true;\r\n}\r\n\r\nasync function redisList() {\r\n  if (!redisClient) return [] as { id: string; expiresAt: number }[];\r\n  // remove expired ids from index\r\n  const now = Date.now();\r\n  await redisClient.zremrangebyscore(REDIS_INDEX_KEY, 0, now - 1);\r\n  const items = await redisClient.zrangebyscore(REDIS_INDEX_KEY, now, '+inf', 'WITHSCORES');\r\n  // zrangebyscore with WITHSCORES returns [id, score, id, score, ...]\r\n  const results: { id: string; expiresAt: number }[] = [];\r\n  for (let i = 0; i < items.length; i += 2) {\r\n    const id = items[i];\r\n    const score = Number(items[i + 1]);\r\n    results.push({ id, expiresAt: score });\r\n  }\r\n  return results;\r\n}\r\n\r\nasync function redisClear() {\r\n  if (!redisClient) return 0;\r\n  const ids = await redisClient.zrange(REDIS_INDEX_KEY, 0, -1);\r\n  if (ids.length === 0) return 0;\r\n  const keys = ids.map((id: string) => REDIS_KEY_PREFIX + id);\r\n  await redisClient.del(...keys);\r\n  const removed = await redisClient.del(REDIS_INDEX_KEY);\r\n  return ids.length;\r\n}\r\n\r\nfunction cleanupChecksumCache() {\r\n  const now = Date.now();\r\n  for (const [key, entry] of checksumCache.entries()) {\r\n    if (entry.expiresAt <= now) checksumCache.delete(key);\r\n  }\r\n}\r\n// run cleanup periodically for memory fallback\r\nsetInterval(cleanupChecksumCache, 30 * 1000).unref();\r\n\r\n// store checksum: POST /npz/checksum/store { id, checksum, ttlMs? }\r\napp.post('/npz/checksum/store', async (req: any, res: any) => {\r\n  const { id, checksum, ttlMs } = req.body || {};\r\n  if (!id || !checksum) return res.status(400).json({ success: false, error: 'missing id or checksum' });\r\n  const ttl = typeof ttlMs === 'number' && ttlMs > 0 ? ttlMs : CHECKSUM_DEFAULT_TTL_MS;\r\n  if (redisClient) {\r\n    try {\r\n      await redisStore(String(id), String(checksum), ttl);\r\n      audit({ t: Date.now(), event: 'checksum_stored_redis', id: String(id) });\r\n      return res.json({ success: true, id: String(id), ttlMs: ttl, backend: 'redis' });\r\n    } catch (e) {\r\n      // fallback to in-memory\r\n    }\r\n  }\r\n  checksumCache.set(String(id), { checksum: String(checksum), expiresAt: Date.now() + ttl });\r\n  audit({ t: Date.now(), event: 'checksum_stored_mem', id: String(id) });\r\n  return res.json({ success: true, id: String(id), ttlMs: ttl, backend: 'memory' });\r\n});\r\n\r\n// verify checksum: POST /npz/checksum/verify { id, checksum }\r\n// if verified, remove from cache (one-time) and return success\r\napp.post('/npz/checksum/verify', async (req: any, res: any) => {\r\n  const { id, checksum } = req.body || {};\r\n  if (!id || !checksum) return res.status(400).json({ success: false, error: 'missing id or checksum' });\r\n\r\n  if (redisClient) {\r\n    try {\r\n      const rec = await redisGet(String(id));\r\n      if (!rec) return res.status(404).json({ success: false, error: 'checksum not found or expired' });\r\n      if (rec.checksum !== String(checksum)) {\r\n        audit({ t: Date.now(), event: 'checksum_mismatch_redis', id: String(id), provided: String(checksum), expected: rec.checksum });\r\n        return res.status(400).json({ success: false, error: 'checksum mismatch' });\r\n      }\r\n      await redisDelete(String(id));\r\n      audit({ t: Date.now(), event: 'checksum_verified_redis', id: String(id) });\r\n      return res.json({ success: true, id: String(id), backend: 'redis' });\r\n    } catch (e) {\r\n      // fallback to memory\r\n    }\r\n  }\r\n\r\n  const entry = checksumCache.get(String(id));\r\n  if (!entry) return res.status(404).json({ success: false, error: 'checksum not found or expired' });\r\n  if (entry.checksum !== String(checksum)) {\r\n    audit({ t: Date.now(), event: 'checksum_mismatch_mem', id: String(id), provided: String(checksum), expected: entry.checksum });\r\n    return res.status(400).json({ success: false, error: 'checksum mismatch' });\r\n  }\r\n  // match: remove and return success\r\n  checksumCache.delete(String(id));\r\n  audit({ t: Date.now(), event: 'checksum_verified_mem', id: String(id) });\r\n  return res.json({ success: true, id: String(id), backend: 'memory' });\r\n});\r\n\r\n// list checksums: GET /npz/checksum/list\r\napp.get('/npz/checksum/list', async (_req: any, res: any) => {\r\n  if (redisClient) {\r\n    try {\r\n      const items = await redisList();\r\n      const now = Date.now();\r\n      const result = items.map((it: any) => ({ id: it.id, expiresInMs: Math.max(0, it.expiresAt - now) }));\r\n      return res.json({ success: true, count: result.length, items: result, backend: 'redis' });\r\n    } catch (e) {\r\n      // fallback\r\n    }\r\n  }\r\n  const now = Date.now();\r\n  const results: { id: string; expiresInMs: number }[] = [];\r\n  for (const [id, entry] of checksumCache.entries()) {\r\n    results.push({ id, expiresInMs: Math.max(0, entry.expiresAt - now) });\r\n  }\r\n  return res.json({ success: true, count: results.length, items: results, backend: 'memory' });\r\n});\r\n\r\n// clear checksums: DELETE /npz/checksum/clear\r\napp.delete('/npz/checksum/clear', async (_req: any, res: any) => {\r\n  if (redisClient) {\r\n    try {\r\n      const cleared = await redisClear();\r\n      audit({ t: Date.now(), event: 'checksum_cleared_redis', cleared });\r\n      return res.json({ success: true, cleared, backend: 'redis' });\r\n    } catch (e) {\r\n      // fallback\r\n    }\r\n  }\r\n  const cleared = checksumCache.size;\r\n  checksumCache.clear();\r\n  audit({ t: Date.now(), event: 'checksum_cleared_mem', cleared });\r\n  return res.json({ success: true, cleared, backend: 'memory' });\r\n});\r\n\r\napp.post('/license/activate', async (req: any, res: any) => {\r\n  const { key, product_id } = req.body || {};\r\n  if (!key) return res.status(400).json({ success: false, error: 'missing key' });\r\n  audit({ t: Date.now(), action: 'activate_attempt', key: is assigned a value but never used.","line":67,"column":58,"nodeType":"Identifier","messageId":"unusedVar","endLine":67,"endColumn":64}],"suppressedMessages":[],"errorCount":0,"fatalErrorCount":0,"warningCount":1,"fixableErrorCount":0,"fixableWarningCount":0,"source":"// Utilities for Nezlephant color palette and helpers\r\n// Base color shorthand '0c8' -> #00cc88\r\n\r\nexport const NEZLEPHANT = {\r\n  baseHex: '#00cc88', // shorthand 0c8\r\n  jokerHex: '#ff00cc', // Joker accent (magenta-pink)\r\n  neutralHex: '#0f1724', // dark neutral\r\n  whiteHex: '#ffffff',\r\n  blackHex: '#000000',\r\n};\r\n\r\nfunction clamp(v: number, a = 0, b = 255) {\r\n  return Math.max(a, Math.min(b, Math.round(v)));\r\n}\r\n\r\nexport function hexToRgb(hex: string): { r: number; g: number; b: number } {\r\n  const h = hex.replace('#', '');\r\n  if (h.length === 3) {\r\n    const r = parseInt(h[0] + h[0], 16);\r\n    const g = parseInt(h[1] + h[1], 16);\r\n    const b = parseInt(h[2] + h[2], 16);\r\n    return { r, g, b };\r\n  }\r\n  const r = parseInt(h.slice(0, 2), 16);\r\n  const g = parseInt(h.slice(2, 4), 16);\r\n  const b = parseInt(h.slice(4, 6), 16);\r\n  return { r, g, b };\r\n}\r\n\r\nexport function rgbToHex(r: number, g: number, b: number): string {\r\n  return `#${[r, g, b].map((n) => clamp(n).toString(16).padStart(2, '0')).join('')}`;\r\n}\r\n\r\nexport function rgba(hex: string, alpha = 1): string {\r\n  const { r, g, b } = hexToRgb(hex);\r\n  return `rgba(${r}, ${g}, ${b}, ${alpha})`;\r\n}\r\n\r\nexport function lighten(hex: string, percent = 0.1): string {\r\n  const { r, g, b } = hexToRgb(hex);\r\n  const nr = clamp(r + (255 - r) * percent);\r\n  const ng = clamp(g + (255 - g) * percent);\r\n  const nb = clamp(b + (255 - b) * percent);\r\n  return rgbToHex(nr, ng, nb);\r\n}\r\n\r\nexport function darken(hex: string, percent = 0.1): string {\r\n  const { r, g, b } = hexToRgb(hex);\r\n  const nr = clamp(r * (1 - percent));\r\n  const ng = clamp(g * (1 - percent));\r\n  const nb = clamp(b * (1 - percent));\r\n  return rgbToHex(nr, ng, nb);\r\n}\r\n\r\nexport function relativeLuminance(hex: string): number {\r\n  const { r, g, b } = hexToRgb(hex);\r\n  const srgb = [r / 255, g / 255, b / 255].map((c) => (c <= 0.03928 ? c / 12.92 : Math.pow((c + 0.055) / 1.055, 2.4)));\r\n  return 0.2126 * srgb[0] + 0.7152 * srgb[1] + 0.0722 * srgb[2];\r\n}\r\n\r\nexport function contrastRatio(hexA: string, hexB: string): number {\r\n  const L1 = relativeLuminance(hexA) + 0.05;\r\n  const L2 = relativeLuminance(hexB) + 0.05;\r\n  return Math.max(L1, L2) / Math.min(L1, L2);\r\n}\r\n\r\nexport function readableTextColor(backgroundHex: string, prefer = NEZLEPHANT.whiteHex): string {\r\n  // return white or black depending on contrast\r\n  const whiteContrast = contrastRatio(backgroundHex, NEZLEPHANT.whiteHex);\r\n  const blackContrast = contrastRatio(backgroundHex, NEZLEPHANT.blackHex);\r\n  return whiteContrast >= blackContrast ? NEZLEPHANT.whiteHex : NEZLEPHANT.blackHex;\r\n}\r\n\r\nexport function cssVariables(prefix = 'nez') {\r\n  const base = NEZLEPHANT.baseHex;\r\n  const j = NEZLEPHANT.jokerHex;\r\n  return `:root {\\n  --${prefix}-base: ${base};\\n  --${prefix}-base-90: ${rgba(base, 0.9)};\\n  --${prefix}-base-80: ${rgba(base, 0.8)};\\n  --${prefix}-base-60: ${rgba(base, 0.6)};\\n  --${prefix}-base-30: ${rgba(base, 0.3)};\\n  --${prefix}-light: ${lighten(base, 0.18)};\\n  --${prefix}-dark: ${darken(base, 0.18)};\\n  --${prefix}-joker: ${j};\\n  --${prefix}-bg: ${NEZLEPHANT.neutralHex};\\n  --${prefix}-text: ${readableTextColor(NEZLEPHANT.neutralHex)};\\n}`;\r\n}\r\n\r\n// Terminal ANSI truecolor helpers (supports modern terminals)\r\nexport function ansiFg(hex: string): string {\r\n  const { r, g, b } = hexToRgb(hex);\r\n  return `\\x1b[38;2;${r};${g};${b}m`;\r\n}\r\nexport function ansiBg(hex: string): string {\r\n  const { r, g, b } = hexToRgb(hex);\r\n  return `\\x1b[48;2;${r};${g};${b}m`;\r\n}\r\nexport const ansiReset = '\\x1b[0m';\r\n\r\n// Preset styled log helpers for Joker + Nezlephant\r\nexport function styledLog(title: string, msg: string, opts?: { accent?: 'joker' | 'base' | 'neutral' }) {\r\n  const accent = opts?.accent === 'joker' ?     done = true;\r\n      s.destroy();\r\n      resolve(true);\r\n    });\r\n    s.on('error', () => { if (!done) { done = true; resolve(false); } });\r\n    s.on('timeout', () => { if (!done) { done = true; s.destroy(); resolve(false); } });\r\n    s.connect(port, host);\r\n  });\r\n}\r\n\r\nexport async function waitForService(urlOrHost: string, port?: number, timeout = 5000) {\r\n  const start { getNpzNamespace } from './npz-config';\r\nimport fs from 'fs';\r\nimport path from 'path';\r\nimport logger from './logger';\r\nimport { Lane } from './npz-router';\r\n\r\nconst NS = getNpzNamespace();\r\nconst ENGINE_FILE = path.join(process.cwd(), '.qflush', `${NS}-npz-engine.json`);\r\n\r\ntype ScoreRecord = {\r\n  laneId: number;\r\n  score: number; // lower is better\r\n  lastSuccess?: number;\r\n  lastFailure?: number;\r\n};\r\n\r\ntype EngineStore = Record<number, ScoreRecord>;\r\n\r\nlet store: EngineStore = {};\r\n\r\n// decay parameters\r\nconst DECAY_INTERVAL_MS = 60 * 1000; // every minute\r\nconst DECAY_FACTOR = 0.9; // multiply score by this every decay interval (towards 0)\r\n\r\nfunction ensureDir() {\r\n  const dir = path.dirname(ENGINE_FILE);\r\n  if (!fs.existsSync(dir)) fs.mkdirSync(dir, { recursive: true });\r\n}\r\n\r\nfunction load() {\r\n  try {\r\n    if (fs.existsSync(ENGINE_FILE)) {\r\n      const raw = fs.readFileSync(ENGINE_FILE, 'utf8');\r\n      store = JSON.parse(raw) as EngineStore;\r\n    }\r\n  } catch (e) {\r\n    store = {};\r\n  }\r\n}\r\n\r\nfunction persist() {\r\n  try {\r\n    ensureDir();\r\n    fs.writeFileSync(ENGINE_FILE, JSON.stringify(store, null, 2), 'utf8');\r\n  } catch (e) {}\r\n}\r\n\r\nfunction applyDecay() {\r\n  const now = Date.now();\r\n  let changed = false;\r\n  for (const k of Object.keys(store)) {\r\n    const id = Number(k);\r\n    const rec = store[id];\r\n    if (!rec) continue;\r\n    // compute how many intervals since lastSuccess/lastFailure (use lastFailure as activity reference)\r\n    const ref = rec.lastFailure || rec.lastSuccess || now;\r\n    const intervals = Math.floor((now - ref) / DECAY_INTERVAL_MS);\r\n    if (intervals <= 0) continue;\r\n    const factor = Math.pow(DECAY_FACTOR, intervals);\r\n    const newScore = rec.score * factor;\r\n    if (Math.abs(newScore - rec.score) > 1e-6) {\r\n      rec.score = newScore;\r\n      changed = true;\r\n    }\r\n  }\r\n  if (changed) persist();\r\n}\r\n\r\nload();\r\n\r\n// schedule periodic decay in-memory (best-effort)\r\nsetInterval(() => {\r\n  try { applyDecay(); } catch (e) {}\r\n}, DECAY_INTERVAL_MS);\r\n\r\n/**\r\n * Adjust lane score.\r\n * delta: positive increases penalty (worse), negative decreases (better).\r\n * latencyMs: optional latency observed to weight the delta.\r\n */\r\nexport function scoreLane(laneId: number, delta: number, latencyMs?: number) {\r\n  let rec = store[laneId];\r\n  if (!rec) rec = { laneId, score: 0 };\r\n  // weight delta by latency (if provided): normalized over 1000ms\r\n  let weight = 1;\r\n  if (latencyMs && latencyMs > 0) weight += Math.min(5, latencyMs / 1000); // cap weight\r\n  rec.score = (rec.score || 0) + delta * weight;\r\n  if (delta < 0) rec.lastSuccess = Date.now();\r\n  if (delta > 0) rec.lastFailure = Date.now();\r\n  store[laneId] = rec;\r\n  persist();\r\n}\r\n\r\nexport function getLaneScore(laneId: number) {\r\n  const rec = store[laneId];\r\n  if (!rec) return 0;\r\n  // apply decay relative to now on read (non-persistent)\r\n  const now = Date.now();\r\n  const ref = rec.lastFailure || rec.lastSuccess || now;\r\n  const intervals = Math.floor((now - ref) / DECAY_INTERVAL_MS);\r\n  const factor = Math.pow(DECAY_FACTOR, intervals);\r\n  return rec.score * factor;\r\n}\r\n\r\nexport function orderLanesByScore(lanes: Lane[]) {\r\n  // return copy sorted by score asc\r\n  const out = lanes.slice();\r\n  out.sort((a, b) => getLaneScore(a.id) - getLaneScore(b.id));\r\n  return out;\r\n}\r\n\r\nexport function resetScores() {\r\n  store = {};\r\n  persist();\r\n}\r\n\r\nexport function getStore() {\r\n  return store;\r\n}\r\n\r\nexport default { scoreLane, getLaneScore, crypto from 'crypto';\r\n\r\ntype Message = { id: string; role: 'user' | 'assistant' | 'system'; text: string; t: number };\r\n\r\ntype Session = { id: string; messages: Message[]; createdAt: number };\r\n\r\nconst SESSIONS: Map<string, Session> = new Map();\r\n\r\nfunction id() { return Math.random().toString(36).slice(2,10); }\r\n\r\nexport function startSession(systemPrompt = ''): Session {\r\n  const sid = 's_' + id();\r\n  const s: Session = { id: sid, messages: [], createdAt: Date.now() };\r\n  if (systemPrompt) s.messages.push({ id: 'm_' + id(), role: 'system', text: systemPrompt, t: Date.now() });\r\n  SESSIONS.set(sid, s);\r\n  return s;\r\n}\r\n\r\nexport function sendMessage(sessionId: string, role: 'user' | 'assistant' | 'system', text: string) {\r\n  const s = SESSIONS.get(sessionId);\r\n  if (!s) throw new Error('session not found');\r\n  const m: Message = { id: 'm_' + id(), role, text, t: Date.now() };\r\n  s.messages.push(m);\r\n  return m;\r\n}\r\n\r\nexport function getHistory(sessionId: string) {\r\n  const s = SESSIONS.get(sessionId);\r\n  if (!s) return [] as Message[];\r\n  return s.messages.slice();\r\n}\r\n\r\nexport function endSession(sessionId: string) {\r\n  return SESSIONS.delete(sessionId);\r\n}\r\n\r\n// --- New: ASCII 4-byte encoding + colorize helpers ---\r\n\r\nfunction md5First4BytesHex(ch: string): string {\r\n  // return first 4 bytes (8 hex chars) of md5 of the char\r\n  const h = crypto.createHash('md5').update(ch).digest('hex');\r\n  return h.slice(0, 8);\r\n}\r\n\r\nexport function encodeAscii4(text: string): { ch: string; hex4: string }[] {\r\n  const out: { ch: string; hex4: string }[] = [];\r\n  for (const ch of text) {\r\n    out.push({ ch, hex4: md5First4BytesHex(ch) });\r\n  }\r\n  return out;\r\n}\r\n\r\nfunction hexToRgb(hex: string) {\r\n  const h = hex.replace('#', '');\r\n  const r = parseInt(h.slice(0, 2), 16);\r\n  const g = parseInt(h.slice(2, 4), 16);\r\n  const b = parseInt(h.slice(4, 6), 16);\r\n  return { r, g, b };\r\n}\r\n\r\nfunction byteToColor(b: number) {\r\n  // map single byte [0..255] to a color by expanding into RGB via simple transform\r\n  const r = (b * 3) % 256;\r\n  const g = (b * 7) % 256;\r\n  const b2 = (b * 13) % 256;\r\n  return { r, g, b: b2 };\r\n}\r\n\r\nexport function colorizeAscii4(text: string): string {\r\n  // returns ANSI colored string: for each char produce a colored block based on its 4-byte hex\r\n  const parts: string[] = [];\r\n  for (const ch of text) {\r\n    const hex4 = md5First4BytesHex(ch); // 8 hex chars\r\n    // split into 4 bytes\r\n    const bytes: number[] = [];\r\n    for (let i = 0; i < 8; i += 2) bytes.push(parseInt(hex4.slice(i, i+2), 16));\r\n    // pick a representative color from bytes\r\n    const col = byteToColor(bytes[0]);\r\n    const ansi = `\\x1b[48;2;${col.r};${col.g};${col.b}m\\x1b[38;2;0;0;0m ${ch} \\x1b[0m`;\r\n    parts.push(ansi);\r\n  }\r\n  return parts.join('');\r\n}\r\n\r\nexport default { startSession, sendMessage, getHistory, endSession, encodeAscii4, colorizeAscii4 };\r\n","usedDeprecatedRules":[]},{"filePath":"D:\\qflush\\src\\utils\\npz-router.ts","messages":[{"ruleId":"@typescript-eslint/no-unused-vars","severity":1,"message":"'lanes' is assigned a value but
