Record<string, { laneId: number; ts: number }>;\r\n\r\ntype CircuitState = {\r\n  failures: number;\r\n  firstFailureTs?: number;\r\n  trippedUntil?: number;\r\n};\r\n\r\nconst circuit: Map<string, Map<number, CircuitState>> = new Map(); // host -> laneId -> state\r\n\r\n// Prometheus metrics\r\nconst laneSuccess = new client.Counter({ name: `${NS}_lane_success_total`, help: 'NPZ lane successes', labelNames: ['host', 'lane', 'namespace'] });\r\nconst laneFailure = new client.Counter({ name: `${NS}_lane_failure_total`, help: 'NPZ lane failures', labelNames: ['host', 'lane', 'namespace'] });\r\n\r\nfunction ensureStoreDir() {\r\n  const dir = path.dirname(STORE_FILE);\r\n  if (!fs.existsSync(dir)) fs.mkdirSync(dir, { recursive: true });\r\n}\r\n\r\nfunction readStore(): Store {\r\n  try {\r\n    if (!fs.existsSync(STORE_FILE)) return {};\r\n    const raw = fs.readFileSync(STORE_FILE, 'utf8');\r\n    return JSON.parse(raw) as Store;\r\n  } catch (err) {\r\n    logger.warn(`npz-router: failed to read store ${err}`);\r\n    return {};\r\n  }\r\n}\r\n\r\nfunction writeStore(s: Store) {\r\n  try {\r\n    ensureStoreDir();\r\n    fs.writeFileSync(STORE_FILE, JSON.stringify(s, null, 2), 'utf8');\r\n  } catch (err) {\r\n    logger.warn(`npz-router: failed to write store ${err}`);\r\n  }\r\n}\r\n\r\nexport function getPreferredLane(host: string): number | null {\r\n  const s = readStore();\r\n  const entry = s[host];\r\n  if (!entry) return null;\r\n  if (Date.now() - entry.ts > PREFERRED_TTL) return null;\r\n  return entry.laneId;\r\n}\r\n\r\nexport function setPreferredLane(host: string, laneId: number) {\r\n  const s = readStore();\r\n  s[host] = { laneId, ts: Date.now() };\r\n  writeStore(s);\r\n}\r\n\r\nexport function lanesForHost(host: string, lanes: Lane[] = DEFAULT_LANES): Lane[] {\r\n  const pref = getPreferredLane(host);\r\n  // first let engine reorder by score\r\n  const ordered = engine.orderLanesByScore(lanes);\r\n  // then apply preferred lane override\r\n  if (pref === null) return ordered.slice();\r\n  const idx = ordered.findIndex((l) => l.id === pref);\r\n  if (idx <= 0) return ordered.slice();\r\n  const res = [ordered[idx], ...ordered.slice(0, idx), ...ordered.slice(idx + 1)];\r\n  return res;\r\n}\r\n\r\n// Circuit breaker helpers\r\nfunction getCircuitMapForHost(host: string) {\r\n  let m = circuit.get(host);\r\n  if (!m) {\r\n    m = new Map();\r\n    circuit.set(host, m);\r\n  }\r\n  return m;\r\n}\r\n\r\nexport function recordFailure(host: string, laneId: number, latencyMs?: number) {\r\n  const m = getCircuitMapForHost(host);\r\n  const now = Date.now();\r\n  const st = m.get(laneId) || { failures: 0 };\r\n  if (!st.firstFailureTs || now - (st.firstFailureTs || 0) > FAIL_WINDOW_MS) {\r\n    st.failures = 1;\r\n    st.firstFailureTs = now;\r\n  } else {\r\n    st.failures = (st.failures || 0) + 1;\r\n  }\r\n  if (st.failures >= FAIL_THRESHOLD) {\r\n    st.trippedUntil = now + COOLDOWN_MS;\r\n    logger.warn(`npz-router: lane ${laneId} for ${host} tripped until ${new Date(st.trippedUntil)}`);\r\n  }\r\n  m.set(laneId, st);\r\n  try { laneFailure.inc({ host, lane: String(laneId), namespace: NS } as any); } catch {}\r\n  try { engine.scoreLane(laneId, 1, latencyMs); } catch {}\r\n}\r\n\r\nexport function recordSuccess(host: string, laneId: number, latencyMs?: number) {\r\n  const m = getCircuitMapForHost(host);\r\n  m.delete(laneId);\r\n  try { laneSuccess.inc({ host, lane: String(laneId), namespace: NS } as any); } catch {}\r\n  try { engine.scoreLane(laneId, -1, latencyMs); } catch {}\r\n}\r\n\r\nexport function isLaneTripped(host: string, laneId: number): boolean {\r\n  const m = circuit.get(host);\r\n  if (!m) return false;\r\n  const st = m.get(laneId);\r\n  if (!st) return false;\r\n  if (st.trippedUntil && Date.now() < st.trippedUntil) return true;\r\n  // cooldown passed\r\n  if (st.trippedUntil && Date.now() >= st.trippedUntil) {\r\n    m.delete(laneId);\r\n    return false;\r\n  }\r\n  return false;\r\n}\r\n\r\n// lightweight fetch wrapper that returns {status, headers, body, durationMs}\r\nasync function tryFetch(fullUrl: string, options: any = {}, timeout = DEFAULT_TIMEOUT) {\r\n  const controller = typeof AbortController !== 'undefined' ? new AbortController() : null;\r\n  const signalOpt = controller ? { signal: controller.signal } : {};\r\n  const opts = { method: options.method || 'GET', headers: options.headers || {}, body: options.body, ...signalOpt };\r\n  let timer: NodeJS.Timeout | null = null;\r\n  const start = performance.now();\r\n  if (controller) timer = setTimeout(() => controller.abort(), timeout);\r\n  try {\r\n    // prefer global fetch\r\n    let ff: any = (globalThis as any).fetch;\r\n    if (!ff) {\r\n      try {\r\n        // eslint-disable-next-line @typescript-eslint/no-var-requires\r\n        ff = require('undici').fetch;\r\n      } catch (e) {\r\n        throw new Error('No fetch available (install undici or use Node 18+)');\r\n      }\r\n    }\r\n    const res = await ff(fullUrl, opts);\r\n    const text = await res.text();\r\n    if (timer) clearTimeout(timer);\r\n    const duration = Math.max(0, Math.round(performance.now() - start));\r\n    return { ok: true, status: res.status, headers: res.headers, body: text, durationMs: duration };\r\n  } catch (err: any) {\r\n    if (timer) clearTimeout(timer);\r\n    const duration = Math.max(0, Math.round(performance.now() - start));\r\n    return { ok: false, error: err, durationMs: duration };\r\n  }\r\n}\r\n\r\nexport type NpzRequest = { method?: string; url: string; headers?: Record<string, string>; body?: any; timeout?: number };\r\nexport type NpzResponse = { status?: number; headers?: any; body?: string; error?: any; gate?: string; laneId?: number; durationMs?: number };\r\n\r\nexport async function npzRoute(req: NpzRequest, lanes: Lane[] = DEFAULT_LANES): Promise<NpzResponse> {\r\n  try {\r\n    const urlObj = new URL(req.url);\r\n    const host = urlObj.host;\r\n    const ordered = lanesForHost(host) as Lane[];\r\n\r\n    // attempt primary\r\n    const primary = ordered[0];\r\n    const primaryUrl = req.url.replace(urlObj.origin, primary.url);\r\n    const timeout = req.timeout || DEFAULT_TIMEOUT;\r\n\r\n    logger.nez('NPZ', `attempting primary lane ${primary.name} -> ${primaryUrl}`);\r\n    const t0 = await tryFetch(primaryUrl, { method: req.method, headers: req.headers, body: req.body }, timeout);\r\n\r\n    if (t0.ok && t0.status && t0.status < 500) {\r\n      logger.nez('NPZ', `primary succeeded (${primary.name})`);\r\n      setPreferredLane(host, primary.id);\r\n      recordSuccess(host, primary.id, t0.durationMs);\r\n      return { status: t0.status, headers: t0.headers, body: t0.body, gate: 'primary', laneId: primary.id, durationMs: t0.durationMs };\r\n    }\r\n\r\n    // primary failed -> try fallback(s)\r\n    logger.warn(`[NPZ] primary failed for ${primary.name}, running fallbacks`);\r\n    recordFailure(host, primary.id, t0.durationMs);\r\n\r\n    for (let i = 1; i < ordered.length; i++) {\r\n      const lane = ordered[i];\r\n      const laneUrl = req.url.replace(urlObj.origin, lane.url);\r\n      logger.nez('NPZ', `trying fallback lane ${lane.name} -> ${laneUrl}`);\r\n      const res = await tryFetch(laneUrl, { method: req.method, headers: req.headers, body: req.body }, timeout);\r\n      if (res.ok && res.status && res.status < 500) {\r\n        logger.nez('NPZ', `fallback lane ${lane.name} succeeded`);\r\n        // set preferred to fallback for next time\r\n        setPreferredLane(host, lane.id);\r\n        recordSuccess(host, lane.id, res.durationMs);\r\n\r\n        // replay primary with an extra header (T2)\r\n        const replayHeaders = Object.assign({}, req.headers || {});\r\n        replayHeaders['X-NPZ-FALLBACK'] = '1';\r\n        const replayUrl = primaryUrl;\r\n        logger.nez('NPZ', `replaying primary (${primary.name}) with fallback header`);\r\n        const replay = await tryFetch(replayUrl, { method: req.method, headers: replayHeaders, body: req.body }, timeout);\r\n        if (replay.ok && replay.status && replay.status < 500) {\r\n          logger.nez('NPZ', `replayed primary succeeded after fallback`);\r\n          return { status: replay.status, headers: replay.headers, body: replay.body, gate: 'replay', laneId: primary.id, durationMs: replay.durationMs };\r\n        }\r\n\r\n        // if replay failed, return fallback result\r\n        return { status: res.status, headers: res.headers, body: res.body, gate: 'fallback', laneId: lane.id, durationMs: res.durationMs };\r\n      } else {\r\n        recordFailure(host, lane.id, res.durationMs);\r\n      }\r\n    }\r\n\r\n    // if all failed, return primary error or generic\r\n    logger.warn('[NPZ] all lanes failed');\r\n    if (t0 && !t0.ok) return { error: t0.error, gate: 'fail', durationMs: t0.durationMs };\r\n    return { status: t0.status, body: t0.body, gate: 'fail', durationMs: t0.durationMs };\r\n  } catch (err) {\r\n    return { error: err, gate: 'error' };\r\n  }\r\n}\r\n\r\nexport function getCircuitState(host: string) {\r\n  const m = circuit.get(host);\r\n  if (!m) return {} as Record<number, CircuitState>;\r\n  const out: Record<number, CircuitState> = {};\r\n  for (const [k, v] of m.entries()) out[k] = v;\r\n  return out;\r\n}\r\n\r\nexport default { DEFAULT_LANES, npzRoute, getPreferredLane, setPreferredLane, lanesForHost, recordFailure, recordSuccess, isLaneTripped, getCircuitState };\r\n","usedDeprecatedRules":[]},{"filePath":"D:\\qflush\\src\\utils\\npz-store-redis.ts","messages":[],"suppressedMessages":[],"errorCount":0,"fatalErrorCount":0,"warningCount":0,"fixableErrorCount":0,"fixableWarningCount":0,"usedDeprecatedRules":[]},{"filePath":"D:\\qflush\\src\\utils\\npz-store.ts","messages":[],"suppressedMessages":[],"errorCount":0,"fatalErrorCount":0,"warningCount":0,"fixableErrorCount":0,"fixableWarningCount":0,"usedDeprecatedRules":[]},{"filePath":"D:\\qflush\\src\\utils\\npz.ts","messages":[],"suppressedMessages":[],"errorCount":0,"fatalErrorCount":0,"warningCount":0,"fixableErrorCount":0,"fixableWarningCount":0,"usedDeprecatedRules":[]},{"filePath":"D:\\qflush\\src\\utils\\package.ts","messages":[],"suppressedMessages":[],"errorCount":0,"fatalErrorCount":0,"warningCount":0,"fixableErrorCount":0,"fixableWarningCount":0,"usedDeprecatedRules":[]},{"filePath":"D:\\qflush\\src\\utils\\paths.ts","messages":[],"suppressedMessages":[],"errorCount":0,"fatalErrorCount":0,"warningCount":0,"fixableErrorCount":0,"fixableWarningCount":0,"usedDeprecatedRules":[]},{"filePath":"D:\\qflush\\src\\utils\\tokens.ts","messages":[],"suppressedMessages":[],"errorCount":0,"fatalErrorCount":0,"warningCount":0,"fixableErrorCount":0,"fixableWarningCount":0,"usedDeprecatedRules":[]}]

 15440: ============================
 15441: FILE: examples\rome-workspace\README.md
 15442: ============================
 15443: ============================
 15444: Minimal example workspace used by CI to satisfy tools that expect a workspace folder (Rome).
 15445: 
 15446: This folder intentionally contains an empty package.json and a simple lockfile to allow `npm ci` to succeed in CI runs that initialize workspaces.

 18000: 
 18001: 
 18002: ============================
 18003: FILE: extensions\visual-studio-npz\README.md
 18004: ============================
 18005: ============================
 18006: NPZ Visual - Visual Studio extension skeleton
 18007: 
 18008: This folder contains a minimal Visual Studio VSIX project that hosts a WebView2-powered Tool Window to display the NPZ panel (the same UI used by the VS Code extension).
 18009: 
 18010: How to build and install using Visual Studio (Community) on Windows:
 18011: 
 18012: 1. Open a Developer Command Prompt for VS 2022 or use the full devenv path.
 18013: 2. Build the VSIX project via MSBuild or devenv.exe:
 18014:    - Using devenv.exe:
 18015:      "C:\Program Files\Microsoft Visual Studio\18\Community\Common7\IDE\devenv.exe" /build Release "extensions\visual-studio-npz\NPZVsix\NPZVsix.csproj"
 18016:    - Or open the solution in Visual Studio and press F5 to debug/install.
 18017: 3. The produced `.vsix` will be in the `bin\Release` folder. Install via Extensions -> Manage Extensions -> Install from VSIX.
 18018: 
 18019: Notes:
 18020: - The Tool Window loads `resources\panel.html` by default. You can change it to point at `http://localhost:4500` (NPZ daemon) to fetch dynamic data.
 18021: - WebView2 runtime may be required on the target machine.
 18022: 
 18023: 
 18024: 
 18025: ============================
 18026: FILE: extensions\vscode-npz\package.json
 18027: ============================
 18028: ============================
 18029: {
 18030:   "name": "qflush",
 18031:   "displayName": "QFlush Extension",
 18032:   "publisher": "funesterie",
 18033:   "version": "3.1.1",
 18034:   "engines": {
 18035:     "vscode": "^1.106.0"
 18036:   },
 18037:   "main": "./out/extension.js",
 18038:   "scripts": {
 18039:     "vscode:prepublish": "npm run build",
 18040:     "build": "tsc -p ./",
 18041:     "package": "npx vsce package",
 18042:     "prestart": "node -e \"require('./src/polyfill-file.js')\""
 18043:   },
 18044:   "devDependencies": {
 18045:     "@types/node": "^24.10.1",
 18046:     "@types/vscode": "^1.106.1",
 18047:     "typescript": "^5.9.3",
 18048:     "vsce": "^2.15.0",
 18049:     "vitest": "^1.3.0"
 18050:   },
 18051:   "description": "Visualize NPZ engine scores and manage lanes from VS Code.",
 18052:   "icon": "icon.png",
 18053:   "repository": {
 18054:     "type": "git",
 18055:     "url": "https://github.com/jEFFLEZ/qflush.git"
 18056:   },
 18057:   "license": "MIT",
 18058:   "contributes": {
 18059:     "commands": [
 18060:       {
 18061:         "command": "qflush.openPanel",
 18062:         "title": "QFlush: Open Panel"
 18063:       },
 18064:       {
 18065:         "command": "qflush.showLicenseStatus",
 18066:         "title": "QFlush: Show License Status"
 18067:       }
 18068:     ],
 18069:     "configuration": {
 18070:       "type": "object",
 18071:       "title": "QFlush",
 18072:       "properties": {
 18073:         "qflush.daemonUrl": {
 18074:           "type": "string",
 18075:           "default": "http://localhost:4500",
 18076:           "description": "URL of the NPZ daemon (including protocol and port)"
 18077:         },
 18078:         "qflush.adminToken": {
 18079:           "type": "string",
 18080:           "default": "changeme",
 18081:           "description": "Admin token to call NPZ admin endpoints"
 18082:         }
 18083:       }
 18084:     }
 18085:   }

 21488: 
 21489: 
 21490: 
 21491: ============================
 21492: FILE: extensions\vscode-npz\README.md
 21493: ============================
 21494: ============================
 21495: # Qflush – NPZ Visual
 21496: 
 21497: Qflush Visual est l’extension officielle pour visualiser et contrôler le moteur Qflush / NPZ depuis VS Code / VSCodium / Theia.
 21498: 
 21499: ## Fonctionnalités
 21500: 
 21501: - Visualisation des scores NPZ en temps réel
 21502: - Panel HTML interactif
 21503: - Commandes : `qflush.openPanel`, `qflush.showLicenseStatus`
 21504: - Intégration avec le daemon Qflush local (`http://localhost:4500`)
 21505: - Préparation pour activation licence Gumroad
 21506: 
 21507: ## Installation
 21508: 
 21509: - Installer Qflush (npm) :
 21510: 
 21511: ```sh
 21512: npm i -g @funeste38/qflush
 21513: ```
 21514: 
 21515: - Lancer le daemon :
 21516: 
 21517: ```
 21518: qflush daemon
 21519: ```
 21520: 
 21521: - Depuis VSCodium, installer l’extension Qflush depuis Open VSX.
 21522: 
 21523: ## Commands
 21524: 
 21525: - `qflush.openPanel` – Ouvre le panneau NPZ Scores
 21526: - `qflush.showLicenseStatus` – Affiche l’état de la licence
 21527: 
 21528: ## Licence

 21574: const vscode = __importStar(require("vscode"));

 21579: // import Rome tag utilities
 21580: const rome_tag_1 = require("@rome/rome-tag");
 21581: const TRIAL_DAYS = 14;
 21582: function isTrialExpired(context) {
 21583:     const started = context.globalState.get('qflush.trialStarted');
 21584:     if (!started)
 21585:         return false; // start on first use
 21586:     const now = Date.now();
 21587:     return now - started > TRIAL_DAYS * 24 * 3600 * 1000;
 21588: }
 21589: function ensureTrialStarted(context) {
 21590:     const started = context.globalState.get('qflush.trialStarted');
 21591:     if (!started)
 21592:         context.globalState.update('qflush.trialStarted', Date.now());
 21593: }
 21594: function postJson(urlStr, body) {
 21595:     return new Promise((resolve, reject) => {
 21596:         try {
 21597:             const url = new URL(urlStr);
 21598:             const data = JSON.stringify(body || {});
 21599:             const opts = {
 21600:                 hostname: url.hostname,
 21601:                 port: url.port || (url.protocol === 'https:' ? 443 : 80),
 21602:                 path: url.pathname + (url.search || ''),
 21603:                 method: 'POST',
 21604:                 headers: {
 21605:                     'Content-Type': 'application/json',
 21606:                     'Content-Length': Buffer.byteLength(data),
 21607:                 },
 21608:             };
 21609:             const lib = url.protocol === 'https:' ? https : http;
 21610:             const req = lib.request(opts, (res) => {
 21611:                 let raw = '';
 21612:                 res.setEncoding('utf8');
 21613:                 res.on('data', (chunk) => (raw += chunk));
 21614:                 res.on('end', () => {
 21615:                     try {
 21616:                         const parsed = raw ? JSON.parse(raw) : {};
 21617:                         if (res.statusCode && res.statusCode >= 200 && res.statusCode < 300)
 21618:                             resolve(parsed);
 21619:                         else
 21620:                             reject(new Error(parsed && parsed.error ? parsed.error : `HTTP ${res.statusCode}`));
 21621:                     }
 21622:                     catch (e) {
 21623:                         reject(e);
 21624:                     }
 21625:                 });
 21626:             });
 21627:             req.on('error', (err) => reject(err));
 21628:             req.write(data);
 21629:             req.end();
 21630:         }
 21631:         catch (e) {
 21632:             reject(e);
 21633:         }
 21634:     });
 21635: }
 21636: function getJson(urlStr) {
 21637:     return new Promise((resolve, reject) => {
 21638:         try {
 21639:             const url = new URL(urlStr);
 21640:             const lib = url.protocol === 'https:' ? https : http;
 21641:             const req = lib.get(urlStr, (res) => {
 21642:                 let raw = '';
 21643:                 res.setEncoding('utf8');
 21644:                 res.on('data', (chunk) => (raw += chunk));
 21645:                 res.on('end', () => {
 21646:                     try {
 21647:                         const parsed = raw ? JSON.parse(raw) : {};
 21648:                         if (res.statusCode && res.statusCode >= 200 && res.statusCode < 300)
 21649:                             resolve(parsed);
 21650:                         else
 21651:                             reject(new Error(parsed && parsed.error ? parsed.error : `HTTP ${res.statusCode}`));
 21652:                     }
 21653:                     catch (e) {
 21654:                         reject(e);
 21655:                     }
 21656:                 });
 21657:             });
 21658:             req.on('error', (err) => reject(err));
 21659:         }
 21660:         catch (e) {
 21661:             reject(e);
 21662:         }
 21663:     });
 21664: }
 21665: async function saveRomeIndexRecord(record) {
 21666:     try {
 21667:         const root = process.cwd();
 21668:         const dir = path.join(root, '.qflush');
 21669:         if (!fs.existsSync(dir))
 21670:             fs.mkdirSync(dir, { recursive: true });
 21671:         const idxFile = path.join(dir, 'rome-index.json');
 21672:         let idx = {};
 21673:         if (fs.existsSync(idxFile)) {
 21674:             try {
 21675:                 idx = JSON.parse(fs.readFileSync(idxFile, 'utf8') || '{}');
 21676:             }
 21677:             catch {
 21678:                 idx = {};
 21679:             }
 21680:         }
 21681:         // normalize path and build canonical record using shared module
 21682:         const relPath = (0, rome_tag_1.normalizeRomePath)(record.path);
 21683:         const rec = (0, rome_tag_1.makeRomeTagRecord)({ type: record.type, path: relPath });
 21684:         idx[rec.path] = rec;
 21685:         fs.writeFileSync(idxFile, JSON.stringify(idx, null, 2), 'utf8');
 21686:         return { success: true, record: idx[rec.path] };
 21687:     }
 21688:     catch (e) {
 21689:         return { success: false, error: String(e) };
 21690:     }
 21691: }
 21692: function activate(context) {
 21693:     ensureTrialStarted(context);
 21694:     const openDisposable = vscode.commands.registerCommand('qflush.openPanel', () => {
 21695:         if (isTrialExpired(context)) {
 21696:             vscode.window.showInformationMessage('QFlush trial expired. Click to purchase a license.', 'Purchase', 'Enter Key').then((v) => {
 21697:                 if (v === 'Purchase')
 21698:                     vscode.env.openExternal(vscode.Uri.parse('https://gumroad.com/l/your-product'));
 21699:                 if (v === 'Enter Key')
 21700:                     vscode.commands.executeCommand('qflush.enterLicense');
 21701:             });
 21702:             return;
 21703:         }
 21704:         const panel = vscode.window.createWebviewPanel('qflushPanel', 'QFlush', vscode.ViewColumn.One, {
 21705:             enableScripts: true,
 21706:             localResourceRoots: [vscode.Uri.file(path.join(context.extensionPath, 'src'))],
 21707:         });
 21708:         const htmlPath = path.join(context.extensionPath, 'src', 'panel.html');
 21709:         let html = '';
 21710:         try {
 21711:             html = fs.readFileSync(htmlPath, 'utf8');
 21712:         }
 21713:         catch (e) {
 21714:             html = `<html><body><pre>panel.html not found at ${htmlPath}</pre></body></html>`;
 21715:         }
 21716:         panel.webview.html = html;
 21717:         const cfg = vscode.workspace.getConfiguration('qflush');
 21718:         const daemonUrl = cfg.get('daemonUrl') || 'http://localhost:4500';
 21719:         const token = cfg.get('adminToken') || '';
 21720:         // Send config to webview securely via postMessage
 21721:         panel.webview.postMessage({ type: 'config', daemonUrl, token });
 21722:         // Handle messages from the webview
 21723:         panel.webview.onDidReceiveMessage(async (message) => {
 21724:             if (message && message.type === 'saveConfig') {
 21725:                 const cfg = vscode.workspace.getConfiguration('qflush');
 21726:                 await cfg.update('daemonUrl', message.daemonUrl, vscode.ConfigurationTarget.Global);
 21727:                 await cfg.update('adminToken', message.token, vscode.ConfigurationTarget.Global);
 21728:                 panel.webview.postMessage({ type: 'saved', info: 'Configuration saved' });
 21729:             }
 21730:         }, undefined, context.subscriptions);
 21731:     });
 21732:     const openPourparler = vscode.commands.registerCommand('qflush.openPourparler', () => {
 21733:         const panel = vscode.window.createWebviewPanel('qflushPourparler', 'Pourparler', vscode.ViewColumn.One, { enableScripts: true, localResourceRoots: [vscode.Uri.file(path.join(context.extensionPath, 'src'))] });
 21734:         const htmlPath = path.join(context.extensionPath, 'src', 'pourparler-web.html');
 21735:         let html = '';
 21736:         try {
 21737:             html = fs.readFileSync(htmlPath, 'utf8');
 21738:         }
 21739:         catch (e) {
 21740:             html = `<html><body><pre>pourparler-web.html not found at ${htmlPath}</pre></body></html>`;
 21741:         }
 21742:         panel.webview.html = html;
 21743:         panel.webview.onDidReceiveMessage(async (msg) => {
 21744:             try {
 21745:                 if (msg && msg.type === 'export') {
 21746:                     const destUri = await vscode.window.showSaveDialog({ defaultUri: vscode.Uri.file(path.join(process.cwd(), msg.filename)), filters: { 'Images': ['png', 'svg'] } });
 21747:                     if (!destUri)
 21748:                         return;
 21749:                     if (msg.format === 'svg') {
 21750:                         fs.writeFileSync(destUri.fsPath, msg.data, 'utf8');
 21751:                     }
 21752:                     else if (msg.format === 'png') {
 21753:                         // data url -> binary
 21754:                         const base64 = msg.data.split(',')[1];
 21755:                         const buf = Buffer.from(base64, 'base64');
 21756:                         fs.writeFileSync(destUri.fsPath, buf);
 21757:                     }
 21758:                     vscode.window.showInformationMessage(`Exported ${msg.filename}`);
 21759:                 }
 21760:                 // new messages from pourparler webview
 21761:                 if (msg && msg.type === 'npzList') {
 21762:                     const cfg = vscode.workspace.getConfiguration('qflush');
 21763:                     const daemonUrl = cfg.get('daemonUrl') || 'http://localhost:4500';
 21764:                     try {
 21765:                         const data = await getJson(`${daemonUrl.replace(/\/$/, '')}/npz/checksum/list`);
 21766:                         panel.webview.postMessage({ type: 'npzListResult', data });
 21767:                     }
 21768:                     catch (e) {
 21769:                         panel.webview.postMessage({ type: 'npzListResult', data: { success: false, error: String(e) } });
 21770:                     }
 21771:                 }
 21772:                 if (msg && msg.type === 'npzClear') {
 21773:                     const cfg = vscode.workspace.getConfiguration('qflush');
 21774:                     const daemonUrl = cfg.get('daemonUrl') || 'http://localhost:4500';
 21775:                     try {
 21776:                         const resp = await fetch(`${daemonUrl.replace(/\/$/, '')}/npz/checksum/clear`, { method: 'DELETE' });
 21777:                         const j = await resp.json();
 21778:                         panel.webview.postMessage({ type: 'npzClearResult', data: j });
 21779:                     }
 21780:                     catch (e) {
 21781:                         panel.webview.postMessage({ type: 'npzClearResult', data: { success: false, error: String(e) } });
 21782:                     }
 21783:                 }
 21784:                 if (msg && msg.type === 'npzIndexTag') {
 21785:                     const rec = msg.payload;
 21786:                     const r = await saveRomeIndexRecord({ path: rec.path, type: rec.type, tag: rec.tag });
 21787:                     panel.webview.postMessage(Object.assign({ type: 'npzIndexTagResult' }, r));
 21788:                 }
 21789:             }
 21790:             catch (e) {
 21791:                 vscode.window.showErrorMessage('Extension message handler failed: ' + String(e));
 21792:             }
 21793:         }, undefined, context.subscriptions);
 21794:     });
 21795:     const enterLicense = vscode.commands.registerCommand('qflush.enterLicense', async () => {
 21796:         const key = await vscode.window.showInputBox({ prompt: 'Enter your QFlush license key' });
 21797:         if (!key)
 21798:             return;
 21799:         const cfg = vscode.workspace.getConfiguration('qflush');
 21800:         const daemonUrl = cfg.get('daemonUrl') || 'http://localhost:4500';
 21801:         const activateUrl = `${daemonUrl.replace(/\/$/, '')}/license/activate`;
 21802:         const progressOptions = { location: vscode.ProgressLocation.Notification, title: 'Activating QFlush license...', cancellable: false };
 21803:         try {
 21804:             await vscode.window.withProgress(progressOptions, async () => {
 21805:                 const res = await postJson(activateUrl, { key });
 21806:                 // store license info locally in extension globalState
 21807:                 await context.globalState.update('qflush.licenseKey', key);
 21808:                 await context.globalState.update('qflush.licenseInfo', res.license || res);
 21809:                 vscode.window.showInformationMessage('License activated successfully. Thanks!');
 21810:             });
 21811:         }
 21812:         catch (err) {
 21813:             vscode.window.showErrorMessage(`License activation failed: ${err && err.message ? err.message : String(err)}`);
 21814:         }
 21815:     });
 21816:     const showStatus = vscode.commands.registerCommand('qflush.showLicenseStatus', async () => {
 21817:         const cfg = vscode.workspace.getConfiguration('qflush');
 21818:         const daemonUrl = cfg.get('daemonUrl') || 'http://localhost:4500';
 21819:         const statusUrl = `${daemonUrl.replace(/\/$/, '')}/license/status`;
 21820:         try {
 21821:             const res = await getJson(statusUrl);
 21822:             if (!res || !res.success) {
 21823:                 vscode.window.showInformationMessage('No license information available');
 21824:                 return;
 21825:             }
 21826:             const lic = res.license;
 21827:             if (!lic) {
 21828:                 vscode.window.showInformationMessage('No local license installed');
 21829:                 return;
 21830:             }
 21831:             const exp = lic.expiresAt ? new Date(lic.expiresAt).toLocaleString() : 'never (subscription)';
 21832:             vscode.window.showInformationMessage(`License: ${lic.key} product=${lic.product_id} expires=${exp} valid=${res.valid}`);
 21833:         }
 21834:         catch (err) {
 21835:             vscode.window.showErrorMessage(`Failed to fetch status: ${err && err.message ? err.message : String(err)}`);
 21836:         }
 21837:     });
 21838:     const openTelemetry = vscode.commands.registerCommand('qflush.openTelemetry', () => {
 21839:         const panel = vscode.window.createWebviewPanel('qflushTelemetry', 'QFlush Telemetry', vscode.ViewColumn.Two, { enableScripts: true, localResourceRoots: [vscode.Uri.file(path.join(context.extensionPath, 'src'))] });
 21840:         const htmlPath = path.join(context.extensionPath, 'src', 'telemetry-view.html');
 21841:         let html = '';
 21842:         try {
 21843:             html = fs.readFileSync(htmlPath, 'utf8');
 21844:         }
 21845:         catch (e) {
 21846:             html = `<html><body><pre>telemetry-view.html not found at ${htmlPath}</pre></body></html>`;
 21847:         }
 21848:         panel.webview.html = html;
 21849:     });
 21850:     context.subscriptions.push(openDisposable, openPourparler, enterLicense, showStatus, openTelemetry);
 21851: }
 21852: function deactivate() { }
 21853:

 21857: FILE: extensions\vscode-npz\src\extension.ts
 21858: ============================
 21859: ============================
 21860: import * as vscode from 'vscode';
 21861: import * as path from 'path';
 21862: import * as fs from 'fs';
 21863: import * as http from 'http';
 21864: import * as https from 'https';
 21865: 
 21866: // import Rome tag utilities
 21867: import { makeRomeTagRecord, RomeIndex, normalizeRomePath } from '@rome/rome-tag';
 21868: 
 21869: const TRIAL_DAYS = 14;
 21870: 
 21871: function isTrialExpired(context: vscode.ExtensionContext): boolean {
 21872:   const started = context.globalState.get<number>('qflush.trialStarted');
 21873:   if (!started) return false; // start on first use
 21874:   const now = Date.now();
 21875:   return now - started > TRIAL_DAYS * 24 * 3600 * 1000;
 21876: }
 21877: 
 21878: function ensureTrialStarted(context: vscode.ExtensionContext) {
 21879:   const started = context.globalState.get<number>('qflush.trialStarted');
 21880:   if (!started) context.globalState.update('qflush.trialStarted', Date.now());
 21881: }
 21882: 
 21883: function postJson(urlStr: string, body: any): Promise<any> {
 21884:   return new Promise((resolve, reject) => {
 21885:     try {
 21886:       const url = new URL(urlStr);
 21887:       const data = JSON.stringify(body || {});
 21888:       const opts: any = {
 21889:         hostname: url.hostname,
 21890:         port: url.port || (url.protocol === 'https:' ? 443 : 80),
 21891:         path: url.pathname + (url.search || ''),
 21892:         method: 'POST',
 21893:         headers: {
 21894:           'Content-Type': 'application/json',
 21895:           'Content-Length': Buffer.byteLength(data),
 21896:         },
 21897:       };
 21898:       const lib = url.protocol === 'https:' ? https : http;
 21899:       const req = lib.request(opts, (res) => {
 21900:         let raw = '';
 21901:         res.setEncoding('utf8');
 21902:         res.on('data', (chunk) => (raw += chunk));
 21903:         res.on('end', () => {
 21904:           try {
 21905:             const parsed = raw ? JSON.parse(raw) : {};
 21906:             if (res.statusCode && res.statusCode >= 200 && res.statusCode < 300) resolve(parsed);
 21907:             else reject(new Error(parsed && parsed.error ? parsed.error : `HTTP ${res.statusCode}`));
 21908:           } catch (e) {
 21909:             reject(e);
 21910:           }
 21911:         });
 21912:       });
 21913:       req.on('error', (err) => reject(err));
 21914:       req.write(data);
 21915:       req.end();
 21916:     } catch (e) {
 21917:       reject(e);
 21918:     }
 21919:   });
 21920: }
 21921: 
 21922: function getJson(urlStr: string): Promise<any> {
 21923:   return new Promise((resolve, reject) => {
 21924:     try {
 21925:       const url = new URL(urlStr);
 21926:       const lib = url.protocol === 'https:' ? https : http;
 21927:       const req = lib.get(urlStr, (res) => {
 21928:         let raw = '';
 21929:         res.setEncoding('utf8');
 21930:         res.on('data', (chunk) => (raw += chunk));
 21931:         res.on('end', () => {
 21932:           try {
 21933:             const parsed = raw ? JSON.parse(raw) : {};
 21934:             if (res.statusCode && res.statusCode >= 200 && res.statusCode < 300) resolve(parsed);
 21935:             else reject(new Error(parsed && parsed.error ? parsed.error : `HTTP ${res.statusCode}`));
 21936:           } catch (e) {
 21937:             reject(e);
 21938:           }
 21939:         });
 21940:       });
 21941:       req.on('error', (err) => reject(err));
 21942:     } catch (e) {
 21943:       reject(e);
 21944:     }
 21945:   });
 21946: }
 21947: 
 21948: async function saveRomeIndexRecord(record: { path: string; type: string; tag?: string }) {
 21949:   try {
 21950:     const root = process.cwd();
 21951:     const dir = path.join(root, '.qflush');
 21952:     if (!fs.existsSync(dir)) fs.mkdirSync(dir, { recursive: true });
 21953:     const idxFile = path.join(dir, 'rome-index.json');
 21954:     let idx: RomeIndex = {};
 21955:     if (fs.existsSync(idxFile)) {
 21956:       try { idx = JSON.parse(fs.readFileSync(idxFile, 'utf8') || '{}'); } catch { idx = {}; }
 21957:     }
 21958: 
 21959:     // normalize path and build canonical record using shared module
 21960:     const relPath = normalizeRomePath(record.path);
 21961:     const rec = makeRomeTagRecord({ type: record.type, path: relPath });
 21962:     idx[rec.path] = rec;
 21963: 
 21964:     fs.writeFileSync(idxFile, JSON.stringify(idx, null, 2), 'utf8');
 21965:     return { success: true, record: idx[rec.path] };
 21966:   } catch (e) {
 21967:     return { success: false, error: String(e) };
 21968:   }
 21969: }
 21970: 
 21971: export function activate(context: vscode.ExtensionContext) {

 21973: 
 21974:   const openDisposable = vscode.commands.registerCommand('qflush.openPanel', () => {
 21975:     if (isTrialExpired(context)) {

 21977:         if (v === 'Purchase') vscode.env.openExternal(vscode.Uri.parse('https://gumroad.com/l/your-product'));
 21978:         if (v === 'Enter Key') vscode.commands.executeCommand('qflush.enterLicense');
 21979:       });
 21980:       return;
 21981:     }
 21982: 
 21983:     const panel = vscode.window.createWebviewPanel(
 21984:       'qflushPanel',
 21985:       'QFlush',
 21986:       vscode.ViewColumn.One,
 21987:       {
 21988:         enableScripts: true,
 21989:         localResourceRoots: [vscode.Uri.file(path.join(context.extensionPath, 'src'))],
 21990:       }
 21991:     );
 21992: 
 21993:     const htmlPath = path.join(context.extensionPath, 'src', 'panel.html');
 21994:     let html = '';

 21997:     } catch (e) {
 21998:       html = `<html><body><pre>panel.html not found at ${htmlPath}</pre></body></html>`;
 21999:     }
 22000: 
 22001:     panel.webview.html = html;
 22002:

 22004:     const daemonUrl = cfg.get<string>('daemonUrl') || 'http://localhost:4500';
 22005:     const token = cfg.get<string>('adminToken') || '';
 22006: 
 22007:     // Send config to webview securely via postMessage
 22008:     panel.webview.postMessage({ type: 'config', daemonUrl, token });
 22009: 
 22010:     // Handle messages from the webview
 22011:     panel.webview.onDidReceiveMessage(
 22012:       async (message) => {
 22013:         if (message && message.type === 'saveConfig') {
 22014:           const cfg = vscode.workspace.getConfiguration('qflush');
 22015:           await cfg.update('daemonUrl', message.daemonUrl, vscode.ConfigurationTarget.Global);
 22016:           await cfg.update('adminToken', message.token, vscode.ConfigurationTarget.Global);
 22017:           panel.webview.postMessage({ type: 'saved', info: 'Configuration saved' });
 22018:         }
 22019:       },
 22020:       undefined,
 22021:       context.subscriptions
 22022:     );
 22023:   });
 22024: 
 22025:   const openPourparler = vscode.commands.registerCommand('qflush.openPourparler', () => {
 22026:     const panel = vscode.window.createWebviewPanel('qflushPourparler', 'Pourparler', vscode.ViewColumn.One, { enableScripts: true, localResourceRoots: [vscode.Uri.file(path.join(context.extensionPath, 'src'))] });
 22027:     const htmlPath = path.join(context.extensionPath, 'src', 'pourparler-web.html');
 22028:     let html = '';
 22029:     try { html = fs.readFileSync(htmlPath, 'utf8'); } catch (e) { html = `<html><body><pre>pourparler-web.html not found at ${htmlPath}</pre></body></html>`; }
 22030:     panel.webview.html = html;
 22031: 
 22032:     panel.webview.onDidReceiveMessage(async (msg) => {
 22033:       try {
 22034:         if (msg && msg.type === 'export') {
 22035:           const destUri = await vscode.window.showSaveDialog({ defaultUri: vscode.Uri.file(path.join(process.cwd(), msg.filename)), filters: { 'Images': ['png','svg'] } });
 22036:           if (!destUri) return;
 22037:           if (msg.format === 'svg') {
 22038:             fs.writeFileSync(destUri.fsPath, msg.data, 'utf8');
 22039:           } else if (msg.format === 'png') {
 22040:             // data url -> binary
 22041:             const base64 = msg.data.split(',')[1];
 22042:             const buf = Buffer.from(base64, 'base64');
 22043:             fs.writeFileSync(destUri.fsPath, buf);
 22044:           }
 22045:           vscode.window.showInformationMessage(`Exported ${msg.filename}`);
 22046:         }
 22047: 
 22048:         // new messages from pourparler webview
 22049:         if (msg && msg.type === 'npzList') {
 22050:           const cfg = vscode.workspace.getConfiguration('qflush');
 22051:           const daemonUrl = cfg.get<string>('daemonUrl') || 'http://localhost:4500';
 22052:           try {
 22053:             const data = await getJson(`${daemonUrl.replace(/\/$/, '')}/npz/checksum/list`);
 22054:             panel.webview.postMessage({ type: 'npzListResult', data });
 22055:           } catch (e) {
 22056:             panel.webview.postMessage({ type: 'npzListResult', data: { success: false, error: String(e) } });
 22057:           }
 22058:         }
 22059: 
 22060:         if (msg && msg.type === 'npzClear') {
 22061:           const cfg = vscode.workspace.getConfiguration('qflush');
 22062:           const daemonUrl = cfg.get<string>('daemonUrl') || 'http://localhost:4500';
 22063:           try {
 22064:             const resp = await fetch(`${daemonUrl.replace(/\/$/, '')}/npz/checksum/clear`, { method: 'DELETE' });
 22065:             const j = await resp.json();
 22066:             panel.webview.postMessage({ type: 'npzClearResult', data: j });
 22067:           } catch (e) {
 22068:             panel.webview.postMessage({ type: 'npzClearResult', data: { success: false, error: String(e) } });
 22069:           }
 22070:         }
 22071: 
 22072:         if (msg && msg.type === 'npzIndexTag') {
 22073:           const rec = msg.payload;
 22074:           const r = await saveRomeIndexRecord({ path: rec.path, type: rec.type, tag: rec.tag });
 22075:           panel.webview.postMessage(Object.assign({ type: 'npzIndexTagResult' }, r));
 22076:         }
 22077:       } catch (e) {
 22078:         vscode.window.showErrorMessage('Extension message handler failed: ' + String(e));
 22079:       }
 22080:     }, undefined, context.subscriptions);
 22081:   });
 22082: 
 22083:   const enterLicense = vscode.commands.registerCommand('qflush.enterLicense', async () => {
 22084:     const key = await vscode.window.showInputBox({ prompt: 'Enter your QFlush license key' });
 22085:     if (!key) return;
 22086: 
 22087:     const cfg = vscode.workspace.getConfiguration('qflush');
 22088:     const daemonUrl = cfg.get<string>('daemonUrl') || 'http://localhost:4500';
 22089:     const activateUrl = `${daemonUrl.replace(/\/$/, '')}/license/activate`;
 22090: 
 22091:     const progressOptions: vscode.ProgressOptions = { location: vscode.ProgressLocation.Notification, title: 'Activating QFlush license...', cancellable: false };
 22092:     try {
 22093:       await vscode.window.withProgress(progressOptions, async () => {
 22094:         const res = await postJson(activateUrl, { key });
 22095:         // store license info locally in extension globalState
 22096:         await context.globalState.update('qflush.licenseKey', key);
 22097:         await context.globalState.update('qflush.licenseInfo', res.license || res);
 22098:         vscode.window.showInformationMessage('License activated successfully. Thanks!');
 22099:       });
 22100:     } catch (err: any) {
 22101:         vscode.window.showErrorMessage(`License activation failed: ${err && err.message ? err.message : String(err)}`);
 22102:     }
 22103:   });
 22104: 
 22105:   const showStatus = vscode.commands.registerCommand('qflush.showLicenseStatus', async () => {
 22106:     const cfg = vscode.workspace.getConfiguration('qflush');
 22107:     const daemonUrl = cfg.get<string>('daemonUrl') || 'http://localhost:4500';
 22108:     const statusUrl = `${daemonUrl.replace(/\/$/, '')}/license/status`;
 22109:     try {
 22110:       const res = await getJson(statusUrl);
 22111:       if (!res || !res.success) {
 22112:         vscode.window.showInformationMessage('No license information available');
 22113:         return;
 22114:       }
 22115:       const lic = res.license;
 22116:       if (!lic) {
 22117:         vscode.window.showInformationMessage('No local license installed');
 22118:         return;
 22119:       }
 22120:       const exp = lic.expiresAt ? new Date(lic.expiresAt).toLocaleString() : 'never (subscription)';
 22121:       vscode.window.showInformationMessage(`License: ${lic.key} product=${lic.product_id} expires=${exp} valid=${res.valid}`);
 22122:     } catch (err: any) {
 22123:       vscode.window.showErrorMessage(`Failed to fetch status: ${err && err.message ? err.message : String(err)}`);
 22124:     }
 22125:   });
 22126: 
 22127:   const openTelemetry = vscode.commands.registerCommand('qflush.openTelemetry', () => {
 22128:     const panel = vscode.window.createWebviewPanel('qflushTelemetry', 'QFlush Telemetry', vscode.ViewColumn.Two, { enableScripts: true, localResourceRoots: [vscode.Uri.file(path.join(context.extensionPath, 'src'))] });
 22129:     const htmlPath = path.join(context.extensionPath, 'src', 'telemetry-view.html');
 22130:     let html = '';
 22131:     try { html = fs.readFileSync(htmlPath, 'utf8'); } catch (e) { html = `<html><body><pre>telemetry-view.html not found at ${htmlPath}</pre></body></html>`; }
 22132:     panel.webview.html = html;
 22133:   });
 22134: 
 22135:   context.subscriptions.push(openDisposable, openPourparler, enterLicense, showStatus, openTelemetry);
 22136: }
 22137: 
 22138: export function deactivate() {}
 22139: 
 22140: 
 22141: 
 22142: ============================
 22143: FILE: extensions\vscode-npz\src\polyfill-file.js
 22144: ============================
 22145: ============================
 22146: // Polyfill minimal File/Blob for Node environments when libraries expect browser globals
 22147: if (typeof globalThis.File === 'undefined') {
 22148:   globalThis.File = class File extends Uint8Array {
 22149:     constructor(parts = [], name = 'file', options = {}) {
 22150:       // naive implementation: store data as concatenated string/Uint8Array
 22151:       const chunks = parts.map(p => typeof p === 'string' ? Buffer.from(p) : Buffer.from(p));
 22152:       const buf = Buffer.concat(chunks);
 22153:       super(buf);
 22154:       this.name = name;
 22155:       this.lastModified = options.lastModified || Date.now();
 22156:       this.size = buf.length;
 22157:       this.type = options.type || '';
 22158:     }
 22159:     text() { return Promise.resolve(Buffer.from(this).toString('utf8')); }
 22160:     arrayBuffer() { return Promise.resolve(Uint8Array.from(this).buffer); }
 22161:     stream() { throw new Error('stream() not implemented'); }
 22162:   };
 22163: }
 22164: if (typeof globalThis.Blob === 'undefined') {
 22165:   globalThis.Blob = class Blob extends Uint8Array {
 22166:     constructor(parts = [], options = {}) {
 22167:       const chunks = parts.map(p => typeof p === 'string' ? Buffer.from(p) : Buffer.from(p));
 22168:       const buf = Buffer.concat(chunks);
 22169:       super(buf);
 22170:       this.size = buf.length;
 22171:       this.type = options.type || '';
 22172:     }
 22173:     text() { return Promise.resolve(Buffer.from(this).toString('utf8')); }
 22174:     arrayBuffer() { return Promise.resolve(Uint8Array.from(this).buffer); }
 22175:   };
 22176: }

 22186:   export function makeRomeTagRecord(input: { type: string; path: string; tag?: string }): { path: string; type: string; tag?: string };
 22187:   export function normalizeRomePath(p: string): string;
 22188: }

 22240: 
 22241: 
 22242: 
 22243: ============================
 22244: FILE: FUNESTERIE-ARCHITECTURE.md
 22245: ============================
 22246: ============================
 22247: FUNESTERIE — Architecture & Vision
 22248: 
 22249: Objectif
 22250: --------
 22251: Créer un écosystème modulaire et évolutif où chaque couche a une responsabilité unique et communique via interfaces claires : QFLUSH (orchestrateur), ROME (moteur logique / indexeur), NPZ (router / admin), BAT (process manager), Nezlephant/OC8 (stockage caché), A11 (interface IA), SPYDER (futur moteur neuronal).
 22252: 
 22253: Sommaire des composants
 22254: -----------------------
 22255: 
 22256: 1) QFLUSH — Orchestrateur
 22257: - CLI + daemon HTTP.
 22258: - Commandes principales : `start`, `kill`, `purge`, `inspect`, `config`, `daemon`.
 22259: - Supervise les modules, expose NPZ/Rome endpoints, centralise la config et le SmartChain pipeline.
 22260: 
 22261: 2) BAT — Process Manager
 22262: - Spawn / stop / restart / status.
 22263: - Détache les services (non bloquant), persiste état dans `.qflush/services.json`, logs dans `.qflush/logs/`.
 22264: - Strictement process management — pas de router ni logique.
 22265: 
 22266: 3) NPZ (Joker) — Router & Admin
 22267: - Router et diagnostics pour les modules.
 22268: - Endpoints exposés par le daemon : checksums, rome-index, rome-links, resolve, SSE stream.
 22269: - CLI : `qflush npz:inspect`, `qflush npz:scores`.
 22270: - Stockage : fallback mémoire/fichiers; Redis optionnel (opt‑in via `QFLUSH_ENABLE_REDIS`).
 22271: 
 22272: 4) ROME — Index, Engine, Logic, Linker
 22273: - Indexation des sources annotées (`ROME-TAG`) → `.qflush/rome-index.json`.
 22274: - Engine évalue l’index et émet des actions (computeEngineActionsSafe).
 22275: - Logic rules (déclaratives) déclenchent actions à la change.
 22276: - Linker (v3.1): scan `[[token]]`, résout cibles, génère `.qflush/rome-links.json`, fournit résolution HTTP et SSE.
 22277: 
 22278: 5) Nezlephant / OC8 — Stockage caché RGBA
 22279: - Encodage/décodage de blobs (PNG / RGBA / OC8).
 22280: - Usage pour secrets (`nez:<file>`), configs, payloads.
 22281: - Intégration via `envapt-nezlephant`.
 22282: 
 22283: 6) A11 — Interface IA (prévu)
 22284: - Proxy/local LLM connector (Ollama/OpenAI/Gemini).
 22285: - Orchestration d’appels IA pour augmentation des règles NPZ/ROME.
 22286: 
 22287: 7) SPYDER — Futur moteur neuronal
 22288: - Architecture envisagée : graph de « neurones » (.ner), snapshots, routage d’état → réponses.
 22289: - Intégration future avec A11 et NPZ.
 22290: 
 22291: Le Mapping (principes)
 22292: ----------------------
 22293: - Ordre de priorité strict pour la résolution des chemins :
 22294:   1. Chemin explicite fourni
 22295:   2. Chemin détecté (detectModules)
 22296:   3. Chemin local candidate
 22297:   4. Résolution via node_modules/package
 22298:   5. Fallback NPZ (optionnel)
 22299: - Early-exit : si un chemin est valide → ne pas ré-interpréter.
 22300: 
 22301: Daemon (qflushd)
 22302: -----------------
 22303: - Expose les endpoints NPZ et Rome.
 22304: - Supervise engineHistory et telemetry (Copilot Bridge).
 22305: - SSE stream pour rome-links & telemetry.
 22306: - Audit log, option Redis.
 22307: 
 22308: Copilot Bridge
 22309: --------------
 22310: - Envoie événements/règles/télémetry vers l’extension VS et services IA.
 22311: - Fournit un canal bidirectionnel (notifications → actions).
 22312: 
 22313: Principes d’exploitation & Dev
 22314: ------------------------------
 22315: - En dev : garder Redis désactivé (fallback mémoire).
 22316: - Activer mapping uniquement quand nécessaire (`QFLUSH_ENABLE_MAPPING=1`).
 22317: - Démarrer le daemon détaché pour éviter d’ouvrir fichiers dans l’IDE (`qflush daemon --detached`).
 22318: 
 22319: Fichiers utiles
 22320: ---------------
 22321: - `.qflush/rome-index.json` — Rome index
 22322: - `.qflush/rome-links.json` — linker output
 22323: - `.qflush/services.json` & `.qflush/logs/` — BAT state & logs
 22324: 
 22325: Next steps recommandés
 22326: ----------------------
 22327: - Ajouter ce doc au README (done).
 22328: - Générer un diagramme SVG/PNG et l’ajouter dans `docs/`.
 22329: - Créer `copilot-context.md` (très court) pour fournir le résumé à Copilot.
 22330: - Intégrer tests unitaires pour NPZ encoder / checksum / linker.
 22331: 
 22332: Notes
 22333: -----
 22334: - SPYDER et A11 sont des objectifs long terme. Pour l’instant conserver les noms est acceptable ; implémentations futures clarifieront les responsabilités.
 22335: 
 22336: 
 22337: 
 22338: 
 22339:

 22373: 
 22374: ============================
 22375: FILE: installers\install-qflush.ps1
 22376: ============================
 22377: ============================
 22378: <#
 22379: PowerShell installer for QFLUSH
 22380: Supports:
 22381:  - user install (default): copies package to %APPDATA% and adds to PATH for current user
 22382:  - system install: copies package to C:\Program Files\Funesterie\QFlush and adds to system PATH (requires elevation)
 22383:  - npm global install: runs `npm install -g @funeste38/qflush` if package is published
 22384: 
 22385: Usage:
 22386:  .\install-qflush.ps1 -Mode user
 22387:  .\install-qflush.ps1 -Mode system
 22388:  .\install-qflush.ps1 -Mode npm
 22389: #>
 22390: param(
 22391:     [ValidateSet('user','system','npm')]
 22392:     [string]$Mode = 'user'
 22393: )
 22394: 
 22395: function Add-PathUser {
 22396:     param([string]$dir)
 22397:     $current = [Environment]::GetEnvironmentVariable('PATH', 'User')
 22398:     if ($current -notlike "*${dir}*") {
 22399:         [Environment]::SetEnvironmentVariable('PATH', "$current;$dir", 'User')
 22400:         Write-Host "Added $dir to user PATH"
 22401:     } else {
 22402:         Write-Host "$dir already in user PATH"
 22403:     }
 22404: }
 22405: 
 22406: function Add-PathMachine {
 22407:     param([string]$dir)
 22408:     $current = [Environment]::GetEnvironmentVariable('PATH', 'Machine')
 22409:     if ($current -notlike "*${dir}*") {
 22410:         [Environment]::SetEnvironmentVariable('PATH', "$current;$dir", 'Machine')
 22411:         Write-Host "Added $dir to machine PATH"
 22412:     } else {
 22413:         Write-Host "$dir already in machine PATH"
 22414:     }
 22415: }
 22416: 
 22417: if ($Mode -eq 'npm') {
 22418:     Write-Host "Installing via npm global..."
 22419:     npm install -g @funeste38/qflush
 22420:     exit $?
 22421: }
 22422: 
 22423: # assume script run from repo root or from extracted package
 22424: $scriptDir = Split-Path -Parent $MyInvocation.MyCommand.Definition
 22425: $source = Join-Path $scriptDir '..' 'dist'
 22426: 
 22427: if ($Mode -eq 'user') {
 22428:     $dest = Join-Path $env:APPDATA 'Funeste38\QFlush'
 22429:     New-Item -ItemType Directory -Path $dest -Force | Out-Null
 22430:     Copy-Item -Path "$scriptDir\..\dist\*" -Destination $dest -Recurse -Force
 22431:     Add-PathUser -dir $dest
 22432:     Write-Host "Installed QFLUSH to $dest (user)"
 22433:     exit 0
 22434: }
 22435: 
 22436: if ($Mode -eq 'system') {
 22437:     if (-not ([Security.Principal.WindowsPrincipal][Security.Principal.WindowsIdentity]::GetCurrent()).IsInRole([Security.Principal.WindowsBuiltInRole]::Administrator)) {
 22438:         Write-Error "System install requires elevation. Run PowerShell as Administrator."
 22439:         exit 1
 22440:     }
 22441:     $dest = 'C:\Program Files\Funesterie\QFlush'
 22442:     New-Item -ItemType Directory -Path $dest -Force | Out-Null
 22443:     Copy-Item -Path "$scriptDir\..\dist\*" -Destination $dest -Recurse -Force
 22444:     Add-PathMachine -dir $dest
 22445:     Write-Host "Installed QFLUSH to $dest (system)"
 22446:     exit 0
 22447: }
 22448: 
 22449: 
 22450: 
 22451: ============================
 22452: FILE: installers\install-qflushd.ps1
 22453: ============================
 22454: ============================
 22455: # PowerShell installer for qflushd (Windows service wrapper)
 22456: # This is an example; for production use consider NSSM or sc.exe wrapper.
 22457: 
 22458: Write-Host "This script downloads qflush and registers qflushd as a scheduled task or service."
 22459: Write-Host "Manual step: create a Windows service pointing to 'node dist/daemon/qflushd.js' using nssm or sc.exe."
 22460: 
 22461: # Example using nssm (assuming nssm.exe is available):
 22462: # nssm install qflushd "C:\Program Files\nodejs\node.exe" "C:\path\to\qflush\dist\daemon\qflushd.js"
 22463: 
 22464: Write-Host "Install instructions provided."
 22465: 
 22466: 
 22467: ============================
 22468: FILE: installers\README-install.md
 22469: ============================
 22470: ============================
 22471: # QFLUSH Installer
 22472: 
 22473: This folder contains a PowerShell installer `install-qflush.ps1` that can:
 22474: 
 22475: - Install QFLUSH for the current user (default) by copying compiled `dist` files to `%APPDATA%\Funeste38\QFlush` and adding the folder to user PATH.
 22476: - Install QFLUSH system-wide (requires Administrator) by copying to `C:\Program Files\Funesterie\QFlush` and adding to machine PATH.
 22477: - Install via npm global if the package is published: `install-qflush.ps1 -Mode npm`.
 22478: 
 22479: Usage examples:
 22480: 
 22481: PowerShell (current user):
 22482: PS> .\install-qflush.ps1 -Mode user
 22483: 
 22484: PowerShell (system/admin):
 22485: PS> Start-Process powershell -Verb runAs -ArgumentList '-NoProfile -ExecutionPolicy Bypass -File "install-qflush.ps1" -Mode system'
 22486: 
 22487: NPM global install (requires published package):
 22488: PS> .\install-qflush.ps1 -Mode npm
 22489: 
 22490: ## Notes
 22491: 
 22492: Use `qflush --help` after installation to list available commands.
 22493: 
 22494:

 22559: ============================
 22560: FILE: netlify\functions\gumroad-webhook.js
 22561: ============================
 22562: ============================
 22563: const fetch = require('node-fetch');
 22564: 
 22565: exports.handler = async function(event, context) {
 22566:   try {
 22567:     const body = event.body ? JSON.parse(event.body) : {};
 22568:     // optional: verify signature if you have one
 22569:     // forward to the local daemon if DAEMON_URL is set, otherwise process here
 22570:     const daemonUrl = process.env.DAEMON_URL || '';
 22571:     if (daemonUrl) {
 22572:       const url = `${daemonUrl.replace(/\/$/, '')}/qflush/license/webhook`;
 22573:       await fetch(url, { method: 'POST', headers: { 'Content-Type': 'application/json' }, body: JSON.stringify(body) });
 22574:       return { statusCode: 200, body: JSON.stringify({ ok: true, forwarded: url }) };
 22575:     }
 22576:     // example local processing: check refund
 22577:     const purchase = body.purchase || body.data || null;
 22578:     let action = 'noop';
 22579:     if (purchase) {
 22580:       if (purchase.refunded || purchase.chargebacked) action = 'clear_license';
 22581:       if (purchase.subscription_cancelled_at) action = 'cancel_subscription';
 22582:     }
 22583:     return { statusCode: 200, body: JSON.stringify({ ok: true, action }) };
 22584:   } catch (err) {
 22585:     return { statusCode: 500, body: JSON.stringify({ ok: false, error: String(err) }) };
 22586:   }
 22587: };
 22588: 
 22589: 
 22590: 
 22591: ============================
 22592: FILE: netlify\functions\token-exchange.js
 22593: ============================
 22594: ============================
 22595: const fetch = require('node-fetch');
 22596: 
 22597: exports.handler = async function(event, context) {
 22598:   try {
 22599:     const tokenUrl = process.env.TOKEN_URL;
 22600:     const clientId = process.env.APP_ID;
 22601:     const clientSecret = process.env.APP_SECRET;
 22602:     if (!tokenUrl || !clientId || !clientSecret) return { statusCode: 500, body: JSON.stringify({ ok:false, error:'missing config' }) };
 22603: 
 22604:     // perform client_credentials exchange
 22605:     const params = new URLSearchParams();
 22606:     params.append('grant_type', 'client_credentials');
 22607: 
 22608:     const res = await fetch(tokenUrl, {
 22609:       method: 'POST',
 22610:       headers: {
 22611:         'Content-Type': 'application/x-www-form-urlencoded',
 22612:         'Authorization': 'Basic ' + Buffer.from(clientId + ':' + clientSecret).toString('base64')
 22613:       },
 22614:       body: params.toString()
 22615:     });
 22616:     const json = await res.json();
 22617:     // optionally store token in Netlify env (not possible from function), so return it to caller
 22618:     return { statusCode: 200, body: JSON.stringify({ ok:true, token: json }) };
 22619:   } catch (err) {
 22620:     return { statusCode: 500, body: JSON.stringify({ ok:false, error:String(err) }) };
 22621:   }
 22622: };
 22623: 
 22624:

 28465: 
 28466: ============================
 28467: FILE: PUBLISH.md
 28468: ============================
 28469: ============================
 28470: # Publishing @qflush/qflush
 28471: 
 28472: This document explains how to publish the `@qflush/qflush` package to npm and includes recommended `package.json` fields.
 28473: 
 28474: NOTE: The public npm listing (package page) is currently under reconstruction. The package can still be published and installed via `npm install @qflush/qflush`, but the npm website display may be incomplete until the rebuild is finished.
 28475: 
 28476: Checklist before publishing:
 28477: 
 28478: - Bump `version` in `package.json` if republishing.
 28479: - Ensure `dist/index.js` exists and starts with `#!/usr/bin/env node`.
 28480: - Run `npm run build` and verify `dist` contains compiled JS and `.d.ts` files.
 28481: - Run `node dist/index.js --help` to verify CLI runs.
 28482: - Run `npm pack` to inspect the tarball contents before publishing.
 28483: - Ensure `package.json` `bin` points to `dist/index.js`.
 28484: - If using `.npmignore`, ensure it does not exclude `dist`.
 28485: - Confirm `prepare` script in `package.json` is present to auto-build on publish.
 28486: 
 28487: Recommended package.json fields:
 28488: 
 28489: ```json
 28490: {
 28491:   "name": "@qflush/qflush",
 28492:   "version": "0.0.0",
 28493:   "description": "QFLUSH — The Funesterie Runtime System",
 28494:   "main": "dist/index.js",
 28495:   "bin": { "qflush": "dist/index.js" },
 28496:   "files": ["dist", "README.md"],
 28497:   "publishConfig": { "access": "public" }
 28498: }
 28499: ```
 28500: 
 28501: Publish steps:
 28502: 
 28503: 1. Login to npm: `npm login` (use account that owns `@qflush` scope)
 28504: 2. From project root `cd qflush`
 28505: 3. Build: `npm run build`
 28506: 4. Publish: `npm publish --access public`
 28507: 
 28508: Testing globally without publishing:
 28509: 
 28510: - Link locally: `cd qflush && npm link`
 28511: - Test: `qflush --help` or `qflush start` or `qflush checksum list`
 28512: - Remove link: `npm unlink -g @qflush/qflush`
 28513: 
 28514: Notes on 2FA:
 28515: 
 28516: - If your npm account requires 2FA for publishing, you'll be prompted for the OTP.
 28517: 
 28518: Troubleshooting:
 28519: 
 28520: - If publish fails due to package name, ensure the scope `@qflush` exists and you have permission to publish under it.
 28521: - If `dist` missing on publish, `prepare` should build, but check logs for errors.
 28522: 
 28523: 
 28524: 
 28525: 
 28526: ============================
 28527: FILE: qflush\.github\workflows\ci.yml

 28529: ============================
 28530: name: CI
 28531: 
 28532: on:
 28533:   push:
 28534:     branches: [ master, main, 'fix/*' ]
 28535:   pull_request:
 28536:     branches: [ master, main ]
 28537: 
 28538: jobs:
 28539:   build-and-test:
 28540:     runs-on: ubuntu-latest
 28541:     steps:
 28542:       - uses: actions/checkout@v4
 28543:       - name: Use Node.js 20
 28544:         uses: actions/setup-node@v4
 28545:         with:
 28546:           node-version: '20'
 28547:       - name: Install dependencies
 28548:         run: |
 28549:           cd qflash
 28550:           npm ci
 28551:       - name: Build
 28552:         run: |
 28553:           cd qflash
 28554:           npm run build
 28555:       - name: Run tests
 28556:         run: |
 28557:           cd qflash
 28558:           npm test
 28559: 
 28560:   integration-dry-run:
 28561:     needs: build-and-test
 28562:     runs-on: ubuntu-latest
 28563:     steps:
 28564:       - uses: actions/checkout@v4
 28565:       - name: Use Node.js 20
 28566:         uses: actions/setup-node@v4
 28567:         with:
 28568:           node-version: '20'
 28569:       - name: Install dependencies
 28570:         run: |
 28571:           cd qflash
 28572:           npm ci
 28573:       - name: Build
 28574:         run: |
 28575:           cd qflash
 28576:           npm run build
 28577:       - name: Integration dry-run
 28578:         run: |
 28579:           cd qflash
 28580:           node dist/index.js start --verbose --dry-run
 28581:         timeout-minutes: 10

 28591: 
 28592: ============================
 28593: FILE: qflush\docs\FCL_README.md
 28594: ============================
 28595: ============================
 28596: Funesterie Config Language (FCL) - README
 28597: 
 28598: FCL is a small, human-friendly format to declare projects, services and pipelines for Funesterie.
 28599: 
 28600: Sections:
 28601: - `@project` global metadata (name, owner, defaultEnv)
 28602: - `@env <name>` environment variables and URLs
 28603: - `@service <name>` description of a launchable service (path, start command, port)
 28604: - `@pipeline <name>` ordered list of services to run together
 28605: 
 28606: Examples:
 28607: 
 28608: @project
 28609:   name = my-stack
 28610:   owner = alice
 28611: 
 28612: @env dev
 28613:   url = http://localhost:3000
 28614: 
 28615: @service api
 28616:   type = node
 28617:   path = apps/api
 28618:   start = pnpm dev:api
 28619:   port = 3000
 28620: 
 28621: @pipeline dev-all
 28622:   steps = ["api"]
 28623: 
 28624: Usage:
 28625: - Place `funesterie.fcl` in the repo root.
 28626: - `qflash compose up` will read `funesterie.fcl` if present and bring up declared services.
 28627: 
 28628: This README is minimal and the spec is intentionally small to keep portability.
 28629: 
 28630: 
 28631: 
 28632: ============================
 28633: FILE: qflush\docs\FCL_SPEC.md
 28634: ============================
 28635: ============================
 28636: Funesterie Config Language (FCL) - Short Spec
 28637: 
 28638: 1. File name: `funesterie.fcl`
 28639: 2. Sections start with `@section` optionally followed by a name: `@service api` or `@env dev`.
 28640: 3. Key-value syntax: `key = value` (strings or numbers).
 28641: 4. Lists use `[]` with comma-separated values: `steps = ["api", "web"]`.
 28642: 5. Comments start with `#` or `//` and extend to end-of-line.
 28643: 6. Supported sections: `@project`, `@env`, `@service`, `@pipeline`.
 28644: 7. `@service <name>` supports keys: `type`, `path`, `start`, `port`, `env`, `token`.
 28645: 8. `@pipeline <name>` supports keys: `description`, `steps` (list of service names).
 28646: 9. Values can be quoted strings or unquoted tokens (no complex expressions).
 28647: 10. FCL is intentionally minimal and designed to be parsed without heavy dependencies.
 28648: 
 28649: Example:
 28650: 
 28651: @service api
 28652:   type = node
 28653:   path = apps/api
 28654:   start = npm run dev
 28655:   port = 3000
 28656: 
 28657: @pipeline dev-all
 28658:   steps = ["api", "web"]
 28659: 
 28660: 
 28661: 
 28662: ============================
 28663: FILE: qflush\examples\funesterie.yml
 28664: ============================
 28665: ============================
 28666: modules:
 28667:   nezlephant:
 28668:     path: ./nezlephant
 28669:     port: 3001
 28670:   envaptex:
 28671:     path: ./envaptex
 28672:     port: 3002
 28673:   freeland:
 28674:     path: ./freeland
 28675:     port: 3003
 28676:   bat:
 28677:     path: ./bat
 28678:     port: 3004
 28679:   rome:
 28680:     path: ./rome
 28681:     port: 3000
 28682: 
 28683: 
 28684: 
 28685: ============================
 28686: FILE: qflush\installers\install-all.ps1
 28687: ============================
 28688: ============================
 28689: <#
 28690: One-step web-style installer for Funesterie (downloads QFLASH and runs installer)
 28691: This script assumes you host funeste38-qflash-<version>.tgz at a reachable URL.
 28692: #>
 28693: param(
 28694:     [string]$PackageUrl = "https://example.com/funeste38-qflash-0.1.1.tgz",
 28695:     [string]$Mode = 'user'
 28696: )
 28697: 
 28698: $temp = Join-Path $env:TEMP "qflash_install.tgz"
 28699: Invoke-WebRequest -Uri $PackageUrl -OutFile $temp
 28700: 
 28701: # extract to AppData
 28702: $dest = Join-Path $env:APPDATA "Funeste38\QFlash"
 28703: New-Item -ItemType Directory -Path $dest -Force | Out-Null
 28704: 
 28705: Add-Type -AssemblyName System.IO.Compression.FileSystem
 28706: [System.IO.Compression.ZipFile]::ExtractToDirectory($temp, $dest)
 28707: 
 28708: Write-Host "QFLASH extracted to $dest"
 28709: 
 28710: # add to user PATH
 28711: $current = [Environment]::GetEnvironmentVariable('PATH', 'User')
 28712: if ($current -notlike "*$dest*") {
 28713:   [Environment]::SetEnvironmentVariable('PATH', "$current;$dest", 'User')
 28714:   Write-Host "Added $dest to user PATH"
 28715: }
 28716: 
 28717: Write-Host "Installation complete. Open a new shell and run 'qflash --help'"
 28718: 
 28719: 
 28720: 
 28721: ============================
 28722: FILE: qflush\installers\install-qflash.ps1
 28723: ============================
 28724: ============================
 28725: <#
 28726: PowerShell installer for QFLASH
 28727: Supports:
 28728:  - user install (default): copies package to %APPDATA% and adds to PATH for current user
 28729:  - system install: copies package to C:\Program Files\Funesterie\QFlash and adds to system PATH (requires elevation)
 28730:  - npm global install: runs `npm install -g @funeste38/qflash` if package is published
 28731: 
 28732: Usage:
 28733:  .\install-qflash.ps1 -Mode user
 28734:  .\install-qflash.ps1 -Mode system
 28735:  .\install-qflash.ps1 -Mode npm
 28736: #>
 28737: param(
 28738:     [ValidateSet('user','system','npm')]
 28739:     [string]$Mode = 'user'
 28740: )
 28741: 
 28742: function Add-PathUser {
 28743:     param([string]$dir)
 28744:     $current = [Environment]::GetEnvironmentVariable('PATH', 'User')
 28745:     if ($current -notlike "*$dir*") {
 28746:         [Environment]::SetEnvironmentVariable('PATH', "$current;$dir", 'User')
 28747:         Write-Host "Added $dir to user PATH"
 28748:     } else {
 28749:         Write-Host "$dir already in user PATH"
 28750:     }
 28751: }
 28752: 
 28753: function Add-PathMachine {
 28754:     param([string]$dir)
 28755:     $current = [Environment]::GetEnvironmentVariable('PATH', 'Machine')
 28756:     if ($current -notlike "*$dir*") {
 28757:         [Environment]::SetEnvironmentVariable('PATH', "$current;$dir", 'Machine')
 28758:         Write-Host "Added $dir to machine PATH"
 28759:     } else {
 28760:         Write-Host "$dir already in machine PATH"
 28761:     }
 28762: }
 28763: 
 28764: if ($Mode -eq 'npm') {
 28765:     Write-Host "Installing via npm global..."
 28766:     npm install -g @funeste38/qflash
 28767:     exit $?
 28768: }
 28769: 
 28770: # assume script run from repo root or from extracted package
 28771: $scriptDir = Split-Path -Parent $MyInvocation.MyCommand.Definition
 28772: $source = Join-Path $scriptDir '..' 'dist'
 28773: 
 28774: if ($Mode -eq 'user') {
 28775:     $dest = Join-Path $env:APPDATA 'Funeste38\QFlash'
 28776:     New-Item -ItemType Directory -Path $dest -Force | Out-Null
 28777:     Copy-Item -Path "$scriptDir\..\dist\*" -Destination $dest -Recurse -Force
 28778:     Add-PathUser -dir $dest
 28779:     Write-Host "Installed QFLASH to $dest (user)"
 28780:     exit 0
 28781: }
 28782: 
 28783: if ($Mode -eq 'system') {
 28784:     if (-not ([Security.Principal.WindowsPrincipal][Security.Principal.WindowsIdentity]::GetCurrent()).IsInRole([Security.Principal.WindowsBuiltInRole]::Administrator)) {
 28785:         Write-Error "System install requires elevation. Run PowerShell as Administrator."
 28786:         exit 1
 28787:     }
 28788:     $dest = 'C:\Program Files\Funesterie\QFlash'
 28789:     New-Item -ItemType Directory -Path $dest -Force | Out-Null
 28790:     Copy-Item -Path "$scriptDir\..\dist\*" -Destination $dest -Recurse -Force
 28791:     Add-PathMachine -dir $dest
 28792:     Write-Host "Installed QFLASH to $dest (system)"
 28793:     exit 0
 28794: }
 28795: 
 28796: 
 28797: 
 28798: ============================
 28799: FILE: qflush\installers\install-qflashd.ps1
 28800: ============================
 28801: ============================
 28802: # PowerShell installer for qflashd (Windows service wrapper)
 28803: # This is an example; for production use consider NSSM or sc.exe wrapper.
 28804: 
 28805: Write-Host "This script downloads qflash and registers qflashd as a scheduled task or service."
 28806: Write-Host "Manual step: create a Windows service pointing to 'node dist/daemon/qflashd.js' using nssm or sc.exe."
 28807: 
 28808: # Example using nssm (assuming nssm.exe is available):
 28809: # nssm install qflashd "C:\Program Files\nodejs\node.exe" "C:\path\to\qflash\dist\daemon\qflashd.js"
 28810: 
 28811: Write-Host "Install instructions provided."
 28812: 
 28813: 
 28814: 
 28815: ============================
 28816: FILE: qflush\installers\README-install.md
 28817: ============================
 28818: ============================
 28819: # QFLASH Installer
 28820: 
 28821: This folder contains a PowerShell installer `install-qflash.ps1` that can:
 28822: 
 28823: - Install QFLASH for the current user (default) by copying compiled `dist` files to `%APPDATA%\Funeste38\QFlash` and adding the folder to user PATH.
 28824: - Install QFLASH system-wide (requires Administrator) by copying to `C:\Program Files\Funesterie\QFlash` and adding to machine PATH.
 28825: - Install via npm global if the package is published: `install-qflash.ps1 -Mode npm`.
 28826: 
 28827: Usage examples:
 28828: 
 28829: PowerShell (current user):
 28830: PS> .\install-qflash.ps1 -Mode user
 28831: 
 28832: PowerShell (system/admin):
 28833: PS> Start-Process powershell -Verb runAs -ArgumentList '-NoProfile -ExecutionPolicy Bypass -File "install-qflash.ps1" -Mode system'
 28834: 
 28835: NPM global install (requires published package):
 28836: PS> .\install-qflash.ps1 -Mode npm
 28837: 
 28838: 
 28839:

 28841: FILE: qflush\LICENSE-COMMERCIAL.md
 28842: ============================
 28843: ============================
 28844: FUNESTERIE COMMERCIAL LICENSE (FCL-PRO 1.0)
 28845: 
 28846: A valid commercial license is required for:
 28847: 
 28848: • Using FCL inside a business or company
 28849: • SaaS products, cloud tools, internal dev tools
 28850: • Any paid product integrating FCL
 28851: • Distributing commercial software using FCL
 28852: • Hosting services that process FCL files
 28853: 
 28854: Pricing:
 28855: - Indie developer:      39€/year
 28856: - Small startup (<10):  99€/year per developer
 28857: - Company:              299€/year per developer
 28858: - Enterprise:           custom contract
 28859: 
 28860: Benefits:
 28861: ✓ Unlimited commercial usage
 28862: ✓ Authorized FCL integration in products
 28863: ✓ Allowed redistribution inside your software
 28864: ✓ “FCL Compatible” badge usage
 28865: ✓ Priority support email
 28866: 
 28867: Prohibited:
 28868: ✗ Reselling FCL as a standalone tool
 28869: ✗ Publishing a competing FCL alternative
 28870: 
 28871: Contact: cellaurojeffrey@gmail.com
 28872: 
 28873: To purchase a commercial license for FCL:
 28874: https://cellaurojeff.gumroad.com/l/jxktq

 28882: FUNESTERIE NON-COMMERCIAL LICENSE (FCL-NC 1.0)
 28883: 
 28884: You may use FCL for personal, private or hobby projects at no cost.
 28885: 
 28886: Allowed:
 28887: ✓ Personal learning
 28888: ✓ Hobby projects
 28889: ✓ Free open-source projects
 28890: ✓ Tutorials, experiments, prototypes
 28891: 
 28892: Not allowed:
 28893: ✗ Use inside a company
 28894: ✗ Any revenue-generating product
 28895: ✗ SaaS integration
 28896: ✗ Paid applications
 28897: ✗ Commercial distribution
 28898: 
 28899: Commercial use requires a Funesterie Commercial License.

 28926:   ],
 28927:   "scripts": {
 28928:     "build": "tsc -p tsconfig.json",
 28929:     "prepare": "npm run build",
 28930:     "test": "node dist/tests/smartchain.test.js",

 28932:   },
