 29312: 
 29313: 
 29314: ============================
 29315: FILE: qflush\PUBLISH.md
 29316: ============================
 29317: ============================
 29318: # Publishing @funeste38/qflash
 29319: 
 29320: Checklist before publishing:
 29321: 
 29322: - Bump `version` in `package.json` if republishing.
 29323: - Ensure `dist/index.js` exists and starts with `#!/usr/bin/env node`.
 29324: - Run `npm run build` and verify `dist` contains compiled JS and `.d.ts` files.
 29325: - Run `node dist/index.js --help` to verify CLI runs.
 29326: - Run `npm pack` to inspect the tarball contents before publishing.
 29327: - Ensure `package.json` `bin` points to `dist/index.js`.
 29328: - If using `.npmignore`, ensure it does not exclude `dist`.
 29329: - Confirm `prepare` script in `package.json` is present to auto-build on publish.
 29330: 
 29331: Publish steps:
 29332: 
 29333: 1. Login to npm: `npm login` (use account that owns `@funeste38` scope)
 29334: 2. From project root `cd qflash`
 29335: 3. Build: `npm run build`
 29336: 4. Publish: `npm publish --access public`
 29337: 
 29338: Testing globally without publishing:
 29339: 
 29340: - Link locally: `cd qflash && npm link`
 29341: - Test: `qflash --help` or `qflash start`
 29342: - Remove link: `npm unlink -g @funeste38/qflash`
 29343: 
 29344: Notes on 2FA:
 29345: - If your npm account requires 2FA for publishing, you'll be prompted for the OTP.
 29346: 
 29347: Troubleshooting:
 29348: - If publish fails due to package name, ensure the scope `@funeste38` exists and you have permission.
 29349: - If `dist` missing on publish, `prepare` should build, but check logs for errors.
 29350: 
 29351: 
 29352: 
 29353: ============================
 29354: FILE: qflush\README.md
 29355: ============================
 29356: ============================
 29357: # @funeste38/qflash ⚡
 29358: 
 29359: QFLASH is the orchestrator of the Funesterie ecosystem.
 29360: Start, stop, purge, inspect, and synchronize modules.
 29361: 
 29362: ## Release
 29363: 
 29364: Latest release: v0.1.4 — https://github.com/jEFFLEZ/qflash/releases/tag/v0.1.4
 29365: 
 29366: ## Install
 29367: 
 29368: Global (recommended):
 29369: 
 29370: npm install -g @funeste38/qflash
 29371: 
 29372: PowerShell one-liner (if installer hosted):
 29373: 
 29374: ```powershell
 29375: iwr -useb https://raw.githubusercontent.com/jEFFLEZ/qflash/main/installers/install-qflash.ps1 | iex
 29376: ```
 29377: 
 29378: ## Commercial license
 29379: 
 29380: To purchase a commercial license for FCL:
 29381: https://cellaurojeff.gumroad.com/l/jxktq
 29382: 
 29383: ## Commands
 29384: 
 29385: - `qflash start`      → launch ecosystem (rome, nezlephant, envaptex, freeland, bat)
 29386: - `qflash kill`       → kill all processes cleanly
 29387: - `qflash purge`      → flush caches + logs + sessions
 29388: - `qflash inspect`    → display status and active ports
 29389: - `qflash config`     → generate default .env/config files
 29390: 
 29391: ## Examples and templates
 29392: 
 29393: Example compose files are provided in `examples/`:
 29394: 
 29395: - `examples/funesterie.yml` — YAML compose example
 29396: - `examples/funesterie.fcl` — Funesterie Config Language (FCL) example
 29397: 
 29398: Use `qflash compose up` to bring up the example stack.
 29399: 
 29400: ## Flags and advanced options
 29401: 
 29402: Global flags (examples):
 29403: - `--dev`            Enable developer mode (may change logging/behavior)
 29404: - `--fresh`          Implicitly purge before starting (maps to `purge` -> `start`)
 29405: - `--force`          Force restart semantics (may add `kill` when starting)
 29406: - `--proxy=NAME`     Proxy selection, forwarded to modules
 29407: 
 29408: Service targeting:
 29409: - `--service <name>` Select a service to target (examples: `rome`, `nezlephant`, `envaptex`, `freeland`, `bat`).
 29410: - `--path <path>`    Assign a path for the most recent `--service` declared.
 29411: - `--token <token>`  Assign a token for the most recent `--service` declared.
 29412: 
 29413: Examples:
 29414: 
 29415: ```
 29416: qflash start --service rome --path D:/rome --token ABC123
 29417: qflash start --service nezlephant --service freeland
 29418: qflash start --service nezlephant --service freeland --fresh
 29419: qflash config --service freeland
 29420: qflash purge --fresh
 29421: ```
 29422: 
 29423: ## Migration guide (meta-package)
 29424: 
 29425: If you currently depend on individual Funesterie packages like `@funeste38/rome`, `@funeste38/nezlephant`, `@funeste38/freeland`, `@funeste38/bat`, prefer to switch to the meta-package `@funeste38/qflash` which re-exports them.
 29426: 
 29427: Quick steps:
 29428: 
 29429: 1. Add the meta-package in your app:
 29430: 
 29431: ```bash
 29432: npm install @funeste38/qflash
 29433: ```
 29434: 
 29435: 2. Replace imports in your codebase (example):
 29436: 
 29437: Before:
 29438: ```js
 29439: import { run } from '@funeste38/rome'
 29440: import { encode } from '@funeste38/nezlephant'
 29441: ```
 29442: 
 29443: After:
 29444: ```js
 29445: import { Rome, Nez, Freeland, Bat } from '@funeste38/qflash'
 29446: Rome.run(...)
 29447: Nez.encode(...)
 29448: ```
 29449: 
 29450: 3. In `package.json` of the app, keep only the dependency on `@funeste38/qflash` and remove the older individual packages.
 29451: 
 29452: 4. For branch migration: prefer creating new branches from `main` (which contains `@funeste38/qflash`). For older branches, replace imports during the merge.
 29453: 
 29454: ## One-liner installer
 29455: 
 29456: Example PowerShell one-liner (host your installer script raw on GitHub or your CDN):
 29457: 
 29458: ```powershell
 29459: iwr -useb https://raw.githubusercontent.com/jEFFLEZ/qflash/main/installers/install-qflash.ps1 | iex
 29460: ```
 29461: 
 29462: ## Future
 29463: 
 29464: Future improvements will focus on better detection, richer SmartChain rules and optional integrations.
 29465: 
 29466: 
 29467: 
 29468: ============================
 29469: FILE: qflush\README-FCL.md
 29470: ============================
 29471: ============================
 29472: # FCL — Funesterie Config Language
 29473: Official Specification — Version 1.0
 29474: 
 29475: FCL is a human-friendly configuration language designed for orchestrators,
 29476: multi-service stacks, automation pipelines and modern application tooling.
 29477: 
 29478: It is owned and maintained by Funesterie™.
 29479: 
 29480: ### Quick Example
 29481: 
 29482: @project
 29483:   name = my-project
 29484:   version = 1.0
 29485: 
 29486: @service api
 29487:   path = apps/api
 29488:   start = "pnpm dev"
 29489: 
 29490: @pipeline dev
 29491:   steps = ["api"]
 29492: 
 29493: ### Syntax Overview
 29494: 
 29495: - Blocks start with @keyword or @keyword name
 29496: - Key-value syntax uses: key = value
 29497: - Strings may use "quotes"
 29498: - Lists use: [ item1, item2, item3 ]
 29499: - Comments: # or //
 29500: 
 29501: ### Purpose
 29502: 
 29503: FCL is designed to be:
 29504: - Lightweight
 29505: - Easy to write
 29506: - Easy to parse
 29507: - Tool-agnostic
 29508: - Human-readable
 29509: 
 29510: ### License
 29511: 
 29512: Personal usage is free.  
 29513: Commercial usage requires a Funesterie™ Commercial License.
 29514: 
 29515: To purchase a commercial license for FCL:
 29516: https://cellaurojeff.gumroad.com/l/jxktq
 29517: 
 29518: See:
 29519: - LICENSE-FUNESTERIE.txt
 29520: - LICENSE-NON-COMMERCIAL.md
 29521: - LICENSE-COMMERCIAL.md
 29522: - TRADEMARK.md
 29523: 
 29524: ### Badge (text)
 29525: 
 29526: [ FUNESTERIE™ LICENSED FORMAT ]
 29527:        FCL – Official Format
 29528: ---------------------------------
 29529: This project uses the Funesterie™
 29530: config language under license.
 29531: 
 29532: 
 29533: 
 29534: ============================
 29535: FILE: qflush\src\chain\smartChain.ts
 29536: ============================
 29537: ============================
 29538: import { logger } from "../utils/logger";
 29539: import { runDetect } from "../commands/detect";
 29540: import { runConfig } from "../commands/config";
 29541: import { runPurge } from "../commands/purge";
 29542: import { runKill } from "../commands/kill";
 29543: import { runStart } from "../commands/start";
 29544: import { runExodia } from "../commands/exodia";
 29545: 
 29546: const ORDER = ["detect", "config", "purge", "kill", "start", "exodia"];
 29547: 
 29548: export type QFlashOptions = {
 29549:   global?: Record<string, any>;
 29550:   modulePaths?: Record<string, string>;
 29551:   tokens?: Record<string, string>;
 29552:   flags?: Record<string, boolean | string>;
 29553:   detected?: Record<string, any>;
 29554:   services?: string[];
 29555: };
 29556: 
 29557: function parseArgs(argv: string[]) {
 29558:   const cmds: string[] = [];
 29559:   const flags: Record<string, boolean | string> = {};
 29560:   const modulePaths: Record<string, string> = {};
 29561:   const tokens: Record<string, string> = {};
 29562:   const services: string[] = [];
 29563: 
 29564:   let currentService: string | undefined;
 29565:   let i = 0;
 29566:   while (i < argv.length) {
 29567:     const a = argv[i];
 29568:     if (!a.startsWith("-")) {
 29569:       cmds.push(a.toLowerCase());
 29570:       i++;
 29571:       continue;
 29572:     }
 29573:     const clean = a.replace(/^--?/, "");
 29574: 
 29575:     if (clean === "service" || clean === "s") {
 29576:       const next = argv[i + 1];
 29577:       if (next && !next.startsWith("-")) {
 29578:         currentService = next.toLowerCase();
 29579:         services.push(currentService);
 29580:         i += 2;
 29581:         continue;
 29582:       } else {
 29583:         i++;
 29584:         continue;
 29585:       }
 29586:     }
 29587: 
 29588:     if (clean === "path") {
 29589:       const next = argv[i + 1];
 29590:       if (next && !next.startsWith("-")) {
 29591:         if (currentService) modulePaths[currentService] = next;
 29592:         i += 2;
 29593:         continue;
 29594:       }
 29595:       i++;
 29596:       continue;
 29597:     }
 29598: 
 29599:     if (clean === "token") {
 29600:       const next = argv[i + 1];
 29601:       if (next && !next.startsWith("-")) {
 29602:         if (currentService) tokens[currentService] = next;
 29603:         i += 2;
 29604:         continue;
 29605:       }
 29606:       i++;
 29607:       continue;
 29608:     }
 29609: 
 29610:     const kv = clean.split("=");
 29611:     if (kv.length === 2) {
 29612:       flags[kv[0]] = kv[1];
 29613:       i++;
 29614:       continue;
 29615:     }
 29616: 
 29617:     const next = argv[i + 1];
 29618:     if (next && !next.startsWith("-")) {
 29619:       flags[clean] = next;
 29620:       i += 2;
 29621:       continue;
 29622:     }
 29623:     flags[clean] = true;
 29624:     i++;
 29625:   }
 29626: 
 29627:   return { cmds, flags, modulePaths, tokens, services };
 29628: }
 29629: 
 29630: export function buildPipeline(argv: string[]) {
 29631:   const { cmds, flags, modulePaths, tokens, services } = parseArgs(argv);
 29632:   const unique = Array.from(new Set(cmds));
 29633:   const known = unique.filter((c) => ORDER.includes(c));
 29634: 
 29635:   if (known.length === 0)
 29636:     return {
 29637:       pipeline: ["detect", "config", "start"],
 29638:       options: { flags, modulePaths, tokens, global: {} as any, services },
 29639:     };
 29640: 
 29641:   // build set with dependencies
 29642:   const set = new Set<string>(known);
 29643:   // dependencies mapping
 29644:   const deps: Record<string, string[]> = {
 29645:     start: ["config"],
 29646:     config: ["detect"],
 29647:     purge: ["detect"],
 29648:   };
 29649: 
 29650:   // add dependencies recursively
 29651:   function addDeps(cmd: string) {
 29652:     const ds = deps[cmd] || [];
 29653:     for (const d of ds) {
 29654:       if (!set.has(d)) {
 29655:         set.add(d);
 29656:         addDeps(d);
 29657:       }
 29658:     }
 29659:   }
 29660:   for (const k of Array.from(set)) addDeps(k);
 29661: 
 29662:   let final: string[] = [];
 29663: 
 29664:   // Flag-driven transformations
 29665:   if (flags["fresh"]) {
 29666:     set.add("purge");
 29667:     // ensure purge runs before start
 29668:   }
 29669:   if (flags["force"]) {
 29670:     // make sure kill runs before start
 29671:     set.add("kill");
 29672:   }
 29673: 
 29674:   const requestedKill = known.includes("kill");
 29675: 
 29676:   if (requestedKill) {
 29677:     // put kill first if user explicitly requested it
 29678:     final.push("kill");
 29679:     for (const k of ORDER) {
 29680:       if (k === "kill") continue;
 29681:       if (set.has(k)) final.push(k);
 29682:     }
 29683:   } else {
 29684:     for (const k of ORDER) {
 29685:       if (set.has(k)) final.push(k);
 29686:     }
 29687:   }
 29688: 
 29689:   // remove duplicates and preserve order
 29690:   final = final.filter((v, i) => final.indexOf(v) === i);
 29691: 
 29692:   logger.info(`SmartChain built pipeline: ${final.join(" -> ")}`);
 29693:   const options: QFlashOptions = { global: {}, flags, modulePaths, tokens, services };
 29694:   return { pipeline: final, options };
 29695: }
 29696: 
 29697: export async function executePipeline(pipeline: string[], options: QFlashOptions) {
 29698:   for (const step of pipeline) {
 29699:     logger.info(`Executing pipeline step: ${step}`);
 29700:     switch (step) {
 29701:       case "detect": {
 29702:         const detected = await runDetect(options);
 29703:         options.detected = detected || {};
 29704:         if (detected && typeof detected === "object") {
 29705:           options.modulePaths = { ...(options.modulePaths || {}), ...(detected.paths || {}) };
 29706:         }
 29707:         break;
 29708:       }
 29709:       case "config":
 29710:         await runConfig(options);
 29711:         break;
 29712:       case "purge":
 29713:         await runPurge(options);
 29714:         break;
 29715:       case "kill":
 29716:         await runKill(options);
 29717:         break;
 29718:       case "start":
 29719:         await runStart(options);
 29720:         break;
 29721:       case "exodia":
 29722:         await runExodia(options);
 29723:         break;
 29724:       default:
 29725:         logger.warn(`Unknown pipeline step: ${step}`);
 29726:     }
 29727:   }
 29728: }
 29729: 
 29730: 
 29731: 
 29732: ============================
 29733: FILE: qflush\src\cli\help.ts
 29734: ============================
 29735: ============================
 29736: import { logger } from "../utils/logger";
 29737: 
 29738: export function showHelp() {
 29739:   logger.info(`qflash - Funesterie orchestrator`);
 29740:   console.log(`
 29741: Usage:
 29742:   qflash [command] [options]
 29743: 
 29744: Commands:
 29745:   start        Launch selected services (default: detect → config → start)
 29746:   kill         Kill running services
 29747:   purge        Clear caches, logs and sessions
 29748:   inspect      Show running services and ports
 29749:   config       Generate missing .env/config files
 29750: 
 29751: Options (examples):
 29752:   --service rome --path D:/rome --token ABC123     Target a specific service and give path/token
 29753:   --service nezlephant --service freeland          Target multiple services
 29754:   --dev --fresh                                    Global flags (dev mode, fresh start)
 29755:   --force                                          Force restart semantics (implies kill before start)
 29756: 
 29757: Examples:
 29758:   qflash start --service rome --path D:/rome
 29759:   qflash start --service nezlephant --service freeland --fresh
 29760:   qflash config --service freeland
 29761:   qflash purge --fresh
 29762: 
 29763: `);
 29764: }
 29765:

 29767: 
 29768: ============================
 29769: FILE: qflush\src\commands\compose.ts
 29770: ============================
 29771: ============================
 29772: import { readCompose } from '../compose/parser';
 29773: import { logger } from '../utils/logger';
 29774: import { runStart } from './start';
 29775: import { startProcess, listRunning } from '../supervisor';
 29776: import { runPurge } from './purge';
 29777: import fs from 'fs';
 29778: import { Tail } from 'tail';
 29779: 
 29780: export async function runCompose(argv: string[]) {
 29781:   const sub = argv[0];
 29782:   const compose = readCompose();
 29783:   if (!compose) {
 29784:     logger.error('No funesterie.yml or funesterie.fcl found');
 29785:     return;
 29786:   }
 29787:   if (sub === 'up') {
 29788:     // support --background flag
 29789:     const bg = argv.includes('--background') || argv.includes('-b');
 29790:     const modules = Object.keys(compose.modules);
 29791:     for (const m of modules) {
 29792:       const def = compose.modules[m];
 29793:       logger.info(`Bringing up ${m} from ${def.path || 'package'}`);
 29794:       if (bg) {
 29795:         // start in background using supervisor
 29796:         const logPath = `${process.cwd()}/.qflash/logs/${m}.log`;
 29797:         startProcess(m, def.path || m, [], { cwd: def.path || process.cwd(), detached: true, logPath });
 29798:       } else {
 29799:         await runStart({ services: [m], modulePaths: { [m]: def.path }, flags: {} } as any);
 29800:       }
 29801:     }
 29802:     return;
 29803:   }
 29804:   if (sub === 'down') {
 29805:     logger.info('Bringing down all modules');
 29806:     await runPurge();
 29807:     return;
 29808:   }
 29809:   if (sub === 'restart') {
 29810:     const name = argv[1];
 29811:     if (!name) {
 29812:       logger.info('Specify module to restart');
 29813:       return;
 29814:     }
 29815:     // naive: stop and start
 29816:     const running = listRunning();
 29817:     if (running.find(r => r.name === name)) {
 29818:       // stop
 29819:       await import('../supervisor').then(s => s.stopProcess(name));
 29820:     }
 29821:     const def = compose.modules[name];
 29822:     if (!def) { logger.info('Unknown module'); return; }
 29823:     await runStart({ services: [name], modulePaths: { [name]: def.path }, flags: {} } as any);
 29824:     return;
 29825:   }
 29826:   if (sub === 'logs') {
 29827:     const name = argv[1];
 29828:     if (!name) { logger.info('Specify module name'); return; }
 29829:     const logFile = `${process.cwd()}/.qflash/logs/${name}.log`;
 29830:     if (!fs.existsSync(logFile)) { logger.info('No log file found'); return; }
 29831:     const t = new Tail(logFile, { fromBeginning: false, retry: true });
 29832:     t.on('line', (data: any) => console.log(data));
 29833:     t.on('error', (err: any) => console.error(err));
 29834:     return;
 29835:   }
 29836:   logger.info('Usage: qflash compose [up|down|restart|logs]');
 29837: }
 29838: 
 29839: 
 29840: 
 29841: ============================
 29842: FILE: qflush\src\commands\config.ts
 29843: ============================
 29844: ============================
 29845: import { promises as fs } from "fs";
 29846: import { logger } from "../utils/logger";
 29847: import { resolvePaths } from "../utils/paths";
 29848: import { QFlashOptions } from "../chain/smartChain";
 29849: 
 29850: export async function runConfig(opts?: QFlashOptions) {
 29851:   logger.info("qflash: generating default configs...");
 29852:   const detected = opts?.detected || {};
 29853:   const paths = resolvePaths(detected);
 29854:   for (const key of Object.keys(paths)) {
 29855:     const p = paths[key];
 29856:     if (!p) continue;
 29857:     const envFile = `${p}/.env`;
 29858:     try {
 29859:       await fs.access(envFile);
 29860:       logger.info(`${key}: .env already exists`);
 29861:     } catch {
 29862:       const content = `# ${key} default env\nPORT=3000\nTOKEN=changeme\n`;
 29863:       await fs.mkdir(p, { recursive: true });
 29864:       await fs.writeFile(envFile, content, { encoding: "utf8" });
 29865:       logger.success(`Created ${envFile}`);
 29866:     }
 29867:   }
 29868: }
 29869: 
 29870: 
 29871: 
 29872: ============================
 29873: FILE: qflush\src\commands\detect.ts
 29874: ============================
 29875: ============================
 29876: import { detectModules } from "../utils/detect";
 29877: import { logger } from "../utils/logger";
 29878: import { QFlashOptions } from "../chain/smartChain";
 29879: 
 29880: export async function runDetect(_opts?: QFlashOptions) {
 29881:   logger.info("qflash: detecting modules...");
 29882:   const detected = await detectModules();
 29883:   for (const k of Object.keys(detected)) {
 29884:     const v = detected[k];
 29885:     logger.info(`${k}: ${v.running ? 'running' : 'stopped'}`);
 29886:   }
 29887:   // return a normalized object
 29888:   return { detected, paths: {} };
 29889: }
 29890: 
 29891: 
 29892: 
 29893: ============================
 29894: FILE: qflush\src\commands\doctor.ts
 29895: ============================
 29896: ============================
 29897: import { logger } from '../utils/logger';
 29898: import { detectModules } from '../utils/detect';
 29899: import { httpProbe } from '../utils/health';
 29900: import { SERVICE_MAP } from '../utils/paths';
 29901: import { ensurePackageInstalled } from '../utils/exec';
 29902: 
 29903: export async function runDoctor(argv: string[] = []) {
 29904:   const fix = argv.includes('--fix') || argv.includes('-f');
 29905: 
 29906:   logger.info('qflash: running doctor checks...');
 29907:   const detected = await detectModules();
 29908:   for (const k of Object.keys(detected)) {
 29909:     const v = detected[k];
 29910:     logger.info(`${k}: installed=${v.installed} running=${v.running} path=${v.path || 'n/a'}`);
 29911:     if (v.bin && v.path) {
 29912:       logger.info(`  bin: ${v.bin}`);
 29913:     }
 29914:   }
 29915: 
 29916:   // check node version
 29917:   logger.info(`Node version: ${process.version}`);
 29918: 
 29919:   // simple http check example
 29920:   const httpOk = await httpProbe('http://localhost:80', 500);
 29921:   logger.info(`HTTP localhost:80 reachable: ${httpOk}`);
 29922: 
 29923:   if (fix) {
 29924:     logger.info('Doctor fix: attempting to install missing Funeste38 packages...');
 29925:     for (const name of Object.keys(SERVICE_MAP)) {
 29926:       const pkg = SERVICE_MAP[name].pkg;
 29927:       const detectedInfo = detected[name];
 29928:       if (!detectedInfo || !detectedInfo.installed) {
 29929:         logger.info(`Installing ${pkg} for service ${name}...`);
 29930:         const ok = ensurePackageInstalled(pkg);
 29931:         if (ok) logger.success(`Installed ${pkg}`);
 29932:         else logger.warn(`Failed to install ${pkg}`);
 29933:       } else {
 29934:         logger.info(`${pkg} already installed`);
 29935:       }
 29936:     }
 29937:   }
 29938: 
 29939:   logger.info('Doctor checks complete');
 29940: }
 29941:

 29951: export async function runExodia(_opts?: QFlashOptions) {
 29952:   logger.warn("EXODIA PROTOCOL PENDING");

 29957: ============================
 29958: FILE: qflush\src\commands\inspect.ts
 29959: ============================
 29960: ============================
 29961: import { logger } from "../utils/logger";
 29962: import { detectModules } from "../utils/detect";
 29963: import { listRunning } from "../supervisor";
 29964: import { QFlashOptions } from "../chain/smartChain";
 29965: 
 29966: export async function runInspect(opts?: QFlashOptions) {
 29967:   logger.info("qflash: inspecting ecosystem...");
 29968:   const detected = opts?.detected || (await detectModules());
 29969:   for (const key of Object.keys(detected)) {
 29970:     const v = detected[key];
 29971:     logger.info(`${key}: ${v.running ? `running (pid=${v.pid || 'unknown'})` : 'stopped'}`);
 29972:     if (v.port) logger.info(`  port: ${v.port}`);
 29973:     if (v.installed) logger.info(`  installed: true`);
 29974:   }
 29975:   const running = listRunning();
 29976:   if (running.length) {
 29977:     logger.info("Supervisor running processes:");
 29978:     for (const r of running) logger.info(`  ${r.name}: pid=${r.pid} cmd=${r.cmd}`);
 29979:   }
 29980: }
 29981: 
 29982: 
 29983: 
 29984: ============================
 29985: FILE: qflush\src\commands\kill.ts
 29986: ============================
 29987: ============================
 29988: import { logger } from "../utils/logger";
 29989: import { findAndKill } from "../utils/detect";
 29990: import { stopAll } from "../supervisor";
 29991: import { QFlashOptions } from "../chain/smartChain";
 29992: 
 29993: export async function runKill(_opts?: QFlashOptions) {
 29994:   logger.info("qflash: killing modules...");
 29995:   const killed = await findAndKill();
 29996:   stopAll();
 29997:   logger.info(`Killed ${killed.length} processes`);
 29998: }
 29999: 
 30000: 
 30001: 
 30002: ============================
 30003: FILE: qflush\src\commands\purge.ts
 30004: ============================
 30005: ============================
 30006: import { logger } from "../utils/logger";
 30007: import { resolvePaths } from "../utils/paths";
 30008: import { rimrafSync } from "../utils/exec";
 30009: import { clearState } from "../supervisor";
 30010: import { QFlashOptions } from "../chain/smartChain";
 30011: 
 30012: export async function runPurge(opts?: QFlashOptions) {
 30013:   logger.info("qflash: purging caches, logs, sessions and supervisor state...");
 30014:   const paths = resolvePaths(opts?.detected || {});
 30015:   const targets = [] as string[];
 30016:   for (const key of Object.keys(paths)) {
 30017:     const p = paths[key];
 30018:     if (!p) continue;
 30019:     targets.push(`${p}/.cache`);
 30020:     targets.push(`${p}/logs`);
 30021:     targets.push(`${p}/tmp`);
 30022:     targets.push(`${p}/sessions`);
 30023:   }
 30024:   for (const t of targets) {
 30025:     try {
 30026:       rimrafSync(t);
 30027:       logger.success(`Removed ${t}`);
 30028:     } catch (err) {
 30029:       logger.warn(`Failed to remove ${t}: ${err}`);
 30030:     }
 30031:   }
 30032:   // clear supervisor state
 30033:   clearState();
 30034:   logger.info("Purge complete.");
 30035: }
 30036: 
 30037: 
 30038: 
 30039: ============================
 30040: FILE: qflush\src\commands\start.ts
 30041: ============================
 30042: ============================
 30043: import { detectModules } from "../utils/detect";
 30044: import { logger } from "../utils/logger";
 30045: import { spawnSafe, ensurePackageInstalled, pathExists, rebuildInstructionsFor } from "../utils/exec";
 30046: import { resolvePaths, SERVICE_MAP } from "../utils/paths";
 30047: import { QFlashOptions } from "../chain/smartChain";
 30048: import { resolvePackagePath, readPackageJson } from "../utils/package";
 30049: import { startProcess } from "../supervisor";
 30050: import { waitForService } from "../utils/health";
 30051: 
 30052: export async function runStart(opts?: QFlashOptions) {
 30053:   logger.info("qflash: starting modules...");
 30054:   const detected = opts?.detected || (await detectModules());
 30055:   const paths = resolvePaths(detected);
 30056: 
 30057:   const services = opts?.services && opts.services.length ? opts.services : Object.keys(SERVICE_MAP);
 30058:   const flags = opts?.flags || {};
 30059: 
 30060:   const waitForStart = Boolean(flags["wait"] || flags["--wait"] || false);
 30061:   const doRestart = Boolean(flags["restart"] || flags["--restart"] || flags["force"] || false);
 30062:   const maxRestarts = typeof flags["restartCount"] === "number" ? (flags["restartCount"] as number) : 3;
 30063: 
 30064:   const procs: Promise<void>[] = [];
 30065: 
 30066:   for (const mod of services) {
 30067:     const promise = (async () => {
 30068:       const p = (opts?.modulePaths && opts.modulePaths[mod]) || paths[mod];
 30069:       const pkg = SERVICE_MAP[mod] && SERVICE_MAP[mod].pkg;
 30070: 
 30071:       // resolve package path (local node_modules or provided path)
 30072:       let pkgPath = p;
 30073:       if (!pkgPath && pkg) pkgPath = resolvePackagePath(pkg);
 30074: 
 30075:       if (!pkgPath && pkg) {
 30076:         const ok = ensurePackageInstalled(pkg);
 30077:         if (!ok) {
 30078:           logger.warn(`${mod} not found and failed to install ${pkg}, skipping`);
 30079:           return;
 30080:         }
 30081:         pkgPath = resolvePackagePath(pkg);
 30082:       }
 30083: 
 30084:       if (!pkgPath) {
 30085:         logger.warn(`${mod} path and package not found, skipping`);
 30086:         return;
 30087:       }
 30088: 
 30089:       const pkgJson = readPackageJson(pkgPath);
 30090: 
 30091:       // choose how to run: package bin if present, else npx <pkg>
 30092:       let runCmd: { cmd: string; args: string[]; cwd?: string } | null = null;
 30093:       if (pkgJson && pkgJson.bin) {
 30094:         const binEntry = typeof pkgJson.bin === "string" ? pkgJson.bin : Object.values(pkgJson.bin)[0];
 30095:         const binPath = require("path").join(pkgPath, binEntry);
 30096: 
 30097:         // prefer running via node when bin is a JS file inside package
 30098:         if (binPath.endsWith(".js") && pathExists(binPath)) {
 30099:           runCmd = { cmd: process.execPath, args: [binPath], cwd: pkgPath };
 30100:         } else if (pathExists(binPath)) {
 30101:           runCmd = { cmd: binPath, args: [], cwd: pkgPath };
 30102:         } else {
 30103:           logger.warn(`${mod} bin entry not found at ${binPath}. ${rebuildInstructionsFor(pkgPath)}`);
 30104:           return;
 30105:         }
 30106:       } else if (pkg) {
 30107:         // fallback to npx but warn about potential npx execution failures
 30108:         logger.warn(`${mod} has no local bin; will run via npx which may fail if package not globally installed.`);
 30109:         runCmd = { cmd: "npx", args: [pkg], cwd: process.cwd() };
 30110:       }
 30111: 
 30112:       if (!runCmd) {
 30113:         logger.warn(`${mod} has no runnable entry, skipping`);
 30114:         return;
 30115:       }
 30116: 
 30117:       let restarts = 0;
 30118: 
 30119:       const spawnOnce = (): Promise<void> => {
 30120:         return new Promise((resolve) => {
 30121:           logger.info(`Launching ${mod} -> ${runCmd!.cmd} ${runCmd!.args.join(" ")}`);
 30122: 
 30123:           // use supervisor to manage and persist process
 30124:           const child = startProcess(mod, runCmd!.cmd, runCmd!.args, { cwd: runCmd!.cwd });
 30125: 
 30126:           if (waitForStart) {
 30127:             // try to wait for a health endpoint if provided in flags
 30128:             const svcUrl = flags["health-url"] || flags["health"];
 30129:             const svcPort = flags["health-port"] || undefined;
 30130:             if (svcUrl) {
 30131:               waitForService(svcUrl as string, svcPort as any).then((ok) => {
 30132:                 if (ok) logger.success(`${mod} passed health check`);
 30133:                 else logger.warn(`${mod} failed health check`);
 30134:                 resolve();
 30135:               });
 30136:             } else {
 30137:               // wait for spawn via PID persistence
 30138:               setTimeout(() => {
 30139:                 logger.info(`${mod} started (delayed wait).`);
 30140:                 resolve();
 30141:               }, 2000);
 30142:             }
 30143:           } else {
 30144:             resolve();
 30145:           }
 30146: 
 30147:           // child exit handled by supervisor
 30148:         });
 30149:       };
 30150: 
 30151:       // start the first time and optionally wait
 30152:       await spawnOnce();
 30153: 
 30154:       // restart logic handled by supervisor-level events, keep simple here
 30155:     })();
 30156: 
 30157:     procs.push(promise);
 30158:   }
 30159: 
 30160:   await Promise.all(procs);
 30161: 
 30162:   logger.success("qflash: start sequence initiated for selected modules");
 30163: }
 30164: 
 30165: 
 30166: 
 30167: ============================
 30168: FILE: qflush\src\compose\fclParser.ts
 30169: ============================
 30170: ============================
 30171: import fs from 'fs';
 30172: 
 30173: function parseValue(raw: string): any {
 30174:   const v = raw.trim();
 30175:   if (v.startsWith('[') && v.endsWith(']')) {
 30176:     // simple list parser
 30177:     const inside = v.slice(1, -1).trim();
 30178:     if (!inside) return [];
 30179:     return inside.split(',').map(x => x.trim().replace(/^"|"$/g, ''));
 30180:   }
 30181:   if (/^\d+$/.test(v)) return Number(v);
 30182:   return v.replace(/^"|"$/g, '');
 30183: }
 30184: 
 30185: export function readFCL(file = 'funesterie.fcl') {
 30186:   try {
 30187:     const raw = fs.readFileSync(file, 'utf8');
 30188:     const lines = raw.split(/\r?\n/);
 30189:     const out: any = { project: {}, env: {}, service: {}, pipeline: {} };
 30190:     let current: { section?: string, name?: string } = {};
 30191:     for (let line of lines) {
 30192:       line = line.trim();
 30193:       if (!line || line.startsWith('#') || line.startsWith('//')) continue;
 30194:       if (line.startsWith('@')) {
 30195:         const parts = line.split(/	|\s+/).filter(Boolean);
 30196:         const sec = parts[0].slice(1);
 30197:         const name = parts[1] || undefined;
 30198:         current = { section: sec, name };
 30199:         if (name) {
 30200:           if (!out[sec]) out[sec] = {};
 30201:           out[sec][name] = out[sec][name] || {};
 30202:         }
 30203:         continue;
 30204:       }
 30205:       const eq = line.indexOf('=');
 30206:       if (eq === -1) continue;
 30207:       const key = line.slice(0, eq).trim();
 30208:       const val = parseValue(line.slice(eq + 1));
 30209:       if (current.section) {
 30210:         if (current.name) {
 30211:           out[current.section][current.name][key] = val;
 30212:         } else {
 30213:           out[current.section][key] = val;
 30214:         }
 30215:       }
 30216:     }
 30217:     return out;
 30218:   } catch (err) {
 30219:     return null;
 30220:   }
 30221: }
 30222: 
 30223: 
 30224: 
 30225: ============================
 30226: FILE: qflush\src\compose\parser.ts
 30227: ============================
 30228: ============================
 30229: import fs from 'fs';
 30230: import yaml from 'js-yaml';
 30231: import { readFCL } from './fclParser';
 30232: 
 30233: export type ModuleDef = {
 30234:   path?: string;
 30235:   port?: number;
 30236:   token?: string;
 30237:   env?: Record<string,string>;
 30238: };
 30239: 
 30240: export type ComposeFile = {
 30241:   modules: Record<string, ModuleDef>;
 30242: };
 30243: 
 30244: export function readCompose(file = 'funesterie.yml'): ComposeFile | null {
 30245:   try {
 30246:     if (fs.existsSync('funesterie.fcl')) {
 30247:       const fcl = readFCL('funesterie.fcl');
 30248:       if (fcl && fcl.service) {
 30249:         const modules: Record<string, ModuleDef> = {};
 30250:         for (const k of Object.keys(fcl.service)) {
 30251:           const s = fcl.service[k];
 30252:           modules[k] = { path: s.path, port: s.port, token: s.token, env: s.env };
 30253:         }
 30254:         return { modules };
 30255:       }
 30256:     }
 30257:     if (!fs.existsSync(file)) return null;
 30258:     const raw = fs.readFileSync(file, 'utf8');
 30259:     const doc = yaml.load(raw) as any;
 30260:     if (!doc || !doc.modules) return null;
 30261:     return { modules: doc.modules } as ComposeFile;
 30262:   } catch (err) {
 30263:     return null;
 30264:   }
 30265: }

 30269: ============================
 30270: FILE: qflush\src\daemon\qflashd.ts
 30271: ============================
 30272: ============================
 30273: import http from 'http';
 30274: import { listRunning, startProcess, stopProcess, stopAll } from '../supervisor';
 30275: import { logger } from '../utils/logger';
 30276: 
 30277: const PORT = process.env.QFLASHD_PORT ? Number(process.env.QFLASHD_PORT) : 4500;
 30278: 
 30279: const server = http.createServer(async (req, res) => {
 30280:   res.setHeader('Content-Type', 'application/json');
 30281:   if (req.url === '/status') {
 30282:     const running = listRunning();
 30283:     res.end(JSON.stringify({ running }));
 30284:     return;
 30285:   }
 30286:   if (req.url && req.url.startsWith('/stop')) {
 30287:     const name = req.url.split('/')[2];
 30288:     if (name) {
 30289:       const ok = stopProcess(name);
 30290:       res.end(JSON.stringify({ ok }));
 30291:       return;
 30292:     }
 30293:     stopAll();
 30294:     res.end(JSON.stringify({ ok: true }));
 30295:     return;
 30296:   }
 30297:   res.statusCode = 404;
 30298:   res.end(JSON.stringify({ error: 'not found' }));
 30299: });
 30300: 
 30301: server.listen(PORT, () => logger.success(`qflashd running on http://localhost:${PORT}`));
 30302:

 30306: FILE: qflush\src\index.ts

 30309: #!/usr/bin/env node
 30310: import { buildPipeline, executePipeline } from "./chain/smartChain";
 30311: import { showHelp } from "./cli/help";
 30312: import { runCompose } from "./commands/compose";
 30313: import { runDoctor } from "./commands/doctor";
 30314: 
 30315: const argv = process.argv.slice(2);
 30316: if (argv.includes("--help") || argv.includes("-h")) {
 30317:   showHelp();
 30318:   process.exit(0);
 30319: }
 30320: 
 30321: const first = argv[0];
 30322: if (first === 'compose') {
 30323:   void runCompose(argv.slice(1));
 30324:   process.exit(0);
 30325: }
 30326: if (first === 'doctor') {
 30327:   void runDoctor(argv.slice(1));
 30328:   process.exit(0);
 30329: }
 30330: if (first === 'daemon') {
 30331:   // start qflashd in-process
 30332:   void import('./daemon/qflashd').then((m) => {
 30333:     // module starts itself and logs
 30334:   }).catch((err) => { console.error('failed to start daemon', err); process.exit(1); });
 30335:   process.exit(0);
 30336: }
 30337: 
 30338: const { pipeline, options } = buildPipeline(argv);
 30339: 
 30340: executePipeline(pipeline, options).catch((err) => {
 30341:   console.error("qflash: fatal", err);
 30342:   process.exit(1);
 30343: });

 30348: FILE: qflush\src\lib\index.ts
 30349: ============================
 30350: ============================
 30351: export * as Rome from "@funeste38/rome";
 30352: export * as Nez from "@funeste38/nezlephant";

 30358: 
 30359: ============================
 30360: FILE: qflush\src\supervisor\index.ts
 30361: ============================
 30362: ============================
 30363: import { spawn } from 'child_process';
 30364: import { writeFileSync, existsSync, mkdirSync, readFileSync, unlinkSync, createWriteStream } from 'fs';
 30365: import { join } from 'path';
 30366: import { logger } from '../utils/logger';
 30367: 
 30368: type ProcRecord = {
 30369:   name: string;
 30370:   pid: number;
 30371:   cmd: string;
 30372:   args: string[];
 30373:   cwd?: string;
 30374:   log?: string;
 30375:   detached?: boolean;
 30376: };
 30377: 
 30378: const STATE_DIR = join(process.cwd(), '.qflash');
 30379: const LOGS_DIR = join(STATE_DIR, 'logs');
 30380: const STATE_FILE = join(STATE_DIR, 'services.json');
 30381: let procs: Record<string, ProcRecord> = {};
 30382: 
 30383: function ensureStateDir() {
 30384:   if (!existsSync(STATE_DIR)) mkdirSync(STATE_DIR, { recursive: true });
 30385:   if (!existsSync(LOGS_DIR)) mkdirSync(LOGS_DIR, { recursive: true });
 30386: }
 30387: 
 30388: function persist() {
 30389:   try {
 30390:     ensureStateDir();
 30391:     writeFileSync(STATE_FILE, JSON.stringify(procs, null, 2), 'utf8');
 30392:   } catch (err) {
 30393:     logger.warn(`Failed to persist supervisor state: ${err}`);
 30394:   }
 30395: }
 30396: 
 30397: function load() {
 30398:   try {
 30399:     if (existsSync(STATE_FILE)) {
 30400:       const raw = readFileSync(STATE_FILE, 'utf8');
 30401:       procs = JSON.parse(raw);
 30402:     }
 30403:   } catch (err) {
 30404:     logger.warn(`Failed to load supervisor state: ${err}`);
 30405:   }
 30406: }
 30407: 
 30408: load();
 30409: 
 30410: export function listRunning() {
 30411:   return Object.values(procs);
 30412: }
 30413: 
 30414: export function startProcess(name: string, cmd: string, args: string[] = [], opts: any = {}) {
 30415:   ensureStateDir();
 30416:   logger.info(`supervisor: starting ${name} -> ${cmd} ${args.join(' ')}`);
 30417: 
 30418:   const logFile = opts.logPath || join(LOGS_DIR, `${name}.log`);
 30419:   const outStream = createWriteStream(logFile, { flags: 'a' });
 30420: 
 30421:   const spawnOpts: any = { cwd: opts.cwd || process.cwd(), shell: true };
 30422: 
 30423:   // decide stdio based on detached/background
 30424:   if (opts.detached) {
 30425:     spawnOpts.detached = true;
 30426:     // ignore stdin, pipe stdout/stderr to log
 30427:     spawnOpts.stdio = ['ignore', 'pipe', 'pipe'];
 30428:   } else {
 30429:     spawnOpts.stdio = ['ignore', 'pipe', 'pipe'];
 30430:   }
 30431: 
 30432:   const child = spawn(cmd, args, spawnOpts);
 30433: 
 30434:   if (child.stdout) child.stdout.pipe(outStream);
 30435:   if (child.stderr) child.stderr.pipe(outStream);
 30436: 
 30437:   child.on('error', (err) => logger.error(`supervisor: ${name} process error ${err.message}`));
 30438:   child.on('exit', (code) => {
 30439:     logger.warn(`supervisor: ${name} exited with ${code}`);
 30440:     if (procs[name]) delete procs[name];
 30441:     persist();
 30442:   });
 30443: 
 30444:   // if detached, allow process to continue after this parent exits
 30445:   if (spawnOpts.detached) {
 30446:     try { child.unref(); } catch {}
 30447:   }
 30448: 
 30449:   procs[name] = { name, pid: child.pid || -1, cmd, args, cwd: opts.cwd, log: logFile, detached: !!spawnOpts.detached };
 30450:   persist();
 30451:   return child;
 30452: }
 30453: 
 30454: export function stopProcess(name: string) {
 30455:   const entry = procs[name];
 30456:   if (!entry) return false;
 30457:   try {
 30458:     process.kill(entry.pid, 'SIGTERM');
 30459:     try { delete procs[name]; persist(); } catch {}
 30460:     return true;
 30461:   } catch (err) {
 30462:     logger.warn(`supervisor: failed to kill ${name} pid=${entry.pid} (${err})`);
 30463:     return false;
 30464:   }
 30465: }
 30466: 
 30467: export function stopAll() {
 30468:   const names = Object.keys(procs);
 30469:   for (const n of names) {
 30470:     stopProcess(n);
 30471:   }
 30472:   try {
 30473:     if (existsSync(STATE_FILE)) unlinkSync(STATE_FILE);
 30474:   } catch {}
 30475: }
 30476: 
 30477: export function clearState() {
 30478:   procs = {};
 30479:   try { if (existsSync(STATE_FILE)) unlinkSync(STATE_FILE); } catch {}
 30480: }
 30481: 
 30482: 
 30483: 
 30484: ============================
 30485: FILE: qflush\src\tests\smartchain.test.ts
 30486: ============================
 30487: ============================
 30488: import { buildPipeline } from "../chain/smartChain";
 30489: 
 30490: function assertEqual(a: any, b: any, msg?: string) {
 30491:   if (JSON.stringify(a) !== JSON.stringify(b)) throw new Error(msg || `Assertion failed: ${JSON.stringify(a)} !== ${JSON.stringify(b)}`);
 30492: }
 30493: 
 30494: function runTests() {
 30495:   assertEqual(buildPipeline(["start"]).pipeline, ["detect","config","start"]);
 30496:   assertEqual(buildPipeline(["kill","start"]).pipeline, ["kill","detect","config","start"]);
 30497:   assertEqual(buildPipeline(["purge","start"]).pipeline, ["detect","config","purge","start"]);
 30498:   assertEqual(buildPipeline(["config","start","detect"]).pipeline, ["detect","config","start"]);
 30499:   assertEqual(buildPipeline(["exodia","start"]).pipeline, ["detect","config","start","exodia"]);
 30500:   console.log("SmartChain tests passed");
 30501: }
 30502: 
 30503: runTests();

 30526: ============================
 30527: FILE: qflush\src\types\tail.d.ts
 30528: ============================
 30529: ============================
 30530: declare module 'tail' {
 30531:   export class Tail {
 30532:     constructor(path: string, options?: any);
 30533:     on(event: string, cb: (...args: any[]) => void): void;
 30534:     unwatch(): void;
 30535:   }
 30536:   export function tail(path: string, options?: any): Tail;
 30537: }
 30538: 
 30539: 
 30540: 
 30541: ============================
 30542: FILE: qflush\src\utils\detect.ts
 30543: ============================
 30544: ============================
 30545: import { exec } from "child_process";
 30546: import { logger } from "./logger";
 30547: import { SERVICE_MAP } from "./paths";
 30548: import { resolvePackagePath } from "./package";
 30549: 
 30550: export async function detectModules() {
 30551:   const out: Record<string, any> = {};
 30552:   for (const name of Object.keys(SERVICE_MAP))
 30553:     out[name] = { running: false, installed: false, path: undefined, bin: undefined };
 30554: 
 30555:   for (const name of Object.keys(SERVICE_MAP)) {
 30556:     try {
 30557:       const pkgPath = resolvePackagePath(SERVICE_MAP[name].pkg);
 30558:       if (pkgPath) {
 30559:         out[name].installed = true;
 30560:         out[name].path = pkgPath;
 30561:         try {
 30562:           const pkgJson = require(require('path').join(pkgPath, 'package.json'));
 30563:           if (pkgJson && pkgJson.bin) {
 30564:             out[name].bin = typeof pkgJson.bin === 'string' ? pkgJson.bin : Object.values(pkgJson.bin)[0];
 30565:           }
 30566:         } catch {}
 30567:       }
 30568:     } catch {}
 30569:   }
 30570: 
 30571:   await new Promise<void>((resolve) => {
 30572:     exec(process.platform === "win32" ? "tasklist" : "ps aux", (err, stdout) => {
 30573:       if (err) {
 30574:         logger.warn(`Failed to list processes: ${err.message}`);
 30575:         return resolve();
 30576:       }
 30577:       const s = stdout.toString();
 30578:       for (const name of Object.keys(SERVICE_MAP)) {
 30579:         const regex = new RegExp(name, "i");
 30580:         if (regex.test(s)) {
 30581:           out[name].running = true;
 30582:         }
 30583:       }
 30584:       resolve();
 30585:     });
 30586:   });
 30587:   return out;
 30588: }
 30589: 
 30590: export async function findAndKill() {
 30591:   const names = Object.keys(SERVICE_MAP);
 30592:   const killed: number[] = [];
 30593:   for (const n of names) {
 30594:     try {
 30595:       if (process.platform === "win32") {
 30596:         exec(`taskkill /IM ${n}.exe /F`, (err) => {});
 30597:       } else {
 30598:         exec(`pkill -f ${n}`, (err) => {});
 30599:       }
 30600:     } catch (err) {
 30601:       // ignore
 30602:     }
 30603:   }
 30604:   return killed;
 30605: }
 30606: 
 30607: 
 30608: 
 30609: ============================
 30610: FILE: qflush\src\utils\exec.ts
 30611: ============================
 30612: ============================
 30613: import { spawn } from "child_process";
 30614: import { logger } from "./logger";
 30615: import { unlinkSync, existsSync, rmSync } from "fs";
 30616: import { execSync } from "child_process";
 30617: 
 30618: export function spawnSafe(command: string, args: string[] = [], opts: any = {}) {
 30619:   try {
 30620:     const proc = spawn(command, args, { stdio: "inherit", shell: true, ...opts });
 30621:     proc.on("error", (err) => logger.error(`Process error: ${err.message}`));
 30622:     return proc;
 30623:   } catch (err: any) {
 30624:     logger.error(`Failed to spawn ${command}: ${err.message}`);
 30625:     throw err;
 30626:   }
 30627: }
 30628: 
 30629: export function rimrafSync(path: string) {
 30630:   if (!path) return;
 30631:   if (!existsSync(path)) return;
 30632:   try {
 30633:     rmSync(path, { recursive: true, force: true });
 30634:   } catch (err) {
 30635:     // fallback
 30636:     try {
 30637:       unlinkSync(path);
 30638:     } catch {}
 30639:   }
 30640: }
 30641: 
 30642: export function isPackageInstalled(pkgName: string) {
 30643:   try {
 30644:     execSync(`npm ls ${pkgName} --depth=0`, { stdio: "ignore" });
 30645:     return true;
 30646:   } catch {
 30647:     return false;
 30648:   }
 30649: }
 30650: 
 30651: export function ensurePackageInstalled(pkgName: string) {
 30652:   if (isPackageInstalled(pkgName)) return true;
 30653:   logger.info(`Installing missing package ${pkgName}...`);
 30654:   try {
 30655:     execSync(`npm install -g ${pkgName}`, { stdio: "inherit" });
 30656:     return true;
 30657:   } catch (err: any) {
 30658:     logger.warn(`Failed to install ${pkgName}: ${err.message}`);
 30659:     return false;
 30660:   }
 30661: }
 30662: 
 30663: // Helpers for CLI pre-launch checks
 30664: export function pathExists(pathStr: string) {
 30665:   return !!pathStr && existsSync(pathStr);
 30666: }
 30667: 
 30668: export function rebuildInstructionsFor(pkgPath?: string) {
 30669:   if (!pkgPath) return `Rebuild the package (cd <pkg> && npm install && npm run build && npm install -g .)`;
 30670:   return `Rebuild the package:\n  cd ${pkgPath}\n  npm install\n  npm run build\n  npm install -g .`;
 30671: }
 30672: 
 30673: 
 30674: 
 30675: ============================
 30676: FILE: qflush\src\utils\health.ts
 30677: ============================
 30678: ============================
 30679: import http from 'http';
 30680: import net from 'net';
 30681: import { logger } from './logger';
 30682: 
 30683: export async function httpProbe(url: string, timeout = 2000): Promise<boolean> {
 30684:   return new Promise((resolve) => {
 30685:     const req = http.get(url, (res) => {
 30686:       res.resume();
 30687:       resolve(Boolean(res.statusCode && res.statusCode < 400));
 30688:     });
 30689:     req.on('error', () => resolve(false));
 30690:     req.setTimeout(timeout, () => {
 30691:       req.destroy();
 30692:       resolve(false);
 30693:     });
 30694:   });
 30695: }
 30696: 
 30697: export async function tcpProbe(host: string, port: number, timeout = 2000): Promise<boolean> {
 30698:   return new Promise((resolve) => {
 30699:     const s = new net.Socket();
 30700:     let done = false;
 30701:     s.setTimeout(timeout);
 30702:     s.on('connect', () => {
 30703:       done = true;
 30704:       s.destroy();
 30705:       resolve(true);
 30706:     });
 30707:     s.on('error', () => { if (!done) { done = true; resolve(false); } });
 30708:     s.on('timeout', () => { if (!done) { done = true; s.destroy(); resolve(false); } });
 30709:     s.connect(port, host);
 30710:   });
 30711: }
 30712: 
 30713: export async function waitForService(urlOrHost: string, port?: number, timeout = 5000) {
 30714:   const start = Date.now();
 30715:   while (Date.now() - start < timeout) {
 30716:     let ok = false;
 30717:     if (typeof port === 'number') {
 30718:       ok = await tcpProbe(urlOrHost, port, 1000);
 30719:     } else if (urlOrHost.startsWith('http')) {
 30720:       ok = await httpProbe(urlOrHost, 1000);
 30721:     }
 30722:     if (ok) return true;
 30723:     await new Promise((r) => setTimeout(r, 500));
 30724:   }
 30725:   return false;
 30726: }
 30727: 
 30728: 
 30729: 
 30730: ============================
 30731: FILE: qflush\src\utils\logger.ts
 30732: ============================
 30733: ============================
 30734: export const logger = {
 30735:   info: (msg: string) => console.log(`\x1b[36m[QFLASH]\x1b[0m ${msg}`),
 30736:   warn: (msg: string) => console.log(`\x1b[33m[QFLASH]\x1b[0m ${msg}`),
 30737:   error: (msg: string) => console.error(`\x1b[31m[QFLASH]\x1b[0m ${msg}`),
 30738:   success: (msg: string) => console.log(`\x1b[32m[QFLASH]\x1b[0m ${msg}`),
 30739: };
 30740: 
 30741: 
 30742: 
 30743: ============================
 30744: FILE: qflush\src\utils\package.ts
 30745: ============================
 30746: ============================
 30747: import { join } from "path";
 30748: import { existsSync } from "fs";
 30749: import { readFileSync } from "fs";
 30750: 
 30751: export function resolvePackagePath(pkgName: string) {
 30752:   try {
 30753:     const resolved = require.resolve(pkgName);
 30754:     // walk up to package root
 30755:     let dir = resolved;
 30756:     while (dir && !existsSync(join(dir, "package.json"))) {
 30757:       const p = require("path").dirname(dir);
 30758:       if (p === dir) break;
 30759:       dir = p;
 30760:     }
 30761:     if (existsSync(join(dir, "package.json"))) return dir;
 30762:   } catch {}
 30763:   // fallback: node_modules path
 30764:   const guess = join(process.cwd(), "node_modules", pkgName);
 30765:   if (existsSync(join(guess, "package.json"))) return guess;
 30766:   return undefined;
 30767: }
 30768: 
 30769: export function readPackageJson(pkgPath: string) {
 30770:   try {
 30771:     const content = readFileSync(join(pkgPath, "package.json"), "utf8");
 30772:     return JSON.parse(content);
 30773:   } catch {
 30774:     return null;
 30775:   }
 30776: }
 30777: 
 30778: 
 30779: 
 30780: ============================
 30781: FILE: qflush\src\utils\paths.ts
 30782: ============================
 30783: ============================
 30784: import { existsSync } from "fs";
 30785: import { join } from "path";
 30786: 
 30787: // Map service names to npm package names and local folder candidates
 30788: export const SERVICE_MAP: Record<string, { pkg: string; candidates: string[] }> = {
 30789:   rome: { pkg: "@funeste38/rome", candidates: ["./rome", "./Rome"] },
 30790:   nezlephant: { pkg: "@funeste38/nezlephant", candidates: ["./nezlephant", "./Nezlephant"] },
 30791:   envaptex: { pkg: "@funeste38/envaptex", candidates: ["./envaptex", "./Envaptex"] },
 30792:   freeland: { pkg: "@funeste38/freeland", candidates: ["./freeland", "./Freeland"] },
 30793:   bat: { pkg: "@funeste38/bat", candidates: ["./bat", "./BAT"] },
 30794: };
 30795: 
 30796: export function resolvePaths(detected: any = {}) {
 30797:   const out: Record<string, string | undefined> = {};
 30798:   for (const key of Object.keys(SERVICE_MAP)) {
 30799:     if (detected && detected[key] && detected[key].path) {
 30800:       out[key] = detected[key].path;
 30801:       continue;
 30802:     }
 30803:     const tries = SERVICE_MAP[key].candidates;
 30804:     for (const t of tries) {
 30805:       const p = join(process.cwd(), t);
 30806:       if (existsSync(p)) {
 30807:         out[key] = p;
 30808:         break;
 30809:       }
 30810:     }
 30811:   }
 30812:   return out;
 30813: }
 30814: 
 30815: 
 30816: 
 30817: ============================
 30818: FILE: qflush\src\utils\tokens.ts
 30819: ============================
 30820: ============================
 30821: import { randomBytes } from "crypto";
 30822: 
 30823: export function generateToken(len = 24) {
 30824:   return randomBytes(len).toString("hex");
 30825: }
 30826: 
 30827: export function resolveTokens(existing: Record<string, any> = {}) {
 30828:   const out: Record<string, string> = {};
 30829:   for (const name of ["A-11", "SPYDER", "BAT", "KEYKEY", "NEZLEPHANT"]) {
 30830:     out[name] = existing[name] || generateToken(12);
 30831:   }
 30832:   return out;
 30833: }
 30834:

 30837: ============================
 30838: FILE: qflush\tools\check-cli.js
 30839: ============================
 30840: ============================
 30841: #!/usr/bin/env node
 30842: const fs = require('fs');
 30843: const path = require('path');
 30844: const pkgPath = path.join(__dirname, '..', 'package.json');
 30845: if (!fs.existsSync(pkgPath)) {
 30846:   console.error('package.json not found');
 30847:   process.exit(2);
 30848: }
 30849: const pkg = JSON.parse(fs.readFileSync(pkgPath, 'utf8'));
 30850: const bin = pkg.bin && (typeof pkg.bin === 'string' ? pkg.bin : Object.values(pkg.bin)[0]);
 30851: if (!bin) {
 30852:   console.error('No bin entry in package.json');
 30853:   process.exit(2);
 30854: }
 30855: const binPath = path.join(__dirname, '..', bin);
 30856: if (!fs.existsSync(binPath)) {
 30857:   console.error(`CLI entry missing: ${binPath}`);
 30858:   console.error('Réparez en reconstruisant le paquet localement:');
 30859:   console.error('  cd qflash');
 30860:   console.error('  npm install');
 30861:   console.error('  npm run build');
 30862:   console.error('  npm install -g .');
 30863:   process.exit(2);
 30864: }
 30865: console.log('CLI check OK:', binPath);
 30866: process.exit(0);
 30867:

 30915: 
 30916: ============================
 30917: FILE: README.md
 30918: ============================
 30919: ============================
 30920: # qflush — Aperçu et guide développeur
 30921: 
 30922: Résumé rapide
 30923: - qflush est l'orchestrateur (CLI + daemon) principal du projet Funesterie. Le coeur se trouve dans `src/` et la sortie build dans `dist/`.
 30924: 
 30925: Architecture (big picture)
 30926: - Entrées principales:
 30927:   - `src/daemon/qflushd.ts` : serveur HTTP (endpoints admin & NPZ).
 30928:   - `src/rome/*` : moteur d'indexation, linker et logique ( règles, exécution d'actions ).
 30929:   - `src/commands/*` : implémentation des commandes CLI exposées dans `package.json`.
 30930:   - `src/utils/*` : helpers (redis, secrets, fetch, hmac, etc.).
 30931: 
 30932: - Flux de données : le daemon expose des endpoints `/npz/*` pour checksum, rome-index et rome-links ; le moteur Rome parcourt et évalue des règles qui déclenchent des actions (ex : `daemon.reload`, `start-service`).
 30933: 
 30934: Convention de build / piège courant
 30935: - TypeScript : `tsconfig.json` doit avoir `rootDir: "src"` et `include: ["src/**/*"]` — cela permet à `tsc` de générer `dist/daemon/qflushd.js` (les scripts CI s'attendent à `dist/daemon/*`).
 30936: 
 30937: Commandes utiles
 30938: - Installer dépendances : `npm ci --no-audit --no-fund`
 30939: - Builder : `npm run build` (exécute `tsc -p .`).
 30940: - Lancer le daemon compilé : `node dist/daemon/qflushd.js` ou `npm start`.
 30941: - Tests : `npm test` (Vitest). En CI/Vitest le bootstrap démarre automatiquement la version compilée du daemon via `vitest.setup.js`.
 30942: 
 30943: Comportements runtime & variables d'environnement importants
 30944: - `QFLUSHD_PORT` : port du daemon (défaut 4500 ou 43421 selon scripts). Tests/CI attendent parfois `4500`.
 30945: - `QFLUSH_ENABLE_REDIS` : contrôle l'utilisation de Redis (0 = in-memory fallback).
 30946: - `QFLUSH_DISABLE_COPILOT` / `QFLUSH_TELEMETRY` : désactiver la passerelle copilot/telemetry en runtime.
 30947: - `VITEST` : si défini, `vitest.setup.js` tente de require et démarrer `dist/daemon/qflushd`.
 30948: 
 30949: Points d'intégration et tests
 30950: - CI (workflow `CI`) : installe deps, compile (`npx tsc`) et démarre le daemon, puis exécute les tests. Les tests d'intégration vérifient les endpoints `/npz/checksum/*` et `/npz/rome-index`.
 30951: - Si vous rencontrez des erreurs de type `dist/daemon/qflushd.js missing` : vérifier `tsconfig.json` (rootDir/include) puis `npm run build`.
 30952: 
 30953: Où regarder en priorité
 30954: - `src/daemon/qflushd.ts` — comportement du serveur et endpoints.
 30955: - `src/rome/` — logique d'indexation et exécution d'actions.
 30956: - `src/commands/` — exemples d'utilisation du moteur via la CLI.
 30957: - `package.json` — scripts exposés (build, test, start, daemon:spawn, etc.).
 30958: 
 30959: Proposition pour la suite
 30960: - Voulez-vous que je :
 30961:   1) Nettoie le repo pour retirer `dist/` du commit (si vous préférez éviter d'avoir des artefacts de build dans la PR),
 30962:   2) Ajoute des extraits d'exemples d'API pour `/npz/*` dans `docs/quick-start.md`,
 30963:   3) Ou merge la PR maintenant et continuer l'amélioration de la documentation ?
 30964: 
 30965: ---
 30966: Pour feedback ou détails supplémentaires, dites-moi quelle partie vous voulez développer en priorité.
 30967: # QFLUSH — Funesterie Orchestrator ⚡
 30968: 
 30969: QFLUSH est l'orchestrateur local de la Funesterie : un CLI + daemon pour démarrer, arrêter, purger, inspecter et synchroniser des modules et flux de travail dans un workspace. Il fournit des endpoints NPZ pour checksum, index Rome et liens, des utilitaires de build et des scripts d'intégration.
 30970: 
 30971: Principales capacités
 30972: - Orchestration de services (detect → config → start/kill)
 30973: - Store NPZ checksum (store/verify/list/clear)
 30974: - Intégration Rome (index / liens / SSE)
 30975: - CLI ergonomique (`qflush`) et daemon `qflushd`
 30976: - Mode développement sans dépendances externes (Redis/Copilot désactivés par défaut)
 30977: 
 30978: Pourquoi utiliser QFLUSH ?
 30979: - Démarrage rapide d'une stack locale sans surprises
 30980: - Outils pour tester et valider les artefacts NPZ
 30981: - Scripts sécurisés pour gérer secrets localement (DPAPI sur Windows)
 30982: 
 30983: Quickstart (rapide)
 30984: 1) Copier l'exemple d'env :
 30985:    - PowerShell: `Copy-Item .env.example .env; notepad .env`
 30986:    - Bash: `cp .env.example .env && ${EDITOR:-nano} .env`
 30987: 2) Installer et builder :
 30988:    `npm ci --no-audit --no-fund && npm run build`
 30989: 3) Lancer les tests :
 30990:    `npm test`
 30991: 4) Lancer le daemon en dev :
 30992:    `qflush daemon` (ou `qflush safe-run --detach daemon`)
 30993: 
 30994: Où aller ensuite
 30995: - Voir `docs/quick-start.md` pour plus de détails.
 30996: - Scripts utiles : `scripts/import-env-to-secrets.ps1` (Windows DPAPI), `scripts/set-secrets.ps1`.
 30997: 
 30998: Si tu veux, je peux :
 30999: - enrichir ce README avec des exemples d'API (curl),
 31000: - ajouter des badges CI/coverage,
 31001: - ou pousser ces changements et ouvrir une PR (`push+pr`).
 31002: 
 31003: Exemples d'API (endpoints NPZ)
 31004: 
 31005: - Store checksum
 31006: 
 31007: ```bash
 31008: curl -X POST "http://localhost:4500/npz/checksum/store" \
 31009:    -H "Content-Type: application/json" \
 31010:    -d '{"id":"t1","checksum":"abc","ttlMs":60000}'
 31011: ```
 31012: 
 31013: - List checksums
 31014: 
 31015: ```bash
 31016: curl "http://localhost:4500/npz/checksum/list"
 31017: ```
 31018: 
 31019: - Verify checksum (mismatch returns non-200)
 31020: 
 31021: ```bash
 31022: curl -X POST "http://localhost:4500/npz/checksum/verify" \
 31023:    -H "Content-Type: application/json" \
 31024:    -d '{"id":"t1","checksum":"abc"}'
 31025: ```
 31026: 
 31027: - Clear checksums
 31028: 
 31029: ```bash
 31030: curl -X DELETE "http://localhost:4500/npz/checksum/clear"
 31031: ```
 31032: 
 31033: - Fetch Rome index
 31034: 
 31035: ```bash
 31036: curl "http://localhost:4500/npz/rome-index"
 31037: ```
 31038: 
 31039: Notes:
 31040: - En local, la variable `QFLUSHD_PORT` peut être utilisée pour changer le port (ex: `QFLUSHD_PORT=43421`).
 31041: - Les tests d'intégration supposent que le daemon compilé expose ces endpoints (via `dist/daemon/qflushd.js`).
 31042: 
 31043: ## Optional integration: A-11 (local AI service)
 31044: 
 31045: FR
 31046: -----
 31047: qflush peut piloter un serveur IA local nommé "A-11" (ex: backend Node + Ollama). Cette intégration est entièrement optionnelle : si A-11 n'est pas installé ou activé, qflush l'ignore et continue d'orchestrer les autres services.
 31048: 
 31049: Exemple de configuration (dans `.qflush/a11.config.json`):
 31050: 
 31051: ```json
 31052: {
 31053:   "enabled": true,
 31054:   "path": "D:/projects/a11",
 31055:   "startCommand": "pwsh -File start-a11-system.ps1",
 31056:   "healthUrl": "http://127.0.0.1:3000/health",
 31057:   "pidFile": ".qflush/a11.pid"
 31058: }
 31059: ```
 31060: 
 31061: Commandes utiles:
 31062: - `qflush start a11` — démarre A-11 si `enabled` et si `startCommand` est défini.
 31063: - `qflush stop a11` — arrête A-11 si un `pidFile` a été créé lors du démarrage.
 31064: - `qflush a11:status` — vérifie le endpoint `healthUrl` ou la présence du processus.
 31065: 
 31066: Comportement:
 31067: - Si `enabled` = false ou le fichier de config manque, qflush n'essaie pas d'installer ni de lancer A-11.
 31068: - En cas d'échec de démarrage, qflush loggue une erreur et continue les autres modules.
 31069: 
 31070: EN
 31071: -----
 31072: qflush can orchestrate an optional local AI service named "A-11" (for example a Node + Ollama backend). This integration is optional: if A-11 is not installed or enabled, qflush will ignore it and continue orchestrating other services.
 31073: 
 31074: Example configuration (put into `.qflush/a11.config.json`):
 31075: 
 31076: ```json
 31077: {
 31078:   "enabled": true,
 31079:   "path": "D:/projects/a11",
 31080:   "startCommand": "pwsh -File start-a11-system.ps1",
 31081:   "healthUrl": "http://127.0.0.1:3000/health",
 31082:   "pidFile": ".qflush/a11.pid"
 31083: }
 31084: ```
 31085: 
 31086: Useful commands:
 31087: - `qflush start a11` — starts A-11 when `enabled` and `startCommand` provided.
 31088: - `qflush stop a11` — stops A-11 if a `pidFile` was recorded on start.
 31089: - `qflush a11:status` — checks `healthUrl` or process presence.
 31090: 
 31091: Behavior notes:
 31092: - If `enabled` is false or config file is absent, qflush will not try to install or start A-11.
 31093: - On start failure qflush logs a clear message and continues with other services.
 31094: 
 31095: ---
 31096: 
 31097: 
 31098: 
 31099: ============================
 31100: FILE: README-FCL.md
 31101: ============================
 31102: ============================
 31103: # FCL — Funesterie Config Language
 31104: Official Specification — Version 1.0
 31105: 
 31106: FCL is a human-friendly configuration language designed for orchestrators,
 31107: multi-service stacks, automation pipelines and modern application tooling.
 31108: 
 31109: It is owned and maintained by Funesterie™.
 31110: 
 31111: ### Quick Example
 31112: 
 31113: @project
 31114:   name = my-project
 31115:   version = 1.0
 31116: 
 31117: @service api
 31118:   path = apps/api
 31119:   start = "pnpm dev"
 31120: 
 31121: @pipeline dev
 31122:   steps = ["api"]
 31123: 
 31124: ### Syntax Overview
 31125: 
 31126: - Blocks start with @keyword or @keyword name
 31127: - Key-value syntax uses: key = value
 31128: - Strings may use "quotes"
 31129: - Lists use: [ item1, item2, item3 ]
 31130: - Comments: # or //
 31131: 
 31132: ### Purpose
 31133: 
 31134: FCL is designed to be:
 31135: - Lightweight
 31136: - Easy to write
 31137: - Easy to parse
 31138: - Tool-agnostic
 31139: - Human-readable
 31140: 
 31141: ### License
 31142: 
 31143: Personal usage is free.  
 31144: Commercial usage requires a Funesterie™ Commercial License.
 31145: 
 31146: To purchase a commercial license for FCL:
 31147: https://cellaurojeff.gumroad.com/l/jxktq
 31148: 
 31149: See:
 31150: - LICENSE-FUNESTERIE.txt
 31151: - LICENSE-NON-COMMERCIAL.md
 31152: - LICENSE-COMMERCIAL.md
 31153: - TRADEMARK.md
 31154: 
 31155: ### Badge (text)
 31156: 
 31157: [ FUNESTERIE™ LICENSED FORMAT ]
 31158:        FCL – Official Format
 31159: ---------------------------------
 31160: This project uses the Funesterie™
 31161: config language under license.
 31162: 
 31163: 
 31164: 
 31165: ============================
 31166: FILE: rome.json
 31167: ============================
 31168: ============================
 31169: {
 31170:   "workspaces": {
 31171:     "patterns": [
 31172:       "server",
 31173:       "backend",
 31174:       "api",
 31175:       "web",
 31176:       "front",
 31177:       "client",
 31178:       "app",
 31179:       "apps/*",
 31180:       "packages/*",
 31181:       "services/*",
 31182:       "src/*"
 31183:     ],
 31184:     "exclude": [
 31185:       "node_modules",
 31186:       ".git",
 31187:       "dist",
 31188:       "build"
 31189:     ]
 31190:   },
 31191:   "packageManager": "auto",
 31192:   "scripts": {
 31193:     "build": "build",
 31194:     "test": "test",
 31195:     "lint": "lint",
 31196:     "dev": "dev"
 31197:   },
 31198:   "processes": {
 31199:     "server": {
 31200:       "command": "npm run dev",
 31201:       "cwd": "apps/server",
 31202:       "detach": true,
 31203:       "restart": "always",
 31204:       "env": {
 31205:         "NODE_ENV": "development"
 31206:       }
 31207:     },
 31208:     "web": {
 31209:       "command": "npm run dev",
 31210:       "cwd": "apps/web",
 31211:       "detach": true,
 31212:       "restart": "always"
 31213:     },
 31214:     "tunnel": {
 31215:       "command": "cloudflared tunnel --url http://127.0.0.1:3000",
 31216:       "detach": true,
 31217:       "restart": "on-failure"
 31218:     },
 31219:     "olloma": {
 31220:       "command": "olloma serve",
 31221:       "detach": true,
 31222:       "restart": "on-failure"
 31223:     }
 31224:   },
 31225:   "output": {
 31226:     "plain": false,
 31227:     "json": false,
 31228:     "noEmoji": false,
 31229:     "ci": false
 31230:   }
 31231: }
 31232: 
 31233: 
 31234: ============================
 31235: FILE: scripts\cleanup-actions.ps1
 31236: ============================
 31237: ============================
 31238: # cleanup-actions.ps1
 31239: # Cancel in-progress/queued workflow runs and close PRs from a feature branch
 31240: Param(
 31241:   [string]$Repo = 'jEFFLEZ/qflush',
 31242:   [string]$FeatureBranch = 'feat/tools-encoders'
 31243: )
 31244: 
 31245: if (-not $env:ACTIONS_TOKEN) {
 31246:   Write-Output 'NO_TOKEN'
 31247:   exit 2
 31248: }
 31249: 
 31250: $headers = @{ Authorization = 'Bearer ' + $env:ACTIONS_TOKEN; Accept = 'application/vnd.github+json'; 'User-Agent' = 'cleanup-script' }
 31251: 
 31252: try {
 31253:   Write-Output "Listing workflow runs for repo $Repo..."
 31254:   $url = "https://api.github.com/repos/$Repo/actions/runs?per_page=200"
 31255:   $resp = Invoke-RestMethod -Uri $url -Headers $headers -Method Get -ErrorAction Stop
 31256:   $runs = $resp.workflow_runs
 31257:   $toCancel = $runs | Where-Object { $_.status -in @('in_progress','queued') }
 31258:   if ($toCancel.Count -eq 0) { Write-Output 'No in_progress/queued runs to cancel.' } else {
 31259:     foreach ($r in $toCancel) {
 31260:       Write-Output "Cancelling run id=$($r.id) name='$($r.name)' branch=$($r.head_branch)"
 31261:       Invoke-RestMethod -Uri "https://api.github.com/repos/$Repo/actions/runs/$($r.id)/cancel" -Method Post -Headers $headers -ErrorAction SilentlyContinue
 31262:     }
 31263:   }
 31264: 
 31265:   Write-Output "Checking PRs with head=$Repo.Split('/')[0]:$FeatureBranch..."
 31266:   $owner = $Repo.Split('/')[0]
 31267:   $prsUrl = "https://api.github.com/repos/$Repo/pulls?head=$owner`:$FeatureBranch"
 31268:   $prs = Invoke-RestMethod -Uri $prsUrl -Headers $headers -Method Get -ErrorAction Stop
 31269:   if ($prs.Count -eq 0) { Write-Output 'No PRs found for feature branch.' } else {
 31270:     foreach ($p in $prs) {
 31271:       Write-Output "Closing PR #$($p.number): $($p.title)"
 31272:       Invoke-RestMethod -Uri "https://api.github.com/repos/$Repo/pulls/$($p.number)" -Method Patch -Headers $headers -Body (@{ state='closed' } | ConvertTo-Json) -ErrorAction SilentlyContinue
 31273:       # optional: delete remote branch ref
 31274:       try {
 31275:         Write-Output "Deleting remote ref heads/$FeatureBranch"
 31276:         Invoke-RestMethod -Uri "https://api.github.com/repos/$Repo/git/refs/heads/$FeatureBranch" -Method Delete -Headers $headers -ErrorAction Stop
 31277:       } catch {
 31278:         Write-Output "Failed to delete remote ref (maybe already deleted): $($_.Exception.Message)"
 31279:       }
 31280:     }
 31281:   }
 31282: 
 31283:   Write-Output 'Done. Summary:'
 31284:   $remaining = Invoke-RestMethod -Uri $url -Headers $headers -Method Get
 31285:   $remaining.workflow_runs | Where-Object { $_.status -in @('in_progress','queued') } | Select-Object id,name,status,head_branch | ConvertTo-Json -Depth 3
 31286: 
 31287: } catch {
 31288:   Write-Error "Error during cleanup: $($_.Exception.Message)"
 31289:   if ($_.Exception.Response) {
 31290:     try { $txt = $_.Exception.Response.GetResponseStream() | New-Object System.IO.StreamReader | ForEach-Object { $_.ReadToEnd() }; Write-Output $txt } catch {}
 31291:   }
 31292:   exit 1
 31293: }
 31294: 
 31295: 
 31296: 
 31297: ============================
 31298: FILE: scripts\cleanup-qflush.ps1
 31299: ============================
 31300: ============================
 31301: # Cleanup script to replace remaining `qflush` references with `qflush`
 31302: # Usage: run from repo root: powershell -ExecutionPolicy Bypass -File .\scripts\cleanup-qflush.ps1
 31303: $ErrorActionPreference = 'Stop'
 31304: 
 31305: Write-Output "Running cleanup-qflush.ps1"
 31306: $root = Get-Location
 31307: Write-Output "Repo root: $root"
 31308: 
 31309: # Files/dirs to ignore (substring match) and file patterns
 31310: $ignoreDirs = @('.git','node_modules','.venv','.vscode','dist','out','release','.release')
 31311: $ignoreExts = @('\.log$','\.tgz$','\.zip$','\.vsix$','\.png$','\.jpg$','\.jpeg$','\.gif$','\.bin$','\.exe$')
 31312: $ignorePattern = (($ignoreDirs | ForEach-Object { [regex]::Escape($_) }) + $ignoreExts) -join '|'
 31313: 
 31314: # Collect files (exclude ignored dirs and file patterns)
 31315: Write-Output "Scanning files..."
 31316: $files = Get-ChildItem -Path $root -Recurse -File -ErrorAction SilentlyContinue | Where-Object { $_.FullName -notmatch $ignorePattern }
 31317: $changed = 0
 31318: $renamed = 0
 31319: 
 31320: foreach ($f in $files) {
 31321:     try {
 31322:         $text = Get-Content -Raw -LiteralPath $f.FullName -ErrorAction Stop
 31323:     } catch {
 31324:         # cannot read file as text (binary or locked), skip
 31325:         continue
 31326:     }
 31327:     if ($null -eq $text -or $text -eq '') { continue }
 31328:     try {
 31329:         # case-insensitive replacement
 31330:         $new = [regex]::Replace($text, 'qflush', 'qflush', 'IgnoreCase')
 31331:     } catch {
 31332:         # regex failed for this content, skip
 31333:         continue
 31334:     }
 31335:     if ($new -ne $text) {
 31336:         try { Set-Content -LiteralPath $f.FullName -Value $new -Encoding UTF8 -ErrorAction Stop } catch { Write-Output "Failed to write file: $($f.FullName) : $_"; continue }
 31337:         Write-Output "Patched: $($f.FullName)"
 31338:         $changed++
 31339:     }
 31340: }
 31341: 
 31342: # rename files/dirs containing qflush (case-insensitive)
 31343: Write-Output "Renaming files/dirs containing 'qflush' in name..."
 31344: $items = Get-ChildItem -Path $root -Recurse -Force -ErrorAction SilentlyContinue | Where-Object { $_.Name -match '(?i)qflush' -and ($_.FullName -notmatch $ignorePattern) } | Sort-Object -Property FullName -Descending
 31345: foreach ($it in $items) {
 31346:     $old = $it.FullName
 31347:     $parent = Split-Path $old -Parent
 31348:     $newName = $it.Name -replace '(?i)qflush','qflush'
 31349:     $newPath = Join-Path $parent $newName
 31350:     if ($old -ieq $newPath) { continue }
 31351:     try {
 31352:         Rename-Item -LiteralPath $old -NewName $newName -ErrorAction Stop
 31353:         Write-Output "Renamed: $old -> $newPath"
 31354:         $renamed++
 31355:     } catch {
 31356:         Write-Output "Failed to rename: $old -> $newPath : $_"
 31357:     }
 31358: }
 31359: 
 31360: if ($changed -gt 0 -or $renamed -gt 0) {
 31361:     Write-Output "Staging changes and committing..."
 31362:     try {
 31363:         git add -A
 31364:         git commit -m "chore(repo): replace qflush -> qflush and normalize names"
 31365:     } catch {
 31366:         Write-Output "git commit returned non-zero or nothing to commit: $_"
 31367:     }
 31368:     # push if upstream configured
 31369:     try {
 31370:         git rev-parse --abbrev-ref --symbolic-full-name '@{u}' > $null 2>&1
 31371:         try { git push } catch { Write-Output 'git push failed, please push manually.' }
 31372:     } catch {
 31373:         Write-Output 'No upstream configured for current branch; please push manually.'
 31374:     }
 31375: }
 31376: 
 31377: Write-Output "Done. Files patched: $changed, renamed: $renamed"
 31378: 
 31379: 
 31380: 
 31381: 
 31382: ============================
 31383: FILE: scripts\create-pr.ps1
 31384: ============================
 31385: ============================
 31386: Param(
 31387:   [string]$HeadBranch = 'feat/tools-encoders',
 31388:   [string]$BaseBranch = 'main',
 31389:   [string]$Title = 'feat(tools): add encoders and css encoder/decoder',
 31390:   [string]$Body = 'Add tools: tools/rgba_brotli_oc8.py, tools/css_encode.js, tools/css_decode.js.'
 31391: )
 31392: 
 31393: if (-not $env:ACTIONS_TOKEN) {
 31394:   Write-Error 'ACTIONS_TOKEN environment variable not set.'
 31395:   exit 2
 31396: }
 31397: 
 31398: $token = $env:ACTIONS_TOKEN
 31399: $payload = @{ title = $Title; head = $HeadBranch; base = $BaseBranch; body = $Body } | ConvertTo-Json -Depth 6
 31400: 
 31401: $headers = @{ Authorization = "Bearer $token"; Accept = 'application/vnd.github+json'; 'User-Agent' = 'qflush-bot' }
 31402: 
 31403: try {
 31404:   $resp = Invoke-RestMethod -Uri 'https://api.github.com/repos/jEFFLEZ/qflush/pulls' -Method Post -Headers $headers -Body $payload -ContentType 'application/json' -ErrorAction Stop
 31405:   Write-Output "PR created: $($resp.html_url)"
 31406: } catch {
 31407:   Write-Error "Failed to create PR: $($_.Exception.Message)"
 31408:   if ($_.Exception.Response) {
 31409:     try { $text = $_.Exception.Response.GetResponseStream() | New-Object System.IO.StreamReader | ForEach-Object { $_.ReadToEnd() }; Write-Output $text } catch {}
 31410:   }
 31411:   exit 1
 31412: }
