 31415: 
 31416: ============================
 31417: FILE: scripts\detach.js
 31418: ============================
 31419: ============================
 31420: #!/usr/bin/env node
 31421: // Spawn the given command detached and unref it.
 31422: const { spawn } = require('child_process');
 31423: const args = process.argv.slice(2);
 31424: let quiet = false;
 31425: if (args[0] === '--quiet' || args.includes('--quiet')) {
 31426:   quiet = true;
 31427:   // remove the flag
 31428:   const idx = args.indexOf('--quiet');
 31429:   if (idx >= 0) args.splice(idx, 1);
 31430: }
 31431: if (args.length === 0) {
 31432:   if (!quiet) console.error('Usage: node scripts/detach.js <command> [args...]');
 31433:   process.exit(1);
 31434: }
 31435: const cmd = args[0];
 31436: const cmdArgs = args.slice(1);
 31437: const child = spawn(cmd, cmdArgs, { detached: true, stdio: 'ignore' });
 31438: child.unref();
 31439: if (!quiet) console.log(`detached pid=${child.pid}`);
 31440: 
 31441: 
 31442: 
 31443: ============================
 31444: FILE: scripts\fix-install-qflush.ps1
 31445: ============================
 31446: ============================
 31447: # Fix + (re)install @funeste38/qflush v3.1.2 and create working shims
 31448: # Usage: exécuter dans un PowerShell lancé en Administrateur depuis la racine du repo
 31449: $ErrorActionPreference = 'Stop'
 31450: 
 31451: # 0) check admin
 31452: $principal = [Security.Principal.WindowsPrincipal][Security.Principal.WindowsIdentity]::GetCurrent()
 31453: if (-not $principal.IsInRole([Security.Principal.WindowsBuiltInRole]::Administrator)) {
 31454:   Write-Error "Exécutez ce script en tant qu'administrateur."
 31455:   exit 1
 31456: }
 31457: 
 31458: # 1) variables
 31459: $repoRoot = (Get-Location).Path      # utilise répertoire courant
 31460: $pkgName = '@funeste38/qflush'
 31461: $githubTag = 'github:jEFFLEZ/qflush#v3.1.2'
 31462: $appNpm = Join-Path $env:APPDATA 'npm'
 31463: $groot = (& npm root -g).Trim()
 31464: 
 31465: # 2) cleanup anciens shims / paquets
 31466: Write-Output "Removing old global packages and shims (if any)..."
 31467: try { npm uninstall -g $pkgName @funeste38/qflush 2>$null } catch {}
 31468: Get-ChildItem $appNpm -Filter 'qflush*' -File -ErrorAction SilentlyContinue | ForEach-Object { Remove-Item $_.FullName -Force -ErrorAction SilentlyContinue }
 31469: 
 31470: # 3) if repo present, build & pack
 31471: $tgzToInstall = $null
 31472: if (Test-Path $repoRoot) {
 31473:   Write-Output "Repo found at $repoRoot — building..."
 31474:   Push-Location $repoRoot
 31475:   try {
 31476:     npm ci
 31477:     npm run build
 31478:     npm pack | Out-Null
 31479:     $tgz = Get-ChildItem -Path $repoRoot -Filter '*.tgz' -File | Sort-Object LastWriteTime -Descending | Select-Object -First 1
 31480:     if ($tgz) { $tgzToInstall = $tgz.FullName; Write-Output "Packed TGZ: $tgzToInstall" }
 31481:   } finally { Pop-Location }
 31482: }
 31483: 
 31484: # 4) install (prefer local tgz if present)
 31485: if ($tgzToInstall) {
 31486:   Write-Output "Installing from local tgz..."
 31487:   npm install -g $tgzToInstall
 31488: } else {
 31489:   Write-Output "Installing from GitHub tag $githubTag..."
 31490:   npm install -g $githubTag
 31491: }
 31492: 
 31493: # 5) determine dist and package.json paths (prefer global package, fallback local repo)
 31494: $pkgGlobalDir = Join-Path $groot ('@funeste38\qflush')
 31495: $distPath = $null; $pkgJson = $null
 31496: if (Test-Path (Join-Path $pkgGlobalDir 'dist\index.js')) {
 31497:   $distPath = Join-Path $pkgGlobalDir 'dist\index.js'
 31498:   $pkgJson  = Join-Path $pkgGlobalDir 'package.json'
 31499:   Write-Output "Using global package dist: $distPath"
 31500: } elseif (Test-Path (Join-Path $repoRoot 'dist\index.js')) {
 31501:   $distPath = Join-Path $repoRoot 'dist\index.js'
 31502:   $pkgJson  = Join-Path $repoRoot 'package.json'
 31503:   Write-Output "Using local repo dist: $distPath"
 31504: } else {
 31505:   Write-Error "Impossible de trouver dist/index.js ni global ni local. Assurez-vous que build a réussi."
 31506:   exit 2
 31507: }
 31508: 
 31509: # 6) prepare paths for require() inside node -e -> use forward slashes to avoid JS escape issues
 31510: $pkgJsonForRequire = ($pkgJson -replace '\\','/')
 31511: 
 31512: # 7) ensure appNpm exists and is in PATH for session
 31513: if (-not (Test-Path $appNpm)) { New-Item -ItemType Directory -Path $appNpm | Out-Null }
 31514: if ((($env:PATH) -split ';') -notcontains $appNpm) {
 31515:   $env:PATH = "$appNpm;$env:PATH"
 31516:   Write-Output "Added $appNpm to PATH for this session."
 31517: }
 31518: 
 31519: # 8) write robust shims (cmd + powershell) and wrapper
 31520: $cmdPath = Join-Path $appNpm 'qflush.cmd'
 31521: $ps1Path = Join-Path $appNpm 'qflush.ps1'
 31522: $wrapperPath = Join-Path $appNpm 'qflush-cli.js'
 31523: 
 31524: # wrapper JS content
 31525: $wrapperContent = @'
 31526: const fs = require("fs");
 31527: const path = require("path");
 31528: const { spawn } = require("child_process");
 31529: 
 31530: function exists(p){ try { return p && fs.existsSync(p); } catch { return false; } }
 31531: 
 31532: const candidates = [
 31533:   path.join(process.env.APPDATA || "", "npm", "node_modules", "@funeste38", "qflush"),
 31534:   path.join(__dirname, "node_modules", "@funeste38", "qflush"),
 31535:   path.join(process.cwd(), "node_modules", "@funeste38", "qflush"),
 31536:   path.join(process.cwd())
 31537: ];
 31538: 
 31539: let pkgDir = null;
 31540: for (const c of candidates) {
 31541:   if (exists(c)) { pkgDir = c; break; }
 31542: }
 31543: 
 31544: let pkgJsonPath = pkgDir ? path.join(pkgDir, "package.json") : null;
 31545: let distPath = pkgDir ? path.join(pkgDir, "dist", "index.js") : null;
 31546: if (!pkgJsonPath || !exists(pkgJsonPath)) pkgJsonPath = path.join(process.cwd(), "package.json");
 31547: if (!distPath || !exists(distPath)) {
 31548:   const localDist = path.join(process.cwd(), "dist", "index.js");
 31549:   if (exists(localDist)) distPath = localDist;
 31550: }
 31551: 
 31552: const argv = process.argv.slice(2);
 31553: if (argv[0] === "--version" || argv[0] === "-v") {
 31554:   try {
 31555:     const pkg = require(pkgJsonPath);
 31556:     console.log(pkg && pkg.version ? pkg.version : "unknown");
 31557:   } catch (e) {
 31558:     console.log("unknown");
 31559:   }
 31560:   process.exit(0);
 31561: }
 31562: 
 31563: if (!distPath || !exists(distPath)) {
 31564:   console.error('qflush: dist not found. Run `npm run build` in the repo or install the package globally.');
 31565:   process.exit(1);
 31566: }
 31567: 
 31568: const child = spawn(process.execPath, [distPath, ...argv], { stdio: 'inherit' });
 31569: child.on('exit', (code) => process.exit(code));
 31570: '@
 31571: 
 31572: Set-Content -Path $wrapperPath -Value $wrapperContent -Encoding UTF8 -Force
 31573: 
 31574: $cmdContent = @"
 31575: @echo off
 31576: if "%1"=="--version" goto version
 31577: if "%1"=="-v" goto version
 31578: node "%APPDATA%\npm\qflush-cli.js" %*
 31579: goto end
 31580: :version
 31581: node "%APPDATA%\npm\qflush-cli.js" --version
 31582: :end
 31583: "@
 31584: 
 31585: $ps1Content = @"
 31586: param([Parameter(ValueFromRemainingArguments=`$true)] `$args)
 31587: `$first = if (`$args.Length -gt 0) { `$args[0] } else { '' }
 31588: if (`$first -eq '--version' -or `$first -eq '-v') {
 31589:   node `"$env:APPDATA\npm\qflush-cli.js`" --version
 31590:   exit 0
 31591: }
 31592: & node `"$env:APPDATA\npm\qflush-cli.js`" @args
 31593: "@
 31594: 
 31595: Set-Content -Path $cmdPath -Value $cmdContent -Encoding ASCII -Force
 31596: Set-Content -Path $ps1Path -Value $ps1Content -Encoding UTF8 -Force
 31597: 
 31598: Write-Output "Shims written:"
 31599: Write-Output " - $cmdPath"
 31600: Write-Output " - $ps1Path"
 31601: Write-Output " - $wrapperPath"
 31602: 
 31603: # 9) final checks
 31604: Write-Output "`nContents of $appNpm (qflush*):"
 31605: Get-ChildItem $appNpm -Filter 'qflush*' -File | Select-Object Name,FullName | Format-Table
 31606: 
 31607: Write-Output "`nAttempting to run: qflush --version (same session)"
 31608: try { qflush --version | Write-Output } catch { Write-Output 'qflush not recognized in this session — rouvrir le shell si nécessaire' }
 31609: 
 31610: Write-Output "`nIf qflush n'est toujours pas trouvé: fermez puis rouvrez PowerShell (Developer PowerShell) et exécutez `qflush --version`."
 31611: 
 31612: 
 31613: 
 31614: ============================
 31615: FILE: scripts\import-env-to-secrets.ps1
 31616: ============================
 31617: ============================
 31618: <#
 31619: Import .env file and store secrets encrypted under %USERPROFILE%\.qflush\secrets.json using DPAPI (Windows)
 31620: Usage:
 31621:   pwsh -NoProfile -ExecutionPolicy Bypass -File .\scripts\import-env-to-secrets.ps1 -EnvPath "$env:USERPROFILE\Desktop\.env" [-Quiet]
 31622: 
 31623: This script detects common secret variable names (NPM_TOKEN, GUMROAD_TOKEN, COPILOT_HMAC_SECRET, REDIS_URL, etc.) and stores only those values encrypted.
 31624: #>
 31625: param(
 31626:   [string]$EnvPath = "$env:USERPROFILE\Desktop\.env",
 31627:   [switch]$RestrictFileAcl,
 31628:   [switch]$Quiet
 31629: )
 31630: 
 31631: function Log([string]$msg) {
 31632:   if ($Quiet) { Write-Verbose $msg } else { Write-Host $msg }
 31633: }
 31634: 
 31635: if (-not (Test-Path $EnvPath)) {
 31636:   Write-Error "Env file not found: $EnvPath"
 31637:   exit 2
 31638: }
 31639: 
 31640: # canonical secret keys we care about
 31641: $canonical = @{
 31642:   'NPM_TOKEN' = 'NPM_TOKEN'
 31643:   'GUMROAD_TOKEN' = 'GUMROAD_TOKEN'
 31644:   'QFLUSH_TOKEN' = 'QFLUSH_TOKEN'
 31645:   'REDIS_URL' = 'REDIS_URL'
 31646:   'COPILOT_HMAC_SECRET' = 'COPILOT_HMAC_SECRET'
 31647:   'COPILOT_WEBHOOK_URL' = 'WEBHOOK_URL'
 31648:   'COPILOT_BRIDGE_URL' = 'COPILOT_BRIDGE_URL'
 31649:   'GUMROAD_TOKEN_FILE' = 'GUMROAD_TOKEN_FILE'
 31650: }
 31651: 
 31652: function NormalizeKey([string]$k) {
 31653:   if (-not $k) { return $null }
 31654:   $u = $k.Trim().ToUpper()
 31655:   if ($canonical.ContainsKey($u)) { return $canonical[$u] }
 31656:   # common heuristics
 31657:   if ($u -match '(^|_)NPM(_|$|TOKEN)') { return 'NPM_TOKEN' }
 31658:   if ($u -match 'GUMROAD') { return 'GUMROAD_TOKEN' }
 31659:   if ($u -match 'COPILOT' -and $u -match 'HMAC|SECRET|KEY') { return 'COPILOT_HMAC_SECRET' }
 31660:   if ($u -match 'COPILOT' -and $u -match 'WEBHOOK') { return 'WEBHOOK_URL' }
 31661:   if ($u -match 'REDIS') { return 'REDIS_URL' }
 31662:   if ($u -match 'QFLUSH' -and $u -match 'TOKEN') { return 'QFLUSH_TOKEN' }
 31663:   # if the key contains TOKEN or SECRET, treat as secret
 31664:   if ($u -match 'TOKEN|SECRET|KEY|PASSWORD|PASS') { return $u }
 31665:   return $null
 31666: }
 31667: 
 31668: # read lines robustly
 31669: $all = Get-Content -Path $EnvPath -ErrorAction Stop
 31670: $map = @{}
 31671: 
 31672: foreach ($line in $all) {
 31673:   $trim = $line.Trim()
 31674:   if ([string]::IsNullOrWhiteSpace($trim)) { continue }
 31675:   if ($trim.StartsWith('#')) { continue }
 31676:   # support KEY=VALUE and export KEY=VALUE
 31677:   if ($trim -match '^(?:export\s+)?([A-Za-z_][A-Za-z0-9_]*)\s*=\s*(.*)$') {
 31678:     $key = $matches[1]
 31679:     $val = $matches[2]
 31680:     # strip optional surrounding quotes
 31681:     if ($val.Length -ge 2 -and (($val.StartsWith('"') -and $val.EndsWith('"')) -or ($val.StartsWith("'") -and $val.EndsWith("'")))) {
 31682:       $val = $val.Substring(1, $val.Length-2)
 31683:     }
 31684:     $canon = NormalizeKey $key
 31685:     if (-not $canon) { continue } # skip non-secret vars
 31686:     # skip boolean flags and numeric ports
 31687:     if ($val -match '^(?:0|1|true|false)$' -or $val -match '^[0-9]+$') { continue }
 31688:     try {
 31689:       $secure = ConvertTo-SecureString $val -AsPlainText -Force
 31690:       $enc = $secure | ConvertFrom-SecureString
 31691:       $map[$canon] = $enc
 31692:       Log "Queued secret: $canon"
 31693:     } catch {
 31694:       $err = ($_ | Out-String).Trim()
 31695:       if ($Quiet) { Write-Verbose ("Failed to encrypt {0}: {1}" -f $key, $err) } else { Write-Warning ("Failed to encrypt {0}: {1}" -f $key, $err) }
 31696:     }
 31697:   }
 31698: }
 31699: 
 31700: if ($map.Count -eq 0) {
 31701:   Log 'No secrets detected in the .env file.'
 31702:   exit 0
 31703: }
 31704: 
 31705: $dir = Join-Path $env:USERPROFILE '.qflush'
 31706: if (-not (Test-Path $dir)) { New-Item -ItemType Directory -Path $dir | Out-Null }
 31707: $file = Join-Path $dir 'secrets.json'
 31708: try {
 31709:   $existing = @{}
 31710:   if (Test-Path $file) {
 31711:     try {
 31712:       $raw = Get-Content $file -Raw -ErrorAction Stop
 31713:       $parsed = $raw | ConvertFrom-Json -ErrorAction Stop
 31714:       if ($parsed -ne $null) {
 31715:         foreach ($p in $parsed.PSObject.Properties) { $existing[$p.Name] = $p.Value }
 31716:       }
 31717:     } catch {
 31718:       $existing = @{}
 31719:     }
 31720:   }
 31721: 
 31722:   foreach ($k in $map.Keys) { $existing[$k] = $map[$k] }
 31723: 
 31724:   $outObj = [ordered]@{}
 31725:   foreach ($name in $existing.Keys) { $outObj[$name] = $existing[$name] }
 31726: 
 31727:   $outObj | ConvertTo-Json -Depth 5 | Set-Content -Path $file -Encoding UTF8
 31728:   Log "Saved encrypted secrets to $file"
 31729:   if ($RestrictFileAcl) {
 31730:     try {
 31731:       icacls $file /inheritance:r /grant:r "$env:USERNAME:(R,W)" | Out-Null
 31732:       Log "Restricted ACL on $file to user $env:USERNAME"
 31733:     } catch {
 31734:       $err2 = ($_ | Out-String).Trim()
 31735:       if ($Quiet) { Write-Verbose ("Failed to set ACL: {0}" -f $err2) } else { Write-Warning ("Failed to set ACL: {0}" -f $err2) }
 31736:     }
 31737:   }
 31738: } catch {
 31739:   $err3 = ($_ | Out-String).Trim()
 31740:   if ($Quiet) { Write-Verbose ("Failed to write secrets file: {0}" -f $err3) } else { Write-Error ("Failed to write secrets file: {0}" -f $err3) }
 31741:   exit 3
 31742: }
 31743: 
 31744: Log 'Done.'
 31745: 
 31746: 
 31747: 
 31748: ============================
 31749: FILE: scripts\install-and-publish.ps1
 31750: ============================
 31751: ============================
 31752: <#
 31753: PowerShell helper to install qflush locally and build + publish the VS Code extension to Azure Marketplace.
 31754: Usage (run as Administrator PowerShell) from repo root (D:\qflush):
 31755: 
 31756: Set-ExecutionPolicy -Scope Process -ExecutionPolicy RemoteSigned
 31757: .\scripts\install-and-publish.ps1
 31758: 
 31759: The script will:
 31760:  - install node deps and build the project
 31761:  - install the CLI globally (npm install -g .)
 31762:  - build the VS Code extension
 31763:  - package the VSIX and publish it to Azure DevOps Marketplace using tfx (prompts for PAT)
 31764: 
 31765: You will be prompted for a Personal Access Token (PAT). Do not paste it here.
 31766: #>
 31767: 
 31768: function To-UnsecureString([securestring] $s) {
 31769:   $bstr = [System.Runtime.InteropServices.Marshal]::SecureStringToBSTR($s)
 31770:   try { [System.Runtime.InteropServices.Marshal]::PtrToStringBSTR($bstr) } finally { [System.Runtime.InteropServices.Marshal]::ZeroFreeBSTR($bstr) }
 31771: }
 31772: 
 31773: Write-Host "Installing project dependencies and building..." -ForegroundColor Cyan
 31774: npm install --no-audit --no-fund
 31775: if ($LASTEXITCODE -ne 0) { Write-Error "npm install failed"; exit 1 }
 31776: 
 31777: npm run build
 31778: if ($LASTEXITCODE -ne 0) { Write-Error "npm run build failed"; exit 1 }
 31779: 
 31780: Write-Host "Installing qflush CLI globally (requires admin)..." -ForegroundColor Cyan
 31781: npm install -g .
 31782: if ($LASTEXITCODE -ne 0) { Write-Error "npm install -g . failed"; exit 1 }
 31783: 
 31784: Write-Host "Building VS Code extension..." -ForegroundColor Cyan
 31785: Push-Location extensions/vscode-npz
 31786: npm ci --no-audit --no-fund
 31787: if ($LASTEXITCODE -ne 0) { Write-Error "npm ci failed in extension"; Pop-Location; exit 1 }
 31788: 
 31789: npm run build
 31790: if ($LASTEXITCODE -ne 0) { Write-Error "Extension build failed"; Pop-Location; exit 1 }
 31791: 
 31792: # ensure tfx is installed
 31793: Write-Host "Ensuring tfx-cli is installed..." -ForegroundColor Cyan
 31794: npm install -g tfx-cli@0.7.0
 31795: if ($LASTEXITCODE -ne 0) { Write-Error "Failed to install tfx-cli"; Pop-Location; exit 1 }
 31796: 
 31797: # create vsix
 31798: Write-Host "Packaging VSIX..." -ForegroundColor Cyan
 31799: try {
 31800:   tfx extension create --manifest-globs vss-extension.json --output-path .. | Write-Host
 31801: } catch {
 31802:   Write-Warning "tfx extension create returned non-zero but will continue if vsix exists"
 31803: }
 31804: 
 31805: # find vsix
 31806: $vsix = Get-ChildItem -Path .. -Filter *.vsix | Sort-Object LastWriteTime -Descending | Select-Object -First 1
 31807: if (-not $vsix) { Write-Error "VSIX not found in repo root"; Pop-Location; exit 1 }
 31808: 
 31809: Write-Host "VSIX packaged: $($vsix.Name)" -ForegroundColor Green
 31810: 
 31811: # prompt for PAT
 31812: $patSec = Read-Host -AsSecureString "Enter Azure DevOps PAT (will not echo)"
 31813: $pat = To-UnsecureString $patSec
 31814: 
 31815: if (-not $pat) { Write-Error "No PAT provided"; Pop-Location; exit 1 }
 31816: 
 31817: # publish
 31818: $publisher = 'funesterie'
 31819: Write-Host "Publishing $($vsix.Name) to Marketplace as publisher $publisher..." -ForegroundColor Cyan
 31820: $cmd = "tfx extension publish --manifest-globs vss-extension.json --publisher $publisher --token $pat --service-url https://marketplace.visualstudio.com/"
 31821: Write-Host $cmd
 31822: Invoke-Expression $cmd
 31823: 
 31824: if ($LASTEXITCODE -ne 0) { Write-Error "tfx publish failed"; Pop-Location; exit 1 }
 31825: 
 31826: Write-Host "Publish command finished. Check Marketplace publisher and pipeline for status." -ForegroundColor Green
 31827: 
 31828: Pop-Location
 31829: # zero the token variable
 31830: $pat = $null
 31831: [System.GC]::Collect()
 31832: [System.GC]::WaitForPendingFinalizers()
 31833: Write-Host "Done." -ForegroundColor Green
 31834:

 31840: ============================
 31841: param([string]$ProjectPath = '.')
 31842: Set-Location $ProjectPath
 31843: 
 31844: Write-Host "Installing @funeste38/qflush..."
 31845: npm install @funeste38/qflush --save
 31846: 
 31847: Get-ChildItem -Path . -Recurse -Include *.ts,*.js,*.tsx,*.jsx | ForEach-Object {
 31848:   (Get-Content $_.FullName) -replace "from '@funeste38/rome'", "from '@funeste38/qflush'" | Set-Content $_.FullName
 31849: }
 31850: Write-Host "Migration done. Please review and run tests."

 31855: FILE: scripts\open-copilot-cli.ps1
 31856: ============================
 31857: ============================
 31858: # Open the official GitHub Copilot CLI repository in the default browser
 31859: # Usage: .\scripts\open-copilot-cli.ps1
 31860: 
 31861: $repoUrl = "https://github.com/github/copilot-cli"
 31862: try {

 31864: } catch {
 31865:   Write-Host "Open this URL in your browser: $repoUrl"

 31869: 
 31870: ============================
 31871: FILE: scripts\prepare-and-run-token-windows.ps1
 31872: ============================
 31873: ============================
 31874: <#
 31875: PowerShell helper to convert a private key to unencrypted PEM, upload it to GitHub Actions secrets
 31876: and run the `get-installation-token.yml` workflow, then download the artifact.
 31877: 
 31878: Usage (PowerShell):
 31879:   .\scripts\prepare-and-run-token-windows.ps1 -KeyPath 'D:\keys\private.pem' -AppId 2326697 -InstallationId 95833021 -Repo 'jEFFLEZ/qflush'
 31880: 
 31881: Requirements:
 31882:  - gh CLI authenticated (gh auth login)
 31883:  - ssh-keygen / openssl available in PATH (Git for Windows provides ssh-keygen)
 31884:  - The script will fail if the private key is encrypted and cannot be converted without the passphrase.
 31885: #>
 31886: [CmdletBinding()]
 31887: param(
 31888:   [Parameter(Mandatory=$true)] [string] $KeyPath,
 31889:   [Parameter(Mandatory=$true)] [string] $AppId,
 31890:   [Parameter(Mandatory=$true)] [string] $InstallationId,
 31891:   [Parameter(Mandatory=$false)] [string] $Repo = 'jEFFLEZ/qflush',
 31892:   [switch] $DryRun
 31893: )
 31894: 
 31895: function Write-ErrAndExit($msg){ Write-Error $msg; exit 1 }
 31896: 
 31897: if (-not (Test-Path $KeyPath)) { Write-ErrAndExit "Key file not found: $KeyPath" }
 31898: 
 31899: $work = Join-Path -Path (Get-Location) -ChildPath "tmp-pem"
 31900: if (Test-Path $work) { Remove-Item -Recurse -Force $work }
 31901: New-Item -ItemType Directory -Path $work | Out-Null
 31902: 
 31903: $dest = Join-Path $work 'private-unencrypted.pem'
 31904: Copy-Item -Path $KeyPath -Destination $dest -Force
 31905: 
 31906: # Detect header
 31907: $head = ((Get-Content -Raw $dest) -split "\r?\n" | Select-Object -First 2) -join "`n"
 31908: Write-Host "Key header: $head"
 31909: 
 31910: # If OPENSSH header, try conversion using ssh-keygen
 31911: if ($head -match 'BEGIN OPENSSH PRIVATE KEY') {
 31912:   Write-Host "Converting OpenSSH key to PEM via ssh-keygen..."
 31913:   $conv = & ssh-keygen -p -f $dest -m PEM -N "" 2>&1
 31914:   if ($LASTEXITCODE -ne 0) {
 31915:     Write-Host $conv
 31916:     Write-ErrAndExit "ssh-keygen conversion failed or key is encrypted. Convert locally with passphrase or produce an unencrypted PEM."
 31917:   }
 31918: }
 31919: 
 31920: # Check for ENCRYPTED marker
 31921: $contents = Get-Content -Raw $dest
 31922: if ($contents -match 'ENCRYPTED' -or $contents -match 'Proc-Type: 4,ENCRYPTED') {
 31923:   Write-ErrAndExit "Private key appears encrypted. You must supply an unencrypted PEM. Use openssl/ssh-keygen locally to decrypt."
 31924: }
 31925: 
 31926: # Validate PEM header
 31927: if (-not ($contents -match '-----BEGIN (RSA |)PRIVATE KEY-----')) {
 31928:   Write-ErrAndExit "Resulting key does not appear to be a PEM private key. Inspect $dest"
 31929: }
 31930: 
 31931: if ($DryRun) { Write-Host "Dry run: prepared key is at $dest"; exit 0 }
 31932: 
 31933: # Set secrets via gh
 31934: Write-Host "Setting repository secrets (APP_ID, INSTALLATION_ID, PRIVATE_KEY_PEM) for $Repo"
 31935: $pk = Get-Content -Raw $dest
 31936: # Use gh secret set
 31937: gh secret set APP_ID --body $AppId --repo $Repo
 31938: if ($LASTEXITCODE -ne 0) { Write-ErrAndExit "Failed to set APP_ID secret" }
 31939: gh secret set INSTALLATION_ID --body $InstallationId --repo $Repo
 31940: if ($LASTEXITCODE -ne 0) { Write-ErrAndExit "Failed to set INSTALLATION_ID secret" }
 31941: # PRIVATE_KEY_PEM: ensure newlines preserved
 31942: # Use temporary file approach
 31943: $tempFile = [System.IO.Path]::GetTempFileName()
 31944: Set-Content -Path $tempFile -Value $pk -NoNewline
 31945: gh secret set PRIVATE_KEY_PEM --body (Get-Content -Raw $tempFile) --repo $Repo
 31946: if ($LASTEXITCODE -ne 0) { Write-ErrAndExit "Failed to set PRIVATE_KEY_PEM secret" }
 31947: Remove-Item $tempFile -Force
 31948: 
 31949: Write-Host "Secrets set. Triggering workflow..."
 31950: $run = gh workflow run get-installation-token.yml --repo $Repo
 31951: if ($LASTEXITCODE -ne 0) { Write-ErrAndExit "Failed to trigger workflow" }
 31952: 
 31953: # List latest runs and pick one for the workflow
 31954: Start-Sleep -Seconds 3
 31955: # get most recent run id (databaseId)
 31956: $runId = gh run list --workflow="get-installation-token.yml" --repo $Repo --limit 1 --json databaseId --jq '.[0].databaseId' 2>$null
 31957: if (-not $runId) { Write-ErrAndExit "Failed to get run id" }
 31958: Write-Host "Triggered run id: $runId"
 31959: 
 31960: # Poll run status until completed or timeout
 31961: $timeoutMinutes = 5
 31962: $waitSeconds = 5
 31963: $elapsed = 0
 31964: $maxSeconds = $timeoutMinutes * 60
 31965: while ($elapsed -lt $maxSeconds) {
 31966:   $status = gh run view $runId --repo $Repo --json status,conclusion --jq '.status' 2>$null
 31967:   if ($status -eq 'completed') { break }
 31968:   Start-Sleep -Seconds $waitSeconds
 31969:   $elapsed += $waitSeconds
 31970: }
 31971: 
 31972: $status = gh run view $runId --repo $Repo --json status,conclusion --jq '.status' 2>$null
 31973: $conclusion = gh run view $runId --repo $Repo --json status,conclusion --jq '.conclusion' 2>$null
 31974: Write-Host "Run status: $status conclusion: $conclusion"
 31975: 
 31976: if ($status -ne 'completed') { Write-ErrAndExit "Run did not complete in time (timeout $timeoutMinutes minutes)" }
 31977: if ($conclusion -ne 'success') { Write-ErrAndExit "Run completed but not successful: $conclusion" }
 31978: 
 31979: # Download artifact to D:\keys
 31980: $destDir = 'D:\keys'
 31981: if (-not (Test-Path $destDir)) { New-Item -ItemType Directory -Path $destDir | Out-Null }
 31982: Write-Host "Downloading artifact installation-token to $destDir"
 31983: # remove existing extracted folder to avoid zip extraction conflicts
 31984: $extractedDir = Join-Path $destDir 'installation-token'
 31985: if (Test-Path $extractedDir) {
 31986:   Write-Host "Removing existing artifact extraction folder $extractedDir"
 31987:   Remove-Item -Recurse -Force $extractedDir
 31988: }
 31989: # remove existing root token file to avoid gh extraction error
 31990: $rootTokenPath = Join-Path $destDir 'token.txt'
 31991: if (Test-Path $rootTokenPath) {
 31992:   Write-Host "Removing existing token file $rootTokenPath to allow artifact extraction"
 31993:   Remove-Item -Force $rootTokenPath
 31994: }
 31995: # remove existing installation-repos.json to avoid gh extraction error
 31996: $rootReposPath = Join-Path $destDir 'installation-repos.json'
 31997: if (Test-Path $rootReposPath) {
 31998:   Write-Host "Removing existing API result file $rootReposPath to allow artifact extraction"
 31999:   Remove-Item -Force $rootReposPath
 32000: }
 32001: 
 32002: gh run download $runId --repo $Repo --name installation-token --dir $destDir
 32003: if ($LASTEXITCODE -ne 0) { Write-ErrAndExit "Failed to download artifact" }
 32004: 
 32005: # artifact may be extracted into $destDir\\installation-token\\token.txt or token may already exist at $destDir\\token.txt
 32006: $artifactTokenPath = Join-Path $extractedDir 'token.txt'
 32007: $rootTokenPath = Join-Path $destDir 'token.txt'
 32008: if (Test-Path $artifactTokenPath) {
 32009:   Copy-Item -Path $artifactTokenPath -Destination $rootTokenPath -Force
 32010:   Write-Host "Token saved to $rootTokenPath"
 32011: } elseif (Test-Path $rootTokenPath) {
 32012:   Write-Host "Token already present at $rootTokenPath"
 32013: } else {
 32014:   Write-ErrAndExit "Token file not found at $artifactTokenPath or $rootTokenPath"
 32015: }
 32016: 
 32017: # also copy installation-repos.json to D:\\keys if present (either in extractedDir or root)
 32018: $artifactReposPath = Join-Path $extractedDir 'installation-repos.json'
 32019: $rootReposPath = Join-Path $destDir 'installation-repos.json'
 32020: if (Test-Path $artifactReposPath) {
 32021:   Copy-Item -Path $artifactReposPath -Destination $rootReposPath -Force
 32022:   Write-Host "API result saved to $rootReposPath"
 32023: } elseif (Test-Path $rootReposPath) {
 32024:   Write-Host "API result already present at $rootReposPath"
 32025: } else {
 32026:   Write-Host "installation-repos.json not found in artifact."
 32027: }
 32028: 
 32029: Write-Host "Done."
 32030: 
 32031: 
 32032: 
 32033: ============================
 32034: FILE: scripts\run-with-timeout.ps1
 32035: ============================
 32036: ============================
 32037: <#
 32038: PowerShell wrapper: run a command with a timeout.
 32039: Usage:
 32040:   pwsh ./scripts/run-with-timeout.ps1 -Cmd "node dist/index.js start" -TimeoutSec 12
 32041: Options:
 32042:   -Quiet (default)  -> do not write to host
 32043:   -Noisy            -> enable console output
 32044:   -LogFile <path>   -> append logs to file
 32045: #>
 32046: param(
 32047:   [Parameter(Mandatory=$true)][string]$Cmd,
 32048:   [int]$TimeoutSec = 10,
 32049:   [switch]$Noisy,
 32050:   [string]$LogFile = ''
 32051: )
 32052: 
 32053: # By default be quiet to avoid spamming UIs (unless -Noisy provided)
 32054: $Quiet = -not $Noisy
 32055: 
 32056: function Log([string]$msg) {
 32057:   if ($LogFile -and $LogFile.Trim()) {
 32058:     try { Add-Content -Path $LogFile -Value ("$(Get-Date -Format o) ``: ``" + $msg) -Encoding UTF8 -ErrorAction SilentlyContinue } catch { }
 32059:   }
 32060:   if (-not $Quiet) { Write-Host $msg }
 32061:   else { Write-Verbose $msg }
 32062: }
 32063: 
 32064: Log "[run-with-timeout] starting command: $Cmd"
 32065: $process = Start-Process pwsh -ArgumentList "-NoProfile","-NoLogo","-Command",$Cmd -PassThru -WindowStyle Hidden
 32066: 
 32067: Start-Sleep -Seconds $TimeoutSec
 32068: 
 32069: if (-not $process.HasExited) {
 32070:     Log "[run-with-timeout] timeout reached ($TimeoutSec s) -> attempting graceful stop (Ctrl+C equivalent)"
 32071:     try {
 32072:         $null = $process.CloseMainWindow()
 32073:     } catch {}
 32074:     Start-Sleep -Seconds 1
 32075:     if (-not $process.HasExited) {
 32076:         Log "[run-with-timeout] still running -> forcing kill"
 32077:         try { Stop-Process -Id $process.Id -Force -ErrorAction SilentlyContinue } catch {}
 32078:     }
 32079: }
 32080: 
 32081: # return exit code if available
 32082: if ($process -and $process.HasExited) { exit $process.ExitCode } else { exit 0 }
 32083: 
 32084: 
 32085: 
 32086: ============================
 32087: FILE: scripts\save-secret-node.js
 32088: ============================
 32089: ============================
 32090: #!/usr/bin/env node
 32091: // Small helper to persist secrets encrypted to %USERPROFILE%/.qflush/secrets.json on Windows
 32092: // Uses Windows DPAPI via PowerShell ConvertFrom-SecureString. For cross-platform, store plain .env.local (user responsibility).
 32093: 
 32094: const { execSync } = require('child_process');
 32095: const fs = require('fs');
 32096: const path = require('path');
 32097: 
 32098: function saveSecret(key, value) {
 32099:   const dir = path.join(process.env.USERPROFILE || process.env.HOME || '.', '.qflush');
 32100:   if (!fs.existsSync(dir)) fs.mkdirSync(dir, { recursive: true });
 32101:   const file = path.join(dir, 'secrets.json');
 32102:   // use PowerShell to ConvertFrom-SecureString
 32103:   try {
 32104:     const cmd = `powershell -NoProfile -Command "$s=(ConvertTo-SecureString '${value.replace(/'/g, "''")}' -AsPlainText -Force); $s | ConvertFrom-SecureString"`;
 32105:     const enc = execSync(cmd, { encoding: 'utf8' }).trim();
 32106:     let obj = {};
 32107:     if (fs.existsSync(file)) obj = JSON.parse(fs.readFileSync(file, 'utf8') || '{}');
 32108:     obj[key] = enc;
 32109:     fs.writeFileSync(file, JSON.stringify(obj, null, 2), 'utf8');
 32110:     console.log(`Saved ${key} to ${file}`);
 32111:   } catch (e) {
 32112:     console.error('Failed to save secret via PowerShell DPAPI, falling back to .env.local');
 32113:     fs.appendFileSync('.env.local', `${key}=${value}\n`, 'utf8');
 32114:   }
 32115: }
 32116: 
 32117: if (process.argv.length < 4) {
 32118:   console.error('Usage: node scripts/save-secret-node.js KEY VALUE');
 32119:   process.exit(2);
 32120: }
 32121: saveSecret(process.argv[2], process.argv[3]);
 32122: 
 32123: 
 32124: 
 32125: ============================
 32126: FILE: scripts\set-secrets.ps1
 32127: ============================
 32128: ============================
 32129: param(
 32130:   [string]$Repo = '',
 32131:   [switch]$PersistLocal,
 32132:   [switch]$Quiet,
 32133:   [switch]$NoPrompt
 32134: )
 32135: 
 32136: # PowerShell script to set secrets using gh CLI or write to .env.local
 32137: # If -PersistLocal is set, secrets are also stored encrypted under $env:USERPROFILE\.qflush\secrets.json
 32138: # Usage: .\scripts\set-secrets.ps1 -Repo 'owner/repo' -PersistLocal
 32139: 
 32140: $VerbosePreference = 'SilentlyContinue'
 32141: if (-not $Quiet) { $VerbosePreference = 'Continue' }
 32142: 
 32143: if (-not $Repo) {
 32144:   try { $u = git remote get-url github 2>$null } catch { $u = $null }
 32145:   if (-not $u) { try { $u = git remote get-url origin 2>$null } catch { $u = $null } }
 32146:   if ($u) { $Repo = ($u -replace '.*?/([^/]+/[^/]+)(\.git)?$','$1') }
 32147: }
 32148: if (-not $Repo) { Write-Error 'Repo not provided and could not be detected. Provide -Repo owner/repo.'; exit 2 }
 32149: 
 32150: $secrets = @('NPM_TOKEN','GUMROAD_TOKEN','QFLUSH_TOKEN','REDIS_URL','COPILOT_HMAC_SECRET','WEBHOOK_URL','GUMROAD_TOKEN_FILE')
 32151: 
 32152: $gh = Get-Command gh -ErrorAction SilentlyContinue
 32153: if ($gh) { $useGh = $true } else { $useGh = $false }
 32154: 
 32155: # helper: persist encrypted secret locally
 32156: function Save-LocalSecret([string]$key, [string]$val) {
 32157:   try {
 32158:     $dir = Join-Path $env:USERPROFILE '.qflush'
 32159:     if (-not (Test-Path $dir)) { New-Item -ItemType Directory -Path $dir | Out-Null }
 32160:     $file = Join-Path $dir 'secrets.json'
 32161:     $enc = (ConvertTo-SecureString $val -AsPlainText -Force | ConvertFrom-SecureString)
 32162:     $obj = @{}
 32163:     if (Test-Path $file) {
 32164:       try { $obj = Get-Content $file -Raw | ConvertFrom-Json } catch { $obj = @{} }
 32165:     }
 32166:     $obj.$key = $enc
 32167:     $obj | ConvertTo-Json -Depth 5 | Set-Content -Path $file -Encoding UTF8
 32168:     Write-Verbose "Saved ${key} to ${file} (encrypted)"
 32169:   } catch {
 32170:     Write-Warning "Failed to save local secret ${key}: $_"
 32171:   }
 32172: }
 32173: 
 32174: foreach ($key in $secrets) {
 32175:   # dynamic env var read
 32176:   try { $val = [System.Environment]::GetEnvironmentVariable($key) } catch { $val = $null }
 32177:   if (-not $val) {
 32178:     if ($NoPrompt) { Write-Verbose "Skipping ${key} (no prompt)"; continue }
 32179:     $val = Read-Host "Provide value for ${key} (leave empty to skip)"
 32180:   }
 32181:   if (-not $val) { Write-Verbose "Skipping ${key}"; continue }
 32182:   if ($useGh) {
 32183:     try {
 32184:       gh secret set $key --body $val --repo $Repo
 32185:       Write-Verbose "Set ${key} as GitHub secret in ${Repo}"
 32186:     } catch {
 32187:       Write-Warning "gh secret set failed for ${key}: $_ - falling back to local file"
 32188:       # fallback to local
 32189:       if (-not (Test-Path '.env.local')) { New-Item -ItemType File -Path '.env.local' | Out-Null }
 32190:       # remove any existing line for the key
 32191:       (Get-Content .env.local) -replace "^${key}=.*$","" | Set-Content .env.local
 32192:       Add-Content .env.local "${key}=${val}"
 32193:     }
 32194:   } else {
 32195:     Write-Verbose "gh not available — writing ${key} to .env.local"
 32196:     if (-not (Test-Path .env.local)) { New-Item -ItemType File -Path '.env.local' | Out-Null }
 32197:     # remove any existing line for the key
 32198:     (Get-Content .env.local) -replace "^${key}=.*$","" | Set-Content .env.local
 32199:     Add-Content .env.local "${key}=${val}"
 32200:   }
 32201: 
 32202:   if ($PersistLocal) {
 32203:     Save-LocalSecret -key $key -val $val
 32204:   } else {
 32205:     if ($NoPrompt) { Write-Verbose "NoPersist set, skipping Save-LocalSecret for ${key}"; continue }
 32206:     # Ask user whether to persist locally
 32207:     $yn = Read-Host "Persist ${key} locally encrypted under %USERPROFILE%\\.qflush? (y/N)"
 32208:     if ($yn -and $yn.ToLower().StartsWith('y')) {
 32209:       Save-LocalSecret -key $key -val $val
 32210:     }
 32211:   }
 32212: }
 32213: 
 32214: Write-Verbose 'Done.'
 32215: 
 32216: 
 32217: 
 32218: ============================
 32219: FILE: scripts\setup-windows-agent.ps1
 32220: ============================
 32221: ============================
 32222: <#
 32223: PowerShell helper to download and configure an Azure DevOps self-hosted agent on Windows.
 32224: Usage (run as Administrator PowerShell):
 32225:   PS> .\setup-windows-agent.ps1 -OrganizationUrl "https://dev.azure.com/funesterie" -Pool "self-hosted" -AgentName "qflush-agent"
 32226: 
 32227: You will be prompted for a PAT if not provided via -PatSecure.
 32228: #>
 32229: param(
 32230:   [string]$OrganizationUrl = "https://dev.azure.com/funesterie",
 32231:   [string]$Pool = "self-hosted",
 32232:   [string]$AgentName = "qflush-agent",
 32233:   [securestring]$PatSecure = $null,
 32234:   [string]$AgentPackageUrl = "https://vstsagentpackage.azureedge.net/agent/2.220.1/vsts-agent-win-x64-2.220.1.zip",
 32235:   [string]$InstallDir = "C:\azagent"
 32236: )
 32237: 
 32238: function To-UnsecureString([securestring] $s) {
 32239:   $bstr = [System.Runtime.InteropServices.Marshal]::SecureStringToBSTR($s)
 32240:   try { [System.Runtime.InteropServices.Marshal]::PtrToStringBSTR($bstr) } finally { [System.Runtime.InteropServices.Marshal]::ZeroFreeBSTR($bstr) }
 32241: }
 32242: 
 32243: if (-not $PatSecure) {
 32244:   Write-Host "Enter a Personal Access Token (PAT) with 'Marketplace (publish)' and 'Agent Pools (read & manage)' scopes:" -ForegroundColor Yellow
 32245:   $PatSecure = Read-Host -AsSecureString "PAT"
 32246: }
 32247: 
 32248: $Pat = To-UnsecureString $PatSecure
 32249: 
 32250: if (-not (Test-Path $InstallDir)) { New-Item -ItemType Directory -Path $InstallDir | Out-Null }
 32251: Push-Location $InstallDir
 32252: 
 32253: $zip = Join-Path $InstallDir "agent.zip"
 32254: Write-Host "Downloading agent package from $AgentPackageUrl ..."
 32255: Invoke-WebRequest -Uri $AgentPackageUrl -OutFile $zip -UseBasicParsing
 32256: 
 32257: Write-Host "Extracting package..."
 32258: Expand-Archive -Path $zip -DestinationPath $InstallDir -Force
 32259: Remove-Item $zip -Force
 32260: 
 32261: # Find the agent folder (the zip extracts into the current folder files)
 32262: $agentExe = Join-Path $InstallDir 'config.cmd'
 32263: if (-not (Test-Path $agentExe)) {
 32264:   Write-Host "Could not find config.cmd in $InstallDir. Listing files:" -ForegroundColor Red
 32265:   Get-ChildItem -Path $InstallDir -Recurse | Select-Object -First 50 | Format-List
 32266:   Pop-Location
 32267:   exit 1
 32268: }
 32269: 
 32270: Write-Host "Configuring agent (unattended)..."
 32271: $argList = "--unattended --url `"$OrganizationUrl`" --auth pat --token `"$Pat`" --pool `"$Pool`" --agent `"$AgentName`" --acceptTeeEula"
 32272: Write-Host ".\config.cmd $argList"
 32273: 
 32274: # Run config.cmd
 32275: & .\config.cmd --unattended --url $OrganizationUrl --auth pat --token $Pat --pool $Pool --agent $AgentName --acceptTeeEula
 32276: 
 32277: if ($LASTEXITCODE -ne 0) {
 32278:   Write-Host "Agent configuration failed (exit $LASTEXITCODE). Check output above." -ForegroundColor Red
 32279:   Pop-Location
 32280:   exit $LASTEXITCODE
 32281: }
 32282: 
 32283: Write-Host "Agent configured. Test run interactively with: .\run.cmd" -ForegroundColor Green
 32284: Write-Host "To install as a service (recommended), follow the Azure DevOps agent pool UI instructions or run the service install script from this folder (if provided)." -ForegroundColor Yellow
 32285: 
 32286: Pop-Location
 32287: Write-Host "Done. Agent should appear in Azure DevOps Agent Pools as online." -ForegroundColor Green
 32288: 
 32289: 
 32290: 
 32291: ============================
 32292: FILE: scripts\store-secret.ps1
 32293: ============================
 32294: ============================
 32295: <#
 32296: store-secret.ps1
 32297: Securely read a token from terminal and store it as a GitHub Actions repository secret using gh CLI.
 32298: Requirements:
 32299:  - GitHub CLI (`gh`) installed and authenticated (run `gh auth login` first)
 32300:  - You must have admin permissions on the target repository
 32301: Usage:
 32302:   PowerShell> .\scripts\store-secret.ps1 -Repo "owner/repo" -Name "ACTIONS_TOKEN"
 32303: 
 32304: This script reads the token securely (no echo), writes to a tempfile, calls `gh secret set` with the file
 32305: and removes the tempfile immediately.
 32306: #>
 32307: param(
 32308:   [Parameter(Mandatory=$true)]
 32309:   [string]$Repo,
 32310:   [Parameter(Mandatory=$true)]
 32311:   [string]$Name
 32312: )
 32313: 
 32314: if (-not (Get-Command gh -ErrorAction SilentlyContinue)) {
 32315:   Write-Error "gh CLI not found. Install and authenticate with 'gh auth login' before running this script."
 32316:   exit 2
 32317: }
 32318: 
 32319: try {
 32320:   $secure = Read-Host -AsSecureString -Prompt "Paste secret value (input hidden)"
 32321:   $plain = [System.Runtime.InteropServices.Marshal]::PtrToStringAuto([System.Runtime.InteropServices.Marshal]::SecureStringToBSTR($secure))
 32322:   $tmp = Join-Path -Path $env:TEMP -ChildPath ([System.Guid]::NewGuid().ToString() + '.secret')
 32323:   Set-Content -Path $tmp -Value $plain -NoNewline -Force
 32324:   # Use gh to set the secret from file
 32325:   $cmd = "gh secret set $Name --repo $Repo --body-file $tmp"
 32326:   Write-Host "Setting secret '$Name' in repo '$Repo'..."
 32327:   $res = & gh secret set $Name --repo $Repo --body-file $tmp 2>&1
 32328:   Write-Host $res
 32329: } finally {
 32330:   if (Test-Path $tmp) { Remove-Item -Force $tmp }
 32331:   if ($null -ne $plain) { $plain = $null }
 32332: }
 32333: 
 32334: Write-Host "Done. Secret stored (or an error was printed above)."
 32335: 
 32336:

 34646: 
 34647: 
 34648: ============================
 34649: FILE: spyder\apps\spyder-core\README.md
 34650: ============================
 34651: ============================
 34652: SPYDER Core
 34653: 
 34654: Simple MVP that listens on TCP port 4000 and forwards TYPE=1 packets to a local A-11 bridge at http://localhost:5000/ask. Stores messages in RAM/cache and snapshots to dead memory.
 34655: 
 34656: Run:
 34657: 
 34658: - npm install
 34659: - npm run start
 34660: 
 34661: 
 34662: 
 34663: ============================
 34664: FILE: spyder\apps\spyder-core\rome.json
 34665: ============================
 34666: ============================
 34667: {
 34668:   "root": true,
 34669:   "formatter": { "enabled": true },
 34670:   "linter": { "enabled": true }
 34671: }
 34672: 
 34673: 
 34674: 
 34675: ============================
 34676: FILE: spyder\apps\spyder-core\src\admin\server.ts
 34677: ============================
 34678: ============================
 34679: import http from 'http';
 34680: import { Collector } from '../utils/collector';
 34681: import { listDecoders } from '../protocol/decoder';
 34682: 
 34683: export function createAdminServer(port: number, collector: Collector, getState: () => any) {
 34684:   const server = http.createServer((req: http.IncomingMessage, res: http.ServerResponse) => {
 34685:     if (!req.url) {
 34686:       res.writeHead(400);
 34687:       res.end('bad request');
 34688:       return;
 34689:     }
 34690: 
 34691:     if (req.url === '/metrics') {
 34692:       res.writeHead(200, { 'Content-Type': 'application/json' });
 34693:       res.end(JSON.stringify(collector.snapshot()));
 34694:       return;
 34695:     }
 34696: 
 34697:     if (req.url === '/memory') {
 34698:       const state = getState();
 34699:       res.writeHead(200, { 'Content-Type': 'application/json' });
 34700:       res.end(JSON.stringify({ ram: state.ram.records, cache: state.cache.records, dead: state.dead.snapshots }));
 34701:       return;
 34702:     }
 34703: 
 34704:     if (req.url === '/graph') {
 34705:       const state = getState();
 34706:       res.writeHead(200, { 'Content-Type': 'application/json' });
 34707:       res.end(JSON.stringify({ nodes: Array.from(state.web.nodes.entries()), edges: state.web.edges }));
 34708:       return;
 34709:     }
 34710: 
 34711:     if (req.url === '/decoders') {
 34712:       res.writeHead(200, { 'Content-Type': 'application/json' });
 34713:       res.end(JSON.stringify({ decoders: listDecoders() }));
 34714:       return;
 34715:     }
 34716: 
 34717:     if (req.url === '/status') {
 34718:       res.writeHead(200, { 'Content-Type': 'application/json' });
 34719:       res.end(JSON.stringify({ ok: true }));
 34720:       return;
 34721:     }
 34722: 
 34723:     res.writeHead(404);
 34724:     res.end('not found');
 34725:   });
 34726: 
 34727:   server.listen(port, '127.0.0.1');
 34728:   return server;
 34729: }
 34730: 
 34731: 
 34732: 
 34733: ============================
 34734: FILE: spyder\apps\spyder-core\src\analyze\score.ts
 34735: ============================
 34736: ============================
 34737: export interface ScoreContext {
 34738:   checksumOk: boolean;
 34739:   decodeOk: boolean;
 34740:   responseOk: boolean;
 34741: }
 34742: 
 34743: export function computeScore(ctx: ScoreContext): number {
 34744:   let s = 0;
 34745:   if (ctx.checksumOk) s += 1;
 34746:   if (ctx.decodeOk) s += 1;
 34747:   if (ctx.responseOk) s += 1;
 34748:   return s;
 34749: }
 34750: 
 34751: 
 34752: 
 34753: ============================
 34754: FILE: spyder\apps\spyder-core\src\cli.ts
 34755: ============================
 34756: ============================
 34757: #!/usr/bin/env node
 34758: import { nlToProlog } from './parser/semantic.js';
 34759: import { PrologEngine } from './logic/prologEngine.js';
 34760: 
 34761: const engine = new PrologEngine();
 34762: 
 34763: const input = process.argv.slice(2).join(' ');
 34764: if (!input) {
 34765:   console.log('Usage: spyder-cli "some sentence"');
 34766:   process.exit(1);
 34767: }
 34768: 
 34769: const fact = nlToProlog(input);
 34770: console.log('Prolog fact:', fact);
 34771: engine.assert(fact);
 34772: console.log('Query back exists?', engine.query(fact));
 34773: 
 34774: 
 34775: 
 34776: ============================
 34777: FILE: spyder\apps\spyder-core\src\config\default.json
 34778: ============================
 34779: ============================
 34780: {
 34781:   "tcpPort": 4000,
 34782:   "adminPort": 4001,
 34783:   "host": "127.0.0.1",
 34784:   "checksum": "xor",
 34785:   "scoreThreshold": 2,
 34786:   "snapshotIntervalMs": 60000,
 34787:   "a11Endpoint": "http://127.0.0.1:3000/v1/chat/completions",
 34788:   "echoTimeoutMs": 2000,
 34789:   "longRequestThresholdMs": 1000,
 34790:   "maxRetries": 1,
 34791:   "plugins": ["@funeste38/bat"],
 34792:   "allowInternet": true,
 34793:   "httpProxy": "",
 34794:   "languages": ["en","fr","es","zh","ru"]
 34795: }
 34796: 
 34797: 
 34798: 
 34799: ============================
 34800: FILE: spyder\apps\spyder-core\src\graph\web.ts
 34801: ============================
 34802: ============================
 34803: export type NodeType = 'message' | 'concept';
 34804: 
 34805: export interface Node {
 34806:   id: string;
 34807:   type: NodeType;
 34808:   payloadRef?: string;
 34809: }
 34810: 
 34811: export type RelationType = 'sequence' | 'cause' | 'combo';
 34812: 
 34813: export interface Edge {
 34814:   from: string;
 34815:   to: string;
 34816:   relation: RelationType;
 34817:   weight: number;
 34818: }
 34819: 
 34820: export class SpiderWeb {
 34821:   nodes = new Map<string, Node>();
 34822:   edges: Edge[] = [];
 34823: 
 34824:   addNode(node: Node) {
 34825:     this.nodes.set(node.id, node);
 34826:   }
 34827: 
 34828:   addEdge(from: string, to: string, relation: RelationType) {
 34829:     const existing = this.edges.find(
 34830:       e => e.from === from && e.to === to && e.relation === relation
 34831:     );
 34832:     if (existing) {
 34833:       existing.weight += 1;
 34834:     } else {
 34835:       this.edges.push({ from, to, relation, weight: 1 });
 34836:     }
 34837:   }
 34838: }
 34839: 
 34840: 
 34841: 
 34842: ============================
 34843: FILE: spyder\apps\spyder-core\src\index.ts
 34844: ============================
 34845: ============================
 34846: import * as net from 'net';
 34847: import config from './config/default.json';
 34848: import { log, logError } from './utils/logger';
 34849: import {
 34850:   PacketType,
 34851:   parsePacket,
 34852:   serializePacket
 34853: } from './protocol/packet';
 34854: import { decodePayload, registerDecoder } from './protocol/decoder';
 34855: import { RamMemory } from './memory/ram';
 34856: import { CacheMemory } from './memory/cache';
 34857: import { DeadMemory } from './memory/dead';
 34858: import { SpiderWeb } from './graph/web';
 34859: import { computeScore } from './analyze/score';
 34860: import { askA11 } from './teacher/bridge';
 34861: import { elapsedMs, classifyLatency } from './utils/metrics';
 34862: import { loadPlugins } from './plugins/loader';
 34863: import { Collector } from './utils/collector';
 34864: import { createAdminServer } from './admin/server';
 34865: import { loadLanguageDecoders } from './lang/loader';
 34866: 
 34867: const ram = new RamMemory();
 34868: const cache = new CacheMemory();
 34869: const dead = new DeadMemory();
 34870: const web = new SpiderWeb();
 34871: const collector = new Collector();
 34872: 
 34873: let exchangeCounter = 0;
 34874: 
 34875: const spyderCtx = {
 34876:   web,
 34877:   ram,
 34878:   cache,
 34879:   dead,
 34880:   config,
 34881:   registerDecoder,
 34882:   askA11,
 34883:   log,
 34884:   logError
 34885: };
 34886: 
 34887: // load plugins (non-blocking)
 34888: loadPlugins(spyderCtx as any).catch(e => logError('plugin loader failed', e));
 34889: 
 34890: // load language decoders
 34891: loadLanguageDecoders().catch(e => logError('language loader failed', e));
 34892: 
 34893: // start admin server
 34894: const admin = createAdminServer((config as any).adminPort || 4001, collector, () => ({ web, ram, cache, dead }));
 34895: log('Admin server listening on', (config as any).adminPort || 4001);
 34896: 
 34897: async function callA11WithRetry(text: string, maxRetries: number, timeoutMs: number) {
 34898:   let attempts = 0;
 34899:   const start = Date.now();
 34900:   while (attempts <= maxRetries) {
 34901:     attempts += 1;
 34902:     try {
 34903:       const before = Date.now();
 34904:       const resp = await askA11((config as any).a11Endpoint, text);
 34905:       const latency = Date.now() - before;
 34906:       collector.inc('requests_total');
 34907:       collector.observe('latency_ms', latency);
 34908:       return { resp: resp.text, attempts, latency, timedOut: false };
 34909:     } catch (e) {
 34910:       collector.inc('requests_error');
 34911:       if (attempts > maxRetries) {
 34912:         return { resp: 'ERROR_A11', attempts, latency: Date.now() - start, timedOut: true };
 34913:       }
 34914:       // else retry
 34915:     }
 34916:   }
 34917:   return { resp: 'ERROR_A11', attempts: 0, latency: 0, timedOut: true };
 34918: }
 34919: 
 34920: const server = net.createServer((socket: any) => {
 34921:   log('Client connected');
 34922: 
 34923:   socket.on('data', async (data: any) => {
 34924:     try {
 34925:       const packet = parsePacket(new Uint8Array(data));
 34926:       if (!packet) {
 34927:         logError('Invalid packet structure');
 34928:         collector.inc('invalid_packet');
 34929:         return;
 34930:       }
 34931: 
 34932:       const checksumOk = packet.checksum >= 0;
 34933: 
 34934:       if (packet.type === PacketType.Question) {
 34935:         const decoded = await decodePayload(packet.payload).catch(() => null);
 34936:         const decodeOk = decoded !== null;
 34937: 
 34938:         const text =
 34939:           typeof decoded === 'string'
 34940:             ? decoded
 34941:             : JSON.stringify(decoded);
 34942: 
 34943:         log('Q:', text);
 34944: 
 34945:         // call A-11 with retries and measure latency
 34946:         const start = Date.now();
 34947:         const call = await callA11WithRetry(text, (config as any).maxRetries, (config as any).echoTimeoutMs);
 34948:         const latency = call.latency;
 34949:         const classification = call.timedOut
 34950:           ? 'timeout'
 34951:           : classifyLatency(latency, (config as any).longRequestThresholdMs);
 34952: 
 34953:         const responseText = call.resp;
 34954:         const payloadBytes = new TextEncoder().encode(responseText);
 34955:         const answerPacket = serializePacket({
 34956:           type: PacketType.Answer,
 34957:           payload: payloadBytes,
 34958:           checksum: 0
 34959:         });
 34960: 
 34961:         socket.write(Buffer.from(answerPacket));
 34962: 
 34963:         const score = computeScore({ checksumOk, decodeOk, responseOk: !call.timedOut });
 34964: 
 34965:         const id = `ex-${++exchangeCounter}`;
 34966:         ram.add({
 34967:           id,
 34968:           question: packet,
 34969:           answer: parsePacket(answerPacket)!,
 34970:           score,
 34971:           timestamp: Date.now(),
 34972:           latencyMs: latency,
 34973:           classification: classification as any,
 34974:           attempts: call.attempts
 34975:         });
 34976: 
 34977:         if ((config as any).scoreThreshold && score >= (config as any).scoreThreshold) {
 34978:           const last = ram.getLast();
 34979:           if (last) cache.promote(last);
 34980:         }
 34981: 
 34982:         // graphe simple : question -> réponse
 34983:         web.addNode({ id: `${id}-q`, type: 'message' });
 34984:         web.addNode({ id: `${id}-a`, type: 'message' });
 34985:         web.addEdge(`${id}-q`, `${id}-a`, 'sequence');
 34986:       }
 34987:     } catch (e) {
 34988:       logError('Error handling data', e);
 34989:     }
 34990:   });
 34991: 
 34992:   socket.on('close', () => {
 34993:     log('Client disconnected');
 34994:   });
 34995: });
 34996: 
 34997: server.listen((config as any).tcpPort, (config as any).host, () => {
 34998:   log(`SPYDER TCP listening on ${(config as any).host}:${(config as any).tcpPort}`);
 34999: });
 35000: 
 35001: // snapshot périodique
 35002: setInterval(() => {
 35003:   if (cache.records.length > 0) {
 35004:     dead.snapshot(cache.records);
 35005:     cache.clear();
 35006:     log('Snapshot saved to dead memory');
 35007:   }
 35008: }, (config as any).snapshotIntervalMs);
 35009: 
 35010:

 35118: ============================
 35119: FILE: spyder\apps\spyder-core\src\lang\detect.ts
 35120: ============================
 35121: ============================
 35122: let franc: any;
 35123: try {
 35124:   franc = require('franc');
 35125: } catch (e) {
 35126:   franc = undefined;
 35127: }
 35128: 
 35129: export function detectLanguage(text: string): string {
 35130:   if (!text || text.trim().length === 0) return 'unknown';
 35131: 
 35132:   // Quick explicit-range heuristics for common scripts
 35133:   try {
 35134:     // Cyrillic range
 35135:     if (/[\u0400-\u04FF\u0500-\u052F\u2DE0-\u2DFF\uA640-\uA69F]/.test(text)) return 'ru';
 35136:     // Arabic range
 35137:     if (/[\u0600-\u06FF\u0750-\u077F]/.test(text)) return 'ar';
 35138:     // Han (CJK Unified Ideographs)
 35139:     if (/[\u4E00-\u9FFF]/.test(text)) return 'zh';
 35140:     // Devanagari
 35141:     if (/[\u0900-\u097F]/.test(text)) return 'hi';
 35142:     // Hiragana/Katakana
 35143:     if (/[\u3040-\u30FF]/.test(text)) return 'ja';
 35144:   } catch (e) {
 35145:     // ignore
 35146:   }
 35147: 
 35148:   if (!franc) return 'unknown';
 35149:   try {
 35150:     const code = franc(text, { minLength: 3 });
 35151:     if (!code || code === 'und') return 'unknown';
 35152:     const map: any = { eng: 'en', fra: 'fr', spa: 'es', cmn: 'zh', rus: 'ru', deu: 'de', jpn: 'ja', ara: 'ar', por: 'pt', ita: 'it', hin: 'hi' };
 35153:     return map[code] || 'unknown';
 35154:   } catch (e) {
 35155:     return 'unknown';
 35156:   }
 35157: }
 35158: 
 35159:

 35161: ============================
 35162: FILE: spyder\apps\spyder-core\src\lang\loader.ts
 35163: ============================
 35164: ============================
 35165: import path from 'path';
 35166: import { registerDecoder } from '../protocol/decoder';
 35167: import config from '../config/default.json';
 35168: 
 35169: export async function loadLanguageDecoders() {
 35170:   const langs: string[] = (config as any).languages || [];
 35171:   for (const l of langs) {
 35172:     try {
 35173:       const p = `./decoders/${l}`;
 35174:       const mod = await import(p);
 35175:       if (mod && mod.default) {
 35176:         registerDecoder(l, mod.default);
 35177:         console.log('Loaded language decoder', l);
 35178:       }
 35179:     } catch (e) {
 35180:       console.warn('Failed to load language decoder', l, e);
 35181:     }
 35182:   }
 35183: }

 35187: ============================
 35188: FILE: spyder\apps\spyder-core\src\logic\prologEngine.ts
 35189: ============================
 35190: ============================
 35191: // Minimal Prolog-like in-memory engine for simple facts and queries
 35192: 
 35193: export class PrologEngine {
 35194:   facts: string[] = [];
 35195: 
 35196:   assert(fact: string) {
 35197:     // store fact as raw string
 35198:     this.facts.push(fact.trim());
 35199:   }
 35200: 
 35201:   query(q: string): boolean {
 35202:     // naive: check if exact fact exists
 35203:     const norm = q.trim();
 35204:     return this.facts.includes(norm);
 35205:   }
 35206: }

 35216: export class CacheMemory {
 35217:   records: ExchangeRecord[] = [];
 35218: 
 35219:   promote(record: ExchangeRecord) {
 35220:     this.records.push(record);
 35221:   }
 35222: 
 35223:   clear() {
 35224:     this.records = [];
 35225:   }
 35226: }

 35235:

 35246: ============================
 35247: FILE: spyder\apps\spyder-core\src\memory\memory.ts
 35248: ============================
 35249: ============================
 35250: function simpleId() {
 35251:   // simple random hex id without using padStart to avoid lib issues
 35252:   const n = Math.floor(Math.random() * 0xffffffff);
 35253:   const s = n.toString(16);
 35254:   return 'i' + ('00000000' + s).slice(-8);
 35255: }
 35256: 
 35257: export type SpyderMessage = {
 35258:   id: string;
 35259:   bits: Uint8Array;
 35260:   type: number;
 35261:   valid: boolean;
 35262:   score: number;
 35263:   timestamp: number;
 35264: };
 35265: 
 35266: export class SpyderMemory {
 35267:   ram: SpyderMessage[] = [];
 35268:   cache: SpyderMessage[] = [];
 35269:   dead: SpyderMessage[][] = [];
 35270: 
 35271:   add(msg: Omit<SpyderMessage, 'id' | 'timestamp'>) {
 35272:     const m: SpyderMessage = { ...msg, id: simpleId(), timestamp: Date.now() } as SpyderMessage;
 35273:     this.ram.push(m);
 35274:     if (m.valid && m.score >= 2) {
 35275:       this.cache.push(m);
 35276:     }
 35277:   }
 35278: 
 35279:   snapshot() {
 35280:     this.dead.push([...this.cache]);
 35281:     this.cache = [];
 35282:   }
 35283: }
 35284: 
 35285: 
 35286: 
 35287: ============================
 35288: FILE: spyder\apps\spyder-core\src\memory\ram.ts
 35289: ============================
 35290: ============================
 35291: import type { SpyderPacket } from '../protocol/packet';
 35292: 
 35293: export interface ExchangeRecord {
 35294:   id: string;
 35295:   question: SpyderPacket;
 35296:   answer?: SpyderPacket;
 35297:   score: number;
 35298:   timestamp: number;
 35299:   latencyMs?: number;
 35300:   classification?: 'short' | 'long' | 'timeout';
 35301:   attempts?: number;
 35302: }
 35303: 
 35304: export class RamMemory {
 35305:   records: ExchangeRecord[] = [];
 35306: 
 35307:   add(record: ExchangeRecord) {
 35308:     this.records.push(record);
 35309:   }
 35310: 
 35311:   getLast(): ExchangeRecord | undefined {
 35312:     return this.records[this.records.length - 1];
 35313:   }
 35314: }

 35317: 
 35318: ============================
 35319: FILE: spyder\apps\spyder-core\src\parser\semantic.ts
 35320: ============================
 35321: ============================
 35322: // Very small NL -> Prolog-like translator for demo purposes
 35323: 
 35324: export function nlToProlog(input: string): string {
 35325:   // naive: "X loves Y" -> loves(x,y).
 35326:   const s = input.trim().toLowerCase();
 35327:   const words = s.split(/\s+/);
 35328:   if (words.length === 3 && words[1] === 'loves') {
 35329:     return `${words[1]}(${words[0]},${words[2]}).`;
 35330:   }
 35331:   // fallback: turn sentence into predicate with tokens
 35332:   const pred = 'sent';
 35333:   const args = words.map(w => w.replace(/[^a-z0-9]/g, '')).join(',');
 35334:   return `${pred}(${args}).`;
 35335: }
 35336: 
 35337: 
 35338: 
 35339: ============================
 35340: FILE: spyder\apps\spyder-core\src\plugins\loader.ts
 35341: ============================
 35342: ============================
 35343: import path from 'path';
 35344: 
 35345: import { PluginRegister, SpyderContext } from './plugin-api';
 35346: 
 35347: export async function loadPlugins(ctx: SpyderContext) {
 35348:   const plugins: string[] = (ctx.config && ctx.config.plugins) || [];
 35349:   for (const p of plugins) {
 35350:     try {
 35351:       let mod: any;
 35352:       if (p.startsWith('.') || p.startsWith('/')) {
 35353:         // local plugin
 35354:         const full = path.resolve(p);
 35355:         mod = await import(full);
 35356:       } else {
 35357:         // npm package
 35358:         mod = await import(p);
 35359:       }
 35360:       const reg: PluginRegister = mod.default || mod.register;
 35361:       if (reg) await reg(ctx);
 35362:       ctx.log('Loaded plugin', p);
 35363:     } catch (e) {
 35364:       ctx.logError('Failed loading plugin', p, e);
 35365:     }
 35366:   }
 35367: }
 35368: 
 35369: 
 35370: 
 35371: ============================
 35372: FILE: spyder\apps\spyder-core\src\plugins\plugin-api.ts
 35373: ============================
 35374: ============================
 35375: import { SpiderWeb } from '../graph/web';
 35376: import { RamMemory } from '../memory/ram';
 35377: import { CacheMemory } from '../memory/cache';
 35378: import { DeadMemory } from '../memory/dead';
 35379: 
 35380: export type SpyderContext = {
 35381:   web: SpiderWeb;
 35382:   ram: RamMemory;
 35383:   cache: CacheMemory;
 35384:   dead: DeadMemory;
 35385:   config: any;
 35386:   registerDecoder: (prefix: string, fn: (input: Uint8Array) => Promise<any>) => void;
 35387:   askA11: (endpoint: string, text: string) => Promise<any>;
 35388:   log: (...args: any[]) => void;
 35389:   logError: (...args: any[]) => void;
 35390: };
 35391: 
 35392: export type PluginRegister = (ctx: SpyderContext) => void | Promise<void>;
 35393: 
 35394: 
 35395: 
 35396: ============================
 35397: FILE: spyder\apps\spyder-core\src\protocol\decoder.ts
 35398: ============================
 35399: ============================
 35400: import { detectLanguage } from '../lang/detect';
 35401: 
 35402: type DecoderFn = (input: Uint8Array) => Promise<any>;
 35403: 
 35404: const registry = new Map<string, DecoderFn>();
 35405: 
 35406: export function registerDecoder(prefix: string, fn: DecoderFn) {
 35407:   registry.set(prefix, fn);
 35408: }
 35409: 
 35410: export function listDecoders() {
 35411:   return Array.from(registry.keys());
 35412: }
 35413: 
 35414: // Décodeur texte brut par défaut
 35415: async function defaultDecoder(input: Uint8Array): Promise<string> {
 35416:   return new TextDecoder().decode(input);
 35417: }
 35418: 
 35419: export async function decodePayload(input: Uint8Array): Promise<any> {
 35420:   const text = new TextDecoder().decode(input);
 35421: 
 35422:   const idx = text.indexOf(':');
 35423:   if (idx > 0) {
 35424:     const prefix = text.slice(0, idx);
 35425:     const rest = text.slice(idx + 1);
 35426: 
 35427:     const fn = registry.get(prefix);
 35428:     if (fn) {
 35429:       try {
 35430:         console.debug('[decoder] using prefix decoder', prefix);
 35431:         return await fn(new TextEncoder().encode(rest));
 35432:       } catch (e) {
 35433:         console.warn('[decoder] prefix decoder error', prefix, e);
 35434:         return null;
 35435:       }
 35436:     } else {
 35437:       console.warn('[decoder] no decoder registered for prefix', prefix);
 35438:     }
 35439:   }
 35440: 
 35441:   // no prefix -> detect language and dispatch
 35442:   const lang = detectLanguage(text);
 35443:   console.debug('[decoder] detected language', lang, 'from text:', text.slice(0, 64));
 35444:   const fn = registry.get(lang);
 35445:   if (fn) {
 35446:     try {
 35447:       return await fn(input);
 35448:     } catch (e) {
 35449:       console.warn('[decoder] language decoder error', lang, e);
 35450:       return null;
 35451:     }
 35452:   } else {
 35453:     console.warn('[decoder] no decoder registered for detected language', lang);
 35454:   }
 35455: 
 35456:   return defaultDecoder(input);
 35457: }
 35458: 
 35459: // Exemple d'enregistrement
 35460: // registerDecoder('nez', async (bytes) => { ... });
 35461: 
 35462: 
 35463: 
 35464: ============================
 35465: FILE: spyder\apps\spyder-core\src\protocol\packet.ts
 35466: ============================
 35467: ============================
 35468: import { computeChecksum } from '../utils/checksum';
 35469: 
 35470: export const SPYDER_HEADER = 0x5e; // 0x5P "style" :P
 35471: 
 35472: export enum PacketType {
 35473:   Question = 1,
 35474:   Answer = 2,
 35475:   Meta = 3
 35476: }
 35477: 
 35478: export interface SpyderPacket {
 35479:   type: PacketType;
 35480:   payload: Uint8Array;
 35481:   checksum: number;
 35482: }
 35483: 
 35484: export function serializePacket(packet: SpyderPacket): Uint8Array {
 35485:   const length = packet.payload.length;
 35486:   const buffer = new Uint8Array(1 + 1 + 2 + length + 1);
 35487:   let offset = 0;
 35488: 
 35489:   buffer[offset++] = SPYDER_HEADER;
 35490:   buffer[offset++] = packet.type;
 35491:   buffer[offset++] = (length >> 8) & 0xff;
 35492:   buffer[offset++] = length & 0xff;
 35493: 
 35494:   buffer.set(packet.payload, offset);
 35495:   offset += length;
 35496: 
 35497:   const cs = computeChecksum(buffer.subarray(0, offset));
 35498:   buffer[offset] = cs;
 35499: 
 35500:   return buffer;
 35501: }
 35502: 
 35503: export function parsePacket(buffer: Uint8Array): SpyderPacket | null {
 35504:   if (buffer.length < 1 + 1 + 2 + 1) return null;
 35505:   let offset = 0;
 35506:   const header = buffer[offset++];
 35507:   if (header !== SPYDER_HEADER) return null;
 35508: 
 35509:   const type = buffer[offset++];
 35510:   const length = (buffer[offset++] << 8) | buffer[offset++];
 35511: 
 35512:   if (buffer.length < 1 + 1 + 2 + length + 1) return null;
 35513: 
 35514:   const payload = buffer.subarray(4, 4 + length);
 35515:   const checksum = buffer[4 + length];
 35516: 
 35517:   const computed = computeChecksum(buffer.subarray(0, 4 + length));
 35518:   if (computed !== checksum) {
 35519:     return {
 35520:       type: type as PacketType,
 35521:       payload,
 35522:       checksum: -1
 35523:     };
 35524:   }
 35525: 
 35526:   return {
 35527:     type: type as PacketType,
 35528:     payload,
 35529:     checksum
 35530:   };
 35531: }
 35532: 
 35533: 
 35534: 
 35535: ============================
 35536: FILE: spyder\apps\spyder-core\src\teacher\bridge.ts
 35537: ============================
 35538: ============================
 35539: import axios from 'axios';
 35540: import config from '../config/default.json';
 35541: 
 35542: interface A11Response {
 35543:   text: string;
 35544: }
 35545: 
 35546: export async function askA11(
 35547:   endpoint: string,
 35548:   messageText: string
 35549: ): Promise<A11Response> {
 35550:   if (!(config as any).allowInternet) {
 35551:     throw new Error('Internet access disabled by configuration');
 35552:   }
 35553: 
 35554:   const body = {
 35555:     model: 'a11-phi3',
 35556:     messages: [{ role: 'user', content: messageText }],
 35557:     stream: false,
 35558:   };
 35559: 
 35560:   const axiosOpts: any = {
 35561:     headers: { 'Content-Type': 'application/json' },
 35562:     timeout: 10000,
 35563:   };
 35564:   if ((config as any).httpProxy) {
 35565:     axiosOpts.proxy = (config as any).httpProxy;
 35566:   }
 35567: 
 35568:   const res = await axios.post(endpoint, body, axiosOpts);
 35569: 
 35570:   const text =
 35571:     res.data?.choices?.[0]?.message?.content ?? JSON.stringify(res.data);
 35572: 
 35573:   return { text };
 35574: }

 35602: 
 35603: ============================
 35604: FILE: spyder\apps\spyder-core\src\utils\checksum.ts
 35605: ============================
 35606: ============================
 35607: export type ChecksumAlgo = 'xor';
 35608: 
 35609: export function xorChecksum(buffer: Uint8Array | Buffer): number {
 35610:   let x = 0;
 35611:   for (let i = 0; i < buffer.length; i++) x ^= buffer[i];
 35612:   return x & 0xff;
 35613: }
 35614: 
 35615: export function computeChecksum(
 35616:   buffer: Uint8Array | Buffer,
 35617:   algo: ChecksumAlgo = 'xor'
 35618: ): number {
 35619:   switch (algo) {
 35620:     case 'xor':
 35621:     default:
 35622:       return xorChecksum(buffer);
 35623:   }
 35624: }
 35625:

 35627: 
 35628: ============================
 35629: FILE: spyder\apps\spyder-core\src\utils\collector.ts
 35630: ============================
 35631: ============================
 35632: type Counters = { [k: string]: number };
 35633: 
 35634: export class Collector {
 35635:   counters: Counters = {};
 35636:   histograms: { [k: string]: number[] } = {};
 35637: 
 35638:   inc(name: string, value = 1) {
 35639:     this.counters[name] = (this.counters[name] || 0) + value;
 35640:   }
 35641: 
 35642:   observe(name: string, v: number) {
 35643:     this.histograms[name] = this.histograms[name] || [];
 35644:     this.histograms[name].push(v);
 35645:   }
 35646: 
 35647:   snapshot() {
 35648:     return {
 35649:       counters: { ...this.counters },
 35650:       histograms: { ...this.histograms }
 35651:     };
 35652:   }
 35653: }

 35675: export function elapsedMs(start: number): number {
 35676:   return Date.now() - start;
 35677: }
 35678: 
 35679: export function isLongRequest(ms: number, threshold: number): boolean {
 35680:   return ms >= threshold;
 35681: }
 35682: 
 35683: export function classifyLatency(ms: number, threshold: number) {
 35684:   return isLongRequest(ms, threshold) ? 'long' : 'short';
 35685: }

 35718: FILE: spyder\apps\spyder-core\tools\mock-a11.js
 35719: ============================
 35720: ============================
 35721: const http = require('http');
 35722: 
 35723: const PORT = 3000;
 35724: 
 35725: const server = http.createServer((req, res) => {
 35726:   if (req.method === 'POST' && req.url === '/v1/chat/completions') {
 35727:     let body = '';
 35728:     req.on('data', (chunk) => (body += chunk));
 35729:     req.on('end', () => {
 35730:       try {
 35731:         const j = JSON.parse(body);
 35732:         const userMsg = j?.messages?.[0]?.content || 'hello';
 35733:         const reply = `A-11 mock reply to: ${userMsg}`;
 35734:         const out = { choices: [{ message: { content: reply } }] };
 35735:         res.writeHead(200, { 'Content-Type': 'application/json' });
 35736:         res.end(JSON.stringify(out));
 35737:       } catch (e) {
 35738:         res.writeHead(400);
 35739:         res.end('bad json');
 35740:       }
 35741:     });
 35742:     return;
 35743:   }
 35744: 
 35745:   res.writeHead(404);
 35746:   res.end('not found');
 35747: });
 35748: 
 35749: server.listen(PORT, '127.0.0.1', () => {
 35750:   console.log(`Mock A-11 listening on http://127.0.0.1:${PORT}`);
 35751: });

 35754: 
 35755: ============================
 35756: FILE: spyder\apps\spyder-core\tools\test-all.ts
 35757: ============================
 35758: ============================
 35759: import { serializePacket, parsePacket, PacketType } from '../src/protocol/packet';
 35760: import { computeChecksum, xorChecksum } from '../src/utils/checksum';
 35761: import { decodePayload } from '../src/protocol/decoder';
 35762: import { elapsedMs, classifyLatency } from '../src/utils/metrics';
 35763: import { RamMemory } from '../src/memory/ram';
 35764: import { SpiderWeb } from '../src/graph/web';
 35765: 
 35766: function assert(cond: boolean, msg: string) {
 35767:   if (!cond) throw new Error('Assertion failed: ' + msg);
 35768: }
 35769: 
 35770: async function run() {
 35771:   console.log('Running integration tests...');
 35772: 
 35773:   // Protocol roundtrip
 35774:   const payload = new TextEncoder().encode('hello test');
 35775:   const pkt = serializePacket({ type: PacketType.Question, payload, checksum: 0 });
 35776:   const parsed = parsePacket(pkt);
 35777:   assert(parsed !== null, 'parsePacket returned null');
 35778:   assert(parsed!.type === PacketType.Question, 'packet type mismatch');
 35779:   const parsedText = new TextDecoder().decode(parsed!.payload);
 35780:   assert(parsedText === 'hello test', 'payload mismatch');
 35781:   console.log('Protocol: serialize/parse OK');
 35782: 
 35783:   // Checksum functions
 35784:   const cs1 = xorChecksum(payload);
 35785:   const cs2 = computeChecksum(payload);
 35786:   assert(typeof cs1 === 'number' && typeof cs2 === 'number', 'checksum types');
 35787:   console.log('Checksum: xor/compute OK', cs1, cs2);
 35788: 
 35789:   // Decoder
 35790:   const dec = await decodePayload(new TextEncoder().encode('plain:some text'));
 35791:   assert(dec === 'some text' || typeof dec === 'string', 'decoder output');
 35792:   const dec2 = await decodePayload(new TextEncoder().encode('just text'));
 35793:   assert(typeof dec2 === 'string', 'default decoder');
 35794:   console.log('Decoder: default and prefix handling OK');
 35795: 
 35796:   // Metrics
 35797:   const lat = 1200;
 35798:   const cls = classifyLatency(lat, 1000);
 35799:   assert(cls === 'long', 'classifyLatency long');
 35800:   console.log('Metrics: classifyLatency OK');
 35801: 
 35802:   // Memory
 35803:   const ram = new RamMemory();
 35804:   const sample = { id: 't1', question: parsed!, score: 2, timestamp: Date.now() } as any;
 35805:   ram.add(sample);
 35806:   const last = ram.getLast();
 35807:   assert(!!last && last.id === 't1', 'RamMemory add/getLast');
 35808:   console.log('Memory: RamMemory OK');
 35809: 
 35810:   // Graph
 35811:   const web = new SpiderWeb();
 35812:   web.addNode({ id: 'n1', type: 'message' });
 35813:   web.addNode({ id: 'n2', type: 'message' });
 35814:   web.addEdge('n1', 'n2', 'sequence');
 35815:   assert(web.nodes.has('n1') && web.nodes.has('n2'), 'SpiderWeb nodes');
 35816:   console.log('Graph: SpiderWeb OK');
 35817: 
 35818:   console.log('\nAll tests passed');
 35819: }
 35820: 
 35821: run().catch(e => {
 35822:   console.error('Tests failed', e);
 35823:   process.exit(1);
 35824: });
 35825:
