 35982: ============================
 35983: FILE: spyder\spyder\src\index.ts
 35984: ============================
 35985: ============================
 35986: import * as net from 'net';
 35987: import { encodePacket, decodePacket } from './protocol/packet';
 35988: import { SpyderMemory } from './memory/memory';
 35989: import { sendToA11 } from './teacher/bridge';
 35990: 
 35991: const PORT = 4000;
 35992: const memory = new SpyderMemory();
 35993: 
 35994: const server = net.createServer((socket: any) => {
 35995:   console.log('Client connected');
 35996:   socket.on('data', async (data: any) => {
 35997:     try {
 35998:       const buf = Uint8Array.from(data);
 35999:       const pkt = decodePacket(buf);
 36000:       if (!pkt) return;
 36001:       const valid = pkt.checksum !== 0;
 36002:       const score = valid ? 2 : 0;
 36003:       memory.add({ bits: pkt.payload, type: pkt.type, valid, score });
 36004:       if (pkt.type === 1) {
 36005:         const resp = await sendToA11(pkt.payload);
 36006:         const out = encodePacket(2 as any, resp);
 36007:         const sendBuf = Buffer.from(out);
 36008:         socket.write(sendBuf);
 36009:         memory.add({ bits: resp, type: 2, valid: resp.length > 0, score: resp.length > 0 ? 2 : 0 });
 36010:       }
 36011:     } catch (e) {
 36012:       // ignore errors in MVP
 36013:     }
 36014:   });
 36015:   socket.on('close', () => console.log('Client disconnected'));
 36016: });
 36017: 
 36018: server.listen(PORT, '127.0.0.1', () => console.log(`SPYDER listening on ${PORT}`));
 36019: 
 36020: 
 36021: 
 36022: ============================
 36023: FILE: spyder\spyder\src\memory\memory.ts
 36024: ============================
 36025: ============================
 36026: function simpleId() {
 36027:   const n = Math.floor(Math.random() * 0xffffffff);
 36028:   const s = n.toString(16);
 36029:   return 'i' + ('00000000' + s).slice(-8);
 36030: }
 36031: 
 36032: export type SpyderMessage = {
 36033:   id: string;
 36034:   bits: Uint8Array;
 36035:   type: number;
 36036:   valid: boolean;
 36037:   score: number;
 36038:   timestamp: number;
 36039: };
 36040: 
 36041: export class SpyderMemory {
 36042:   ram: SpyderMessage[] = [];
 36043:   cache: SpyderMessage[] = [];
 36044:   dead: SpyderMessage[][] = [];
 36045: 
 36046:   add(msg: Omit<SpyderMessage, 'id' | 'timestamp'>) {
 36047:     const m: SpyderMessage = { ...msg, id: simpleId(), timestamp: Date.now() } as SpyderMessage;
 36048:     this.ram.push(m);
 36049:     if (m.valid && m.score >= 2) this.cache.push(m);
 36050:   }
 36051: 
 36052:   snapshot() {
 36053:     this.dead.push([...this.cache]);
 36054:     this.cache = [];
 36055:   }
 36056: }
 36057: 
 36058: 
 36059: 
 36060: ============================
 36061: FILE: spyder\spyder\src\protocol\packet.ts
 36062: ============================
 36063: ============================
 36064: export type PacketType = 1 | 2 | 3;
 36065: 
 36066: export interface Packet {
 36067:   header: number; // 1 byte
 36068:   type: PacketType; // 1 byte
 36069:   length: number; // 2 bytes
 36070:   payload: Uint8Array;
 36071:   checksum: number; // 1 byte
 36072: }
 36073: 
 36074: const HEADER = 0x5A;
 36075: 
 36076: export function encodePacket(type: PacketType, payload: Uint8Array): Uint8Array {
 36077:   const length = payload.length;
 36078:   const buffer = new Uint8Array(1 + 1 + 2 + length + 1);
 36079:   buffer[0] = HEADER;
 36080:   buffer[1] = type;
 36081:   buffer[2] = (length >> 8) & 0xff;
 36082:   buffer[3] = length & 0xff;
 36083:   buffer.set(payload, 4);
 36084:   let checksum = 0;
 36085:   for (let i = 0; i < 4 + length; i++) checksum ^= buffer[i];
 36086:   buffer[4 + length] = checksum;
 36087:   return buffer;
 36088: }
 36089: 
 36090: export function decodePacket(buf: Uint8Array): Packet | null {
 36091:   if (buf.length < 5) return null;
 36092:   if (buf[0] !== HEADER) return null;
 36093:   const type = buf[1] as PacketType;
 36094:   const length = (buf[2] << 8) | buf[3];
 36095:   if (buf.length < 4 + length + 1) return null;
 36096:   const payload = buf.slice(4, 4 + length);
 36097:   const checksum = buf[4 + length];
 36098:   let cs = 0;
 36099:   for (let i = 0; i < 4 + length; i++) cs ^= buf[i];
 36100:   const valid = cs === checksum;
 36101:   return { header: buf[0], type, length, payload, checksum: valid ? checksum : 0 };
 36102: }
 36103: 
 36104: 
 36105: 
 36106: ============================
 36107: FILE: spyder\spyder\src\teacher\bridge.ts
 36108: ============================
 36109: ============================
 36110: import http from 'http';
 36111: 
 36112: function concatUint8(arr: Uint8Array[]) {
 36113:   let total = 0;
 36114:   for (const a of arr) total += a.length;
 36115:   const out = new Uint8Array(total);
 36116:   let offs = 0;
 36117:   for (const a of arr) {
 36118:     out.set(a, offs);
 36119:     offs += a.length;
 36120:   }
 36121:   return out;
 36122: }
 36123: 
 36124: function uint8ToBase64(u8: Uint8Array): string {
 36125:   const G = (globalThis as any);
 36126:   if (G && G.Buffer) return G.Buffer.from(u8).toString('base64');
 36127:   let binary = '';
 36128:   for (let i = 0; i < u8.length; i++) binary += String.fromCharCode(u8[i]);
 36129:   if (typeof btoa !== 'undefined') return btoa(binary);
 36130:   throw new Error('No base64 encoder available');
 36131: }
 36132: 
 36133: function base64ToUint8(b64: string): Uint8Array {
 36134:   const G = (globalThis as any);
 36135:   if (G && G.Buffer) return Uint8Array.from(G.Buffer.from(b64, 'base64'));
 36136:   if (typeof atob !== 'undefined') {
 36137:     const bin = atob(b64);
 36138:     const u8 = new Uint8Array(bin.length);
 36139:     for (let i = 0; i < bin.length; i++) u8[i] = bin.charCodeAt(i);
 36140:     return u8;
 36141:   }
 36142:   throw new Error('No base64 decoder available');
 36143: }
 36144: 
 36145: export async function sendToA11(payload: Uint8Array): Promise<Uint8Array> {
 36146:   const bodyObj = { data: uint8ToBase64(payload) };
 36147:   const data = JSON.stringify(bodyObj);
 36148:   const enc = new TextEncoder();
 36149:   const dataLen = enc.encode(data).length;
 36150: 
 36151:   const options = {
 36152:     hostname: '127.0.0.1',
 36153:     port: 5000,
 36154:     path: '/ask',
 36155:     method: 'POST',
 36156:     headers: {
 36157:       'Content-Type': 'application/json',
 36158:       'Content-Length': String(dataLen),
 36159:     },
 36160:     timeout: 5000,
 36161:   } as const;
 36162: 
 36163:   return new Promise((resolve) => {
 36164:     const req = http.request(options, (res: any) => {
 36165:       const chunks: Uint8Array[] = [];
 36166:       res.on('data', (c: any) => {
 36167:         try {
 36168:           chunks.push(Uint8Array.from(c));
 36169:         } catch (e) {
 36170:           // ignore
 36171:         }
 36172:       });
 36173:       res.on('end', () => {
 36174:         try {
 36175:           const all = concatUint8(chunks);
 36176:           const text = new TextDecoder('utf-8').decode(all);
 36177:           const json = JSON.parse(text);
 36178:           if (json && json.data) {
 36179:             resolve(base64ToUint8(json.data));
 36180:             return;
 36181:           }
 36182:         } catch (e) {
 36183:           // fallthrough
 36184:         }
 36185:         resolve(new Uint8Array());
 36186:       });
 36187:     });
 36188: 
 36189:     req.on('error', () => resolve(new Uint8Array()));
 36190:     req.on('timeout', () => { req.destroy(); resolve(new Uint8Array()); });
 36191:     req.write(data);
 36192:     req.end();
 36193:   });
 36194: }
 36195:

 36203: declare module 'http';
 36204: declare module 'uuid';
 36205: 
 36206: declare var Buffer: any;
 36207: declare var console: any;

 36220:     "rootDir": "src",
 36221:     "strict": false,

 36223:     "moduleResolution": "node",
 36224:     "lib": ["es2019", "dom"],
 36225:     "skipLibCheck": true,

 36227:     "baseUrl": "."
 36228:   },

 36230: }

 36237: ============================

 36245: 
 36246: 
 36247: ============================
 36248: FILE: src\chain\smartChain.ts
 36249: ============================
 36250: ============================
 36251: // ROME-TAG: 0x8CD4FC
 36252: 
 36253: import { logger } from "../utils/logger";
 36254: import { runDetect } from "../commands/detect";
 36255: import { runConfig } from "../commands/config";
 36256: import { runPurge } from "../commands/purge";
 36257: import { runKill } from "../commands/kill";
 36258: import { runStart } from "../commands/start";
 36259: import { runExodia } from "../commands/exodia";
 36260: 
 36261: const ORDER = ["detect", "config", "purge", "kill", "start", "exodia"];
 36262: 
 36263: export type qflushOptions = {
 36264:   global?: Record<string, any>;
 36265:   modulePaths?: Record<string, string>;
 36266:   tokens?: Record<string, string>;
 36267:   flags?: Record<string, boolean | string>;
 36268:   detected?: Record<string, any>;
 36269:   services?: string[];
 36270: };
 36271: 
 36272: function parseArgs(argv: string[]) {
 36273:   const cmds: string[] = [];
 36274:   const flags: Record<string, boolean | string> = {};
 36275:   const modulePaths: Record<string, string> = {};
 36276:   const tokens: Record<string, string> = {};
 36277:   const services: string[] = [];
 36278: 
 36279:   let currentService: string | undefined;
 36280:   let i = 0;
 36281:   while (i < argv.length) {
 36282:     const a = argv[i];
 36283:     if (!a.startsWith("-")) {
 36284:       cmds.push(a.toLowerCase());
 36285:       i++;
 36286:       continue;
 36287:     }
 36288:     const clean = a.replace(/^--?/, "");
 36289: 
 36290:     if (clean === "service" || clean === "s") {
 36291:       const next = argv[i + 1];
 36292:       if (next && !next.startsWith("-")) {
 36293:         currentService = next.toLowerCase();
 36294:         services.push(currentService);
 36295:         i += 2;
 36296:         continue;
 36297:       } else {
 36298:         i++;
 36299:         continue;
 36300:       }
 36301:     }
 36302: 
 36303:     if (clean === "path") {
 36304:       const next = argv[i + 1];
 36305:       if (next && !next.startsWith("-")) {
 36306:         if (currentService) modulePaths[currentService] = next;
 36307:         i += 2;
 36308:         continue;
 36309:       }
 36310:       i++;
 36311:       continue;
 36312:     }
 36313: 
 36314:     if (clean === "token") {
 36315:       const next = argv[i + 1];
 36316:       if (next && !next.startsWith("-")) {
 36317:         if (currentService) tokens[currentService] = next;
 36318:         i += 2;
 36319:         continue;
 36320:       }
 36321:       i++;
 36322:       continue;
 36323:     }
 36324: 
 36325:     const kv = clean.split("=");
 36326:     if (kv.length === 2) {
 36327:       flags[kv[0]] = kv[1];
 36328:       i++;
 36329:       continue;
 36330:     }
 36331: 
 36332:     const next = argv[i + 1];
 36333:     if (next && !next.startsWith("-")) {
 36334:       flags[clean] = next;
 36335:       i += 2;
 36336:       continue;
 36337:     }
 36338:     flags[clean] = true;
 36339:     i++;
 36340:   }
 36341: 
 36342:   return { cmds, flags, modulePaths, tokens, services };
 36343: }
 36344: 
 36345: export function buildPipeline(argv: string[]) {
 36346:   const { cmds, flags, modulePaths, tokens, services } = parseArgs(argv);
 36347:   const unique = Array.from(new Set(cmds));
 36348:   const known = unique.filter((c) => ORDER.includes(c));
 36349: 
 36350:   if (known.length === 0)
 36351:     return {
 36352:       pipeline: ["detect", "config", "start"],
 36353:       options: { flags, modulePaths, tokens, global: {} as any, services },
 36354:     };
 36355: 
 36356:   // build set with dependencies
 36357:   const set = new Set<string>(known);
 36358:   // dependencies mapping
 36359:   const deps: Record<string, string[]> = {
 36360:     start: ["config"],
 36361:     config: ["detect"],
 36362:     purge: ["detect"],
 36363:   };
 36364: 
 36365:   // add dependencies recursively
 36366:   function addDeps(cmd: string) {
 36367:     const ds = deps[cmd] || [];
 36368:     for (const d of ds) {
 36369:       if (!set.has(d)) {
 36370:         set.add(d);
 36371:         addDeps(d);
 36372:       }
 36373:     }
 36374:   }
 36375:   for (const k of Array.from(set)) addDeps(k);
 36376: 
 36377:   let final: string[] = [];
 36378: 
 36379:   // Flag-driven transformations
 36380:   if (flags["fresh"]) {
 36381:     set.add("purge");
 36382:     // ensure purge runs before start
 36383:   }
 36384:   if (flags["force"]) {
 36385:     // make sure kill runs before start
 36386:     set.add("kill");
 36387:   }
 36388: 
 36389:   const requestedKill = known.includes("kill");
 36390: 
 36391:   if (requestedKill) {
 36392:     // put kill first if user explicitly requested it
 36393:     final.push("kill");
 36394:     for (const k of ORDER) {
 36395:       if (k === "kill") continue;
 36396:       if (set.has(k)) final.push(k);
 36397:     }
 36398:   } else {
 36399:     for (const k of ORDER) {
 36400:       if (set.has(k)) final.push(k);
 36401:     }
 36402:   }
 36403: 
 36404:   // remove duplicates and preserve order
 36405:   final = final.filter((v, i) => final.indexOf(v) === i);
 36406: 
 36407:   logger.info(`SmartChain built pipeline: ${final.join(" -> ")}`);
 36408:   const options: qflushOptions = { global: {}, flags, modulePaths, tokens, services };
 36409:   return { pipeline: final, options };
 36410: }
 36411: 
 36412: export async function executePipeline(pipeline: string[], options: qflushOptions) {
 36413:   for (const step of pipeline) {
 36414:     logger.info(`Executing pipeline step: ${step}`);
 36415:     switch (step) {
 36416:       case "detect": {
 36417:         const detected = await runDetect(options);
 36418:         options.detected = detected || {};
 36419:         if (detected && typeof detected === "object") {
 36420:           options.modulePaths = { ...(options.modulePaths || {}), ...(detected.paths || {}) };
 36421:         }
 36422:         break;
 36423:       }
 36424:       case "config":
 36425:         await runConfig(options);
 36426:         break;
 36427:       case "purge":
 36428:         await runPurge(options);
 36429:         break;
 36430:       case "kill":
 36431:         await runKill(options);
 36432:         break;
 36433:       case "start":
 36434:         await runStart(options);
 36435:         break;
 36436:       case "exodia":
 36437:         await runExodia(options);
 36438:         break;
 36439:       default:
 36440:         logger.warn(`Unknown pipeline step: ${step}`);
 36441:     }
 36442:   }
 36443: }
 36444: 
 36445: 
 36446: 
 36447: 
 36448: ============================
 36449: FILE: src\cli\help.ts
 36450: ============================
 36451: ============================
 36452: // ROME-TAG: 0x1DEEBD
 36453: 
 36454: import alias from '../utils/alias';
 36455: const logger = alias.importUtil('@utils/logger') || alias.importUtil('../utils/logger') || console;
 36456: 
 36457: export function showHelp() {
 36458:   logger.info(`qflush - Funesterie orchestrator`);
 36459:   console.log(`
 36460: Usage:
 36461:   qflush [command] [options]
 36462: 
 36463: Commands:
 36464:   start        Launch selected services (default: detect → config → start)
 36465:   kill         Kill running services
 36466:   purge        Clear caches, logs and sessions
 36467:   inspect      Show running services and ports
 36468:   config       Generate missing .env/config files
 36469:   secret import  Import secrets from a .env file into local encrypted store (Windows DPAPI)
 36470: 
 36471: Options (examples):
 36472:   --service rome --path D:/rome --token ABC123     Target a specific service and give path/token
 36473:   --service nezlephant --service freeland          Target multiple services
 36474:   --dev --fresh                                    Global flags (dev mode, fresh start)
 36475:   --force                                          Force restart semantics (implies kill before start)
 36476: 
 36477: Examples:
 36478:   qflush start --service rome --path D:/rome
 36479:   qflush start --service nezlephant --service freeland --fresh
 36480:   qflush config --service freeland
 36481:   qflush purge --fresh
 36482: 
 36483: Scripts & helpers:
 36484:   node scripts/detach.js [--quiet] <command>   # spawn detached process (use --quiet to suppress output)
 36485:   ./scripts/run-with-timeout.sh <sec> <cmd>    # run command with timeout (POSIX)
 36486:   pwsh ./scripts/run-with-timeout.ps1 -Cmd "node dist/index.js start" -TimeoutSec 12  # PowerShell watchdog (quiet by default)
 36487:   qflush secret import [--env <path>] [--no-acl]   # import .env and store encrypted locally
 36488: 
 36489: `);
 36490: }
 36491: 
 36492: 
 36493: 
 36494: ============================
 36495: FILE: src\commands\a11.ts
 36496: ============================
 36497: ============================
 36498: // ROME-TAG: 0xA11A11
 36499: 
 36500: import { spawn } from 'child_process';
 36501: import * as fs from 'fs';
 36502: import * as path from 'path';
 36503: 
 36504: let fetch: any;
 36505: try { fetch = require('node-fetch'); } catch (e) { fetch = undefined; }
 36506: 
 36507: const CFG_PATH = path.join(process.cwd(), '.qflush', 'a11.config.json');
 36508: 
 36509: function loadCfg() {
 36510:   try {
 36511:     if (!fs.existsSync(CFG_PATH)) return null;
 36512:     return JSON.parse(fs.readFileSync(CFG_PATH, 'utf8'));
 36513:   } catch (e) { return null; }
 36514: }
 36515: 
 36516: export default async function runA11(argv: string[] = []) {
 36517:   const sub = argv[0] || 'status';
 36518:   const cfg = loadCfg();
 36519:   if (!cfg || !cfg.enabled) {
 36520:     console.log('A-11 not enabled or not configured (see .qflush/a11.config.json)');
 36521:     return 0;
 36522:   }
 36523: 
 36524:   if (sub === 'start') {
 36525:     if (!cfg.startCommand) { console.error('no startCommand configured for A-11'); return 1; }
 36526:     try {
 36527:       const parts = cfg.startCommand.split(' ');
 36528:       const proc = spawn(parts[0], parts.slice(1), { cwd: cfg.path || process.cwd(), detached: true, stdio: 'ignore', shell: true });
 36529:       proc.unref();
 36530:       if (cfg.pidFile) fs.writeFileSync(cfg.pidFile, String(proc.pid), 'utf8');
 36531:       console.log('A-11 start invoked (detached).');
 36532:       return 0;
 36533:     } catch (e) {
 36534:       console.error('failed to start A-11:', String(e));
 36535:       return 1;
 36536:     }
 36537:   }
 36538: 
 36539:   if (sub === 'stop') {
 36540:     if (cfg.pidFile && fs.existsSync(cfg.pidFile)) {
 36541:       try {
 36542:         const pid = Number(fs.readFileSync(cfg.pidFile, 'utf8'));
 36543:         try { process.kill(pid); } catch (e) {}
 36544:         try { fs.unlinkSync(cfg.pidFile); } catch (e) {}
 36545:         console.log('A-11 stop requested (pid ' + pid + ').');
 36546:         return 0;
 36547:       } catch (e) { console.error('failed to stop A-11', String(e)); return 1; }
 36548:     }
 36549:     console.log('no pidFile for A-11; cannot stop cleanly');
 36550:     return 0;
 36551:   }
 36552: 
 36553:   // status
 36554:   if (cfg.healthUrl) {
 36555:     try {
 36556:       const res = await fetch(cfg.healthUrl, { method: 'GET' });
 36557:       if (res.ok) { console.log('A-11 healthy'); return 0; }
 36558:       console.log('A-11 unhealthy, status', res.status);
 36559:       return 2;
 36560:     } catch (e) {
 36561:       console.log('A-11 health check failed:', String(e));
 36562:       return 3;
 36563:     }
 36564:   }
 36565: 
 36566:   // fallback: check pid
 36567:   if (cfg.pidFile && fs.existsSync(cfg.pidFile)) {
 36568:     try {
 36569:       const pid = Number(fs.readFileSync(cfg.pidFile,'utf8'));
 36570:       try { process.kill(pid, 0); console.log('A-11 running (pid', pid + ')'); return 0; } catch (e) { console.log('A-11 not running'); return 3; }
 36571:     } catch (e) { console.log('A-11 check failed', String(e)); return 3; }
 36572:   }
 36573: 
 36574:   console.log('A-11 not running (no healthUrl or pidFile)');
 36575:   return 3;
 36576: }
 36577: 
 36578: 
 36579: 
 36580: ============================
 36581: FILE: src\commands\a11-key.ts
 36582: ============================
 36583: ============================
 36584: import * as fs from 'fs';
 36585: import * as path from 'path';
 36586: 
 36587: const CFG = path.join(process.cwd(), '.qflush', 'a11.config.json');
 36588: 
 36589: export default async function runA11Key(argv: string[] = []) {
 36590:   const sub = argv[0] || 'status';
 36591:   if (sub === 'set') {
 36592:     const key = argv[1];
 36593:     if (!key) { console.error('usage: qflush a11-key set <key>'); return 2; }
 36594:     try {
 36595:       const dir = path.dirname(CFG);
 36596:       if (!fs.existsSync(dir)) fs.mkdirSync(dir, { recursive: true });
 36597:       const cfg = { key: key, createdAt: new Date().toISOString() };
 36598:       fs.writeFileSync(CFG, JSON.stringify(cfg, null, 2), 'utf8');
 36599:       console.log('A11 key saved to .qflush/a11.config.json');
 36600:       return 0;
 36601:     } catch (e) { console.error('failed to save key', e); return 3; }
 36602:   }
 36603:   if (sub === 'start') {
 36604:     console.log('start not implemented in CLI stub');
 36605:     return 0;
 36606:   }
 36607:   console.log('usage: qflush a11-key [set <key>|start|status]');
 36608:   return 1;
 36609: }
 36610: 
 36611: 
 36612: 
 36613: ============================
 36614: FILE: src\commands\apply.ts
 36615: ============================
 36616: ============================
 36617: // src/commands/apply.ts
 36618: import * as fs from 'fs';
 36619: import * as path from 'path';
 36620: import logger from '../utils/logger';
 36621: import { decodeCortexPacketFromPng } from '../cortex/pngCodec';
 36622: import { CortexPacket } from '../cortex/types';
 36623: import { applyCortexPacket } from '../cortex/applyPacket';
 36624: 
 36625: declare const require: any;
 36626: 
 36627: export default async function runApply(argv: string[] = []) {
 36628:   try {
 36629:     const approveAll = argv.includes('--approve') || argv.includes('-a');
 36630:     const approveIdArg = argv.find(a => a.startsWith('--approve-id='));
 36631:     const approveId = approveIdArg ? approveIdArg.split('=')[1] : null;
 36632: 
 36633:     const qflushDir = path.join(process.cwd(), '.qflush');
 36634:     if (!fs.existsSync(qflushDir)) fs.mkdirSync(qflushDir, { recursive: true });
 36635: 
 36636:     // 1) Ensure spyder.config.json exists
 36637:     const spyCfgPath = path.join(qflushDir, 'spyder.config.json');
 36638:     if (!fs.existsSync(spyCfgPath)) {
 36639:       const defaultCfg = { enabled: false, frequency: 'passive', routes: [] };
 36640:       fs.writeFileSync(spyCfgPath, JSON.stringify(defaultCfg, null, 2), 'utf8');
 36641:       logger.info('Created default .qflush/spyder.config.json');
 36642:     } else {
 36643:       logger.info('.qflush/spyder.config.json already present');
 36644:     }
 36645: 
 36646:     // 2) Synchronize cortex/PacketRouter mapping
 36647:     let cortexRoutes: Record<string, boolean> = {};
 36648:     try {
 36649:       // require router module to discover known actions
 36650:       const router = require('../cortex/router');
 36651:       const keys = router && router.cortexActions ? Object.keys(router.cortexActions) : [];
 36652:       for (const k of keys) cortexRoutes[k] = true; // default enable known actions
 36653:     } catch (e) {
 36654:       logger.warn('Could not require cortex/router to sync routes: ' + String(e));
 36655:     }
 36656: 
 36657:     const cortexRoutesPath = path.join(qflushDir, 'cortex.routes.json');
 36658:     try {
 36659:       fs.writeFileSync(cortexRoutesPath, JSON.stringify({ cortexActions: cortexRoutes }, null, 2), 'utf8');
 36660:       logger.info('Wrote .qflush/cortex.routes.json');
 36661:     } catch (e) {
 36662:       logger.warn('Failed to write cortex.routes.json: ' + String(e));
 36663:     }
 36664: 
 36665:     // 3) Generate supporting files if missing
 36666:     const lastPath = path.join(qflushDir, 'cortex.last.json');
 36667:     const cachePath = path.join(qflushDir, 'spyder.cache.json');
 36668:     try { if (!fs.existsSync(lastPath)) fs.writeFileSync(lastPath, JSON.stringify({ initializedAt: new Date().toISOString() }, null, 2), 'utf8'); } catch (e) {}
 36669:     try { if (!fs.existsSync(cachePath)) fs.writeFileSync(cachePath, JSON.stringify({ createdAt: new Date().toISOString(), items: [] }, null, 2), 'utf8'); } catch (e) {}
 36670: 
 36671:     // 4) Scan incoming JSON and PNG packets
 36672:     const incomingJsonDir = path.join(qflushDir, 'incoming', 'json');
 36673:     const incomingPngDir = path.join(qflushDir, 'incoming', 'png');
 36674:     const collected: { pkt: CortexPacket; src?: string }[] = [];
 36675: 
 36676:     if (fs.existsSync(incomingJsonDir)) {
 36677:       for (const f of fs.readdirSync(incomingJsonDir)) {
 36678:         if (!f.endsWith('.json')) continue;
 36679:         try {
 36680:           const raw = fs.readFileSync(path.join(incomingJsonDir, f), 'utf8');
 36681:           const j = JSON.parse(raw) as CortexPacket;
 36682:           if (j && j.kind === 'cortex-packet') {
 36683:             collected.push({ pkt: j, src: path.join(incomingJsonDir, f) });
 36684:             logger.info('Queued incoming JSON packet: ' + (j.id || '[no-id]'));
 36685:           } else {
 36686:             logger.warn('Skipping JSON not matching cortex-packet: ' + f);
 36687:           }
 36688:         } catch (e) {
 36689:           logger.warn('Failed to parse incoming json ' + f + ': ' + String(e));
 36690:         }
 36691:       }
 36692:     }
 36693: 
 36694:     if (fs.existsSync(incomingPngDir)) {
 36695:       for (const f of fs.readdirSync(incomingPngDir)) {
 36696:         if (!f.endsWith('.png')) continue;
 36697:         try {
 36698:           const pkt = await decodeCortexPacketFromPng(path.join(incomingPngDir, f));
 36699:           collected.push({ pkt, src: path.join(incomingPngDir, f) });
 36700:           logger.info('Decoded incoming PNG packet: ' + (pkt.id || '[no-id]'));
 36701:         } catch (e) {
 36702:           logger.warn('Failed to decode incoming png ' + f + ': ' + String(e));
 36703:         }
 36704:       }
 36705:     }
 36706: 
 36707:     // Apply collected packets
 36708:     const processedDir = path.join(qflushDir, 'processed');
 36709:     if (!fs.existsSync(processedDir)) fs.mkdirSync(processedDir, { recursive: true });
 36710:     for (const entry of collected) {
 36711:       const pkt = entry.pkt;
 36712:       try {
 36713:         // if approve flags present, inject into packet payload when AUTO-PATCH
 36714:         if (approveAll) {
 36715:           try { if (!pkt.payload) pkt.payload = {}; (pkt.payload as any).approve = true; } catch (e) {}
 36716:         }
 36717:         if (approveId && pkt.id === approveId) {
 36718:           try { if (!pkt.payload) pkt.payload = {}; (pkt.payload as any).approve = true; } catch (e) {}
 36719:         }
 36720: 
 36721:         logger.info('Applying packet: ' + pkt.type + ' ' + (pkt.id || ''));
 36722:         await applyCortexPacket(pkt);
 36723:         const last = { appliedAt: new Date().toISOString(), packet: pkt };
 36724:         fs.writeFileSync(lastPath, JSON.stringify(last, null, 2), 'utf8');
 36725: 
 36726:         // archive original source file into dated folder
 36727:         try {
 36728:           if (entry.src && fs.existsSync(entry.src)) {
 36729:             const m = new Date();
 36730:             const y = m.getFullYear();
 36731:             const mm = String(m.getMonth() + 1).padStart(2, '0');
 36732:             const archiveDir = path.join(processedDir, `${y}-${mm}`);
 36733:             if (!fs.existsSync(archiveDir)) fs.mkdirSync(archiveDir, { recursive: true });
 36734:             const base = path.basename(entry.src);
 36735:             const dest = path.join(archiveDir, `${Date.now()}-${base}`);
 36736:             try { fs.renameSync(entry.src, dest); } catch (e) { fs.copyFileSync(entry.src, dest); try { fs.unlinkSync(entry.src); } catch(e){} }
 36737:             // write metadata
 36738:             try { fs.writeFileSync(dest + '.applied.json', JSON.stringify({ appliedAt: new Date().toISOString(), packetId: pkt.id || null }, null, 2), 'utf8'); } catch (e) {}
 36739:           } else {
 36740:             // if no src, write packet copy
 36741:             const id = pkt.id || (`manual-${Date.now()}`);
 36742:             const target = path.join(processedDir, `${id}.json`);
 36743:             fs.writeFileSync(target, JSON.stringify(pkt, null, 2), 'utf8');
 36744:           }
 36745:         } catch (e) { /* ignore */ }
 36746:       } catch (e) {
 36747:         logger.warn('Failed to apply packet: ' + String(e));
 36748:         // move to failed folder if source exists
 36749:         try {
 36750:           if (entry.src && fs.existsSync(entry.src)) {
 36751:             const failDir = path.join(qflushDir, 'failed');
 36752:             const m = new Date();
 36753:             const y = m.getFullYear();
 36754:             const mm = String(m.getMonth() + 1).padStart(2, '0');
 36755:             const archiveDir = path.join(failDir, `${y}-${mm}`);
 36756:             if (!fs.existsSync(archiveDir)) fs.mkdirSync(archiveDir, { recursive: true });
 36757:             const base = path.basename(entry.src);
 36758:             const dest = path.join(archiveDir, `${Date.now()}-${base}`);
 36759:             try { fs.renameSync(entry.src, dest); } catch (e) { fs.copyFileSync(entry.src, dest); try { fs.unlinkSync(entry.src); } catch(e){} }
 36760:             try { fs.writeFileSync(dest + '.error.json', JSON.stringify({ error: String(e), when: new Date().toISOString() }, null, 2), 'utf8'); } catch (e) {}
 36761:           }
 36762:         } catch (_) {}
 36763:       }
 36764:     }
 36765: 
 36766:     // 5) Ensure that SPYDER is wired into lifecycle: update spyder.config.json.routes with cortexRoutes keys
 36767:     try {
 36768:       const raw = fs.readFileSync(spyCfgPath, 'utf8');
 36769:       const spyCfg = JSON.parse(raw || '{}');
 36770:       spyCfg.routes = Object.keys(cortexRoutes);
 36771:       fs.writeFileSync(spyCfgPath, JSON.stringify(spyCfg, null, 2), 'utf8');
 36772:       logger.info('Updated spyder.config.json routes');
 36773:     } catch (e) {
 36774:       logger.warn('Failed to update spyder.config.json routes: ' + String(e));
 36775:     }
 36776: 
 36777:     // cleanup old archives (keep default 6 months unless configured)
 36778:     try {
 36779:       const archiveUtils = require('../utils/archive');
 36780:       const keep = process.env.QFLUSH_ARCHIVE_KEEP_MONTHS ? Number(process.env.QFLUSH_ARCHIVE_KEEP_MONTHS) : 6;
 36781:       try {
 36782:         archiveUtils.cleanupDatedArchives(path.join(qflushDir, 'processed'), keep);
 36783:       } catch (e) {}
 36784:       try {
 36785:         archiveUtils.cleanupDatedArchives(path.join(qflushDir, 'failed'), keep);
 36786:       } catch (e) {}
 36787:     } catch (e) {}
 36788: 
 36789:     logger.success('qflush apply complete — SPYDER initialized and cortex routes synchronized');
 36790:     return 0;
 36791:   } catch (e) {
 36792:     console.error('qflush apply failed', e);
 36793:     return 1;
 36794:   }
 36795: }
 36796: 
 36797: 
 36798: 
 36799: ============================
 36800: FILE: src\commands\checksum.ts
 36801: ============================
 36802: ============================
 36803: // ROME-TAG: 0xA0F9B4
 36804: 
 36805: import alias from '../utils/alias';
 36806: const fetch = alias.importUtil('../utils/fetch') || alias.importUtil('@utils/fetch') || (globalThis as any).fetch;
 36807: const logger = alias.importUtil('@utils/logger') || alias.importUtil('../utils/logger') || console;
 36808: 
 36809: const DAEMON = process.env.QFLUSH_DAEMON || 'http://localhost:4500';
 36810: 
 36811: async function postJson(url: string, body: any): Promise<any> {
 36812:   const res = await fetch(url, { method: 'POST', headers: { 'Content-Type': 'application/json' }, body: JSON.stringify(body) } as any);
 36813:   const json: any = await res.json();
 36814:   return json;
 36815: }
 36816: 
 36817: async function getJson(url: string): Promise<any> {
 36818:   const res = await fetch(url);
 36819:   const json: any = await res.json();
 36820:   return json;
 36821: }
 36822: 
 36823: export default async function runChecksum(argv: string[] = []) {
 36824:   const sub = argv[0];
 36825:   if (!sub) {
 36826:     logger.info('Usage: qflush checksum <store|verify|list|clear>');
 36827:     return 1;
 36828:   }
 36829: 
 36830:   if (sub === 'store') {
 36831:     const id = argv[1];
 36832:     const checksum = argv[2];
 36833:     const ttlArg = argv.find((a) => a.startsWith('--ttl='));
 36834:     const ttlMs = ttlArg ? Number(ttlArg.split('=')[1]) : undefined;
 36835:     if (!id || !checksum) {
 36836:       logger.error('Usage: qflush checksum store <id> <checksum> [--ttl=ms]');
 36837:       return 1;
 36838:     }
 36839:     const body: any = { id, checksum };
 36840:     if (ttlMs) body.ttlMs = ttlMs;
 36841:     const res = await postJson(`${DAEMON.replace(/\/$/, '')}/npz/checksum/store`, body);
 36842:     logger.info(`store => ${JSON.stringify(res)}`);
 36843:     return 0;
 36844:   }
 36845: 
 36846:   if (sub === 'verify') {
 36847:     const id = argv[1];
 36848:     const checksum = argv[2];
 36849:     if (!id || !checksum) {
 36850:       logger.error('Usage: qflush checksum verify <id> <checksum>');
 36851:       return 1;
 36852:     }
 36853:     const res: any = await postJson(`${DAEMON.replace(/\/$/, '')}/npz/checksum/verify`, { id, checksum });
 36854:     if (res && (res as any).success) {
 36855:       logger.success('verify: OK');
 36856:       return 0;
 36857:     }
 36858:     logger.error(`verify failed: ${JSON.stringify(res)}`);
 36859:     return 2;
 36860:   }
 36861: 
 36862:   if (sub === 'list') {
 36863:     const res = await getJson(`${DAEMON.replace(/\/$/, '')}/npz/checksum/list`);
 36864:     logger.info(JSON.stringify(res, null, 2));
 36865:     return 0;
 36866:   }
 36867: 
 36868:   if (sub === 'clear') {
 36869:     const res = await fetch(`${DAEMON.replace(/\/$/, '')}/npz/checksum/clear`, { method: 'DELETE' } as any);
 36870:     const j: any = await res.json();
 36871:     logger.info(JSON.stringify(j));
 36872:     return 0;
 36873:   }
 36874: 
 36875:   logger.error('Unknown checksum command');
 36876:   return 1;
 36877: }
 36878: 
 36879: 
 36880: 
 36881: ============================
 36882: FILE: src\commands\compose.ts
 36883: ============================
 36884: ============================
 36885: // ROME-TAG: 0xD0CF40
 36886: 
 36887: import alias from '../utils/alias';
 36888: const logger = alias.importUtil('@utils/logger') || alias.importUtil('../utils/logger') || console;
 36889: import { readCompose } from '../compose/parser';
 36890: import { runStart } from './start';
 36891: import { startProcess, listRunning, stopProcess } from '../supervisor';
 36892: import { runPurge } from './purge';
 36893: import fs from 'fs';
 36894: import { Tail } from 'tail';
 36895: 
 36896: export async function runCompose(argv: string[]) {
 36897:   const sub = argv[0];
 36898:   const compose = readCompose();
 36899:   if (!compose) {
 36900:     logger.error('No funesterie.yml or funesterie.fcl found');
 36901:     return;
 36902:   }
 36903:   if (sub === 'up') {
 36904:     // support --background flag
 36905:     const bg = argv.includes('--background') || argv.includes('-b');
 36906:     const modules = Object.keys(compose.modules);
 36907:     for (const m of modules) {
 36908:       const def = compose.modules[m];
 36909:       logger.info(`Bringing up ${m} from ${def.path || 'package'}`);
 36910:       if (bg) {
 36911:         // start in background using supervisor
 36912:         const logPath = `${process.cwd()}/.qflush/logs/${m}.log`;
 36913:         startProcess(m, def.path || m, [], { cwd: def.path || process.cwd(), detached: true, logPath });
 36914:       } else {
 36915:         await runStart({ services: [m], modulePaths: { [m]: def.path }, flags: {} } as any);
 36916:       }
 36917:     }
 36918:     return;
 36919:   }
 36920:   if (sub === 'down') {
 36921:     logger.info('Bringing down all modules');
 36922:     await runPurge();
 36923:     return;
 36924:   }
 36925:   if (sub === 'restart') {
 36926:     const name = argv[1];
 36927:     if (!name) {
 36928:       logger.info('Specify module to restart');
 36929:       return;
 36930:     }
 36931:     // naive: stop and start
 36932:     const running = listRunning();
 36933:     if (running.find(r => r.name === name)) {
 36934:       // stop
 36935:       await stopProcess(name);
 36936:     }
 36937:     const def = compose.modules[name];
 36938:     if (!def) { logger.info('Unknown module'); return; }
 36939:     await runStart({ services: [name], modulePaths: { [name]: def.path }, flags: {} } as any);
 36940:     return;
 36941:   }
 36942:   if (sub === 'logs') {
 36943:     const name = argv[1];
 36944:     if (!name) { logger.info('Specify module name'); return; }
 36945:     const logFile = `${process.cwd()}/.qflush/logs/${name}.log`;
 36946:     if (!fs.existsSync(logFile)) { logger.info('No log file found'); return; }
 36947:     const t = new Tail(logFile, { fromBeginning: false });
 36948:     t.on('line', (data: any) => console.log(data));
 36949:     t.on('error', (err: any) => console.error(err));
 36950:     return;
 36951:   }
 36952:   logger.info('Usage: qflush compose [up|down|restart|logs]');
 36953: }
 36954:

 36957: ============================
 36958: FILE: src\commands\config.ts
 36959: ============================
 36960: ============================
 36961: // ROME-TAG: 0x130555
 36962: 
 36963: import { promises as fs } from "fs";
 36964: import { logger } from "../utils/logger";
 36965: import { resolvePaths } from "../utils/paths";
 36966: import { qflushOptions } from "../chain/smartChain";
 36967: 
 36968: export async function runConfig(opts?: qflushOptions) {
 36969:   logger.info("qflush: generating default configs...");
 36970:   const detected = opts?.detected || {};
 36971:   const paths = resolvePaths(detected);
 36972:   for (const key of Object.keys(paths)) {
 36973:     const p = paths[key];
 36974:     if (!p) continue;
 36975:     const envFile = `${p}/.env`;
 36976:     try {
 36977:       await fs.access(envFile);
 36978:       logger.info(`${key}: .env already exists`);
 36979:     } catch {
 36980:       const content = `# ${key} default env\nPORT=3000\nTOKEN=changeme\n`;
 36981:       await fs.mkdir(p, { recursive: true });
 36982:       await fs.writeFile(envFile, content, { encoding: "utf8" });
 36983:       logger.success(`Created ${envFile}`);
 36984:     }
 36985:   }
 36986: }
 36987:

 36991: ============================
 36992: FILE: src\commands\copilot.ts
 36993: ============================
 36994: ============================
 36995: #!/usr/bin/env node
 36996: // ROME-TAG: 0x5293A0
 36997: 
 36998: import fetch from '../utils/fetch';
 36999: import * as readline from 'readline';
 37000: 
 37001: async function postMessage(msg: string) {
 37002:   try {
 37003:     const res = await fetch(`${process.env.QFLUSH_DAEMON || 'http://localhost:4500'}/copilot/message`, { method: 'POST', body: JSON.stringify({ message: msg }), headers: { 'Content-Type': 'application/json' } } as any);
 37004:     const j = await res.json();
 37005:     console.log('sent', j);
 37006:   } catch (e) { console.error('send failed', e); }
 37007: }
 37008: 
 37009: export default async function runCopilot(args: string[]) {
 37010:   if (args.includes('--stream')) {
 37011:     // open SSE stream
 37012:     const EventSource = require('eventsource');
 37013:     const es = new EventSource(`${process.env.QFLUSH_DAEMON || 'http://localhost:4500'}/copilot/stream`);
 37014:     es.onmessage = (ev: any) => { console.log('copilot event', ev.data); };
 37015:     es.onerror = (e: any) => { console.error('SSE error', e); es.close(); };
 37016:     return 0;
 37017:   }
 37018:   const rl = readline.createInterface({ input: process.stdin, output: process.stdout });
 37019:   rl.question('message> ', async (answer) => { await postMessage(answer); rl.close(); process.exit(0); });
 37020:   return 0;
 37021: }
 37022:

 37026: FILE: src\commands\copilot-bridge.ts
 37027: ============================
 37028: ============================
 37029: #!/usr/bin/env node
 37030: // ROME-TAG: 0x10C74C
 37031: 
 37032: import fetch from 'node-fetch';
 37033: import * as fs from 'fs';
 37034: 
 37035: export default async function runCopilotBridge(args: string[]) {
 37036:   const cfgPath = '.qflush/copilot.json';
 37037:   if (!fs.existsSync(cfgPath)) { console.error('copilot not configured'); return 1; }
 37038:   const cfg = JSON.parse(fs.readFileSync(cfgPath,'utf8'));
 37039:   if (args[0] === 'send-snapshot') {
 37040:     const state = { /* minimal snapshot */ };
 37041:     try { await fetch(cfg.webhookUrl, { method: 'POST', body: JSON.stringify({ type: 'engine_snapshot', snapshot: state }), headers: { 'Content-Type': 'application/json' } }); console.log('sent'); } catch (e) { console.error('failed', e); return 2; }
 37042:     return 0;
 37043:   }
 37044:   console.log('copilot-bridge: noop');
 37045:   return 0;
 37046: }

 37050: ============================
 37051: FILE: src\commands\detect.ts
 37052: ============================
 37053: ============================
 37054: // ROME-TAG: 0x9C32F0
 37055: 
 37056: import { detectModules } from "../utils/detect";
 37057: import { logger } from "../utils/logger";
 37058: import { qflushOptions } from "../chain/smartChain";
 37059: 
 37060: export async function runDetect(_opts?: qflushOptions) {
 37061:   logger.info("qflush: detecting modules...");
 37062:   const detected = await detectModules();
 37063:   for (const k of Object.keys(detected)) {
 37064:     const v = detected[k];
 37065:     logger.info(`${k}: ${v.running ? 'running' : 'stopped'}`);
 37066:   }
 37067:   // return a normalized object
 37068:   return { detected, paths: {} };
 37069: }

 37074: ============================
 37075: FILE: src\commands\doctor.ts
 37076: ============================
 37077: ============================
 37078: // ROME-TAG: 0xED1E50
 37079: 
 37080: import alias from '../utils/alias';
 37081: const logger = alias.importUtil('@utils/logger') || alias.importUtil('../utils/logger') || console;
 37082: import { detectModules } from '../utils/detect';
 37083: import { httpProbe } from '../utils/health';
 37084: import { SERVICE_MAP } from '../utils/paths';
 37085: import { ensurePackageInstalled } from '../utils/exec';
 37086: 
 37087: export async function runDoctor(argv: string[] = []) {
 37088:   const fix = argv.includes('--fix') || argv.includes('-f');
 37089: 
 37090:   logger.info('qflush: running doctor checks...');
 37091:   const detected = await detectModules();
 37092:   for (const k of Object.keys(detected)) {
 37093:     const v = detected[k];
 37094:     logger.info(`${k}: installed=${v.installed} running=${v.running} path=${v.path || 'n/a'}`);
 37095:     if (v.bin && v.path) {
 37096:       logger.info(`  bin: ${v.bin}`);
 37097:     }
 37098:   }
 37099: 
 37100:   // check node version
 37101:   logger.info(`Node version: ${process.version}`);
 37102: 
 37103:   // simple http check example
 37104:   const httpOk = await httpProbe('http://localhost:80', 500);
 37105:   logger.info(`HTTP localhost:80 reachable: ${httpOk}`);
 37106: 
 37107:   if (fix) {
 37108:     logger.info('Doctor fix: attempting to install missing Funeste38 packages...');
 37109:     for (const name of Object.keys(SERVICE_MAP)) {
 37110:       const pkg = SERVICE_MAP[name].pkg;
 37111:       const detectedInfo = detected[name];
 37112:       if (!detectedInfo || !detectedInfo.installed) {
 37113:         logger.info(`Installing ${pkg} for service ${name}...`);
 37114:         const ok = ensurePackageInstalled(pkg);
 37115:         if (ok) logger.success(`Installed ${pkg}`);
 37116:         else logger.warn(`Failed to install ${pkg}`);
 37117:       } else {
 37118:         logger.info(`${pkg} already installed`);
 37119:       }
 37120:     }
 37121:   }
 37122: 
 37123:   logger.info('Doctor checks complete');
 37124: }

 37128: ============================
 37129: FILE: src\commands\engine.ts
 37130: ============================
 37131: ============================
 37132: #!/usr/bin/env node
 37133: // ROME-TAG: 0xE2F4A9
 37134: 
 37135: import { loadRomeIndexFromDisk } from '../rome/index-loader';
 37136: import { evaluateIndex } from '../rome/engine';
 37137: import { executeAction } from '../rome/executor';
 37138: 
 37139: export default async function runEngine(args: string[]) {
 37140:   const dry = args.includes('--dry-run') || args.includes('--dry');
 37141:   const idx = loadRomeIndexFromDisk();
 37142:   const actions = evaluateIndex(idx);
 37143:   console.log('Engine actions:', actions);
 37144:   if (dry) {
 37145:     console.log('Running in dry-run mode, simulating actions...');
 37146:     for (const a of actions) {
 37147:       try {
 37148:         // simulate by calling executeAction with dryRun
 37149:         const actionString = String((a as any).action ?? a);
 37150:         const res = await executeAction(actionString, { path: (a as any).path || null, dryRun: true });
 37151:         console.log('Simulate', a, '->', res);
 37152:       } catch (e) {
 37153:         console.warn('simulate failed', e);
 37154:       }
 37155:     }
 37156:   }
 37157:   return 0;
 37158: }

 37178: ============================
 37179: FILE: src\commands\freeze.ts
 37180: ============================
 37181: ============================
 37182: import { freezeAll } from '../supervisor';
 37183: 
 37184: export default async function runFreeze(argv: string[] = []) {
 37185:   // parse --health=<url>
 37186:   let healthUrl: string | null = null;
 37187:   for (const a of argv) {
 37188:     if (a.startsWith('--health=')) {
 37189:       healthUrl = a.split('=')[1];
 37190:       break;
 37191:     }
 37192:     if (a === '--health') {
 37193:       const idx = argv.indexOf(a);
 37194:       if (idx >= 0 && idx < argv.length - 1) healthUrl = argv[idx + 1];
 37195:       break;
 37196:     }
 37197:   }
 37198: 
 37199:   if (!healthUrl) {
 37200:     freezeAll('manual');
 37201:     console.log('QFLUSH frozen (manual)');
 37202:     return 0;
 37203:   }
 37204: 
 37205:   freezeAll('manual', {
 37206:     autoResume: true,
 37207:     resumeCheck: {
 37208:       url: healthUrl,
 37209:       intervalMs: 3000,
 37210:       timeoutMs: 120000,
 37211:     },
 37212:   });
 37213: 
 37214:   console.log(`QFLUSH frozen + auto-resume active (health=${healthUrl})`);
 37215:   return 0;
 37216: }
 37217: 
 37218: 
 37219: 
 37220: ============================
 37221: FILE: src\commands\inspect.ts
 37222: ============================
 37223: ============================
 37224: // ROME-TAG: 0xEA570C
 37225: 
 37226: import { logger } from "../utils/logger";
 37227: import { detectModules } from "../utils/detect";
 37228: import { listRunning } from "../supervisor";
 37229: import { qflushOptions } from "../chain/smartChain";
 37230: 
 37231: export async function runInspect(opts?: qflushOptions) {
 37232:   logger.info("qflush: inspecting ecosystem...");
 37233:   const detected = opts?.detected || (await detectModules());
 37234:   for (const key of Object.keys(detected)) {
 37235:     const v = detected[key];
 37236:     logger.info(`${key}: ${v.running ? `running (pid=${v.pid || 'unknown'})` : 'stopped'}`);
 37237:     if (v.port) logger.info(`  port: ${v.port}`);
 37238:     if (v.installed) logger.info(`  installed: true`);
 37239:   }
 37240:   const running = listRunning();
 37241:   if (running.length) {
 37242:     logger.info("Supervisor running processes:");
 37243:     for (const r of running) logger.info(`  ${r.name}: pid=${r.pid} cmd=${r.cmd}`);
 37244:   }
 37245: }

 37251: FILE: src\commands\kill.ts
 37252: ============================
 37253: ============================
 37254: // ROME-TAG: 0x3AB4E4
 37255: 
 37256: import { logger } from "../utils/logger";
 37257: import { findAndKill } from "../utils/detect";
 37258: import { stopAll } from "../supervisor";
 37259: import { qflushOptions } from "../chain/smartChain";
 37260: 
 37261: export async function runKill(_opts?: qflushOptions) {
 37262:   logger.info("qflush: killing modules...");
 37263:   const killed = await findAndKill();
 37264:   stopAll();
 37265:   logger.info(`Killed ${killed.length} processes`);
 37266: }

 37270: 
 37271: ============================
 37272: FILE: src\commands\license.ts
 37273: ============================
 37274: ============================
 37275: /* ROME-TAG: 0xF45330 */
 37276: import alias from '../utils/alias';
 37277: const logger = alias.importUtil('@utils/logger') || alias.importUtil('../utils/logger') || console;
 37278: import gumroad from '../utils/gumroad-license';
 37279: import { getSecret } from '../utils/secrets';
 37280: 
 37281: export async function runLicense(argv: string[] = []) {
 37282:   const sub = argv[0];
 37283:   if (!sub) {
 37284:     logger.info('Usage: qflush license activate <key> [--product=<id>]');
 37285:     return 1;
 37286:   }
 37287: 
 37288:   if (sub === 'activate') {
 37289:     const key = argv[1];
 37290:     if (!key) {
 37291:       logger.error('No license key provided. Usage: qflush license activate <key> [--product=<id>]');
 37292:       return 1;
 37293:     }
 37294:     // parse optional --product=ID
 37295:     const prodArg = argv.find((a) => a.startsWith('--product='));
 37296:     const productId = prodArg ? prodArg.split('=')[1] : process.env.GUMROAD_PRODUCT_ID || process.env.GUMROAD_PRODUCT_YEARLY || process.env.GUMROAD_PRODUCT_MONTHLY;
 37297:     const token = getSecret('GUMROAD_TOKEN', { fileEnv: 'GUMROAD_TOKEN_FILE' });
 37298:     if (!token) {
 37299:       logger.error('GUMROAD_TOKEN not set (env or file). Set it to perform activation.');
 37300:       return 1;
 37301:     }
 37302:     if (!productId) {
 37303:       logger.warn('No product id provided, continuing with provided key verification (Gumroad may accept product lookup).');
 37304:     }
 37305:     try {
 37306:       const rec = await gumroad.activateLicense(productId as string, key, token);
 37307:       logger.success(`License activated. Expires: ${rec.expiresAt ? new Date(rec.expiresAt).toISOString() : 'subscription/never'}`);
 37308:       return 0;
 37309:     } catch (err: any) {
 37310:       logger.error(`License activation failed: ${err.message || err}`);
 37311:       return 2;
 37312:     }
 37313:   }
 37314: 
 37315:   if (sub === 'status') {
 37316:     const rec = gumroad.loadLicense();
 37317:     if (!rec) {
 37318:       logger.info('No local license found');
 37319:       return 0;
 37320:     }
 37321:     logger.info(`Local license: key=${rec.key} product=${rec.product_id} expires=${rec.expiresAt ? new Date(rec.expiresAt).toISOString() : 'never'}`);
 37322:     return 0;
 37323:   }
 37324: 
 37325:   if (sub === 'clear') {
 37326:     gumroad.clearLicense();
 37327:     logger.info('Local license cleared');
 37328:     return 0;
 37329:   }
 37330: 
 37331:   logger.info('Unknown license command');
 37332:   return 1;
 37333: }
 37334: 
 37335: 
 37336: 
 37337: ============================
 37338: FILE: src\commands\license-activate.ts
 37339: ============================
 37340: ============================
 37341: // ROME-TAG: 0xA65E04
 37342: 
 37343: import license from '../utils/license';
 37344: 
 37345: export default async function runLicenseActivate(args: string[]) {
 37346:   const key = args[0];
 37347:   const product = args[1] || process.env.GUMROAD_PRODUCT_MONTHLY;
 37348:   if (!key) {
 37349:     console.error('usage: qflush license:activate <key> [product_id]');
 37350:     return 1;
 37351:   }
 37352:   try {
 37353:     const res = await license.activateLicense(key, product);
 37354:     if (res.ok) {
 37355:       console.log('License activated:', res.license);
 37356:       return 0;
 37357:     }
 37358:     console.error('Activation failed:', res.error);
 37359:     return 2;
 37360:   } catch (e) {
 37361:     console.error('Activation error:', e);
 37362:     return 3;
 37363:   }
 37364: }

 37389: ============================
 37390: FILE: src\commands\logic.ts
 37391: ============================
 37392: ============================
 37393: #!/usr/bin/env node
 37394: // ROME-TAG: 0x66F831
 37395: 
 37396: import { loadLogicRules } from '../rome/logic-loader';
 37397: import { loadRomeIndexFromDisk } from '../rome/index-loader';
 37398: import { evaluateRulesForRecord } from '../rome/logic-loader';
 37399: 
 37400: export default async function runLogic(args: string[]) {
 37401:   const rules = loadLogicRules();
 37402:   console.log('Loaded rules:', rules.map(r=>r.name));
 37403:   const idx = loadRomeIndexFromDisk();
 37404:   for (const p of Object.values(idx)) {
 37405:     const matches = evaluateRulesForRecord(idx, p as any);
 37406:     if (matches.length) console.log('Match for', (p as any).path, matches);
 37407:   }
 37408:   return 0;
 37409: }

 37435: ============================
 37436: FILE: src\commands\npz-scores.ts
 37437: ============================
 37438: ============================
 37439: // ROME-TAG: 0xF933B3
 37440: 
 37441: import engine from '../utils/npz-engine';
 37442: import { stringify } from 'csv-stringify/sync';
 37443: 
 37444: export async function runNpzScores(args: string[] = []) {
 37445:   const store = engine.getStore();
 37446:   const items = Object.values(store).map((r: any) => ({ laneId: r.laneId, score: r.score, lastSuccess: r.lastSuccess, lastFailure: r.lastFailure }));
 37447:   // sort by score asc
 37448:   items.sort((a, b) => (a.score as number) - (b.score as number));
 37449: 
 37450:   if (args.includes('--reset')) {
 37451:     engine.resetScores();
 37452:     console.log('npz: scores reset');
 37453:     return 0;
 37454:   }
 37455: 
 37456:   if (args.includes('--csv')) {
 37457:     const records = items.map((it) => ({ laneId: it.laneId, score: it.score, lastSuccess: it.lastSuccess || '', lastFailure: it.lastFailure || '' }));
 37458:     const csv = stringify(records, { header: true });
 37459:     console.log(csv);
 37460:     return 0;
 37461:   }
 37462: 
 37463:   console.log(JSON.stringify(items, null, 2));
 37464:   return 0;
 37465: }
 37466: 
 37467: export default runNpzScores;
 37468:

 37471: ============================
 37472: FILE: src\commands\purge.ts
 37473: ============================
 37474: ============================
 37475: // ROME-TAG: 0x263C6D
 37476: 
 37477: import { logger } from "../utils/logger";
 37478: import { resolvePaths } from "../utils/paths";
 37479: import { rimrafSync } from "../utils/exec";
 37480: import { clearState } from "../supervisor";
 37481: import { qflushOptions } from "../chain/smartChain";
 37482: 
 37483: export async function runPurge(opts?: qflushOptions) {
 37484:   logger.info("qflush: purging caches, logs, sessions and supervisor state...");
 37485:   const paths = resolvePaths(opts?.detected || {});
 37486:   const targets = [] as string[];
 37487:   for (const key of Object.keys(paths)) {
 37488:     const p = paths[key];
 37489:     if (!p) continue;
 37490:     targets.push(`${p}/.cache`);
 37491:     targets.push(`${p}/logs`);
 37492:     targets.push(`${p}/tmp`);
 37493:     targets.push(`${p}/sessions`);
 37494:   }
 37495:   for (const t of targets) {
 37496:     try {
 37497:       rimrafSync(t);
 37498:       logger.success(`Removed ${t}`);
 37499:     } catch (err) {
 37500:       logger.warn(`Failed to remove ${t}: ${err}`);
 37501:     }
 37502:   }
 37503:   // clear supervisor state
 37504:   clearState();
 37505:   logger.info("Purge complete.");
 37506: }
