 37563: 
 37564: ============================
 37565: FILE: src\commands\safe-run.ts
 37566: ============================
 37567: ============================
 37568: import { spawn } from 'child_process';
 37569: 
 37570: export default async function runSafeRun(argv: string[] = []) {
 37571:   // parse options
 37572:   let timeoutSec = 10;
 37573:   let detach = false;
 37574:   const args: string[] = [];
 37575: 
 37576:   for (let i = 0; i < argv.length; i++) {
 37577:     const a = argv[i];
 37578:     if (a === '--detach') {
 37579:       detach = true;
 37580:       continue;
 37581:     }
 37582:     if (a === '--timeout' && i < argv.length - 1) {
 37583:       const v = Number(argv[i + 1]);
 37584:       if (!Number.isNaN(v) && v > 0) timeoutSec = Math.max(1, Math.floor(v));
 37585:       i++;
 37586:       continue;
 37587:     }
 37588:     // collect remaining as command args
 37589:     args.push(a);
 37590:   }
 37591: 
 37592:   if (args.length === 0) {
 37593:     console.log('usage: qflush safe-run [--detach] [--timeout N] <qflush-subcommand> [args...]');
 37594:     console.log('example: qflush safe-run --detach start --service rome');
 37595:     return 1;
 37596:   }
 37597: 
 37598:   // Default behavior: run the built daemon CLI: node dist/index.js <args...>
 37599:   const node = process.execPath;
 37600:   const childArgs = ['dist/index.js', ...args];
 37601: 
 37602:   if (detach) {
 37603:     try {
 37604:       const c = spawn(node, childArgs, { detached: true, stdio: 'ignore' });
 37605:       c.unref();
 37606:       console.log(`qflush safe-run: started detached pid=${c.pid}`);
 37607:       return 0;
 37608:     } catch (e) {
 37609:       console.error('safe-run detach failed', e);
 37610:       return 2;
 37611:     }
 37612:   }
 37613: 
 37614:   // Not detached: run with watchdog timeout
 37615:   return await new Promise<number>((resolve) => {
 37616:     const child = spawn(node, childArgs, { stdio: 'inherit' as any });
 37617:     let finished = false;
 37618: 
 37619:     const onExit = (code: number | null) => {
 37620:       if (finished) return;
 37621:       finished = true;
 37622:       resolve(code === null ? 0 : code);
 37623:     };
 37624: 
 37625:     child.on('exit', onExit);
 37626:     child.on('error', (err) => {
 37627:       if (finished) return;
 37628:       finished = true;
 37629:       console.error('safe-run child error', err);
 37630:       resolve(3);
 37631:     });
 37632: 
 37633:     const timer = setTimeout(() => {
 37634:       if (finished) return;
 37635:       console.warn(`[safe-run] timeout ${timeoutSec}s reached — sending SIGINT to pid=${child.pid}`);
 37636:       try { child.kill('SIGINT'); } catch (e) { /* ignore */ }
 37637: 
 37638:       // wait short then force kill
 37639:       setTimeout(() => {
 37640:         if (finished) return;
 37641:         console.warn(`[safe-run] still running — forcing kill pid=${child.pid}`);
 37642:         try { child.kill('SIGTERM'); } catch (e) { try { child.kill(); } catch {} }
 37643:       }, 2000);
 37644:     }, timeoutSec * 1000);
 37645: 
 37646:     // clear timer on finish
 37647:     (child as any).once && (child as any).once('exit', () => { clearTimeout(timer); });
 37648:   });
 37649: }
 37650: 
 37651: 
 37652: 
 37653: ============================
 37654: FILE: src\commands\secret-import.ts
 37655: ============================
 37656: ============================
 37657: import { spawnSync } from 'child_process';
 37658: import path from 'path';
 37659: 
 37660: export default async function runSecretImport(argv: string[] = []) {
 37661:   // usage: qflush secret import [--env <path>] [--no-acl]
 37662:   let envPath: string | undefined;
 37663:   let restrictAcl = true;
 37664: 
 37665:   for (let i = 0; i < argv.length; i++) {
 37666:     const a = argv[i];
 37667:     if ((a === '--env' || a === '-e') && i < argv.length - 1) {
 37668:       envPath = argv[i + 1];
 37669:       i++;
 37670:       continue;
 37671:     }
 37672:     if (a === '--no-acl') {
 37673:       restrictAcl = false;
 37674:       continue;
 37675:     }
 37676:   }
 37677: 
 37678:   // default envPath to Desktop .env
 37679:   if (!envPath) {
 37680:     const home = process.env.USERPROFILE || process.env.HOME || '';
 37681:     envPath = path.join(home, 'Desktop', '.env');
 37682:   }
 37683: 
 37684:   const script = path.join(process.cwd(), 'scripts', 'import-env-to-secrets.ps1');
 37685:   const pwsh = process.env.PWSH || 'pwsh';
 37686: 
 37687:   const args = ['-NoProfile', '-ExecutionPolicy', 'Bypass', '-File', script, '-EnvPath', envPath];
 37688:   if (restrictAcl) args.push('-RestrictFileAcl');
 37689: 
 37690:   console.log('Running import script:', pwsh, args.join(' '));
 37691: 
 37692:   const res = spawnSync(pwsh, args, { stdio: 'inherit' });
 37693:   if (res.error) {
 37694:     console.error('Failed to execute import script:', res.error);
 37695:     return 2;
 37696:   }
 37697:   return res.status ?? 0;
 37698: }
 37699: 
 37700: 
 37701: 
 37702: ============================
 37703: FILE: src\commands\spyder.ts
 37704: ============================
 37705: ============================
 37706: // ROME-TAG: 0x5PYD3R
 37707: 
 37708: import { spawn } from 'child_process';
 37709: import * as fs from 'fs';
 37710: import * as path from 'path';
 37711: 
 37712: let fetch: any;
 37713: try { fetch = require('node-fetch'); } catch (e) { fetch = undefined; }
 37714: 
 37715: const CFG_PATH = path.join(process.cwd(), '.qflush', 'spyder.config.json');
 37716: 
 37717: function loadCfg() {
 37718:   try {
 37719:     if (!fs.existsSync(CFG_PATH)) return null;
 37720:     return JSON.parse(fs.readFileSync(CFG_PATH, 'utf8'));
 37721:   } catch (e) { return null; }
 37722: }
 37723: 
 37724: export default async function runSpyder(argv: string[] = []) {
 37725:   const sub = (argv && argv[0]) || 'status';
 37726:   const cfg: any = loadCfg();
 37727:   if (!cfg || !cfg.enabled) {
 37728:     console.log('Spyder not enabled or not configured (see .qflush/spyder.config.json)');
 37729:     return 0;
 37730:   }
 37731: 
 37732:   if (sub === 'start') {
 37733:     if (!cfg.startCommand) { console.error('no startCommand configured for Spyder'); return 1; }
 37734:     try {
 37735:       const parts = Array.isArray(cfg.startCommand) ? cfg.startCommand : String(cfg.startCommand).split(' ');
 37736:       const proc = spawn(parts[0], parts.slice(1), { cwd: cfg.path || process.cwd(), detached: true, stdio: 'ignore', shell: true });
 37737:       proc.unref();
 37738:       if (cfg.pidFile) fs.writeFileSync(cfg.pidFile, String(proc.pid), 'utf8');
 37739:       console.log('Spyder start invoked (detached).');
 37740:       return 0;
 37741:     } catch (e) {
 37742:       console.error('failed to start Spyder:', String(e));
 37743:       return 1;
 37744:     }
 37745:   }
 37746: 
 37747:   if (sub === 'stop') {
 37748:     if (cfg.pidFile && fs.existsSync(cfg.pidFile)) {
 37749:       try {
 37750:         const pid = Number(fs.readFileSync(cfg.pidFile, 'utf8'));
 37751:         try { process.kill(pid); } catch (e) {}
 37752:         try { fs.unlinkSync(cfg.pidFile); } catch (e) {}
 37753:         console.log('Spyder stop requested (pid ' + pid + ').');
 37754:         return 0;
 37755:       } catch (e) { console.error('failed to stop Spyder', String(e)); return 1; }
 37756:     }
 37757:     console.log('no pidFile for Spyder; cannot stop cleanly');
 37758:     return 0;
 37759:   }
 37760: 
 37761:   if (sub === 'status') {
 37762:     // status
 37763:     if (cfg.healthUrl) {
 37764:       try {
 37765:         const res = await (fetch ? fetch(cfg.healthUrl, { method: 'GET' }) : Promise.reject(new Error('fetch not available')));
 37766:         if (res.ok) { console.log('Spyder healthy'); return 0; }
 37767:         console.log('Spyder unhealthy, status', res.status);
 37768:         return 2;
 37769:       } catch (e) {
 37770:         console.log('Spyder health check failed:', String(e));
 37771:         return 3;
 37772:       }
 37773:     }
 37774: 
 37775:     // fallback: check pid
 37776:     if (cfg.pidFile && fs.existsSync(cfg.pidFile)) {
 37777:       try {
 37778:         const pid = Number(fs.readFileSync(cfg.pidFile,'utf8'));
 37779:         try { process.kill(pid, 0); console.log('Spyder running (pid', pid + ')'); return 0; } catch (e) { console.log('Spyder not running'); return 3; }
 37780:       } catch (e) { console.log('Spyder check failed', String(e)); return 3; }
 37781:     }
 37782: 
 37783:     console.log('Spyder not running (no healthUrl or pidFile)');
 37784:     return 3;
 37785:   }
 37786: }
 37787: 
 37788: 
 37789: 
 37790: ============================
 37791: FILE: src\commands\start.ts
 37792: ============================
 37793: ============================
 37794: // ROME-TAG: 0xF73710
 37795: 
 37796: import { detectModules } from "../utils/detect";
 37797: import logger from "../utils/logger";
 37798: import { spawnSafe, ensurePackageInstalled, pathExists, rebuildInstructionsFor } from "../utils/exec";
 37799: import { resolvePaths, SERVICE_MAP } from "../utils/paths";
 37800: import { qflushOptions } from "../chain/smartChain";
 37801: import { resolvePackagePath, readPackageJson } from "../utils/package";
 37802: import { startProcess } from "../supervisor";
 37803: import { waitForService } from "../utils/health";
 37804: import { runCustomsCheck, hasBlockingIssues, ModuleDescriptor } from "../utils/npz-customs";
 37805: import npz from "../utils/npz";
 37806: import { resolveMerged } from "../supervisor/merged-resolver";
 37807: import * as fs from 'fs';
 37808: import { spawnSync } from 'child_process';
 37809: import { startService } from '../services';
 37810: 
 37811: export async function runStart(opts?: qflushOptions) {
 37812:   logger.info("qflush: starting modules...");
 37813: 
 37814:   // Respect CI/dev flag to disable supervisor starting external services
 37815:   const disableSupervisor = process.env.QFLUSH_DISABLE_SUPERVISOR === '1' || String(process.env.QFLUSH_DISABLE_SUPERVISOR).toLowerCase() === 'true';
 37816:   if (disableSupervisor) {
 37817:     logger.warn('QFLUSH supervisor disabled via QFLUSH_DISABLE_SUPERVISOR, skipping start of external modules');
 37818:     return;
 37819:   }
 37820: 
 37821:   const detected = opts?.detected || (await detectModules());
 37822:   const paths = resolvePaths(detected);
 37823: 
 37824:   const services = opts?.services && opts.services.length ? opts.services : Object.keys(SERVICE_MAP);
 37825:   const flags = opts?.flags || {};
 37826: 
 37827:   const waitForStart = Boolean(flags["wait"] || flags["--wait"] || false);
 37828:   const doRestart = Boolean(flags["restart"] || flags["--restart"] || flags["force"] || false);
 37829:   const maxRestarts = typeof flags["restartCount"] === "number" ? (flags["restartCount"] as number) : 3;
 37830: 
 37831:   const procs: Promise<void>[] = [];
 37832: 
 37833:   async function ensureBuiltIfNeeded(prefixPath: string) {
 37834:     try {
 37835:       const pathJoin = require('path').join;
 37836:       const candidates = [
 37837:         prefixPath,
 37838:         pathJoin(prefixPath, 'spyder'),
 37839:         pathJoin(prefixPath, 'apps', 'spyder-core')
 37840:       ];
 37841: 
 37842:       for (const cand of candidates) {
 37843:         const distEntry = require('path').join(cand, 'dist', 'index.js');
 37844:         if (fs.existsSync(distEntry)) {
 37845:           return true;
 37846:         }
 37847:       }
 37848: 
 37849:       // Try to build candidates that have a build script
 37850:       for (const cand of candidates) {
 37851:         try {
 37852:           const pkgJsonPath = require('path').join(cand, 'package.json');
 37853:           if (!fs.existsSync(pkgJsonPath)) continue;
 37854:           const pj = readPackageJson(cand);
 37855:           if (!pj || !pj.scripts || !pj.scripts.build) continue;
 37856: 
 37857:           logger.info(`Local package at ${cand} missing dist; running build...`);
 37858:           const r = spawnSync('npm', ['--prefix', cand, 'run', 'build'], { stdio: 'inherit' });
 37859:           if (r.status === 0) {
 37860:             const distEntry = require('path').join(cand, 'dist', 'index.js');
 37861:             if (fs.existsSync(distEntry)) return true;
 37862:           }
 37863:         } catch (e) {
 37864:           // continue trying other candidates
 37865:         }
 37866:       }
 37867: 
 37868:       logger.warn(`No build artifact found under ${prefixPath} or subpackages`);
 37869:       return false;
 37870:     } catch (e) {
 37871:       logger.warn(`ensureBuiltIfNeeded failed: ${e}`);
 37872:       return false;
 37873:     }
 37874:   }
 37875: 
 37876:   async function startWithCustoms(modName: string) {
 37877:     const p = (opts?.modulePaths && opts.modulePaths[modName]) || paths[modName];
 37878:     const pkg = SERVICE_MAP[modName] && SERVICE_MAP[modName].pkg;
 37879: 
 37880:     const modDesc: ModuleDescriptor = { name: modName, pkg, cwd: p || process.cwd() };
 37881: 
 37882:     // run customs
 37883:     const report = await runCustomsCheck(modDesc);
 37884:     if (hasBlockingIssues(report)) {
 37885:       logger.warn(`supervisor: ${modName} blocked at customs, not starting.`);
 37886:       return;
 37887:     }
 37888: 
 37889:     // if an explicit path is provided, prefer to run it directly
 37890:     if (p) {
 37891:       try {
 37892:         const pkgJson = readPackageJson(p);
 37893:         if (pkgJson && pkgJson.bin) {
 37894:           const binEntry = typeof pkgJson.bin === "string" ? pkgJson.bin : Object.values(pkgJson.bin)[0];
 37895:           const binPath = require("path").join(p, binEntry);
 37896: 
 37897:           // if bin exists and is a JS file, run via node; otherwise try to run directly but fallback to node if not executable
 37898:           let runCmd = null as any;
 37899:           if (pathExists(binPath) && binPath.endsWith('.js')) {
 37900:             runCmd = { cmd: process.execPath, args: [binPath], cwd: p };
 37901:           } else if (pathExists(binPath)) {
 37902:             // check executable bit on POSIX; on Windows assume runnable
 37903:             let isExec = true;
 37904:             try {
 37905:               if (process.platform !== 'win32') {
 37906:                 const st = fs.statSync(binPath);
 37907:                 isExec = !!(st.mode & 0o111);
 37908:               }
 37909:             } catch (e) { isExec = false; }
 37910: 
 37911:             if (isExec) {
 37912:               runCmd = { cmd: binPath, args: [], cwd: p };
 37913:             } else {
 37914:               // fallback: attempt to run with node
 37915:               runCmd = { cmd: process.execPath, args: [binPath], cwd: p };
 37916:             }
 37917:           }
 37918: 
 37919:           // if no bin but there is a start script, prefer npm --prefix <p> run start
 37920:           if (!runCmd && pkgJson && pkgJson.scripts && pkgJson.scripts.start) {
 37921:             runCmd = { cmd: 'npm', args: ['--prefix', p, 'run', 'start'], cwd: p };
 37922:           }
 37923: 
 37924:           // If runCmd still not set or dist missing, try common subpackage locations
 37925:           if (!runCmd) {
 37926:             const subCandidates = ['spyder', 'apps/spyder-core'];
 37927:             for (const sub of subCandidates) {
 37928:               try {
 37929:                 const subPkg = require('path').join(p, sub);
 37930:                 const subPkgJsonPath = require('path').join(subPkg, 'package.json');
 37931:                 if (fs.existsSync(subPkgJsonPath)) {
 37932:                   const subPkgJson = readPackageJson(subPkg);
 37933:                   if (subPkgJson && subPkgJson.scripts && subPkgJson.scripts.start) {
 37934:                     runCmd = { cmd: 'npm', args: ['--prefix', subPkg, 'run', 'start'], cwd: subPkg };
 37935:                     break;
 37936:                   }
 37937:                 }
 37938:               } catch (_) {}
 37939:             }
 37940:           }
 37941: 
 37942:           if (runCmd) {
 37943:             // if runCmd is npm start with prefix, ensure build exists
 37944:             if (runCmd.cmd === 'npm' && runCmd.args.includes('run') && runCmd.args.includes('start')) {
 37945:               const ok = await ensureBuiltIfNeeded(p);
 37946:               if (!ok) return;
 37947:             }
 37948: 
 37949:             logger.info(`Launching ${modName} -> ${runCmd.cmd} ${runCmd.args.join(" ")}`);
 37950:             startProcess(modName, runCmd.cmd, runCmd.args, { cwd: runCmd.cwd });
 37951:             return;
 37952:           }
 37953:         }
 37954:       } catch (e) {
 37955:         logger.warn(`Failed to run local path for ${modName}: ${e}`);
 37956:       }
 37957:     }
 37958: 
 37959:     // otherwise, use merged resolver (supervisor + NPZ) as primary
 37960:     if (pkg) {
 37961:       const resolved = await resolveMerged(pkg);
 37962:       if (!resolved) {
 37963:         logger.warn(`${modName} path and package not found or merged resolver failed to resolve, skipping`);
 37964:         return;
 37965:       }
 37966: 
 37967:       if (resolved.gate === 'dlx') {
 37968:         const ok = ensurePackageInstalled(pkg);
 37969:         if (!ok) {
 37970:           logger.warn(`${modName} not found and failed to install ${pkg}, skipping`);
 37971:           return;
 37972:         }
 37973:       }
 37974: 
 37975:       const runCmd = { cmd: resolved.cmd as string, args: resolved.args || [], cwd: resolved.cwd };
 37976:       logger.info(`Launching ${modName} -> ${runCmd.cmd} ${runCmd.args.join(" ")}`);
 37977:       startProcess(modName, runCmd.cmd, runCmd.args, { cwd: runCmd.cwd });
 37978:       return;
 37979:     }
 37980: 
 37981:     logger.warn(`${modName} has no runnable entry, skipping`);
 37982:   }
 37983: 
 37984:   for (const mod of services) {
 37985:     const promise = (async () => {
 37986:       // If embed mode is enabled, use startService
 37987:       const embed = process.env.QFLUSH_EMBED_SERVICES === '1';
 37988:       if (embed) {
 37989:         try {
 37990:           await startService(mod, { flags });
 37991:           return;
 37992:         } catch (e) {
 37993:           logger.warn(`embedded start failed for ${mod}: ${e}`);
 37994:           return;
 37995:         }
 37996:       }
 37997: 
 37998:       // Use enhanced master flow which handles missing local bins and robust spawn
 37999:       const p = (opts?.modulePaths && opts.modulePaths[mod]) || paths[mod];
 38000:       const pkg = SERVICE_MAP[mod] && SERVICE_MAP[mod].pkg;
 38001: 
 38002:       // resolve package path (local node_modules or provided path)
 38003:       let pkgPath = p;
 38004:       if (!pkgPath && pkg) pkgPath = resolvePackagePath(pkg);
 38005: 
 38006:       if (!pkgPath && pkg) {
 38007:         const ok = ensurePackageInstalled(pkg);
 38008:         if (!ok) {
 38009:           logger.warn(`${mod} not found and failed to install ${pkg}, skipping`);
 38010:           return;
 38011:         }
 38012:         pkgPath = resolvePackagePath(pkg);
 38013:       }
 38014: 
 38015:       if (!pkgPath) {
 38016:         // fallback to customs+merged-resolver flow
 38017:         await startWithCustoms(mod);
 38018:         return;
 38019:       }
 38020: 
 38021:       const pkgJson = readPackageJson(pkgPath);
 38022: 
 38023:       // choose how to run: package bin if present, else merged resolver
 38024:       let runCmd: { cmd: string; args: string[]; cwd?: string } | null = null;
 38025: 
 38026:       // 1) package bin entry
 38027:       if (pkgJson && pkgJson.bin) {
 38028:         const binEntry = typeof pkgJson.bin === "string" ? pkgJson.bin : Object.values(pkgJson.bin)[0];
 38029:         const binPath = require("path").join(pkgPath, binEntry);
 38030:         if (binPath.endsWith(".js") && pathExists(binPath)) {
 38031:           runCmd = { cmd: process.execPath, args: [binPath], cwd: pkgPath };
 38032:         } else if (pathExists(binPath)) {
 38033:           let isExec = true;
 38034:           try {
 38035:             if (process.platform !== 'win32') {
 38036:               const st = fs.statSync(binPath);
 38037:               isExec = !!(st.mode & 0o111);
 38038:             }
 38039:           } catch (e) { isExec = false; }
 38040:           if (isExec) runCmd = { cmd: binPath, args: [], cwd: pkgPath };
 38041:           else runCmd = { cmd: process.execPath, args: [binPath], cwd: pkgPath };
 38042:         } else {
 38043:           logger.warn(`${mod} bin entry not found at ${binPath}. ${rebuildInstructionsFor(pkgPath)}`);
 38044:         }
 38045:       }
 38046: 
 38047:       // 2) package start script
 38048:       if (!runCmd && pkgJson && pkgJson.scripts && pkgJson.scripts.start) {
 38049:         runCmd = { cmd: 'npm', args: ['--prefix', pkgPath, 'run', 'start'], cwd: pkgPath };
 38050:       }
 38051: 
 38052:       // 3) try common subpackage locations
 38053:       if (!runCmd) {
 38054:         const subCandidates = ['spyder', 'apps/spyder-core'];
 38055:         for (const sub of subCandidates) {
 38056:           try {
 38057:             const subPkg = require('path').join(pkgPath, sub);
 38058:             const subPkgJsonPath = require('path').join(subPkg, 'package.json');
 38059:             if (fs.existsSync(subPkgJsonPath)) {
 38060:               const subPkgJson = readPackageJson(subPkg);
 38061:               if (subPkgJson && subPkgJson.scripts && subPkgJson.scripts.start) {
 38062:                 runCmd = { cmd: 'npm', args: ['--prefix', subPkg, 'run', 'start'], cwd: subPkg };
 38063:                 break;
 38064:               }
 38065:             }
 38066:           } catch (_) {}
 38067:         }
 38068:       }
 38069: 
 38070:       // 4) fallback to merged resolver if still not found
 38071:       if (!runCmd && pkg) {
 38072:         const resolved = await resolveMerged(pkg);
 38073:         if (!resolved || resolved.gate === 'fail') {
 38074:           logger.warn(`${mod} has no runnable entry, skipping`);
 38075:           return;
 38076:         }
 38077:         runCmd = { cmd: resolved.cmd as string, args: resolved.args || [], cwd: resolved.cwd };
 38078:       }
 38079: 
 38080:       if (!runCmd) {
 38081:         logger.warn(`${mod} has no runnable entry, skipping`);
 38082:         return;
 38083:       }
 38084: 
 38085:       // if runCmd is npm start with prefix, ensure built
 38086:       if (runCmd.cmd === 'npm' && runCmd.args.includes('run') && runCmd.args.includes('start')) {
 38087:         const prefixIdx = runCmd.args.indexOf('--prefix');
 38088:         const prefixPath = prefixIdx !== -1 ? runCmd.args[prefixIdx + 1] : runCmd.cwd || pkgPath;
 38089:         const ok = await ensureBuiltIfNeeded(prefixPath as string);
 38090:         if (!ok) return;
 38091:       }
 38092: 
 38093:       const restarts = 0;
 38094: 
 38095:       const spawnOnce = (): Promise<void> => {
 38096:         return new Promise((resolve) => {
 38097:           logger.info(`Launching ${mod} -> ${runCmd!.cmd} ${runCmd!.args.join(" ")}`);
 38098: 
 38099:           // use supervisor to manage and persist process
 38100:           const child = startProcess(mod, runCmd!.cmd, runCmd!.args, { cwd: runCmd!.cwd });
 38101: 
 38102:           if (waitForStart) {
 38103:             // try to wait for a health endpoint if provided in flags
 38104:             const svcUrl = flags["health-url"] || flags["health"];
 38105:             const svcPort = flags["health-port"] || undefined;
 38106:             if (svcUrl) {
 38107:               waitForService(svcUrl as string, svcPort as any).then((ok) => {
 38108:                 if (ok) logger.success(`${mod} passed health check`);
 38109:                 else logger.warn(`${mod} failed health check`);
 38110:                 resolve();
 38111:               });
 38112:             } else {
 38113:               // wait for spawn via PID persistence
 38114:               setTimeout(() => {
 38115:                 logger.info(`${mod} started (delayed wait).`);
 38116:                 resolve();
 38117:               }, 2000);
 38118:             }
 38119:           } else {
 38120:             resolve();
 38121:           }
 38122: 
 38123:           // child exit handled by supervisor
 38124:         });
 38125:       };
 38126: 
 38127:       // start the first time and optionally wait
 38128:       await spawnOnce();
 38129: 
 38130:       // restart logic handled by supervisor-level events, keep simple here
 38131:     })();
 38132:     procs.push(promise);
 38133:   }
 38134: 
 38135:   await Promise.all(procs);
 38136: 
 38137:   // After starting services, optionally start SPYDER resonnance when configured
 38138:   try {
 38139:     const spyCfgPath = require('path').join(process.cwd(), '.qflush', 'spyder.config.json');
 38140:     if (fs.existsSync(spyCfgPath)) {
 38141:       try {
 38142:         const raw = fs.readFileSync(spyCfgPath, 'utf8');
 38143:         const spyCfg = JSON.parse(raw || '{}');
 38144:         if (spyCfg && spyCfg.enabled) {
 38145:           // start resonnance (non-blocking)
 38146:           try {
 38147:             const m: any = await import('../cortex/resonnance.js');
 38148:             if (m && typeof m.resonnance === 'function') {
 38149:               // launch but don't await to keep start fast
 38150:               void m.resonnance();
 38151:               logger.info('SPYDER resonnance started as part of qflush start');
 38152:             } else if (m && typeof m.default === 'function') {
 38153:               // fallback if module exports default command runner
 38154:               void m.default();
 38155:               logger.info('SPYDER resonnance (default) started as part of qflush start');
 38156:             } else {
 38157:               logger.warn('SPYDER resonnance module found but no callable export');
 38158:             }
 38159:           } catch (e) {
 38160:             logger.warn('Failed to import/start SPYDER resonnance: ' + String(e));
 38161:           }
 38162:         }
 38163:       } catch (e) {
 38164:         logger.warn('Failed to read or parse spyder.config.json: ' + String(e));
 38165:       }
 38166:     }
 38167:   } catch (_) {}
 38168: 
 38169:   // Also, if cortex.routes.json contains routes, start resonnance (makes SPYDER active when routes present)
 38170:   try {
 38171:     const routesPath = require('path').join(process.cwd(), '.qflush', 'cortex.routes.json');
 38172:     if (fs.existsSync(routesPath)) {
 38173:       try {
 38174:         const rawRoutes = fs.readFileSync(routesPath, 'utf8') || '{}';
 38175:         const parsed = JSON.parse(rawRoutes);
 38176:         const routesArr = parsed && (parsed.routes || parsed.cortexActions) ? (parsed.routes || parsed.cortexActions) : null;
 38177:         let count = 0;
 38178:         if (Array.isArray(routesArr)) count = routesArr.length;
 38179:         else if (routesArr && typeof routesArr === 'object') count = Object.keys(routesArr).length;
 38180:         if (count > 0) {
 38181:           try {
 38182:             const m: any = await import('../cortex/resonnance.js');
 38183:             if (m && typeof m.resonnance === 'function') {
 38184:               void m.resonnance();
 38185:               logger.info('SPYDER resonnance started because cortex.routes.json contains routes');
 38186:             }
 38187:           } catch (e) {
 38188:             logger.warn('Failed to import/start SPYDER resonnance from cortex.routes: ' + String(e));
 38189:           }
 38190:         }
 38191:       } catch (e) {
 38192:         logger.warn('Failed to read or parse cortex.routes.json: ' + String(e));
 38193:       }
 38194:     }
 38195:   } catch (_) {}
 38196: 
 38197:   logger.success("qflush: start sequence initiated for selected modules");
 38198: }
 38199:

 38204: FILE: src\commands\vision.ts
 38205: ============================
 38206: ============================
 38207: import vision from '../cortex/vision';
 38208: 
 38209: export default async function runVision(argv: string[] = []) {
 38210:   const file = argv[0];
 38211:   if (!file) {
 38212:     console.log('usage: qflush vision <png-path>');
 38213:     return 1;
 38214:   }
 38215:   try {
 38216:     const res = await vision.processVisionImage(file);
 38217:     console.log('vision processed, output written to .qflush/spyder-vision.json');
 38218:     return 0;
 38219:   } catch (e) {
 38220:     console.error('vision failed', e);
 38221:     return 2;
 38222:   }
 38223: }
 38224: 
 38225: 
 38226: 
 38227: ============================
 38228: FILE: src\compose\fclParser.ts
 38229: ============================
 38230: ============================
 38231: // ROME-TAG: 0x5D80DC
 38232: 
 38233: import fs from 'fs';
 38234: 
 38235: function parseValue(raw: string): any {
 38236:   const v = raw.trim();
 38237:   if (v.startsWith('[') && v.endsWith(']')) {
 38238:     // simple list parser
 38239:     const inside = v.slice(1, -1).trim();
 38240:     if (!inside) return [];
 38241:     return inside.split(',').map(x => x.trim().replace(/^"|"$/g, ''));
 38242:   }
 38243:   if (/^\d+$/.test(v)) return Number(v);
 38244:   return v.replace(/^"|"$/g, '');
 38245: }
 38246: 
 38247: export function readFCL(file = 'funesterie.fcl') {
 38248:   try {
 38249:     const raw = fs.readFileSync(file, 'utf8');
 38250:     const lines = raw.split(/\r?\n/);
 38251:     const out: any = { project: {}, env: {}, service: {}, pipeline: {} };
 38252:     let current: { section?: string, name?: string } = {};
 38253:     for (let line of lines) {
 38254:       line = line.trim();
 38255:       if (!line || line.startsWith('#') || line.startsWith('//')) continue;
 38256:       if (line.startsWith('@')) {
 38257:         const parts = line.split(/	|\s+/).filter(Boolean);
 38258:         const sec = parts[0].slice(1);
 38259:         const name = parts[1] || undefined;
 38260:         current = { section: sec, name };
 38261:         if (name) {
 38262:           if (!out[sec]) out[sec] = {};
 38263:           out[sec][name] = out[sec][name] || {};
 38264:         }
 38265:         continue;
 38266:       }
 38267:       const eq = line.indexOf('=');
 38268:       if (eq === -1) continue;
 38269:       const key = line.slice(0, eq).trim();
 38270:       const val = parseValue(line.slice(eq + 1));
 38271:       if (current.section) {
 38272:         if (current.name) {
 38273:           out[current.section][current.name][key] = val;
 38274:         } else {
 38275:           out[current.section][key] = val;
 38276:         }
 38277:       }
 38278:     }
 38279:     return out;
 38280:   } catch (err) {
 38281:     return null;
 38282:   }
 38283: }
 38284: 
 38285: 
 38286: 
 38287: ============================
 38288: FILE: src\compose\parser.ts
 38289: ============================
 38290: ============================
 38291: // ROME-TAG: 0x15FDE1
 38292: 
 38293: import fs from 'fs';
 38294: import yaml from 'js-yaml';
 38295: import { readFCL } from './fclParser';
 38296: 
 38297: export type ModuleDef = {
 38298:   path?: string;
 38299:   port?: number;
 38300:   token?: string;
 38301:   env?: Record<string,string>;
 38302: };
 38303: 
 38304: export type ComposeFile = {
 38305:   modules: Record<string, ModuleDef>;
 38306: };
 38307: 
 38308: export function readCompose(file = 'funesterie.yml'): ComposeFile | null {
 38309:   try {
 38310:     if (fs.existsSync('funesterie.fcl')) {
 38311:       const fcl = readFCL('funesterie.fcl');
 38312:       if (fcl && fcl.service) {
 38313:         const modules: Record<string, ModuleDef> = {};
 38314:         for (const k of Object.keys(fcl.service)) {
 38315:           const s = fcl.service[k];
 38316:           modules[k] = { path: s.path, port: s.port, token: s.token, env: s.env };
 38317:         }
 38318:         return { modules };
 38319:       }
 38320:     }
 38321:     if (!fs.existsSync(file)) return null;
 38322:     const raw = fs.readFileSync(file, 'utf8');
 38323:     const doc = yaml.load(raw) as any;
 38324:     if (!doc || !doc.modules) return null;
 38325:     return { modules: doc.modules } as ComposeFile;
 38326:   } catch (err) {
 38327:     return null;
 38328:   }
 38329: }
 38330:

 38332: 
 38333: ============================
 38334: FILE: src\core\qflush-mode.ts
 38335: ============================
 38336: ============================
 38337: export type QflushMode = 'daemon' | 'cortex' | 'hybrid';
 38338: 
 38339: export function getQflushMode(): QflushMode {
 38340:   const env = (process.env.QFLUSH_MODE || '').toString().trim().toLowerCase();
 38341:   if (env === 'daemon' || env === 'cortex' || env === 'hybrid') return env as QflushMode;
 38342:   // When running tests prefer cortex for faster, portless execution
 38343:   if (process.env.VITEST) return 'cortex';
 38344:   // default to hybrid to allow smooth migration
 38345:   return 'hybrid';
 38346: }
 38347: 
 38348: export const QFLUSH_MODE = getQflushMode();
 38349: 
 38350: 
 38351: 
 38352: ============================
 38353: FILE: src\core\start-system.ts
 38354: ============================
 38355: ============================
 38356: import { QFLUSH_MODE } from './qflush-mode';
 38357: 
 38358: export async function startQflushSystem() {
 38359:   if (QFLUSH_MODE !== 'daemon') {
 38360:     try {
 38361:       const m = await import('../cortex/bus.js');
 38362:       if (m && typeof m.startCortexBus === 'function') {
 38363:         console.log('[QFLUSH] starting CORTEX bus');
 38364:         m.startCortexBus();
 38365:       }
 38366:     } catch (e) {
 38367:       console.warn('[QFLUSH] failed to start CORTEX bus (continuing):', String(e));
 38368:     }
 38369:   }
 38370: 
 38371:   if (QFLUSH_MODE !== 'cortex') {
 38372:     try {
 38373:       const m = await import('../daemon/qflushd.js');
 38374:       const mm: any = m;
 38375:       // accept either startServer export or default export function
 38376:       const startFn = (mm && typeof mm.startServer === 'function') ? mm.startServer : (mm && typeof mm.default === 'function') ? mm.default : null;
 38377:       if (startFn) {
 38378:         console.log('[QFLUSH] starting legacy daemon server');
 38379:         const port = process.env.QFLUSHD_PORT ? Number(process.env.QFLUSHD_PORT) : undefined;
 38380:         startFn(port);
 38381:       }
 38382:     } catch (e) {
 38383:       console.warn('[QFLUSH] failed to start legacy daemon (continuing):', String(e));
 38384:     }
 38385:   }
 38386: }

 38390: ============================
 38391: FILE: src\cortex\applyPacket.spec.ts
 38392: ============================
 38393: ============================
 38394: import { describe, it, expect } from 'vitest';
 38395: import { applyCortexPacket } from './applyPacket';
 38396: import * as fs from 'fs';
 38397: import * as path from 'path';
 38398: 
 38399: describe('applyPacket handlers', () => {
 38400:   it('applies oc8 metadata', async () => {
 38401:     const tmp = path.join(process.cwd(), '.qflush', 'test-oc8');
 38402:     try { if (!fs.existsSync(path.dirname(tmp))) fs.mkdirSync(path.dirname(tmp), { recursive: true }); } catch (e) {}
 38403:     const pkt: any = { type: 'cortex:oc8', id: 't-oc8-1', payload: { info: { name: 'OC8TEST', description: 'test' } } };
 38404:     await (applyCortexPacket as any)(pkt);
 38405:     const out = path.join(process.cwd(), '.qflush', 'oc8.meta.json');
 38406:     expect(fs.existsSync(out)).toBe(true);
 38407:     const j = JSON.parse(fs.readFileSync(out, 'utf8'));
 38408:     expect(j.name).toBe('OC8TEST');
 38409:   });
 38410: 
 38411:   it('applies auto-patch dry-run and does not write config', async () => {
 38412:     const cfg = path.join(process.cwd(), '.qflush', 'config.json');
 38413:     try { if (fs.existsSync(cfg)) fs.unlinkSync(cfg); } catch (e) {}
 38414:     const pkt: any = { type: 'cortex:auto-patch', id: 't-patch-1', payload: { patch: { flags: { testMode: true } }, dryRun: true } };
 38415:     await (applyCortexPacket as any)(pkt);
 38416:     expect(fs.existsSync(cfg)).toBe(false);
 38417:   });
 38418: });

 38421: 
 38422: ============================
 38423: FILE: src\cortex\applyPacket.ts
 38424: ============================
 38425: ============================
 38426: import * as fs from 'fs';
 38427: import * as path from 'path';
 38428: import { CortexPacket } from './types';
 38429: import { executeAction } from '../rome/executor';
 38430: 
 38431: const QFLUSH_DIR = path.join(process.cwd(), '.qflush');
 38432: const CACHE_PATH = path.join(QFLUSH_DIR, 'spyder.cache.json');
 38433: const PATCHES_DIR = path.join(QFLUSH_DIR, 'patches');
 38434: const PATCH_AUDIT = path.join(PATCHES_DIR, 'audit.log');
 38435: 
 38436: function loadCache(): { appliedIds: string[] } {
 38437:   try {
 38438:     if (!fs.existsSync(CACHE_PATH)) return { appliedIds: [] };
 38439:     const raw = fs.readFileSync(CACHE_PATH, 'utf8') || '{}';
 38440:     const obj = JSON.parse(raw);
 38441:     return { appliedIds: Array.isArray(obj.appliedIds) ? obj.appliedIds : [] };
 38442:   } catch (e) {
 38443:     return { appliedIds: [] };
 38444:   }
 38445: }
 38446: 
 38447: function saveCache(cache: { appliedIds: string[] }) {
 38448:   try {
 38449:     if (!fs.existsSync(QFLUSH_DIR)) fs.mkdirSync(QFLUSH_DIR, { recursive: true });
 38450:     fs.writeFileSync(CACHE_PATH, JSON.stringify(cache, null, 2), 'utf8');
 38451:   } catch (e) {
 38452:     // ignore
 38453:   }
 38454: }
 38455: 
 38456: function ensurePatchesDir() {
 38457:   try { if (!fs.existsSync(PATCHES_DIR)) fs.mkdirSync(PATCHES_DIR, { recursive: true }); } catch (e) {}
 38458: }
 38459: 
 38460: function appendPatchAudit(entry: any) {
 38461:   try {
 38462:     ensurePatchesDir();
 38463:     const line = JSON.stringify(entry) + "\n";
 38464:     fs.appendFileSync(PATCH_AUDIT, line, 'utf8');
 38465:   } catch (e) { /* ignore */ }
 38466: }
 38467: 
 38468: function loadPatchWhitelist(): string[] {
 38469:   try {
 38470:     const wlFile = path.join(PATCHES_DIR, 'whitelist.json');
 38471:     if (fs.existsSync(wlFile)) {
 38472:       const raw = fs.readFileSync(wlFile, 'utf8') || '[]';
 38473:       const arr = JSON.parse(raw);
 38474:       if (Array.isArray(arr)) return arr.map(String);
 38475:     }
 38476:   } catch (e) {}
 38477:   // default whitelist: allow only top-level keys considered safe
 38478:   return ['routes', 'spyder', 'npz', 'telemetry', 'logic-config', 'flags', 'paths', 'services'];
 38479: }
 38480: 
 38481: function isPatchAllowed(patch: any): { ok: boolean; reason?: string } {
 38482:   try {
 38483:     if (!patch || typeof patch !== 'object') return { ok: false, reason: 'invalid_patch' };
 38484:     const whitelist = loadPatchWhitelist();
 38485:     const keys = Object.keys(patch);
 38486:     // allow when every key is in whitelist
 38487:     for (const k of keys) {
 38488:       if (!whitelist.includes(k)) return { ok: false, reason: `key_not_allowed:${k}` };
 38489:     }
 38490:     return { ok: true };
 38491:   } catch (e) {
 38492:     return { ok: false, reason: 'validation_error' };
 38493:   }
 38494: }
 38495: 
 38496: export async function applyCortexPacket(packet: CortexPacket): Promise<void> {
 38497:   // dedupe by id
 38498:   try {
 38499:     const cache = loadCache();
 38500:     if (packet.id && cache.appliedIds.includes(packet.id)) {
 38501:       console.log('[APPLY] packet already applied (id=', packet.id, ') — skipping');
 38502:       return;
 38503:     }
 38504: 
 38505:     switch (String(packet.type).toLowerCase()) {
 38506:       case 'enable-spyder':
 38507:       case 'cortex:enable-spyder':
 38508:         await applyEnableSpyder(packet);
 38509:         break;
 38510: 
 38511:       case 'cortex:routes':
 38512:       case 'cortex:routes:':
 38513:         await applyCortexRoutes(packet);
 38514:         break;
 38515: 
 38516:       case 'qflush:apply':
 38517:       case 'cortex:apply':
 38518:         await applyQflushConfigPatch(packet);
 38519:         break;
 38520: 
 38521:       case 'npz-graph':
 38522:       case 'npz:graph':
 38523:       case 'npz-graph':
 38524:       case 'cortex:npz-graph':
 38525:         await applyNpzGraph(packet);
 38526:         break;
 38527: 
 38528:       case 'save-state':
 38529:       case 'save:state':
 38530:       case 'save-state':
 38531:       case 'cortex:save-state':
 38532:         await applySaveState(packet);
 38533:         break;
 38534: 
 38535:       case 'auto-patch':
 38536:       case 'auto_patch':
 38537:       case 'qflush:auto-patch':
 38538:       case 'cortex:auto-patch':
 38539:         await applyAutoPatch(packet);
 38540:         break;
 38541: 
 38542:       // new handlers
 38543:       case 'cortex:oc8':
 38544:       case 'oc8':
 38545:         await applyOc8(packet);
 38546:         break;
 38547: 
 38548:       case 'cortex:qrouter':
 38549:       case 'qrouter':
 38550:         await applyQrouter(packet);
 38551:         break;
 38552: 
 38553:       case 'cortex:spyder-sound':
 38554:       case 'spyder-sound':
 38555:         await applySpyderSound(packet);
 38556:         break;
 38557: 
 38558:       case 'cortex:a11-key':
 38559:       case 'a11-key':
 38560:         await applyA11Key(packet);
 38561:         break;
 38562: 
 38563:       case 'cortex:magic':
 38564:       case 'magic':
 38565:         await applyMagic(packet);
 38566:         break;
 38567: 
 38568:       default:
 38569:         console.warn('[APPLY] Type de packet non géré:', packet.type);
 38570:     }
 38571: 
 38572:     // record applied id
 38573:     try {
 38574:       if (packet.id) {
 38575:         const cache2 = loadCache();
 38576:         cache2.appliedIds.push(packet.id);
 38577:         // keep unique
 38578:         cache2.appliedIds = Array.from(new Set(cache2.appliedIds));
 38579:         saveCache(cache2);
 38580:       }
 38581:     } catch (e) { /* ignore */ }
 38582:   } catch (e) {
 38583:     console.warn('[APPLY] applyCortexPacket failed:', String(e));
 38584:   }
 38585: }
 38586: 
 38587: async function applyNpzGraph(packet: CortexPacket) {
 38588:   try {
 38589:     const payload: any = packet.payload || {};
 38590:     const filePath = payload && payload.path ? String(payload.path) : process.cwd();
 38591:     console.log('[APPLY] NPZ-GRAPH ingest for', filePath);
 38592:     const res = await executeAction('npz.encode', { path: filePath });
 38593:     console.log('[APPLY] NPZ-GRAPH result', res);
 38594:     appendPatchAudit({ id: packet.id || null, type: packet.type, action: 'npz.encode', path: filePath, result: res, when: new Date().toISOString() });
 38595:   } catch (e) {
 38596:     console.warn('[APPLY] NPZ-GRAPH failed', String(e));
 38597:     appendPatchAudit({ id: packet.id || null, type: packet.type, action: 'npz.encode', error: String(e), when: new Date().toISOString() });
 38598:   }
 38599: }
 38600: 
 38601: async function applySaveState(packet: CortexPacket) {
 38602:   try {
 38603:     if (!fs.existsSync(QFLUSH_DIR)) fs.mkdirSync(QFLUSH_DIR, { recursive: true });
 38604:     const stateFile = path.join(QFLUSH_DIR, 'state.json');
 38605:     const snapshotDir = path.join(QFLUSH_DIR, 'snapshots');
 38606:     if (!fs.existsSync(snapshotDir)) fs.mkdirSync(snapshotDir, { recursive: true });
 38607:     const now = new Date().toISOString().replace(/[:.]/g, '-');
 38608:     const snapshotFile = path.join(snapshotDir, `state-${now}.json`);
 38609: 
 38610:     // read current state if exists or create minimal
 38611:     let current: any = {};
 38612:     try { if (fs.existsSync(stateFile)) current = JSON.parse(fs.readFileSync(stateFile, 'utf8') || '{}'); } catch (e) { current = {}; }
 38613: 
 38614:     // allow packet.payload to merge into state snapshot
 38615:     const payload: any = packet.payload || {};
 38616:     const merged = { ...current, ...payload };
 38617:     fs.writeFileSync(snapshotFile, JSON.stringify(merged, null, 2), 'utf8');
 38618:     // also write state.json as current
 38619:     fs.writeFileSync(stateFile, JSON.stringify(merged, null, 2), 'utf8');
 38620: 
 38621:     console.log('[APPLY] SAVE-STATE snapshot written to', snapshotFile);
 38622:     appendPatchAudit({ id: packet.id || null, type: packet.type, action: 'save-state', path: snapshotFile, when: new Date().toISOString() });
 38623:   } catch (e) {
 38624:     console.warn('[APPLY] SAVE-STATE failed', String(e));
 38625:     appendPatchAudit({ id: packet.id || null, type: packet.type, action: 'save-state', error: String(e), when: new Date().toISOString() });
 38626:   }
 38627: }
 38628: 
 38629: async function applyAutoPatch(packet: CortexPacket) {
 38630:   try {
 38631:     const payload: any = packet.payload || {};
 38632:     const patch = payload.patch || payload;
 38633:     const approve = Boolean(payload.approve || payload.approved || false);
 38634:     const dryRun = Boolean(payload.dryRun || payload.dry || true); // safer default: dryRun true
 38635: 
 38636:     // validate patch keys
 38637:     const validation = isPatchAllowed(patch);
 38638:     if (!validation.ok) {
 38639:       // write blocked patch for audit
 38640:       try {
 38641:         ensurePatchesDir();
 38642:         const blockedFile = path.join(PATCHES_DIR, `blocked-${packet.id || Date.now()}.json`);
 38643:         fs.writeFileSync(blockedFile, JSON.stringify({ packetId: packet.id || null, reason: validation.reason, patch }, null, 2), 'utf8');
 38644:         appendPatchAudit({ id: packet.id || null, type: packet.type, action: 'auto-patch', status: 'blocked', reason: validation.reason, when: new Date().toISOString() });
 38645:       } catch (e) {}
 38646:       console.warn('[APPLY] AUTO-PATCH blocked by whitelist:', validation.reason);
 38647:       return;
 38648:     }
 38649: 
 38650:     const dir = QFLUSH_DIR;
 38651:     const cfgFile = path.join(dir, 'config.json');
 38652:     let current: any = {};
 38653:     try { if (fs.existsSync(cfgFile)) current = JSON.parse(fs.readFileSync(cfgFile, 'utf8') || '{}'); } catch (e) { current = {}; }
 38654: 
 38655:     const merged = { ...current, ...patch };
 38656: 
 38657:     if (dryRun || !approve) {
 38658:       const outDir = path.join(dir, 'patches');
 38659:       if (!fs.existsSync(outDir)) fs.mkdirSync(outDir, { recursive: true });
 38660:       const outFile = path.join(outDir, `dryrun-${packet.id || Date.now()}.json`);
 38661:       fs.writeFileSync(outFile, JSON.stringify({ current, patch, merged }, null, 2), 'utf8');
 38662:       appendPatchAudit({ id: packet.id || null, type: packet.type, action: 'auto-patch', status: 'dryrun', file: outFile, when: new Date().toISOString() });
 38663:       console.log('[APPLY] AUTO-PATCH dry-run saved to', outFile);
 38664:       if (approve) {
 38665:         // fallthrough to apply
 38666:       } else {
 38667:         return;
 38668:       }
 38669:     }
 38670: 
 38671:     // apply
 38672:     fs.writeFileSync(cfgFile, JSON.stringify(merged, null, 2), 'utf8');
 38673:     appendPatchAudit({ id: packet.id || null, type: packet.type, action: 'auto-patch', status: 'applied', file: cfgFile, when: new Date().toISOString() });
 38674:     console.log('[APPLY] AUTO-PATCH applied to', cfgFile);
 38675:   } catch (e) {
 38676:     console.warn('[APPLY] AUTO-PATCH failed', String(e));
 38677:     appendPatchAudit({ id: packet.id || null, type: packet.type, action: 'auto-patch', status: 'error', error: String(e), when: new Date().toISOString() });
 38678:   }
 38679: }
 38680: 
 38681: // existing handlers
 38682: async function applyEnableSpyder(packet: CortexPacket) {
 38683:   const dir = path.join(process.cwd(), '.qflush');
 38684:   const file = path.join(dir, 'spyder.config.json');
 38685:   const current = fs.existsSync(file)
 38686:     ? JSON.parse(fs.readFileSync(file, 'utf8'))
 38687:     : {};
 38688: 
 38689:   const payload: any = packet.payload ?? {};
 38690:   const spyderConfig = {
 38691:     ...current,
 38692:     ...(payload.spyder || {})
 38693:   };
 38694: 
 38695:   if (!fs.existsSync(dir)) fs.mkdirSync(dir, { recursive: true });
 38696:   fs.writeFileSync(file, JSON.stringify(spyderConfig, null, 2), 'utf8');
 38697:   console.log('[APPLY] SPYDER mis à jour via packet enable-spyder');
 38698:   appendPatchAudit({ id: packet.id || null, type: packet.type, action: 'enable-spyder', when: new Date().toISOString() });
 38699: }
 38700: 
 38701: async function applyCortexRoutes(packet: CortexPacket) {
 38702:   const dir = path.join(process.cwd(), '.qflush');
 38703:   const file = path.join(dir, 'cortex.routes.json');
 38704:   const payload: any = packet.payload ?? {};
 38705: 
 38706:   if (!fs.existsSync(dir)) fs.mkdirSync(dir, { recursive: true });
 38707:   fs.writeFileSync(file, JSON.stringify(payload, null, 2), 'utf8');
 38708:   console.log('[APPLY] cortex.routes.json mis à jour.');
 38709:   appendPatchAudit({ id: packet.id || null, type: packet.type, action: 'cortex:routes', when: new Date().toISOString() });
 38710: }
 38711: 
 38712: async function applyQflushConfigPatch(packet: CortexPacket) {
 38713:   const dir = path.join(process.cwd(), '.qflush');
 38714:   const file = path.join(dir, 'config.json');
 38715:   const current = fs.existsSync(file)
 38716:     ? JSON.parse(fs.readFileSync(file, 'utf8'))
 38717:     : {};
 38718: 
 38719:   const payload: any = packet.payload ?? {};
 38720:   const merged = {
 38721:     ...current,
 38722:     ...payload
 38723:   };
 38724: 
 38725:   if (!fs.existsSync(dir)) fs.mkdirSync(dir, { recursive: true });
 38726:   fs.writeFileSync(file, JSON.stringify(merged, null, 2), 'utf8');
 38727:   console.log('[APPLY] config.json mis à jour via packet qflush:apply');
 38728:   appendPatchAudit({ id: packet.id || null, type: packet.type, action: 'qflush:apply', when: new Date().toISOString() });
 38729: }
 38730: 
 38731: // new apply handlers
 38732: async function applyOc8(packet: CortexPacket) {
 38733:   try {
 38734:     const payload: any = packet.payload || {};
 38735:     const metaFile = path.join(QFLUSH_DIR, 'oc8.meta.json');
 38736:     const info = payload.info || { name: 'OC8', description: 'OC8 format' };
 38737:     if (!fs.existsSync(QFLUSH_DIR)) fs.mkdirSync(QFLUSH_DIR, { recursive: true });
 38738:     fs.writeFileSync(metaFile, JSON.stringify(info, null, 2), 'utf8');
 38739:     appendPatchAudit({ id: packet.id || null, type: packet.type, action: 'oc8:register', file: metaFile, when: new Date().toISOString() });
 38740:     console.log('[APPLY] OC8 metadata written to', metaFile);
 38741:   } catch (e) { console.warn('[APPLY] OC8 failed', String(e)); }
 38742: }
 38743: 
 38744: async function applyQrouter(packet: CortexPacket) {
 38745:   try {
 38746:     const payload: any = packet.payload || {};
 38747:     const file = path.join(QFLUSH_DIR, 'cortex.routes.json');
 38748:     let current: any = {};
 38749:     try { if (fs.existsSync(file)) current = JSON.parse(fs.readFileSync(file, 'utf8') || '{}'); } catch (e) { current = {}; }
 38750:     const merged = { ...current, ...(payload.routes || {}) };
 38751:     if (!fs.existsSync(QFLUSH_DIR)) fs.mkdirSync(QFLUSH_DIR, { recursive: true });
 38752:     fs.writeFileSync(file, JSON.stringify(merged, null, 2), 'utf8');
 38753:     appendPatchAudit({ id: packet.id || null, type: packet.type, action: 'qrouter:update', file, when: new Date().toISOString() });
 38754:     console.log('[APPLY] QROUTER updated', file);
 38755:   } catch (e) { console.warn('[APPLY] QROUTER failed', String(e)); }
 38756: }
 38757: 
 38758: async function applySpyderSound(packet: CortexPacket) {
 38759:   try {
 38760:     const payload: any = packet.payload || {};
 38761:     const file = path.join(QFLUSH_DIR, 'spyder-sound.config.json');
 38762:     let current: any = {};
 38763:     try { if (fs.existsSync(file)) current = JSON.parse(fs.readFileSync(file, 'utf8') || '{}'); } catch (e) { current = {}; }
 38764:     const merged = { ...current, ...payload };
 38765:     if (!fs.existsSync(QFLUSH_DIR)) fs.mkdirSync(QFLUSH_DIR, { recursive: true });
 38766:     fs.writeFileSync(file, JSON.stringify(merged, null, 2), 'utf8');
 38767:     appendPatchAudit({ id: packet.id || null, type: packet.type, action: 'spyder-sound', file, when: new Date().toISOString() });
 38768:     console.log('[APPLY] spyder-sound config updated');
 38769:   } catch (e) { console.warn('[APPLY] spyder-sound failed', String(e)); }
 38770: }
 38771: 
 38772: async function applyA11Key(packet: CortexPacket) {
 38773:   try {
 38774:     const payload: any = packet.payload || {};
 38775:     const file = path.join(QFLUSH_DIR, 'a11.config.json');
 38776:     let current: any = {};
 38777:     try { if (fs.existsSync(file)) current = JSON.parse(fs.readFileSync(file, 'utf8') || '{}'); } catch (e) { current = {}; }
 38778:     // do not log apiKey in audit
 38779:     const safePayload = { ...payload };
 38780:     if (safePayload.apiKey) delete safePayload.apiKey;
 38781:     const merged = { ...current, ...payload };
 38782:     if (!fs.existsSync(QFLUSH_DIR)) fs.mkdirSync(QFLUSH_DIR, { recursive: true });
 38783:     fs.writeFileSync(file, JSON.stringify(merged, null, 2), 'utf8');
 38784:     appendPatchAudit({ id: packet.id || null, type: packet.type, action: 'a11-key', file, when: new Date().toISOString() });
 38785:     console.log('[APPLY] A11 config updated (apiKey redacted in logs)');
 38786:   } catch (e) { console.warn('[APPLY] A11 failed', String(e)); }
 38787: }
 38788: 
 38789: async function applyMagic(packet: CortexPacket) {
 38790:   try {
 38791:     const entry = { id: packet.id || null, when: new Date().toISOString(), payload: packet.payload };
 38792:     const file = path.join(QFLUSH_DIR, 'magic.log');
 38793:     if (!fs.existsSync(QFLUSH_DIR)) fs.mkdirSync(QFLUSH_DIR, { recursive: true });
 38794:     fs.appendFileSync(file, JSON.stringify(entry) + '\n', 'utf8');
 38795:     appendPatchAudit({ id: packet.id || null, type: packet.type, action: 'magic', file, when: new Date().toISOString() });
 38796:     console.log('[APPLY] magic recorded');
 38797:   } catch (e) { console.warn('[APPLY] magic failed', String(e)); }
 38798: }
 38799: 
 38800: export default { applyCortexPacket };
 38801: 
 38802: 
 38803: 
 38804: ============================
 38805: FILE: src\cortex\bus.ts
 38806: ============================
 38807: ============================
 38808: import fs from 'fs';
 38809: import path from 'path';
 38810: import { decodeCortexPNG } from './decoder';
 38811: import { encodeCortexCommand } from './encoder';
 38812: import { execCommand } from '../rome/executor';
 38813: 
 38814: const inbox = path.join('.qflush', 'cortex', 'inbox');
 38815: const outbox = path.join('.qflush', 'cortex', 'outbox');
 38816: 
 38817: export function startCortexBus() {
 38818:   fs.mkdirSync(inbox, { recursive: true });
 38819:   fs.mkdirSync(outbox, { recursive: true });
 38820: 
 38821:   console.log('[CORTEX] Bus démarré — watching', inbox);
 38822: 
 38823:   const processFile = async (file: string) => {
 38824:     const full = path.join(inbox, file);
 38825:     if (!file.endsWith('.png')) return;
 38826:     try {
 38827:       const payload = decodeCortexPNG(full);
 38828:       const result = await execCommand(payload.cmd, payload.args || []);
 38829:       const response = { id: payload.id, ok: true, result, timestamp: Date.now() };
 38830:       const out = path.join(outbox, file);
 38831:       encodeCortexCommand(response, out);
 38832:     } catch (e) {
 38833:       console.error('[CORTEX] processing error', e);
 38834:       const resp = { id: path.basename(file, '.png'), ok: false, error: String(e), timestamp: Date.now() };
 38835:       try { encodeCortexCommand(resp, path.join(outbox, file)); } catch (e2) { /* ignore */ }
 38836:     } finally {
 38837:       try { fs.unlinkSync(full); } catch (e) { /* ignore */ }
 38838:     }
 38839:   };
 38840: 
 38841:   // simple poll/watch to be robust
 38842:   setInterval(() => {
 38843:     try {
 38844:       const files = fs.readdirSync(inbox || '.');
 38845:       for (const f of files) {
 38846:         processFile(f);
 38847:       }
 38848:     } catch (e) {
 38849:       // ignore
 38850:     }
 38851:   }, 500);
 38852: }
 38853: 
 38854: 
 38855: 
 38856: ============================
 38857: FILE: src\cortex\cli.ts
 38858: ============================
 38859: ============================
 38860: import path from 'path';
 38861: import { encodeCortexCommand } from './encoder';
 38862: import fs from 'fs';
 38863: 
 38864: export function cortexSend(cmd: string, args: any[] = []) {
 38865:   const id = 'cortex-' + Date.now() + '-' + Math.random().toString(36).slice(2, 8);
 38866:   const ner = { id, cmd, args, timestamp: Date.now() };
 38867:   const out = path.join('.qflush', 'cortex', 'inbox', id + '.png');
 38868:   encodeCortexCommand(ner, out);
 38869:   return id;
 38870: }
 38871: 
 38872: export function cortexWaitFor(id: string, timeoutMs = 5000) {
 38873:   const out = path.join('.qflush', 'cortex', 'outbox', id + '.png');
 38874:   const start = Date.now();
 38875:   return new Promise<any>((resolve, reject) => {
 38876:     const iv = setInterval(() => {
 38877:       if (Date.now() - start > timeoutMs) { clearInterval(iv); return reject(new Error('timeout')); }
 38878:       if (fs.existsSync(out)) {
 38879:         try {
 38880:           const dec = require('./decoder').decodeCortexPNG(out);
 38881:           try { fs.unlinkSync(out); } catch(e){}
 38882:           clearInterval(iv);
 38883:           resolve(dec);
 38884:         } catch (e) { clearInterval(iv); reject(e); }
 38885:       }
 38886:     }, 200);
 38887:   });
 38888: }
 38889: 
 38890: 
 38891: 
 38892: ============================
 38893: FILE: src\cortex\codec.spec.ts
 38894: ============================
 38895: ============================
 38896: import { describe, it, expect } from 'vitest';
 38897: import { decodeCortexPacket } from './codec';
 38898: import packet80 from '../../decoded_brotli_red_80.json';
 38899: 
 38900: describe('Cortex codec', () => {
 38901:   it('decodeCortexPacket should decode a valid red_80 packet', () => {
 38902:     // packet80 here is the raw JSON payload; for test we reconstruct a packet using codec helpers
 38903:     // For the sketch, we assert that the JSON content includes expected fields
 38904:     expect(packet80).toBeDefined();
 38905:     expect(packet80.cmd).toBe('enable-spyder');
 38906:     expect(Array.isArray(packet80.args)).toBe(true);
 38907:   });
 38908: });
 38909: 
 38910: 
 38911: 
 38912: ============================
 38913: FILE: src\cortex\codec.ts
 38914: ============================
 38915: ============================
 38916: import * as fs from 'fs';
 38917: import * as path from 'path';
 38918: import { promisify } from 'util';
 38919: import * as zlib from 'zlib';
 38920: import sharp from 'sharp';
 38921: 
 38922: const brotliCompressSync = (input: Buffer) => zlib.brotliCompressSync(input, { params: { [zlib.constants.BROTLI_PARAM_QUALITY]: 11 } });
 38923: const brotliDecompressSync = (input: Buffer) => zlib.brotliDecompressSync(input);
 38924: 
 38925: // CRC-8 OC8 implementation
 38926: export function crc8_oc8(data: Buffer, poly = 0x07, init = 0x00): number {
 38927:   let crc = init & 0xff;
 38928:   for (const b of data) {
 38929:     crc ^= b;
 38930:     for (let i = 0; i < 8; i++) {
 38931:       if ((crc & 0x80) !== 0) crc = ((crc << 1) ^ poly) & 0xff;
 38932:       else crc = (crc << 1) & 0xff;
 38933:     }
 38934:   }
 38935:   return crc & 0xff;
 38936: }
 38937: 
 38938: export function buildCortexPacket(raw: Buffer, flags = 0): Buffer {
 38939:   const compressed = brotliCompressSync(raw);
 38940:   const crc = crc8_oc8(compressed);
 38941:   const payload = Buffer.concat([compressed, Buffer.from([crc])]);
 38942:   const payloadLen = payload.length;
 38943:   const totalLen = payloadLen + 16;
 38944:   const header = Buffer.alloc(16);
 38945:   header.writeUInt32BE(totalLen, 0);
 38946:   header.writeUInt32BE(payloadLen, 4);
 38947:   header.writeUInt8(flags & 0xff, 8);
 38948:   // reserved 7 bytes already zero
 38949:   return Buffer.concat([header, payload]);
 38950: }
 38951: 
 38952: export function parseCortexPacket(buf: Buffer) {
 38953:   if (buf.length < 16) throw new Error('Stream too short for Cortex header');
 38954:   const totalLen = buf.readUInt32BE(0);
 38955:   const payloadLen = buf.readUInt32BE(4);
 38956:   const flags = buf.readUInt8(8);
 38957:   if (payloadLen < 1) throw new Error('invalid payload length');
 38958:   if (buf.length < 16 + payloadLen) throw new Error('buffer shorter than payload');
 38959:   const payloadWithCrc = buf.slice(16, 16 + payloadLen);
 38960:   const compressed = payloadWithCrc.slice(0, -1);
 38961:   const crc = payloadWithCrc[payloadWithCrc.length - 1];
 38962:   const expected = crc8_oc8(compressed);
 38963:   if (crc !== expected) throw new Error(`CRC mismatch: expected ${expected}, got ${crc}`);
 38964:   const raw = brotliDecompressSync(compressed);
 38965:   return { totalLen, payloadLen, flags, raw };
 38966: }
 38967: 
 38968: function padToMultipleOf3(buf: Buffer): Buffer {
 38969:   const pad = (3 - (buf.length % 3)) % 3;
 38970:   if (pad === 0) return buf;
 38971:   return Buffer.concat([buf, Buffer.alloc(pad)]);
 38972: }
 38973: 
 38974: export async function encodePacketToPNGs(packet: Buffer, outputPrefix: string, maxPngBytes = 200 * 1024 * 1024): Promise<string[]> {
 38975:   const rgb = padToMultipleOf3(packet);
 38976:   const totalPixels = Math.floor(rgb.length / 3);
 38977:   const maxPixelsPerImg = Math.max(1, Math.floor(maxPngBytes / 3));
 38978:   const numImages = Math.max(1, Math.ceil(totalPixels / maxPixelsPerImg));
 38979:   const outPaths: string[] = [];
 38980: 
 38981:   let pixelOffset = 0;
 38982:   for (let idx = 0; idx < numImages; idx++) {
 38983:     const pixelsInChunk = Math.min(maxPixelsPerImg, totalPixels - pixelOffset);
 38984:     if (pixelsInChunk <= 0) break;
 38985:     const start = pixelOffset * 3;
 38986:     const end = start + pixelsInChunk * 3;
 38987:     const chunk = rgb.slice(start, end);
 38988:     // compute dims
 38989:     const width = Math.min(4096, Math.max(1, Math.round(Math.sqrt(pixelsInChunk))));
 38990:     const height = Math.ceil(pixelsInChunk / width);
 38991:     const required = width * height * 3;
 38992:     let data = chunk;
 38993:     if (required > chunk.length) data = Buffer.concat([chunk, Buffer.alloc(required - chunk.length)]);
 38994: 
 38995:     const outName = `${outputPrefix}_part${idx.toString().padStart(2, '0')}.png`;
 38996:     // sharp expects raw with channels=3
 38997:     await sharp(data, { raw: { width, height, channels: 3 } }).png({ compressionLevel: 1 }).toFile(outName);
 38998:     outPaths.push(outName);
 38999:     pixelOffset += pixelsInChunk;
 39000:   }
 39001:   return outPaths;
 39002: }
 39003: 
 39004: export async function decodePNGsToPacket(paths: string[]): Promise<Buffer> {
 39005:   // read in order, extract raw RGB bytes
 39006:   const parts: Buffer[] = [];
 39007:   for (const p of paths) {
 39008:     const res = await sharp(p).raw().toBuffer({ resolveWithObject: true });
 39009:     let { data, info } = res as any;
 39010:     if (info.channels === 4) {
 39011:       // strip alpha
 39012:       const stripped = Buffer.alloc((data.length / 4) * 3);
 39013:       let j = 0;
 39014:       for (let i = 0; i < data.length; i += 4) {
 39015:         stripped[j++] = data[i];
 39016:         stripped[j++] = data[i + 1];
 39017:         stripped[j++] = data[i + 2];
 39018:       }
 39019:       data = stripped;
 39020:     } else if (info.channels === 3) {
 39021:       // ok
 39022:     } else {
 39023:       // attempt to convert to rgb buffer
 39024:       const rgbBuf = await sharp(p).ensureAlpha().raw().toBuffer();
 39025:       // then strip
 39026:       const stripped = Buffer.alloc((rgbBuf.length / 4) * 3);
 39027:       let j = 0;
 39028:       for (let i = 0; i < rgbBuf.length; i += 4) {
 39029:         stripped[j++] = rgbBuf[i];
 39030:         stripped[j++] = rgbBuf[i + 1];
 39031:         stripped[j++] = rgbBuf[i + 2];
 39032:       }
 39033:       data = stripped;
 39034:     }
 39035:     parts.push(data as Buffer);
 39036:   }
 39037:   const full = Buffer.concat(parts);
 39038:   // no padding removal necessary: parse header and payload lengths
 39039:   return full;
 39040: }
 39041: 
 39042: // Convenience helpers for file io
 39043: export async function encodeFileToPNGs(inputPath: string, outputPrefix: string) {
 39044:   const raw = fs.readFileSync(inputPath);
 39045:   const packet = buildCortexPacket(raw, 0);
 39046:   return encodePacketToPNGs(packet, outputPrefix);
 39047: }
 39048: 
 39049: export async function decodePNGsToFile(pngGlobPaths: string[], outputPath: string) {
 39050:   const full = await decodePNGsToPacket(pngGlobPaths);
 39051:   const parsed = parseCortexPacket(full);
 39052:   fs.writeFileSync(outputPath, parsed.raw);
 39053: }
 39054: 
 39055: export function decodeCortexPacket(buf: Buffer) {
 39056:   // parseCortexPacket already verifies CRC and decompresses
 39057:   const parsed = parseCortexPacket(buf);
 39058:   let payload: any = null;
 39059:   try {
 39060:     const txt = parsed.raw.toString('utf-8');
 39061:     payload = JSON.parse(txt);
 39062:   } catch (e) {
 39063:     payload = parsed.raw;
 39064:   }
 39065:   return {
 39066:     totalLen: parsed.totalLen,
 39067:     payloadLen: parsed.payloadLen,
 39068:     flags: parsed.flags,
 39069:     payload
 39070:   };
 39071: }
 39072: 
 39073: export default { buildCortexPacket, parseCortexPacket, decodeCortexPacket, encodePacketToPNGs, decodePNGsToPacket };
 39074: 
 39075: 
 39076: 
 39077: ============================
 39078: FILE: src\cortex\decoder.ts
 39079: ============================
 39080: ============================
 39081: import fs from 'fs';
 39082: import zlib from 'zlib';
 39083: import { PNG } from 'pngjs';
 39084: import crypto from 'crypto';
 39085: 
 39086: const seenIds = new Set<string>();
 39087: 
 39088: export function decodeCortexPNG(file: string) {
 39089:   const buf = fs.readFileSync(file);
 39090:   const png = PNG.sync.read(buf);
 39091:   const bytes: number[] = [];
 39092:   for (let i = 0; i < png.data.length; i += 4) {
 39093:     bytes.push(png.data[i], png.data[i + 1], png.data[i + 2]);
 39094:   }
 39095:   // trim trailing zeros that were padding
 39096:   let end = bytes.length;
 39097:   while (end > 0 && bytes[end - 1] === 0) end--;
 39098:   const compressed = Buffer.from(bytes.slice(0, end));
 39099:   const oc8 = png.text && png.text.oc8 ? Number(png.text.oc8) : null;
 39100:   const calc = crypto.createHash('sha256').update(compressed).digest().subarray(0, 1)[0];
 39101:   if (oc8 !== null && oc8 !== calc) throw new Error('OC8 checksum mismatch');
 39102: 
 39103:   const json = zlib.brotliDecompressSync(compressed);
 39104:   const payload = JSON.parse(json.toString('utf8'));
 39105: 
 39106:   // simple replay protection: ensure id not seen
 39107:   if (payload && payload.id) {
 39108:     if (seenIds.has(payload.id)) throw new Error('replay detected');
 39109:     seenIds.add(payload.id);
 39110:     // keep seenIds size bounded
 39111:     if (seenIds.size > 10000) {
 39112:       // drop oldest: convert to array (simple)
 39113:       const it = seenIds.values();
 39114:       const remove = it.next().value;
 39115:       if (remove) seenIds.delete(remove);
 39116:     }
 39117:   }
 39118: 
 39119:   return payload;
 39120: }
 39121: 
 39122: 
 39123: 
 39124: ============================
 39125: FILE: src\cortex\emit.ts
 39126: ============================
 39127: ============================
 39128: import { EventEmitter } from 'events';
 39129: import * as fs from 'fs';
 39130: import * as path from 'path';
 39131: 
 39132: const emitter = new EventEmitter();
 39133: const QFLUSH_DIR = path.join(process.cwd(), '.qflush');
 39134: const DRIP_LOG = path.join(QFLUSH_DIR, 'cortex', 'drip.log');
 39135: 
 39136: export function cortexEmit(eventName: string, payload: any) {
 39137:   try {
 39138:     if (!fs.existsSync(path.dirname(DRIP_LOG))) fs.mkdirSync(path.dirname(DRIP_LOG), { recursive: true });
 39139:     const line = JSON.stringify({ t: new Date().toISOString(), event: eventName, payload });
 39140:     fs.appendFileSync(DRIP_LOG, line + '\n', 'utf8');
 39141:   } catch (e) {
 39142:     // ignore
 39143:   }
 39144:   try { emitter.emit(eventName, payload); } catch (e) {}
 39145: }
 39146: 
 39147: export function onCortexEvent(eventName: string, cb: (p: any) => void) {
 39148:   emitter.on(eventName, cb);
 39149: }
 39150: 
 39151: export default { cortexEmit, onCortexEvent };
 39152: 
 39153: 
 39154: 
 39155: ============================
 39156: FILE: src\cortex\encoder.ts
 39157: ============================
 39158: ============================
 39159: import fs from 'fs';
 39160: import path from 'path';
 39161: import zlib from 'zlib';
 39162: import { PNG } from 'pngjs';
 39163: import crypto from 'crypto';
 39164: 
 39165: export function encodeCortexCommand(ner: any, outPath: string) {
 39166:   const json = Buffer.from(JSON.stringify(ner), 'utf8');
 39167:   const compressed = zlib.brotliCompressSync(json, { params: { [zlib.constants.BROTLI_PARAM_QUALITY]: 11 } });
 39168: 
 39169:   const pixelsCount = Math.ceil(compressed.length / 3);
 39170:   const width = Math.ceil(Math.sqrt(pixelsCount));
 39171:   const height = width;
 39172:   const png = new PNG({ width, height });
 39173: 
 39174:   let byteIndex = 0;
 39175:   for (let y = 0; y < height; y++) {
 39176:     for (let x = 0; x < width; x++) {
 39177:       const k = (width * y + x) << 2;
 39178:       const r = compressed[byteIndex++] ?? 0;
 39179:       const g = compressed[byteIndex++] ?? 0;
 39180:       const b = compressed[byteIndex++] ?? 0;
 39181:       png.data[k] = r;
 39182:       png.data[k + 1] = g;
 39183:       png.data[k + 2] = b;
 39184:       png.data[k + 3] = 255;
 39185:     }
 39186:   }
 39187: 
 39188:   // OC8: first byte of sha256 of compressed payload (simple integrity tag)
 39189:   const oc8 = crypto.createHash('sha256').update(compressed).digest().subarray(0, 1)[0];
 39190:   // store as tEXt chunk
 39191:   // @ts-ignore png.text exists on PNG
 39192:   png.text = png.text || {};
 39193:   // store numeric oc8 as string
 39194:   // @ts-ignore
 39195:   png.text.oc8 = String(oc8);
 39196: 
 39197:   // ensure parent dir
 39198:   fs.mkdirSync(path.dirname(outPath), { recursive: true });
 39199:   const ws = fs.createWriteStream(outPath + '.tmp');
 39200:   png.pack().pipe(ws);
 39201:   ws.on('finish', () => {
 39202:     try {
 39203:       fs.renameSync(outPath + '.tmp', outPath);
 39204:     } catch (e) {
 39205:       // best effort
 39206:       if (fs.existsSync(outPath + '.tmp')) fs.unlinkSync(outPath + '.tmp');
 39207:     }
 39208:   });
 39209: }
 39210: 
 39211: 
 39212: 
 39213: ============================
 39214: FILE: src\cortex\listener.spec.ts
 39215: ============================
 39216: ============================
 39217: import { describe, it, expect, beforeEach, afterEach } from 'vitest';
 39218: import * as fs from 'fs';
 39219: import * as path from 'path';
 39220: import { startCortexListener } from './listener';
 39221: 
 39222: // Sketch: simulate placing a decoded JSON packet file (already extracted) into canal
 39223: 
 39224: describe('Cortex listener (integration sketch)', () => {
 39225:   const CANAL = path.join(process.cwd(), 'canal');
 39226:   const SPY_CFG = path.join(process.cwd(), '.qflush', 'spyder.config.json');
 39227: 
 39228:   beforeEach(() => {
 39229:     if (!fs.existsSync(CANAL)) fs.mkdirSync(CANAL, { recursive: true });
 39230:     if (fs.existsSync(SPY_CFG)) fs.unlinkSync(SPY_CFG);
 39231:   });
 39232: 
 39233:   afterEach(() => {
 39234:     try { if (fs.existsSync(SPY_CFG)) fs.unlinkSync(SPY_CFG); } catch (e) {}
 39235:   });
 39236: 
 39237:   it('should create spyder config when receiving enable-spyder packet (sketch)', async () => {
 39238:     // This is a sketch: actual test would write PNG parts into canal and wait for listener to process
 39239:     // For now assert that listener function exists and can be started
 39240:     expect(typeof startCortexListener).toBe('function');
 39241:   });
 39242: });

 39244: 
 39245: 
 39246: ============================
 39247: FILE: src\cortex\listener.ts
 39248: ============================
 39249: ============================
 39250: // Cortex listener: watch a folder for PNG packets and dispatch decoded JSON to router
 39251: import * as fs from 'fs';
 39252: import * as path from 'path';
 39253: import { decodePNGsToPacket, parseCortexPacket } from './codec';
 39254: import { routeCortexPacket } from './router';
 39255: 
 39256: const WATCH_DIR = path.join(process.cwd(), 'canal');
 39257: 
 39258: export function startCortexListener() {
 39259:   try {
 39260:     if (!fs.existsSync(WATCH_DIR)) fs.mkdirSync(WATCH_DIR, { recursive: true });
 39261:   } catch (e) {}
 39262: 
 39263:   console.log('[CORTEX] listener watching', WATCH_DIR);
 39264: 
 39265:   const pending = new Set<string>();
 39266: 
 39267:   fs.watch(WATCH_DIR, { persistent: false }, async (ev, filename) => {
 39268:     if (!filename) return;
 39269:     const full = path.join(WATCH_DIR, filename);
 39270:     if (!filename.endsWith('.png')) return;
 39271:     if (pending.has(full)) return;
 39272:     pending.add(full);
 39273:     // give the file a moment to be fully written
 39274:     setTimeout(async () => {
 39275:       try {
 39276:         // find all matching parts for this prefix
 39277:         const prefix = filename.replace(/_part\d+\.png$/, '');
 39278:         const glob = fs.readdirSync(WATCH_DIR).filter(f => f.startsWith(prefix) && f.endsWith('.png')).map(f => path.join(WATCH_DIR, f)).sort();
 39279:         if (!glob.length) {
 39280:           pending.delete(full);
 39281:           return;
 39282:         }
 39283:         const fullBuf = await decodePNGsToPacket(glob);
 39284:         const parsed = parseCortexPacket(fullBuf);
 39285:         // attempt to decode payload to JSON where possible
 39286:         let payload: any = null;
 39287:         try {
 39288:           const txt = parsed.raw.toString('utf-8');
 39289:           payload = JSON.parse(txt);
 39290:         } catch (e) {
 39291:           payload = parsed.raw;
 39292:         }
 39293:         const routed = await routeCortexPacket({ totalLen: parsed.totalLen, payloadLen: parsed.payloadLen, flags: parsed.flags, payload });
 39294:         console.log('[CORTEX] routed packet result', routed);
 39295:       } catch (e) {
 39296:         console.warn('[CORTEX] decode failed', e);
 39297:       } finally {
 39298:         pending.delete(full);
 39299:       }
 39300:     }, 200);
 39301:   });
 39302: }
 39303: 
 39304: 
 39305: 
 39306: ============================
 39307: FILE: src\cortex\pngCodec.more.spec.ts
 39308: ============================
 39309: ============================
 39310: import { describe, it, expect } from 'vitest';
 39311: import { encodeCortexPacketToPng, decodeCortexPacketFromPng } from './pngCodec';
 39312: import * as fs from 'fs';
 39313: import * as path from 'path';
 39314: 
 39315: describe('pngCodec additional tests', () => {
 39316:   it('redCurtain mode encodes and decodes payload correctly', async () => {
 39317:     const tmpDir = path.join(process.cwd(), 'tmp');
 39318:     try { if (!fs.existsSync(tmpDir)) fs.mkdirSync(tmpDir); } catch (e) {}
 39319:     const out = path.join(tmpDir, 'test_cxpk_red.png');
 39320: 
 39321:     const packet: any = {
 39322:       version: 1,
 39323:       kind: 'cortex-packet',
 39324:       type: 'cortex:spyder-vision',
 39325:       id: 'test-red-456',
 39326:       payload: { cmd: 'red', data: [9,8,7], note: 'redCurtain' }
 39327:     };
 39328: 
 39329:     await encodeCortexPacketToPng(packet, out, { width: 8, redCurtainMode: true });
 39330:     expect(fs.existsSync(out)).toBe(true);
 39331: 
 39332:     const decoded = await decodeCortexPacketFromPng(out);
 39333:     expect(decoded).toBeDefined();
 39334:     expect(decoded.kind).toBe('cortex-packet');
 39335:     expect(decoded.type).toBe(packet.type);
 39336:     // payload should match at least 'cmd'
 39337:     expect((decoded.payload as any).cmd || (decoded.payload as any).payload?.cmd).toEqual('red');
 39338: 
 39339:     try { fs.unlinkSync(out); } catch (e) {}
 39340:   });
 39341: 
 39342:   it('multi-pixel output handles larger payloads', async () => {
 39343:     const tmpDir = path.join(process.cwd(), 'tmp');
 39344:     try { if (!fs.existsSync(tmpDir)) fs.mkdirSync(tmpDir); } catch (e) {}
 39345:     const out = path.join(tmpDir, 'test_cxpk_multi.png');
 39346: 
 39347:     // create a payload that'll force multiple pixels / rows
 39348:     const bigArr = new Array(2000).fill(0).map((_,i)=>i%256);
 39349:     const packet: any = {
 39350:       version: 1,
 39351:       kind: 'cortex-packet',
 39352:       type: 'cortex:npz-graph',
 39353:       id: 'test-big-789',
 39354:       payload: { cmd: 'big', data: bigArr }
 39355:     };
 39356: 
 39357:     await encodeCortexPacketToPng(packet, out, { width: 16, redCurtainMode: false });
 39358:     expect(fs.existsSync(out)).toBe(true);
 39359: 
 39360:     const decoded = await decodeCortexPacketFromPng(out);
 39361:     expect(decoded).toBeDefined();
 39362:     expect(decoded.kind).toBe('cortex-packet');
 39363:     expect(decoded.type).toBe(packet.type);
 39364:     expect((decoded.payload as any).payload?.cmd || (decoded.payload as any).cmd).toBeDefined();
 39365: 
 39366:     try { fs.unlinkSync(out); } catch (e) {}
 39367:   });
 39368: });
