 39372: ============================
 39373: FILE: src\cortex\pngCodec.spec.ts
 39374: ============================
 39375: ============================
 39376: import { describe, it, expect } from 'vitest';
 39377: import { encodeCortexPacketToPng, decodeCortexPacketFromPng } from './pngCodec';
 39378: import * as fs from 'fs';
 39379: import * as path from 'path';
 39380: 
 39381: describe('pngCodec roundtrip', () => {
 39382:   it('encodes and decodes a CortexPacket via PNG CXPK', async () => {
 39383:     const tmpDir = path.join(process.cwd(), 'tmp');
 39384:     try { if (!fs.existsSync(tmpDir)) fs.mkdirSync(tmpDir); } catch (e) {}
 39385:     const out = path.join(tmpDir, 'test_cxpk.png');
 39386: 
 39387:     const packet: any = {
 39388:       version: 1,
 39389:       kind: 'cortex-packet',
 39390:       type: 'cortex:spyder-vision',
 39391:       id: 'test-123',
 39392:       payload: { cmd: 'test', data: [1,2,3], note: 'roundtrip' }
 39393:     };
 39394: 
 39395:     await encodeCortexPacketToPng(packet, out, { width: 16, redCurtainMode: false });
 39396:     expect(fs.existsSync(out)).toBe(true);
 39397: 
 39398:     const decoded = await decodeCortexPacketFromPng(out);
 39399:     expect(decoded).toBeDefined();
 39400:     expect(decoded.kind).toBe('cortex-packet');
 39401:     expect(decoded.type).toBe(packet.type);
 39402:     expect(decoded.payload).toBeDefined();
 39403:     expect((decoded.payload as any).payload?.cmd ?? (decoded.payload as any).cmd ?? (decoded.payload as any).payload).toBeDefined();
 39404: 
 39405:     // cleanup
 39406:     try { fs.unlinkSync(out); } catch (e) {}
 39407:   });
 39408: });
 39409: 
 39410: 
 39411: 
 39412: ============================
 39413: FILE: src\cortex\pngCodec.ts
 39414: ============================
 39415: ============================
 39416: import { CortexPacket } from './types';
 39417: import { PNG } from 'pngjs';
 39418: import * as fs from 'fs';
 39419: import * as zlib from 'zlib';
 39420: 
 39421: const MAGIC = Buffer.from('CXPK');
 39422: const HEADER_SIZE = 12; // 4 + 1 +3 +4
 39423: 
 39424: export interface EncodePngOptions {
 39425:   width?: number;
 39426:   redCurtainMode?: boolean;
 39427: }
 39428: 
 39429: export function encodeCortexPacketToPng(
 39430:   packet: CortexPacket,
 39431:   outputPath: string,
 39432:   options: EncodePngOptions = {}
 39433: ): Promise<void> {
 39434:   return new Promise((resolve, reject) => {
 39435:     try {
 39436:       const json = JSON.stringify(packet);
 39437:       const payload = zlib.brotliCompressSync(Buffer.from(json, 'utf8'));
 39438: 
 39439:       const header = Buffer.alloc(HEADER_SIZE);
 39440:       MAGIC.copy(header, 0); // 0..3
 39441:       header.writeUInt8(1, 4); // version
 39442:       header.writeUInt8(0, 5);
 39443:       header.writeUInt8(0, 6);
 39444:       header.writeUInt8(0, 7);
 39445:       header.writeUInt32BE(payload.length, 8);
 39446: 
 39447:       const rawData = Buffer.concat([header, payload]);
 39448: 
 39449:       const redCurtainMode = options.redCurtainMode ?? false;
 39450:       const bytesPerPixel = redCurtainMode ? 1 : 4;
 39451: 
 39452:       const totalPixels = Math.ceil(rawData.length / bytesPerPixel);
 39453:       const width = options.width ?? 8;
 39454:       const height = Math.ceil(totalPixels / width);
 39455: 
 39456:       const png = new PNG({ width, height });
 39457:       const data = png.data;
 39458: 
 39459:       for (let i = 0; i < totalPixels; i++) {
 39460:         const pxIndex = i * 4;
 39461:         const byteIndex = i * bytesPerPixel;
 39462:         if (redCurtainMode) {
 39463:           const value = rawData[byteIndex] ?? 0;
 39464:           data[pxIndex] = value;
 39465:           data[pxIndex + 1] = 0;
 39466:           data[pxIndex + 2] = 0;
 39467:           data[pxIndex + 3] = 255;
 39468:         } else {
 39469:           data[pxIndex] = rawData[byteIndex] ?? 0;
 39470:           data[pxIndex + 1] = rawData[byteIndex + 1] ?? 0;
 39471:           data[pxIndex + 2] = rawData[byteIndex + 2] ?? 0;
 39472:           data[pxIndex + 3] = rawData[byteIndex + 3] ?? 0;
 39473:         }
 39474:       }
 39475: 
 39476:       // padding
 39477:       for (let i = totalPixels * 4; i < data.length; i++) data[i] = data[i] || 0;
 39478: 
 39479:       const ws = fs.createWriteStream(outputPath);
 39480:       png.pack().pipe(ws);
 39481:       ws.on('finish', () => resolve());
 39482:       ws.on('error', reject);
 39483:     } catch (e) {
 39484:       reject(e);
 39485:     }
 39486:   });
 39487: }
 39488: 
 39489: export function decodeCortexPacketFromPng(inputPath: string): Promise<CortexPacket> {
 39490:   return new Promise((resolve, reject) => {
 39491:     try {
 39492:       const rs = fs.createReadStream(inputPath);
 39493:       // pngjs types may not match stream typings in TS env; cast to any for pipe
 39494:       rs.pipe(new (PNG as any)())
 39495:         .on('parsed', function (this: PNG) {
 39496:           try {
 39497:             const data = this.data; // RGBA
 39498:             // attempt red-curtain detection: many pixels with G=B=0 and A=255
 39499:             let redCurtain = true;
 39500:             for (let i = 0; i < data.length; i += 4) {
 39501:               if (!(data[i + 1] === 0 && data[i + 2] === 0 && data[i + 3] === 255)) { redCurtain = false; break; }
 39502:             }
 39503: 
 39504:             let rawData: Buffer;
 39505:             if (redCurtain) {
 39506:               const bytes = data.length / 4;
 39507:               rawData = Buffer.alloc(bytes);
 39508:               for (let i = 0; i < bytes; i++) rawData[i] = data[i * 4];
 39509:             } else {
 39510:               // take raw RGBA stream
 39511:               rawData = Buffer.from(data);
 39512:             }
 39513: 
 39514:             const magic = rawData.subarray(0, 4);
 39515:             if (!magic.equals(MAGIC)) return reject(new Error('Invalid CORTEX PNG, bad MAGIC'));
 39516:             const version = rawData.readUInt8(4);
 39517:             const length = rawData.readUInt32BE(8);
 39518:             const headerSize = HEADER_SIZE;
 39519:             const payloadBytes = rawData.subarray(headerSize, headerSize + length);
 39520:             const decompressed = zlib.brotliDecompressSync(payloadBytes);
 39521:             const jsonString = decompressed.toString('utf8');
 39522:             const packet = JSON.parse(jsonString) as CortexPacket;
 39523:             if (packet.kind !== 'cortex-packet') return reject(new Error('Invalid cortex packet kind'));
 39524:             resolve(packet);
 39525:           } catch (e) {
 39526:             reject(e);
 39527:           }
 39528:         })
 39529:         .on('error', reject);
 39530:     } catch (e) {
 39531:       reject(e);
 39532:     }
 39533:   });
 39534: }
 39535: 
 39536: 
 39537: 
 39538: ============================
 39539: FILE: src\cortex\resonnance.ts
 39540: ============================
 39541: ============================
 39542: // src/cortex/resonnance.ts
 39543: import { startCortexListener } from './listener';
 39544: 
 39545: export async function resonnance() {
 39546:   // Tu peux logger un petit rituel SPYDER ici 😈
 39547:   console.log('[CORTEX] Résonnance SPYDER activée…');
 39548:   console.log('[CORTEX] En attente de paquets (enable-spyder, cortex-packet, etc.)');
 39549: 
 39550:   await startCortexListener();
 39551: }
 39552: 
 39553: 
 39554: 
 39555: ============================
 39556: FILE: src\cortex\router.docs.md
 39557: ============================
 39558: ============================
 39559: Router behavior
 39560: ================
 39561: 
 39562: - Router consults `.qflush/cortex.routes.json` using `routesConfig` helper.
 39563: - When `payload.candidates` present, `pickBestRoute(candidates)` picks route by score and enabled flag.
 39564: - Handlers for idea names either call apply handlers (NPZ-GRAPH, SAVE-STATE, AUTO-PATCH) or emit events (CORTEX-DRIP, SPYDER-SOUND).
 39565: 
 39566: Routes
 39567: ------
 39568: - CORTEX-DRIP -> emit
 39569: - NPZ-GRAPH -> executeAction('npz.encode')
 39570: - OC8-LANG -> placeholder
 39571: - QUANTUM-ROUTER -> uses routesConfig
 39572: - SPYDER-SOUND -> emit
 39573: - SAVE-STATE -> apply
 39574: - AUTO-PATCH -> apply
 39575: - SPYDER-VISION -> vision pipeline
 39576: - A11-KEY -> CLI a11-key handler
 39577: - FUNESTERIE-MAGIE -> emit
 39578: 
 39579: 
 39580: 
 39581: 
 39582: ============================
 39583: FILE: src\cortex\router.spec.ts
 39584: ============================
 39585: ============================
 39586: import { describe, it, expect, vi, beforeEach } from 'vitest';
 39587: import * as router from './router';
 39588: import * as emit from './emit';
 39589: 
 39590: describe('Cortex router', () => {
 39591:   beforeEach(() => {
 39592:     try { vi.restoreAllMocks(); } catch (e) {}
 39593:   });
 39594: 
 39595:   it('routes NPZ-GRAPH to npz handler (noop stub)', async () => {
 39596:     const pkt: any = { totalLen: 0, payloadLen: 0, flags: 0, payload: { cmd: 'NPZ-GRAPH', path: '.' }, type: 'cortex:npz-graph' };
 39597:     const res = await router.routeCortexPacket(pkt);
 39598:     expect(res).toBeUndefined();
 39599:   });
 39600: 
 39601:   it('emits CORTEX-DRIP events (noop stub)', async () => {
 39602:     const spy = vi.spyOn(emit, 'cortexEmit').mockImplementation(() => {});
 39603:     const pkt: any = { totalLen: 0, payloadLen: 0, flags: 0, payload: { cmd: 'CORTEX-DRIP', data: 1 }, type: 'cortex:drip' };
 39604:     const res = await router.routeCortexPacket(pkt);
 39605:     expect(res).toBeUndefined();
 39606:     expect(spy).not.toHaveBeenCalled();
 39607:   });
 39608: });
 39609: 
 39610: 
 39611: 
 39612: ============================
 39613: FILE: src\cortex\router.ts
 39614: ============================
 39615: ============================
 39616: // src/cortex/router.ts
 39617: import type { CortexPacket } from "./types";
 39618: import alias from '../utils/alias';
 39619: 
 39620: export type CortexRouteHandler = (packet: CortexPacket) => Promise<any> | any;
 39621: 
 39622: const noopHandler: CortexRouteHandler = async () => { return; };
 39623: 
 39624: function resolveImport(name: string) {
 39625:   try {
 39626:     const g: any = (globalThis as any) || (global as any);
 39627:     if (g && typeof g.__importUtilMock === 'function') return g.__importUtilMock(name);
 39628:   } catch (e) {}
 39629:   try { return alias.importUtil(name); } catch (e) {}
 39630:   try {
 39631:     // try require
 39632:     return require(name);
 39633:   } catch (e) {}
 39634:   return undefined;
 39635: }
 39636: 
 39637: // helper wrappers that resolve modules at call time (so tests can mock resolveImport via global)
 39638: async function safeExecuteAction(action: string, ctx: any = {}) {
 39639:   try {
 39640:     const executorMod: any = resolveImport('../rome/executor') || resolveImport('@rome/executor') || resolveImport('src/rome/executor') || resolveImport('../rome/executor');
 39641:     if (!executorMod) return { success: false, error: 'executor_unavailable' };
 39642:     const fn = executorMod.executeAction || (executorMod.default && executorMod.default.executeAction) || executorMod;
 39643:     if (typeof fn !== 'function') return { success: false, error: 'executeAction_unavailable' };
 39644:     return await fn(action, ctx);
 39645:   } catch (e) {
 39646:     return { success: false, error: String(e) };
 39647:   }
 39648: }
 39649: 
 39650: async function safeRunSpyder(argv: string[] = []) {
 39651:   try {
 39652:     const runSpyderMod: any = resolveImport('../commands/spyder') || resolveImport('@commands/spyder') || resolveImport('src/commands/spyder');
 39653:     if (!runSpyderMod) return { code: null, error: 'spyder_unavailable' };
 39654:     const fn = runSpyderMod.default || runSpyderMod;
 39655:     if (typeof fn !== 'function') return { code: null, error: 'spyder_run_unavailable' };
 39656:     return await fn(argv);
 39657:   } catch (e) {
 39658:     return { code: null, error: String(e) };
 39659:   }
 39660: }
 39661: 
 39662: function safeEmit(eventName: string, payload: any) {
 39663:   try {
 39664:     const emitMod: any = resolveImport('./emit') || resolveImport('@cortex/emit') || resolveImport('src/cortex/emit');
 39665:     if (!emitMod) return false;
 39666:     const fn = emitMod.cortexEmit || (emitMod.default && emitMod.default.cortexEmit) || emitMod;
 39667:     if (typeof fn !== 'function') return false;
 39668:     fn(eventName, payload);
 39669:     return true;
 39670:   } catch (e) {
 39671:     return false;
 39672:   }
 39673: }
 39674: 
 39675: async function safeProcessVision(p: any) {
 39676:   try {
 39677:     const visionMod: any = resolveImport('./vision') || resolveImport('@cortex/vision') || resolveImport('src/cortex/vision');
 39678:     if (!visionMod) return { ok: false, error: 'vision_unavailable' };
 39679:     const fn = visionMod.processVisionImage || (visionMod.default && visionMod.default.processVisionImage);
 39680:     if (typeof fn !== 'function') return { ok: false, error: 'vision_fn_unavailable' };
 39681:     return await fn(p && p.path ? p.path : (p && p.pngPath ? p.pngPath : p));
 39682:   } catch (e) {
 39683:     return { ok: false, error: String(e) };
 39684:   }
 39685: }
 39686: 
 39687: async function safeApplyPacket(pkt: any) {
 39688:   try {
 39689:     const applyMod: any = resolveImport('./applyPacket') || resolveImport('@cortex/applyPacket') || resolveImport('src/cortex/applyPacket');
 39690:     if (!applyMod) return { ok: false, error: 'apply_unavailable' };
 39691:     const fn = applyMod.applyCortexPacket || (applyMod.default && applyMod.default.applyCortexPacket) || (applyMod.default && applyMod.default.default) || applyMod.default || applyMod;
 39692:     if (typeof fn !== 'function') return { ok: false, error: 'apply_fn_unavailable' };
 39693:     return await fn(pkt);
 39694:   } catch (e) {
 39695:     return { ok: false, error: String(e) };
 39696:   }
 39697: }
 39698: 
 39699: // Handlers
 39700: const handlers: Record<string, CortexRouteHandler> = {
 39701:   'cortex:npz-graph': async (pkt) => {
 39702:     const filePath = pkt.payload && pkt.payload.path ? pkt.payload.path : 'unknown';
 39703:     const res = await safeExecuteAction('npz.encode', { path: filePath });
 39704:     return res;
 39705:   },
 39706:   'npz-graph': async (pkt) => {
 39707:     const filePath = pkt.payload && pkt.payload.path ? pkt.payload.path : 'unknown';
 39708:     const res = await safeExecuteAction('npz.encode', { path: filePath });
 39709:     return res;
 39710:   },
 39711:   'cortex:drip': async (pkt) => {
 39712:     const ok = safeEmit('CORTEX-DRIP', pkt.payload);
 39713:     return { ok };
 39714:   },
 39715:   'cortex:enable-spyder': async (pkt) => {
 39716:     try {
 39717:       const cfg = pkt.payload || {};
 39718:       const args = Array.isArray(cfg.args) && cfg.args.length ? cfg.args : ['start'];
 39719:       const res = await safeRunSpyder(args);
 39720:       return { ok: true, res };
 39721:     } catch (e) {
 39722:       return { ok: false, error: String(e) };
 39723:     }
 39724:   },
 39725:   'cortex:spyder-vision': async (pkt) => {
 39726:     return await safeProcessVision(pkt.payload);
 39727:   },
 39728:   'spyder-vision': async (pkt) => {
 39729:     return await safeProcessVision(pkt.payload);
 39730:   },
 39731:   'vision': async (pkt) => {
 39732:     return await safeProcessVision(pkt.payload);
 39733:   },
 39734:   // apply-related handlers
 39735:   'cortex:apply': async (pkt) => {
 39736:     return await safeApplyPacket(pkt);
 39737:   },
 39738:   'qflush:apply': async (pkt) => {
 39739:     return await safeApplyPacket(pkt);
 39740:   },
 39741:   // save state and auto-patch forward to apply logic
 39742:   'cortex:save-state': async (pkt) => { return await safeApplyPacket(pkt); },
 39743:   'save-state': async (pkt) => { return await safeApplyPacket(pkt); },
 39744:   'save:state': async (pkt) => { return await safeApplyPacket(pkt); },
 39745:   'auto-patch': async (pkt) => { return await safeApplyPacket(pkt); },
 39746:   'auto_patch': async (pkt) => { return await safeApplyPacket(pkt); },
 39747:   'auto-patch:apply': async (pkt) => { return await safeApplyPacket(pkt); },
 39748:   'auto_patch:apply': async (pkt) => { return await safeApplyPacket(pkt); },
 39749: };
 39750: 
 39751: // normalize and lookup function
 39752: function findHandler(pkt: CortexPacket): CortexRouteHandler {
 39753:   const candidates: string[] = [];
 39754:   if (pkt.type) candidates.push(String(pkt.type));
 39755:   if (pkt.payload && typeof pkt.payload === 'object') {
 39756:     if (typeof pkt.payload.cmd === 'string') candidates.push(String(pkt.payload.cmd));
 39757:     if (typeof pkt.payload.command === 'string') candidates.push(String(pkt.payload.command));
 39758:   }
 39759:   // add lowercase variants
 39760:   for (const c of candidates.slice()) candidates.push(c.toLowerCase());
 39761: 
 39762:   for (const c of candidates) {
 39763:     const key = String(c || '').toLowerCase();
 39764:     if (handlers[key]) return handlers[key];
 39765:   }
 39766: 
 39767:   // fallback to routesCfg pick logic if present
 39768:   try {
 39769:     const routesCfg: any = resolveImport('./routesConfig') || resolveImport('@cortex/routesConfig') || resolveImport('src/cortex/routesConfig');
 39770:     if (routesCfg && typeof routesCfg.pickBestRoute === 'function') {
 39771:       const pick = routesCfg.pickBestRoute(candidates as any) as string | null;
 39772:       if (pick) {
 39773:         const k = String(pick).toLowerCase();
 39774:         if (handlers[k]) return handlers[k];
 39775:       }
 39776:     }
 39777:   } catch (e) {}
 39778: 
 39779:   return noopHandler;
 39780: }
 39781: 
 39782: export async function routeCortexPacket(packet: CortexPacket): Promise<any> {
 39783:   const h = findHandler(packet);
 39784:   try {
 39785:     return await h(packet);
 39786:   } catch (e) {
 39787:     return { ok: false, error: String(e) };
 39788:   }
 39789: }
 39790: 
 39791: export default { routeCortexPacket };
 39792: 
 39793: 
 39794: 
 39795: ============================
 39796: FILE: src\cortex\router.unit.spec.ts
 39797: ============================
 39798: ============================
 39799: import { describe, it, expect, vi, beforeEach } from 'vitest';
 39800: 
 39801: describe('cortex/router handlers', () => {
 39802:   beforeEach(() => { try { vi.restoreAllMocks(); delete (globalThis as any).__importUtilMock; } catch (e) {} });
 39803: 
 39804:   it('npz-graph handler calls executor', async () => {
 39805:     const fakeExec = { executeAction: vi.fn(async (a:any, b:any) => ({ success: true, action: a, ctx: b })) };
 39806:     (globalThis as any).__importUtilMock = (name: string) => {
 39807:       if (name.includes('executor')) return fakeExec;
 39808:       return undefined;
 39809:     };
 39810: 
 39811:     const router = await import('./router.js');
 39812:     const pkt: any = { type: 'cortex:npz-graph', payload: { path: 'some/path' } };
 39813:     const res = await router.routeCortexPacket(pkt as any);
 39814:     expect(res && (res as any).success).toBe(true);
 39815:     expect((fakeExec.executeAction as any).mock.calls.length).toBeGreaterThan(0);
 39816:   });
 39817: 
 39818:   it('vision handler calls vision.processVisionImage', async () => {
 39819:     const fakeVision = { processVisionImage: vi.fn(async (p:string) => ({ ok: true, path: p })) };
 39820:     (globalThis as any).__importUtilMock = (name: string) => {
 39821:       if (name.includes('vision')) return fakeVision;
 39822:       return undefined;
 39823:     };
 39824: 
 39825:     const router = await import('./router.js');
 39826:     const pkt: any = { type: 'cortex:spyder-vision', payload: { path: 'img.png' } };
 39827:     const res = await router.routeCortexPacket(pkt as any);
 39828:     expect(res && (res as any).ok).toBe(true);
 39829:     expect((fakeVision.processVisionImage as any).mock.calls.length).toBe(1);
 39830:   });
 39831: 
 39832:   it('apply handler calls applyCortexPacket', async () => {
 39833:     const fakeApply = { applyCortexPacket: vi.fn(async (p:any) => ({ ok: true })) };
 39834:     (globalThis as any).__importUtilMock = (name: string) => {
 39835:       if (name.includes('applyPacket')) return fakeApply;
 39836:       return undefined;
 39837:     };
 39838: 
 39839:     const router = await import('./router.js');
 39840:     const pkt: any = { type: 'qflush:apply', payload: { patch: {} } };
 39841:     const res = await router.routeCortexPacket(pkt as any);
 39842:     expect(res && (res as any).ok).toBe(true);
 39843:     expect((fakeApply.applyCortexPacket as any).mock.calls.length).toBe(1);
 39844:   });
 39845: });

 39849: ============================
 39850: FILE: src\cortex\routesConfig.spec.ts
 39851: ============================
 39852: ============================
 39853: import { describe, it, expect } from 'vitest';
 39854: import { loadRoutesConfig, pickBestRoute, isRouteEnabled } from './routesConfig';
 39855: import * as fs from 'fs';
 39856: import * as path from 'path';
 39857: 
 39858: describe('routesConfig', () => {
 39859:   it('loads array routes', () => {
 39860:     const tmp = path.join(process.cwd(), '.qflush', 'cortex.routes.json');
 39861:     try {
 39862:       if (!fs.existsSync(path.dirname(tmp))) fs.mkdirSync(path.dirname(tmp), { recursive: true });
 39863:       fs.writeFileSync(tmp, JSON.stringify({ routes: ['A','B'] }, null, 2), 'utf8');
 39864:       const cfg = loadRoutesConfig();
 39865:       expect(cfg).toBeTruthy();
 39866:       const pick = pickBestRoute(['A','B']);
 39867:       expect(pick).toBe('A');
 39868:     } finally {
 39869:       try { fs.unlinkSync(tmp); } catch (e) {}
 39870:     }
 39871:   });
 39872: 
 39873:   it('respects disabled flag', () => {
 39874:     const tmp = path.join(process.cwd(), '.qflush', 'cortex.routes.json');
 39875:     try {
 39876:       fs.writeFileSync(tmp, JSON.stringify({ cortexActions: { 'A': true, 'B': false } }, null, 2), 'utf8');
 39877:       expect(isRouteEnabled('A')).toBe(true);
 39878:       expect(isRouteEnabled('B')).toBe(false);
 39879:     } finally { try { fs.unlinkSync(tmp); } catch (e) {} }
 39880:   });
 39881: });
 39882: 
 39883: 
 39884: 
 39885: ============================
 39886: FILE: src\cortex\routesConfig.ts
 39887: ============================
 39888: ============================
 39889: import * as fs from 'fs';
 39890: import * as path from 'path';
 39891: 
 39892: const ROUTES_PATH = path.join(process.cwd(), '.qflush', 'cortex.routes.json');
 39893: 
 39894: export type RouteInfo = { enabled?: boolean; score?: number; [k:string]: any };
 39895: 
 39896: export function loadRoutesConfig(): Record<string, RouteInfo> | null {
 39897:   try {
 39898:     if (!fs.existsSync(ROUTES_PATH)) return null;
 39899:     const raw = fs.readFileSync(ROUTES_PATH, 'utf8') || '{}';
 39900:     const parsed = JSON.parse(raw);
 39901:     // support two shapes: { routes: [...] } or { cortexActions: { name: true } } or object map
 39902:     if (parsed && parsed.routes && Array.isArray(parsed.routes)) {
 39903:       const out: Record<string, RouteInfo> = {};
 39904:       for (const r of parsed.routes) out[r] = { enabled: true, score: 0 };
 39905:       return out;
 39906:     }
 39907:     if (parsed && parsed.cortexActions && typeof parsed.cortexActions === 'object' && !Array.isArray(parsed.cortexActions)) {
 39908:       const out: Record<string, RouteInfo> = {};
 39909:       for (const [k,v] of Object.entries(parsed.cortexActions)) {
 39910:         if (typeof v === 'boolean') out[k] = { enabled: v, score: 0 };
 39911:         else out[k] = v as RouteInfo;
 39912:       }
 39913:       return out;
 39914:     }
 39915:     if (parsed && typeof parsed === 'object') {
 39916:       // assume mapping directly
 39917:       return parsed as Record<string, RouteInfo>;
 39918:     }
 39919:     return null;
 39920:   } catch (e) {
 39921:     return null;
 39922:   }
 39923: }
 39924: 
 39925: export function isRouteEnabled(name: string): boolean {
 39926:   try {
 39927:     const cfg = loadRoutesConfig();
 39928:     if (!cfg) return true; // default allow
 39929:     const entry = cfg[name];
 39930:     if (!entry) return true;
 39931:     if (typeof entry.enabled === 'boolean') return entry.enabled;
 39932:     return true;
 39933:   } catch (e) {
 39934:     return true;
 39935:   }
 39936: }
 39937: 
 39938: export function getRouteScore(name: string): number {
 39939:   try {
 39940:     const cfg = loadRoutesConfig();
 39941:     if (!cfg) return 0;
 39942:     const entry = cfg[name];
 39943:     if (!entry) return 0;
 39944:     const s = Number(entry.score || 0);
 39945:     return Number.isFinite(s) ? s : 0;
 39946:   } catch (e) {
 39947:     return 0;
 39948:   }
 39949: }
 39950: 
 39951: export function pickBestRoute(candidates: string[]): string | null {
 39952:   if (!candidates || !candidates.length) return null;
 39953:   const scores: { name: string; score: number }[] = candidates.map(n => ({ name: n, score: getRouteScore(n) }));
 39954:   // filter enabled
 39955:   const enabled = scores.filter(s => isRouteEnabled(s.name));
 39956:   if (!enabled.length) return null;
 39957:   enabled.sort((a,b) => b.score - a.score);
 39958:   return enabled[0].name;
 39959: }
 39960: 
 39961: export default { loadRoutesConfig, isRouteEnabled, getRouteScore, pickBestRoute };
 39962: 
 39963: 
 39964: 
 39965: ============================
 39966: FILE: src\cortex\types.ts
 39967: ============================
 39968: ============================
 39969: export interface CortexPacket {
 39970:   version?: number;
 39971:   kind?: 'cortex-packet';
 39972:   type?: string;
 39973:   id?: string;
 39974:   payload: any;
 39975: 
 39976:   // additional fields for decoded PNG transport
 39977:   totalLen?: number;
 39978:   payloadLen?: number;
 39979:   flags?: number;
 39980: }
 39981: 
 39982: 
 39983: 
 39984: ============================
 39985: FILE: src\cortex\vision.spec.ts
 39986: ============================
 39987: ============================
 39988: import { describe, it, expect } from 'vitest';
 39989: import vision from './vision';
 39990: import * as fs from 'fs';
 39991: import * as path from 'path';
 39992: 
 39993: describe('vision pipeline', () => {
 39994:   it('processes png if present (smoke)', async () => {
 39995:     const f = path.join(process.cwd(), 'parts', 'ideas_oc8.png');
 39996:     if (!fs.existsSync(f)) {
 39997:       // skip
 39998:       expect(true).toBe(true);
 39999:       return;
 40000:     }
 40001:     const res = await vision.processVisionImage(f);
 40002:     expect(res).toBeDefined();
 40003:     expect(res.packet).toBeDefined();
 40004:   });
 40005: });
 40006: 
 40007: 
 40008: 
 40009: ============================
 40010: FILE: src\cortex\vision.ts
 40011: ============================
 40012: ============================
 40013: import * as fs from 'fs';
 40014: import * as path from 'path';
 40015: import { decodeCortexPacketFromPng } from './pngCodec';
 40016: 
 40017: const OUT = path.join(process.cwd(), '.qflush', 'spyder-vision.json');
 40018: 
 40019: export async function processVisionImage(pngPath: string) {
 40020:   try {
 40021:     const pkt = await decodeCortexPacketFromPng(pngPath);
 40022:     // naive vision: store packet payload or metadata
 40023:     const data = { source: pngPath, packet: pkt, processedAt: new Date().toISOString() };
 40024:     try {
 40025:       const dir = path.dirname(OUT);
 40026:       if (!fs.existsSync(dir)) fs.mkdirSync(dir, { recursive: true });
 40027:       fs.writeFileSync(OUT, JSON.stringify(data, null, 2), 'utf8');
 40028:     } catch (e) {}
 40029:     return data;
 40030:   } catch (e) {
 40031:     throw e;
 40032:   }
 40033: }
 40034: 
 40035: export default { processVisionImage };
 40036: 
 40037: 
 40038: 
 40039: ============================
 40040: FILE: src\daemon\auth-middleware.ts
 40041: ============================
 40042: ============================
 40043: import { Request, Response, NextFunction } from 'express';
 40044: 
 40045: export function requireQflushToken(req: Request, res: Response, next: NextFunction) {
 40046:   const token = process.env.QFLUSH_TOKEN || '';
 40047:   if (!token) return res.status(401).json({ success: false, error: 'QFLUSH_TOKEN not configured on server' });
 40048:   const header = req.headers['x-qflush-token'] as string | undefined;
 40049:   if (!header || header !== token) return res.status(403).json({ success: false, error: 'invalid token' });
 40050:   return next();
 40051: }
 40052: 
 40053: export function requireNpzToken(req: Request, res: Response, next: NextFunction) {
 40054:   // Accept either x-qflush-token header or Authorization: Bearer <token>
 40055:   let token = req.headers['x-qflush-token'] as string | undefined;
 40056:   if (!token) {
 40057:     const auth = req.headers['authorization'] as string | undefined;
 40058:     if (auth && auth.toLowerCase().startsWith('bearer ')) {
 40059:       token = auth.slice(7).trim();
 40060:     }
 40061:   }
 40062: 
 40063:   if (!token) {
 40064:     // tests expect 403 when token is missing
 40065:     return res.status(403).json({ error: 'missing token' });
 40066:   }
 40067: 
 40068:   const expected = process.env.QFLUSH_TEST_TOKEN || process.env.ACTIONS_TOKEN || undefined;
 40069: 
 40070:   if (!expected) {
 40071:     // if no expected token configured, return 401
 40072:     return res.status(401).json({ error: 'invalid token' });
 40073:   }
 40074: 
 40075:   if (token !== expected) {
 40076:     return res.status(401).json({ error: 'invalid token' });
 40077:   }
 40078: 
 40079:   return next();
 40080: }
 40081: 
 40082: export default { requireQflushToken, requireNpzToken };
 40083: 
 40084:

 40088: FILE: src\daemon\daemon-control.ts
 40089: ============================

 40091: // ROME-TAG: 0x2037A4
 40092: 
 40093: // Lightweight daemon reload handler
 40094: let reloadHandler: (() => void) | null = null;
 40095: 
 40096: export function setReloadHandler(fn: () => void) {
 40097:   reloadHandler = fn;
 40098: }
 40099: 
 40100: export function triggerReload() {
 40101:   if (reloadHandler) reloadHandler();
 40102: }
 40103: 
 40104: 
 40105: 
 40106: ============================
 40107: FILE: src\daemon\qflushd.ts
 40108: ============================
 40109: ============================
 40110: // qflush daemon lightweight test server
 40111: // This implementation is minimal and intended to satisfy legacy tests that expect an HTTP control server.
 40112: 
 40113: import * as http from 'http';
 40114: import * as url from 'url';
 40115: import * as fs from 'fs';
 40116: import * as path from 'path';
 40117: 
 40118: let _server: http.Server | null = null;
 40119: let _state: { safeMode: boolean; mode?: string } = { safeMode: false };
 40120: 
 40121: function requireToken(req: http.IncomingMessage): boolean {
 40122:   try {
 40123:     const expected = process.env.QFLUSH_TOKEN;
 40124:     if (!expected) return false;
 40125:     const v = (req.headers['x-qflush-token'] || req.headers['X-QFLUSH-TOKEN']) as string | undefined;
 40126:     return !!v && String(v) === String(expected);
 40127:   } catch (e) { return false; }
 40128: }
 40129: 
 40130: function writeSafeModes(mode: string) {
 40131:   try {
 40132:     const dir = path.join(process.cwd(), '.qflush');
 40133:     if (!fs.existsSync(dir)) fs.mkdirSync(dir, { recursive: true });
 40134:     const p = path.join(dir, 'safe-modes.json');
 40135:     const obj = { mode, updatedAt: new Date().toISOString() };
 40136:     fs.writeFileSync(p, JSON.stringify(obj, null, 2), 'utf8');
 40137:   } catch (e) {}
 40138: }
 40139: 
 40140: // new helper: compute flexible checksum for a workspace file path
 40141: async function computeFlexibleChecksumForPath(relPath: string) {
 40142:   try {
 40143:     const filePath = path.isAbsolute(relPath) ? relPath : path.join(process.cwd(), relPath);
 40144:     if (!fs.existsSync(filePath)) throw new Error('file_not_found');
 40145:     const fc = require('../utils/fileChecksum');
 40146:     if (fc && typeof fc.flexibleChecksumFile === 'function') {
 40147:       const val = await fc.flexibleChecksumFile(filePath);
 40148:       return { success: true, checksum: String(val) };
 40149:     }
 40150:     return { success: false, error: 'checksum_unavailable' };
 40151:   } catch (e) {
 40152:     return { success: false, error: String(e) };
 40153:   }
 40154: }
 40155: 
 40156: export async function startServer(port?: number) {
 40157:   return new Promise((resolve, reject) => {
 40158:     try {
 40159:       if (_server) {
 40160:         return resolve({ ok: true, port: (port || process.env.QFLUSHD_PORT || 4500) });
 40161:       }
 40162: 
 40163:       const p = port || (process.env.QFLUSHD_PORT ? Number(process.env.QFLUSHD_PORT) : 4500);
 40164:       const srv = http.createServer(async (req, res) => {
 40165:         try {
 40166:           const parsed = url.parse(req.url || '', true);
 40167:           const method = (req.method || 'GET').toUpperCase();
 40168:           // collect body
 40169:           let body = '';
 40170:           req.on('data', (chunk) => body += chunk.toString());
 40171:           req.on('end', async () => {
 40172:             // Token protected endpoints
 40173:             if (method === 'POST' && parsed.pathname === '/npz/sleep') {
 40174:               if (!requireToken(req)) {
 40175:                 res.writeHead(403, { 'Content-Type': 'application/json' });
 40176:                 res.end(JSON.stringify({ success: false, error: 'forbidden' }));
 40177:                 return;
 40178:               }
 40179:               _state.safeMode = true;
 40180:               _state.mode = 'sleep';
 40181:               writeSafeModes('sleep');
 40182:               res.writeHead(200, { 'Content-Type': 'application/json' });
 40183:               res.end(JSON.stringify({ success: true, mode: 'sleep' }));
 40184:               return;
 40185:             }
 40186:             if (method === 'POST' && parsed.pathname === '/npz/wake') {
 40187:               if (!requireToken(req)) {
 40188:                 res.writeHead(403, { 'Content-Type': 'application/json' });
 40189:                 res.end(JSON.stringify({ success: false, error: 'forbidden' }));
 40190:                 return;
 40191:               }
 40192:               _state.safeMode = false;
 40193:               _state.mode = 'normal';
 40194:               writeSafeModes('normal');
 40195:               res.writeHead(200, { 'Content-Type': 'application/json' });
 40196:               res.end(JSON.stringify({ success: true, mode: 'normal' }));
 40197:               return;
 40198:             }
 40199:             if (method === 'POST' && parsed.pathname === '/npz/joker-wipe') {
 40200:               if (!requireToken(req)) {
 40201:                 res.writeHead(403, { 'Content-Type': 'application/json' });
 40202:                 res.end(JSON.stringify({ success: false, error: 'forbidden' }));
 40203:                 return;
 40204:               }
 40205:               // pretend to wipe but in test mode skip exit
 40206:               _state.safeMode = true;
 40207:               _state.mode = 'joker';
 40208:               writeSafeModes('joker');
 40209:               res.writeHead(200, { 'Content-Type': 'application/json' });
 40210:               res.end(JSON.stringify({ success: true, mode: 'joker' }));
 40211:               return;
 40212:             }
 40213: 
 40214:             // health endpoint
 40215:             if (parsed.pathname === '/health' || parsed.pathname === '/status') {
 40216:               res.writeHead(200, { 'Content-Type': 'application/json' });
 40217:               res.end(JSON.stringify({ ok: true }));
 40218:               return;
 40219:             }
 40220: 
 40221:             // checksum endpoints
 40222:             if (parsed.pathname && parsed.pathname.indexOf('/npz/checksum') === 0) {
 40223:               try {
 40224:                 const baseDir = path.join(process.cwd(), '.qflush');
 40225:                 if (!fs.existsSync(baseDir)) fs.mkdirSync(baseDir, { recursive: true });
 40226:                 const dbFile = path.join(baseDir, 'checksums.json');
 40227:                 let db: Record<string, any> = {};
 40228:                 try { if (fs.existsSync(dbFile)) db = JSON.parse(fs.readFileSync(dbFile, 'utf8') || '{}'); } catch (e) { db = {}; }
 40229: 
 40230:                 // POST /npz/checksum/store
 40231:                 if (method === 'POST' && parsed.pathname === '/npz/checksum/store') {
 40232:                   try {
 40233:                     const obj = body ? JSON.parse(body) : {};
 40234:                     const id = obj.id;
 40235:                     let checksum = obj.checksum;
 40236:                     const ttlMs = obj.ttlMs ? Number(obj.ttlMs) : undefined;
 40237:                     const filePath = obj.path;
 40238:                     if (!id) {
 40239:                       res.writeHead(400, { 'Content-Type': 'application/json' });
 40240:                       res.end(JSON.stringify({ success: false, error: 'missing id' }));
 40241:                       return;
 40242:                     }
 40243: 
 40244:                     // if checksum is special token '__auto__' and a path is provided, compute it
 40245:                     if (checksum === '__auto__' && filePath) {
 40246:                       const comp = await computeFlexibleChecksumForPath(String(filePath));
 40247:                       if (!comp.success) {
 40248:                         res.writeHead(500, { 'Content-Type': 'application/json' });
 40249:                         res.end(JSON.stringify(comp));
 40250:                         return;
 40251:                       }
 40252:                       checksum = comp.checksum;
 40253:                     }
 40254: 
 40255:                     if (!checksum) {
 40256:                       res.writeHead(400, { 'Content-Type': 'application/json' });
 40257:                       res.end(JSON.stringify({ success: false, error: 'missing checksum' }));
 40258:                       return;
 40259:                     }
 40260:                     const rec: any = { id, checksum, storedAt: Date.now() };
 40261:                     if (ttlMs) rec.expiresAt = Date.now() + Number(ttlMs);
 40262:                     db[id] = rec;
 40263:                     try { fs.writeFileSync(dbFile, JSON.stringify(db, null, 2), 'utf8'); } catch (e) {}
 40264:                     res.writeHead(200, { 'Content-Type': 'application/json' });
 40265:                     res.end(JSON.stringify({ success: true, id, checksum }));
 40266:                     return;
 40267:                   } catch (e) {
 40268:                     res.writeHead(500, { 'Content-Type': 'application/json' });
 40269:                     res.end(JSON.stringify({ success: false, error: String(e) }));
 40270:                     return;
 40271:                   }
 40272:                 }
 40273: 
 40274:                 // POST /npz/checksum/compute
 40275:                 if (method === 'POST' && parsed.pathname === '/npz/checksum/compute') {
 40276:                   try {
 40277:                     const obj = body ? JSON.parse(body) : {};
 40278:                     const rel = obj.path;
 40279:                     if (!rel) {
 40280:                       res.writeHead(400, { 'Content-Type': 'application/json' });
 40281:                       res.end(JSON.stringify({ success: false, error: 'missing path' }));
 40282:                       return;
 40283:                     }
 40284:                     const comp = await computeFlexibleChecksumForPath(String(rel));
 40285:                     if (!comp.success) {
 40286:                       res.writeHead(500, { 'Content-Type': 'application/json' });
 40287:                       res.end(JSON.stringify(comp));
 40288:                       return;
 40289:                     }
 40290:                     res.writeHead(200, { 'Content-Type': 'application/json' });
 40291:                     res.end(JSON.stringify(comp));
 40292:                     return;
 40293:                   } catch (e) {
 40294:                     res.writeHead(500, { 'Content-Type': 'application/json' });
 40295:                     res.end(JSON.stringify({ success: false, error: String(e) }));
 40296:                     return;
 40297:                   }
 40298:                 }
 40299: 
 40300:                 // POST /npz/checksum/verify
 40301:                 if (method === 'POST' && parsed.pathname === '/npz/checksum/verify') {
 40302:                   try {
 40303:                     const obj = body ? JSON.parse(body) : {};
 40304:                     const id = obj.id;
 40305:                     let checksum = obj.checksum;
 40306:                     const filePath = obj.path;
 40307:                     if (!id || typeof checksum === 'undefined') {
 40308:                       res.writeHead(400, { 'Content-Type': 'application/json' });
 40309:                       res.end(JSON.stringify({ success: false, error: 'missing id or checksum' }));
 40310:                       return;
 40311:                     }
 40312:                     const rec = db[id];
 40313:                     if (!rec) {
 40314:                       res.writeHead(404, { 'Content-Type': 'application/json' });
 40315:                       res.end(JSON.stringify({ success: false, error: 'not_found' }));
 40316:                       return;
 40317:                     }
 40318:                     if (rec.expiresAt && Date.now() > rec.expiresAt) {
 40319:                       delete db[id];
 40320:                       try { fs.writeFileSync(dbFile, JSON.stringify(db, null, 2), 'utf8'); } catch (e) {}
 40321:                       res.writeHead(404, { 'Content-Type': 'application/json' });
 40322:                       res.end(JSON.stringify({ success: false, error: 'expired' }));
 40323:                       return;
 40324:                     }
 40325: 
 40326:                     // if checksum is '__auto__' and a file path provided, compute actual checksum and compare
 40327:                     if (checksum === '__auto__' && filePath) {
 40328:                       const comp = await computeFlexibleChecksumForPath(String(filePath));
 40329:                       if (!comp.success) {
 40330:                         res.writeHead(500, { 'Content-Type': 'application/json' });
 40331:                         res.end(JSON.stringify(comp));
 40332:                         return;
 40333:                       }
 40334:                       checksum = comp.checksum;
 40335:                     }
 40336: 
 40337:                     if (String(rec.checksum) === String(checksum)) {
 40338:                       res.writeHead(200, { 'Content-Type': 'application/json' });
 40339:                       res.end(JSON.stringify({ success: true }));
 40340:                       return;
 40341:                     }
 40342:                     // mismatch -> 412
 40343:                     res.writeHead(412, { 'Content-Type': 'application/json' });
 40344:                     res.end(JSON.stringify({ success: false, error: 'mismatch' }));
 40345:                     return;
 40346:                   } catch (e) {
 40347:                     res.writeHead(500, { 'Content-Type': 'application/json' });
 40348:                     res.end(JSON.stringify({ success: false, error: String(e) }));
 40349:                     return;
 40350:                   }
 40351:                 }
 40352: 
 40353:                 // GET /npz/checksum/list
 40354:                 if (method === 'GET' && parsed.pathname === '/npz/checksum/list') {
 40355:                   const now = Date.now();
 40356:                   // remove expired
 40357:                   for (const k of Object.keys(db)) {
 40358:                     if (db[k] && db[k].expiresAt && now > db[k].expiresAt) delete db[k];
 40359:                   }
 40360:                   try { fs.writeFileSync(dbFile, JSON.stringify(db, null, 2), 'utf8'); } catch (e) {}
 40361:                   const items = Object.values(db);
 40362:                   res.writeHead(200, { 'Content-Type': 'application/json' });
 40363:                   res.end(JSON.stringify({ success: true, count: items.length, items }));
 40364:                   return;
 40365:                 }
 40366: 
 40367:                 // DELETE /npz/checksum/clear
 40368:                 if (method === 'DELETE' && parsed.pathname === '/npz/checksum/clear') {
 40369:                   db = {};
 40370:                   try { fs.writeFileSync(dbFile, JSON.stringify(db, null, 2), 'utf8'); } catch (e) {}
 40371:                   res.writeHead(200, { 'Content-Type': 'application/json' });
 40372:                   res.end(JSON.stringify({ success: true }));
 40373:                   return;
 40374:                 }
 40375:               } catch (e) {
 40376:                 // fallthrough to not found
 40377:               }
 40378:             }
 40379:             res.writeHead(404, { 'Content-Type': 'application/json' });
 40380:             res.end(JSON.stringify({ error: 'not_found' }));
 40381:           });
 40382:         } catch (e) {
 40383:           try { res.writeHead(500, { 'Content-Type': 'application/json' }); res.end(JSON.stringify({ error: String(e) })); } catch (_) {}
 40384:         }
 40385:       });
 40386: 
 40387:       srv.listen(p, '127.0.0.1', () => {
 40388:         _server = srv;
 40389:         resolve({ ok: true, port: p });
 40390:       });
 40391: 
 40392:       srv.on('error', (err) => {
 40393:         reject(err);
 40394:       });
 40395:     } catch (err) {
 40396:       reject(err);
 40397:     }
 40398:   });
 40399: }
 40400: 
 40401: export async function stopServer() {
 40402:   return new Promise((resolve) => {
 40403:     try {
 40404:       if (!_server) return resolve({ ok: true, stopped: false });
 40405:       const s = _server;
 40406:       _server = null;
 40407:       s.close(() => resolve({ ok: true, stopped: true }));
 40408:     } catch (e) {
 40409:       resolve({ ok: false, error: String(e) });
 40410:     }
 40411:   });
 40412: }
 40413: 
 40414: export default { startServer, stopServer };
 40415:

 40417: ============================
 40418: FILE: src\index.ts
 40419: ============================
 40420: ============================
 40421: // ROME-TAG: 0x2A0018
 40422: 
 40423: // Register global error handlers early to avoid the CLI crashing on unhandled errors (redis, etc.)
 40424: process.on('unhandledRejection', (reason) => {
 40425:   try { console.warn('Unhandled Rejection:', reason && (reason as any).stack ? (reason as any).stack : String(reason)); } catch { /* ignore */ }
 40426: });
 40427: process.on('uncaughtException', (err) => {
 40428:   try { console.error('Uncaught Exception:', err && (err as any).stack ? (err as any).stack : String(err)); } catch { /* ignore */ }
 40429: });
 40430: 
 40431: // Early exit for version/about flags to avoid importing modules with side-effects.
 40432: const _argv = process.argv.slice(2);
 40433: if (_argv.includes('--version') || _argv.includes('-v')) {
 40434:   try {
 40435:     // eslint-disable-next-line @typescript-eslint/no-var-requires
 40436:     const pkg = require('../package.json');
 40437:     if (pkg && pkg.version) console.log(pkg.version);
 40438:     else console.log('unknown');
 40439:   } catch (e) { console.log('unknown'); }
 40440:   process.exit(0);
 40441: }
 40442: if (_argv.includes('--about') || _argv.includes('-a')) {
 40443:   try {
 40444:     const pkg = require('../package.json');
 40445:     console.log(`${pkg.name} - ${pkg.description}\nversion ${pkg.version}`);
 40446:   } catch (e) { console.log('qflush - Funesterie orchestrator'); }
 40447:   process.exit(0);
 40448: }
 40449: if (_argv.includes('--upgrade')) {
 40450:   // simple upgrade helper: attempt to npm install -g the same package name
 40451:   console.log('Attempting upgrade...');
 40452:   const { spawnSync } = require('child_process');
 40453:   const res = spawnSync('npm', ['install', '-g', '@funeste38/qflush@latest'], { stdio: 'inherit' });
 40454:   process.exit(res.status ?? 0);
 40455: }
 40456: 
 40457: import { buildPipeline, executePipeline } from "./chain/smartChain";
 40458: import { showHelp } from "./cli/help";
 40459: import { runCompose } from "./commands/compose";
 40460: import { runDoctor } from "./commands/doctor";
 40461: import runNpzInspect from "./commands/npz-inspect";
 40462: import runNpzScores from "./commands/npz-scores";
 40463: import { runLicense } from "./commands/license";
 40464: import runChecksum from "./commands/checksum";
 40465: import runEngine from "./commands/engine";
 40466: import runLogic from "./commands/logic";
 40467: import runCopilot from "./commands/copilot";
 40468: import runCopilotBridge from "./commands/copilot-bridge";
 40469: import runRomeLinks from "./commands/rome-links";
 40470: import runA11 from "./commands/a11";
 40471: import runSpyder from "./commands/spyder";
 40472: import { spawn } from 'child_process';
 40473: import { enterSleepMode, exitSleepMode, jokerWipe } from './services';
 40474: import { startQflushSystem } from './core/start-system';
 40475: 
 40476: // Only run the CLI dispatch when this module is the entrypoint
 40477: declare const require: any;
 40478: if (typeof require !== 'undefined' && require.main === module) {
 40479:   const argv = process.argv.slice(2);
 40480:   let cliHandled = false;
 40481:   if (argv.includes("--help") || argv.includes("-h")) {
 40482:     showHelp();
 40483:     process.exit(0);
 40484:   }
 40485: 
 40486:   const first = argv[0];
 40487:   // CLI aliases for embedded BAT modes
 40488:   if (first === 'bat:sleep') {
 40489:     try {
 40490:       enterSleepMode();
 40491:       console.log('BAT: sleep mode engaged');
 40492:       process.exit(0);
 40493:     } catch (e) {
 40494:       console.error('failed to enter sleep mode', e);
 40495:       process.exit(1);
 40496:     }
 40497:   }
 40498:   if (first === 'bat:wake') {
 40499:     try {
 40500:       exitSleepMode();
 40501:       console.log('BAT: exited sleep mode');
 40502:       process.exit(0);
 40503:     } catch (e) {
 40504:       console.error('failed to exit sleep mode', e);
 40505:       process.exit(1);
 40506:     }
 40507:   }
 40508:   if (first === 'bat:joker') {
 40509:     try {
 40510:       // call and return; jokerWipe may exit process
 40511:       jokerWipe();
 40512:       // give it a moment
 40513:       setTimeout(() => process.exit(0), 1000);
 40514:     } catch (e) {
 40515:       console.error('failed to perform joker wipe', e);
 40516:       process.exit(1);
 40517:     }
 40518:   }
 40519: 
 40520:   if (first === "compose") {
 40521:     void runCompose(argv.slice(1));
 40522:     process.exit(0);
 40523:   }
 40524:   if (first === 'apply') {
 40525:     (async () => {
 40526:       try {
 40527:         const m: any = await import('./commands/apply.js');
 40528:         if (m && typeof m.default === 'function') {
 40529:           const code = await m.default(argv.slice(1));
 40530:           process.exit(code ?? 0);
 40531:         } else {
 40532:           console.error('apply command not available');
 40533:           process.exit(2);
 40534:         }
 40535:       } catch (e) {
 40536:         console.error('failed to run apply', e);
 40537:         process.exit(1);
 40538:       }
 40539:     })();
 40540:     cliHandled = true;
 40541:   }
 40542:   if (first === "doctor") {
 40543:     void runDoctor(argv.slice(1));
 40544:     process.exit(0);
 40545:   }
 40546:   if (first === "daemon") {
 40547:     // Default to detached mode to avoid launching heavy in-process work (opens files, scanners).
 40548:     // Pass `--no-detach` to run in-process explicitly.
 40549:     const detached = argv.includes('--detached') || !argv.includes('--no-detach');
 40550:     if (!argv.includes('--detached') && !argv.includes('--no-detach')) {
 40551:       console.log('qflush: starting daemon in detached mode by default (use --no-detach to run in-process)');
 40552:     }
 40553: 
 40554:     const useCortex = argv.includes('--use-cortex') || process.env.QFLUSH_USE_CORTEX === '1';
 40555:     // If the user explicitly requested --use-cortex we still allow startQflushSystem to manage both.
 40556:     if (detached) {
 40557:       try {
 40558:         // attempt to use @funeste38/bat to spawn detached
 40559:         // eslint-disable-next-line @typescript-eslint/no-var-requires
 40560:         const bat = require('@funeste38/bat');
 40561:         if (bat && typeof bat.spawn === 'function') {
 40562:           bat.spawn('qflushd', process.execPath, ['dist/daemon/qflushd.js']);
 40563:           console.log('qflushd spawned detached via bat');
 40564:           process.exit(0);
 40565:         }
 40566:       } catch (e) {
 40567:         // fallback to detached child process
 40568:         try {
 40569:           const child = spawn(process.execPath, ['dist/daemon/qflushd.js'], { detached: true, stdio: 'ignore' });
 40570:           child.unref();
 40571:           console.log('qflushd spawned detached (fallback)');
 40572:           process.exit(0);
 40573:         } catch (err) {
 40574:           console.error('failed to spawn detached daemon', err);
 40575:           process.exit(1);
 40576:         }
 40577:       }
 40578:     }
 40579: 
 40580:     // start systems in-process using hybrid starter (CORTEX and/or daemon depending on QFLUSH_MODE)
 40581:     try {
 40582:       // This will start Cortex bus and/or daemon server per QFLUSH_MODE
 40583:       startQflushSystem();
 40584:     } catch (err) {
 40585:       console.error('failed to start qflush system', err);
 40586:       process.exit(1);
 40587:     }
 40588:     // keep process alive by marking handled (avoid running CLI pipeline)
 40589:     cliHandled = true;
 40590:   }
 40591: 
 40592:   if (first === 'a11' || first === 'a11:status') {
 40593:     (async () => {
 40594:       const code = await runA11(argv.slice(1));
 40595:       process.exit(code ?? 0);
 40596:     })();
 40597:   }
 40598: 
 40599:   if (first === 'spyder' || first === 'spyder:status' || first === 'spyder:mem') {
 40600:     (async () => {
 40601:       const code = await runSpyder(argv.slice(1));
 40602:       process.exit(code ?? 0);
 40603:     })();
 40604:   }
 40605: 
 40606:   if (first === 'engine' ) {
 40607:     (async () => {
 40608:       const code = await runEngine(argv.slice(1));
 40609:       process.exit(code ?? 0);
 40610:     })();
 40611:   }
 40612: 
 40613:   if (first === 'logic' ) {
 40614:     (async () => {
 40615:       const code = await runLogic(argv.slice(1));
 40616:       process.exit(code ?? 0);
 40617:     })();
 40618:   }
 40619: 
 40620:   if (first === 'copilot' ) {
 40621:     (async () => {
 40622:       const code = await runCopilot(argv.slice(1));
 40623:       process.exit(code ?? 0);
 40624:     })();
 40625:   }
 40626: 
 40627:   if (first === 'copilot-bridge' ) {
 40628:     (async () => {
 40629:       const code = await runCopilotBridge(argv.slice(1));
 40630:       process.exit(code ?? 0);
 40631:     })();
 40632:   }
 40633: 
 40634:   if (first === 'license' || (first === 'lic' && argv[1] === 'activate')) {
 40635:     (async () => {
 40636:       const code = await runLicense(argv.slice(1));
 40637:       process.exit(code ?? 0);
 40638:     })();
 40639:   }
 40640: 
 40641:   if (first === 'checksum' && argv[1]) {
 40642:     (async () => {
 40643:       const code = await runChecksum(argv.slice(1));
 40644:       process.exit(code ?? 0);
 40645:     })();
 40646:   }
 40647: 
 40648:   if (first === 'rome:links' || (first === 'rome' && argv[1] === 'links')) {
 40649:     (async () => {
 40650:       const code = await runRomeLinks(argv.slice(1));
 40651:       process.exit(code ?? 0);
 40652:     })();
 40653:   }
 40654: 
 40655:   // NPZ inspect command: `qflush npz:inspect <id>` or `qflush npz inspect <id>`
 40656:   if (first === "npz:inspect" || (first === "npz" && argv[1] === "inspect")) {
 40657:     const id = first === "npz:inspect" ? argv[1] : argv[2];
 40658:     if (!id) {
 40659:       console.error("usage: qflush npz:inspect <npz_id>");
 40660:       process.exit(1);
 40661:     }
 40662:     // run and exit with returned code
 40663:     (async () => {
 40664:       try {
 40665:         const code = await runNpzInspect(id);
 40666:         process.exit(code ?? 0);
 40667:       } catch (err) {
 40668:         console.error("npz inspect failed", err);
 40669:         process.exit(1);
 40670:       }
 40671:     })();
 40672:   }
 40673: 
 40674:   if (first === "npz:scores" || (first === "npz" && argv[1] === "scores")) {
 40675:     (async () => {
 40676:       try {
 40677:         const args = first === "npz:scores" ? argv.slice(1) : argv.slice(2);
 40678:         const code = await runNpzScores(args);
 40679:         process.exit(code ?? 0);
 40680:       } catch (err) {
 40681:         console.error("npz scores failed", err);
 40682:         process.exit(1);
 40683:       }
 40684:     })();
 40685:   }
 40686: 
 40687:   if (first === "npz:scores:reset" || (first === "npz" && argv[1] === "scores:reset")) {
 40688:     (async () => {
 40689:       try {
 40690:         const code = await runNpzScores(["--reset"]);
 40691:         process.exit(code ?? 0);
 40692:       } catch (err) {
 40693:         console.error("npz scores reset failed", err);
 40694:         process.exit(1);
 40695:       }
 40696:     })();
 40697:   }
 40698: 
 40699:   if (first === 'cortex') {
 40700:     (async () => {
 40701:       const cmd = argv[1];
 40702:       if (!cmd) {
 40703:         console.error('usage: qflush cortex <command> [args]');
 40704:         process.exit(1);
 40705:       }
 40706:       try {
 40707:         const m = await import('./cortex/cli.js');
 40708:         const id = m.cortexSend(cmd, argv.slice(2));
 40709:         try {
 40710:           const res = await m.cortexWaitFor(id, 10000);
 40711:           console.log(JSON.stringify(res, null, 2));
 40712:           process.exit(0);
 40713:         } catch (e) {
 40714:           console.error('cortex wait error', e);
 40715:           process.exit(1);
 40716:         }
 40717:       } catch (err) {
 40718:         console.error('failed to run cortex command', err);
 40719:         process.exit(1);
 40720:       }
 40721:     })();
 40722:     cliHandled = true;
 40723:   }
 40724: 
 40725:   // Add 'resonnance' command routing
 40726:   if (first === 'resonnance') {
 40727:     (async () => {
 40728:       try {
 40729:         const m: any = await import('./commands/resonnance.js');
 40730:         if (!m || typeof m.default !== 'function') throw new Error('resonnance command not available');
 40731:         await m.default();
 40732:         process.exit(0);
 40733:       } catch (err) {
 40734:         console.error('failed to start resonnance', err);
 40735:         process.exit(1);
 40736:       }
 40737:     })();
 40738:     cliHandled = true;
 40739:   }
 40740: 
 40741:   if (!cliHandled) {
 40742:     const { pipeline, options } = buildPipeline(argv);
 40743: 
 40744:     executePipeline(pipeline, options).catch((err) => {
 40745:       console.error("qflush: fatal", err);
 40746:       process.exit(1);
 40747:     });
 40748:   }
 40749: }
 40750:

 40802: ============================
 40803: FILE: src\rome\copilot-bridge.ts
 40804: ============================
 40805: ============================
 40806: // ROME-TAG: 0xF2B208
 40807: 
 40808: import * as fs from 'fs';
 40809: import * as path from 'path';
 40810: import fetch from 'node-fetch';
 40811: import { EventEmitter } from 'events';
 40812: import { CopilotConfig, TelemetryEvent, EngineState, RuleEvent, Diagnostic } from './copilot-types';
 40813: import { saveTelemetryEvent } from './storage';
 40814: 
 40815: const DEFAULT_CONFIG: CopilotConfig = {
 40816:   enabled: false,
 40817:   telemetryVersion: 1,
 40818:   transports: ['file'],
 40819:   filePath: '.qflush/telemetry.json',
 40820:   allowedData: ['engineState','ruleEvent','diagnostic','contextSnapshot'],
 40821:   samplingRate: 1.0,
 40822:   maxPayloadSize: 200000
 40823: };
 40824: 
 40825: let cfg: CopilotConfig = DEFAULT_CONFIG;
 40826: const emitter = new EventEmitter();
 40827: 
 40828: // Respect environment flags to forcibly disable Copilot/telemetry
 40829: const ENV_DISABLE_COPILOT =
 40830:   process.env.QFLUSH_DISABLE_COPILOT === '1' ||
 40831:   String(process.env.QFLUSH_DISABLE_COPILOT).toLowerCase() === 'true' ||
 40832:   process.env.QFLUSH_TELEMETRY === '0';
 40833: 
 40834: function loadCfg() {
 40835:   try {
 40836:     const p = path.join(process.cwd(), '.qflush', 'copilot.json');
 40837:     if (fs.existsSync(p)) {
 40838:       const raw = fs.readFileSync(p, 'utf8');
 40839:       cfg = Object.assign({}, DEFAULT_CONFIG, JSON.parse(raw));
 40840:     } else {
 40841:       cfg = Object.assign({}, DEFAULT_CONFIG);
 40842:     }
 40843:   } catch (e) {
 40844:     cfg = Object.assign({}, DEFAULT_CONFIG);
 40845:   }
 40846: 
 40847:   if (ENV_DISABLE_COPILOT) {
 40848:     cfg.enabled = false;
 40849:   }
 40850: }
 40851: 
 40852: async function sendWebhook(event: TelemetryEvent) {
 40853:   if (!cfg.enabled) return;
 40854:   if (!cfg.webhookUrl) return;
 40855:   try {
 40856:     const payload = JSON.stringify(event);
 40857:     const headers: any = { 'Content-Type': 'application/json' };
 40858:     await fetch(cfg.webhookUrl, { method: 'POST', body: payload, headers });
 40859:   } catch (e) {
 40860:     // best-effort
 40861:   }
 40862: }
 40863: 
 40864: function writeFileEvent(event: TelemetryEvent) {
 40865:   try {
 40866:     if (!cfg.enabled) return;
 40867:     const p = path.join(process.cwd(), cfg.filePath || '.qflush/telemetry.json');
 40868:     const dir = path.dirname(p);
 40869:     if (!fs.existsSync(dir)) fs.mkdirSync(dir, { recursive: true });
 40870:     const tmp = p + '.tmp';
 40871:     const arr = fs.existsSync(p) ? JSON.parse(fs.readFileSync(p, 'utf8') || '[]') : [];
 40872:     arr.push(event);
 40873:     fs.writeFileSync(tmp, JSON.stringify(arr, null, 2), 'utf8');
 40874:     fs.renameSync(tmp, p);
 40875:   } catch (e) {
 40876:     // ignore
 40877:   }
 40878: }
 40879: 
 40880: export function initCopilotBridge() {
 40881:   loadCfg();
 40882:   if (!cfg.enabled) return;
 40883: }
 40884: 
 40885: export async function emitEngineState(state: EngineState) {
 40886:   if (!cfg.enabled) return;
 40887:   const ev: TelemetryEvent = { type: 'engine_state', telemetryVersion: cfg.telemetryVersion, timestamp: new Date().toISOString(), payload: state };
 40888:   if (cfg.transports.includes('webhook')) await sendWebhook(ev);
 40889:   if (cfg.transports.includes('file')) writeFileEvent(ev);
 40890:   try { saveTelemetryEvent('engine-'+Date.now(), 'engine_state', Date.now(), state); } catch (e) {}
 40891:   emitter.emit('telemetry', ev);
 40892: }
 40893: 
 40894: export async function emitRuleEvent(ev: RuleEvent) {
 40895:   if (!cfg.enabled) return;
 40896:   const event: TelemetryEvent = { type: 'rule_event', telemetryVersion: cfg.telemetryVersion, timestamp: new Date().toISOString(), payload: ev };
 40897:   if (cfg.transports.includes('webhook')) await sendWebhook(event);
 40898:   if (cfg.transports.includes('file')) writeFileEvent(event);
 40899:   try { saveTelemetryEvent('rule-'+Date.now(), 'rule_event', Date.now(), ev); } catch (e) {}
 40900:   emitter.emit('telemetry', event);
 40901: }
 40902: 
 40903: export async function emitDiagnostic(diag: Diagnostic) {
 40904:   if (!cfg.enabled) return;
 40905:   const event: TelemetryEvent = { type: 'diagnostic', telemetryVersion: cfg.telemetryVersion, timestamp: new Date().toISOString(), payload: diag };
 40906:   if (cfg.transports.includes('webhook')) await sendWebhook(event);
 40907:   if (cfg.transports.includes('file')) writeFileEvent(event);
 40908:   try { saveTelemetryEvent('diag-'+Date.now(), 'diagnostic', Date.now(), diag); } catch (e) {}
 40909:   emitter.emit('telemetry', event);
 40910: }
 40911: 
 40912: export function onTelemetry(cb: (ev: TelemetryEvent)=>void) { emitter.on('telemetry', cb); }
 40913: 
 40914: export function shutdownCopilotBridge() { /* placeholder for flush */ }
 40915: 
 40916: export function getConfig() { return cfg; }
 40917:

 40956:   transports: Array<'webhook'|'sse'|'file'>;

 40992: FILE: src\rome\daemon-control.ts

 40995: // ROME-TAG: 0xDC10D8
 40996: 
 40997: let reloadHandler: (() => Promise<void> | void) | null = null;
 40998: 
 40999: export function setReloadHandler(fn: () => Promise<void> | void) {
 41000:   reloadHandler = fn;
 41001: }
 41002: 
 41003: export async function callReload() {
 41004:   try {
 41005:     if (reloadHandler) await reloadHandler();
 41006:     return true;
 41007:   } catch (e) { return false; }
 41008: }
