 43248: 
 43249: ============================
 43250: FILE: src\tests\rome-index.test.ts
 43251: ============================
 43252: ============================
 43253: // ROME-TAG: 0x2F0688
 43254: 
 43255: import * as http from 'http';
 43256: import { spawn, ChildProcess } from 'child_process';
 43257: import fetch from '../utils/fetch';
 43258: 
 43259: const PORT = process.env.QFLUSHD_PORT ? Number(process.env.QFLUSHD_PORT) : 4500;
 43260: const BASE = `http://localhost:${PORT}`;
 43261: 
 43262: async function waitForJson(path: string, attempts = 20, delayMs = 250) {
 43263:   for (let i = 0; i < attempts; i++) {
 43264:     try {
 43265:       const res = await fetch(`${BASE}${path}`);
 43266:       if (!res.ok) throw new Error(`status ${res.status}`);
 43267:       const j = await res.json();
 43268:       return j;
 43269:     } catch (e) {
 43270:       // wait and retry
 43271:       await new Promise((r) => setTimeout(r, delayMs));
 43272:     }
 43273:   }
 43274:   throw new Error(`failed to fetch JSON ${path} after ${attempts} attempts`);
 43275: }
 43276: 
 43277: async function isReachable(attempts = 5, delayMs = 200) {
 43278:   for (let i = 0; i < attempts; i++) {
 43279:     try {
 43280:       const res = await fetch(`${BASE}/npz/rome-index`);
 43281:       if (res.ok) return true;
 43282:     } catch (e) {}
 43283:     await new Promise((r) => setTimeout(r, delayMs));
 43284:   }
 43285:   return false;
 43286: }
 43287: 
 43288: export async function runTests() {
 43289:   let serverMod: any = null;
 43290:   let spawned: ChildProcess | null = null;
 43291:   try {
 43292:     // If service already reachable, skip starting
 43293:     if (!(await isReachable(100, 200))) {
 43294:       try {
 43295:         // prefer importing the TS module (no .js) so Vitest can resolve it
 43296:         serverMod = await import('../daemon/qflushd');
 43297:         // start server programmatically on test port
 43298:         if (serverMod && typeof serverMod.startServer === 'function') {
 43299:           serverMod.startServer(PORT);
 43300:         } else {
 43301:           // fallback: spawn daemon process from dist (if present)
 43302:           try {
 43303:             spawned = spawn('node', ['./dist/daemon/qflushd.js'], {
 43304:               env: { ...process.env, QFLUSHD_PORT: String(PORT), QFLUSH_ENABLE_REDIS: '0' },
 43305:               stdio: ['ignore', 'pipe', 'pipe'],
 43306:             });
 43307:             // pipe output to console to help debugging
 43308:             if (spawned.stdout) spawned.stdout.on('data', (d) => console.log('[qflushd]', d.toString()));
 43309:             if (spawned.stderr) spawned.stderr.on('data', (d) => console.error('[qflushd]', d.toString()));
 43310:           } catch (e) {
 43311:             // ignore spawn failure, will fail on subsequent fetch attempts
 43312:           }
 43313:         }
 43314:       } catch (e) {
 43315:         // import failed; try spawning the dist daemon as a last resort
 43316:         try {
 43317:           spawned = spawn('node', ['./dist/daemon/qflushd.js'], {
 43318:             env: { ...process.env, QFLUSHD_PORT: String(PORT), QFLUSH_ENABLE_REDIS: '0' },
 43319:             stdio: ['ignore', 'pipe', 'pipe'],
 43320:           });
 43321:           if (spawned.stdout) spawned.stdout.on('data', (d) => console.log('[qflushd]', d.toString()));
 43322:           if (spawned.stderr) spawned.stderr.on('data', (d) => console.error('[qflushd]', d.toString()));
 43323:         } catch (ee) {}
 43324:       }
 43325: 
 43326:       // give it a moment to start
 43327:       await new Promise((r) => setTimeout(r, 400));
 43328: 
 43329:       // ensure it's reachable before proceeding
 43330:       if (!(await isReachable(100, 200))) {
 43331:         console.error(`qflushd not reachable at ${BASE} après 100 tentatives`);
 43332:         throw new Error(`qflushd not reachable at ${BASE}`);
 43333:       }
 43334:     }
 43335: 
 43336:     const res = await fetch(`${BASE}/npz/rome-index`);
 43337:     const j: any = await res.json();
 43338:     console.log('rome-index test response:', j && j.count);
 43339: 
 43340:     const all: any = await waitForJson('/npz/rome-index', 40, 200);
 43341:     if (!all || !Array.isArray(all.items)) {
 43342:       console.error('invalid index response', all);
 43343:       throw new Error('invalid index response');
 43344:     }
 43345:     console.log('rome-index count=', all.count);
 43346: 
 43347:     // try filter by type 'daemon' (should return 0 or more)
 43348:     const byDaemon: any = await waitForJson('/npz/rome-index?type=daemon', 10, 200);
 43349:     if (!byDaemon || !Array.isArray(byDaemon.items)) {
 43350:       console.error('invalid filtered response', byDaemon);
 43351:       throw new Error('invalid filtered response');
 43352:     }
 43353:     console.log('rome-index daemon count=', byDaemon.count);
 43354:   } finally {
 43355:     try { if (serverMod && typeof serverMod.stopServer === 'function') serverMod.stopServer(); } catch (e) {}
 43356:     try { if (spawned && typeof spawned.kill === 'function') spawned.kill(); } catch (e) {}
 43357:   }
 43358: }
 43359: 
 43360: import { describe, it, expect } from 'vitest';
 43361: 
 43362: describe('rome-index (stub)', () => {
 43363:   it('stub passes', () => {
 43364:     expect(true).toBe(true);
 43365:   });
 43366: });
 43367: 
 43368: 
 43369: 
 43370: ============================
 43371: FILE: src\tests\rome-links.test.ts
 43372: ============================
 43373: ============================
 43374: /// <reference types="vitest" />
 43375: import { resolveRomeToken, computeRomeLinksForFiles, mergeAndWrite, readExistingLinks, romeLinksEmitter } from '../rome/linker';
 43376: import { describe, it, expect } from 'vitest';
 43377: 
 43378: const projectRoot = process.cwd();
 43379: 
 43380: describe('rome linker resolver', () => {
 43381:   it('resolves tokens using index', () => {
 43382:     // this test relies on existing .qflush/rome-index.json in workspace
 43383:     const from = 'src/rome/linker.test.ts';
 43384:     const token = 'linker';
 43385:     const res = resolveRomeToken(projectRoot, from, token);
 43386:     expect(res).toBeDefined();
 43387:     expect(res.score).toBeGreaterThanOrEqual(0);
 43388:   });
 43389: 
 43390:   it('emits update on mergeAndWrite', async () => {
 43391:     const testLinks = [{ from: 'src/a.ts', line: 1, token: 'a', target: null, score: 0 }];
 43392:     await new Promise((resolve, reject) => {
 43393:       const handler = (updated: any) => {
 43394:         try {
 43395:           expect(Array.isArray(updated)).toBe(true);
 43396:           romeLinksEmitter.removeListener('updated', handler);
 43397:           resolve(undefined);
 43398:         } catch (e) {
 43399:           reject(e);
 43400:         }
 43401:       };
 43402:       romeLinksEmitter.on('updated', handler);
 43403:       mergeAndWrite(projectRoot, testLinks as any);
 43404:     });
 43405:   });
 43406: });
 43407: 
 43408: 
 43409:

 43418: 
 43419: function assertEqual(a: any, b: any, msg?: string) {
 43420:   if (JSON.stringify(a) !== JSON.stringify(b)) throw new Error(msg || `Assertion failed: ${JSON.stringify(a)} !== ${JSON.stringify(b)}`);
 43421: }
 43422: 
 43423: export async function runTests() {
 43424:   assertEqual(buildPipeline(["start"]).pipeline, ["detect","config","start"]);
 43425:   assertEqual(buildPipeline(["kill","start"]).pipeline, ["kill","detect","config","start"]);
 43426:   assertEqual(buildPipeline(["purge","start"]).pipeline, ["detect","config","purge","start"]);
 43427:   assertEqual(buildPipeline(["config","start","detect"]).pipeline, ["detect","config","start"]);
 43428:   assertEqual(buildPipeline(["exodia","start"]).pipeline, ["detect","config","start","exodia"]);
 43429:   console.log("SmartChain tests passed");
 43430: }

 43434:     expect(true).toBe(true);

 43653: ============================
 43654: FILE: src\utils\alias.ts
 43655: ============================
 43656: ============================
 43657: import * as fs from 'fs';
 43658: import * as path from 'path';
 43659: 
 43660: // avoid static import of './paths' to prevent TypeScript module resolution issues in some environments
 43661: let resolvePaths: any = undefined;
 43662: try {
 43663:   // require at runtime; if not available, leave undefined
 43664:   // use dynamic path to avoid TypeScript module resolution of literal './paths'
 43665:   // eslint-disable-next-line @typescript-eslint/no-var-requires
 43666:   const p = require(path.join(__dirname, 'paths'));
 43667:   resolvePaths = p && p.resolvePaths;
 43668: } catch (e) {
 43669:   resolvePaths = undefined;
 43670: }
 43671: 
 43672: function tryRequire(filePath: string) {
 43673:   try {
 43674:     if (fs.existsSync(filePath)) return require(filePath);
 43675:   } catch (e) {
 43676:     try { return require(filePath); } catch (e) {}
 43677:   }
 43678:   return undefined;
 43679: }
 43680: 
 43681: function tryRequireVariants(basePath: string) {
 43682:   const variants = [".js", ".ts", "/index.js", "/index.ts"];
 43683:   for (const v of variants) {
 43684:     const p = basePath.endsWith(v) ? basePath : basePath + v;
 43685:     const m = tryRequire(p);
 43686:     if (m) return (m && m.default) || m;
 43687:   }
 43688:   return undefined;
 43689: }
 43690: 
 43691: export function importUtil(name: string): any {
 43692:   // normalize alias forms such as '@utils/foo' or '#utils/foo' to a simple local name
 43693:   let localName = name;
 43694:   const aliasMatch = name && (name.startsWith('@utils/') || name.startsWith('#utils/'));
 43695:   if (aliasMatch) localName = name.replace(/^(@|#)?utils\//, '');
 43696: 
 43697:   // prefer spyder local workspace copy when present
 43698:   try {
 43699:     if (typeof resolvePaths === 'function') {
 43700:       const paths = resolvePaths();
 43701:       const spy = paths && paths['spyder'];
 43702:       if (spy) {
 43703:         // common locations inside spyder package layout
 43704:         const candidates = [
 43705:           path.join(spy, 'apps', 'spyder-core', 'src', 'utils', localName),
 43706:           path.join(spy, 'apps', 'spyder-core', 'src', localName),
 43707:           path.join(spy, 'src', 'utils', localName),
 43708:           path.join(spy, 'src', localName),
 43709:           path.join(spy, 'utils', localName),
 43710:         ];
 43711:         for (const c of candidates) {
 43712:           const m = tryRequireVariants(c);
 43713:           if (m) return m;
 43714:         }
 43715:         // try requiring from spyder root via Node resolution (works if spyder is a package)
 43716:         try {
 43717:           const resolved = require.resolve(localName, { paths: [spy] });
 43718:           const m = require(resolved);
 43719:           if (m) return (m && m.default) || m;
 43720:         } catch (e) {}
 43721:       }
 43722:     }
 43723:   } catch (e) {
 43724:     // ignore
 43725:   }
 43726: 
 43727:   // If name was an alias like @utils/foo, try local src/utils/<foo>
 43728:   if (aliasMatch) {
 43729:     try {
 43730:       const local = tryRequireVariants(path.join(__dirname, localName));
 43731:       if (local) return local;
 43732:     } catch (e) {}
 43733:   }
 43734: 
 43735:   // fallback: if a relative path or module name was passed, try requiring directly
 43736:   try {
 43737:     // try direct file/module
 43738:     const m1 = tryRequire(name);
 43739:     if (m1) return (m1 && m1.default) || m1;
 43740:   } catch (e) {}
 43741: 
 43742:   // last resort: require by name (could be from node_modules)
 43743:   try {
 43744:     const m = require(name);
 43745:     return (m && m.default) || m;
 43746:   } catch (e) {}
 43747: 
 43748:   return undefined;
 43749: }
 43750: 
 43751: export default { importUtil };
 43752: 
 43753: 
 43754: 
 43755: ============================
 43756: FILE: src\utils\archive.ts
 43757: ============================
 43758: ============================
 43759: import * as fs from 'fs';
 43760: import * as path from 'path';
 43761: 
 43762: // Remove dated subfolders named YYYY-MM older than keepMonths
 43763: export function cleanupDatedArchives(baseDir: string, keepMonths = 6) {
 43764:   try {
 43765:     if (!fs.existsSync(baseDir)) return;
 43766:     const entries = fs.readdirSync(baseDir, { withFileTypes: true });
 43767:     const now = new Date();
 43768:     for (const e of entries) {
 43769:       if (!e.isDirectory()) continue;
 43770:       const name = e.name;
 43771:       const m = /^([0-9]{4})-([0-9]{2})$/.exec(name);
 43772:       if (!m) continue;
 43773:       const year = Number(m[1]);
 43774:       const month = Number(m[2]);
 43775:       if (!year || !month) continue;
 43776:       const dirDate = new Date(year, month - 1, 1);
 43777:       const monthsDiff = (now.getFullYear() - dirDate.getFullYear()) * 12 + (now.getMonth() - dirDate.getMonth());
 43778:       if (monthsDiff > keepMonths) {
 43779:         // remove directory recursively
 43780:         try {
 43781:           fs.rmSync(path.join(baseDir, name), { recursive: true, force: true });
 43782:         } catch (e) {
 43783:           try {
 43784:             // fallback for older Node: use custom rm
 43785:             const rimraf = (p: string) => {
 43786:               if (!fs.existsSync(p)) return;
 43787:               for (const f of fs.readdirSync(p)) {
 43788:                 const fp = path.join(p, f);
 43789:                 const st = fs.statSync(fp);
 43790:                 if (st.isDirectory()) rimraf(fp);
 43791:                 else fs.unlinkSync(fp);
 43792:               }
 43793:               fs.rmdirSync(p);
 43794:             };
 43795:             rimraf(path.join(baseDir, name));
 43796:           } catch (e2) {}
 43797:         }
 43798:       }
 43799:     }
 43800:   } catch (e) {
 43801:     // ignore errors
 43802:   }
 43803: }
 43804: 
 43805: export default { cleanupDatedArchives };
 43806: 
 43807: 
 43808: 
 43809: ============================
 43810: FILE: src\utils\auth.ts
 43811: ============================
 43812: ============================
 43813: // ROME-TAG: 0xC8C1C0
 43814: 
 43815: import { Request } from 'express';
 43816: 
 43817: export function isAdminAuthorized(req: Request): boolean {
 43818:   const token = process.env.NPZ_ADMIN_TOKEN;
 43819:   const user = process.env.NPZ_ADMIN_USER;
 43820:   const pass = process.env.NPZ_ADMIN_PASS;
 43821:   const allowIps = (process.env.NPZ_ADMIN_ALLOW_IPS || '').split(',').map(s => s.trim()).filter(Boolean);
 43822: 
 43823:   // IP allowlist
 43824:   if (allowIps.length > 0) {
 43825:     const ip = (req.headers['x-forwarded-for'] as string) || req.socket.remoteAddress || '';
 43826:     for (const a of allowIps) {
 43827:       if (ip && ip.includes(a)) return true;
 43828:     }
 43829:   }
 43830: 
 43831:   // x-admin-token header
 43832:   const providedToken = (req.headers['x-admin-token'] as string) || (req.query && (req.query as any).token);
 43833:   if (token && providedToken && providedToken === token) return true;
 43834: 
 43835:   // Authorization: Bearer <token>
 43836:   const auth = req.headers['authorization'] as string | undefined;
 43837:   if (auth && auth.startsWith('Bearer ')) {
 43838:     const b = auth.slice(7).trim();
 43839:     if (token && b === token) return true;
 43840:   }
 43841: 
 43842:   // Basic auth
 43843:   if (auth && auth.startsWith('Basic ')) {
 43844:     try {
 43845:       const payload = Buffer.from(auth.slice(6), 'base64').toString('utf8');
 43846:       const [u, p] = payload.split(':');
 43847:       if (user && pass && u === user && p === pass) return true;
 43848:     } catch (e) {
 43849:       // ignore
 43850:     }
 43851:   }
 43852: 
 43853:   return false;
 43854: }
 43855: 
 43856: export default { isAdminAuthorized };
 43857: 
 43858: 
 43859: 
 43860: ============================
 43861: FILE: src\utils\colors.ts
 43862: ============================
 43863: ============================
 43864: // ROME-TAG: 0xBAEB58
 43865: 
 43866: // Utilities for Nezlephant color palette and helpers
 43867: // Base color shorthand '0c8' -> #00cc88
 43868: 
 43869: export const NEZLEPHANT = {
 43870:   baseHex: '#00cc88', // shorthand 0c8
 43871:   jokerHex: '#ff00cc', // Joker accent (magenta-pink)
 43872:   neutralHex: '#0f1724', // dark neutral
 43873:   whiteHex: '#ffffff',
 43874:   blackHex: '#000000',
 43875: };
 43876: 
 43877: function clamp(v: number, a = 0, b = 255) {
 43878:   return Math.max(a, Math.min(b, Math.round(v)));
 43879: }
 43880: 
 43881: export function hexToRgb(hex: string): { r: number; g: number; b: number } {
 43882:   const h = hex.replace('#', '');
 43883:   if (h.length === 3) {
 43884:     const r = parseInt(h[0] + h[0], 16);
 43885:     const g = parseInt(h[1] + h[1], 16);
 43886:     const b = parseInt(h[2] + h[2], 16);
 43887:     return { r, g, b };
 43888:   }
 43889:   const r = parseInt(h.slice(0, 2), 16);
 43890:   const g = parseInt(h.slice(2, 4), 16);
 43891:   const b = parseInt(h.slice(4, 6), 16);
 43892:   return { r, g, b };
 43893: }
 43894: 
 43895: export function rgbToHex(r: number, g: number, b: number): string {
 43896:   return `#${[r, g, b].map((n) => clamp(n).toString(16).padStart(2, '0')).join('')}`;
 43897: }
 43898: 
 43899: export function rgba(hex: string, alpha = 1): string {
 43900:   const { r, g, b } = hexToRgb(hex);
 43901:   return `rgba(${r}, ${g}, ${b}, ${alpha})`;
 43902: }
 43903: 
 43904: export function lighten(hex: string, percent = 0.1): string {
 43905:   const { r, g, b } = hexToRgb(hex);
 43906:   const nr = clamp(r + (255 - r) * percent);
 43907:   const ng = clamp(g + (255 - g) * percent);
 43908:   const nb = clamp(b + (255 - b) * percent);
 43909:   return rgbToHex(nr, ng, nb);
 43910: }
 43911: 
 43912: export function darken(hex: string, percent = 0.1): string {
 43913:   const { r, g, b } = hexToRgb(hex);
 43914:   const nr = clamp(r * (1 - percent));
 43915:   const ng = clamp(g * (1 - percent));
 43916:   const nb = clamp(b * (1 - percent));
 43917:   return rgbToHex(nr, ng, nb);
 43918: }
 43919: 
 43920: export function relativeLuminance(hex: string): number {
 43921:   const { r, g, b } = hexToRgb(hex);
 43922:   const srgb = [r / 255, g / 255, b / 255].map((c) => (c <= 0.03928 ? c / 12.92 : Math.pow((c + 0.055) / 1.055, 2.4)));
 43923:   return 0.2126 * srgb[0] + 0.7152 * srgb[1] + 0.0722 * srgb[2];
 43924: }
 43925: 
 43926: export function contrastRatio(hexA: string, hexB: string): number {
 43927:   const L1 = relativeLuminance(hexA) + 0.05;
 43928:   const L2 = relativeLuminance(hexB) + 0.05;
 43929:   return Math.max(L1, L2) / Math.min(L1, L2);
 43930: }
 43931: 
 43932: export function readableTextColor(backgroundHex: string, prefer = NEZLEPHANT.whiteHex): string {
 43933:   // return white or black depending on contrast
 43934:   const whiteContrast = contrastRatio(backgroundHex, NEZLEPHANT.whiteHex);
 43935:   const blackContrast = contrastRatio(backgroundHex, NEZLEPHANT.blackHex);
 43936:   return whiteContrast >= blackContrast ? NEZLEPHANT.whiteHex : NEZLEPHANT.blackHex;
 43937: }
 43938: 
 43939: export function cssVariables(prefix = 'nez') {
 43940:   const base = NEZLEPHANT.baseHex;
 43941:   const j = NEZLEPHANT.jokerHex;
 43942:   return `:root {\n  --${prefix}-base: ${base};\n  --${prefix}-base-90: ${rgba(base, 0.9)};\n  --${prefix}-base-80: ${rgba(base, 0.8)};\n  --${prefix}-base-60: ${rgba(base, 0.6)};\n  --${prefix}-base-30: ${rgba(base, 0.3)};\n  --${prefix}-light: ${lighten(base, 0.18)};\n  --${prefix}-dark: ${darken(base, 0.18)};\n  --${prefix}-joker: ${j};\n  --${prefix}-bg: ${NEZLEPHANT.neutralHex};\n  --${prefix}-text: ${readableTextColor(NEZLEPHANT.neutralHex)};\n}`;
 43943: }
 43944: 
 43945: // Terminal ANSI truecolor helpers (supports modern terminals)
 43946: export function ansiFg(hex: string): string {
 43947:   const { r, g, b } = hexToRgb(hex);
 43948:   return `\x1b[38;2;${r};${g};${b}m`;
 43949: }
 43950: export function ansiBg(hex: string): string {
 43951:   const { r, g, b } = hexToRgb(hex);
 43952:   return `\x1b[48;2;${r};${g};${b}m`;
 43953: }
 43954: export const ansiReset = '\x1b[0m';
 43955: 
 43956: // Preset styled log helpers for Joker + Nezlephant
 43957: export function styledLog(title: string, msg: string, opts?: { accent?: 'joker' | 'base' | 'neutral' }) {
 43958:   const accent = opts?.accent === 'joker' ? NEZLEPHANT.jokerHex : opts?.accent === 'neutral' ? NEZLEPHANT.neutralHex : NEZLEPHANT.baseHex;
 43959:   const bg = ansiBg(darken(accent, 0.15));
 43960:   const fg = ansiFg(readableTextColor(darken(accent, 0.15)));
 43961:   const accentFg = ansiFg(accent);
 43962: 
 43963:   // If output is not a TTY or NO_COLOR is set, avoid ANSI color sequences and print plain text
 43964:   if (process.env.NO_COLOR || !(process.stdout && process.stdout.isTTY)) {
 43965:     process.stdout.write(`[${title}] ${msg}\n`);
 43966:     return;
 43967:   }
 43968: 
 43969:   process.stdout.write(`${bg}${fg} [${title}] ${ansiReset} ${accentFg}${msg}${ansiReset}\n`);
 43970: }
 43971: 
 43972: export default {
 43973:   NEZLEPHANT,
 43974:   hexToRgb,
 43975:   rgbToHex,
 43976:   rgba,
 43977:   lighten,
 43978:   darken,
 43979:   readableTextColor,
 43980:   cssVariables,
 43981:   ansiFg,
 43982:   ansiBg,
 43983:   ansiReset,
 43984:   styledLog,
 43985: };
 43986: 
 43987: 
 43988: 
 43989: ============================
 43990: FILE: src\utils\detect.ts
 43991: ============================
 43992: ============================
 43993: // ROME-TAG: 0x29A73C
 43994: 
 43995: import { exec } from "child_process";
 43996: import alias from './alias';
 43997: const logger = alias.importUtil('@utils/logger') || alias.importUtil('./logger') || console;
 43998: import { SERVICE_MAP } from "./paths";
 43999: import { resolvePackagePath } from "./package";
 44000: 
 44001: export async function detectModules() {
 44002:   const out: Record<string, any> = {};
 44003:   for (const name of Object.keys(SERVICE_MAP))
 44004:     out[name] = { running: false, installed: false, path: undefined, bin: undefined };
 44005: 
 44006:   for (const name of Object.keys(SERVICE_MAP)) {
 44007:     try {
 44008:       const pkgPath = resolvePackagePath(SERVICE_MAP[name].pkg);
 44009:       if (pkgPath) {
 44010:         out[name].installed = true;
 44011:         out[name].path = pkgPath;
 44012:         try {
 44013:           const pkgJson = require(require('path').join(pkgPath, 'package.json'));
 44014:           if (pkgJson && pkgJson.bin) {
 44015:             out[name].bin = typeof pkgJson.bin === 'string' ? pkgJson.bin : Object.values(pkgJson.bin)[0];
 44016:           }
 44017:         } catch {}
 44018:       }
 44019:     } catch {}
 44020:   }
 44021: 
 44022:   await new Promise<void>((resolve) => {
 44023:     exec(process.platform === "win32" ? "tasklist" : "ps aux", (err, stdout) => {
 44024:       if (err) {
 44025:         logger.warn(`Failed to list processes: ${err.message}`);
 44026:         return resolve();
 44027:       }
 44028:       const s = stdout.toString();
 44029:       for (const name of Object.keys(SERVICE_MAP)) {
 44030:         const regex = new RegExp(name, "i");
 44031:         if (regex.test(s)) {
 44032:           out[name].running = true;
 44033:         }
 44034:       }
 44035:       resolve();
 44036:     });
 44037:   });
 44038:   return out;
 44039: }
 44040: 
 44041: export async function findAndKill() {
 44042:   const names = Object.keys(SERVICE_MAP);
 44043:   const killed: number[] = [];
 44044:   for (const n of names) {
 44045:     try {
 44046:       if (process.platform === "win32") {
 44047:         exec(`taskkill /IM ${n}.exe /F`, (err) => {});
 44048:       } else {
 44049:         exec(`pkill -f ${n}`, (err) => {});
 44050:       }
 44051:     } catch (err) {
 44052:       // ignore
 44053:     }
 44054:   }
 44055:   return killed;
 44056: }
 44057: 
 44058: 
 44059: 
 44060: ============================
 44061: FILE: src\utils\exec.ts
 44062: ============================
 44063: ============================
 44064: // ROME-TAG: 0xEB40C5
 44065: 
 44066: import { spawn } from "child_process";
 44067: import { logger } from "./logger";
 44068: import { unlinkSync, existsSync, rmSync } from "fs";
 44069: import { execSync } from "child_process";
 44070: 
 44071: export function spawnSafe(command: string, args: string[] = [], opts: any = {}) {
 44072:   try {
 44073:     const proc = spawn(command, args, { stdio: "inherit", shell: true, ...opts });
 44074:     proc.on("error", (err) => logger.error(`Process error: ${err.message}`));
 44075:     return proc;
 44076:   } catch (err: any) {
 44077:     logger.error(`Failed to spawn ${command}: ${err.message}`);
 44078:     throw err;
 44079:   }
 44080: }
 44081: 
 44082: export function rimrafSync(path: string) {
 44083:   if (!path) return;
 44084:   if (!existsSync(path)) return;
 44085:   try {
 44086:     rmSync(path, { recursive: true, force: true });
 44087:   } catch (err) {
 44088:     // fallback
 44089:     try {
 44090:       unlinkSync(path);
 44091:     } catch {}
 44092:   }
 44093: }
 44094: 
 44095: export function isPackageInstalled(pkgName: string) {
 44096:   try {
 44097:     execSync(`npm ls ${pkgName} --depth=0`, { stdio: "ignore" });
 44098:     return true;
 44099:   } catch {
 44100:     return false;
 44101:   }
 44102: }
 44103: 
 44104: export function ensurePackageInstalled(pkgName: string) {
 44105:   if (isPackageInstalled(pkgName)) return true;
 44106:   // In CI or when explicitly requested, avoid attempting global npm installs
 44107:   const skipInstalls = process.env.QFLUSH_SKIP_GLOBAL_INSTALLS === '1' || process.env.CI === 'true' || process.env.GITHUB_ACTIONS === 'true';
 44108:   if (skipInstalls) {
 44109:     logger.info(`Skipping global install of ${pkgName} (CI or skip flag set)`);
 44110:     return false;
 44111:   }
 44112:   logger.info(`Installing missing package ${pkgName}...`);
 44113:   try {
 44114:     execSync(`npm install -g ${pkgName}`, { stdio: "inherit" });
 44115:     return true;
 44116:   } catch (err: any) {
 44117:     logger.warn(`Failed to install ${pkgName}: ${err.message}`);
 44118:     return false;
 44119:   }
 44120: }
 44121: 
 44122: // Helpers for CLI pre-launch checks
 44123: export function pathExists(pathStr: string) {
 44124:   return !!pathStr && existsSync(pathStr);
 44125: }
 44126: 
 44127: export function rebuildInstructionsFor(pkgPath?: string) {
 44128:   if (!pkgPath) return `Rebuild the package (cd <pkg> && npm install && npm run build && npm install -g .)`;
 44129:   return `Rebuild the package:\n  cd ${pkgPath}\n  npm install\n  npm run build\n  npm install -g .`;
 44130: }
 44131: 
 44132: 
 44133: 
 44134: ============================
 44135: FILE: src\utils\fetch.ts
 44136: ============================
 44137: ============================
 44138: // ROME-TAG: 0xF66B59
 44139: 
 44140: // small wrapper around available fetch implementations
 44141: // tries global fetch, then undici, otherwise falls back to node's http(s) for simple requests
 44142: import * as http from 'http';
 44143: import * as https from 'https';
 44144: 
 44145: export type FetchInit = { method?: string; headers?: Record<string,string>; body?: any };
 44146: 
 44147: async function simpleFetch(url: string, init: FetchInit = {}) {
 44148:   return new Promise<any>((resolve, reject) => {
 44149:     try {
 44150:       const u = new URL(url);
 44151:       const isHttps = u.protocol === 'https:';
 44152:       const lib: any = isHttps ? https : http;
 44153:       const opts: any = { method: init.method || 'GET', headers: init.headers || {}, hostname: u.hostname, port: u.port || (isHttps ? 443 : 80), path: u.pathname + (u.search || '') };
 44154:       const req = lib.request(opts, (res: any) => {
 44155:         const bufs: any[] = [];
 44156:         res.on('data', (d: any) => bufs.push(d));
 44157:         res.on('end', () => {
 44158:           const txt = Buffer.concat(bufs).toString('utf8');
 44159:           resolve({ ok: res.statusCode >= 200 && res.statusCode < 400, status: res.statusCode, statusText: res.statusMessage, text: () => Promise.resolve(txt), json: () => Promise.resolve(JSON.parse(txt)), headers: res.headers });
 44160:         });
 44161:       });
 44162:       req.on('error', (e: any) => reject(e));
 44163:       if (init.body) req.write(typeof init.body === 'string' ? init.body : JSON.stringify(init.body));
 44164:       req.end();
 44165:     } catch (e) { reject(e); }
 44166:   });
 44167: }
 44168: 
 44169: export async function fetchWrapper(url: string, init?: FetchInit) {
 44170:   if (typeof (globalThis as any).fetch === 'function') return (globalThis as any).fetch(url, init as any);
 44171:   try {
 44172:     // try undici
 44173:      
 44174:     const undici = require('undici');
 44175:     if (undici && typeof undici.fetch === 'function') return undici.fetch(url, init as any);
 44176:   } catch (e) {
 44177:     // ignore
 44178:   }
 44179:   return simpleFetch(url, init || {});
 44180: }
 44181: 
 44182: export default fetchWrapper;
 44183: 
 44184: 
 44185: 
 44186: ============================
 44187: FILE: src\utils\fileChecksum.ts
 44188: ============================
 44189: ============================
 44190: import * as fs from 'fs';
 44191: import normalize from './normalize';
 44192: import * as os from 'os';
 44193: import * as path from 'path';
 44194: 
 44195: // Note: keep local xor implementation to avoid circular import issues
 44196: export function xorChecksum(buffer: Uint8Array | Buffer): number {
 44197:   let x = 0;
 44198:   for (let i = 0; i < buffer.length; i++) x ^= buffer[i];
 44199:   return x & 0xff;
 44200: }
 44201: 
 44202: export function checksumBufferIgnoringRomeTag(buf: Buffer | Uint8Array): number {
 44203:   // normalize by removing ROME-TAG lines from UTF-8 interpretation
 44204:   const text = Buffer.isBuffer(buf) ? buf.toString('utf8') : Buffer.from(buf).toString('utf8');
 44205:   const cleaned = normalize.stripRomeTagLines(text);
 44206:   const b = Buffer.from(cleaned, 'utf8');
 44207:   return xorChecksum(b);
 44208: }
 44209: 
 44210: export function checksumFileIgnoringRomeTag(filePath: string): number {
 44211:   const raw = fs.readFileSync(filePath);
 44212:   return checksumBufferIgnoringRomeTag(raw);
 44213: }
 44214: 
 44215: // Flexible checksum: try multiple decoding strategies
 44216: export async function flexibleChecksumBuffer(buf: Buffer | Uint8Array): Promise<number> {
 44217:   const buffer = Buffer.isBuffer(buf) ? buf : Buffer.from(buf);
 44218: 
 44219:   // 1) PNG detection (PNG file signature: 89 50 4E 47 0D 0A 1A 0A)
 44220:   try {
 44221:     if (buffer.length >= 8 && buffer[0] === 0x89 && buffer[1] === 0x50 && buffer[2] === 0x4E && buffer[3] === 0x47) {
 44222:       // write to temp file and try to decode via existing pngCodec
 44223:       try {
 44224:         const tmp = path.join(os.tmpdir(), `qflush_cxpk_${Date.now()}_${Math.random().toString(36).slice(2,8)}.png`);
 44225:         fs.writeFileSync(tmp, buffer);
 44226:         try {
 44227:           // dynamic import to avoid circular deps
 44228:           const pngCodec = require('../cortex/pngCodec');
 44229:           if (pngCodec && typeof pngCodec.decodeCortexPacketFromPng === 'function') {
 44230:             const pkt = await pngCodec.decodeCortexPacketFromPng(tmp);
 44231:             try { fs.unlinkSync(tmp); } catch (e) {}
 44232:             // use payload or whole packet JSON
 44233:             const target = pkt && pkt.payload ? pkt.payload : pkt;
 44234:             const json = JSON.stringify(target);
 44235:             return xorChecksum(Buffer.from(json, 'utf8'));
 44236:           }
 44237:         } catch (e) {
 44238:           try { fs.unlinkSync(tmp); } catch (e2) {}
 44239:         }
 44240:       } catch (e) {
 44241:         // ignore and fallback
 44242:       }
 44243:     }
 44244:   } catch (e) {}
 44245: 
 44246:   // 2) Cortex binary packet (try parse via src/cortex/codec)
 44247:   try {
 44248:     const codec = require('../cortex/codec');
 44249:     if (codec && typeof codec.decodeCortexPacket === 'function') {
 44250:       try {
 44251:         const parsed = codec.decodeCortexPacket(buffer);
 44252:         if (parsed && parsed.payload) {
 44253:           const json = typeof parsed.payload === 'string' ? parsed.payload : JSON.stringify(parsed.payload);
 44254:           return xorChecksum(Buffer.from(json, 'utf8'));
 44255:         }
 44256:       } catch (e) {
 44257:         // not a cortex binary packet, continue
 44258:       }
 44259:     }
 44260:   } catch (e) {}
 44261: 
 44262:   // 3) fallback to text normalization checksum
 44263:   try {
 44264:     return checksumBufferIgnoringRomeTag(buffer);
 44265:   } catch (e) {
 44266:     // last resort: plain xor on raw bytes
 44267:     return xorChecksum(buffer);
 44268:   }
 44269: }
 44270: 
 44271: export async function flexibleChecksumFile(filePath: string): Promise<number> {
 44272:   const raw = fs.readFileSync(filePath);
 44273:   return flexibleChecksumBuffer(raw);
 44274: }
 44275: 
 44276: export default { xorChecksum, checksumBufferIgnoringRomeTag, checksumFileIgnoringRomeTag, flexibleChecksumBuffer, flexibleChecksumFile };
 44277: 
 44278: 
 44279: 
 44280: ============================
 44281: FILE: src\utils\gumroad-license.ts
 44282: ============================
 44283: ============================
 44284: // ROME-TAG: 0xC4BE64
 44285: 
 44286: import * as fs from 'fs';
 44287: import * as path from 'path';
 44288: import fetch from 'node-fetch';
 44289: 
 44290: const DEFAULT_STORAGE = path.join(process.cwd(), '.qflush', 'license.json');
 44291: 
 44292: export type LicenseRecord = {
 44293:   key: string;
 44294:   product_id: string;
 44295:   createdAt: number;
 44296:   expiresAt?: number | null;
 44297:   recurring?: boolean;
 44298:   lastVerified?: number;
 44299:   metadata?: Record<string, any>;
 44300: };
 44301: 
 44302: function getStoragePath() {
 44303:   return process.env.GUMROAD_LICENSE_PATH || DEFAULT_STORAGE;
 44304: }
 44305: 
 44306: function ensureDir(storagePath: string) {
 44307:   const dir = path.dirname(storagePath);
 44308:   if (!fs.existsSync(dir)) fs.mkdirSync(dir, { recursive: true });
 44309: }
 44310: 
 44311: export function saveLicense(rec: LicenseRecord) {
 44312:   const storage = getStoragePath();
 44313:   ensureDir(storage);
 44314:   fs.writeFileSync(storage, JSON.stringify(rec, null, 2), 'utf8');
 44315: }
 44316: 
 44317: export function loadLicense(): LicenseRecord | null {
 44318:   try {
 44319:     const storage = getStoragePath();
 44320:     if (!fs.existsSync(storage)) return null;
 44321:     const raw = fs.readFileSync(storage, 'utf8');
 44322:     return JSON.parse(raw) as LicenseRecord;
 44323:   } catch (e) {
 44324:     return null;
 44325:   }
 44326: }
 44327: 
 44328: export function readTokenFromFile(): string | null {
 44329:   const p = process.env.GUMROAD_TOKEN_FILE;
 44330:   if (!p) return null;
 44331:   try {
 44332:     if (!fs.existsSync(p)) return null;
 44333:     return fs.readFileSync(p, 'utf8').trim();
 44334:   } catch (e) {
 44335:     return null;
 44336:   }
 44337: }
 44338: 
 44339: export async function verifyWithGumroad(product_id: string, licenseKey: string, token: string) {
 44340:   // Gumroad license verify endpoint
 44341:   const url = 'https://api.gumroad.com/v2/licenses/verify';
 44342:   const body = { product_id, license_key: licenseKey };
 44343:   const res = await fetch(url, {
 44344:     method: 'POST',
 44345:     headers: { 'Content-Type': 'application/json', Authorization: `Bearer ${token}` },
 44346:     body: JSON.stringify(body),
 44347:   });
 44348:   if (!res.ok) throw new Error(`Gumroad API returned ${res.status}`);
 44349:   const json: any = await res.json();
 44350:   return json;
 44351: }
 44352: 
 44353: export function isLicenseValid(rec: LicenseRecord | null) {
 44354:   if (!rec) return false;
 44355:   if (rec.expiresAt && Date.now() > rec.expiresAt) return false;
 44356:   return true;
 44357: }
 44358: 
 44359: export async function activateLicense(product_id: string, licenseKey: string, token: string) {
 44360:   const data: any = await verifyWithGumroad(product_id, licenseKey, token);
 44361:   if (data && data.success) {
 44362:     const purchase = (data as any).purchase || {};
 44363:     const now = Date.now();
 44364:     const recurring = !!purchase.subscription_ended_at || !!purchase.subscription_cancelled_at ? false : !!purchase.subscription_id;
 44365:     const expiresAt = recurring ? null : now + 365 * 24 * 3600 * 1000; // 1 year default
 44366:     const rec = {
 44367:       key: licenseKey,
 44368:       product_id,
 44369:       createdAt: now,
 44370:       expiresAt,
 44371:       recurring,
 44372:       lastVerified: now,
 44373:       metadata: purchase,
 44374:     };
 44375:     saveLicense(rec as LicenseRecord);
 44376:     return rec;
 44377:   }
 44378:   throw new Error('License verification failed');
 44379: }
 44380: 
 44381: export function clearLicense() {
 44382:   try {
 44383:     const storage = getStoragePath();
 44384:     if (fs.existsSync(storage)) fs.unlinkSync(storage);
 44385:   } catch (e) {}
 44386: }
 44387: 
 44388: export default { saveLicense, loadLicense, verifyWithGumroad, activateLicense, isLicenseValid, clearLicense, readTokenFromFile };
 44389: 
 44390: 
 44391: 
 44392: ============================
 44393: FILE: src\utils\health.ts
 44394: ============================
 44395: ============================
 44396: // ROME-TAG: 0x1CA919
 44397: 
 44398: import http from 'http';
 44399: import net from 'net';
 44400: import { logger } from './logger';
 44401: 
 44402: export async function httpProbe(url: string, timeout = 2000): Promise<boolean> {
 44403:   return new Promise((resolve) => {
 44404:     const req = http.get(url, (res) => {
 44405:       res.resume();
 44406:       resolve(Boolean(res.statusCode && res.statusCode < 400));
 44407:     });
 44408:     req.on('error', () => resolve(false));
 44409:     req.setTimeout(timeout, () => {
 44410:       req.destroy();
 44411:       resolve(false);
 44412:     });
 44413:   });
 44414: }
 44415: 
 44416: export async function tcpProbe(host: string, port: number, timeout = 2000): Promise<boolean> {
 44417:   return new Promise((resolve) => {
 44418:     const s = new net.Socket();
 44419:     let done = false;
 44420:     s.setTimeout(timeout);
 44421:     s.on('connect', () => {
 44422:       done = true;
 44423:       s.destroy();
 44424:       resolve(true);
 44425:     });
 44426:     s.on('error', () => { if (!done) { done = true; resolve(false); } });
 44427:     s.on('timeout', () => { if (!done) { done = true; s.destroy(); resolve(false); } });
 44428:     s.connect(port, host);
 44429:   });
 44430: }
 44431: 
 44432: export async function waitForService(urlOrHost: string, port?: number, timeout = 5000) {
 44433:   const start = Date.now();
 44434:   while (Date.now() - start < timeout) {
 44435:     let ok = false;
 44436:     if (typeof port === 'number') {
 44437:       ok = await tcpProbe(urlOrHost, port, 1000);
 44438:     } else if (urlOrHost.startsWith('http')) {
 44439:       ok = await httpProbe(urlOrHost, 1000);
 44440:     }
 44441:     if (ok) return true;
 44442:     await new Promise((r) => setTimeout(r, 500));
 44443:   }
 44444:   return false;
 44445: }
 44446: 
 44447: 
 44448: 
 44449: ============================
 44450: FILE: src\utils\license.ts
 44451: ============================
 44452: ============================
 44453: // ROME-TAG: 0x3C04E4
 44454: 
 44455: import * as fs from 'fs';
 44456: import * as path from 'path';
 44457: import fetch from 'node-fetch';
 44458: 
 44459: const STORE = path.join(process.cwd(), '.qflush', 'license.json');
 44460: 
 44461: export type LicenseRecord = {
 44462:   key: string;
 44463:   product_id?: string;
 44464:   valid?: boolean;
 44465:   expires_at?: string | null;
 44466:   verifiedAt?: number;
 44467: };
 44468: 
 44469: function ensureDir() {
 44470:   const dir = path.dirname(STORE);
 44471:   if (!fs.existsSync(dir)) fs.mkdirSync(dir, { recursive: true });
 44472: }
 44473: 
 44474: export function readLicense(): LicenseRecord | null {
 44475:   try {
 44476:     if (!fs.existsSync(STORE)) return null;
 44477:     const raw = fs.readFileSync(STORE, 'utf8');
 44478:     return JSON.parse(raw) as LicenseRecord;
 44479:   } catch (e) {
 44480:     return null;
 44481:   }
 44482: }
 44483: 
 44484: export function saveLicense(rec: LicenseRecord) {
 44485:   try {
 44486:     ensureDir();
 44487:     fs.writeFileSync(STORE, JSON.stringify(rec, null, 2), 'utf8');
 44488:     return true;
 44489:   } catch (e) {
 44490:     return false;
 44491:   }
 44492: }
 44493: 
 44494: async function verifyWithGumroad(key: string, productId?: string) {
 44495:   const token = process.env.GUMROAD_TOKEN;
 44496:   if (!token) throw new Error('GUMROAD_TOKEN not configured');
 44497:   const url = `https://api.gumroad.com/v2/licenses/verify`;
 44498:   const body = new URLSearchParams();
 44499:   body.append('product_permalink', productId || '');
 44500:   body.append('license_key', key);
 44501: 
 44502:   const res = await fetch(url, { method: 'POST', body, headers: { Authorization: `Bearer ${token}` } });
 44503:   const json: any = await res.json();
 44504:   return json;
 44505: }
 44506: 
 44507: export async function activateLicense(key: string, productId?: string) {
 44508:   const resp: any = await verifyWithGumroad(key, productId);
 44509:   if (resp && (resp as any).success) {
 44510:     const purchase = (resp as any).purchase || {};
 44511:     const lic = { key, product_id: purchase.product_id || productId, valid: true, expires_at: purchase ? purchase.license_expires_at : null, verifiedAt: Date.now() } as LicenseRecord;
 44512:     saveLicense(lic);
 44513:     return { ok: true, license: lic, raw: resp };
 44514:   }
 44515:   // failure
 44516:   const lic = { key, product_id: productId, valid: false, verifiedAt: Date.now() } as LicenseRecord;
 44517:   saveLicense(lic);
 44518:   return { ok: false, error: resp };
 44519: }
 44520: 
 44521: export default { readLicense, saveLicense, activateLicense };
 44522: 
 44523:

 44526: FILE: src\utils\logger.ts
 44527: ============================

 44529: // ROME-TAG: 0x0E71A8
 44530: 
 44531: import colors from './colors';
 44532: 
 44533: export const logger = {
 44534:   info: (msg: string) => console.log(`\x1b[36m[QFLUSH]\x1b[0m ${msg}`),
 44535:   warn: (msg: string) => console.log(`\x1b[33m[QFLUSH]\x1b[0m ${msg}`),
 44536:   error: (msg: string) => console.error(`\x1b[31m[QFLUSH]\x1b[0m ${msg}`),
 44537:   success: (msg: string) => console.log(`\x1b[32m[QFLUSH]\x1b[0m ${msg}`),
 44538:   joker: (title: string, msg: string) => colors.styledLog(title, msg, { accent: 'joker' }),
 44539:   nez: (title: string, msg: string) => colors.styledLog(title, msg, { accent: 'base' }),
 44540:   neutral: (title: string, msg: string) => colors.styledLog(title, msg, { accent: 'neutral' }),
 44541: };
 44542: 
 44543: export default logger;
