 44546: 
 44547: ============================
 44548: FILE: src\utils\normalize.ts
 44549: ============================
 44550: ============================
 44551: import * as fs from 'fs';
 44552: 
 44553: export function stripRomeTagLines(textOrBuffer: string | Buffer): string {
 44554:   const txt = Buffer.isBuffer(textOrBuffer) ? textOrBuffer.toString('utf8') : textOrBuffer;
 44555:   const lines = txt.split(/\r?\n/);
 44556:   const out = lines.filter(l => !/^\s*\/\/\s*ROME-TAG:/i.test(l));
 44557:   return out.join('\n');
 44558: }
 44559: 
 44560: export function stripRomeTagFromFile(filePath: string): string {
 44561:   const raw = fs.readFileSync(filePath, 'utf8');
 44562:   return stripRomeTagLines(raw);
 44563: }
 44564: 
 44565: export default { stripRomeTagLines, stripRomeTagFromFile };
 44566: 
 44567: 
 44568: 
 44569: ============================
 44570: FILE: src\utils\npz.ts
 44571: ============================
 44572: ============================
 44573: // ROME-TAG: 0x1553F0
 44574: 
 44575: import { spawnSync } from 'child_process';
 44576: import { existsSync } from 'fs';
 44577: import * as path from 'path';
 44578: import logger from './logger';
 44579: import { SERVICE_MAP } from './paths';
 44580: 
 44581: export type ResolveResult = { gate: 'green' | 'yellow' | 'dlx' | 'fail'; cmd?: string; args?: string[]; cwd?: string };
 44582: 
 44583: function isWindows() {
 44584:   return process.platform === 'win32';
 44585: }
 44586: 
 44587: function findLocalBin(moduleName: string, cwd: string): string | null {
 44588:   // try node_modules/.bin/<name> or <pkg>/bin
 44589:   const localBin = path.join(cwd, 'node_modules', '.bin', moduleName + (isWindows() ? '.cmd' : ''));
 44590:   if (existsSync(localBin)) return localBin;
 44591:   // try package bin entry via require.resolve
 44592:   try {
 44593:     const pkgPath = require.resolve(moduleName, { paths: [cwd] });
 44594:     return pkgPath;
 44595:   } catch {
 44596:     return null;
 44597:   }
 44598: }
 44599: 
 44600: function resolveViaModuleGate(pkgName: string): { cmd: string; args: string[]; cwd?: string } | null {
 44601:   try {
 44602:     const pkgPath = require.resolve(pkgName);
 44603:     // run via node <pkgPath>
 44604:     return { cmd: process.execPath, args: [pkgPath], cwd: path.dirname(pkgPath) };
 44605:   } catch {
 44606:     return null;
 44607:   }
 44608: }
 44609: 
 44610: export function npzResolve(nameOrPkg: string, opts: { cwd?: string } = {}): ResolveResult {
 44611:   const cwd = opts.cwd || process.cwd();
 44612: 
 44613:   // Gate 0: if nameOrPkg matches a known SERVICE_MAP package, prefer local candidates in workspace
 44614:   try {
 44615:     for (const key of Object.keys(SERVICE_MAP)) {
 44616:       if (SERVICE_MAP[key].pkg === nameOrPkg) {
 44617:         const tries = SERVICE_MAP[key].candidates || [];
 44618:         for (const t of tries) {
 44619:           const candidatePath = path.join(cwd, t);
 44620:           try {
 44621:             if (!existsSync(candidatePath)) continue;
 44622:             // prefer dist entry if exists
 44623:             const distEntry = path.join(candidatePath, 'dist', 'index.js');
 44624:             if (existsSync(distEntry)) {
 44625:               logger.nez && logger.nez('NPZ:JOKER', `${nameOrPkg} -> local dist ${distEntry}`);
 44626:               return { gate: 'green', cmd: process.execPath, args: [distEntry], cwd: path.dirname(distEntry) };
 44627:             }
 44628:             // otherwise if package.json with start script exists, prefer npm --prefix <candidate> run start
 44629:             const pkgJsonPath = path.join(candidatePath, 'package.json');
 44630:             if (existsSync(pkgJsonPath)) {
 44631:               try {
 44632:                 const pj = require(pkgJsonPath);
 44633:                 if (pj && pj.scripts && pj.scripts.start) {
 44634:                   logger.nez && logger.nez('NPZ:JOKER', `${nameOrPkg} -> local start script at ${candidatePath}`);
 44635:                   return { gate: 'green', cmd: 'npm', args: ['--prefix', candidatePath, 'run', 'start'], cwd: candidatePath };
 44636:                 }
 44637:               } catch (e) {
 44638:                 // ignore
 44639:               }
 44640:             }
 44641:           } catch (e) {
 44642:             // ignore candidate
 44643:           }
 44644:         }
 44645:         break;
 44646:       }
 44647:     }
 44648:   } catch (e) {
 44649:     // ignore
 44650:   }
 44651: 
 44652:   // Gate 1: GREEN - local bin
 44653:   const local = findLocalBin(nameOrPkg, cwd);
 44654:   if (local) {
 44655:     logger.nez && logger.nez('NPZ:JOKER', `${nameOrPkg} -> ${local}`);
 44656:     return { gate: 'green', cmd: local, args: [], cwd };
 44657:   }
 44658: 
 44659:   // Gate 2: YELLOW - module resolution
 44660:   const mod = resolveViaModuleGate(nameOrPkg);
 44661:   if (mod) {
 44662:     logger.nez && logger.nez('NPZ:JOKER', `${nameOrPkg} -> ${mod.cmd} ${mod.args.join(' ')}`);
 44663:     return { gate: 'yellow', cmd: mod.cmd, args: mod.args, cwd: mod.cwd };
 44664:   }
 44665: 
 44666:   // Gate 3: DLX - use npm exec as modern fallback, fallback to npx if needed
 44667:   try {
 44668:     // prefer `npm exec -- <pkg>` which is the modern replacement for npx (npm v7+)
 44669:     // This will allow running installed or remote packages consistently.
 44670:     logger.joker && logger.joker('NPZ:JOKER', `${nameOrPkg} -> npm exec`);
 44671:     return { gate: 'dlx', cmd: 'npm', args: ['exec', '--', nameOrPkg], cwd };
 44672:   } catch (err) {
 44673:     // last-resort: npx
 44674:     try {
 44675:       logger.joker && logger.joker('NPZ:JOKER', `${nameOrPkg} -> npx`);
 44676:       return { gate: 'dlx', cmd: 'npx', args: [nameOrPkg], cwd };
 44677:     } catch (e) {
 44678:       logger.warn && logger.warn(`[NPZ:JOKER][FAIL] ${nameOrPkg} cannot be resolved`);
 44679:       return { gate: 'fail' };
 44680:     }
 44681:   }
 44682: }
 44683: 
 44684: export function runResolved(res: ResolveResult): { ok: boolean; status?: number } {
 44685:   if (!res.cmd) return { ok: false };
 44686:   const args = res.args || [];
 44687:   logger.nez && logger.nez('NPZ:JOKER', `running ${res.cmd} ${args.join(' ')}`);
 44688:   try {
 44689:     const r = spawnSync(res.cmd, args, { stdio: 'inherit', cwd: res.cwd || process.cwd(), shell: false });
 44690:     return { ok: r.status === 0, status: r.status ?? undefined };
 44691:   } catch (err) {
 44692:     logger.error && logger.error(`[NPZ:JOKER] failed to run ${err}`);
 44693:     return { ok: false };
 44694:   }
 44695: }
 44696: 
 44697: export default { npzResolve, runResolved };
 44698: 
 44699: 
 44700: 
 44701: ============================
 44702: FILE: src\utils\NPZ_README.md
 44703: ============================
 44704: ============================
 44705: # NPZ Joker (Gotham Customs) v2.0
 44706: 
 44707: NPZ ("Joker") is the internal resolver/router used by qflush to start modules and proxy requests across multiple lanes (primary/backup). It provides:
 44708: 
 44709: - Gate-based resolver for binaries/modules: GREEN (local bin), YELLOW (module), DLX (npx), FAIL
 44710: - HTTP proxy router with T0/T1/T2 flow: try primary, fallback, then replay primary with extra header
 44711: - Douane (customs) checks before starting modules (env, files, ports)
 44712: - Request tracking with `npz_id` and optional Redis store
 44713: - Circuit breaker per-host per-lane and adaptive preferred lane ordering
 44714: - Prometheus metrics and an admin API
 44715: 
 44716: ## v2.0 changes
 44717: 
 44718: - Namespaced keys and metrics via `NPZ_NAMESPACE` to avoid cross-app conflicts
 44719: - Redis-backed store optional via `REDIS_URL`
 44720: - Prometheus metrics and `/metrics` endpoint
 44721: - Admin endpoints protected by `NPZ_ADMIN_TOKEN`
 44722: - NPZ integrated as primary resolver for `qflush start` and as middleware in the daemon
 44723: 
 44724: Usage
 44725: 
 44726: - Middleware: `npzMiddleware()` to proxy requests via `/proxy` route
 44727: - Admin: `/npz/inspect/:id`, `/npz/lanes`, `/npz/preferred/:host`, `/npz/circuit/:host` (protected by `NPZ_ADMIN_TOKEN` header or `?token=`)
 44728: - Metrics: `/metrics` endpoint
 44729: 
 44730: Environment
 44731: 
 44732: - `REDIS_URL` to enable Redis-backed store
 44733: - `NPZ_ADMIN_TOKEN` to protect admin endpoints
 44734: - `qflushD_PORT` to set the daemon port
 44735: 
 44736: Files of interest
 44737: 
 44738: - `src/utils/npz.ts` - Joker resolver
 44739: - `src/utils/npz-router.ts` - HTTP router with lanes and circuit breaker
 44740: - `src/utils/npz-customs.ts` - customs scanners
 44741: - `src/utils/npz-middleware.ts` - Express middleware for proxying and tracking
 44742: - `src/utils/npz-store.ts` - unified store (file or redis)
 44743: - `src/utils/npz-store-redis.ts` - Redis-backed store
 44744: - `src/utils/npz-metrics.ts` - /metrics middleware
 44745: - `src/utils/npz-admin.ts` - admin endpoints
 44746: 
 44747: Example
 44748: 
 44749: Start the daemon:
 44750: 
 44751: ```
 44752: REDIS_URL=redis://127.0.0.1:6379 NPZ_ADMIN_TOKEN=secret node dist/daemon/qflushd.js
 44753: ```
 44754: 
 44755: Proxy a request (example):
 44756: 
 44757: ```
 44758: curl -v http://localhost:4500/proxy/api/health
 44759: 
 44760: 
 44761: 
 44762: 
 44763: 
 44764: 
 44765: ============================
 44766: FILE: src\utils\npz-admin.ts
 44767: ============================
 44768: ============================
 44769: // ROME-TAG: 0x332555
 44770: 
 44771: import express from 'express';
 44772: import npzStore from './npz-store';
 44773: import npzRouter from './npz-router';
 44774: import engine from './npz-engine';
 44775: import { stringify } from 'csv-stringify/sync';
 44776: import { isAdminAuthorized } from './auth';
 44777: 
 44778: const router = express.Router();
 44779: 
 44780: function requireToken(req: any, res: any, next: any) {
 44781:   if (!isAdminAuthorized(req)) return res.status(401).json({ error: 'unauthorized' });
 44782:   next();
 44783: }
 44784: 
 44785: router.use('/npz', requireToken);
 44786: 
 44787: router.get('/npz/inspect/:id', async (req: any, res: any) => {
 44788:   const r = await npzStore.getRequestRecord(req.params.id);
 44789:   res.json(r || { error: 'not found' });
 44790: });
 44791: 
 44792: router.get('/npz/lanes', (req: any, res: any) => {
 44793:   res.json(npzRouter.DEFAULT_LANES);
 44794: });
 44795: 
 44796: router.get('/npz/preferred/:host', (req: any, res: any) => {
 44797:   const host = req.params.host;
 44798:   const pref = npzRouter.getPreferredLane(host);
 44799:   res.json({ host, preferred: pref });
 44800: });
 44801: 
 44802: router.get('/npz/circuit/:host', (req: any, res: any) => {
 44803:   const host = req.params.host;
 44804:   const state = npzRouter.getCircuitState(host);
 44805:   res.json(state);
 44806: });
 44807: 
 44808: // Admin scores endpoint
 44809: router.get('/npz/scores', (req: any, res: any) => {
 44810:   try {
 44811:     const store = engine.getStore();
 44812:     const items = Object.values(store).map((r: any) => ({ laneId: r.laneId, score: r.score, lastSuccess: r.lastSuccess, lastFailure: r.lastFailure }));
 44813:     items.sort((a: any, b: any) => a.score - b.score);
 44814:     res.json(items);
 44815:   } catch (err) {
 44816:     res.status(500).json({ error: String(err) });
 44817:   }
 44818: });
 44819: 
 44820: router.post('/npz/scores/reset', (req: any, res: any) => {
 44821:   try {
 44822:     engine.resetScores();
 44823:     res.json({ ok: true });
 44824:   } catch (err) {
 44825:     res.status(500).json({ error: String(err) });
 44826:   }
 44827: });
 44828: 
 44829: router.get('/npz/scores.csv', (req: any, res: any) => {
 44830:   try {
 44831:     const store = engine.getStore();
 44832:     const items = Object.values(store).map((r: any) => ({ laneId: r.laneId, score: r.score, lastSuccess: r.lastSuccess, lastFailure: r.lastFailure }));
 44833:     items.sort((a: any, b: any) => a.score - b.score);
 44834:     const csv = stringify(items, { header: true });
 44835:     res.set('Content-Type', 'text/csv');
 44836:     res.send(csv);
 44837:   } catch (err) {
 44838:     res.status(500).json({ error: String(err) });
 44839:   }
 44840: });
 44841: 
 44842: export default router;
 44843: 
 44844: 
 44845: 
 44846: ============================
 44847: FILE: src\utils\npz-config.ts
 44848: ============================
 44849: ============================
 44850: // ROME-TAG: 0x925520
 44851: 
 44852: import crypto from 'crypto';
 44853: 
 44854: export function getNpzNamespace(): string {
 44855:   // allow override
 44856:   const env = process.env.NPZ_NAMESPACE;
 44857:   if (env && env.trim().length > 0) return env.trim();
 44858: 
 44859:   const seed = 'npz';
 44860:   try {
 44861:     // try to require the nezlephant package directly to avoid loading the whole lib index
 44862:     // which may pull packages that are not compatible in the runner.
 44863:      
 44864:     const nez = require('@funeste38/nezlephant');
 44865:     if (nez) {
 44866:       if (typeof nez.encode === 'function') {
 44867:         const out = nez.encode(seed);
 44868:         if (typeof out === 'string' && out.length >= 8) return out.slice(0, 8);
 44869:       }
 44870:       if (typeof nez.hash === 'function') {
 44871:         const h = nez.hash(seed);
 44872:         if (typeof h === 'string' && h.length >= 8) return h.slice(0, 8);
 44873:       }
 44874:     }
 44875:   } catch (e) {
 44876:     // ignore and fallback
 44877:   }
 44878: 
 44879:   // fallback: sha256(seed) and take first 4 bytes (8 hex chars)
 44880:   const hash = crypto.createHash('sha256').update(seed).digest('hex').slice(0, 8);
 44881:   return hash;
 44882: }
 44883: 
 44884: export default { getNpzNamespace };
 44885: 
 44886: 
 44887: 
 44888: ============================
 44889: FILE: src\utils\npz-customs.ts
 44890: ============================
 44891: ============================
 44892: // ROME-TAG: 0x91FBE1
 44893: 
 44894: import * as fs from 'fs';
 44895: import * as path from 'path';
 44896: import * as net from 'net';
 44897: import alias from './alias';
 44898: const logger = alias.importUtil('@utils/logger') || alias.importUtil('./logger') || console;
 44899: 
 44900: export type ModuleDescriptor = {
 44901:   name: string;
 44902:   pkg?: string;
 44903:   cwd: string;
 44904:   requiredEnv?: string[];
 44905:   requiredFiles?: string[];
 44906:   requiredPorts?: number[];
 44907: };
 44908: 
 44909: export type CustomsIssue = {
 44910:   level: 'info' | 'warning' | 'block';
 44911:   code: string;
 44912:   message: string;
 44913: };
 44914: 
 44915: export type CustomsReport = {
 44916:   module: string;
 44917:   issues: CustomsIssue[];
 44918: };
 44919: 
 44920: export type CustomsScanner = (mod: ModuleDescriptor) => Promise<CustomsIssue[]>;
 44921: 
 44922: export const MODULES: ModuleDescriptor[] = [
 44923:   { name: 'freeland', pkg: '@funeste38/freeland', cwd: process.cwd(), requiredEnv: ['FREELAND_DB_URL'], requiredFiles: ['freeland.config.json'] },
 44924:   { name: 'bat', pkg: '@funeste38/bat', cwd: process.cwd(), requiredEnv: ['BAT_TOKEN'], requiredFiles: ['bat.config.json'] },
 44925: ];
 44926: 
 44927: export const envScanner: CustomsScanner = async (mod) => {
 44928:   const issues: CustomsIssue[] = [];
 44929:   const required = mod.requiredEnv || [];
 44930:   for (const key of required) {
 44931:     if (!process.env[key]) {
 44932:       issues.push({ level: 'block', code: 'MISSING_ENV', message: `Missing env var: ${key}` });
 44933:     }
 44934:   }
 44935:   return issues;
 44936: };
 44937: 
 44938: export const fileScanner: CustomsScanner = async (mod) => {
 44939:   const issues: CustomsIssue[] = [];
 44940:   const required = mod.requiredFiles || [];
 44941:   for (const rel of required) {
 44942:     const full = path.join(mod.cwd, rel);
 44943:     if (!fs.existsSync(full)) {
 44944:       issues.push({ level: 'warning', code: 'MISSING_FILE', message: `Config file not found: ${rel}` });
 44945:     }
 44946:   }
 44947:   return issues;
 44948: };
 44949: 
 44950: function checkPortInUse(port: number): Promise<boolean> {
 44951:   return new Promise((resolve) => {
 44952:     const server = net.createServer();
 44953:     server.once('error', () => resolve(true));
 44954:     server.once('listening', () => {
 44955:       server.close(() => resolve(false));
 44956:     });
 44957:     server.listen(port, '127.0.0.1');
 44958:   });
 44959: }
 44960: 
 44961: export const portScanner: CustomsScanner = async (mod) => {
 44962:   const issues: CustomsIssue[] = [];
 44963:   const ports = mod.requiredPorts || [];
 44964:   for (const port of ports) {
 44965:     if (await checkPortInUse(port)) {
 44966:       issues.push({ level: 'block', code: 'PORT_IN_USE', message: `Port ${port} already in use` });
 44967:     }
 44968:   }
 44969:   return issues;
 44970: };
 44971: 
 44972: const SCANNERS: CustomsScanner[] = [envScanner, fileScanner, portScanner];
 44973: 
 44974: export async function runCustomsCheck(mod: ModuleDescriptor): Promise<CustomsReport> {
 44975:   const issues: CustomsIssue[] = [];
 44976:   for (const scanner of SCANNERS) {
 44977:     try {
 44978:       const res = await scanner(mod);
 44979:       if (res && res.length) issues.push(...res);
 44980:     } catch (err) {
 44981:       logger.warn(`customs: scanner error for ${mod.name} ${err}`);
 44982:     }
 44983:   }
 44984: 
 44985:   if (issues.length === 0) {
 44986:     logger.info(`[NPZ][CUSTOMS][PASS] ${mod.name} - all clear`);
 44987:   } else {
 44988:     for (const issue of issues) {
 44989:       const tag = issue.level.toUpperCase();
 44990:       if (issue.level === 'block') logger.warn(`[NPZ][CUSTOMS][${tag}] ${mod.name} - ${issue.message}`);
 44991:       else logger.info(`[NPZ][CUSTOMS][${tag}] ${mod.name} - ${issue.message}`);
 44992:     }
 44993:   }
 44994: 
 44995:   return { module: mod.name, issues };
 44996: }
 44997: 
 44998: export function hasBlockingIssues(report: CustomsReport): boolean {
 44999:   return report.issues.some((i) => i.level === 'block');
 45000: }
 45001: 
 45002: export default {
 45003:   MODULES,
 45004:   runCustomsCheck,
 45005:   hasBlockingIssues,
 45006: };
 45007: 
 45008: 
 45009: 
 45010: ============================
 45011: FILE: src\utils\npz-engine.ts
 45012: ============================
 45013: ============================
 45014: // ROME-TAG: 0x043BA9
 45015: 
 45016: import { getNpzNamespace } from './npz-config';
 45017: import fs from 'fs';
 45018: import path from 'path';
 45019: import logger from './logger';
 45020: import { Lane } from './npz-router';
 45021: 
 45022: const NS = getNpzNamespace();
 45023: const ENGINE_FILE = path.join(process.cwd(), '.qflush', `${NS}-npz-engine.json`);
 45024: 
 45025: type ScoreRecord = {
 45026:   laneId: number;
 45027:   score: number; // lower is better
 45028:   lastSuccess?: number;
 45029:   lastFailure?: number;
 45030: };
 45031: 
 45032: type EngineStore = Record<number, ScoreRecord>;
 45033: 
 45034: let store: EngineStore = {};
 45035: 
 45036: // decay parameters
 45037: const DECAY_INTERVAL_MS = 60 * 1000; // every minute
 45038: const DECAY_FACTOR = 0.9; // multiply score by this every decay interval (towards 0)
 45039: 
 45040: function ensureDir() {
 45041:   const dir = path.dirname(ENGINE_FILE);
 45042:   if (!fs.existsSync(dir)) fs.mkdirSync(dir, { recursive: true });
 45043: }
 45044: 
 45045: function load() {
 45046:   try {
 45047:     if (fs.existsSync(ENGINE_FILE)) {
 45048:       const raw = fs.readFileSync(ENGINE_FILE, 'utf8');
 45049:       store = JSON.parse(raw) as EngineStore;
 45050:     }
 45051:   } catch (e) {
 45052:     store = {};
 45053:   }
 45054: }
 45055: 
 45056: function persist() {
 45057:   try {
 45058:     ensureDir();
 45059:     fs.writeFileSync(ENGINE_FILE, JSON.stringify(store, null, 2), 'utf8');
 45060:   } catch (e) {}
 45061: }
 45062: 
 45063: function applyDecay() {
 45064:   const now = Date.now();
 45065:   let changed = false;
 45066:   for (const k of Object.keys(store)) {
 45067:     const id = Number(k);
 45068:     const rec = store[id];
 45069:     if (!rec) continue;
 45070:     // compute how many intervals since lastSuccess/lastFailure (use lastFailure as activity reference)
 45071:     const ref = rec.lastFailure || rec.lastSuccess || now;
 45072:     const intervals = Math.floor((now - ref) / DECAY_INTERVAL_MS);
 45073:     if (intervals <= 0) continue;
 45074:     const factor = Math.pow(DECAY_FACTOR, intervals);
 45075:     const newScore = rec.score * factor;
 45076:     if (Math.abs(newScore - rec.score) > 1e-6) {
 45077:       rec.score = newScore;
 45078:       changed = true;
 45079:     }
 45080:   }
 45081:   if (changed) persist();
 45082: }
 45083: 
 45084: load();
 45085: 
 45086: // schedule periodic decay in-memory (best-effort)
 45087: setInterval(() => {
 45088:   try { applyDecay(); } catch (e) {}
 45089: }, DECAY_INTERVAL_MS);
 45090: 
 45091: /**
 45092:  * Adjust lane score.
 45093:  * delta: positive increases penalty (worse), negative decreases (better).
 45094:  * latencyMs: optional latency observed to weight the delta.
 45095:  */
 45096: export function scoreLane(laneId: number, delta: number, latencyMs?: number) {
 45097:   let rec = store[laneId];
 45098:   if (!rec) rec = { laneId, score: 0 };
 45099:   // weight delta by latency (if provided): normalized over 1000ms
 45100:   let weight = 1;
 45101:   if (latencyMs && latencyMs > 0) weight += Math.min(5, latencyMs / 1000); // cap weight
 45102:   rec.score = (rec.score || 0) + delta * weight;
 45103:   if (delta < 0) rec.lastSuccess = Date.now();
 45104:   if (delta > 0) rec.lastFailure = Date.now();
 45105:   store[laneId] = rec;
 45106:   persist();
 45107: }
 45108: 
 45109: export function getLaneScore(laneId: number) {
 45110:   const rec = store[laneId];
 45111:   if (!rec) return 0;
 45112:   // apply decay relative to now on read (non-persistent)
 45113:   const now = Date.now();
 45114:   const ref = rec.lastFailure || rec.lastSuccess || now;
 45115:   const intervals = Math.floor((now - ref) / DECAY_INTERVAL_MS);
 45116:   const factor = Math.pow(DECAY_FACTOR, intervals);
 45117:   return rec.score * factor;
 45118: }
 45119: 
 45120: export function orderLanesByScore(lanes: Lane[]) {
 45121:   // return copy sorted by score asc
 45122:   const out = lanes.slice();
 45123:   out.sort((a, b) => getLaneScore(a.id) - getLaneScore(b.id));
 45124:   return out;
 45125: }
 45126: 
 45127: export function resetScores() {
 45128:   store = {};
 45129:   persist();
 45130: }
 45131: 
 45132: export function getStore() {
 45133:   return store;
 45134: }
 45135: 
 45136: export default { scoreLane, getLaneScore, orderLanesByScore, resetScores, getStore };
 45137: 
 45138: 
 45139: 
 45140: 
 45141: ============================
 45142: FILE: src\utils\npz-metrics.ts
 45143: ============================
 45144: ============================
 45145: // ROME-TAG: 0x41A515
 45146: 
 45147: import client from 'prom-client';
 45148: import { Request, Response, NextFunction } from 'express';
 45149: 
 45150: client.collectDefaultMetrics();
 45151: 
 45152: export function metricsMiddleware() {
 45153:   const registry = client.register;
 45154:   return async function (req: Request, res: Response, next: NextFunction) {
 45155:     if (req.path === '/metrics') {
 45156:       res.set('Content-Type', registry.contentType);
 45157:       res.send(await registry.metrics());
 45158:       return;
 45159:     }
 45160:     next();
 45161:   };
 45162: }
 45163: 
 45164: export default metricsMiddleware;
 45165: 
 45166: 
 45167: 
 45168: ============================
 45169: FILE: src\utils\npz-middleware.ts
 45170: ============================
 45171: ============================
 45172: // ROME-TAG: 0x381550
 45173: 
 45174: import { Request, Response, NextFunction } from 'express';
 45175: import { v4 as uuidv4 } from 'uuid';
 45176: import { npzRoute } from './npz-router';
 45177: import npzStore from './npz-store';
 45178: import npz from './npz';
 45179: import logger from './logger';
 45180: import client from 'prom-client';
 45181: import { getNpzNamespace } from './npz-config';
 45182: 
 45183: const NS = getNpzNamespace();
 45184: const requestDuration = new client.Histogram({
 45185:   name: `${NS}_request_duration_seconds`,
 45186:   help: 'Duration of NPZ handled requests',
 45187:   labelNames: ['gate', 'lane', 'npz_id', 'namespace'] as string[],
 45188: });
 45189: 
 45190: export type NpzMiddlewareOptions = {
 45191:   lanes?: any[];
 45192:   cookieName?: string;
 45193:   cookieMaxAge?: number;
 45194: };
 45195: 
 45196: export function npzMiddleware(opts: NpzMiddlewareOptions = {}) {
 45197:   const cookieName = opts.cookieName || `${NS}_lane`;
 45198:   const lanes = opts.lanes || undefined;
 45199:   const maxAge = opts.cookieMaxAge || 24 * 3600; // seconds
 45200: 
 45201:   return async function (req: Request, res: Response, next: NextFunction) {
 45202:     const start = process.hrtime();
 45203:     try {
 45204:       // assign npz_id
 45205:       const npz_id = (req.headers['x-npz-id'] as string) || req.cookies?.['npz_id'] || uuidv4();
 45206:       res.cookie('npz_id', npz_id, { maxAge: maxAge * 1000, httpOnly: true });
 45207:       await npzStore.createRequestRecord(npz_id, { path: req.path, method: req.method });
 45208: 
 45209:       const fullUrl = req.protocol + '://' + req.get('host') + req.originalUrl;
 45210: 
 45211:       const report = await npzRoute({ method: req.method, url: fullUrl, headers: req.headers as any, body: (req as any).body });
 45212: 
 45213:       if (report && (report.status || report.body || report.error)) {
 45214:         // update record with lane if stored via router
 45215:         const rec = await npzStore.getRequestRecord(npz_id);
 45216:         const lane = rec?.laneId;
 45217:         if (lane !== undefined) {
 45218:           res.cookie(cookieName, String(lane), { maxAge: maxAge * 1000 });
 45219:         }
 45220: 
 45221:         // metrics
 45222:         const diff = process.hrtime(start);
 45223:         const duration = diff[0] + diff[1] / 1e9;
 45224:         const gate = (report as any).gate || 'unknown';
 45225:         const laneId = (report as any).laneId !== undefined ? String((report as any).laneId) : String(lane || 'unknown');
 45226:         requestDuration.labels(gate, laneId, npz_id, NS).observe(duration);
 45227: 
 45228:         logger.nez('NPZ', `npz_id=${npz_id} gate=${gate} lane=${laneId} duration=${duration.toFixed(3)}s`);
 45229: 
 45230:         if (report.status) res.status(report.status);
 45231:         // set headers (careful with set-cookie)
 45232:         if (report.headers) {
 45233:           try {
 45234:             for (const [k, v] of Object.entries(report.headers)) {
 45235:               if (k.toLowerCase() === 'set-cookie') continue;
 45236:               res.setHeader(k, v as any);
 45237:             }
 45238:           } catch (e) {}
 45239:         }
 45240:         res.send(report.body || (report.error ? String((report as any).error) : ''));
 45241:         return;
 45242:       }
 45243: 
 45244:       next();
 45245:     } catch (err) {
 45246:       logger.warn(`npz-middleware: error ${err}`);
 45247:       next();
 45248:     }
 45249:   };
 45250: }
 45251: 
 45252: export default npzMiddleware;
 45253: 
 45254: 
 45255: 
 45256: ============================
 45257: FILE: src\utils\npz-pourparler.ts
 45258: ============================
 45259: ============================
 45260: // ROME-TAG: 0x94B7C0
 45261: 
 45262: import crypto from 'crypto';
 45263: 
 45264: type Message = { id: string; role: 'user' | 'assistant' | 'system'; text: string; t: number };
 45265: 
 45266: type Session = { id: string; messages: Message[]; createdAt: number };
 45267: 
 45268: const SESSIONS: Map<string, Session> = new Map();
 45269: 
 45270: function id() { return Math.random().toString(36).slice(2,10); }
 45271: 
 45272: export function startSession(systemPrompt = ''): Session {
 45273:   const sid = 's_' + id();
 45274:   const s: Session = { id: sid, messages: [], createdAt: Date.now() };
 45275:   if (systemPrompt) s.messages.push({ id: 'm_' + id(), role: 'system', text: systemPrompt, t: Date.now() });
 45276:   SESSIONS.set(sid, s);
 45277:   return s;
 45278: }
 45279: 
 45280: export function sendMessage(sessionId: string, role: 'user' | 'assistant' | 'system', text: string) {
 45281:   const s = SESSIONS.get(sessionId);
 45282:   if (!s) throw new Error('session not found');
 45283:   const m: Message = { id: 'm_' + id(), role, text, t: Date.now() };
 45284:   s.messages.push(m);
 45285:   return m;
 45286: }
 45287: 
 45288: export function getHistory(sessionId: string) {
 45289:   const s = SESSIONS.get(sessionId);
 45290:   if (!s) return [] as Message[];
 45291:   return s.messages.slice();
 45292: }
 45293: 
 45294: export function endSession(sessionId: string) {
 45295:   return SESSIONS.delete(sessionId);
 45296: }
 45297: 
 45298: // --- New: ASCII 4-byte encoding + colorize helpers ---
 45299: 
 45300: function md5First4BytesHex(ch: string): string {
 45301:   // return first 4 bytes (8 hex chars) of md5 of the char
 45302:   const h = crypto.createHash('md5').update(ch).digest('hex');
 45303:   return h.slice(0, 8);
 45304: }
 45305: 
 45306: export function encodeAscii4(text: string): { ch: string; hex4: string }[] {
 45307:   const out: { ch: string; hex4: string }[] = [];
 45308:   for (const ch of text) {
 45309:     out.push({ ch, hex4: md5First4BytesHex(ch) });
 45310:   }
 45311:   return out;
 45312: }
 45313: 
 45314: function hexToRgb(hex: string) {
 45315:   const h = hex.replace('#', '');
 45316:   const r = parseInt(h.slice(0, 2), 16);
 45317:   const g = parseInt(h.slice(2, 4), 16);
 45318:   const b = parseInt(h.slice(4, 6), 16);
 45319:   return { r, g, b };
 45320: }
 45321: 
 45322: function byteToColor(b: number) {
 45323:   // map single byte [0..255] to a color by expanding into RGB via simple transform
 45324:   const r = (b * 3) % 256;
 45325:   const g = (b * 7) % 256;
 45326:   const b2 = (b * 13) % 256;
 45327:   return { r, g, b: b2 };
 45328: }
 45329: 
 45330: export function colorizeAscii4(text: string): string {
 45331:   // returns ANSI colored string: for each char produce a colored block based on its 4-byte hex
 45332:   const parts: string[] = [];
 45333:   for (const ch of text) {
 45334:     const hex4 = md5First4BytesHex(ch); // 8 hex chars
 45335:     // split into 4 bytes
 45336:     const bytes: number[] = [];
 45337:     for (let i = 0; i < 8; i += 2) bytes.push(parseInt(hex4.slice(i, i+2), 16));
 45338:     // pick a representative color from bytes
 45339:     const col = byteToColor(bytes[0]);
 45340:     const ansi = `\x1b[48;2;${col.r};${col.g};${col.b}m\x1b[38;2;0;0;0m ${ch} \x1b[0m`;
 45341:     parts.push(ansi);
 45342:   }
 45343:   return parts.join('');
 45344: }
 45345: 
 45346: export default { startSession, sendMessage, getHistory, endSession, encodeAscii4, colorizeAscii4 };
 45347: 
 45348: 
 45349: 
 45350: ============================
 45351: FILE: src\utils\npz-router.ts
 45352: ============================
 45353: ============================
 45354: // ROME-TAG: 0xB3686C
 45355: 
 45356: import fs from 'fs';
 45357: import path from 'path';
 45358: import { performance } from 'perf_hooks';
 45359: import logger from './logger';
 45360: import client from 'prom-client';
 45361: import { getNpzNamespace } from './npz-config';
 45362: import engine from './npz-engine';
 45363: 
 45364: const NS = getNpzNamespace();
 45365: 
 45366: export type Lane = { id: number; name: string; url: string };
 45367: 
 45368: export const DEFAULT_LANES: Lane[] = [
 45369:   { id: 0, name: 'primary', url: 'https://api.primary.local' },
 45370:   { id: 1, name: 'backup-fast', url: 'https://fast.api.local' },
 45371:   { id: 2, name: 'backup-slow', url: 'https://slow.api.local' },
 45372: ];
 45373: 
 45374: const STORE_FILE = path.join(process.cwd(), '.qflash', `${NS}-npz-lanes.json`);
 45375: const DEFAULT_TIMEOUT = 3000; // ms
 45376: const PREFERRED_TTL = 24 * 3600 * 1000; // 24h
 45377: 
 45378: // Circuit breaker settings
 45379: const FAIL_THRESHOLD = 3; // failures
 45380: const FAIL_WINDOW_MS = 60 * 1000; // 1m
 45381: const COOLDOWN_MS = 5 * 60 * 1000; // 5m
 45382: 
 45383: type Store = Record<string, { laneId: number; ts: number }>;
 45384: 
 45385: type CircuitState = {
 45386:   failures: number;
 45387:   firstFailureTs?: number;
 45388:   trippedUntil?: number;
 45389: };
 45390: 
 45391: const circuit: Map<string, Map<number, CircuitState>> = new Map(); // host -> laneId -> state
 45392: 
 45393: // Prometheus metrics
 45394: const laneSuccess = new client.Counter({ name: `${NS}_lane_success_total`, help: 'NPZ lane successes', labelNames: ['host', 'lane', 'namespace'] });
 45395: const laneFailure = new client.Counter({ name: `${NS}_lane_failure_total`, help: 'NPZ lane failures', labelNames: ['host', 'lane', 'namespace'] });
 45396: 
 45397: function ensureStoreDir() {
 45398:   const dir = path.dirname(STORE_FILE);
 45399:   if (!fs.existsSync(dir)) fs.mkdirSync(dir, { recursive: true });
 45400: }
 45401: 
 45402: function readStore(): Store {
 45403:   try {
 45404:     if (!fs.existsSync(STORE_FILE)) return {};
 45405:     const raw = fs.readFileSync(STORE_FILE, 'utf8');
 45406:     return JSON.parse(raw) as Store;
 45407:   } catch (err) {
 45408:     logger.warn(`npz-router: failed to read store ${err}`);
 45409:     return {};
 45410:   }
 45411: }
 45412: 
 45413: function writeStore(s: Store) {
 45414:   try {
 45415:     ensureStoreDir();
 45416:     fs.writeFileSync(STORE_FILE, JSON.stringify(s, null, 2), 'utf8');
 45417:   } catch (err) {
 45418:     logger.warn(`npz-router: failed to write store ${err}`);
 45419:   }
 45420: }
 45421: 
 45422: export function getPreferredLane(host: string): number | null {
 45423:   const s = readStore();
 45424:   const entry = s[host];
 45425:   if (!entry) return null;
 45426:   if (Date.now() - entry.ts > PREFERRED_TTL) return null;
 45427:   return entry.laneId;
 45428: }
 45429: 
 45430: export function setPreferredLane(host: string, laneId: number) {
 45431:   const s = readStore();
 45432:   s[host] = { laneId, ts: Date.now() };
 45433:   writeStore(s);
 45434: }
 45435: 
 45436: export function lanesForHost(host: string, lanes: Lane[] = DEFAULT_LANES): Lane[] {
 45437:   const pref = getPreferredLane(host);
 45438:   // first let engine reorder by score
 45439:   const ordered = engine.orderLanesByScore(lanes);
 45440:   // then apply preferred lane override
 45441:   if (pref === null) return ordered.slice();
 45442:   const idx = ordered.findIndex((l) => l.id === pref);
 45443:   if (idx <= 0) return ordered.slice();
 45444:   const res = [ordered[idx], ...ordered.slice(0, idx), ...ordered.slice(idx + 1)];
 45445:   return res;
 45446: }
 45447: 
 45448: // Circuit breaker helpers
 45449: function getCircuitMapForHost(host: string) {
 45450:   let m = circuit.get(host);
 45451:   if (!m) {
 45452:     m = new Map();
 45453:     circuit.set(host, m);
 45454:   }
 45455:   return m;
 45456: }
 45457: 
 45458: export function recordFailure(host: string, laneId: number, latencyMs?: number) {
 45459:   const m = getCircuitMapForHost(host);
 45460:   const now = Date.now();
 45461:   const st = m.get(laneId) || { failures: 0 };
 45462:   if (!st.firstFailureTs || now - (st.firstFailureTs || 0) > FAIL_WINDOW_MS) {
 45463:     st.failures = 1;
 45464:     st.firstFailureTs = now;
 45465:   } else {
 45466:     st.failures = (st.failures || 0) + 1;
 45467:   }
 45468:   if (st.failures >= FAIL_THRESHOLD) {
 45469:     st.trippedUntil = now + COOLDOWN_MS;
 45470:     logger.warn(`npz-router: lane ${laneId} for ${host} tripped until ${new Date(st.trippedUntil)}`);
 45471:   }
 45472:   m.set(laneId, st);
 45473:   try { laneFailure.inc({ host, lane: String(laneId), namespace: NS } as any); } catch {}
 45474:   try { engine.scoreLane(laneId, 1, latencyMs); } catch {}
 45475: }
 45476: 
 45477: export function recordSuccess(host: string, laneId: number, latencyMs?: number) {
 45478:   const m = getCircuitMapForHost(host);
 45479:   m.delete(laneId);
 45480:   try { laneSuccess.inc({ host, lane: String(laneId), namespace: NS } as any); } catch {}
 45481:   try { engine.scoreLane(laneId, -1, latencyMs); } catch {}
 45482: }
 45483: 
 45484: export function isLaneTripped(host: string, laneId: number): boolean {
 45485:   const m = circuit.get(host);
 45486:   if (!m) return false;
 45487:   const st = m.get(laneId);
 45488:   if (!st) return false;
 45489:   if (st.trippedUntil && Date.now() < st.trippedUntil) return true;
 45490:   // cooldown passed
 45491:   if (st.trippedUntil && Date.now() >= st.trippedUntil) {
 45492:     m.delete(laneId);
 45493:     return false;
 45494:   }
 45495:   return false;
 45496: }
 45497: 
 45498: // lightweight fetch wrapper that returns {status, headers, body, durationMs}
 45499: async function tryFetch(fullUrl: string, options: any = {}, timeout = DEFAULT_TIMEOUT) {
 45500:   const controller = typeof AbortController !== 'undefined' ? new AbortController() : null;
 45501:   const signalOpt = controller ? { signal: controller.signal } : {};
 45502:   const opts = { method: options.method || 'GET', headers: options.headers || {}, body: options.body, ...signalOpt };
 45503:   let timer: NodeJS.Timeout | null = null;
 45504:   const start = performance.now();
 45505:   if (controller) timer = setTimeout(() => controller.abort(), timeout);
 45506:   try {
 45507:     // prefer global fetch
 45508:     let ff: any = (globalThis as any).fetch;
 45509:     if (!ff) {
 45510:       try {
 45511:          
 45512:         ff = require('undici').fetch;
 45513:       } catch (e) {
 45514:         throw new Error('No fetch available (install undici or use Node 18+)');
 45515:       }
 45516:     }
 45517:     const res = await ff(fullUrl, opts);
 45518:     const text = await res.text();
 45519:     if (timer) clearTimeout(timer);
 45520:     const duration = Math.max(0, Math.round(performance.now() - start));
 45521:     return { ok: true, status: res.status, headers: res.headers, body: text, durationMs: duration };
 45522:   } catch (err: any) {
 45523:     if (timer) clearTimeout(timer);
 45524:     const duration = Math.max(0, Math.round(performance.now() - start));
 45525:     return { ok: false, error: err, durationMs: duration };
 45526:   }
 45527: }
 45528: 
 45529: export type NpzRequest = { method?: string; url: string; headers?: Record<string, string>; body?: any; timeout?: number };
 45530: export type NpzResponse = { status?: number; headers?: any; body?: string; error?: any; gate?: string; laneId?: number; durationMs?: number };
 45531: 
 45532: export async function npzRoute(req: NpzRequest, lanes: Lane[] = DEFAULT_LANES): Promise<NpzResponse> {
 45533:   try {
 45534:     const urlObj = new URL(req.url);
 45535:     const host = urlObj.host;
 45536:     const ordered = lanesForHost(host) as Lane[];
 45537: 
 45538:     // attempt primary
 45539:     const primary = ordered[0];
 45540:     const primaryUrl = req.url.replace(urlObj.origin, primary.url);
 45541:     const timeout = req.timeout || DEFAULT_TIMEOUT;
 45542: 
 45543:     logger.nez('NPZ', `attempting primary lane ${primary.name} -> ${primaryUrl}`);
 45544:     const t0 = await tryFetch(primaryUrl, { method: req.method, headers: req.headers, body: req.body }, timeout);
 45545: 
 45546:     if (t0.ok && t0.status && t0.status < 500) {
 45547:       logger.nez('NPZ', `primary succeeded (${primary.name})`);
 45548:       setPreferredLane(host, primary.id);
 45549:       recordSuccess(host, primary.id, t0.durationMs);
 45550:       return { status: t0.status, headers: t0.headers, body: t0.body, gate: 'primary', laneId: primary.id, durationMs: t0.durationMs };
 45551:     }
 45552: 
 45553:     // primary failed -> try fallback(s)
 45554:     logger.warn(`[NPZ] primary failed for ${primary.name}, running fallbacks`);
 45555:     recordFailure(host, primary.id, t0.durationMs);
 45556: 
 45557:     for (let i = 1; i < ordered.length; i++) {
 45558:       const lane = ordered[i];
 45559:       const laneUrl = req.url.replace(urlObj.origin, lane.url);
 45560:       logger.nez('NPZ', `trying fallback lane ${lane.name} -> ${laneUrl}`);
 45561:       const res = await tryFetch(laneUrl, { method: req.method, headers: req.headers, body: req.body }, timeout);
 45562:       if (res.ok && res.status && res.status < 500) {
 45563:         logger.nez('NPZ', `fallback lane ${lane.name} succeeded`);
 45564:         // set preferred to fallback for next time
 45565:         setPreferredLane(host, lane.id);
 45566:         recordSuccess(host, lane.id, res.durationMs);
 45567: 
 45568:         // replay primary with an extra header (T2)
 45569:         const replayHeaders = Object.assign({}, req.headers || {});
 45570:         replayHeaders['X-NPZ-FALLBACK'] = '1';
 45571:         const replayUrl = primaryUrl;
 45572:         logger.nez('NPZ', `replaying primary (${primary.name}) with fallback header`);
 45573:         const replay = await tryFetch(replayUrl, { method: req.method, headers: replayHeaders, body: req.body }, timeout);
 45574:         if (replay.ok && replay.status && replay.status < 500) {
 45575:           logger.nez('NPZ', `replayed primary succeeded after fallback`);
 45576:           return { status: replay.status, headers: replay.headers, body: replay.body, gate: 'replay', laneId: primary.id, durationMs: replay.durationMs };
 45577:         }
 45578: 
 45579:         // if replay failed, return fallback result
 45580:         return { status: res.status, headers: res.headers, body: res.body, gate: 'fallback', laneId: lane.id, durationMs: res.durationMs };
 45581:       } else {
 45582:         recordFailure(host, lane.id, res.durationMs);
 45583:       }
 45584:     }
 45585: 
 45586:     // if all failed, return primary error or generic
 45587:     logger.warn('[NPZ] all lanes failed');
 45588:     if (t0 && !t0.ok) return { error: t0.error, gate: 'fail', durationMs: t0.durationMs };
 45589:     return { status: t0.status, body: t0.body, gate: 'fail', durationMs: t0.durationMs };
 45590:   } catch (err) {
 45591:     return { error: err, gate: 'error' };
 45592:   }
 45593: }
 45594: 
 45595: export function getCircuitState(host: string) {
 45596:   const m = circuit.get(host);
 45597:   if (!m) return {} as Record<number, CircuitState>;
 45598:   const out: Record<number, CircuitState> = {};
 45599:   for (const [k, v] of m.entries()) out[k] = v;
 45600:   return out;
 45601: }
 45602: 
 45603: export default { DEFAULT_LANES, npzRoute, getPreferredLane, setPreferredLane, lanesForHost, recordFailure, recordSuccess, isLaneTripped, getCircuitState };
 45604: 
 45605: 
 45606: 
 45607: ============================
 45608: FILE: src\utils\npz-store.ts
 45609: ============================
 45610: ============================
 45611: // ROME-TAG: 0x11D9FC
 45612: 
 45613: import fs from 'fs';
 45614: import path from 'path';
 45615: import { createRecord as redisCreate, getRecord as redisGet, updateRecord as redisUpdate } from './npz-store-redis';
 45616: import { getNpzNamespace } from './npz-config';
 45617: 
 45618: const NS = getNpzNamespace();
 45619: // Use .qflush as canonical state directory (was .qflush)
 45620: const STORE_DIR = path.join(process.cwd(), '.qflush');
 45621: const REQUEST_STORE = path.join(STORE_DIR, `${NS}-npz-requests.json`);
 45622: 
 45623: type NpzRecord = {
 45624:   id: string;
 45625:   laneId?: number;
 45626:   ts: number;
 45627:   meta?: Record<string, any>;
 45628: };
 45629: 
 45630: let fileStore: Record<string, NpzRecord> = {};
 45631: 
 45632: function ensureDir() {
 45633:   if (!fs.existsSync(STORE_DIR)) fs.mkdirSync(STORE_DIR, { recursive: true });
 45634: }
 45635: 
 45636: function loadFileStore() {
 45637:   try {
 45638:     if (fs.existsSync(REQUEST_STORE)) {
 45639:       const raw = fs.readFileSync(REQUEST_STORE, 'utf8');
 45640:       fileStore = JSON.parse(raw);
 45641:     }
 45642:   } catch (e) {
 45643:     fileStore = {};
 45644:   }
 45645: }
 45646: 
 45647: function persistFileStore() {
 45648:   try {
 45649:     ensureDir();
 45650:     fs.writeFileSync(REQUEST_STORE, JSON.stringify(fileStore, null, 2), 'utf8');
 45651:   } catch (e) {}
 45652: }
 45653: 
 45654: loadFileStore();
 45655: 
 45656: const ENABLE_REDIS = (process.env.QFLUSH_ENABLE_REDIS === '1' || String(process.env.QFLUSH_ENABLE_REDIS).toLowerCase() === 'true');
 45657: const USE_REDIS = ENABLE_REDIS && Boolean(process.env.REDIS_URL);
 45658: 
 45659: export async function createRequestRecord(idOrMeta?: string | Record<string, any>, maybeMeta?: Record<string, any>) {
 45660:   if (USE_REDIS) {
 45661:     const meta = typeof idOrMeta === 'string' ? maybeMeta : (idOrMeta as Record<string, any> | undefined);
 45662:     const rec = await redisCreate(meta);
 45663:     return rec;
 45664:   }
 45665: 
 45666:   // file mode: if id provided, use it
 45667:   let id: string;
 45668:   let meta: Record<string, any> | undefined;
 45669:   if (typeof idOrMeta === 'string') {
 45670:     id = idOrMeta;
 45671:     meta = maybeMeta;
 45672:   } else {
 45673:     id = (idOrMeta && (idOrMeta as any).id) || (Math.random() + '_' + Date.now()).toString();
 45674:     meta = (idOrMeta as Record<string, any>) || undefined;
 45675:   }
 45676:   const rec: NpzRecord = { id, ts: Date.now(), meta };
 45677:   fileStore[id] = rec;
 45678:   persistFileStore();
 45679:   return rec;
 45680: }
 45681: 
 45682: export async function updateRequestRecord(id: string, patch: Partial<NpzRecord>) {
 45683:   if (USE_REDIS) {
 45684:     return await redisUpdate(id, patch as any);
 45685:   }
 45686:   if (!fileStore[id]) return null;
 45687:   fileStore[id] = { ...fileStore[id], ...patch };
 45688:   persistFileStore();
 45689:   return fileStore[id];
 45690: }
 45691: 
 45692: export async function getRequestRecord(id: string) {
 45693:   if (USE_REDIS) {
 45694:     return await redisGet(id);
 45695:   }
 45696:   return fileStore[id] || null;
 45697: }
 45698: 
 45699: export default { createRequestRecord, updateRequestRecord, getRequestRecord };
 45700: 
 45701: 
 45702: 
 45703: 
 45704: ============================
 45705: FILE: src\utils\npz-store-redis.ts
 45706: ============================
 45707: ============================
 45708: // ROME-TAG: 0xC27F4F
 45709: 
 45710: // Redis implementation removed - use in-memory fallback to avoid external dependency.
 45711: import { v4 as uuidv4 } from 'uuid';
 45712: import { getNpzNamespace } from './npz-config';
 45713: 
 45714: // NOTE: this module intentionally does NOT depend on ioredis anymore.
 45715: // It exposes the same async API but stores data in memory with TTL semantics.
 45716: 
 45717: const NS = getNpzNamespace();
 45718: 
 45719: type RedisNpzRecord = { id: string; laneId?: number; ts: number; meta?: Record<string, any> };
 45720: 
 45721: const store = new Map<string, RedisNpzRecord & { expiresAt?: number }>();
 45722: 
 45723: function nowMs() { return Date.now(); }
 45724: 
 45725: export async function createRecord(meta?: Record<string, any>) {
 45726:   const id = uuidv4();
 45727:   const rec: RedisNpzRecord = { id, ts: nowMs(), meta };
 45728:   // default TTL 24h
 45729:   const expiresAt = nowMs() + 24 * 3600 * 1000;
 45730:   store.set(id, Object.assign({}, rec, { expiresAt }));
 45731:   return rec;
 45732: }
 45733: 
 45734: export async function updateRecord(id: string, patch: Partial<RedisNpzRecord>) {
 45735:   const entry = store.get(id);
 45736:   if (!entry) return null;
 45737:   const updated = Object.assign({}, entry, patch);
 45738:   store.set(id, updated);
 45739:   // return shallow copy
 45740:   const copy = Object.assign({}, updated);
 45741:   delete (copy as any).expiresAt;
 45742:   return copy;
 45743: }
 45744: 
 45745: export async function getRecord(id: string) {
 45746:   const entry = store.get(id);
 45747:   if (!entry) return null;
 45748:   if (entry.expiresAt && entry.expiresAt < nowMs()) {
 45749:     store.delete(id);
 45750:     return null;
 45751:   }
 45752:   const copy = Object.assign({}, entry);
 45753:   delete (copy as any).expiresAt;
 45754:   return copy;
 45755: }
 45756: 
 45757: export async function deleteRecord(id: string) {
 45758:   return store.delete(id);
 45759: }
 45760: 
 45761: export async function listRecords() {
 45762:   const now = nowMs();
 45763:   const res: Array<RedisNpzRecord> = [];
 45764:   for (const [k, v] of store.entries()) {
 45765:     if (v.expiresAt && v.expiresAt < now) { store.delete(k); continue; }
 45766:     const copy = Object.assign({}, v);
 45767:     delete (copy as any).expiresAt;
 45768:     res.push(copy);
 45769:   }
 45770:   return res;
 45771: }
 45772: 
 45773: export async function clearAll() {
 45774:   const n = store.size;
 45775:   store.clear();
 45776:   return n;
 45777: }
 45778: 
 45779: // helper: not part of original API but useful for tests
 45780: export function __internal_size() { return store.size; }
 45781: 
 45782: 
 45783: ============================
 45784: FILE: src\utils\package.ts
 45785: ============================
 45786: ============================
 45787: // ROME-TAG: 0xB044BC
 45788: 
 45789: import { join } from "path";
 45790: import { existsSync } from "fs";
 45791: import { readFileSync } from "fs";
 45792: 
 45793: export function resolvePackagePath(pkgName: string) {
 45794:   try {
 45795:     const resolved = require.resolve(pkgName);
 45796:     // walk up to package root
 45797:     let dir = resolved;
 45798:     while (dir && !existsSync(join(dir, "package.json"))) {
 45799:       const p = require("path").dirname(dir);
 45800:       if (p === dir) break;
 45801:       dir = p;
 45802:     }
 45803:     if (existsSync(join(dir, "package.json"))) return dir;
 45804:   } catch {}
 45805:   // fallback: node_modules path
 45806:   const guess = join(process.cwd(), "node_modules", pkgName);
 45807:   if (existsSync(join(guess, "package.json"))) return guess;
 45808:   return undefined;
 45809: }
 45810: 
 45811: export function readPackageJson(pkgPath: string) {
 45812:   try {
 45813:     const content = readFileSync(join(pkgPath, "package.json"), "utf8");
 45814:     return JSON.parse(content);
 45815:   } catch {
 45816:     return null;
 45817:   }
 45818: }
 45819:

 45821: 
 45822: ============================
 45823: FILE: src\utils\paths.ts
 45824: ============================
 45825: ============================
 45826: // ROME-TAG: 0x1609C0
 45827: 
 45828: import { existsSync } from "fs";
 45829: import { join } from "path";
 45830: 
 45831: // Map service names to npm package names and local folder candidates
 45832: export const SERVICE_MAP: Record<string, { pkg: string; candidates: string[] }> = {
 45833:   rome: { pkg: "@funeste38/rome", candidates: ["./rome", "./Rome"] },
 45834:   nezlephant: { pkg: "@funeste38/nezlephant", candidates: ["./nezlephant", "./Nezlephant"] },
 45835:   envaptex: { pkg: "@funeste38/envaptex", candidates: ["./envaptex", "./Envaptex"] },
 45836:   freeland: { pkg: "@funeste38/freeland", candidates: ["./freeland", "./Freeland"] },
 45837:   bat: { pkg: "@funeste38/bat", candidates: ["./bat", "./BAT"] },
 45838:   // placeholders for future projects
 45839:   // Prefer the apps/spyder-core subpackage so the runtime runs the actual app entrypoint
 45840:   spyder: { pkg: "@funeste38/spyder", candidates: ["./spyder/apps/spyder-core", "./spyder/spyder", "./spyder"] },
 45841: };
 45842: 
 45843: export function resolvePaths(detected: any = {}) {
 45844:   const out: Record<string, string | undefined> = {};
 45845:   for (const key of Object.keys(SERVICE_MAP)) {
 45846:     // Prefer local candidate folders when present in the workspace
 45847:     const tries = SERVICE_MAP[key].candidates;
 45848:     let found: string | undefined;
 45849:     for (const t of tries) {
 45850:       const p = join(process.cwd(), t);
 45851:       if (existsSync(p)) {
 45852:         found = p;
 45853:         break;
 45854:       }
 45855:     }
 45856:     if (found) {
 45857:       out[key] = found;
 45858:       continue;
 45859:     }
 45860: 
 45861:     // Fallback to detected package path (e.g., node_modules resolution)
 45862:     if (detected && detected[key] && detected[key].path) {
 45863:       out[key] = detected[key].path;
 45864:       continue;
 45865:     }
 45866:   }
 45867:   return out;
 45868: }

 45872: ============================
 45873: FILE: src\utils\redis.ts
 45874: ============================
 45875: ============================
 45876: // Small helper to create an optional Redis client.
 45877: // If QFLUSH_DISABLE_REDIS=1 or no URL is provided, returns null.
 45878: 
 45879: export function createRedisClient(): any | null {
 45880:   const DISABLED = process.env.QFLUSH_DISABLE_REDIS === '1' || String(process.env.QFLUSH_DISABLE_REDIS).toLowerCase() === 'true';
 45881:   const url = process.env.QFLUSH_REDIS_URL || process.env.REDIS_URL || '';
 45882:   if (DISABLED || !url) return null;
 45883:   // Require lazily to avoid forcing ioredis dependency when not used
 45884:   try {
 45885:     // eslint-disable-next-line @typescript-eslint/no-var-requires
 45886:     const Redis = require('ioredis');
 45887:     const opts: any = {};
 45888:     return new Redis(url, opts);
 45889:   } catch (e) {
 45890:     return null;
 45891:   }
 45892: }

 45895: 
 45896: ============================
 45897: FILE: src\utils\secrets.ts
 45898: ============================
 45899: ============================
 45900: import fs from 'fs';
 45901: 
 45902: export type SecretOpts = {
 45903:   fileEnv?: string; // env var that points to a file containing the secret
 45904:   required?: boolean; // throw if not found
 45905:   cliAlias?: string; // --alias=value
 45906: };
 45907: 
 45908: export function getSecret(name: string, opts?: SecretOpts): string | undefined {
 45909:   // 1) CLI arg form --name=value or --alias=value
 45910:   const alias = opts?.cliAlias || name.toLowerCase();
 45911:   const cliExact = process.argv.find((a) => a === `--${alias}`);
 45912:   if (cliExact) {
 45913:     // next arg is the value
 45914:     const idx = process.argv.indexOf(cliExact);
 45915:     if (idx >= 0 && idx < process.argv.length - 1) return process.argv[idx + 1];
 45916:   }
 45917:   const cli = process.argv.find((a) => a.startsWith(`--${alias}=`));
 45918:   if (cli) return cli.split('=')[1];
 45919: 
 45920:   // 2) environment variables (exact name or upper-case)
 45921:   if (process.env[name]) return process.env[name];
 45922:   const up = name.toUpperCase();
 45923:   if (process.env[up]) return process.env[up];
 45924:   const low = name.toLowerCase();
 45925:   if (process.env[low]) return process.env[low];
 45926: 
 45927:   // 3) file referenced by env var
 45928:   if (opts && opts.fileEnv) {
 45929:     const p = process.env[opts.fileEnv];
 45930:     if (p && typeof p === 'string' && fs.existsSync(p)) {
 45931:       try {
 45932:         return fs.readFileSync(p, 'utf8').trim();
 45933:       } catch (e) {
 45934:         // ignore read errors
 45935:       }
 45936:     }
 45937:   }
 45938: 
 45939:   if (opts && opts.required) throw new Error(`${name} required but not provided`);
 45940:   return undefined;
 45941: }

 45946: FILE: src\utils\tokens.ts
 45947: ============================
 45948: ============================
 45949: // ROME-TAG: 0xD439BD
 45950: 
 45951: import { randomBytes } from "crypto";
 45952: 
 45953: export function generateToken(len = 24) {
 45954:   return randomBytes(len).toString("hex");
 45955: }
 45956: 
 45957: export function resolveTokens(existing: Record<string, any> = {}) {
 45958:   const out: Record<string, string> = {};
 45959:   for (const name of ["A-11", "SPYDER", "BAT", "KEYKEY", "NEZLEPHANT"]) {
 45960:     out[name] = existing[name] || generateToken(12);
 45961:   }
 45962:   return out;
 45963: }

 45974: 
 45975: Short blurb:
 45976: QFLUSH is a developer-focused runtime orchestrator designed to connect structured modules (Rome) with unstructured projects (the Cambrousse). It provides an index/tag system, a small daemon for checksum and admin APIs, a CLI and a VS Code extension for tight integration.

 46040: 
 46041: ============================
 46042: FILE: tools\check-circular.js
 46043: ============================
 46044: ============================
 46045: #!/usr/bin/env node
 46046: const fs = require('fs');
 46047: const path = require('path');
 46048: 
 46049: // Very simple circular import detector based on static string imports
 46050: const ROOT = process.cwd();
 46051: const visited = new Set();
 46052: const stack = [];
 46053: const graph = new Map();
 46054: 
 46055: function collectImports(file) {
 46056:   if (!fs.existsSync(file)) return [];
 46057:   const txt = fs.readFileSync(file,'utf8');
 46058:   const re = /import\s+(?:[^'";]+)\s+from\s+['"]([^'"]+)['"]/g;
 46059:   const res = [];
 46060:   let m;
 46061:   while ((m = re.exec(txt)) !== null) {
 46062:     res.push(m[1]);
 46063:   }
 46064:   return res;
 46065: }
 46066: 
 46067: function resolveModule(fromFile, mod) {
 46068:   if (mod.startsWith('.') || mod.startsWith('/')) {
 46069:     const base = path.dirname(fromFile);
 46070:     const resolved = path.resolve(base, mod);
 46071:     // try .ts, .js
 46072:     const cand = [resolved + '.ts', resolved + '.js', path.join(resolved,'index.ts'), path.join(resolved,'index.js')];
 46073:     for (const c of cand) if (fs.existsSync(c)) return path.relative(ROOT, c).replace(/\\/g,'/');
 46074:     return null;
 46075:   }
 46076:   // external module
 46077:   return null;
 46078: }
 46079: 
 46080: function buildGraph(dir) {
 46081:   const items = fs.readdirSync(dir);
 46082:   for (const it of items) {
 46083:     if (it === 'node_modules' || it === '.git') continue;
 46084:     const full = path.join(dir,it);
 46085:     const st = fs.statSync(full);
 46086:     if (st.isDirectory()) buildGraph(full);
 46087:     else {
 46088:       const ext = path.extname(it).toLowerCase();
 46089:       if (!['.ts','.js','.tsx','.jsx'].includes(ext)) continue;
 46090:       const rel = path.relative(ROOT, full).replace(/\\/g,'/');
 46091:       const imps = collectImports(full).map(i => resolveModule(full, i)).filter(Boolean);
 46092:       graph.set(rel, imps);
 46093:     }
 46094:   }
 46095: }
 46096: 
 46097: function detectCycles() {
 46098:   const cycles = [];
 46099:   const temp = new Set();
 46100:   const perm = new Set();
 46101: 
 46102:   function visit(n, pathStack) {
 46103:     if (perm.has(n)) return;
 46104:     if (temp.has(n)) {
 46105:       const idx = pathStack.indexOf(n);
 46106:       const cycle = pathStack.slice(idx).concat([n]);
 46107:       cycles.push(cycle);
 46108:       return;
 46109:     }
 46110:     temp.add(n);
 46111:     const neigh = graph.get(n) || [];
 46112:     for (const m of neigh) visit(m, pathStack.concat([n]));
 46113:     temp.delete(n);
 46114:     perm.add(n);
 46115:   }
 46116: 
 46117:   for (const k of graph.keys()) visit(k, []);
 46118:   return cycles;
 46119: }
 46120: 
 46121: buildGraph(path.join(ROOT, 'src'));
 46122: const cycles = detectCycles();
 46123: if (cycles.length) {
 46124:   console.warn('Circular dependencies detected:');
 46125:   for (const c of cycles) console.warn(' - ' + c.join(' -> '));
 46126:   process.exit(2);
 46127: }
 46128: console.log('No circular dependencies detected');
 46129: 
 46130: 
 46131: 
 46132: ============================
 46133: FILE: tools\check-cli.js
 46134: ============================
 46135: ============================
 46136: #!/usr/bin/env node
 46137: const fs = require('fs');
 46138: const path = require('path');
 46139: const pkgPath = path.join(__dirname, '..', 'package.json');
 46140: if (!fs.existsSync(pkgPath)) {
 46141:   console.error('package.json not found');
 46142:   process.exit(2);
 46143: }
 46144: const pkg = JSON.parse(fs.readFileSync(pkgPath, 'utf8'));
 46145: const bin = pkg.bin && (typeof pkg.bin === 'string' ? pkg.bin : Object.values(pkg.bin)[0]);
 46146: if (!bin) {
 46147:   console.error('No bin entry in package.json');
 46148:   process.exit(2);
 46149: }
 46150: const binPath = path.join(__dirname, '..', bin);
 46151: if (!fs.existsSync(binPath)) {
 46152:   console.error(`CLI entry missing: ${binPath}`);
 46153:   console.error('Réparez en reconstruisant le paquet localement:');
 46154:   console.error('  cd qflush');
 46155:   console.error('  npm install');
 46156:   console.error('  npm run build');
 46157:   console.error('  npm install -g .');
 46158:   process.exit(2);
 46159: }
 46160: console.log('CLI check OK:', binPath);
 46161: process.exit(0);
 46162:
