FILE: spyder\apps\spyder-core\src\protocol\decoder.ts
============================
============================
     1: import { detectLanguage } from '../lang/detect';
     2: 
     3: type DecoderFn = (input: Uint8Array) => Promise<any>;
     4: 
     5: const registry = new Map<string, DecoderFn>();
     6: 
     7: export function registerDecoder(prefix: string, fn: DecoderFn) {
     8:   registry.set(prefix, fn);
     9: }
    10: 
    11: export function listDecoders() {
    12:   return Array.from(registry.keys());
    13: }
    14: 
    15: // Décodeur texte brut par défaut
    16: async function defaultDecoder(input: Uint8Array): Promise<string> {
    17:   return new TextDecoder().decode(input);
    18: }
    19: 
    20: export async function decodePayload(input: Uint8Array): Promise<any> {
    21:   const text = new TextDecoder().decode(input);
    22: 
    23:   const idx = text.indexOf(':');
    24:   if (idx > 0) {
    25:     const prefix = text.slice(0, idx);
    26:     const rest = text.slice(idx + 1);
    27: 
    28:     const fn = registry.get(prefix);
    29:     if (fn) {
    30:       try {
    31:         console.debug('[decoder] using prefix decoder', prefix);
    32:         return await fn(new TextEncoder().encode(rest));
    33:       } catch (e) {
    34:         console.warn('[decoder] prefix decoder error', prefix, e);
    35:         return null;
    36:       }
    37:     } else {
    38:       console.warn('[decoder] no decoder registered for prefix', prefix);
    39:     }
    40:   }
    41: 
    42:   // no prefix -> detect language and dispatch
    43:   const lang = detectLanguage(text);
    44:   console.debug('[decoder] detected language', lang, 'from text:', text.slice(0, 64));
    45:   const fn = registry.get(lang);
    46:   if (fn) {
    47:     try {
    48:       return await fn(input);
    49:     } catch (e) {
    50:       console.warn('[decoder] language decoder error', lang, e);
    51:       return null;
    52:     }
    53:   } else {
    54:     console.warn('[decoder] no decoder registered for detected language', lang);
    55:   }
    56: 
    57:   return defaultDecoder(input);
    58: }
    59: 
    60: // Exemple d'enregistrement
    61: // registerDecoder('nez', async (bytes) => { ... });
    62: 


============================
FILE: spyder\apps\spyder-core\src\protocol\packet.ts
============================
============================
     1: import { computeChecksum } from '../utils/checksum';
     2: 
     3: export const SPYDER_HEADER = 0x5e; // 0x5P "style" :P
     4: 
     5: export enum PacketType {
     6:   Question = 1,
     7:   Answer = 2,
     8:   Meta = 3
     9: }
    10: 
    11: export interface SpyderPacket {
    12:   type: PacketType;
    13:   payload: Uint8Array;
    14:   checksum: number;
    15: }
    16: 
    17: export function serializePacket(packet: SpyderPacket): Uint8Array {
    18:   const length = packet.payload.length;
    19:   const buffer = new Uint8Array(1 + 1 + 2 + length + 1);
    20:   let offset = 0;
    21: 
    22:   buffer[offset++] = SPYDER_HEADER;
    23:   buffer[offset++] = packet.type;
    24:   buffer[offset++] = (length >> 8) & 0xff;
    25:   buffer[offset++] = length & 0xff;
    26: 
    27:   buffer.set(packet.payload, offset);
    28:   offset += length;
    29: 
    30:   const cs = computeChecksum(buffer.subarray(0, offset));
    31:   buffer[offset] = cs;
    32: 
    33:   return buffer;
    34: }
    35: 
    36: export function parsePacket(buffer: Uint8Array): SpyderPacket | null {
    37:   if (buffer.length < 1 + 1 + 2 + 1) return null;
    38:   let offset = 0;
    39:   const header = buffer[offset++];
    40:   if (header !== SPYDER_HEADER) return null;
    41: 
    42:   const type = buffer[offset++];
    43:   const length = (buffer[offset++] << 8) | buffer[offset++];
    44: 
    45:   if (buffer.length < 1 + 1 + 2 + length + 1) return null;
    46: 
    47:   const payload = buffer.subarray(4, 4 + length);
    48:   const checksum = buffer[4 + length];
    49: 
    50:   const computed = computeChecksum(buffer.subarray(0, 4 + length));
    51:   if (computed !== checksum) {
    52:     return {
    53:       type: type as PacketType,
    54:       payload,
    55:       checksum: -1
    56:     };
    57:   }
    58: 
    59:   return {
    60:     type: type as PacketType,
    61:     payload,
    62:     checksum
    63:   };
    64: }
    65: 


============================
FILE: spyder\apps\spyder-core\src\teacher\bridge.ts
============================
============================
     1: import axios from 'axios';
     2: import config from '../config/default.json';
     3: 
     4: interface A11Response {
     5:   text: string;
     6: }
     7: 
     8: export async function askA11(
     9:   endpoint: string,
    10:   messageText: string
    11: ): Promise<A11Response> {
    12:   if (!(config as any).allowInternet) {
    13:     throw new Error('Internet access disabled by configuration');
    14:   }
    15: 
    16:   const body = {
    17:     model: 'a11-phi3',
    18:     messages: [{ role: 'user', content: messageText }],
    19:     stream: false,
    20:   };
    21: 
    22:   const axiosOpts: any = {
    23:     headers: { 'Content-Type': 'application/json' },
    24:     timeout: 10000,
    25:   };
    26:   if ((config as any).httpProxy) {
    27:     axiosOpts.proxy = (config as any).httpProxy;
    28:   }
    29: 
    30:   const res = await axios.post(endpoint, body, axiosOpts);
    31: 
    32:   const text =
    33:     res.data?.choices?.[0]?.message?.content ?? JSON.stringify(res.data);
    34: 
    35:   return { text };
    36: }
    37:

FILE: spyder\apps\spyder-core\src\utils\checksum.ts
============================
============================
     1: export type ChecksumAlgo = 'xor';
     2: 
     3: export function xorChecksum(buffer: Uint8Array | Buffer): number {
     4:   let x = 0;
     5:   for (let i = 0; i < buffer.length; i++) x ^= buffer[i];
     6:   return x & 0xff;
     7: }
     8: 
     9: export function computeChecksum(
    10:   buffer: Uint8Array | Buffer,
    11:   algo: ChecksumAlgo = 'xor'
    12: ): number {
    13:   switch (algo) {
    14:     case 'xor':
    15:     default:
    16:       return xorChecksum(buffer);
    17:   }
    18: }
    19: 


============================
FILE: spyder\apps\spyder-core\src\utils\collector.ts
============================
============================
     1: type Counters = { [k: string]: number };
     2: 
     3: export class Collector {
     4:   counters: Counters = {};
     5:   histograms: { [k: string]: number[] } = {};
     6: 
     7:   inc(name: string, value = 1) {
     8:     this.counters[name] = (this.counters[name] || 0) + value;
     9:   }
    10: 
    11:   observe(name: string, v: number) {
    12:     this.histograms[name] = this.histograms[name] || [];
    13:     this.histograms[name].push(v);
    14:   }
    15: 
    16:   snapshot() {
    17:     return {
    18:       counters: { ...this.counters },
    19:       histograms: { ...this.histograms }
    20:     };
    21:   }
    22: }
    23:

FILE: spyder\apps\spyder-core\src\utils\metrics.ts

============================
     1: export function elapsedMs(start: number): number {
     2:   return Date.now() - start;
     3: }
     4: 
     5: export function isLongRequest(ms: number, threshold: number): boolean {
     6:   return ms >= threshold;
     7: }
     8: 
     9: export function classifyLatency(ms: number, threshold: number) {
    10:   return isLongRequest(ms, threshold) ? 'long' : 'short';
    11: }
    12:

     1: import * as net from 'net';
     2: import { serializePacket, PacketType } from '../src/protocol/packet';
     3: 
     4: function makeQuestion(text: string) {
     5:   const payload = new TextEncoder().encode(text);
     6:   return serializePacket({ type: PacketType.Question, payload, checksum: 0 });
     7: }
     8: 
     9: const client = new net.Socket();
    10: client.connect(4000, '127.0.0.1', () => {
    11:   console.log('Connected to SPYDER');
    12:   const pkt = makeQuestion('hello world');
    13:   client.write(Buffer.from(pkt));
    14: });
    15: 
    16: client.on('data', (data) => {
    17:   console.log('Received', data);
    18:   client.destroy();
    19: });
    20: 
    21: client.on('close', () => console.log('Connection closed'));
    22:

     1: const http = require('http');
     2: 
     3: const PORT = 3000;
     4: 
     5: const server = http.createServer((req, res) => {
     6:   if (req.method === 'POST' && req.url === '/v1/chat/completions') {
     7:     let body = '';
     8:     req.on('data', (chunk) => (body += chunk));
     9:     req.on('end', () => {
    10:       try {
    11:         const j = JSON.parse(body);
    12:         const userMsg = j?.messages?.[0]?.content || 'hello';
    13:         const reply = `A-11 mock reply to: ${userMsg}`;
    14:         const out = { choices: [{ message: { content: reply } }] };
    15:         res.writeHead(200, { 'Content-Type': 'application/json' });
    16:         res.end(JSON.stringify(out));
    17:       } catch (e) {
    18:         res.writeHead(400);
    19:         res.end('bad json');
    20:       }
    21:     });
    22:     return;
    23:   }
    24: 
    25:   res.writeHead(404);
    26:   res.end('not found');
    27: });
    28: 
    29: server.listen(PORT, '127.0.0.1', () => {
    30:   console.log(`Mock A-11 listening on http://127.0.0.1:${PORT}`);
    31: });
    32: 


============================
FILE: spyder\apps\spyder-core\tools\test-all.ts
============================
============================
     1: import { serializePacket, parsePacket, PacketType } from '../src/protocol/packet';
     2: import { computeChecksum, xorChecksum } from '../src/utils/checksum';
     3: import { decodePayload } from '../src/protocol/decoder';
     4: import { elapsedMs, classifyLatency } from '../src/utils/metrics';
     5: import { RamMemory } from '../src/memory/ram';
     6: import { SpiderWeb } from '../src/graph/web';
     7: 
     8: function assert(cond: boolean, msg: string) {
     9:   if (!cond) throw new Error('Assertion failed: ' + msg);
    10: }
    11: 
    12: async function run() {
    13:   console.log('Running integration tests...');
    14: 
    15:   // Protocol roundtrip
    16:   const payload = new TextEncoder().encode('hello test');
    17:   const pkt = serializePacket({ type: PacketType.Question, payload, checksum: 0 });
    18:   const parsed = parsePacket(pkt);
    19:   assert(parsed !== null, 'parsePacket returned null');
    20:   assert(parsed!.type === PacketType.Question, 'packet type mismatch');
    21:   const parsedText = new TextDecoder().decode(parsed!.payload);
    22:   assert(parsedText === 'hello test', 'payload mismatch');
    23:   console.log('Protocol: serialize/parse OK');
    24: 
    25:   // Checksum functions
    26:   const cs1 = xorChecksum(payload);
    27:   const cs2 = computeChecksum(payload);
    28:   assert(typeof cs1 === 'number' && typeof cs2 === 'number', 'checksum types');
    29:   console.log('Checksum: xor/compute OK', cs1, cs2);
    30: 
    31:   // Decoder
    32:   const dec = await decodePayload(new TextEncoder().encode('plain:some text'));
    33:   assert(dec === 'some text' || typeof dec === 'string', 'decoder output');
    34:   const dec2 = await decodePayload(new TextEncoder().encode('just text'));
    35:   assert(typeof dec2 === 'string', 'default decoder');
    36:   console.log('Decoder: default and prefix handling OK');
    37: 
    38:   // Metrics
    39:   const lat = 1200;
    40:   const cls = classifyLatency(lat, 1000);
    41:   assert(cls === 'long', 'classifyLatency long');
    42:   console.log('Metrics: classifyLatency OK');
    43: 
    44:   // Memory
    45:   const ram = new RamMemory();
    46:   const sample = { id: 't1', question: parsed!, score: 2, timestamp: Date.now() } as any;
    47:   ram.add(sample);
    48:   const last = ram.getLast();
    49:   assert(!!last && last.id === 't1', 'RamMemory add/getLast');
    50:   console.log('Memory: RamMemory OK');
    51: 
    52:   // Graph
    53:   const web = new SpiderWeb();
    54:   web.addNode({ id: 'n1', type: 'message' });
    55:   web.addNode({ id: 'n2', type: 'message' });
    56:   web.addEdge('n1', 'n2', 'sequence');
    57:   assert(web.nodes.has('n1') && web.nodes.has('n2'), 'SpiderWeb nodes');
    58:   console.log('Graph: SpiderWeb OK');
    59: 
    60:   console.log('\nAll tests passed');
    61: }
    62: 
    63: run().catch(e => {
    64:   console.error('Tests failed', e);
    65:   process.exit(1);
    66: });
    67:

     2: import { serializePacket } from '../src/protocol/packet';
     3: import { PacketType } from '../src/protocol/packet';
     4: 
     5: function makeQuestion(text: string) {
     6:   const payload = new TextEncoder().encode(text);
     7:   return serializePacket({ type: PacketType.Question, payload, checksum: 0 });
     8: }
     9: 
    10: (async function() {
    11:   const client = new net.Socket();
    12:   client.connect(4000, '127.0.0.1', () => {
    13:     console.log('Connected to SPYDER');
    14:     const pkt = makeQuestion('Привет, как дела?');
    15:     client.write(Buffer.from(pkt));
    16:   });
    17: 
    18:   client.on('data', (data) => {
    19:     console.log('Received', new TextDecoder().decode(new Uint8Array(data)));
    20:     client.destroy();
    21:   });
    22: 
    23:   client.on('close', () => console.log('Connection closed'));

FILE: spyder\spyder\src\index.ts
============================
============================
     1: import * as net from 'net';
     2: import { encodePacket, decodePacket } from './protocol/packet';
     3: import { SpyderMemory } from './memory/memory';
     4: import { sendToA11 } from './teacher/bridge';
     5: 
     6: const PORT = 4000;
     7: const memory = new SpyderMemory();
     8: 
     9: const server = net.createServer((socket: any) => {
    10:   console.log('Client connected');
    11:   socket.on('data', async (data: any) => {
    12:     try {
    13:       const buf = Uint8Array.from(data);
    14:       const pkt = decodePacket(buf);
    15:       if (!pkt) return;
    16:       const valid = pkt.checksum !== 0;
    17:       const score = valid ? 2 : 0;
    18:       memory.add({ bits: pkt.payload, type: pkt.type, valid, score });
    19:       if (pkt.type === 1) {
    20:         const resp = await sendToA11(pkt.payload);
    21:         const out = encodePacket(2 as any, resp);
    22:         const sendBuf = Buffer.from(out);
    23:         socket.write(sendBuf);
    24:         memory.add({ bits: resp, type: 2, valid: resp.length > 0, score: resp.length > 0 ? 2 : 0 });
    25:       }
    26:     } catch (e) {
    27:       // ignore errors in MVP
    28:     }
    29:   });
    30:   socket.on('close', () => console.log('Client disconnected'));
    31: });
    32: 
    33: server.listen(PORT, '127.0.0.1', () => console.log(`SPYDER listening on ${PORT}`));
    34: 


============================
FILE: spyder\spyder\src\memory\memory.ts
============================
============================
     1: function simpleId() {
     2:   const n = Math.floor(Math.random() * 0xffffffff);
     3:   const s = n.toString(16);
     4:   return 'i' + ('00000000' + s).slice(-8);
     5: }
     6: 
     7: export type SpyderMessage = {
     8:   id: string;
     9:   bits: Uint8Array;
    10:   type: number;
    11:   valid: boolean;
    12:   score: number;
    13:   timestamp: number;
    14: };
    15: 
    16: export class SpyderMemory {
    17:   ram: SpyderMessage[] = [];
    18:   cache: SpyderMessage[] = [];
    19:   dead: SpyderMessage[][] = [];
    20: 
    21:   add(msg: Omit<SpyderMessage, 'id' | 'timestamp'>) {
    22:     const m: SpyderMessage = { ...msg, id: simpleId(), timestamp: Date.now() } as SpyderMessage;
    23:     this.ram.push(m);
    24:     if (m.valid && m.score >= 2) this.cache.push(m);
    25:   }
    26: 
    27:   snapshot() {
    28:     this.dead.push([...this.cache]);
    29:     this.cache = [];
    30:   }
    31: }
    32: 


============================
FILE: spyder\spyder\src\protocol\packet.ts
============================
============================
     1: export type PacketType = 1 | 2 | 3;
     2: 
     3: export interface Packet {
     4:   header: number; // 1 byte
     5:   type: PacketType; // 1 byte
     6:   length: number; // 2 bytes
     7:   payload: Uint8Array;
     8:   checksum: number; // 1 byte
     9: }
    10: 
    11: const HEADER = 0x5A;
    12: 
    13: export function encodePacket(type: PacketType, payload: Uint8Array): Uint8Array {
    14:   const length = payload.length;
    15:   const buffer = new Uint8Array(1 + 1 + 2 + length + 1);
    16:   buffer[0] = HEADER;
    17:   buffer[1] = type;
    18:   buffer[2] = (length >> 8) & 0xff;
    19:   buffer[3] = length & 0xff;
    20:   buffer.set(payload, 4);
    21:   let checksum = 0;
    22:   for (let i = 0; i < 4 + length; i++) checksum ^= buffer[i];
    23:   buffer[4 + length] = checksum;
    24:   return buffer;
    25: }
    26: 
    27: export function decodePacket(buf: Uint8Array): Packet | null {
    28:   if (buf.length < 5) return null;
    29:   if (buf[0] !== HEADER) return null;
    30:   const type = buf[1] as PacketType;
    31:   const length = (buf[2] << 8) | buf[3];
    32:   if (buf.length < 4 + length + 1) return null;
    33:   const payload = buf.slice(4, 4 + length);
    34:   const checksum = buf[4 + length];
    35:   let cs = 0;
    36:   for (let i = 0; i < 4 + length; i++) cs ^= buf[i];
    37:   const valid = cs === checksum;
    38:   return { header: buf[0], type, length, payload, checksum: valid ? checksum : 0 };
    39: }
    40: 


============================
FILE: spyder\spyder\src\teacher\bridge.ts
============================
============================
     1: import http from 'http';
     2: 
     3: function concatUint8(arr: Uint8Array[]) {
     4:   let total = 0;
     5:   for (const a of arr) total += a.length;
     6:   const out = new Uint8Array(total);
     7:   let offs = 0;
     8:   for (const a of arr) {
     9:     out.set(a, offs);
    10:     offs += a.length;
    11:   }
    12:   return out;
    13: }
    14: 
    15: function uint8ToBase64(u8: Uint8Array): string {
    16:   const G = (globalThis as any);
    17:   if (G && G.Buffer) return G.Buffer.from(u8).toString('base64');
    18:   let binary = '';
    19:   for (let i = 0; i < u8.length; i++) binary += String.fromCharCode(u8[i]);
    20:   if (typeof btoa !== 'undefined') return btoa(binary);
    21:   throw new Error('No base64 encoder available');
    22: }
    23: 
    24: function base64ToUint8(b64: string): Uint8Array {
    25:   const G = (globalThis as any);
    26:   if (G && G.Buffer) return Uint8Array.from(G.Buffer.from(b64, 'base64'));
    27:   if (typeof atob !== 'undefined') {
    28:     const bin = atob(b64);
    29:     const u8 = new Uint8Array(bin.length);
    30:     for (let i = 0; i < bin.length; i++) u8[i] = bin.charCodeAt(i);
    31:     return u8;
    32:   }
    33:   throw new Error('No base64 decoder available');
    34: }
    35: 
    36: export async function sendToA11(payload: Uint8Array): Promise<Uint8Array> {
    37:   const bodyObj = { data: uint8ToBase64(payload) };
    38:   const data = JSON.stringify(bodyObj);
    39:   const enc = new TextEncoder();
    40:   const dataLen = enc.encode(data).length;
    41: 
    42:   const options = {
    43:     hostname: '127.0.0.1',
    44:     port: 5000,
    45:     path: '/ask',
    46:     method: 'POST',
    47:     headers: {
    48:       'Content-Type': 'application/json',
    49:       'Content-Length': String(dataLen),
    50:     },
    51:     timeout: 5000,
    52:   } as const;
    53: 
    54:   return new Promise((resolve) => {
    55:     const req = http.request(options, (res: any) => {
    56:       const chunks: Uint8Array[] = [];
    57:       res.on('data', (c: any) => {
    58:         try {
    59:           chunks.push(Uint8Array.from(c));
    60:         } catch (e) {
    61:           // ignore
    62:         }
    63:       });
    64:       res.on('end', () => {
    65:         try {
    66:           const all = concatUint8(chunks);
    67:           const text = new TextDecoder('utf-8').decode(all);
    68:           const json = JSON.parse(text);
    69:           if (json && json.data) {
    70:             resolve(base64ToUint8(json.data));
    71:             return;
    72:           }
    73:         } catch (e) {
    74:           // fallthrough
    75:         }
    76:         resolve(new Uint8Array());
    77:       });
    78:     });
    79: 
    80:     req.on('error', () => resolve(new Uint8Array()));
    81:     req.on('timeout', () => { req.destroy(); resolve(new Uint8Array()); });
    82:     req.write(data);
    83:     req.end();
    84:   });
    85: }
    86:

============================
FILE: src\chain\smartChain.ts
============================
============================
     1: // ROME-TAG: 0x8CD4FC
     2: 
     3: import { logger } from "../utils/logger";
     4: import { runDetect } from "../commands/detect";
     5: import { runConfig } from "../commands/config";
     6: import { runPurge } from "../commands/purge";
     7: import { runKill } from "../commands/kill";
     8: import { runStart } from "../commands/start";
     9: import { runExodia } from "../commands/exodia";
    10: 
    11: const ORDER = ["detect", "config", "purge", "kill", "start", "exodia"];
    12: 
    13: export type qflushOptions = {
    14:   global?: Record<string, any>;
    15:   modulePaths?: Record<string, string>;
    16:   tokens?: Record<string, string>;
    17:   flags?: Record<string, boolean | string>;
    18:   detected?: Record<string, any>;
    19:   services?: string[];
    20: };
    21: 
    22: function parseArgs(argv: string[]) {
    23:   const cmds: string[] = [];
    24:   const flags: Record<string, boolean | string> = {};
    25:   const modulePaths: Record<string, string> = {};
    26:   const tokens: Record<string, string> = {};
    27:   const services: string[] = [];
    28: 
    29:   let currentService: string | undefined;
    30:   let i = 0;
    31:   while (i < argv.length) {
    32:     const a = argv[i];
    33:     if (!a.startsWith("-")) {
    34:       cmds.push(a.toLowerCase());
    35:       i++;
    36:       continue;
    37:     }
    38:     const clean = a.replace(/^--?/, "");
    39: 
    40:     if (clean === "service" || clean === "s") {
    41:       const next = argv[i + 1];
    42:       if (next && !next.startsWith("-")) {
    43:         currentService = next.toLowerCase();
    44:         services.push(currentService);
    45:         i += 2;
    46:         continue;
    47:       } else {
    48:         i++;
    49:         continue;
    50:       }
    51:     }
    52: 
    53:     if (clean === "path") {
    54:       const next = argv[i + 1];
    55:       if (next && !next.startsWith("-")) {
    56:         if (currentService) modulePaths[currentService] = next;
    57:         i += 2;
    58:         continue;
    59:       }
    60:       i++;
    61:       continue;
    62:     }
    63: 
    64:     if (clean === "token") {
    65:       const next = argv[i + 1];
    66:       if (next && !next.startsWith("-")) {
    67:         if (currentService) tokens[currentService] = next;
    68:         i += 2;
    69:         continue;
    70:       }
    71:       i++;
    72:       continue;
    73:     }
    74: 
    75:     const kv = clean.split("=");
    76:     if (kv.length === 2) {
    77:       flags[kv[0]] = kv[1];
    78:       i++;
    79:       continue;
    80:     }
    81: 
    82:     const next = argv[i + 1];
    83:     if (next && !next.startsWith("-")) {
    84:       flags[clean] = next;
    85:       i += 2;
    86:       continue;
    87:     }
    88:     flags[clean] = true;
    89:     i++;
    90:   }
    91: 
    92:   return { cmds, flags, modulePaths, tokens, services };
    93: }
    94: 
    95: export function buildPipeline(argv: string[]) {
    96:   const { cmds, flags, modulePaths, tokens, services } = parseArgs(argv);
    97:   const unique = Array.from(new Set(cmds));
    98:   const known = unique.filter((c) => ORDER.includes(c));
    99: 
   100:   if (known.length === 0)
   101:     return {
   102:       pipeline: ["detect", "config", "start"],
   103:       options: { flags, modulePaths, tokens, global: {} as any, services },
   104:     };
   105: 
   106:   // build set with dependencies
   107:   const set = new Set<string>(known);
   108:   // dependencies mapping
   109:   const deps: Record<string, string[]> = {
   110:     start: ["config"],
   111:     config: ["detect"],
   112:     purge: ["detect"],
   113:   };
   114: 
   115:   // add dependencies recursively
   116:   function addDeps(cmd: string) {
   117:     const ds = deps[cmd] || [];
   118:     for (const d of ds) {
   119:       if (!set.has(d)) {
   120:         set.add(d);
   121:         addDeps(d);
   122:       }
   123:     }
   124:   }
   125:   for (const k of Array.from(set)) addDeps(k);
   126: 
   127:   let final: string[] = [];
   128: 
   129:   // Flag-driven transformations
   130:   if (flags["fresh"]) {
   131:     set.add("purge");
   132:     // ensure purge runs before start
   133:   }
   134:   if (flags["force"]) {
   135:     // make sure kill runs before start
   136:     set.add("kill");
   137:   }
   138: 
   139:   const requestedKill = known.includes("kill");
   140: 
   141:   if (requestedKill) {
   142:     // put kill first if user explicitly requested it
   143:     final.push("kill");
   144:     for (const k of ORDER) {
   145:       if (k === "kill") continue;
   146:       if (set.has(k)) final.push(k);
   147:     }
   148:   } else {
   149:     for (const k of ORDER) {
   150:       if (set.has(k)) final.push(k);
   151:     }
   152:   }
   153: 
   154:   // remove duplicates and preserve order
   155:   final = final.filter((v, i) => final.indexOf(v) === i);
   156: 
   157:   logger.info(`SmartChain built pipeline: ${final.join(" -> ")}`);
   158:   const options: qflushOptions = { global: {}, flags, modulePaths, tokens, services };
   159:   return { pipeline: final, options };
   160: }
   161: 
   162: export async function executePipeline(pipeline: string[], options: qflushOptions) {
   163:   for (const step of pipeline) {
   164:     logger.info(`Executing pipeline step: ${step}`);
   165:     switch (step) {
   166:       case "detect": {
   167:         const detected = await runDetect(options);
   168:         options.detected = detected || {};
   169:         if (detected && typeof detected === "object") {
   170:           options.modulePaths = { ...(options.modulePaths || {}), ...(detected.paths || {}) };
   171:         }
   172:         break;
   173:       }
   174:       case "config":
   175:         await runConfig(options);
   176:         break;
   177:       case "purge":
   178:         await runPurge(options);
   179:         break;
   180:       case "kill":
   181:         await runKill(options);
   182:         break;
   183:       case "start":
   184:         await runStart(options);
   185:         break;
   186:       case "exodia":
   187:         await runExodia(options);
   188:         break;
   189:       default:
   190:         logger.warn(`Unknown pipeline step: ${step}`);
   191:     }
   192:   }
   193: }
   194: 
   195: 


============================
FILE: src\cli\help.ts
============================
============================
     1: // ROME-TAG: 0x1DEEBD
     2: 
     3: import alias from '../utils/alias';
     4: const logger = alias.importUtil('@utils/logger') || alias.importUtil('../utils/logger') || console;
     5: 
     6: export function showHelp() {
     7:   logger.info(`qflush - Funesterie orchestrator`);
     8:   console.log(`
     9: Usage:
    10:   qflush [command] [options]
    11: 
    12: Commands:
    13:   start        Launch selected services (default: detect → config → start)
    14:   kill         Kill running services
    15:   purge        Clear caches, logs and sessions
    16:   inspect      Show running services and ports
    17:   config       Generate missing .env/config files
    18:   secret import  Import secrets from a .env file into local encrypted store (Windows DPAPI)
    19: 
    20: Options (examples):
    21:   --service rome --path D:/rome --token ABC123     Target a specific service and give path/token
    22:   --service nezlephant --service freeland          Target multiple services
    23:   --dev --fresh                                    Global flags (dev mode, fresh start)
    24:   --force                                          Force restart semantics (implies kill before start)
    25: 
    26: Examples:
    27:   qflush start --service rome --path D:/rome
    28:   qflush start --service nezlephant --service freeland --fresh
    29:   qflush config --service freeland
    30:   qflush purge --fresh
    31: 
    32: Scripts & helpers:
    33:   node scripts/detach.js [--quiet] <command>   # spawn detached process (use --quiet to suppress output)
    34:   ./scripts/run-with-timeout.sh <sec> <cmd>    # run command with timeout (POSIX)
    35:   pwsh ./scripts/run-with-timeout.ps1 -Cmd "node dist/index.js start" -TimeoutSec 12  # PowerShell watchdog (quiet by default)
    36:   qflush secret import [--env <path>] [--no-acl]   # import .env and store encrypted locally
    37: 
    38: `);
    39: }
    40: 


============================
FILE: src\commands\a11.ts
============================
============================
     1: // ROME-TAG: 0xA11A11
     2: 
     3: import { spawn } from 'child_process';
     4: import * as fs from 'fs';
     5: import * as path from 'path';
     6: 
     7: let fetch: any;
     8: try { fetch = require('node-fetch'); } catch (e) { fetch = undefined; }
     9: 
    10: const CFG_PATH = path.join(process.cwd(), '.qflush', 'a11.config.json');
    11: 
    12: function loadCfg() {
    13:   try {
    14:     if (!fs.existsSync(CFG_PATH)) return null;
    15:     return JSON.parse(fs.readFileSync(CFG_PATH, 'utf8'));
    16:   } catch (e) { return null; }
    17: }
    18: 
    19: export default async function runA11(argv: string[] = []) {
    20:   const sub = argv[0] || 'status';
    21:   const cfg = loadCfg();
    22:   if (!cfg || !cfg.enabled) {
    23:     console.log('A-11 not enabled or not configured (see .qflush/a11.config.json)');
    24:     return 0;
    25:   }
    26: 
    27:   if (sub === 'start') {
    28:     if (!cfg.startCommand) { console.error('no startCommand configured for A-11'); return 1; }
    29:     try {
    30:       const parts = cfg.startCommand.split(' ');
    31:       const proc = spawn(parts[0], parts.slice(1), { cwd: cfg.path || process.cwd(), detached: true, stdio: 'ignore', shell: true });
    32:       proc.unref();
    33:       if (cfg.pidFile) fs.writeFileSync(cfg.pidFile, String(proc.pid), 'utf8');
    34:       console.log('A-11 start invoked (detached).');
    35:       return 0;
    36:     } catch (e) {
    37:       console.error('failed to start A-11:', String(e));
    38:       return 1;
    39:     }
    40:   }
    41: 
    42:   if (sub === 'stop') {
    43:     if (cfg.pidFile && fs.existsSync(cfg.pidFile)) {
    44:       try {
    45:         const pid = Number(fs.readFileSync(cfg.pidFile, 'utf8'));
    46:         try { process.kill(pid); } catch (e) {}
    47:         try { fs.unlinkSync(cfg.pidFile); } catch (e) {}
    48:         console.log('A-11 stop requested (pid ' + pid + ').');
    49:         return 0;
    50:       } catch (e) { console.error('failed to stop A-11', String(e)); return 1; }
    51:     }
    52:     console.log('no pidFile for A-11; cannot stop cleanly');
    53:     return 0;
    54:   }
    55: 
    56:   // status
    57:   if (cfg.healthUrl) {
    58:     try {
    59:       const res = await fetch(cfg.healthUrl, { method: 'GET' });
    60:       if (res.ok) { console.log('A-11 healthy'); return 0; }
    61:       console.log('A-11 unhealthy, status', res.status);
    62:       return 2;
    63:     } catch (e) {
    64:       console.log('A-11 health check failed:', String(e));
    65:       return 3;
    66:     }
    67:   }
    68: 
    69:   // fallback: check pid
    70:   if (cfg.pidFile && fs.existsSync(cfg.pidFile)) {
    71:     try {
    72:       const pid = Number(fs.readFileSync(cfg.pidFile,'utf8'));
    73:       try { process.kill(pid, 0); console.log('A-11 running (pid', pid + ')'); return 0; } catch (e) { console.log('A-11 not running'); return 3; }
    74:     } catch (e) { console.log('A-11 check failed', String(e)); return 3; }
    75:   }
    76: 
    77:   console.log('A-11 not running (no healthUrl or pidFile)');
    78:   return 3;
    79: }
    80: 


============================
FILE: src\commands\a11-key.ts
============================
============================
     1: import * as fs from 'fs';
     2: import * as path from 'path';
     3: 
     4: const CFG = path.join(process.cwd(), '.qflush', 'a11.config.json');
     5: 
     6: export default async function runA11Key(argv: string[] = []) {
     7:   const sub = argv[0] || 'status';
     8:   if (sub === 'set') {
     9:     const key = argv[1];
    10:     if (!key) { console.error('usage: qflush a11-key set <key>'); return 2; }
    11:     try {
    12:       const dir = path.dirname(CFG);
    13:       if (!fs.existsSync(dir)) fs.mkdirSync(dir, { recursive: true });
    14:       const cfg = { key: key, createdAt: new Date().toISOString() };
    15:       fs.writeFileSync(CFG, JSON.stringify(cfg, null, 2), 'utf8');
    16:       console.log('A11 key saved to .qflush/a11.config.json');
    17:       return 0;
    18:     } catch (e) { console.error('failed to save key', e); return 3; }
    19:   }
    20:   if (sub === 'start') {
    21:     console.log('start not implemented in CLI stub');
    22:     return 0;
    23:   }
    24:   console.log('usage: qflush a11-key [set <key>|start|status]');
    25:   return 1;
    26: }
    27: 


============================
FILE: src\commands\apply.ts
============================
============================
     1: // src/commands/apply.ts
     2: import * as fs from 'fs';
     3: import * as path from 'path';
     4: import logger from '../utils/logger';
     5: import { decodeCortexPacketFromPng } from '../cortex/pngCodec';
     6: import { CortexPacket } from '../cortex/types';
     7: import { applyCortexPacket } from '../cortex/applyPacket';
     8: 
     9: declare const require: any;
    10: 
    11: export default async function runApply(argv: string[] = []) {
    12:   try {
    13:     const approveAll = argv.includes('--approve') || argv.includes('-a');
    14:     const approveIdArg = argv.find(a => a.startsWith('--approve-id='));
    15:     const approveId = approveIdArg ? approveIdArg.split('=')[1] : null;
    16: 
    17:     const qflushDir = path.join(process.cwd(), '.qflush');
    18:     if (!fs.existsSync(qflushDir)) fs.mkdirSync(qflushDir, { recursive: true });
    19: 
    20:     // 1) Ensure spyder.config.json exists
    21:     const spyCfgPath = path.join(qflushDir, 'spyder.config.json');
    22:     if (!fs.existsSync(spyCfgPath)) {
    23:       const defaultCfg = { enabled: false, frequency: 'passive', routes: [] };
    24:       fs.writeFileSync(spyCfgPath, JSON.stringify(defaultCfg, null, 2), 'utf8');
    25:       logger.info('Created default .qflush/spyder.config.json');
    26:     } else {
    27:       logger.info('.qflush/spyder.config.json already present');
    28:     }
    29: 
    30:     // 2) Synchronize cortex/PacketRouter mapping
    31:     let cortexRoutes: Record<string, boolean> = {};
    32:     try {
    33:       // require router module to discover known actions
    34:       const router = require('../cortex/router');
    35:       const keys = router && router.cortexActions ? Object.keys(router.cortexActions) : [];
    36:       for (const k of keys) cortexRoutes[k] = true; // default enable known actions
    37:     } catch (e) {
    38:       logger.warn('Could not require cortex/router to sync routes: ' + String(e));
    39:     }
    40: 
    41:     const cortexRoutesPath = path.join(qflushDir, 'cortex.routes.json');
    42:     try {
    43:       fs.writeFileSync(cortexRoutesPath, JSON.stringify({ cortexActions: cortexRoutes }, null, 2), 'utf8');
    44:       logger.info('Wrote .qflush/cortex.routes.json');
    45:     } catch (e) {
    46:       logger.warn('Failed to write cortex.routes.json: ' + String(e));
    47:     }
    48: 
    49:     // 3) Generate supporting files if missing
    50:     const lastPath = path.join(qflushDir, 'cortex.last.json');
    51:     const cachePath = path.join(qflushDir, 'spyder.cache.json');
    52:     try { if (!fs.existsSync(lastPath)) fs.writeFileSync(lastPath, JSON.stringify({ initializedAt: new Date().toISOString() }, null, 2), 'utf8'); } catch (e) {}
    53:     try { if (!fs.existsSync(cachePath)) fs.writeFileSync(cachePath, JSON.stringify({ createdAt: new Date().toISOString(), items: [] }, null, 2), 'utf8'); } catch (e) {}
    54: 
    55:     // 4) Scan incoming JSON and PNG packets
    56:     const incomingJsonDir = path.join(qflushDir, 'incoming', 'json');
    57:     const incomingPngDir = path.join(qflushDir, 'incoming', 'png');
    58:     const collected: { pkt: CortexPacket; src?: string }[] = [];
    59: 
    60:     if (fs.existsSync(incomingJsonDir)) {
    61:       for (const f of fs.readdirSync(incomingJsonDir)) {
    62:         if (!f.endsWith('.json')) continue;
    63:         try {
    64:           const raw = fs.readFileSync(path.join(incomingJsonDir, f), 'utf8');
    65:           const j = JSON.parse(raw) as CortexPacket;
    66:           if (j && j.kind === 'cortex-packet') {
    67:             collected.push({ pkt: j, src: path.join(incomingJsonDir, f) });
    68:             logger.info('Queued incoming JSON packet: ' + (j.id || '[no-id]'));
    69:           } else {
    70:             logger.warn('Skipping JSON not matching cortex-packet: ' + f);
    71:           }
    72:         } catch (e) {
    73:           logger.warn('Failed to parse incoming json ' + f + ': ' + String(e));
    74:         }
    75:       }
    76:     }
    77: 
    78:     if (fs.existsSync(incomingPngDir)) {
    79:       for (const f of fs.readdirSync(incomingPngDir)) {
    80:         if (!f.endsWith('.png')) continue;
    81:         try {
    82:           const pkt = await decodeCortexPacketFromPng(path.join(incomingPngDir, f));
    83:           collected.push({ pkt, src: path.join(incomingPngDir, f) });
    84:           logger.info('Decoded incoming PNG packet: ' + (pkt.id || '[no-id]'));
    85:         } catch (e) {
    86:           logger.warn('Failed to decode incoming png ' + f + ': ' + String(e));
    87:         }
    88:       }
    89:     }
    90: 
    91:     // Apply collected packets
    92:     const processedDir = path.join(qflushDir, 'processed');
    93:     if (!fs.existsSync(processedDir)) fs.mkdirSync(processedDir, { recursive: true });
    94:     for (const entry of collected) {
    95:       const pkt = entry.pkt;
    96:       try {
    97:         // if approve flags present, inject into packet payload when AUTO-PATCH
    98:         if (approveAll) {
    99:           try { if (!pkt.payload) pkt.payload = {}; (pkt.payload as any).approve = true; } catch (e) {}
   100:         }
   101:         if (approveId && pkt.id === approveId) {
   102:           try { if (!pkt.payload) pkt.payload = {}; (pkt.payload as any).approve = true; } catch (e) {}
   103:         }
   104: 
   105:         logger.info('Applying packet: ' + pkt.type + ' ' + (pkt.id || ''));
   106:         await applyCortexPacket(pkt);
   107:         const last = { appliedAt: new Date().toISOString(), packet: pkt };
   108:         fs.writeFileSync(lastPath, JSON.stringify(last, null, 2), 'utf8');
   109: 
   110:         // archive original source file into dated folder
   111:         try {
   112:           if (entry.src && fs.existsSync(entry.src)) {
   113:             const m = new Date();
   114:             const y = m.getFullYear();
   115:             const mm = String(m.getMonth() + 1).padStart(2, '0');
   116:             const archiveDir = path.join(processedDir, `${y}-${mm}`);
   117:             if (!fs.existsSync(archiveDir)) fs.mkdirSync(archiveDir, { recursive: true });
   118:             const base = path.basename(entry.src);
   119:             const dest = path.join(archiveDir, `${Date.now()}-${base}`);
   120:             try { fs.renameSync(entry.src, dest); } catch (e) { fs.copyFileSync(entry.src, dest); try { fs.unlinkSync(entry.src); } catch(e){} }
   121:             // write metadata
   122:             try { fs.writeFileSync(dest + '.applied.json', JSON.stringify({ appliedAt: new Date().toISOString(), packetId: pkt.id || null }, null, 2), 'utf8'); } catch (e) {}
   123:           } else {
   124:             // if no src, write packet copy
   125:             const id = pkt.id || (`manual-${Date.now()}`);
   126:             const target = path.join(processedDir, `${id}.json`);
   127:             fs.writeFileSync(target, JSON.stringify(pkt, null, 2), 'utf8');
   128:           }
   129:         } catch (e) { /* ignore */ }
   130:       } catch (e) {
   131:         logger.warn('Failed to apply packet: ' + String(e));
   132:         // move to failed folder if source exists
   133:         try {
   134:           if (entry.src && fs.existsSync(entry.src)) {
   135:             const failDir = path.join(qflushDir, 'failed');
   136:             const m = new Date();
   137:             const y = m.getFullYear();
   138:             const mm = String(m.getMonth() + 1).padStart(2, '0');
   139:             const archiveDir = path.join(failDir, `${y}-${mm}`);
   140:             if (!fs.existsSync(archiveDir)) fs.mkdirSync(archiveDir, { recursive: true });
   141:             const base = path.basename(entry.src);
   142:             const dest = path.join(archiveDir, `${Date.now()}-${base}`);
   143:             try { fs.renameSync(entry.src, dest); } catch (e) { fs.copyFileSync(entry.src, dest); try { fs.unlinkSync(entry.src); } catch(e){} }
   144:             try { fs.writeFileSync(dest + '.error.json', JSON.stringify({ error: String(e), when: new Date().toISOString() }, null, 2), 'utf8'); } catch (e) {}
   145:           }
   146:         } catch (_) {}
   147:       }
   148:     }
   149: 
   150:     // 5) Ensure that SPYDER is wired into lifecycle: update spyder.config.json.routes with cortexRoutes keys
   151:     try {
   152:       const raw = fs.readFileSync(spyCfgPath, 'utf8');
   153:       const spyCfg = JSON.parse(raw || '{}');
   154:       spyCfg.routes = Object.keys(cortexRoutes);
   155:       fs.writeFileSync(spyCfgPath, JSON.stringify(spyCfg, null, 2), 'utf8');
   156:       logger.info('Updated spyder.config.json routes');
   157:     } catch (e) {
   158:       logger.warn('Failed to update spyder.config.json routes: ' + String(e));
   159:     }
   160: 
   161:     // cleanup old archives (keep default 6 months unless configured)
   162:     try {
   163:       const archiveUtils = require('../utils/archive');
   164:       const keep = process.env.QFLUSH_ARCHIVE_KEEP_MONTHS ? Number(process.env.QFLUSH_ARCHIVE_KEEP_MONTHS) : 6;
   165:       try {
   166:         archiveUtils.cleanupDatedArchives(path.join(qflushDir, 'processed'), keep);
   167:       } catch (e) {}
   168:       try {
   169:         archiveUtils.cleanupDatedArchives(path.join(qflushDir, 'failed'), keep);
   170:       } catch (e) {}
   171:     } catch (e) {}
   172: 
   173:     logger.success('qflush apply complete — SPYDER initialized and cortex routes synchronized');
   174:     return 0;
   175:   } catch (e) {
   176:     console.error('qflush apply failed', e);
   177:     return 1;
   178:   }
   179: }
   180: 


============================
FILE: src\commands\checksum.ts
============================
============================
     1: // ROME-TAG: 0xA0F9B4
     2: 
     3: import alias from '../utils/alias';
     4: const fetch = alias.importUtil('../utils/fetch') || alias.importUtil('@utils/fetch') || (globalThis as any).fetch;
     5: const logger = alias.importUtil('@utils/logger') || alias.importUtil('../utils/logger') || console;
     6: 
     7: const DAEMON = process.env.QFLUSH_DAEMON || 'http://localhost:4500';
     8: 
     9: async function postJson(url: string, body: any): Promise<any> {
    10:   const res = await fetch(url, { method: 'POST', headers: { 'Content-Type': 'application/json' }, body: JSON.stringify(body) } as any);
    11:   const json: any = await res.json();
    12:   return json;
    13: }
    14: 
    15: async function getJson(url: string): Promise<any> {
    16:   const res = await fetch(url);
    17:   const json: any = await res.json();
    18:   return json;
    19: }
    20: 
    21: export default async function runChecksum(argv: string[] = []) {
    22:   const sub = argv[0];
    23:   if (!sub) {
    24:     logger.info('Usage: qflush checksum <store|verify|list|clear>');
    25:     return 1;
    26:   }
    27: 
    28:   if (sub === 'store') {
    29:     const id = argv[1];
    30:     const checksum = argv[2];
    31:     const ttlArg = argv.find((a) => a.startsWith('--ttl='));
    32:     const ttlMs = ttlArg ? Number(ttlArg.split('=')[1]) : undefined;
    33:     if (!id || !checksum) {
    34:       logger.error('Usage: qflush checksum store <id> <checksum> [--ttl=ms]');
    35:       return 1;
    36:     }
    37:     const body: any = { id, checksum };
    38:     if (ttlMs) body.ttlMs = ttlMs;
    39:     const res = await postJson(`${DAEMON.replace(/\/$/, '')}/npz/checksum/store`, body);
    40:     logger.info(`store => ${JSON.stringify(res)}`);
    41:     return 0;
    42:   }
    43: 
    44:   if (sub === 'verify') {
    45:     const id = argv[1];
    46:     const checksum = argv[2];
    47:     if (!id || !checksum) {
    48:       logger.error('Usage: qflush checksum verify <id> <checksum>');
    49:       return 1;
    50:     }
    51:     const res: any = await postJson(`${DAEMON.replace(/\/$/, '')}/npz/checksum/verify`, { id, checksum });
    52:     if (res && (res as any).success) {
    53:       logger.success('verify: OK');
    54:       return 0;
    55:     }
    56:     logger.error(`verify failed: ${JSON.stringify(res)}`);
    57:     return 2;
    58:   }
    59: 
    60:   if (sub === 'list') {
    61:     const res = await getJson(`${DAEMON.replace(/\/$/, '')}/npz/checksum/list`);
    62:     logger.info(JSON.stringify(res, null, 2));
    63:     return 0;
    64:   }
    65: 
    66:   if (sub === 'clear') {
    67:     const res = await fetch(`${DAEMON.replace(/\/$/, '')}/npz/checksum/clear`, { method: 'DELETE' } as any);
    68:     const j: any = await res.json();
    69:     logger.info(JSON.stringify(j));
    70:     return 0;
    71:   }
    72: 
    73:   logger.error('Unknown checksum command');
    74:   return 1;
    75: }
    76: 


============================
FILE: src\commands\compose.ts
============================
============================
     1: // ROME-TAG: 0xD0CF40
     2: 
     3: import alias from '../utils/alias';
     4: const logger = alias.importUtil('@utils/logger') || alias.importUtil('../utils/logger') || console;
     5: import { readCompose } from '../compose/parser';
     6: import { runStart } from './start';
     7: import { startProcess, listRunning, stopProcess } from '../supervisor';
     8: import { runPurge } from './purge';
     9: import fs from 'fs';
    10: import { Tail } from 'tail';
    11: 
    12: export async function runCompose(argv: string[]) {
    13:   const sub = argv[0];
    14:   const compose = readCompose();
    15:   if (!compose) {
    16:     logger.error('No funesterie.yml or funesterie.fcl found');
    17:     return;
    18:   }
    19:   if (sub === 'up') {
    20:     // support --background flag
    21:     const bg = argv.includes('--background') || argv.includes('-b');
    22:     const modules = Object.keys(compose.modules);
    23:     for (const m of modules) {
    24:       const def = compose.modules[m];
    25:       logger.info(`Bringing up ${m} from ${def.path || 'package'}`);
    26:       if (bg) {
    27:         // start in background using supervisor
    28:         const logPath = `${process.cwd()}/.qflush/logs/${m}.log`;
    29:         startProcess(m, def.path || m, [], { cwd: def.path || process.cwd(), detached: true, logPath });
    30:       } else {
    31:         await runStart({ services: [m], modulePaths: { [m]: def.path }, flags: {} } as any);
    32:       }
    33:     }
    34:     return;
    35:   }
    36:   if (sub === 'down') {
    37:     logger.info('Bringing down all modules');
    38:     await runPurge();
    39:     return;
    40:   }
    41:   if (sub === 'restart') {
    42:     const name = argv[1];
    43:     if (!name) {
    44:       logger.info('Specify module to restart');
    45:       return;
    46:     }
    47:     // naive: stop and start
    48:     const running = listRunning();
    49:     if (running.find(r => r.name === name)) {
    50:       // stop
    51:       await stopProcess(name);
    52:     }
    53:     const def = compose.modules[name];
    54:     if (!def) { logger.info('Unknown module'); return; }
    55:     await runStart({ services: [name], modulePaths: { [name]: def.path }, flags: {} } as any);
    56:     return;
    57:   }
    58:   if (sub === 'logs') {
    59:     const name = argv[1];
    60:     if (!name) { logger.info('Specify module name'); return; }
    61:     const logFile = `${process.cwd()}/.qflush/logs/${name}.log`;
    62:     if (!fs.existsSync(logFile)) { logger.info('No log file found'); return; }
    63:     const t = new Tail(logFile, { fromBeginning: false });
    64:     t.on('line', (data: any) => console.log(data));
    65:     t.on('error', (err: any) => console.error(err));
    66:     return;
    67:   }
    68:   logger.info('Usage: qflush compose [up|down|restart|logs]');
    69: }
    70: 


============================
FILE: src\commands\config.ts
============================
============================
     1: // ROME-TAG: 0x130555
     2: 
     3: import { promises as fs } from "fs";
     4: import { logger } from "../utils/logger";
     5: import { resolvePaths } from "../utils/paths";
     6: import { qflushOptions } from "../chain/smartChain";
     7: 
     8: export async function runConfig(opts?: qflushOptions) {
     9:   logger.info("qflush: generating default configs...");
    10:   const detected = opts?.detected || {};
    11:   const paths = resolvePaths(detected);
    12:   for (const key of Object.keys(paths)) {
    13:     const p = paths[key];
    14:     if (!p) continue;
    15:     const envFile = `${p}/.env`;
    16:     try {
    17:       await fs.access(envFile);
    18:       logger.info(`${key}: .env already exists`);
    19:     } catch {
    20:       const content = `# ${key} default env\nPORT=3000\nTOKEN=changeme\n`;
    21:       await fs.mkdir(p, { recursive: true });
    22:       await fs.writeFile(envFile, content, { encoding: "utf8" });
    23:       logger.success(`Created ${envFile}`);
    24:     }
    25:   }
    26: }
    27: 
    28: 


============================
FILE: src\commands\copilot.ts
============================
============================
     1: #!/usr/bin/env node
     2: // ROME-TAG: 0x5293A0
     3: 
     4: import fetch from '../utils/fetch';
     5: import * as readline from 'readline';
     6: 
     7: async function postMessage(msg: string) {
     8:   try {
     9:     const res = await fetch(`${process.env.QFLUSH_DAEMON || 'http://localhost:4500'}/copilot/message`, { method: 'POST', body: JSON.stringify({ message: msg }), headers: { 'Content-Type': 'application/json' } } as any);
    10:     const j = await res.json();
    11:     console.log('sent', j);
    12:   } catch (e) { console.error('send failed', e); }
    13: }
    14: 
    15: export default async function runCopilot(args: string[]) {
    16:   if (args.includes('--stream')) {
    17:     // open SSE stream
    18:     const EventSource = require('eventsource');
    19:     const es = new EventSource(`${process.env.QFLUSH_DAEMON || 'http://localhost:4500'}/copilot/stream`);
    20:     es.onmessage = (ev: any) => { console.log('copilot event', ev.data); };
    21:     es.onerror = (e: any) => { console.error('SSE error', e); es.close(); };
    22:     return 0;
    23:   }
    24:   const rl = readline.createInterface({ input: process.stdin, output: process.stdout });
    25:   rl.question('message> ', async (answer) => { await postMessage(answer); rl.close(); process.exit(0); });
    26:   return 0;
    27: }
    28:

     1: #!/usr/bin/env node
     2: // ROME-TAG: 0x10C74C
     3: 
     4: import fetch from 'node-fetch';
     5: import * as fs from 'fs';
     6: 
     7: export default async function runCopilotBridge(args: string[]) {
     8:   const cfgPath = '.qflush/copilot.json';
     9:   if (!fs.existsSync(cfgPath)) { console.error('copilot not configured'); return 1; }
    10:   const cfg = JSON.parse(fs.readFileSync(cfgPath,'utf8'));
    11:   if (args[0] === 'send-snapshot') {
    12:     const state = { /* minimal snapshot */ };
    13:     try { await fetch(cfg.webhookUrl, { method: 'POST', body: JSON.stringify({ type: 'engine_snapshot', snapshot: state }), headers: { 'Content-Type': 'application/json' } }); console.log('sent'); } catch (e) { console.error('failed', e); return 2; }
    14:     return 0;
    15:   }
    16:   console.log('copilot-bridge: noop');
    17:   return 0;
    18: }

     3: import { detectModules } from "../utils/detect";
     4: import { logger } from "../utils/logger";
     5: import { qflushOptions } from "../chain/smartChain";
     6: 
     7: export async function runDetect(_opts?: qflushOptions) {
     8:   logger.info("qflush: detecting modules...");
     9:   const detected = await detectModules();
    10:   for (const k of Object.keys(detected)) {
    11:     const v = detected[k];
    12:     logger.info(`${k}: ${v.running ? 'running' : 'stopped'}`);
    13:   }
    14:   // return a normalized object
    15:   return { detected, paths: {} };
    16: }

FILE: src\commands\doctor.ts
============================
============================
     1: // ROME-TAG: 0xED1E50
     2: 
     3: import alias from '../utils/alias';
     4: const logger = alias.importUtil('@utils/logger') || alias.importUtil('../utils/logger') || console;
     5: import { detectModules } from '../utils/detect';
     6: import { httpProbe } from '../utils/health';
     7: import { SERVICE_MAP } from '../utils/paths';
     8: import { ensurePackageInstalled } from '../utils/exec';
     9: 
    10: export async function runDoctor(argv: string[] = []) {
    11:   const fix = argv.includes('--fix') || argv.includes('-f');
    12: 
    13:   logger.info('qflush: running doctor checks...');
    14:   const detected = await detectModules();
    15:   for (const k of Object.keys(detected)) {
    16:     const v = detected[k];
    17:     logger.info(`${k}: installed=${v.installed} running=${v.running} path=${v.path || 'n/a'}`);
    18:     if (v.bin && v.path) {
    19:       logger.info(`  bin: ${v.bin}`);
    20:     }
    21:   }
    22: 
    23:   // check node version
    24:   logger.info(`Node version: ${process.version}`);
    25: 
    26:   // simple http check example
    27:   const httpOk = await httpProbe('http://localhost:80', 500);
    28:   logger.info(`HTTP localhost:80 reachable: ${httpOk}`);
    29: 
    30:   if (fix) {
    31:     logger.info('Doctor fix: attempting to install missing Funeste38 packages...');
    32:     for (const name of Object.keys(SERVICE_MAP)) {
    33:       const pkg = SERVICE_MAP[name].pkg;
    34:       const detectedInfo = detected[name];
    35:       if (!detectedInfo || !detectedInfo.installed) {
    36:         logger.info(`Installing ${pkg} for service ${name}...`);
    37:         const ok = ensurePackageInstalled(pkg);
    38:         if (ok) logger.success(`Installed ${pkg}`);
    39:         else logger.warn(`Failed to install ${pkg}`);
    40:       } else {
    41:         logger.info(`${pkg} already installed`);
    42:       }
    43:     }
    44:   }
    45: 
    46:   logger.info('Doctor checks complete');
    47: }
    48:

FILE: src\commands\engine.ts
============================
============================
     1: #!/usr/bin/env node
     2: // ROME-TAG: 0xE2F4A9
     3: 
     4: import { loadRomeIndexFromDisk } from '../rome/index-loader';
     5: import { evaluateIndex } from '../rome/engine';
     6: import { executeAction } from '../rome/executor';
     7: 
     8: export default async function runEngine(args: string[]) {
     9:   const dry = args.includes('--dry-run') || args.includes('--dry');
    10:   const idx = loadRomeIndexFromDisk();
    11:   const actions = evaluateIndex(idx);
    12:   console.log('Engine actions:', actions);
    13:   if (dry) {
    14:     console.log('Running in dry-run mode, simulating actions...');
    15:     for (const a of actions) {
    16:       try {
    17:         // simulate by calling executeAction with dryRun
    18:         const actionString = String((a as any).action ?? a);
    19:         const res = await executeAction(actionString, { path: (a as any).path || null, dryRun: true });
    20:         console.log('Simulate', a, '->', res);
    21:       } catch (e) {
    22:         console.warn('simulate failed', e);
    23:       }
    24:     }
    25:   }
    26:   return 0;
    27: }
    28:

FILE: src\commands\freeze.ts
============================
============================
     1: import { freezeAll } from '../supervisor';
     2: 
     3: export default async function runFreeze(argv: string[] = []) {
     4:   // parse --health=<url>
     5:   let healthUrl: string | null = null;
     6:   for (const a of argv) {
     7:     if (a.startsWith('--health=')) {
     8:       healthUrl = a.split('=')[1];
     9:       break;
    10:     }
    11:     if (a === '--health') {
    12:       const idx = argv.indexOf(a);
    13:       if (idx >= 0 && idx < argv.length - 1) healthUrl = argv[idx + 1];
    14:       break;
    15:     }
    16:   }
    17: 
    18:   if (!healthUrl) {
    19:     freezeAll('manual');
    20:     console.log('QFLUSH frozen (manual)');
    21:     return 0;
    22:   }
    23: 
    24:   freezeAll('manual', {
    25:     autoResume: true,
    26:     resumeCheck: {
    27:       url: healthUrl,
    28:       intervalMs: 3000,
    29:       timeoutMs: 120000,
    30:     },
    31:   });
    32: 
    33:   console.log(`QFLUSH frozen + auto-resume active (health=${healthUrl})`);
    34:   return 0;
    35: }
    36:

     1: // ROME-TAG: 0xEA570C
     2: 
     3: import { logger } from "../utils/logger";
     4: import { detectModules } from "../utils/detect";
     5: import { listRunning } from "../supervisor";
     6: import { qflushOptions } from "../chain/smartChain";
     7: 
     8: export async function runInspect(opts?: qflushOptions) {
     9:   logger.info("qflush: inspecting ecosystem...");
    10:   const detected = opts?.detected || (await detectModules());
    11:   for (const key of Object.keys(detected)) {
    12:     const v = detected[key];
    13:     logger.info(`${key}: ${v.running ? `running (pid=${v.pid || 'unknown'})` : 'stopped'}`);
    14:     if (v.port) logger.info(`  port: ${v.port}`);
    15:     if (v.installed) logger.info(`  installed: true`);
    16:   }
    17:   const running = listRunning();
    18:   if (running.length) {
    19:     logger.info("Supervisor running processes:");
    20:     for (const r of running) logger.info(`  ${r.name}: pid=${r.pid} cmd=${r.cmd}`);
    21:   }
    22: }

============================
FILE: src\commands\license.ts
============================
============================
     1: /* ROME-TAG: 0xF45330 */
     2: import alias from '../utils/alias';
     3: const logger = alias.importUtil('@utils/logger') || alias.importUtil('../utils/logger') || console;
     4: import gumroad from '../utils/gumroad-license';
     5: import { getSecret } from '../utils/secrets';
     6: 
     7: export async function runLicense(argv: string[] = []) {
     8:   const sub = argv[0];
     9:   if (!sub) {
    10:     logger.info('Usage: qflush license activate <key> [--product=<id>]');
    11:     return 1;
    12:   }
    13: 
    14:   if (sub === 'activate') {
    15:     const key = argv[1];
    16:     if (!key) {
    17:       logger.error('No license key provided. Usage: qflush license activate <key> [--product=<id>]');
    18:       return 1;
    19:     }
    20:     // parse optional --product=ID
    21:     const prodArg = argv.find((a) => a.startsWith('--product='));
    22:     const productId = prodArg ? prodArg.split('=')[1] : process.env.GUMROAD_PRODUCT_ID || process.env.GUMROAD_PRODUCT_YEARLY || process.env.GUMROAD_PRODUCT_MONTHLY;
    23:     const token = getSecret('GUMROAD_TOKEN', { fileEnv: 'GUMROAD_TOKEN_FILE' });
    24:     if (!token) {
    25:       logger.error('GUMROAD_TOKEN not set (env or file). Set it to perform activation.');
    26:       return 1;
    27:     }
    28:     if (!productId) {
    29:       logger.warn('No product id provided, continuing with provided key verification (Gumroad may accept product lookup).');
    30:     }
    31:     try {
    32:       const rec = await gumroad.activateLicense(productId as string, key, token);
    33:       logger.success(`License activated. Expires: ${rec.expiresAt ? new Date(rec.expiresAt).toISOString() : 'subscription/never'}`);
    34:       return 0;
    35:     } catch (err: any) {
    36:       logger.error(`License activation failed: ${err.message || err}`);
    37:       return 2;
    38:     }
    39:   }
    40: 
    41:   if (sub === 'status') {
    42:     const rec = gumroad.loadLicense();
    43:     if (!rec) {
    44:       logger.info('No local license found');
    45:       return 0;
    46:     }
    47:     logger.info(`Local license: key=${rec.key} product=${rec.product_id} expires=${rec.expiresAt ? new Date(rec.expiresAt).toISOString() : 'never'}`);
    48:     return 0;
    49:   }
    50: 
    51:   if (sub === 'clear') {
    52:     gumroad.clearLicense();
    53:     logger.info('Local license cleared');
    54:     return 0;
    55:   }
    56: 
    57:   logger.info('Unknown license command');
    58:   return 1;
    59: }
    60:

     3: import license from '../utils/license';
     4: 
     5: export default async function runLicenseActivate(args: string[]) {
     6:   const key = args[0];
     7:   const product = args[1] || process.env.GUMROAD_PRODUCT_MONTHLY;
     8:   if (!key) {
     9:     console.error('usage: qflush license:activate <key> [product_id]');
    10:     return 1;
    11:   }
    12:   try {
    13:     const res = await license.activateLicense(key, product);
    14:     if (res.ok) {
    15:       console.log('License activated:', res.license);
    16:       return 0;
    17:     }
    18:     console.error('Activation failed:', res.error);
    19:     return 2;
    20:   } catch (e) {
    21:     console.error('Activation error:', e);
    22:     return 3;
    23:   }
    24: }

     4: import { loadLogicRules } from '../rome/logic-loader';

     6: import { evaluateRulesForRecord } from '../rome/logic-loader';
     7: 
     8: export default async function runLogic(args: string[]) {
     9:   const rules = loadLogicRules();
    10:   console.log('Loaded rules:', rules.map(r=>r.name));

    13:     const matches = evaluateRulesForRecord(idx, p as any);
    14:     if (matches.length) console.log('Match for', (p as any).path, matches);
    15:   }
    16:   return 0;
    17: }

FILE: src\commands\npz-scores.ts
============================
============================
     1: // ROME-TAG: 0xF933B3
     2: 
     3: import engine from '../utils/npz-engine';
     4: import { stringify } from 'csv-stringify/sync';
     5: 
     6: export async function runNpzScores(args: string[] = []) {
     7:   const store = engine.getStore();
     8:   const items = Object.values(store).map((r: any) => ({ laneId: r.laneId, score: r.score, lastSuccess: r.lastSuccess, lastFailure: r.lastFailure }));
     9:   // sort by score asc
    10:   items.sort((a, b) => (a.score as number) - (b.score as number));
    11: 
    12:   if (args.includes('--reset')) {
    13:     engine.resetScores();
    14:     console.log('npz: scores reset');
    15:     return 0;
    16:   }
    17: 
    18:   if (args.includes('--csv')) {
    19:     const records = items.map((it) => ({ laneId: it.laneId, score: it.score, lastSuccess: it.lastSuccess || '', lastFailure: it.lastFailure || '' }));
    20:     const csv = stringify(records, { header: true });
    21:     console.log(csv);
    22:     return 0;
    23:   }
    24: 
    25:   console.log(JSON.stringify(items, null, 2));
    26:   return 0;
    27: }
    28: 
    29: export default runNpzScores;
    30: 


============================
FILE: src\commands\purge.ts
============================
============================
     1: // ROME-TAG: 0x263C6D
     2: 
     3: import { logger } from "../utils/logger";
     4: import { resolvePaths } from "../utils/paths";
     5: import { rimrafSync } from "../utils/exec";
     6: import { clearState } from "../supervisor";
     7: import { qflushOptions } from "../chain/smartChain";
     8: 
     9: export async function runPurge(opts?: qflushOptions) {
    10:   logger.info("qflush: purging caches, logs, sessions and supervisor state...");
    11:   const paths = resolvePaths(opts?.detected || {});
    12:   const targets = [] as string[];
    13:   for (const key of Object.keys(paths)) {
    14:     const p = paths[key];
    15:     if (!p) continue;
    16:     targets.push(`${p}/.cache`);
    17:     targets.push(`${p}/logs`);
    18:     targets.push(`${p}/tmp`);
    19:     targets.push(`${p}/sessions`);
    20:   }
    21:   for (const t of targets) {
    22:     try {
    23:       rimrafSync(t);
    24:       logger.success(`Removed ${t}`);
    25:     } catch (err) {
    26:       logger.warn(`Failed to remove ${t}: ${err}`);
    27:     }
    28:   }
    29:   // clear supervisor state
    30:   clearState();
    31:   logger.info("Purge complete.");
    32: }
    33: 
    34:
