============================
FILE: src\commands\safe-run.ts
============================
============================
     1: import { spawn } from 'child_process';
     2: 
     3: export default async function runSafeRun(argv: string[] = []) {
     4:   // parse options
     5:   let timeoutSec = 10;
     6:   let detach = false;
     7:   const args: string[] = [];
     8: 
     9:   for (let i = 0; i < argv.length; i++) {
    10:     const a = argv[i];
    11:     if (a === '--detach') {
    12:       detach = true;
    13:       continue;
    14:     }
    15:     if (a === '--timeout' && i < argv.length - 1) {
    16:       const v = Number(argv[i + 1]);
    17:       if (!Number.isNaN(v) && v > 0) timeoutSec = Math.max(1, Math.floor(v));
    18:       i++;
    19:       continue;
    20:     }
    21:     // collect remaining as command args
    22:     args.push(a);
    23:   }
    24: 
    25:   if (args.length === 0) {
    26:     console.log('usage: qflush safe-run [--detach] [--timeout N] <qflush-subcommand> [args...]');
    27:     console.log('example: qflush safe-run --detach start --service rome');
    28:     return 1;
    29:   }
    30: 
    31:   // Default behavior: run the built daemon CLI: node dist/index.js <args...>
    32:   const node = process.execPath;
    33:   const childArgs = ['dist/index.js', ...args];
    34: 
    35:   if (detach) {
    36:     try {
    37:       const c = spawn(node, childArgs, { detached: true, stdio: 'ignore' });
    38:       c.unref();
    39:       console.log(`qflush safe-run: started detached pid=${c.pid}`);
    40:       return 0;
    41:     } catch (e) {
    42:       console.error('safe-run detach failed', e);
    43:       return 2;
    44:     }
    45:   }
    46: 
    47:   // Not detached: run with watchdog timeout
    48:   return await new Promise<number>((resolve) => {
    49:     const child = spawn(node, childArgs, { stdio: 'inherit' as any });
    50:     let finished = false;
    51: 
    52:     const onExit = (code: number | null) => {
    53:       if (finished) return;
    54:       finished = true;
    55:       resolve(code === null ? 0 : code);
    56:     };
    57: 
    58:     child.on('exit', onExit);
    59:     child.on('error', (err) => {
    60:       if (finished) return;
    61:       finished = true;
    62:       console.error('safe-run child error', err);
    63:       resolve(3);
    64:     });
    65: 
    66:     const timer = setTimeout(() => {
    67:       if (finished) return;
    68:       console.warn(`[safe-run] timeout ${timeoutSec}s reached — sending SIGINT to pid=${child.pid}`);
    69:       try { child.kill('SIGINT'); } catch (e) { /* ignore */ }
    70: 
    71:       // wait short then force kill
    72:       setTimeout(() => {
    73:         if (finished) return;
    74:         console.warn(`[safe-run] still running — forcing kill pid=${child.pid}`);
    75:         try { child.kill('SIGTERM'); } catch (e) { try { child.kill(); } catch {} }
    76:       }, 2000);
    77:     }, timeoutSec * 1000);
    78: 
    79:     // clear timer on finish
    80:     (child as any).once && (child as any).once('exit', () => { clearTimeout(timer); });
    81:   });
    82: }
    83: 


============================
FILE: src\commands\secret-import.ts
============================
============================
     1: import { spawnSync } from 'child_process';
     2: import path from 'path';
     3: 
     4: export default async function runSecretImport(argv: string[] = []) {
     5:   // usage: qflush secret import [--env <path>] [--no-acl]
     6:   let envPath: string | undefined;
     7:   let restrictAcl = true;
     8: 
     9:   for (let i = 0; i < argv.length; i++) {
    10:     const a = argv[i];
    11:     if ((a === '--env' || a === '-e') && i < argv.length - 1) {
    12:       envPath = argv[i + 1];
    13:       i++;
    14:       continue;
    15:     }
    16:     if (a === '--no-acl') {
    17:       restrictAcl = false;
    18:       continue;
    19:     }
    20:   }
    21: 
    22:   // default envPath to Desktop .env
    23:   if (!envPath) {
    24:     const home = process.env.USERPROFILE || process.env.HOME || '';
    25:     envPath = path.join(home, 'Desktop', '.env');
    26:   }
    27: 
    28:   const script = path.join(process.cwd(), 'scripts', 'import-env-to-secrets.ps1');
    29:   const pwsh = process.env.PWSH || 'pwsh';
    30: 
    31:   const args = ['-NoProfile', '-ExecutionPolicy', 'Bypass', '-File', script, '-EnvPath', envPath];
    32:   if (restrictAcl) args.push('-RestrictFileAcl');
    33: 
    34:   console.log('Running import script:', pwsh, args.join(' '));
    35: 
    36:   const res = spawnSync(pwsh, args, { stdio: 'inherit' });
    37:   if (res.error) {
    38:     console.error('Failed to execute import script:', res.error);
    39:     return 2;
    40:   }
    41:   return res.status ?? 0;
    42: }
    43: 


============================
FILE: src\commands\spyder.ts
============================
============================
     1: // ROME-TAG: 0x5PYD3R
     2: 
     3: import { spawn } from 'child_process';
     4: import * as fs from 'fs';
     5: import * as path from 'path';
     6: 
     7: let fetch: any;
     8: try { fetch = require('node-fetch'); } catch (e) { fetch = undefined; }
     9: 
    10: const CFG_PATH = path.join(process.cwd(), '.qflush', 'spyder.config.json');
    11: 
    12: function loadCfg() {
    13:   try {
    14:     if (!fs.existsSync(CFG_PATH)) return null;
    15:     return JSON.parse(fs.readFileSync(CFG_PATH, 'utf8'));
    16:   } catch (e) { return null; }
    17: }
    18: 
    19: export default async function runSpyder(argv: string[] = []) {
    20:   const sub = (argv && argv[0]) || 'status';
    21:   const cfg: any = loadCfg();
    22:   if (!cfg || !cfg.enabled) {
    23:     console.log('Spyder not enabled or not configured (see .qflush/spyder.config.json)');
    24:     return 0;
    25:   }
    26: 
    27:   if (sub === 'start') {
    28:     if (!cfg.startCommand) { console.error('no startCommand configured for Spyder'); return 1; }
    29:     try {
    30:       const parts = Array.isArray(cfg.startCommand) ? cfg.startCommand : String(cfg.startCommand).split(' ');
    31:       const proc = spawn(parts[0], parts.slice(1), { cwd: cfg.path || process.cwd(), detached: true, stdio: 'ignore', shell: true });
    32:       proc.unref();
    33:       if (cfg.pidFile) fs.writeFileSync(cfg.pidFile, String(proc.pid), 'utf8');
    34:       console.log('Spyder start invoked (detached).');
    35:       return 0;
    36:     } catch (e) {
    37:       console.error('failed to start Spyder:', String(e));
    38:       return 1;
    39:     }
    40:   }
    41: 
    42:   if (sub === 'stop') {
    43:     if (cfg.pidFile && fs.existsSync(cfg.pidFile)) {
    44:       try {
    45:         const pid = Number(fs.readFileSync(cfg.pidFile, 'utf8'));
    46:         try { process.kill(pid); } catch (e) {}
    47:         try { fs.unlinkSync(cfg.pidFile); } catch (e) {}
    48:         console.log('Spyder stop requested (pid ' + pid + ').');
    49:         return 0;
    50:       } catch (e) { console.error('failed to stop Spyder', String(e)); return 1; }
    51:     }
    52:     console.log('no pidFile for Spyder; cannot stop cleanly');
    53:     return 0;
    54:   }
    55: 
    56:   if (sub === 'status') {
    57:     // status
    58:     if (cfg.healthUrl) {
    59:       try {
    60:         const res = await (fetch ? fetch(cfg.healthUrl, { method: 'GET' }) : Promise.reject(new Error('fetch not available')));
    61:         if (res.ok) { console.log('Spyder healthy'); return 0; }
    62:         console.log('Spyder unhealthy, status', res.status);
    63:         return 2;
    64:       } catch (e) {
    65:         console.log('Spyder health check failed:', String(e));
    66:         return 3;
    67:       }
    68:     }
    69: 
    70:     // fallback: check pid
    71:     if (cfg.pidFile && fs.existsSync(cfg.pidFile)) {
    72:       try {
    73:         const pid = Number(fs.readFileSync(cfg.pidFile,'utf8'));
    74:         try { process.kill(pid, 0); console.log('Spyder running (pid', pid + ')'); return 0; } catch (e) { console.log('Spyder not running'); return 3; }
    75:       } catch (e) { console.log('Spyder check failed', String(e)); return 3; }
    76:     }
    77: 
    78:     console.log('Spyder not running (no healthUrl or pidFile)');
    79:     return 3;
    80:   }
    81: }
    82: 


============================
FILE: src\commands\start.ts
============================
============================
     1: // ROME-TAG: 0xF73710
     2: 
     3: import { detectModules } from "../utils/detect";
     4: import logger from "../utils/logger";
     5: import { spawnSafe, ensurePackageInstalled, pathExists, rebuildInstructionsFor } from "../utils/exec";
     6: import { resolvePaths, SERVICE_MAP } from "../utils/paths";
     7: import { qflushOptions } from "../chain/smartChain";
     8: import { resolvePackagePath, readPackageJson } from "../utils/package";
     9: import { startProcess } from "../supervisor";
    10: import { waitForService } from "../utils/health";
    11: import { runCustomsCheck, hasBlockingIssues, ModuleDescriptor } from "../utils/npz-customs";
    12: import npz from "../utils/npz";
    13: import { resolveMerged } from "../supervisor/merged-resolver";
    14: import * as fs from 'fs';
    15: import { spawnSync } from 'child_process';
    16: import { startService } from '../services';
    17: 
    18: export async function runStart(opts?: qflushOptions) {
    19:   logger.info("qflush: starting modules...");
    20: 
    21:   // Respect CI/dev flag to disable supervisor starting external services
    22:   const disableSupervisor = process.env.QFLUSH_DISABLE_SUPERVISOR === '1' || String(process.env.QFLUSH_DISABLE_SUPERVISOR).toLowerCase() === 'true';
    23:   if (disableSupervisor) {
    24:     logger.warn('QFLUSH supervisor disabled via QFLUSH_DISABLE_SUPERVISOR, skipping start of external modules');
    25:     return;
    26:   }
    27: 
    28:   const detected = opts?.detected || (await detectModules());
    29:   const paths = resolvePaths(detected);
    30: 
    31:   const services = opts?.services && opts.services.length ? opts.services : Object.keys(SERVICE_MAP);
    32:   const flags = opts?.flags || {};
    33: 
    34:   const waitForStart = Boolean(flags["wait"] || flags["--wait"] || false);
    35:   const doRestart = Boolean(flags["restart"] || flags["--restart"] || flags["force"] || false);
    36:   const maxRestarts = typeof flags["restartCount"] === "number" ? (flags["restartCount"] as number) : 3;
    37: 
    38:   const procs: Promise<void>[] = [];
    39: 
    40:   async function ensureBuiltIfNeeded(prefixPath: string) {
    41:     try {
    42:       const pathJoin = require('path').join;
    43:       const candidates = [
    44:         prefixPath,
    45:         pathJoin(prefixPath, 'spyder'),
    46:         pathJoin(prefixPath, 'apps', 'spyder-core')
    47:       ];
    48: 
    49:       for (const cand of candidates) {
    50:         const distEntry = require('path').join(cand, 'dist', 'index.js');
    51:         if (fs.existsSync(distEntry)) {
    52:           return true;
    53:         }
    54:       }
    55: 
    56:       // Try to build candidates that have a build script
    57:       for (const cand of candidates) {
    58:         try {
    59:           const pkgJsonPath = require('path').join(cand, 'package.json');
    60:           if (!fs.existsSync(pkgJsonPath)) continue;
    61:           const pj = readPackageJson(cand);
    62:           if (!pj || !pj.scripts || !pj.scripts.build) continue;
    63: 
    64:           logger.info(`Local package at ${cand} missing dist; running build...`);
    65:           const r = spawnSync('npm', ['--prefix', cand, 'run', 'build'], { stdio: 'inherit' });
    66:           if (r.status === 0) {
    67:             const distEntry = require('path').join(cand, 'dist', 'index.js');
    68:             if (fs.existsSync(distEntry)) return true;
    69:           }
    70:         } catch (e) {
    71:           // continue trying other candidates
    72:         }
    73:       }
    74: 
    75:       logger.warn(`No build artifact found under ${prefixPath} or subpackages`);
    76:       return false;
    77:     } catch (e) {
    78:       logger.warn(`ensureBuiltIfNeeded failed: ${e}`);
    79:       return false;
    80:     }
    81:   }
    82: 
    83:   async function startWithCustoms(modName: string) {
    84:     const p = (opts?.modulePaths && opts.modulePaths[modName]) || paths[modName];
    85:     const pkg = SERVICE_MAP[modName] && SERVICE_MAP[modName].pkg;
    86: 
    87:     const modDesc: ModuleDescriptor = { name: modName, pkg, cwd: p || process.cwd() };
    88: 
    89:     // run customs
    90:     const report = await runCustomsCheck(modDesc);
    91:     if (hasBlockingIssues(report)) {
    92:       logger.warn(`supervisor: ${modName} blocked at customs, not starting.`);
    93:       return;
    94:     }
    95: 
    96:     // if an explicit path is provided, prefer to run it directly
    97:     if (p) {
    98:       try {
    99:         const pkgJson = readPackageJson(p);
   100:         if (pkgJson && pkgJson.bin) {
   101:           const binEntry = typeof pkgJson.bin === "string" ? pkgJson.bin : Object.values(pkgJson.bin)[0];
   102:           const binPath = require("path").join(p, binEntry);
   103: 
   104:           // if bin exists and is a JS file, run via node; otherwise try to run directly but fallback to node if not executable
   105:           let runCmd = null as any;
   106:           if (pathExists(binPath) && binPath.endsWith('.js')) {
   107:             runCmd = { cmd: process.execPath, args: [binPath], cwd: p };
   108:           } else if (pathExists(binPath)) {
   109:             // check executable bit on POSIX; on Windows assume runnable
   110:             let isExec = true;
   111:             try {
   112:               if (process.platform !== 'win32') {
   113:                 const st = fs.statSync(binPath);
   114:                 isExec = !!(st.mode & 0o111);
   115:               }
   116:             } catch (e) { isExec = false; }
   117: 
   118:             if (isExec) {
   119:               runCmd = { cmd: binPath, args: [], cwd: p };
   120:             } else {
   121:               // fallback: attempt to run with node
   122:               runCmd = { cmd: process.execPath, args: [binPath], cwd: p };
   123:             }
   124:           }
   125: 
   126:           // if no bin but there is a start script, prefer npm --prefix <p> run start
   127:           if (!runCmd && pkgJson && pkgJson.scripts && pkgJson.scripts.start) {
   128:             runCmd = { cmd: 'npm', args: ['--prefix', p, 'run', 'start'], cwd: p };
   129:           }
   130: 
   131:           // If runCmd still not set or dist missing, try common subpackage locations
   132:           if (!runCmd) {
   133:             const subCandidates = ['spyder', 'apps/spyder-core'];
   134:             for (const sub of subCandidates) {
   135:               try {
   136:                 const subPkg = require('path').join(p, sub);
   137:                 const subPkgJsonPath = require('path').join(subPkg, 'package.json');
   138:                 if (fs.existsSync(subPkgJsonPath)) {
   139:                   const subPkgJson = readPackageJson(subPkg);
   140:                   if (subPkgJson && subPkgJson.scripts && subPkgJson.scripts.start) {
   141:                     runCmd = { cmd: 'npm', args: ['--prefix', subPkg, 'run', 'start'], cwd: subPkg };
   142:                     break;
   143:                   }
   144:                 }
   145:               } catch (_) {}
   146:             }
   147:           }
   148: 
   149:           if (runCmd) {
   150:             // if runCmd is npm start with prefix, ensure build exists
   151:             if (runCmd.cmd === 'npm' && runCmd.args.includes('run') && runCmd.args.includes('start')) {
   152:               const ok = await ensureBuiltIfNeeded(p);
   153:               if (!ok) return;
   154:             }
   155: 
   156:             logger.info(`Launching ${modName} -> ${runCmd.cmd} ${runCmd.args.join(" ")}`);
   157:             startProcess(modName, runCmd.cmd, runCmd.args, { cwd: runCmd.cwd });
   158:             return;
   159:           }
   160:         }
   161:       } catch (e) {
   162:         logger.warn(`Failed to run local path for ${modName}: ${e}`);
   163:       }
   164:     }
   165: 
   166:     // otherwise, use merged resolver (supervisor + NPZ) as primary
   167:     if (pkg) {
   168:       const resolved = await resolveMerged(pkg);
   169:       if (!resolved) {
   170:         logger.warn(`${modName} path and package not found or merged resolver failed to resolve, skipping`);
   171:         return;
   172:       }
   173: 
   174:       if (resolved.gate === 'dlx') {
   175:         const ok = ensurePackageInstalled(pkg);
   176:         if (!ok) {
   177:           logger.warn(`${modName} not found and failed to install ${pkg}, skipping`);
   178:           return;
   179:         }
   180:       }
   181: 
   182:       const runCmd = { cmd: resolved.cmd as string, args: resolved.args || [], cwd: resolved.cwd };
   183:       logger.info(`Launching ${modName} -> ${runCmd.cmd} ${runCmd.args.join(" ")}`);
   184:       startProcess(modName, runCmd.cmd, runCmd.args, { cwd: runCmd.cwd });
   185:       return;
   186:     }
   187: 
   188:     logger.warn(`${modName} has no runnable entry, skipping`);
   189:   }
   190: 
   191:   for (const mod of services) {
   192:     const promise = (async () => {
   193:       // If embed mode is enabled, use startService
   194:       const embed = process.env.QFLUSH_EMBED_SERVICES === '1';
   195:       if (embed) {
   196:         try {
   197:           await startService(mod, { flags });
   198:           return;
   199:         } catch (e) {
   200:           logger.warn(`embedded start failed for ${mod}: ${e}`);
   201:           return;
   202:         }
   203:       }
   204: 
   205:       // Use enhanced master flow which handles missing local bins and robust spawn
   206:       const p = (opts?.modulePaths && opts.modulePaths[mod]) || paths[mod];
   207:       const pkg = SERVICE_MAP[mod] && SERVICE_MAP[mod].pkg;
   208: 
   209:       // resolve package path (local node_modules or provided path)
   210:       let pkgPath = p;
   211:       if (!pkgPath && pkg) pkgPath = resolvePackagePath(pkg);
   212: 
   213:       if (!pkgPath && pkg) {
   214:         const ok = ensurePackageInstalled(pkg);
   215:         if (!ok) {
   216:           logger.warn(`${mod} not found and failed to install ${pkg}, skipping`);
   217:           return;
   218:         }
   219:         pkgPath = resolvePackagePath(pkg);
   220:       }
   221: 
   222:       if (!pkgPath) {
   223:         // fallback to customs+merged-resolver flow
   224:         await startWithCustoms(mod);
   225:         return;
   226:       }
   227: 
   228:       const pkgJson = readPackageJson(pkgPath);
   229: 
   230:       // choose how to run: package bin if present, else merged resolver
   231:       let runCmd: { cmd: string; args: string[]; cwd?: string } | null = null;
   232: 
   233:       // 1) package bin entry
   234:       if (pkgJson && pkgJson.bin) {
   235:         const binEntry = typeof pkgJson.bin === "string" ? pkgJson.bin : Object.values(pkgJson.bin)[0];
   236:         const binPath = require("path").join(pkgPath, binEntry);
   237:         if (binPath.endsWith(".js") && pathExists(binPath)) {
   238:           runCmd = { cmd: process.execPath, args: [binPath], cwd: pkgPath };
   239:         } else if (pathExists(binPath)) {
   240:           let isExec = true;
   241:           try {
   242:             if (process.platform !== 'win32') {
   243:               const st = fs.statSync(binPath);
   244:               isExec = !!(st.mode & 0o111);
   245:             }
   246:           } catch (e) { isExec = false; }
   247:           if (isExec) runCmd = { cmd: binPath, args: [], cwd: pkgPath };
   248:           else runCmd = { cmd: process.execPath, args: [binPath], cwd: pkgPath };
   249:         } else {
   250:           logger.warn(`${mod} bin entry not found at ${binPath}. ${rebuildInstructionsFor(pkgPath)}`);
   251:         }
   252:       }
   253: 
   254:       // 2) package start script
   255:       if (!runCmd && pkgJson && pkgJson.scripts && pkgJson.scripts.start) {
   256:         runCmd = { cmd: 'npm', args: ['--prefix', pkgPath, 'run', 'start'], cwd: pkgPath };
   257:       }
   258: 
   259:       // 3) try common subpackage locations
   260:       if (!runCmd) {
   261:         const subCandidates = ['spyder', 'apps/spyder-core'];
   262:         for (const sub of subCandidates) {
   263:           try {
   264:             const subPkg = require('path').join(pkgPath, sub);
   265:             const subPkgJsonPath = require('path').join(subPkg, 'package.json');
   266:             if (fs.existsSync(subPkgJsonPath)) {
   267:               const subPkgJson = readPackageJson(subPkg);
   268:               if (subPkgJson && subPkgJson.scripts && subPkgJson.scripts.start) {
   269:                 runCmd = { cmd: 'npm', args: ['--prefix', subPkg, 'run', 'start'], cwd: subPkg };
   270:                 break;
   271:               }
   272:             }
   273:           } catch (_) {}
   274:         }
   275:       }
   276: 
   277:       // 4) fallback to merged resolver if still not found
   278:       if (!runCmd && pkg) {
   279:         const resolved = await resolveMerged(pkg);
   280:         if (!resolved || resolved.gate === 'fail') {
   281:           logger.warn(`${mod} has no runnable entry, skipping`);
   282:           return;
   283:         }
   284:         runCmd = { cmd: resolved.cmd as string, args: resolved.args || [], cwd: resolved.cwd };
   285:       }
   286: 
   287:       if (!runCmd) {
   288:         logger.warn(`${mod} has no runnable entry, skipping`);
   289:         return;
   290:       }
   291: 
   292:       // if runCmd is npm start with prefix, ensure built
   293:       if (runCmd.cmd === 'npm' && runCmd.args.includes('run') && runCmd.args.includes('start')) {
   294:         const prefixIdx = runCmd.args.indexOf('--prefix');
   295:         const prefixPath = prefixIdx !== -1 ? runCmd.args[prefixIdx + 1] : runCmd.cwd || pkgPath;
   296:         const ok = await ensureBuiltIfNeeded(prefixPath as string);
   297:         if (!ok) return;
   298:       }
   299: 
   300:       const restarts = 0;
   301: 
   302:       const spawnOnce = (): Promise<void> => {
   303:         return new Promise((resolve) => {
   304:           logger.info(`Launching ${mod} -> ${runCmd!.cmd} ${runCmd!.args.join(" ")}`);
   305: 
   306:           // use supervisor to manage and persist process
   307:           const child = startProcess(mod, runCmd!.cmd, runCmd!.args, { cwd: runCmd!.cwd });
   308: 
   309:           if (waitForStart) {
   310:             // try to wait for a health endpoint if provided in flags
   311:             const svcUrl = flags["health-url"] || flags["health"];
   312:             const svcPort = flags["health-port"] || undefined;
   313:             if (svcUrl) {
   314:               waitForService(svcUrl as string, svcPort as any).then((ok) => {
   315:                 if (ok) logger.success(`${mod} passed health check`);
   316:                 else logger.warn(`${mod} failed health check`);
   317:                 resolve();
   318:               });
   319:             } else {
   320:               // wait for spawn via PID persistence
   321:               setTimeout(() => {
   322:                 logger.info(`${mod} started (delayed wait).`);
   323:                 resolve();
   324:               }, 2000);
   325:             }
   326:           } else {
   327:             resolve();
   328:           }
   329: 
   330:           // child exit handled by supervisor
   331:         });
   332:       };
   333: 
   334:       // start the first time and optionally wait
   335:       await spawnOnce();
   336: 
   337:       // restart logic handled by supervisor-level events, keep simple here
   338:     })();
   339:     procs.push(promise);
   340:   }
   341: 
   342:   await Promise.all(procs);
   343: 
   344:   // After starting services, optionally start SPYDER resonnance when configured
   345:   try {
   346:     const spyCfgPath = require('path').join(process.cwd(), '.qflush', 'spyder.config.json');
   347:     if (fs.existsSync(spyCfgPath)) {
   348:       try {
   349:         const raw = fs.readFileSync(spyCfgPath, 'utf8');
   350:         const spyCfg = JSON.parse(raw || '{}');
   351:         if (spyCfg && spyCfg.enabled) {
   352:           // start resonnance (non-blocking)
   353:           try {
   354:             const m: any = await import('../cortex/resonnance.js');
   355:             if (m && typeof m.resonnance === 'function') {
   356:               // launch but don't await to keep start fast
   357:               void m.resonnance();
   358:               logger.info('SPYDER resonnance started as part of qflush start');
   359:             } else if (m && typeof m.default === 'function') {
   360:               // fallback if module exports default command runner
   361:               void m.default();
   362:               logger.info('SPYDER resonnance (default) started as part of qflush start');
   363:             } else {
   364:               logger.warn('SPYDER resonnance module found but no callable export');
   365:             }
   366:           } catch (e) {
   367:             logger.warn('Failed to import/start SPYDER resonnance: ' + String(e));
   368:           }
   369:         }
   370:       } catch (e) {
   371:         logger.warn('Failed to read or parse spyder.config.json: ' + String(e));
   372:       }
   373:     }
   374:   } catch (_) {}
   375: 
   376:   // Also, if cortex.routes.json contains routes, start resonnance (makes SPYDER active when routes present)
   377:   try {
   378:     const routesPath = require('path').join(process.cwd(), '.qflush', 'cortex.routes.json');
   379:     if (fs.existsSync(routesPath)) {
   380:       try {
   381:         const rawRoutes = fs.readFileSync(routesPath, 'utf8') || '{}';
   382:         const parsed = JSON.parse(rawRoutes);
   383:         const routesArr = parsed && (parsed.routes || parsed.cortexActions) ? (parsed.routes || parsed.cortexActions) : null;
   384:         let count = 0;
   385:         if (Array.isArray(routesArr)) count = routesArr.length;
   386:         else if (routesArr && typeof routesArr === 'object') count = Object.keys(routesArr).length;
   387:         if (count > 0) {
   388:           try {
   389:             const m: any = await import('../cortex/resonnance.js');
   390:             if (m && typeof m.resonnance === 'function') {
   391:               void m.resonnance();
   392:               logger.info('SPYDER resonnance started because cortex.routes.json contains routes');
   393:             }
   394:           } catch (e) {
   395:             logger.warn('Failed to import/start SPYDER resonnance from cortex.routes: ' + String(e));
   396:           }
   397:         }
   398:       } catch (e) {
   399:         logger.warn('Failed to read or parse cortex.routes.json: ' + String(e));
   400:       }
   401:     }
   402:   } catch (_) {}
   403: 
   404:   logger.success("qflush: start sequence initiated for selected modules");
   405: }
   406: 
   407: 


============================
FILE: src\commands\vision.ts
============================
============================
     1: import vision from '../cortex/vision';
     2: 
     3: export default async function runVision(argv: string[] = []) {
     4:   const file = argv[0];
     5:   if (!file) {
     6:     console.log('usage: qflush vision <png-path>');
     7:     return 1;
     8:   }
     9:   try {
    10:     const res = await vision.processVisionImage(file);
    11:     console.log('vision processed, output written to .qflush/spyder-vision.json');
    12:     return 0;
    13:   } catch (e) {
    14:     console.error('vision failed', e);
    15:     return 2;
    16:   }
    17: }
    18: 


============================
FILE: src\compose\fclParser.ts
============================
============================
     1: // ROME-TAG: 0x5D80DC
     2: 
     3: import fs from 'fs';
     4: 
     5: function parseValue(raw: string): any {
     6:   const v = raw.trim();
     7:   if (v.startsWith('[') && v.endsWith(']')) {
     8:     // simple list parser
     9:     const inside = v.slice(1, -1).trim();
    10:     if (!inside) return [];
    11:     return inside.split(',').map(x => x.trim().replace(/^"|"$/g, ''));
    12:   }
    13:   if (/^\d+$/.test(v)) return Number(v);
    14:   return v.replace(/^"|"$/g, '');
    15: }
    16: 
    17: export function readFCL(file = 'funesterie.fcl') {
    18:   try {
    19:     const raw = fs.readFileSync(file, 'utf8');
    20:     const lines = raw.split(/\r?\n/);
    21:     const out: any = { project: {}, env: {}, service: {}, pipeline: {} };
    22:     let current: { section?: string, name?: string } = {};
    23:     for (let line of lines) {
    24:       line = line.trim();
    25:       if (!line || line.startsWith('#') || line.startsWith('//')) continue;
    26:       if (line.startsWith('@')) {
    27:         const parts = line.split(/	|\s+/).filter(Boolean);
    28:         const sec = parts[0].slice(1);
    29:         const name = parts[1] || undefined;
    30:         current = { section: sec, name };
    31:         if (name) {
    32:           if (!out[sec]) out[sec] = {};
    33:           out[sec][name] = out[sec][name] || {};
    34:         }
    35:         continue;
    36:       }
    37:       const eq = line.indexOf('=');
    38:       if (eq === -1) continue;
    39:       const key = line.slice(0, eq).trim();
    40:       const val = parseValue(line.slice(eq + 1));
    41:       if (current.section) {
    42:         if (current.name) {
    43:           out[current.section][current.name][key] = val;
    44:         } else {
    45:           out[current.section][key] = val;
    46:         }
    47:       }
    48:     }
    49:     return out;
    50:   } catch (err) {
    51:     return null;
    52:   }
    53: }
    54: 


============================
FILE: src\compose\parser.ts
============================
============================
     1: // ROME-TAG: 0x15FDE1
     2: 
     3: import fs from 'fs';
     4: import yaml from 'js-yaml';
     5: import { readFCL } from './fclParser';
     6: 
     7: export type ModuleDef = {
     8:   path?: string;
     9:   port?: number;
    10:   token?: string;
    11:   env?: Record<string,string>;
    12: };
    13: 
    14: export type ComposeFile = {
    15:   modules: Record<string, ModuleDef>;
    16: };
    17: 
    18: export function readCompose(file = 'funesterie.yml'): ComposeFile | null {
    19:   try {
    20:     if (fs.existsSync('funesterie.fcl')) {
    21:       const fcl = readFCL('funesterie.fcl');
    22:       if (fcl && fcl.service) {
    23:         const modules: Record<string, ModuleDef> = {};
    24:         for (const k of Object.keys(fcl.service)) {
    25:           const s = fcl.service[k];
    26:           modules[k] = { path: s.path, port: s.port, token: s.token, env: s.env };
    27:         }
    28:         return { modules };
    29:       }
    30:     }
    31:     if (!fs.existsSync(file)) return null;
    32:     const raw = fs.readFileSync(file, 'utf8');
    33:     const doc = yaml.load(raw) as any;
    34:     if (!doc || !doc.modules) return null;
    35:     return { modules: doc.modules } as ComposeFile;
    36:   } catch (err) {
    37:     return null;
    38:   }
    39: }
    40: 


============================
FILE: src\core\qflush-mode.ts
============================
============================
     1: export type QflushMode = 'daemon' | 'cortex' | 'hybrid';
     2: 
     3: export function getQflushMode(): QflushMode {
     4:   const env = (process.env.QFLUSH_MODE || '').toString().trim().toLowerCase();
     5:   if (env === 'daemon' || env === 'cortex' || env === 'hybrid') return env as QflushMode;
     6:   // When running tests prefer cortex for faster, portless execution
     7:   if (process.env.VITEST) return 'cortex';
     8:   // default to hybrid to allow smooth migration
     9:   return 'hybrid';
    10: }
    11: 
    12: export const QFLUSH_MODE = getQflushMode();
    13: 


============================
FILE: src\core\start-system.ts
============================
============================
     1: import { QFLUSH_MODE } from './qflush-mode';
     2: 
     3: export async function startQflushSystem() {
     4:   if (QFLUSH_MODE !== 'daemon') {
     5:     try {
     6:       const m = await import('../cortex/bus.js');
     7:       if (m && typeof m.startCortexBus === 'function') {
     8:         console.log('[QFLUSH] starting CORTEX bus');
     9:         m.startCortexBus();
    10:       }
    11:     } catch (e) {
    12:       console.warn('[QFLUSH] failed to start CORTEX bus (continuing):', String(e));
    13:     }
    14:   }
    15: 
    16:   if (QFLUSH_MODE !== 'cortex') {
    17:     try {
    18:       const m = await import('../daemon/qflushd.js');
    19:       const mm: any = m;
    20:       // accept either startServer export or default export function
    21:       const startFn = (mm && typeof mm.startServer === 'function') ? mm.startServer : (mm && typeof mm.default === 'function') ? mm.default : null;
    22:       if (startFn) {
    23:         console.log('[QFLUSH] starting legacy daemon server');
    24:         const port = process.env.QFLUSHD_PORT ? Number(process.env.QFLUSHD_PORT) : undefined;
    25:         startFn(port);
    26:       }
    27:     } catch (e) {
    28:       console.warn('[QFLUSH] failed to start legacy daemon (continuing):', String(e));
    29:     }
    30:   }
    31: }
    32:

FILE: src\cortex\applyPacket.spec.ts

     1: import { describe, it, expect } from 'vitest';
     2: import { applyCortexPacket } from './applyPacket';
     3: import * as fs from 'fs';
     4: import * as path from 'path';
     5: 
     6: describe('applyPacket handlers', () => {
     7:   it('applies oc8 metadata', async () => {
     8:     const tmp = path.join(process.cwd(), '.qflush', 'test-oc8');
     9:     try { if (!fs.existsSync(path.dirname(tmp))) fs.mkdirSync(path.dirname(tmp), { recursive: true }); } catch (e) {}
    10:     const pkt: any = { type: 'cortex:oc8', id: 't-oc8-1', payload: { info: { name: 'OC8TEST', description: 'test' } } };
    11:     await (applyCortexPacket as any)(pkt);
    12:     const out = path.join(process.cwd(), '.qflush', 'oc8.meta.json');
    13:     expect(fs.existsSync(out)).toBe(true);
    14:     const j = JSON.parse(fs.readFileSync(out, 'utf8'));
    15:     expect(j.name).toBe('OC8TEST');
    16:   });
    17: 
    18:   it('applies auto-patch dry-run and does not write config', async () => {
    19:     const cfg = path.join(process.cwd(), '.qflush', 'config.json');
    20:     try { if (fs.existsSync(cfg)) fs.unlinkSync(cfg); } catch (e) {}
    21:     const pkt: any = { type: 'cortex:auto-patch', id: 't-patch-1', payload: { patch: { flags: { testMode: true } }, dryRun: true } };
    22:     await (applyCortexPacket as any)(pkt);
    23:     expect(fs.existsSync(cfg)).toBe(false);
    24:   });
    25: });

============================
FILE: src\cortex\applyPacket.ts
============================
============================
     1: import * as fs from 'fs';
     2: import * as path from 'path';
     3: import { CortexPacket } from './types';
     4: import { executeAction } from '../rome/executor';
     5: 
     6: const QFLUSH_DIR = path.join(process.cwd(), '.qflush');
     7: const CACHE_PATH = path.join(QFLUSH_DIR, 'spyder.cache.json');
     8: const PATCHES_DIR = path.join(QFLUSH_DIR, 'patches');
     9: const PATCH_AUDIT = path.join(PATCHES_DIR, 'audit.log');
    10: 
    11: function loadCache(): { appliedIds: string[] } {
    12:   try {
    13:     if (!fs.existsSync(CACHE_PATH)) return { appliedIds: [] };
    14:     const raw = fs.readFileSync(CACHE_PATH, 'utf8') || '{}';
    15:     const obj = JSON.parse(raw);
    16:     return { appliedIds: Array.isArray(obj.appliedIds) ? obj.appliedIds : [] };
    17:   } catch (e) {
    18:     return { appliedIds: [] };
    19:   }
    20: }
    21: 
    22: function saveCache(cache: { appliedIds: string[] }) {
    23:   try {
    24:     if (!fs.existsSync(QFLUSH_DIR)) fs.mkdirSync(QFLUSH_DIR, { recursive: true });
    25:     fs.writeFileSync(CACHE_PATH, JSON.stringify(cache, null, 2), 'utf8');
    26:   } catch (e) {
    27:     // ignore
    28:   }
    29: }
    30: 
    31: function ensurePatchesDir() {
    32:   try { if (!fs.existsSync(PATCHES_DIR)) fs.mkdirSync(PATCHES_DIR, { recursive: true }); } catch (e) {}
    33: }
    34: 
    35: function appendPatchAudit(entry: any) {
    36:   try {
    37:     ensurePatchesDir();
    38:     const line = JSON.stringify(entry) + "\n";
    39:     fs.appendFileSync(PATCH_AUDIT, line, 'utf8');
    40:   } catch (e) { /* ignore */ }
    41: }
    42: 
    43: function loadPatchWhitelist(): string[] {
    44:   try {
    45:     const wlFile = path.join(PATCHES_DIR, 'whitelist.json');
    46:     if (fs.existsSync(wlFile)) {
    47:       const raw = fs.readFileSync(wlFile, 'utf8') || '[]';
    48:       const arr = JSON.parse(raw);
    49:       if (Array.isArray(arr)) return arr.map(String);
    50:     }
    51:   } catch (e) {}
    52:   // default whitelist: allow only top-level keys considered safe
    53:   return ['routes', 'spyder', 'npz', 'telemetry', 'logic-config', 'flags', 'paths', 'services'];
    54: }
    55: 
    56: function isPatchAllowed(patch: any): { ok: boolean; reason?: string } {
    57:   try {
    58:     if (!patch || typeof patch !== 'object') return { ok: false, reason: 'invalid_patch' };
    59:     const whitelist = loadPatchWhitelist();
    60:     const keys = Object.keys(patch);
    61:     // allow when every key is in whitelist
    62:     for (const k of keys) {
    63:       if (!whitelist.includes(k)) return { ok: false, reason: `key_not_allowed:${k}` };
    64:     }
    65:     return { ok: true };
    66:   } catch (e) {
    67:     return { ok: false, reason: 'validation_error' };
    68:   }
    69: }
    70: 
    71: export async function applyCortexPacket(packet: CortexPacket): Promise<void> {
    72:   // dedupe by id
    73:   try {
    74:     const cache = loadCache();
    75:     if (packet.id && cache.appliedIds.includes(packet.id)) {
    76:       console.log('[APPLY] packet already applied (id=', packet.id, ') — skipping');
    77:       return;
    78:     }
    79: 
    80:     switch (String(packet.type).toLowerCase()) {
    81:       case 'enable-spyder':
    82:       case 'cortex:enable-spyder':
    83:         await applyEnableSpyder(packet);
    84:         break;
    85: 
    86:       case 'cortex:routes':
    87:       case 'cortex:routes:':
    88:         await applyCortexRoutes(packet);
    89:         break;
    90: 
    91:       case 'qflush:apply':
    92:       case 'cortex:apply':
    93:         await applyQflushConfigPatch(packet);
    94:         break;
    95: 
    96:       case 'npz-graph':
    97:       case 'npz:graph':
    98:       case 'npz-graph':
    99:       case 'cortex:npz-graph':
   100:         await applyNpzGraph(packet);
   101:         break;
   102: 
   103:       case 'save-state':
   104:       case 'save:state':
   105:       case 'save-state':
   106:       case 'cortex:save-state':
   107:         await applySaveState(packet);
   108:         break;
   109: 
   110:       case 'auto-patch':
   111:       case 'auto_patch':
   112:       case 'qflush:auto-patch':
   113:       case 'cortex:auto-patch':
   114:         await applyAutoPatch(packet);
   115:         break;
   116: 
   117:       // new handlers
   118:       case 'cortex:oc8':
   119:       case 'oc8':
   120:         await applyOc8(packet);
   121:         break;
   122: 
   123:       case 'cortex:qrouter':
   124:       case 'qrouter':
   125:         await applyQrouter(packet);
   126:         break;
   127: 
   128:       case 'cortex:spyder-sound':
   129:       case 'spyder-sound':
   130:         await applySpyderSound(packet);
   131:         break;
   132: 
   133:       case 'cortex:a11-key':
   134:       case 'a11-key':
   135:         await applyA11Key(packet);
   136:         break;
   137: 
   138:       case 'cortex:magic':
   139:       case 'magic':
   140:         await applyMagic(packet);
   141:         break;
   142: 
   143:       default:
   144:         console.warn('[APPLY] Type de packet non géré:', packet.type);
   145:     }
   146: 
   147:     // record applied id
   148:     try {
   149:       if (packet.id) {
   150:         const cache2 = loadCache();
   151:         cache2.appliedIds.push(packet.id);
   152:         // keep unique
   153:         cache2.appliedIds = Array.from(new Set(cache2.appliedIds));
   154:         saveCache(cache2);
   155:       }
   156:     } catch (e) { /* ignore */ }
   157:   } catch (e) {
   158:     console.warn('[APPLY] applyCortexPacket failed:', String(e));
   159:   }
   160: }
   161: 
   162: async function applyNpzGraph(packet: CortexPacket) {
   163:   try {
   164:     const payload: any = packet.payload || {};
   165:     const filePath = payload && payload.path ? String(payload.path) : process.cwd();
   166:     console.log('[APPLY] NPZ-GRAPH ingest for', filePath);
   167:     const res = await executeAction('npz.encode', { path: filePath });
   168:     console.log('[APPLY] NPZ-GRAPH result', res);
   169:     appendPatchAudit({ id: packet.id || null, type: packet.type, action: 'npz.encode', path: filePath, result: res, when: new Date().toISOString() });
   170:   } catch (e) {
   171:     console.warn('[APPLY] NPZ-GRAPH failed', String(e));
   172:     appendPatchAudit({ id: packet.id || null, type: packet.type, action: 'npz.encode', error: String(e), when: new Date().toISOString() });
   173:   }
   174: }
   175: 
   176: async function applySaveState(packet: CortexPacket) {
   177:   try {
   178:     if (!fs.existsSync(QFLUSH_DIR)) fs.mkdirSync(QFLUSH_DIR, { recursive: true });
   179:     const stateFile = path.join(QFLUSH_DIR, 'state.json');
   180:     const snapshotDir = path.join(QFLUSH_DIR, 'snapshots');
   181:     if (!fs.existsSync(snapshotDir)) fs.mkdirSync(snapshotDir, { recursive: true });
   182:     const now = new Date().toISOString().replace(/[:.]/g, '-');
   183:     const snapshotFile = path.join(snapshotDir, `state-${now}.json`);
   184: 
   185:     // read current state if exists or create minimal
   186:     let current: any = {};
   187:     try { if (fs.existsSync(stateFile)) current = JSON.parse(fs.readFileSync(stateFile, 'utf8') || '{}'); } catch (e) { current = {}; }
   188: 
   189:     // allow packet.payload to merge into state snapshot
   190:     const payload: any = packet.payload || {};
   191:     const merged = { ...current, ...payload };
   192:     fs.writeFileSync(snapshotFile, JSON.stringify(merged, null, 2), 'utf8');
   193:     // also write state.json as current
   194:     fs.writeFileSync(stateFile, JSON.stringify(merged, null, 2), 'utf8');
   195: 
   196:     console.log('[APPLY] SAVE-STATE snapshot written to', snapshotFile);
   197:     appendPatchAudit({ id: packet.id || null, type: packet.type, action: 'save-state', path: snapshotFile, when: new Date().toISOString() });
   198:   } catch (e) {
   199:     console.warn('[APPLY] SAVE-STATE failed', String(e));
   200:     appendPatchAudit({ id: packet.id || null, type: packet.type, action: 'save-state', error: String(e), when: new Date().toISOString() });
   201:   }
   202: }
   203: 
   204: async function applyAutoPatch(packet: CortexPacket) {
   205:   try {
   206:     const payload: any = packet.payload || {};
   207:     const patch = payload.patch || payload;
   208:     const approve = Boolean(payload.approve || payload.approved || false);
   209:     const dryRun = Boolean(payload.dryRun || payload.dry || true); // safer default: dryRun true
   210: 
   211:     // validate patch keys
   212:     const validation = isPatchAllowed(patch);
   213:     if (!validation.ok) {
   214:       // write blocked patch for audit
   215:       try {
   216:         ensurePatchesDir();
   217:         const blockedFile = path.join(PATCHES_DIR, `blocked-${packet.id || Date.now()}.json`);
   218:         fs.writeFileSync(blockedFile, JSON.stringify({ packetId: packet.id || null, reason: validation.reason, patch }, null, 2), 'utf8');
   219:         appendPatchAudit({ id: packet.id || null, type: packet.type, action: 'auto-patch', status: 'blocked', reason: validation.reason, when: new Date().toISOString() });
   220:       } catch (e) {}
   221:       console.warn('[APPLY] AUTO-PATCH blocked by whitelist:', validation.reason);
   222:       return;
   223:     }
   224: 
   225:     const dir = QFLUSH_DIR;
   226:     const cfgFile = path.join(dir, 'config.json');
   227:     let current: any = {};
   228:     try { if (fs.existsSync(cfgFile)) current = JSON.parse(fs.readFileSync(cfgFile, 'utf8') || '{}'); } catch (e) { current = {}; }
   229: 
   230:     const merged = { ...current, ...patch };
   231: 
   232:     if (dryRun || !approve) {
   233:       const outDir = path.join(dir, 'patches');
   234:       if (!fs.existsSync(outDir)) fs.mkdirSync(outDir, { recursive: true });
   235:       const outFile = path.join(outDir, `dryrun-${packet.id || Date.now()}.json`);
   236:       fs.writeFileSync(outFile, JSON.stringify({ current, patch, merged }, null, 2), 'utf8');
   237:       appendPatchAudit({ id: packet.id || null, type: packet.type, action: 'auto-patch', status: 'dryrun', file: outFile, when: new Date().toISOString() });
   238:       console.log('[APPLY] AUTO-PATCH dry-run saved to', outFile);
   239:       if (approve) {
   240:         // fallthrough to apply
   241:       } else {
   242:         return;
   243:       }
   244:     }
   245: 
   246:     // apply
   247:     fs.writeFileSync(cfgFile, JSON.stringify(merged, null, 2), 'utf8');
   248:     appendPatchAudit({ id: packet.id || null, type: packet.type, action: 'auto-patch', status: 'applied', file: cfgFile, when: new Date().toISOString() });
   249:     console.log('[APPLY] AUTO-PATCH applied to', cfgFile);
   250:   } catch (e) {
   251:     console.warn('[APPLY] AUTO-PATCH failed', String(e));
   252:     appendPatchAudit({ id: packet.id || null, type: packet.type, action: 'auto-patch', status: 'error', error: String(e), when: new Date().toISOString() });
   253:   }
   254: }
   255: 
   256: // existing handlers
   257: async function applyEnableSpyder(packet: CortexPacket) {
   258:   const dir = path.join(process.cwd(), '.qflush');
   259:   const file = path.join(dir, 'spyder.config.json');
   260:   const current = fs.existsSync(file)
   261:     ? JSON.parse(fs.readFileSync(file, 'utf8'))
   262:     : {};
   263: 
   264:   const payload: any = packet.payload ?? {};
   265:   const spyderConfig = {
   266:     ...current,
   267:     ...(payload.spyder || {})
   268:   };
   269: 
   270:   if (!fs.existsSync(dir)) fs.mkdirSync(dir, { recursive: true });
   271:   fs.writeFileSync(file, JSON.stringify(spyderConfig, null, 2), 'utf8');
   272:   console.log('[APPLY] SPYDER mis à jour via packet enable-spyder');
   273:   appendPatchAudit({ id: packet.id || null, type: packet.type, action: 'enable-spyder', when: new Date().toISOString() });
   274: }
   275: 
   276: async function applyCortexRoutes(packet: CortexPacket) {
   277:   const dir = path.join(process.cwd(), '.qflush');
   278:   const file = path.join(dir, 'cortex.routes.json');
   279:   const payload: any = packet.payload ?? {};
   280: 
   281:   if (!fs.existsSync(dir)) fs.mkdirSync(dir, { recursive: true });
   282:   fs.writeFileSync(file, JSON.stringify(payload, null, 2), 'utf8');
   283:   console.log('[APPLY] cortex.routes.json mis à jour.');
   284:   appendPatchAudit({ id: packet.id || null, type: packet.type, action: 'cortex:routes', when: new Date().toISOString() });
   285: }
   286: 
   287: async function applyQflushConfigPatch(packet: CortexPacket) {
   288:   const dir = path.join(process.cwd(), '.qflush');
   289:   const file = path.join(dir, 'config.json');
   290:   const current = fs.existsSync(file)
   291:     ? JSON.parse(fs.readFileSync(file, 'utf8'))
   292:     : {};
   293: 
   294:   const payload: any = packet.payload ?? {};
   295:   const merged = {
   296:     ...current,
   297:     ...payload
   298:   };
   299: 
   300:   if (!fs.existsSync(dir)) fs.mkdirSync(dir, { recursive: true });
   301:   fs.writeFileSync(file, JSON.stringify(merged, null, 2), 'utf8');
   302:   console.log('[APPLY] config.json mis à jour via packet qflush:apply');
   303:   appendPatchAudit({ id: packet.id || null, type: packet.type, action: 'qflush:apply', when: new Date().toISOString() });
   304: }
   305: 
   306: // new apply handlers
   307: async function applyOc8(packet: CortexPacket) {
   308:   try {
   309:     const payload: any = packet.payload || {};
   310:     const metaFile = path.join(QFLUSH_DIR, 'oc8.meta.json');
   311:     const info = payload.info || { name: 'OC8', description: 'OC8 format' };
   312:     if (!fs.existsSync(QFLUSH_DIR)) fs.mkdirSync(QFLUSH_DIR, { recursive: true });
   313:     fs.writeFileSync(metaFile, JSON.stringify(info, null, 2), 'utf8');
   314:     appendPatchAudit({ id: packet.id || null, type: packet.type, action: 'oc8:register', file: metaFile, when: new Date().toISOString() });
   315:     console.log('[APPLY] OC8 metadata written to', metaFile);
   316:   } catch (e) { console.warn('[APPLY] OC8 failed', String(e)); }
   317: }
   318: 
   319: async function applyQrouter(packet: CortexPacket) {
   320:   try {
   321:     const payload: any = packet.payload || {};
   322:     const file = path.join(QFLUSH_DIR, 'cortex.routes.json');
   323:     let current: any = {};
   324:     try { if (fs.existsSync(file)) current = JSON.parse(fs.readFileSync(file, 'utf8') || '{}'); } catch (e) { current = {}; }
   325:     const merged = { ...current, ...(payload.routes || {}) };
   326:     if (!fs.existsSync(QFLUSH_DIR)) fs.mkdirSync(QFLUSH_DIR, { recursive: true });
   327:     fs.writeFileSync(file, JSON.stringify(merged, null, 2), 'utf8');
   328:     appendPatchAudit({ id: packet.id || null, type: packet.type, action: 'qrouter:update', file, when: new Date().toISOString() });
   329:     console.log('[APPLY] QROUTER updated', file);
   330:   } catch (e) { console.warn('[APPLY] QROUTER failed', String(e)); }
   331: }
   332: 
   333: async function applySpyderSound(packet: CortexPacket) {
   334:   try {
   335:     const payload: any = packet.payload || {};
   336:     const file = path.join(QFLUSH_DIR, 'spyder-sound.config.json');
   337:     let current: any = {};
   338:     try { if (fs.existsSync(file)) current = JSON.parse(fs.readFileSync(file, 'utf8') || '{}'); } catch (e) { current = {}; }
   339:     const merged = { ...current, ...payload };
   340:     if (!fs.existsSync(QFLUSH_DIR)) fs.mkdirSync(QFLUSH_DIR, { recursive: true });
   341:     fs.writeFileSync(file, JSON.stringify(merged, null, 2), 'utf8');
   342:     appendPatchAudit({ id: packet.id || null, type: packet.type, action: 'spyder-sound', file, when: new Date().toISOString() });
   343:     console.log('[APPLY] spyder-sound config updated');
   344:   } catch (e) { console.warn('[APPLY] spyder-sound failed', String(e)); }
   345: }
   346: 
   347: async function applyA11Key(packet: CortexPacket) {
   348:   try {
   349:     const payload: any = packet.payload || {};
   350:     const file = path.join(QFLUSH_DIR, 'a11.config.json');
   351:     let current: any = {};
   352:     try { if (fs.existsSync(file)) current = JSON.parse(fs.readFileSync(file, 'utf8') || '{}'); } catch (e) { current = {}; }
   353:     // do not log apiKey in audit
   354:     const safePayload = { ...payload };
   355:     if (safePayload.apiKey) delete safePayload.apiKey;
   356:     const merged = { ...current, ...payload };
   357:     if (!fs.existsSync(QFLUSH_DIR)) fs.mkdirSync(QFLUSH_DIR, { recursive: true });
   358:     fs.writeFileSync(file, JSON.stringify(merged, null, 2), 'utf8');
   359:     appendPatchAudit({ id: packet.id || null, type: packet.type, action: 'a11-key', file, when: new Date().toISOString() });
   360:     console.log('[APPLY] A11 config updated (apiKey redacted in logs)');
   361:   } catch (e) { console.warn('[APPLY] A11 failed', String(e)); }
   362: }
   363: 
   364: async function applyMagic(packet: CortexPacket) {
   365:   try {
   366:     const entry = { id: packet.id || null, when: new Date().toISOString(), payload: packet.payload };
   367:     const file = path.join(QFLUSH_DIR, 'magic.log');
   368:     if (!fs.existsSync(QFLUSH_DIR)) fs.mkdirSync(QFLUSH_DIR, { recursive: true });
   369:     fs.appendFileSync(file, JSON.stringify(entry) + '\n', 'utf8');
   370:     appendPatchAudit({ id: packet.id || null, type: packet.type, action: 'magic', file, when: new Date().toISOString() });
   371:     console.log('[APPLY] magic recorded');
   372:   } catch (e) { console.warn('[APPLY] magic failed', String(e)); }
   373: }
   374: 
   375: export default { applyCortexPacket };
   376: 


============================
FILE: src\cortex\bus.ts
============================
============================
     1: import fs from 'fs';
     2: import path from 'path';
     3: import { decodeCortexPNG } from './decoder';
     4: import { encodeCortexCommand } from './encoder';
     5: import { execCommand } from '../rome/executor';
     6: 
     7: const inbox = path.join('.qflush', 'cortex', 'inbox');
     8: const outbox = path.join('.qflush', 'cortex', 'outbox');
     9: 
    10: export function startCortexBus() {
    11:   fs.mkdirSync(inbox, { recursive: true });
    12:   fs.mkdirSync(outbox, { recursive: true });
    13: 
    14:   console.log('[CORTEX] Bus démarré — watching', inbox);
    15: 
    16:   const processFile = async (file: string) => {
    17:     const full = path.join(inbox, file);
    18:     if (!file.endsWith('.png')) return;
    19:     try {
    20:       const payload = decodeCortexPNG(full);
    21:       const result = await execCommand(payload.cmd, payload.args || []);
    22:       const response = { id: payload.id, ok: true, result, timestamp: Date.now() };
    23:       const out = path.join(outbox, file);
    24:       encodeCortexCommand(response, out);
    25:     } catch (e) {
    26:       console.error('[CORTEX] processing error', e);
    27:       const resp = { id: path.basename(file, '.png'), ok: false, error: String(e), timestamp: Date.now() };
    28:       try { encodeCortexCommand(resp, path.join(outbox, file)); } catch (e2) { /* ignore */ }
    29:     } finally {
    30:       try { fs.unlinkSync(full); } catch (e) { /* ignore */ }
    31:     }
    32:   };
    33: 
    34:   // simple poll/watch to be robust
    35:   setInterval(() => {
    36:     try {
    37:       const files = fs.readdirSync(inbox || '.');
    38:       for (const f of files) {
    39:         processFile(f);
    40:       }
    41:     } catch (e) {
    42:       // ignore
    43:     }
    44:   }, 500);
    45: }
    46: 


============================
FILE: src\cortex\cli.ts
============================
============================
     1: import path from 'path';
     2: import { encodeCortexCommand } from './encoder';
     3: import fs from 'fs';
     4: 
     5: export function cortexSend(cmd: string, args: any[] = []) {
     6:   const id = 'cortex-' + Date.now() + '-' + Math.random().toString(36).slice(2, 8);
     7:   const ner = { id, cmd, args, timestamp: Date.now() };
     8:   const out = path.join('.qflush', 'cortex', 'inbox', id + '.png');
     9:   encodeCortexCommand(ner, out);
    10:   return id;
    11: }
    12: 
    13: export function cortexWaitFor(id: string, timeoutMs = 5000) {
    14:   const out = path.join('.qflush', 'cortex', 'outbox', id + '.png');
    15:   const start = Date.now();
    16:   return new Promise<any>((resolve, reject) => {
    17:     const iv = setInterval(() => {
    18:       if (Date.now() - start > timeoutMs) { clearInterval(iv); return reject(new Error('timeout')); }
    19:       if (fs.existsSync(out)) {
    20:         try {
    21:           const dec = require('./decoder').decodeCortexPNG(out);
    22:           try { fs.unlinkSync(out); } catch(e){}
    23:           clearInterval(iv);
    24:           resolve(dec);
    25:         } catch (e) { clearInterval(iv); reject(e); }
    26:       }
    27:     }, 200);
    28:   });
    29: }
    30:

============================
FILE: src\cortex\codec.ts
============================
============================
     1: import * as fs from 'fs';
     2: import * as path from 'path';
     3: import { promisify } from 'util';
     4: import * as zlib from 'zlib';
     5: import sharp from 'sharp';
     6: 
     7: const brotliCompressSync = (input: Buffer) => zlib.brotliCompressSync(input, { params: { [zlib.constants.BROTLI_PARAM_QUALITY]: 11 } });
     8: const brotliDecompressSync = (input: Buffer) => zlib.brotliDecompressSync(input);
     9: 
    10: // CRC-8 OC8 implementation
    11: export function crc8_oc8(data: Buffer, poly = 0x07, init = 0x00): number {
    12:   let crc = init & 0xff;
    13:   for (const b of data) {
    14:     crc ^= b;
    15:     for (let i = 0; i < 8; i++) {
    16:       if ((crc & 0x80) !== 0) crc = ((crc << 1) ^ poly) & 0xff;
    17:       else crc = (crc << 1) & 0xff;
    18:     }
    19:   }
    20:   return crc & 0xff;
    21: }
    22: 
    23: export function buildCortexPacket(raw: Buffer, flags = 0): Buffer {
    24:   const compressed = brotliCompressSync(raw);
    25:   const crc = crc8_oc8(compressed);
    26:   const payload = Buffer.concat([compressed, Buffer.from([crc])]);
    27:   const payloadLen = payload.length;
    28:   const totalLen = payloadLen + 16;
    29:   const header = Buffer.alloc(16);
    30:   header.writeUInt32BE(totalLen, 0);
    31:   header.writeUInt32BE(payloadLen, 4);
    32:   header.writeUInt8(flags & 0xff, 8);
    33:   // reserved 7 bytes already zero
    34:   return Buffer.concat([header, payload]);
    35: }
    36: 
    37: export function parseCortexPacket(buf: Buffer) {
    38:   if (buf.length < 16) throw new Error('Stream too short for Cortex header');
    39:   const totalLen = buf.readUInt32BE(0);
    40:   const payloadLen = buf.readUInt32BE(4);
    41:   const flags = buf.readUInt8(8);
    42:   if (payloadLen < 1) throw new Error('invalid payload length');
    43:   if (buf.length < 16 + payloadLen) throw new Error('buffer shorter than payload');
    44:   const payloadWithCrc = buf.slice(16, 16 + payloadLen);
    45:   const compressed = payloadWithCrc.slice(0, -1);
    46:   const crc = payloadWithCrc[payloadWithCrc.length - 1];
    47:   const expected = crc8_oc8(compressed);
    48:   if (crc !== expected) throw new Error(`CRC mismatch: expected ${expected}, got ${crc}`);
    49:   const raw = brotliDecompressSync(compressed);
    50:   return { totalLen, payloadLen, flags, raw };
    51: }
    52: 
    53: function padToMultipleOf3(buf: Buffer): Buffer {
    54:   const pad = (3 - (buf.length % 3)) % 3;
    55:   if (pad === 0) return buf;
    56:   return Buffer.concat([buf, Buffer.alloc(pad)]);
    57: }
    58: 
    59: export async function encodePacketToPNGs(packet: Buffer, outputPrefix: string, maxPngBytes = 200 * 1024 * 1024): Promise<string[]> {
    60:   const rgb = padToMultipleOf3(packet);
    61:   const totalPixels = Math.floor(rgb.length / 3);
    62:   const maxPixelsPerImg = Math.max(1, Math.floor(maxPngBytes / 3));
    63:   const numImages = Math.max(1, Math.ceil(totalPixels / maxPixelsPerImg));
    64:   const outPaths: string[] = [];
    65: 
    66:   let pixelOffset = 0;
    67:   for (let idx = 0; idx < numImages; idx++) {
    68:     const pixelsInChunk = Math.min(maxPixelsPerImg, totalPixels - pixelOffset);
    69:     if (pixelsInChunk <= 0) break;
    70:     const start = pixelOffset * 3;
    71:     const end = start + pixelsInChunk * 3;
    72:     const chunk = rgb.slice(start, end);
    73:     // compute dims
    74:     const width = Math.min(4096, Math.max(1, Math.round(Math.sqrt(pixelsInChunk))));
    75:     const height = Math.ceil(pixelsInChunk / width);
    76:     const required = width * height * 3;
    77:     let data = chunk;
    78:     if (required > chunk.length) data = Buffer.concat([chunk, Buffer.alloc(required - chunk.length)]);
    79: 
    80:     const outName = `${outputPrefix}_part${idx.toString().padStart(2, '0')}.png`;
    81:     // sharp expects raw with channels=3
    82:     await sharp(data, { raw: { width, height, channels: 3 } }).png({ compressionLevel: 1 }).toFile(outName);
    83:     outPaths.push(outName);
    84:     pixelOffset += pixelsInChunk;
    85:   }
    86:   return outPaths;
    87: }
    88: 
    89: export async function decodePNGsToPacket(paths: string[]): Promise<Buffer> {
    90:   // read in order, extract raw RGB bytes
    91:   const parts: Buffer[] = [];
    92:   for (const p of paths) {
    93:     const res = await sharp(p).raw().toBuffer({ resolveWithObject: true });
    94:     let { data, info } = res as any;
    95:     if (info.channels === 4) {
    96:       // strip alpha
    97:       const stripped = Buffer.alloc((data.length / 4) * 3);
    98:       let j = 0;
    99:       for (let i = 0; i < data.length; i += 4) {
   100:         stripped[j++] = data[i];
   101:         stripped[j++] = data[i + 1];
   102:         stripped[j++] = data[i + 2];
   103:       }
   104:       data = stripped;
   105:     } else if (info.channels === 3) {
   106:       // ok
   107:     } else {
   108:       // attempt to convert to rgb buffer
   109:       const rgbBuf = await sharp(p).ensureAlpha().raw().toBuffer();
   110:       // then strip
   111:       const stripped = Buffer.alloc((rgbBuf.length / 4) * 3);
   112:       let j = 0;
   113:       for (let i = 0; i < rgbBuf.length; i += 4) {
   114:         stripped[j++] = rgbBuf[i];
   115:         stripped[j++] = rgbBuf[i + 1];
   116:         stripped[j++] = rgbBuf[i + 2];
   117:       }
   118:       data = stripped;
   119:     }
   120:     parts.push(data as Buffer);
   121:   }
   122:   const full = Buffer.concat(parts);
   123:   // no padding removal necessary: parse header and payload lengths
   124:   return full;
   125: }
   126: 
   127: // Convenience helpers for file io
   128: export async function encodeFileToPNGs(inputPath: string, outputPrefix: string) {
   129:   const raw = fs.readFileSync(inputPath);
   130:   const packet = buildCortexPacket(raw, 0);
   131:   return encodePacketToPNGs(packet, outputPrefix);
   132: }
   133: 
   134: export async function decodePNGsToFile(pngGlobPaths: string[], outputPath: string) {
   135:   const full = await decodePNGsToPacket(pngGlobPaths);
   136:   const parsed = parseCortexPacket(full);
   137:   fs.writeFileSync(outputPath, parsed.raw);
   138: }
   139: 
   140: export function decodeCortexPacket(buf: Buffer) {
   141:   // parseCortexPacket already verifies CRC and decompresses
   142:   const parsed = parseCortexPacket(buf);
   143:   let payload: any = null;
   144:   try {
   145:     const txt = parsed.raw.toString('utf-8');
   146:     payload = JSON.parse(txt);
   147:   } catch (e) {
   148:     payload = parsed.raw;
   149:   }
   150:   return {
   151:     totalLen: parsed.totalLen,
   152:     payloadLen: parsed.payloadLen,
   153:     flags: parsed.flags,
   154:     payload
   155:   };
   156: }
   157: 
   158: export default { buildCortexPacket, parseCortexPacket, decodeCortexPacket, encodePacketToPNGs, decodePNGsToPacket };
   159: 


============================
FILE: src\cortex\decoder.ts
============================
============================
     1: import fs from 'fs';
     2: import zlib from 'zlib';
     3: import { PNG } from 'pngjs';
     4: import crypto from 'crypto';
     5: 
     6: const seenIds = new Set<string>();
     7: 
     8: export function decodeCortexPNG(file: string) {
     9:   const buf = fs.readFileSync(file);
    10:   const png = PNG.sync.read(buf);
    11:   const bytes: number[] = [];
    12:   for (let i = 0; i < png.data.length; i += 4) {
    13:     bytes.push(png.data[i], png.data[i + 1], png.data[i + 2]);
    14:   }
    15:   // trim trailing zeros that were padding
    16:   let end = bytes.length;
    17:   while (end > 0 && bytes[end - 1] === 0) end--;
    18:   const compressed = Buffer.from(bytes.slice(0, end));
    19:   const oc8 = png.text && png.text.oc8 ? Number(png.text.oc8) : null;
    20:   const calc = crypto.createHash('sha256').update(compressed).digest().subarray(0, 1)[0];
    21:   if (oc8 !== null && oc8 !== calc) throw new Error('OC8 checksum mismatch');
    22: 
    23:   const json = zlib.brotliDecompressSync(compressed);
    24:   const payload = JSON.parse(json.toString('utf8'));
    25: 
    26:   // simple replay protection: ensure id not seen
    27:   if (payload && payload.id) {
    28:     if (seenIds.has(payload.id)) throw new Error('replay detected');
    29:     seenIds.add(payload.id);
    30:     // keep seenIds size bounded
    31:     if (seenIds.size > 10000) {
    32:       // drop oldest: convert to array (simple)
    33:       const it = seenIds.values();
    34:       const remove = it.next().value;
    35:       if (remove) seenIds.delete(remove);
    36:     }
    37:   }
    38: 
    39:   return payload;
    40: }
    41: 


============================
FILE: src\cortex\emit.ts
============================
============================
     1: import { EventEmitter } from 'events';
     2: import * as fs from 'fs';
     3: import * as path from 'path';
     4: 
     5: const emitter = new EventEmitter();
     6: const QFLUSH_DIR = path.join(process.cwd(), '.qflush');
     7: const DRIP_LOG = path.join(QFLUSH_DIR, 'cortex', 'drip.log');
     8: 
     9: export function cortexEmit(eventName: string, payload: any) {
    10:   try {
    11:     if (!fs.existsSync(path.dirname(DRIP_LOG))) fs.mkdirSync(path.dirname(DRIP_LOG), { recursive: true });
    12:     const line = JSON.stringify({ t: new Date().toISOString(), event: eventName, payload });
    13:     fs.appendFileSync(DRIP_LOG, line + '\n', 'utf8');
    14:   } catch (e) {
    15:     // ignore
    16:   }
    17:   try { emitter.emit(eventName, payload); } catch (e) {}
    18: }
    19: 
    20: export function onCortexEvent(eventName: string, cb: (p: any) => void) {
    21:   emitter.on(eventName, cb);
    22: }
    23: 
    24: export default { cortexEmit, onCortexEvent };
    25: 


============================
FILE: src\cortex\encoder.ts
============================
============================
     1: import fs from 'fs';
     2: import path from 'path';
     3: import zlib from 'zlib';
     4: import { PNG } from 'pngjs';
     5: import crypto from 'crypto';
     6: 
     7: export function encodeCortexCommand(ner: any, outPath: string) {
     8:   const json = Buffer.from(JSON.stringify(ner), 'utf8');
     9:   const compressed = zlib.brotliCompressSync(json, { params: { [zlib.constants.BROTLI_PARAM_QUALITY]: 11 } });
    10: 
    11:   const pixelsCount = Math.ceil(compressed.length / 3);
    12:   const width = Math.ceil(Math.sqrt(pixelsCount));
    13:   const height = width;
    14:   const png = new PNG({ width, height });
    15: 
    16:   let byteIndex = 0;
    17:   for (let y = 0; y < height; y++) {
    18:     for (let x = 0; x < width; x++) {
    19:       const k = (width * y + x) << 2;
    20:       const r = compressed[byteIndex++] ?? 0;
    21:       const g = compressed[byteIndex++] ?? 0;
    22:       const b = compressed[byteIndex++] ?? 0;
    23:       png.data[k] = r;
    24:       png.data[k + 1] = g;
    25:       png.data[k + 2] = b;
    26:       png.data[k + 3] = 255;
    27:     }
    28:   }
    29: 
    30:   // OC8: first byte of sha256 of compressed payload (simple integrity tag)
    31:   const oc8 = crypto.createHash('sha256').update(compressed).digest().subarray(0, 1)[0];
    32:   // store as tEXt chunk
    33:   // @ts-ignore png.text exists on PNG
    34:   png.text = png.text || {};
    35:   // store numeric oc8 as string
    36:   // @ts-ignore
    37:   png.text.oc8 = String(oc8);
    38: 
    39:   // ensure parent dir
    40:   fs.mkdirSync(path.dirname(outPath), { recursive: true });
    41:   const ws = fs.createWriteStream(outPath + '.tmp');
    42:   png.pack().pipe(ws);
    43:   ws.on('finish', () => {
    44:     try {
    45:       fs.renameSync(outPath + '.tmp', outPath);
    46:     } catch (e) {
    47:       // best effort
    48:       if (fs.existsSync(outPath + '.tmp')) fs.unlinkSync(outPath + '.tmp');
    49:     }
    50:   });
    51: }
    52: 


============================
FILE: src\cortex\listener.spec.ts
============================
============================
     1: import { describe, it, expect, beforeEach, afterEach } from 'vitest';
     2: import * as fs from 'fs';
     3: import * as path from 'path';
     4: import { startCortexListener } from './listener';
     5: 
     6: // Sketch: simulate placing a decoded JSON packet file (already extracted) into canal
     7: 
     8: describe('Cortex listener (integration sketch)', () => {
     9:   const CANAL = path.join(process.cwd(), 'canal');
    10:   const SPY_CFG = path.join(process.cwd(), '.qflush', 'spyder.config.json');
    11: 
    12:   beforeEach(() => {
    13:     if (!fs.existsSync(CANAL)) fs.mkdirSync(CANAL, { recursive: true });
    14:     if (fs.existsSync(SPY_CFG)) fs.unlinkSync(SPY_CFG);
    15:   });
    16: 
    17:   afterEach(() => {
    18:     try { if (fs.existsSync(SPY_CFG)) fs.unlinkSync(SPY_CFG); } catch (e) {}
    19:   });
    20: 
    21:   it('should create spyder config when receiving enable-spyder packet (sketch)', async () => {
    22:     // This is a sketch: actual test would write PNG parts into canal and wait for listener to process
    23:     // For now assert that listener function exists and can be started
    24:     expect(typeof startCortexListener).toBe('function');
    25:   });
    26: });
    27: 


============================
FILE: src\cortex\listener.ts
============================
============================
     1: // Cortex listener: watch a folder for PNG packets and dispatch decoded JSON to router
     2: import * as fs from 'fs';
     3: import * as path from 'path';
     4: import { decodePNGsToPacket, parseCortexPacket } from './codec';
     5: import { routeCortexPacket } from './router';
     6: 
     7: const WATCH_DIR = path.join(process.cwd(), 'canal');
     8: 
     9: export function startCortexListener() {
    10:   try {
    11:     if (!fs.existsSync(WATCH_DIR)) fs.mkdirSync(WATCH_DIR, { recursive: true });
    12:   } catch (e) {}
    13: 
    14:   console.log('[CORTEX] listener watching', WATCH_DIR);
    15: 
    16:   const pending = new Set<string>();
    17: 
    18:   fs.watch(WATCH_DIR, { persistent: false }, async (ev, filename) => {
    19:     if (!filename) return;
    20:     const full = path.join(WATCH_DIR, filename);
    21:     if (!filename.endsWith('.png')) return;
    22:     if (pending.has(full)) return;
    23:     pending.add(full);
    24:     // give the file a moment to be fully written
    25:     setTimeout(async () => {
    26:       try {
    27:         // find all matching parts for this prefix
    28:         const prefix = filename.replace(/_part\d+\.png$/, '');
    29:         const glob = fs.readdirSync(WATCH_DIR).filter(f => f.startsWith(prefix) && f.endsWith('.png')).map(f => path.join(WATCH_DIR, f)).sort();
    30:         if (!glob.length) {
    31:           pending.delete(full);
    32:           return;
    33:         }
    34:         const fullBuf = await decodePNGsToPacket(glob);
    35:         const parsed = parseCortexPacket(fullBuf);
    36:         // attempt to decode payload to JSON where possible
    37:         let payload: any = null;
    38:         try {
    39:           const txt = parsed.raw.toString('utf-8');
    40:           payload = JSON.parse(txt);
    41:         } catch (e) {
    42:           payload = parsed.raw;
    43:         }
    44:         const routed = await routeCortexPacket({ totalLen: parsed.totalLen, payloadLen: parsed.payloadLen, flags: parsed.flags, payload });
    45:         console.log('[CORTEX] routed packet result', routed);
    46:       } catch (e) {
    47:         console.warn('[CORTEX] decode failed', e);
    48:       } finally {
    49:         pending.delete(full);
    50:       }
    51:     }, 200);
    52:   });
    53: }
    54: 


============================
FILE: src\cortex\pngCodec.more.spec.ts
============================
============================
     1: import { describe, it, expect } from 'vitest';
     2: import { encodeCortexPacketToPng, decodeCortexPacketFromPng } from './pngCodec';
     3: import * as fs from 'fs';
     4: import * as path from 'path';
     5: 
     6: describe('pngCodec additional tests', () => {
     7:   it('redCurtain mode encodes and decodes payload correctly', async () => {
     8:     const tmpDir = path.join(process.cwd(), 'tmp');
     9:     try { if (!fs.existsSync(tmpDir)) fs.mkdirSync(tmpDir); } catch (e) {}
    10:     const out = path.join(tmpDir, 'test_cxpk_red.png');
    11: 
    12:     const packet: any = {
    13:       version: 1,
    14:       kind: 'cortex-packet',
    15:       type: 'cortex:spyder-vision',
    16:       id: 'test-red-456',
    17:       payload: { cmd: 'red', data: [9,8,7], note: 'redCurtain' }
    18:     };
    19: 
    20:     await encodeCortexPacketToPng(packet, out, { width: 8, redCurtainMode: true });
    21:     expect(fs.existsSync(out)).toBe(true);
    22: 
    23:     const decoded = await decodeCortexPacketFromPng(out);
    24:     expect(decoded).toBeDefined();
    25:     expect(decoded.kind).toBe('cortex-packet');
    26:     expect(decoded.type).toBe(packet.type);
    27:     // payload should match at least 'cmd'
    28:     expect((decoded.payload as any).cmd || (decoded.payload as any).payload?.cmd).toEqual('red');
    29: 
    30:     try { fs.unlinkSync(out); } catch (e) {}
    31:   });
    32: 
    33:   it('multi-pixel output handles larger payloads', async () => {
    34:     const tmpDir = path.join(process.cwd(), 'tmp');
    35:     try { if (!fs.existsSync(tmpDir)) fs.mkdirSync(tmpDir); } catch (e) {}
    36:     const out = path.join(tmpDir, 'test_cxpk_multi.png');
    37: 
    38:     // create a payload that'll force multiple pixels / rows
    39:     const bigArr = new Array(2000).fill(0).map((_,i)=>i%256);
    40:     const packet: any = {
    41:       version: 1,
    42:       kind: 'cortex-packet',
    43:       type: 'cortex:npz-graph',
    44:       id: 'test-big-789',
    45:       payload: { cmd: 'big', data: bigArr }
    46:     };
    47: 
    48:     await encodeCortexPacketToPng(packet, out, { width: 16, redCurtainMode: false });
    49:     expect(fs.existsSync(out)).toBe(true);
    50: 
    51:     const decoded = await decodeCortexPacketFromPng(out);
    52:     expect(decoded).toBeDefined();
    53:     expect(decoded.kind).toBe('cortex-packet');
    54:     expect(decoded.type).toBe(packet.type);
    55:     expect((decoded.payload as any).payload?.cmd || (decoded.payload as any).cmd).toBeDefined();
    56: 
    57:     try { fs.unlinkSync(out); } catch (e) {}
    58:   });
    59: });
    60:

     5: 
     6: describe('pngCodec roundtrip', () => {
     7:   it('encodes and decodes a CortexPacket via PNG CXPK', async () => {
     8:     const tmpDir = path.join(process.cwd(), 'tmp');
     9:     try { if (!fs.existsSync(tmpDir)) fs.mkdirSync(tmpDir); } catch (e) {}
    10:     const out = path.join(tmpDir, 'test_cxpk.png');
    11: 
    12:     const packet: any = {
    13:       version: 1,
    14:       kind: 'cortex-packet',
    15:       type: 'cortex:spyder-vision',
    16:       id: 'test-123',
    17:       payload: { cmd: 'test', data: [1,2,3], note: 'roundtrip' }
    18:     };
    19: 
    20:     await encodeCortexPacketToPng(packet, out, { width: 16, redCurtainMode: false });
    21:     expect(fs.existsSync(out)).toBe(true);
