============================
FILE: src\cortex\pngCodec.ts
============================
============================
     1: import { CortexPacket } from './types';
     2: import { PNG } from 'pngjs';
     3: import * as fs from 'fs';
     4: import * as zlib from 'zlib';
     5: 
     6: const MAGIC = Buffer.from('CXPK');
     7: const HEADER_SIZE = 12; // 4 + 1 +3 +4
     8: 
     9: export interface EncodePngOptions {
    10:   width?: number;
    11:   redCurtainMode?: boolean;
    12: }
    13: 
    14: export function encodeCortexPacketToPng(
    15:   packet: CortexPacket,
    16:   outputPath: string,
    17:   options: EncodePngOptions = {}
    18: ): Promise<void> {
    19:   return new Promise((resolve, reject) => {
    20:     try {
    21:       const json = JSON.stringify(packet);
    22:       const payload = zlib.brotliCompressSync(Buffer.from(json, 'utf8'));
    23: 
    24:       const header = Buffer.alloc(HEADER_SIZE);
    25:       MAGIC.copy(header, 0); // 0..3
    26:       header.writeUInt8(1, 4); // version
    27:       header.writeUInt8(0, 5);
    28:       header.writeUInt8(0, 6);
    29:       header.writeUInt8(0, 7);
    30:       header.writeUInt32BE(payload.length, 8);
    31: 
    32:       const rawData = Buffer.concat([header, payload]);
    33: 
    34:       const redCurtainMode = options.redCurtainMode ?? false;
    35:       const bytesPerPixel = redCurtainMode ? 1 : 4;
    36: 
    37:       const totalPixels = Math.ceil(rawData.length / bytesPerPixel);
    38:       const width = options.width ?? 8;
    39:       const height = Math.ceil(totalPixels / width);
    40: 
    41:       const png = new PNG({ width, height });
    42:       const data = png.data;
    43: 
    44:       for (let i = 0; i < totalPixels; i++) {
    45:         const pxIndex = i * 4;
    46:         const byteIndex = i * bytesPerPixel;
    47:         if (redCurtainMode) {
    48:           const value = rawData[byteIndex] ?? 0;
    49:           data[pxIndex] = value;
    50:           data[pxIndex + 1] = 0;
    51:           data[pxIndex + 2] = 0;
    52:           data[pxIndex + 3] = 255;
    53:         } else {
    54:           data[pxIndex] = rawData[byteIndex] ?? 0;
    55:           data[pxIndex + 1] = rawData[byteIndex + 1] ?? 0;
    56:           data[pxIndex + 2] = rawData[byteIndex + 2] ?? 0;
    57:           data[pxIndex + 3] = rawData[byteIndex + 3] ?? 0;
    58:         }
    59:       }
    60: 
    61:       // padding
    62:       for (let i = totalPixels * 4; i < data.length; i++) data[i] = data[i] || 0;
    63: 
    64:       const ws = fs.createWriteStream(outputPath);
    65:       png.pack().pipe(ws);
    66:       ws.on('finish', () => resolve());
    67:       ws.on('error', reject);
    68:     } catch (e) {
    69:       reject(e);
    70:     }
    71:   });
    72: }
    73: 
    74: export function decodeCortexPacketFromPng(inputPath: string): Promise<CortexPacket> {
    75:   return new Promise((resolve, reject) => {
    76:     try {
    77:       const rs = fs.createReadStream(inputPath);
    78:       // pngjs types may not match stream typings in TS env; cast to any for pipe
    79:       rs.pipe(new (PNG as any)())
    80:         .on('parsed', function (this: PNG) {
    81:           try {
    82:             const data = this.data; // RGBA
    83:             // attempt red-curtain detection: many pixels with G=B=0 and A=255
    84:             let redCurtain = true;
    85:             for (let i = 0; i < data.length; i += 4) {
    86:               if (!(data[i + 1] === 0 && data[i + 2] === 0 && data[i + 3] === 255)) { redCurtain = false; break; }
    87:             }
    88: 
    89:             let rawData: Buffer;
    90:             if (redCurtain) {
    91:               const bytes = data.length / 4;
    92:               rawData = Buffer.alloc(bytes);
    93:               for (let i = 0; i < bytes; i++) rawData[i] = data[i * 4];
    94:             } else {
    95:               // take raw RGBA stream
    96:               rawData = Buffer.from(data);
    97:             }
    98: 
    99:             const magic = rawData.subarray(0, 4);
   100:             if (!magic.equals(MAGIC)) return reject(new Error('Invalid CORTEX PNG, bad MAGIC'));
   101:             const version = rawData.readUInt8(4);
   102:             const length = rawData.readUInt32BE(8);
   103:             const headerSize = HEADER_SIZE;
   104:             const payloadBytes = rawData.subarray(headerSize, headerSize + length);
   105:             const decompressed = zlib.brotliDecompressSync(payloadBytes);
   106:             const jsonString = decompressed.toString('utf8');
   107:             const packet = JSON.parse(jsonString) as CortexPacket;
   108:             if (packet.kind !== 'cortex-packet') return reject(new Error('Invalid cortex packet kind'));
   109:             resolve(packet);
   110:           } catch (e) {
   111:             reject(e);
   112:           }
   113:         })
   114:         .on('error', reject);
   115:     } catch (e) {
   116:       reject(e);
   117:     }
   118:   });
   119: }
   120:

     7:   console.log('[CORTEX] En attente de paquets (enable-spyder, cortex-packet, etc.)');

============================
FILE: src\cortex\router.docs.md
============================
============================
     1: Router behavior
     2: ================
     3: 
     4: - Router consults `.qflush/cortex.routes.json` using `routesConfig` helper.
     5: - When `payload.candidates` present, `pickBestRoute(candidates)` picks route by score and enabled flag.
     6: - Handlers for idea names either call apply handlers (NPZ-GRAPH, SAVE-STATE, AUTO-PATCH) or emit events (CORTEX-DRIP, SPYDER-SOUND).
     7: 
     8: Routes
     9: ------
    10: - CORTEX-DRIP -> emit
    11: - NPZ-GRAPH -> executeAction('npz.encode')
    12: - OC8-LANG -> placeholder
    13: - QUANTUM-ROUTER -> uses routesConfig
    14: - SPYDER-SOUND -> emit
    15: - SAVE-STATE -> apply
    16: - AUTO-PATCH -> apply
    17: - SPYDER-VISION -> vision pipeline
    18: - A11-KEY -> CLI a11-key handler
    19: - FUNESTERIE-MAGIE -> emit
    20: 
    21:

FILE: src\cortex\router.spec.ts
============================
============================
     1: import { describe, it, expect, vi, beforeEach } from 'vitest';
     2: import * as router from './router';
     3: import * as emit from './emit';
     4: 
     5: describe('Cortex router', () => {
     6:   beforeEach(() => {
     7:     try { vi.restoreAllMocks(); } catch (e) {}
     8:   });
     9: 
    10:   it('routes NPZ-GRAPH to npz handler (noop stub)', async () => {
    11:     const pkt: any = { totalLen: 0, payloadLen: 0, flags: 0, payload: { cmd: 'NPZ-GRAPH', path: '.' }, type: 'cortex:npz-graph' };
    12:     const res = await router.routeCortexPacket(pkt);
    13:     expect(res).toBeUndefined();
    14:   });
    15: 
    16:   it('emits CORTEX-DRIP events (noop stub)', async () => {
    17:     const spy = vi.spyOn(emit, 'cortexEmit').mockImplementation(() => {});
    18:     const pkt: any = { totalLen: 0, payloadLen: 0, flags: 0, payload: { cmd: 'CORTEX-DRIP', data: 1 }, type: 'cortex:drip' };
    19:     const res = await router.routeCortexPacket(pkt);
    20:     expect(res).toBeUndefined();
    21:     expect(spy).not.toHaveBeenCalled();
    22:   });
    23: });
    24: 


============================
FILE: src\cortex\router.ts
============================
============================
     1: // src/cortex/router.ts
     2: import type { CortexPacket } from "./types";
     3: import alias from '../utils/alias';
     4: 
     5: export type CortexRouteHandler = (packet: CortexPacket) => Promise<any> | any;
     6: 
     7: const noopHandler: CortexRouteHandler = async () => { return; };
     8: 
     9: function resolveImport(name: string) {
    10:   try {
    11:     const g: any = (globalThis as any) || (global as any);
    12:     if (g && typeof g.__importUtilMock === 'function') return g.__importUtilMock(name);
    13:   } catch (e) {}
    14:   try { return alias.importUtil(name); } catch (e) {}
    15:   try {
    16:     // try require
    17:     return require(name);
    18:   } catch (e) {}
    19:   return undefined;
    20: }
    21: 
    22: // helper wrappers that resolve modules at call time (so tests can mock resolveImport via global)
    23: async function safeExecuteAction(action: string, ctx: any = {}) {
    24:   try {
    25:     const executorMod: any = resolveImport('../rome/executor') || resolveImport('@rome/executor') || resolveImport('src/rome/executor') || resolveImport('../rome/executor');
    26:     if (!executorMod) return { success: false, error: 'executor_unavailable' };
    27:     const fn = executorMod.executeAction || (executorMod.default && executorMod.default.executeAction) || executorMod;
    28:     if (typeof fn !== 'function') return { success: false, error: 'executeAction_unavailable' };
    29:     return await fn(action, ctx);
    30:   } catch (e) {
    31:     return { success: false, error: String(e) };
    32:   }
    33: }
    34: 
    35: async function safeRunSpyder(argv: string[] = []) {
    36:   try {
    37:     const runSpyderMod: any = resolveImport('../commands/spyder') || resolveImport('@commands/spyder') || resolveImport('src/commands/spyder');
    38:     if (!runSpyderMod) return { code: null, error: 'spyder_unavailable' };
    39:     const fn = runSpyderMod.default || runSpyderMod;
    40:     if (typeof fn !== 'function') return { code: null, error: 'spyder_run_unavailable' };
    41:     return await fn(argv);
    42:   } catch (e) {
    43:     return { code: null, error: String(e) };
    44:   }
    45: }
    46: 
    47: function safeEmit(eventName: string, payload: any) {
    48:   try {
    49:     const emitMod: any = resolveImport('./emit') || resolveImport('@cortex/emit') || resolveImport('src/cortex/emit');
    50:     if (!emitMod) return false;
    51:     const fn = emitMod.cortexEmit || (emitMod.default && emitMod.default.cortexEmit) || emitMod;
    52:     if (typeof fn !== 'function') return false;
    53:     fn(eventName, payload);
    54:     return true;
    55:   } catch (e) {
    56:     return false;
    57:   }
    58: }
    59: 
    60: async function safeProcessVision(p: any) {
    61:   try {
    62:     const visionMod: any = resolveImport('./vision') || resolveImport('@cortex/vision') || resolveImport('src/cortex/vision');
    63:     if (!visionMod) return { ok: false, error: 'vision_unavailable' };
    64:     const fn = visionMod.processVisionImage || (visionMod.default && visionMod.default.processVisionImage);
    65:     if (typeof fn !== 'function') return { ok: false, error: 'vision_fn_unavailable' };
    66:     return await fn(p && p.path ? p.path : (p && p.pngPath ? p.pngPath : p));
    67:   } catch (e) {
    68:     return { ok: false, error: String(e) };
    69:   }
    70: }
    71: 
    72: async function safeApplyPacket(pkt: any) {
    73:   try {
    74:     const applyMod: any = resolveImport('./applyPacket') || resolveImport('@cortex/applyPacket') || resolveImport('src/cortex/applyPacket');
    75:     if (!applyMod) return { ok: false, error: 'apply_unavailable' };
    76:     const fn = applyMod.applyCortexPacket || (applyMod.default && applyMod.default.applyCortexPacket) || (applyMod.default && applyMod.default.default) || applyMod.default || applyMod;
    77:     if (typeof fn !== 'function') return { ok: false, error: 'apply_fn_unavailable' };
    78:     return await fn(pkt);
    79:   } catch (e) {
    80:     return { ok: false, error: String(e) };
    81:   }
    82: }
    83: 
    84: // Handlers
    85: const handlers: Record<string, CortexRouteHandler> = {
    86:   'cortex:npz-graph': async (pkt) => {
    87:     const filePath = pkt.payload && pkt.payload.path ? pkt.payload.path : 'unknown';
    88:     const res = await safeExecuteAction('npz.encode', { path: filePath });
    89:     return res;
    90:   },
    91:   'npz-graph': async (pkt) => {
    92:     const filePath = pkt.payload && pkt.payload.path ? pkt.payload.path : 'unknown';
    93:     const res = await safeExecuteAction('npz.encode', { path: filePath });
    94:     return res;
    95:   },
    96:   'cortex:drip': async (pkt) => {
    97:     const ok = safeEmit('CORTEX-DRIP', pkt.payload);
    98:     return { ok };
    99:   },
   100:   'cortex:enable-spyder': async (pkt) => {
   101:     try {
   102:       const cfg = pkt.payload || {};
   103:       const args = Array.isArray(cfg.args) && cfg.args.length ? cfg.args : ['start'];
   104:       const res = await safeRunSpyder(args);
   105:       return { ok: true, res };
   106:     } catch (e) {
   107:       return { ok: false, error: String(e) };
   108:     }
   109:   },
   110:   'cortex:spyder-vision': async (pkt) => {
   111:     return await safeProcessVision(pkt.payload);
   112:   },
   113:   'spyder-vision': async (pkt) => {
   114:     return await safeProcessVision(pkt.payload);
   115:   },
   116:   'vision': async (pkt) => {
   117:     return await safeProcessVision(pkt.payload);
   118:   },
   119:   // apply-related handlers
   120:   'cortex:apply': async (pkt) => {
   121:     return await safeApplyPacket(pkt);
   122:   },
   123:   'qflush:apply': async (pkt) => {
   124:     return await safeApplyPacket(pkt);
   125:   },
   126:   // save state and auto-patch forward to apply logic
   127:   'cortex:save-state': async (pkt) => { return await safeApplyPacket(pkt); },
   128:   'save-state': async (pkt) => { return await safeApplyPacket(pkt); },
   129:   'save:state': async (pkt) => { return await safeApplyPacket(pkt); },
   130:   'auto-patch': async (pkt) => { return await safeApplyPacket(pkt); },
   131:   'auto_patch': async (pkt) => { return await safeApplyPacket(pkt); },
   132:   'auto-patch:apply': async (pkt) => { return await safeApplyPacket(pkt); },
   133:   'auto_patch:apply': async (pkt) => { return await safeApplyPacket(pkt); },
   134: };
   135: 
   136: // normalize and lookup function
   137: function findHandler(pkt: CortexPacket): CortexRouteHandler {
   138:   const candidates: string[] = [];
   139:   if (pkt.type) candidates.push(String(pkt.type));
   140:   if (pkt.payload && typeof pkt.payload === 'object') {
   141:     if (typeof pkt.payload.cmd === 'string') candidates.push(String(pkt.payload.cmd));
   142:     if (typeof pkt.payload.command === 'string') candidates.push(String(pkt.payload.command));
   143:   }
   144:   // add lowercase variants
   145:   for (const c of candidates.slice()) candidates.push(c.toLowerCase());
   146: 
   147:   for (const c of candidates) {
   148:     const key = String(c || '').toLowerCase();
   149:     if (handlers[key]) return handlers[key];
   150:   }
   151: 
   152:   // fallback to routesCfg pick logic if present
   153:   try {
   154:     const routesCfg: any = resolveImport('./routesConfig') || resolveImport('@cortex/routesConfig') || resolveImport('src/cortex/routesConfig');
   155:     if (routesCfg && typeof routesCfg.pickBestRoute === 'function') {
   156:       const pick = routesCfg.pickBestRoute(candidates as any) as string | null;
   157:       if (pick) {
   158:         const k = String(pick).toLowerCase();
   159:         if (handlers[k]) return handlers[k];
   160:       }
   161:     }
   162:   } catch (e) {}
   163: 
   164:   return noopHandler;
   165: }
   166: 
   167: export async function routeCortexPacket(packet: CortexPacket): Promise<any> {
   168:   const h = findHandler(packet);
   169:   try {
   170:     return await h(packet);
   171:   } catch (e) {
   172:     return { ok: false, error: String(e) };
   173:   }
   174: }
   175: 
   176: export default { routeCortexPacket };
   177: 


============================
FILE: src\cortex\router.unit.spec.ts
============================
============================
     1: import { describe, it, expect, vi, beforeEach } from 'vitest';
     2: 
     3: describe('cortex/router handlers', () => {
     4:   beforeEach(() => { try { vi.restoreAllMocks(); delete (globalThis as any).__importUtilMock; } catch (e) {} });
     5: 
     6:   it('npz-graph handler calls executor', async () => {
     7:     const fakeExec = { executeAction: vi.fn(async (a:any, b:any) => ({ success: true, action: a, ctx: b })) };
     8:     (globalThis as any).__importUtilMock = (name: string) => {
     9:       if (name.includes('executor')) return fakeExec;
    10:       return undefined;
    11:     };
    12: 
    13:     const router = await import('./router.js');
    14:     const pkt: any = { type: 'cortex:npz-graph', payload: { path: 'some/path' } };
    15:     const res = await router.routeCortexPacket(pkt as any);
    16:     expect(res && (res as any).success).toBe(true);
    17:     expect((fakeExec.executeAction as any).mock.calls.length).toBeGreaterThan(0);
    18:   });
    19: 
    20:   it('vision handler calls vision.processVisionImage', async () => {
    21:     const fakeVision = { processVisionImage: vi.fn(async (p:string) => ({ ok: true, path: p })) };
    22:     (globalThis as any).__importUtilMock = (name: string) => {
    23:       if (name.includes('vision')) return fakeVision;
    24:       return undefined;
    25:     };
    26: 
    27:     const router = await import('./router.js');
    28:     const pkt: any = { type: 'cortex:spyder-vision', payload: { path: 'img.png' } };
    29:     const res = await router.routeCortexPacket(pkt as any);
    30:     expect(res && (res as any).ok).toBe(true);
    31:     expect((fakeVision.processVisionImage as any).mock.calls.length).toBe(1);
    32:   });
    33: 
    34:   it('apply handler calls applyCortexPacket', async () => {
    35:     const fakeApply = { applyCortexPacket: vi.fn(async (p:any) => ({ ok: true })) };
    36:     (globalThis as any).__importUtilMock = (name: string) => {
    37:       if (name.includes('applyPacket')) return fakeApply;
    38:       return undefined;
    39:     };
    40: 
    41:     const router = await import('./router.js');
    42:     const pkt: any = { type: 'qflush:apply', payload: { patch: {} } };
    43:     const res = await router.routeCortexPacket(pkt as any);
    44:     expect(res && (res as any).ok).toBe(true);
    45:     expect((fakeApply.applyCortexPacket as any).mock.calls.length).toBe(1);
    46:   });
    47: });
    48: 


============================
FILE: src\cortex\routesConfig.spec.ts
============================
============================
     1: import { describe, it, expect } from 'vitest';
     2: import { loadRoutesConfig, pickBestRoute, isRouteEnabled } from './routesConfig';
     3: import * as fs from 'fs';
     4: import * as path from 'path';
     5: 
     6: describe('routesConfig', () => {
     7:   it('loads array routes', () => {
     8:     const tmp = path.join(process.cwd(), '.qflush', 'cortex.routes.json');
     9:     try {
    10:       if (!fs.existsSync(path.dirname(tmp))) fs.mkdirSync(path.dirname(tmp), { recursive: true });
    11:       fs.writeFileSync(tmp, JSON.stringify({ routes: ['A','B'] }, null, 2), 'utf8');
    12:       const cfg = loadRoutesConfig();
    13:       expect(cfg).toBeTruthy();
    14:       const pick = pickBestRoute(['A','B']);
    15:       expect(pick).toBe('A');
    16:     } finally {
    17:       try { fs.unlinkSync(tmp); } catch (e) {}
    18:     }
    19:   });
    20: 
    21:   it('respects disabled flag', () => {
    22:     const tmp = path.join(process.cwd(), '.qflush', 'cortex.routes.json');
    23:     try {
    24:       fs.writeFileSync(tmp, JSON.stringify({ cortexActions: { 'A': true, 'B': false } }, null, 2), 'utf8');
    25:       expect(isRouteEnabled('A')).toBe(true);
    26:       expect(isRouteEnabled('B')).toBe(false);
    27:     } finally { try { fs.unlinkSync(tmp); } catch (e) {} }
    28:   });
    29: });
    30: 


============================
FILE: src\cortex\routesConfig.ts
============================
============================
     1: import * as fs from 'fs';
     2: import * as path from 'path';
     3: 
     4: const ROUTES_PATH = path.join(process.cwd(), '.qflush', 'cortex.routes.json');
     5: 
     6: export type RouteInfo = { enabled?: boolean; score?: number; [k:string]: any };
     7: 
     8: export function loadRoutesConfig(): Record<string, RouteInfo> | null {
     9:   try {
    10:     if (!fs.existsSync(ROUTES_PATH)) return null;
    11:     const raw = fs.readFileSync(ROUTES_PATH, 'utf8') || '{}';
    12:     const parsed = JSON.parse(raw);
    13:     // support two shapes: { routes: [...] } or { cortexActions: { name: true } } or object map
    14:     if (parsed && parsed.routes && Array.isArray(parsed.routes)) {
    15:       const out: Record<string, RouteInfo> = {};
    16:       for (const r of parsed.routes) out[r] = { enabled: true, score: 0 };
    17:       return out;
    18:     }
    19:     if (parsed && parsed.cortexActions && typeof parsed.cortexActions === 'object' && !Array.isArray(parsed.cortexActions)) {
    20:       const out: Record<string, RouteInfo> = {};
    21:       for (const [k,v] of Object.entries(parsed.cortexActions)) {
    22:         if (typeof v === 'boolean') out[k] = { enabled: v, score: 0 };
    23:         else out[k] = v as RouteInfo;
    24:       }
    25:       return out;
    26:     }
    27:     if (parsed && typeof parsed === 'object') {
    28:       // assume mapping directly
    29:       return parsed as Record<string, RouteInfo>;
    30:     }
    31:     return null;
    32:   } catch (e) {
    33:     return null;
    34:   }
    35: }
    36: 
    37: export function isRouteEnabled(name: string): boolean {
    38:   try {
    39:     const cfg = loadRoutesConfig();
    40:     if (!cfg) return true; // default allow
    41:     const entry = cfg[name];
    42:     if (!entry) return true;
    43:     if (typeof entry.enabled === 'boolean') return entry.enabled;
    44:     return true;
    45:   } catch (e) {
    46:     return true;
    47:   }
    48: }
    49: 
    50: export function getRouteScore(name: string): number {
    51:   try {
    52:     const cfg = loadRoutesConfig();
    53:     if (!cfg) return 0;
    54:     const entry = cfg[name];
    55:     if (!entry) return 0;
    56:     const s = Number(entry.score || 0);
    57:     return Number.isFinite(s) ? s : 0;
    58:   } catch (e) {
    59:     return 0;
    60:   }
    61: }
    62: 
    63: export function pickBestRoute(candidates: string[]): string | null {
    64:   if (!candidates || !candidates.length) return null;
    65:   const scores: { name: string; score: number }[] = candidates.map(n => ({ name: n, score: getRouteScore(n) }));
    66:   // filter enabled
    67:   const enabled = scores.filter(s => isRouteEnabled(s.name));
    68:   if (!enabled.length) return null;
    69:   enabled.sort((a,b) => b.score - a.score);
    70:   return enabled[0].name;
    71: }
    72: 
    73: export default { loadRoutesConfig, isRouteEnabled, getRouteScore, pickBestRoute };
    74:

     1: export interface CortexPacket {
     2:   version?: number;
     3:   kind?: 'cortex-packet';
     4:   type?: string;
     5:   id?: string;
     6:   payload: any;
     7: 
     8:   // additional fields for decoded PNG transport
     9:   totalLen?: number;
    10:   payloadLen?: number;
    11:   flags?: number;
    12: }
    13:

     1: import { describe, it, expect } from 'vitest';
     2: import vision from './vision';
     3: import * as fs from 'fs';
     4: import * as path from 'path';
     5: 
     6: describe('vision pipeline', () => {
     7:   it('processes png if present (smoke)', async () => {
     8:     const f = path.join(process.cwd(), 'parts', 'ideas_oc8.png');
     9:     if (!fs.existsSync(f)) {
    10:       // skip
    11:       expect(true).toBe(true);
    12:       return;
    13:     }
    14:     const res = await vision.processVisionImage(f);
    15:     expect(res).toBeDefined();
    16:     expect(res.packet).toBeDefined();
    17:   });
    18: });

============================
FILE: src\cortex\vision.ts
============================
============================
     1: import * as fs from 'fs';
     2: import * as path from 'path';
     3: import { decodeCortexPacketFromPng } from './pngCodec';
     4: 
     5: const OUT = path.join(process.cwd(), '.qflush', 'spyder-vision.json');
     6: 
     7: export async function processVisionImage(pngPath: string) {
     8:   try {
     9:     const pkt = await decodeCortexPacketFromPng(pngPath);
    10:     // naive vision: store packet payload or metadata
    11:     const data = { source: pngPath, packet: pkt, processedAt: new Date().toISOString() };
    12:     try {
    13:       const dir = path.dirname(OUT);
    14:       if (!fs.existsSync(dir)) fs.mkdirSync(dir, { recursive: true });
    15:       fs.writeFileSync(OUT, JSON.stringify(data, null, 2), 'utf8');
    16:     } catch (e) {}
    17:     return data;
    18:   } catch (e) {
    19:     throw e;
    20:   }
    21: }
    22: 
    23: export default { processVisionImage };
    24: 


============================
FILE: src\daemon\auth-middleware.ts
============================
============================
     1: import { Request, Response, NextFunction } from 'express';
     2: 
     3: export function requireQflushToken(req: Request, res: Response, next: NextFunction) {
     4:   const token = process.env.QFLUSH_TOKEN || '';
     5:   if (!token) return res.status(401).json({ success: false, error: 'QFLUSH_TOKEN not configured on server' });
     6:   const header = req.headers['x-qflush-token'] as string | undefined;
     7:   if (!header || header !== token) return res.status(403).json({ success: false, error: 'invalid token' });
     8:   return next();
     9: }
    10: 
    11: export function requireNpzToken(req: Request, res: Response, next: NextFunction) {
    12:   // Accept either x-qflush-token header or Authorization: Bearer <token>
    13:   let token = req.headers['x-qflush-token'] as string | undefined;
    14:   if (!token) {
    15:     const auth = req.headers['authorization'] as string | undefined;
    16:     if (auth && auth.toLowerCase().startsWith('bearer ')) {
    17:       token = auth.slice(7).trim();
    18:     }
    19:   }
    20: 
    21:   if (!token) {
    22:     // tests expect 403 when token is missing
    23:     return res.status(403).json({ error: 'missing token' });
    24:   }
    25: 
    26:   const expected = process.env.QFLUSH_TEST_TOKEN || process.env.ACTIONS_TOKEN || undefined;
    27: 
    28:   if (!expected) {
    29:     // if no expected token configured, return 401
    30:     return res.status(401).json({ error: 'invalid token' });
    31:   }
    32: 
    33:   if (token !== expected) {
    34:     return res.status(401).json({ error: 'invalid token' });
    35:   }
    36: 
    37:   return next();
    38: }
    39: 
    40: export default { requireQflushToken, requireNpzToken };
    41: 
    42: 


============================
FILE: src\daemon\daemon-control.ts
============================
============================
     1: // ROME-TAG: 0x2037A4
     2: 
     3: // Lightweight daemon reload handler
     4: let reloadHandler: (() => void) | null = null;
     5: 
     6: export function setReloadHandler(fn: () => void) {
     7:   reloadHandler = fn;
     8: }
     9: 
    10: export function triggerReload() {
    11:   if (reloadHandler) reloadHandler();
    12: }
    13: 


============================
FILE: src\daemon\qflushd.ts
============================
============================
     1: // qflush daemon lightweight test server
     2: // This implementation is minimal and intended to satisfy legacy tests that expect an HTTP control server.
     3: 
     4: import * as http from 'http';
     5: import * as url from 'url';
     6: import * as fs from 'fs';
     7: import * as path from 'path';
     8: 
     9: let _server: http.Server | null = null;
    10: let _state: { safeMode: boolean; mode?: string } = { safeMode: false };
    11: 
    12: function requireToken(req: http.IncomingMessage): boolean {
    13:   try {
    14:     const expected = process.env.QFLUSH_TOKEN;
    15:     if (!expected) return false;
    16:     const v = (req.headers['x-qflush-token'] || req.headers['X-QFLUSH-TOKEN']) as string | undefined;
    17:     return !!v && String(v) === String(expected);
    18:   } catch (e) { return false; }
    19: }
    20: 
    21: function writeSafeModes(mode: string) {
    22:   try {
    23:     const dir = path.join(process.cwd(), '.qflush');
    24:     if (!fs.existsSync(dir)) fs.mkdirSync(dir, { recursive: true });
    25:     const p = path.join(dir, 'safe-modes.json');
    26:     const obj = { mode, updatedAt: new Date().toISOString() };
    27:     fs.writeFileSync(p, JSON.stringify(obj, null, 2), 'utf8');
    28:   } catch (e) {}
    29: }
    30: 
    31: // new helper: compute flexible checksum for a workspace file path
    32: async function computeFlexibleChecksumForPath(relPath: string) {
    33:   try {
    34:     const filePath = path.isAbsolute(relPath) ? relPath : path.join(process.cwd(), relPath);
    35:     if (!fs.existsSync(filePath)) throw new Error('file_not_found');
    36:     const fc = require('../utils/fileChecksum');
    37:     if (fc && typeof fc.flexibleChecksumFile === 'function') {
    38:       const val = await fc.flexibleChecksumFile(filePath);
    39:       return { success: true, checksum: String(val) };
    40:     }
    41:     return { success: false, error: 'checksum_unavailable' };
    42:   } catch (e) {
    43:     return { success: false, error: String(e) };
    44:   }
    45: }
    46: 
    47: export async function startServer(port?: number) {
    48:   return new Promise((resolve, reject) => {
    49:     try {
    50:       if (_server) {
    51:         return resolve({ ok: true, port: (port || process.env.QFLUSHD_PORT || 4500) });
    52:       }
    53: 
    54:       const p = port || (process.env.QFLUSHD_PORT ? Number(process.env.QFLUSHD_PORT) : 4500);
    55:       const srv = http.createServer(async (req, res) => {
    56:         try {
    57:           const parsed = url.parse(req.url || '', true);
    58:           const method = (req.method || 'GET').toUpperCase();
    59:           // collect body
    60:           let body = '';
    61:           req.on('data', (chunk) => body += chunk.toString());
    62:           req.on('end', async () => {
    63:             // Token protected endpoints
    64:             if (method === 'POST' && parsed.pathname === '/npz/sleep') {
    65:               if (!requireToken(req)) {
    66:                 res.writeHead(403, { 'Content-Type': 'application/json' });
    67:                 res.end(JSON.stringify({ success: false, error: 'forbidden' }));
    68:                 return;
    69:               }
    70:               _state.safeMode = true;
    71:               _state.mode = 'sleep';
    72:               writeSafeModes('sleep');
    73:               res.writeHead(200, { 'Content-Type': 'application/json' });
    74:               res.end(JSON.stringify({ success: true, mode: 'sleep' }));
    75:               return;
    76:             }
    77:             if (method === 'POST' && parsed.pathname === '/npz/wake') {
    78:               if (!requireToken(req)) {
    79:                 res.writeHead(403, { 'Content-Type': 'application/json' });
    80:                 res.end(JSON.stringify({ success: false, error: 'forbidden' }));
    81:                 return;
    82:               }
    83:               _state.safeMode = false;
    84:               _state.mode = 'normal';
    85:               writeSafeModes('normal');
    86:               res.writeHead(200, { 'Content-Type': 'application/json' });
    87:               res.end(JSON.stringify({ success: true, mode: 'normal' }));
    88:               return;
    89:             }
    90:             if (method === 'POST' && parsed.pathname === '/npz/joker-wipe') {
    91:               if (!requireToken(req)) {
    92:                 res.writeHead(403, { 'Content-Type': 'application/json' });
    93:                 res.end(JSON.stringify({ success: false, error: 'forbidden' }));
    94:                 return;
    95:               }
    96:               // pretend to wipe but in test mode skip exit
    97:               _state.safeMode = true;
    98:               _state.mode = 'joker';
    99:               writeSafeModes('joker');
   100:               res.writeHead(200, { 'Content-Type': 'application/json' });
   101:               res.end(JSON.stringify({ success: true, mode: 'joker' }));
   102:               return;
   103:             }
   104: 
   105:             // health endpoint
   106:             if (parsed.pathname === '/health' || parsed.pathname === '/status') {
   107:               res.writeHead(200, { 'Content-Type': 'application/json' });
   108:               res.end(JSON.stringify({ ok: true }));
   109:               return;
   110:             }
   111: 
   112:             // checksum endpoints
   113:             if (parsed.pathname && parsed.pathname.indexOf('/npz/checksum') === 0) {
   114:               try {
   115:                 const baseDir = path.join(process.cwd(), '.qflush');
   116:                 if (!fs.existsSync(baseDir)) fs.mkdirSync(baseDir, { recursive: true });
   117:                 const dbFile = path.join(baseDir, 'checksums.json');
   118:                 let db: Record<string, any> = {};
   119:                 try { if (fs.existsSync(dbFile)) db = JSON.parse(fs.readFileSync(dbFile, 'utf8') || '{}'); } catch (e) { db = {}; }
   120: 
   121:                 // POST /npz/checksum/store
   122:                 if (method === 'POST' && parsed.pathname === '/npz/checksum/store') {
   123:                   try {
   124:                     const obj = body ? JSON.parse(body) : {};
   125:                     const id = obj.id;
   126:                     let checksum = obj.checksum;
   127:                     const ttlMs = obj.ttlMs ? Number(obj.ttlMs) : undefined;
   128:                     const filePath = obj.path;
   129:                     if (!id) {
   130:                       res.writeHead(400, { 'Content-Type': 'application/json' });
   131:                       res.end(JSON.stringify({ success: false, error: 'missing id' }));
   132:                       return;
   133:                     }
   134: 
   135:                     // if checksum is special token '__auto__' and a path is provided, compute it
   136:                     if (checksum === '__auto__' && filePath) {
   137:                       const comp = await computeFlexibleChecksumForPath(String(filePath));
   138:                       if (!comp.success) {
   139:                         res.writeHead(500, { 'Content-Type': 'application/json' });
   140:                         res.end(JSON.stringify(comp));
   141:                         return;
   142:                       }
   143:                       checksum = comp.checksum;
   144:                     }
   145: 
   146:                     if (!checksum) {
   147:                       res.writeHead(400, { 'Content-Type': 'application/json' });
   148:                       res.end(JSON.stringify({ success: false, error: 'missing checksum' }));
   149:                       return;
   150:                     }
   151:                     const rec: any = { id, checksum, storedAt: Date.now() };
   152:                     if (ttlMs) rec.expiresAt = Date.now() + Number(ttlMs);
   153:                     db[id] = rec;
   154:                     try { fs.writeFileSync(dbFile, JSON.stringify(db, null, 2), 'utf8'); } catch (e) {}
   155:                     res.writeHead(200, { 'Content-Type': 'application/json' });
   156:                     res.end(JSON.stringify({ success: true, id, checksum }));
   157:                     return;
   158:                   } catch (e) {
   159:                     res.writeHead(500, { 'Content-Type': 'application/json' });
   160:                     res.end(JSON.stringify({ success: false, error: String(e) }));
   161:                     return;
   162:                   }
   163:                 }
   164: 
   165:                 // POST /npz/checksum/compute
   166:                 if (method === 'POST' && parsed.pathname === '/npz/checksum/compute') {
   167:                   try {
   168:                     const obj = body ? JSON.parse(body) : {};
   169:                     const rel = obj.path;
   170:                     if (!rel) {
   171:                       res.writeHead(400, { 'Content-Type': 'application/json' });
   172:                       res.end(JSON.stringify({ success: false, error: 'missing path' }));
   173:                       return;
   174:                     }
   175:                     const comp = await computeFlexibleChecksumForPath(String(rel));
   176:                     if (!comp.success) {
   177:                       res.writeHead(500, { 'Content-Type': 'application/json' });
   178:                       res.end(JSON.stringify(comp));
   179:                       return;
   180:                     }
   181:                     res.writeHead(200, { 'Content-Type': 'application/json' });
   182:                     res.end(JSON.stringify(comp));
   183:                     return;
   184:                   } catch (e) {
   185:                     res.writeHead(500, { 'Content-Type': 'application/json' });
   186:                     res.end(JSON.stringify({ success: false, error: String(e) }));
   187:                     return;
   188:                   }
   189:                 }
   190: 
   191:                 // POST /npz/checksum/verify
   192:                 if (method === 'POST' && parsed.pathname === '/npz/checksum/verify') {
   193:                   try {
   194:                     const obj = body ? JSON.parse(body) : {};
   195:                     const id = obj.id;
   196:                     let checksum = obj.checksum;
   197:                     const filePath = obj.path;
   198:                     if (!id || typeof checksum === 'undefined') {
   199:                       res.writeHead(400, { 'Content-Type': 'application/json' });
   200:                       res.end(JSON.stringify({ success: false, error: 'missing id or checksum' }));
   201:                       return;
   202:                     }
   203:                     const rec = db[id];
   204:                     if (!rec) {
   205:                       res.writeHead(404, { 'Content-Type': 'application/json' });
   206:                       res.end(JSON.stringify({ success: false, error: 'not_found' }));
   207:                       return;
   208:                     }
   209:                     if (rec.expiresAt && Date.now() > rec.expiresAt) {
   210:                       delete db[id];
   211:                       try { fs.writeFileSync(dbFile, JSON.stringify(db, null, 2), 'utf8'); } catch (e) {}
   212:                       res.writeHead(404, { 'Content-Type': 'application/json' });
   213:                       res.end(JSON.stringify({ success: false, error: 'expired' }));
   214:                       return;
   215:                     }
   216: 
   217:                     // if checksum is '__auto__' and a file path provided, compute actual checksum and compare
   218:                     if (checksum === '__auto__' && filePath) {
   219:                       const comp = await computeFlexibleChecksumForPath(String(filePath));
   220:                       if (!comp.success) {
   221:                         res.writeHead(500, { 'Content-Type': 'application/json' });
   222:                         res.end(JSON.stringify(comp));
   223:                         return;
   224:                       }
   225:                       checksum = comp.checksum;
   226:                     }
   227: 
   228:                     if (String(rec.checksum) === String(checksum)) {
   229:                       res.writeHead(200, { 'Content-Type': 'application/json' });
   230:                       res.end(JSON.stringify({ success: true }));
   231:                       return;
   232:                     }
   233:                     // mismatch -> 412
   234:                     res.writeHead(412, { 'Content-Type': 'application/json' });
   235:                     res.end(JSON.stringify({ success: false, error: 'mismatch' }));
   236:                     return;
   237:                   } catch (e) {
   238:                     res.writeHead(500, { 'Content-Type': 'application/json' });
   239:                     res.end(JSON.stringify({ success: false, error: String(e) }));
   240:                     return;
   241:                   }
   242:                 }
   243: 
   244:                 // GET /npz/checksum/list
   245:                 if (method === 'GET' && parsed.pathname === '/npz/checksum/list') {
   246:                   const now = Date.now();
   247:                   // remove expired
   248:                   for (const k of Object.keys(db)) {
   249:                     if (db[k] && db[k].expiresAt && now > db[k].expiresAt) delete db[k];
   250:                   }
   251:                   try { fs.writeFileSync(dbFile, JSON.stringify(db, null, 2), 'utf8'); } catch (e) {}
   252:                   const items = Object.values(db);
   253:                   res.writeHead(200, { 'Content-Type': 'application/json' });
   254:                   res.end(JSON.stringify({ success: true, count: items.length, items }));
   255:                   return;
   256:                 }
   257: 
   258:                 // DELETE /npz/checksum/clear
   259:                 if (method === 'DELETE' && parsed.pathname === '/npz/checksum/clear') {
   260:                   db = {};
   261:                   try { fs.writeFileSync(dbFile, JSON.stringify(db, null, 2), 'utf8'); } catch (e) {}
   262:                   res.writeHead(200, { 'Content-Type': 'application/json' });
   263:                   res.end(JSON.stringify({ success: true }));
   264:                   return;
   265:                 }
   266:               } catch (e) {
   267:                 // fallthrough to not found
   268:               }
   269:             }
   270:             res.writeHead(404, { 'Content-Type': 'application/json' });
   271:             res.end(JSON.stringify({ error: 'not_found' }));
   272:           });
   273:         } catch (e) {
   274:           try { res.writeHead(500, { 'Content-Type': 'application/json' }); res.end(JSON.stringify({ error: String(e) })); } catch (_) {}
   275:         }
   276:       });
   277: 
   278:       srv.listen(p, '127.0.0.1', () => {
   279:         _server = srv;
   280:         resolve({ ok: true, port: p });
   281:       });
   282: 
   283:       srv.on('error', (err) => {
   284:         reject(err);
   285:       });
   286:     } catch (err) {
   287:       reject(err);
   288:     }
   289:   });
   290: }
   291: 
   292: export async function stopServer() {
   293:   return new Promise((resolve) => {
   294:     try {
   295:       if (!_server) return resolve({ ok: true, stopped: false });
   296:       const s = _server;
   297:       _server = null;
   298:       s.close(() => resolve({ ok: true, stopped: true }));
   299:     } catch (e) {
   300:       resolve({ ok: false, error: String(e) });
   301:     }
   302:   });
   303: }
   304: 
   305: export default { startServer, stopServer };

     1: // ROME-TAG: 0x2A0018

     3: // Register global error handlers early to avoid the CLI crashing on unhandled errors (redis, etc.)
     4: process.on('unhandledRejection', (reason) => {
     5:   try { console.warn('Unhandled Rejection:', reason && (reason as any).stack ? (reason as any).stack : String(reason)); } catch { /* ignore */ }
     6: });
     7: process.on('uncaughtException', (err) => {
     8:   try { console.error('Uncaught Exception:', err && (err as any).stack ? (err as any).stack : String(err)); } catch { /* ignore */ }
     9: });
    10: 
    11: // Early exit for version/about flags to avoid importing modules with side-effects.
    12: const _argv = process.argv.slice(2);
    13: if (_argv.includes('--version') || _argv.includes('-v')) {
    14:   try {
    15:     // eslint-disable-next-line @typescript-eslint/no-var-requires
    16:     const pkg = require('../package.json');
    17:     if (pkg && pkg.version) console.log(pkg.version);
    18:     else console.log('unknown');
    19:   } catch (e) { console.log('unknown'); }
    20:   process.exit(0);
    21: }
    22: if (_argv.includes('--about') || _argv.includes('-a')) {
    23:   try {
    24:     const pkg = require('../package.json');
    25:     console.log(`${pkg.name} - ${pkg.description}\nversion ${pkg.version}`);
    26:   } catch (e) { console.log('qflush - Funesterie orchestrator'); }
    27:   process.exit(0);
    28: }
    29: if (_argv.includes('--upgrade')) {
    30:   // simple upgrade helper: attempt to npm install -g the same package name
    31:   console.log('Attempting upgrade...');
    32:   const { spawnSync } = require('child_process');
    33:   const res = spawnSync('npm', ['install', '-g', '@funeste38/qflush@latest'], { stdio: 'inherit' });
    34:   process.exit(res.status ?? 0);
    35: }

    37: import { buildPipeline, executePipeline } from "./chain/smartChain";
    38: import { showHelp } from "./cli/help";
    39: import { runCompose } from "./commands/compose";
    40: import { runDoctor } from "./commands/doctor";
    41: import runNpzInspect from "./commands/npz-inspect";
    42: import runNpzScores from "./commands/npz-scores";

    47: import runCopilot from "./commands/copilot";

    49: import runRomeLinks from "./commands/rome-links";
    50: import runA11 from "./commands/a11";
    51: import runSpyder from "./commands/spyder";
    52: import { spawn } from 'child_process';
    53: import { enterSleepMode, exitSleepMode, jokerWipe } from './services';
    54: import { startQflushSystem } from './core/start-system';
    55: 
    56: // Only run the CLI dispatch when this module is the entrypoint
    57: declare const require: any;
    58: if (typeof require !== 'undefined' && require.main === module) {
    59:   const argv = process.argv.slice(2);
    60:   let cliHandled = false;
    61:   if (argv.includes("--help") || argv.includes("-h")) {
    62:     showHelp();
    63:     process.exit(0);
    64:   }
    65: 
    66:   const first = argv[0];
    67:   // CLI aliases for embedded BAT modes
    68:   if (first === 'bat:sleep') {
    69:     try {
    70:       enterSleepMode();
    71:       console.log('BAT: sleep mode engaged');
    72:       process.exit(0);
    73:     } catch (e) {
    74:       console.error('failed to enter sleep mode', e);
    75:       process.exit(1);
    76:     }
    77:   }
    78:   if (first === 'bat:wake') {
    79:     try {
    80:       exitSleepMode();
    81:       console.log('BAT: exited sleep mode');
    82:       process.exit(0);
    83:     } catch (e) {
    84:       console.error('failed to exit sleep mode', e);
    85:       process.exit(1);
    86:     }
    87:   }
    88:   if (first === 'bat:joker') {
    89:     try {
    90:       // call and return; jokerWipe may exit process
    91:       jokerWipe();
    92:       // give it a moment
    93:       setTimeout(() => process.exit(0), 1000);
    94:     } catch (e) {
    95:       console.error('failed to perform joker wipe', e);
    96:       process.exit(1);
    97:     }
    98:   }
    99: 
   100:   if (first === "compose") {
   101:     void runCompose(argv.slice(1));
   102:     process.exit(0);
   103:   }
   104:   if (first === 'apply') {
   105:     (async () => {
   106:       try {
   107:         const m: any = await import('./commands/apply.js');
   108:         if (m && typeof m.default === 'function') {
   109:           const code = await m.default(argv.slice(1));
   110:           process.exit(code ?? 0);
   111:         } else {
   112:           console.error('apply command not available');
   113:           process.exit(2);
   114:         }
   115:       } catch (e) {
   116:         console.error('failed to run apply', e);
   117:         process.exit(1);
   118:       }
   119:     })();
   120:     cliHandled = true;
   121:   }
   122:   if (first === "doctor") {
   123:     void runDoctor(argv.slice(1));
   124:     process.exit(0);
   125:   }
   126:   if (first === "daemon") {
   127:     // Default to detached mode to avoid launching heavy in-process work (opens files, scanners).
   128:     // Pass `--no-detach` to run in-process explicitly.
   129:     const detached = argv.includes('--detached') || !argv.includes('--no-detach');
   130:     if (!argv.includes('--detached') && !argv.includes('--no-detach')) {
   131:       console.log('qflush: starting daemon in detached mode by default (use --no-detach to run in-process)');
   132:     }
   133: 
   134:     const useCortex = argv.includes('--use-cortex') || process.env.QFLUSH_USE_CORTEX === '1';
   135:     // If the user explicitly requested --use-cortex we still allow startQflushSystem to manage both.
   136:     if (detached) {
   137:       try {
   138:         // attempt to use @funeste38/bat to spawn detached
   139:         // eslint-disable-next-line @typescript-eslint/no-var-requires
   140:         const bat = require('@funeste38/bat');
   141:         if (bat && typeof bat.spawn === 'function') {
   142:           bat.spawn('qflushd', process.execPath, ['dist/daemon/qflushd.js']);
   143:           console.log('qflushd spawned detached via bat');
   144:           process.exit(0);
   145:         }
   146:       } catch (e) {
   147:         // fallback to detached child process
   148:         try {
   149:           const child = spawn(process.execPath, ['dist/daemon/qflushd.js'], { detached: true, stdio: 'ignore' });
   150:           child.unref();
   151:           console.log('qflushd spawned detached (fallback)');
   152:           process.exit(0);
   153:         } catch (err) {
   154:           console.error('failed to spawn detached daemon', err);
   155:           process.exit(1);
   156:         }
   157:       }
   158:     }
   159: 
   160:     // start systems in-process using hybrid starter (CORTEX and/or daemon depending on QFLUSH_MODE)
   161:     try {
   162:       // This will start Cortex bus and/or daemon server per QFLUSH_MODE
   163:       startQflushSystem();
   164:     } catch (err) {
   165:       console.error('failed to start qflush system', err);
   166:       process.exit(1);
   167:     }
   168:     // keep process alive by marking handled (avoid running CLI pipeline)
   169:     cliHandled = true;
   170:   }
   171: 
   172:   if (first === 'a11' || first === 'a11:status') {
   173:     (async () => {
   174:       const code = await runA11(argv.slice(1));
   175:       process.exit(code ?? 0);
   176:     })();
   177:   }
   178: 
   179:   if (first === 'spyder' || first === 'spyder:status' || first === 'spyder:mem') {
   180:     (async () => {
   181:       const code = await runSpyder(argv.slice(1));
   182:       process.exit(code ?? 0);
   183:     })();
   184:   }
   185: 
   186:   if (first === 'engine' ) {
   187:     (async () => {
   188:       const code = await runEngine(argv.slice(1));
   189:       process.exit(code ?? 0);
   190:     })();
   191:   }
   192: 
   193:   if (first === 'logic' ) {
   194:     (async () => {
   195:       const code = await runLogic(argv.slice(1));
   196:       process.exit(code ?? 0);
   197:     })();
   198:   }
   199: 
   200:   if (first === 'copilot' ) {
   201:     (async () => {
   202:       const code = await runCopilot(argv.slice(1));
   203:       process.exit(code ?? 0);
   204:     })();
   205:   }
   206: 
   207:   if (first === 'copilot-bridge' ) {
   208:     (async () => {
   209:       const code = await runCopilotBridge(argv.slice(1));
   210:       process.exit(code ?? 0);
   211:     })();
   212:   }
   213: 
   214:   if (first === 'license' || (first === 'lic' && argv[1] === 'activate')) {
   215:     (async () => {
   216:       const code = await runLicense(argv.slice(1));
   217:       process.exit(code ?? 0);
   218:     })();
   219:   }
   220: 
   221:   if (first === 'checksum' && argv[1]) {
   222:     (async () => {
   223:       const code = await runChecksum(argv.slice(1));
   224:       process.exit(code ?? 0);
   225:     })();
   226:   }
   227: 
   228:   if (first === 'rome:links' || (first === 'rome' && argv[1] === 'links')) {
   229:     (async () => {
   230:       const code = await runRomeLinks(argv.slice(1));
   231:       process.exit(code ?? 0);
   232:     })();
   233:   }
   234: 
   235:   // NPZ inspect command: `qflush npz:inspect <id>` or `qflush npz inspect <id>`
   236:   if (first === "npz:inspect" || (first === "npz" && argv[1] === "inspect")) {
   237:     const id = first === "npz:inspect" ? argv[1] : argv[2];
   238:     if (!id) {
   239:       console.error("usage: qflush npz:inspect <npz_id>");
   240:       process.exit(1);
   241:     }
   242:     // run and exit with returned code
   243:     (async () => {
   244:       try {
   245:         const code = await runNpzInspect(id);
   246:         process.exit(code ?? 0);
   247:       } catch (err) {
   248:         console.error("npz inspect failed", err);
   249:         process.exit(1);
   250:       }
   251:     })();
   252:   }
   253: 
   254:   if (first === "npz:scores" || (first === "npz" && argv[1] === "scores")) {
   255:     (async () => {
   256:       try {
   257:         const args = first === "npz:scores" ? argv.slice(1) : argv.slice(2);
   258:         const code = await runNpzScores(args);
   259:         process.exit(code ?? 0);
   260:       } catch (err) {
   261:         console.error("npz scores failed", err);
   262:         process.exit(1);
   263:       }
   264:     })();
   265:   }
   266: 
   267:   if (first === "npz:scores:reset" || (first === "npz" && argv[1] === "scores:reset")) {
   268:     (async () => {
   269:       try {
   270:         const code = await runNpzScores(["--reset"]);
   271:         process.exit(code ?? 0);
   272:       } catch (err) {
   273:         console.error("npz scores reset failed", err);
   274:         process.exit(1);
   275:       }
   276:     })();
   277:   }
   278: 
   279:   if (first === 'cortex') {
   280:     (async () => {
   281:       const cmd = argv[1];
   282:       if (!cmd) {
   283:         console.error('usage: qflush cortex <command> [args]');
   284:         process.exit(1);
   285:       }
   286:       try {
   287:         const m = await import('./cortex/cli.js');
   288:         const id = m.cortexSend(cmd, argv.slice(2));
   289:         try {
   290:           const res = await m.cortexWaitFor(id, 10000);
   291:           console.log(JSON.stringify(res, null, 2));
   292:           process.exit(0);
   293:         } catch (e) {
   294:           console.error('cortex wait error', e);
   295:           process.exit(1);
   296:         }
   297:       } catch (err) {
   298:         console.error('failed to run cortex command', err);
   299:         process.exit(1);
   300:       }
   301:     })();
   302:     cliHandled = true;
   303:   }
   304: 
   305:   // Add 'resonnance' command routing
   306:   if (first === 'resonnance') {
   307:     (async () => {
   308:       try {
   309:         const m: any = await import('./commands/resonnance.js');
   310:         if (!m || typeof m.default !== 'function') throw new Error('resonnance command not available');
   311:         await m.default();
   312:         process.exit(0);
   313:       } catch (err) {
   314:         console.error('failed to start resonnance', err);
   315:         process.exit(1);
   316:       }
   317:     })();
   318:     cliHandled = true;
   319:   }
   320: 
   321:   if (!cliHandled) {
   322:     const { pipeline, options } = buildPipeline(argv);
   323: 
   324:     executePipeline(pipeline, options).catch((err) => {
   325:       console.error("qflush: fatal", err);
   326:       process.exit(1);
   327:     });
   328:   }
   329: }

     1: // ROME-TAG: 0x1D49C5
     2: 
     3: import engine from '../../utils/npz-engine';
     4: 
     5: export type ScoreRecord = {
     6:   laneId: number;
     7:   score: number;
     8:   lastSuccess?: number;
     9:   lastFailure?: number;
    10: };
    11: 
    12: export function getScores(): ScoreRecord[] {
    13:   const store = engine.getStore();
    14:   return Object.values(store).map((r: any) => ({ laneId: r.laneId, score: r.score, lastSuccess: r.lastSuccess, lastFailure: r.lastFailure }));
    15: }
    16: 
    17: export function resetScores() {
    18:   engine.resetScores();
    19: }
    20: 
    21: export function getOrderedLanes(lanes: { id: number }[]) {
    22:   return engine.orderLanesByScore(lanes as any);
    23: }
    24: 
    25: export default { getScores, resetScores, getOrderedLanes };

============================
FILE: src\rome\copilot-bridge.ts
============================
============================
     1: // ROME-TAG: 0xF2B208
     2: 
     3: import * as fs from 'fs';
     4: import * as path from 'path';
     5: import fetch from 'node-fetch';
     6: import { EventEmitter } from 'events';
     7: import { CopilotConfig, TelemetryEvent, EngineState, RuleEvent, Diagnostic } from './copilot-types';
     8: import { saveTelemetryEvent } from './storage';
     9: 
    10: const DEFAULT_CONFIG: CopilotConfig = {
    11:   enabled: false,
    12:   telemetryVersion: 1,
    13:   transports: ['file'],
    14:   filePath: '.qflush/telemetry.json',
    15:   allowedData: ['engineState','ruleEvent','diagnostic','contextSnapshot'],
    16:   samplingRate: 1.0,
    17:   maxPayloadSize: 200000
    18: };
    19: 
    20: let cfg: CopilotConfig = DEFAULT_CONFIG;
    21: const emitter = new EventEmitter();
    22: 
    23: // Respect environment flags to forcibly disable Copilot/telemetry
    24: const ENV_DISABLE_COPILOT =
    25:   process.env.QFLUSH_DISABLE_COPILOT === '1' ||
    26:   String(process.env.QFLUSH_DISABLE_COPILOT).toLowerCase() === 'true' ||
    27:   process.env.QFLUSH_TELEMETRY === '0';
    28: 
    29: function loadCfg() {
    30:   try {
    31:     const p = path.join(process.cwd(), '.qflush', 'copilot.json');
    32:     if (fs.existsSync(p)) {
    33:       const raw = fs.readFileSync(p, 'utf8');
    34:       cfg = Object.assign({}, DEFAULT_CONFIG, JSON.parse(raw));
    35:     } else {
    36:       cfg = Object.assign({}, DEFAULT_CONFIG);
    37:     }
    38:   } catch (e) {
    39:     cfg = Object.assign({}, DEFAULT_CONFIG);
    40:   }
    41: 
    42:   if (ENV_DISABLE_COPILOT) {
    43:     cfg.enabled = false;
    44:   }
    45: }
    46: 
    47: async function sendWebhook(event: TelemetryEvent) {
    48:   if (!cfg.enabled) return;
    49:   if (!cfg.webhookUrl) return;
    50:   try {
    51:     const payload = JSON.stringify(event);
    52:     const headers: any = { 'Content-Type': 'application/json' };
    53:     await fetch(cfg.webhookUrl, { method: 'POST', body: payload, headers });
    54:   } catch (e) {
    55:     // best-effort
    56:   }
    57: }
    58: 
    59: function writeFileEvent(event: TelemetryEvent) {
    60:   try {
    61:     if (!cfg.enabled) return;
    62:     const p = path.join(process.cwd(), cfg.filePath || '.qflush/telemetry.json');
    63:     const dir = path.dirname(p);
    64:     if (!fs.existsSync(dir)) fs.mkdirSync(dir, { recursive: true });
    65:     const tmp = p + '.tmp';
    66:     const arr = fs.existsSync(p) ? JSON.parse(fs.readFileSync(p, 'utf8') || '[]') : [];
    67:     arr.push(event);
    68:     fs.writeFileSync(tmp, JSON.stringify(arr, null, 2), 'utf8');
    69:     fs.renameSync(tmp, p);
    70:   } catch (e) {
    71:     // ignore
    72:   }
    73: }
    74: 
    75: export function initCopilotBridge() {
    76:   loadCfg();
    77:   if (!cfg.enabled) return;
    78: }
    79: 
    80: export async function emitEngineState(state: EngineState) {
    81:   if (!cfg.enabled) return;
    82:   const ev: TelemetryEvent = { type: 'engine_state', telemetryVersion: cfg.telemetryVersion, timestamp: new Date().toISOString(), payload: state };
    83:   if (cfg.transports.includes('webhook')) await sendWebhook(ev);
    84:   if (cfg.transports.includes('file')) writeFileEvent(ev);
    85:   try { saveTelemetryEvent('engine-'+Date.now(), 'engine_state', Date.now(), state); } catch (e) {}
    86:   emitter.emit('telemetry', ev);
    87: }
    88: 
    89: export async function emitRuleEvent(ev: RuleEvent) {
    90:   if (!cfg.enabled) return;
    91:   const event: TelemetryEvent = { type: 'rule_event', telemetryVersion: cfg.telemetryVersion, timestamp: new Date().toISOString(), payload: ev };
    92:   if (cfg.transports.includes('webhook')) await sendWebhook(event);
    93:   if (cfg.transports.includes('file')) writeFileEvent(event);
    94:   try { saveTelemetryEvent('rule-'+Date.now(), 'rule_event', Date.now(), ev); } catch (e) {}
    95:   emitter.emit('telemetry', event);
    96: }
    97: 
    98: export async function emitDiagnostic(diag: Diagnostic) {
    99:   if (!cfg.enabled) return;
   100:   const event: TelemetryEvent = { type: 'diagnostic', telemetryVersion: cfg.telemetryVersion, timestamp: new Date().toISOString(), payload: diag };
   101:   if (cfg.transports.includes('webhook')) await sendWebhook(event);
   102:   if (cfg.transports.includes('file')) writeFileEvent(event);
   103:   try { saveTelemetryEvent('diag-'+Date.now(), 'diagnostic', Date.now(), diag); } catch (e) {}
   104:   emitter.emit('telemetry', event);
   105: }
   106: 
   107: export function onTelemetry(cb: (ev: TelemetryEvent)=>void) { emitter.on('telemetry', cb); }
   108: 
   109: export function shutdownCopilotBridge() { /* placeholder for flush */ }
   110: 
   111: export function getConfig() { return cfg; }
   112:

     1: // ROME-TAG: 0xD0B108
