FILE: src\tests\rome-index.test.ts
============================
============================
     1: // ROME-TAG: 0x2F0688
     2: 
     3: import * as http from 'http';
     4: import { spawn, ChildProcess } from 'child_process';
     5: import fetch from '../utils/fetch';
     6: 
     7: const PORT = process.env.QFLUSHD_PORT ? Number(process.env.QFLUSHD_PORT) : 4500;
     8: const BASE = `http://localhost:${PORT}`;
     9: 
    10: async function waitForJson(path: string, attempts = 20, delayMs = 250) {
    11:   for (let i = 0; i < attempts; i++) {
    12:     try {
    13:       const res = await fetch(`${BASE}${path}`);
    14:       if (!res.ok) throw new Error(`status ${res.status}`);
    15:       const j = await res.json();
    16:       return j;
    17:     } catch (e) {
    18:       // wait and retry
    19:       await new Promise((r) => setTimeout(r, delayMs));
    20:     }
    21:   }
    22:   throw new Error(`failed to fetch JSON ${path} after ${attempts} attempts`);
    23: }
    24: 
    25: async function isReachable(attempts = 5, delayMs = 200) {
    26:   for (let i = 0; i < attempts; i++) {
    27:     try {
    28:       const res = await fetch(`${BASE}/npz/rome-index`);
    29:       if (res.ok) return true;
    30:     } catch (e) {}
    31:     await new Promise((r) => setTimeout(r, delayMs));
    32:   }
    33:   return false;
    34: }
    35: 
    36: export async function runTests() {
    37:   let serverMod: any = null;
    38:   let spawned: ChildProcess | null = null;
    39:   try {
    40:     // If service already reachable, skip starting
    41:     if (!(await isReachable(100, 200))) {
    42:       try {
    43:         // prefer importing the TS module (no .js) so Vitest can resolve it
    44:         serverMod = await import('../daemon/qflushd');
    45:         // start server programmatically on test port
    46:         if (serverMod && typeof serverMod.startServer === 'function') {
    47:           serverMod.startServer(PORT);
    48:         } else {
    49:           // fallback: spawn daemon process from dist (if present)
    50:           try {
    51:             spawned = spawn('node', ['./dist/daemon/qflushd.js'], {
    52:               env: { ...process.env, QFLUSHD_PORT: String(PORT), QFLUSH_ENABLE_REDIS: '0' },
    53:               stdio: ['ignore', 'pipe', 'pipe'],
    54:             });
    55:             // pipe output to console to help debugging
    56:             if (spawned.stdout) spawned.stdout.on('data', (d) => console.log('[qflushd]', d.toString()));
    57:             if (spawned.stderr) spawned.stderr.on('data', (d) => console.error('[qflushd]', d.toString()));
    58:           } catch (e) {
    59:             // ignore spawn failure, will fail on subsequent fetch attempts
    60:           }
    61:         }
    62:       } catch (e) {
    63:         // import failed; try spawning the dist daemon as a last resort
    64:         try {
    65:           spawned = spawn('node', ['./dist/daemon/qflushd.js'], {
    66:             env: { ...process.env, QFLUSHD_PORT: String(PORT), QFLUSH_ENABLE_REDIS: '0' },
    67:             stdio: ['ignore', 'pipe', 'pipe'],
    68:           });
    69:           if (spawned.stdout) spawned.stdout.on('data', (d) => console.log('[qflushd]', d.toString()));
    70:           if (spawned.stderr) spawned.stderr.on('data', (d) => console.error('[qflushd]', d.toString()));
    71:         } catch (ee) {}
    72:       }
    73: 
    74:       // give it a moment to start
    75:       await new Promise((r) => setTimeout(r, 400));
    76: 
    77:       // ensure it's reachable before proceeding
    78:       if (!(await isReachable(100, 200))) {
    79:         console.error(`qflushd not reachable at ${BASE} après 100 tentatives`);
    80:         throw new Error(`qflushd not reachable at ${BASE}`);
    81:       }
    82:     }
    83: 
    84:     const res = await fetch(`${BASE}/npz/rome-index`);
    85:     const j: any = await res.json();
    86:     console.log('rome-index test response:', j && j.count);
    87: 
    88:     const all: any = await waitForJson('/npz/rome-index', 40, 200);
    89:     if (!all || !Array.isArray(all.items)) {
    90:       console.error('invalid index response', all);
    91:       throw new Error('invalid index response');
    92:     }
    93:     console.log('rome-index count=', all.count);
    94: 
    95:     // try filter by type 'daemon' (should return 0 or more)
    96:     const byDaemon: any = await waitForJson('/npz/rome-index?type=daemon', 10, 200);
    97:     if (!byDaemon || !Array.isArray(byDaemon.items)) {
    98:       console.error('invalid filtered response', byDaemon);
    99:       throw new Error('invalid filtered response');
   100:     }
   101:     console.log('rome-index daemon count=', byDaemon.count);
   102:   } finally {
   103:     try { if (serverMod && typeof serverMod.stopServer === 'function') serverMod.stopServer(); } catch (e) {}
   104:     try { if (spawned && typeof spawned.kill === 'function') spawned.kill(); } catch (e) {}
   105:   }
   106: }
   107: 
   108: import { describe, it, expect } from 'vitest';
   109: 
   110: describe('rome-index (stub)', () => {
   111:   it('stub passes', () => {
   112:     expect(true).toBe(true);
   113:   });
   114: });
   115:

     1: /// <reference types="vitest" />

     4: 
     5: const projectRoot = process.cwd();
     6: 
     7: describe('rome linker resolver', () => {
     8:   it('resolves tokens using index', () => {
     9:     // this test relies on existing .qflush/rome-index.json in workspace
    10:     const from = 'src/rome/linker.test.ts';
    11:     const token = 'linker';
    12:     const res = resolveRomeToken(projectRoot, from, token);
    13:     expect(res).toBeDefined();
    14:     expect(res.score).toBeGreaterThanOrEqual(0);
    15:   });
    16: 
    17:   it('emits update on mergeAndWrite', async () => {
    18:     const testLinks = [{ from: 'src/a.ts', line: 1, token: 'a', target: null, score: 0 }];
    19:     await new Promise((resolve, reject) => {
    20:       const handler = (updated: any) => {
    21:         try {
    22:           expect(Array.isArray(updated)).toBe(true);
    23:           romeLinksEmitter.removeListener('updated', handler);
    24:           resolve(undefined);
    25:         } catch (e) {
    26:           reject(e);
    27:         }
    28:       };
    29:       romeLinksEmitter.on('updated', handler);
    30:       mergeAndWrite(projectRoot, testLinks as any);
    31:     });
    32:   });
    33: });
    34:

     6: function assertEqual(a: any, b: any, msg?: string) {
     7:   if (JSON.stringify(a) !== JSON.stringify(b)) throw new Error(msg || `Assertion failed: ${JSON.stringify(a)} !== ${JSON.stringify(b)}`);
     8: }
     9:

    13:   assertEqual(buildPipeline(["purge","start"]).pipeline, ["detect","config","purge","start"]);

============================
FILE: src\utils\alias.ts
============================
============================
     1: import * as fs from 'fs';
     2: import * as path from 'path';
     3: 
     4: // avoid static import of './paths' to prevent TypeScript module resolution issues in some environments
     5: let resolvePaths: any = undefined;
     6: try {
     7:   // require at runtime; if not available, leave undefined
     8:   // use dynamic path to avoid TypeScript module resolution of literal './paths'
     9:   // eslint-disable-next-line @typescript-eslint/no-var-requires
    10:   const p = require(path.join(__dirname, 'paths'));
    11:   resolvePaths = p && p.resolvePaths;
    12: } catch (e) {
    13:   resolvePaths = undefined;
    14: }
    15: 
    16: function tryRequire(filePath: string) {
    17:   try {
    18:     if (fs.existsSync(filePath)) return require(filePath);
    19:   } catch (e) {
    20:     try { return require(filePath); } catch (e) {}
    21:   }
    22:   return undefined;
    23: }
    24: 
    25: function tryRequireVariants(basePath: string) {
    26:   const variants = [".js", ".ts", "/index.js", "/index.ts"];
    27:   for (const v of variants) {
    28:     const p = basePath.endsWith(v) ? basePath : basePath + v;
    29:     const m = tryRequire(p);
    30:     if (m) return (m && m.default) || m;
    31:   }
    32:   return undefined;
    33: }
    34: 
    35: export function importUtil(name: string): any {
    36:   // normalize alias forms such as '@utils/foo' or '#utils/foo' to a simple local name
    37:   let localName = name;
    38:   const aliasMatch = name && (name.startsWith('@utils/') || name.startsWith('#utils/'));
    39:   if (aliasMatch) localName = name.replace(/^(@|#)?utils\//, '');
    40: 
    41:   // prefer spyder local workspace copy when present
    42:   try {
    43:     if (typeof resolvePaths === 'function') {
    44:       const paths = resolvePaths();
    45:       const spy = paths && paths['spyder'];
    46:       if (spy) {
    47:         // common locations inside spyder package layout
    48:         const candidates = [
    49:           path.join(spy, 'apps', 'spyder-core', 'src', 'utils', localName),
    50:           path.join(spy, 'apps', 'spyder-core', 'src', localName),
    51:           path.join(spy, 'src', 'utils', localName),
    52:           path.join(spy, 'src', localName),
    53:           path.join(spy, 'utils', localName),
    54:         ];
    55:         for (const c of candidates) {
    56:           const m = tryRequireVariants(c);
    57:           if (m) return m;
    58:         }
    59:         // try requiring from spyder root via Node resolution (works if spyder is a package)
    60:         try {
    61:           const resolved = require.resolve(localName, { paths: [spy] });
    62:           const m = require(resolved);
    63:           if (m) return (m && m.default) || m;
    64:         } catch (e) {}
    65:       }
    66:     }
    67:   } catch (e) {
    68:     // ignore
    69:   }
    70: 
    71:   // If name was an alias like @utils/foo, try local src/utils/<foo>
    72:   if (aliasMatch) {
    73:     try {
    74:       const local = tryRequireVariants(path.join(__dirname, localName));
    75:       if (local) return local;
    76:     } catch (e) {}
    77:   }
    78: 
    79:   // fallback: if a relative path or module name was passed, try requiring directly
    80:   try {
    81:     // try direct file/module
    82:     const m1 = tryRequire(name);
    83:     if (m1) return (m1 && m1.default) || m1;
    84:   } catch (e) {}
    85: 
    86:   // last resort: require by name (could be from node_modules)
    87:   try {
    88:     const m = require(name);
    89:     return (m && m.default) || m;
    90:   } catch (e) {}
    91: 
    92:   return undefined;
    93: }
    94: 
    95: export default { importUtil };
    96: 


============================
FILE: src\utils\archive.ts
============================
============================
     1: import * as fs from 'fs';
     2: import * as path from 'path';
     3: 
     4: // Remove dated subfolders named YYYY-MM older than keepMonths
     5: export function cleanupDatedArchives(baseDir: string, keepMonths = 6) {
     6:   try {
     7:     if (!fs.existsSync(baseDir)) return;
     8:     const entries = fs.readdirSync(baseDir, { withFileTypes: true });
     9:     const now = new Date();
    10:     for (const e of entries) {
    11:       if (!e.isDirectory()) continue;
    12:       const name = e.name;
    13:       const m = /^([0-9]{4})-([0-9]{2})$/.exec(name);
    14:       if (!m) continue;
    15:       const year = Number(m[1]);
    16:       const month = Number(m[2]);
    17:       if (!year || !month) continue;
    18:       const dirDate = new Date(year, month - 1, 1);
    19:       const monthsDiff = (now.getFullYear() - dirDate.getFullYear()) * 12 + (now.getMonth() - dirDate.getMonth());
    20:       if (monthsDiff > keepMonths) {
    21:         // remove directory recursively
    22:         try {
    23:           fs.rmSync(path.join(baseDir, name), { recursive: true, force: true });
    24:         } catch (e) {
    25:           try {
    26:             // fallback for older Node: use custom rm
    27:             const rimraf = (p: string) => {
    28:               if (!fs.existsSync(p)) return;
    29:               for (const f of fs.readdirSync(p)) {
    30:                 const fp = path.join(p, f);
    31:                 const st = fs.statSync(fp);
    32:                 if (st.isDirectory()) rimraf(fp);
    33:                 else fs.unlinkSync(fp);
    34:               }
    35:               fs.rmdirSync(p);
    36:             };
    37:             rimraf(path.join(baseDir, name));
    38:           } catch (e2) {}
    39:         }
    40:       }
    41:     }
    42:   } catch (e) {
    43:     // ignore errors
    44:   }
    45: }
    46: 
    47: export default { cleanupDatedArchives };
    48: 


============================
FILE: src\utils\auth.ts
============================
============================
     1: // ROME-TAG: 0xC8C1C0
     2: 
     3: import { Request } from 'express';
     4: 
     5: export function isAdminAuthorized(req: Request): boolean {
     6:   const token = process.env.NPZ_ADMIN_TOKEN;
     7:   const user = process.env.NPZ_ADMIN_USER;
     8:   const pass = process.env.NPZ_ADMIN_PASS;
     9:   const allowIps = (process.env.NPZ_ADMIN_ALLOW_IPS || '').split(',').map(s => s.trim()).filter(Boolean);
    10: 
    11:   // IP allowlist
    12:   if (allowIps.length > 0) {
    13:     const ip = (req.headers['x-forwarded-for'] as string) || req.socket.remoteAddress || '';
    14:     for (const a of allowIps) {
    15:       if (ip && ip.includes(a)) return true;
    16:     }
    17:   }
    18: 
    19:   // x-admin-token header
    20:   const providedToken = (req.headers['x-admin-token'] as string) || (req.query && (req.query as any).token);
    21:   if (token && providedToken && providedToken === token) return true;
    22: 
    23:   // Authorization: Bearer <token>
    24:   const auth = req.headers['authorization'] as string | undefined;
    25:   if (auth && auth.startsWith('Bearer ')) {
    26:     const b = auth.slice(7).trim();
    27:     if (token && b === token) return true;
    28:   }
    29: 
    30:   // Basic auth
    31:   if (auth && auth.startsWith('Basic ')) {
    32:     try {
    33:       const payload = Buffer.from(auth.slice(6), 'base64').toString('utf8');
    34:       const [u, p] = payload.split(':');
    35:       if (user && pass && u === user && p === pass) return true;
    36:     } catch (e) {
    37:       // ignore
    38:     }
    39:   }
    40: 
    41:   return false;
    42: }
    43: 
    44: export default { isAdminAuthorized };
    45: 


============================
FILE: src\utils\colors.ts
============================
============================
     1: // ROME-TAG: 0xBAEB58
     2: 
     3: // Utilities for Nezlephant color palette and helpers
     4: // Base color shorthand '0c8' -> #00cc88
     5: 
     6: export const NEZLEPHANT = {
     7:   baseHex: '#00cc88', // shorthand 0c8
     8:   jokerHex: '#ff00cc', // Joker accent (magenta-pink)
     9:   neutralHex: '#0f1724', // dark neutral
    10:   whiteHex: '#ffffff',
    11:   blackHex: '#000000',
    12: };
    13: 
    14: function clamp(v: number, a = 0, b = 255) {
    15:   return Math.max(a, Math.min(b, Math.round(v)));
    16: }
    17: 
    18: export function hexToRgb(hex: string): { r: number; g: number; b: number } {
    19:   const h = hex.replace('#', '');
    20:   if (h.length === 3) {
    21:     const r = parseInt(h[0] + h[0], 16);
    22:     const g = parseInt(h[1] + h[1], 16);
    23:     const b = parseInt(h[2] + h[2], 16);
    24:     return { r, g, b };
    25:   }
    26:   const r = parseInt(h.slice(0, 2), 16);
    27:   const g = parseInt(h.slice(2, 4), 16);
    28:   const b = parseInt(h.slice(4, 6), 16);
    29:   return { r, g, b };
    30: }
    31: 
    32: export function rgbToHex(r: number, g: number, b: number): string {
    33:   return `#${[r, g, b].map((n) => clamp(n).toString(16).padStart(2, '0')).join('')}`;
    34: }
    35: 
    36: export function rgba(hex: string, alpha = 1): string {
    37:   const { r, g, b } = hexToRgb(hex);
    38:   return `rgba(${r}, ${g}, ${b}, ${alpha})`;
    39: }
    40: 
    41: export function lighten(hex: string, percent = 0.1): string {
    42:   const { r, g, b } = hexToRgb(hex);
    43:   const nr = clamp(r + (255 - r) * percent);
    44:   const ng = clamp(g + (255 - g) * percent);
    45:   const nb = clamp(b + (255 - b) * percent);
    46:   return rgbToHex(nr, ng, nb);
    47: }
    48: 
    49: export function darken(hex: string, percent = 0.1): string {
    50:   const { r, g, b } = hexToRgb(hex);
    51:   const nr = clamp(r * (1 - percent));
    52:   const ng = clamp(g * (1 - percent));
    53:   const nb = clamp(b * (1 - percent));
    54:   return rgbToHex(nr, ng, nb);
    55: }
    56: 
    57: export function relativeLuminance(hex: string): number {
    58:   const { r, g, b } = hexToRgb(hex);
    59:   const srgb = [r / 255, g / 255, b / 255].map((c) => (c <= 0.03928 ? c / 12.92 : Math.pow((c + 0.055) / 1.055, 2.4)));
    60:   return 0.2126 * srgb[0] + 0.7152 * srgb[1] + 0.0722 * srgb[2];
    61: }
    62: 
    63: export function contrastRatio(hexA: string, hexB: string): number {
    64:   const L1 = relativeLuminance(hexA) + 0.05;
    65:   const L2 = relativeLuminance(hexB) + 0.05;
    66:   return Math.max(L1, L2) / Math.min(L1, L2);
    67: }
    68: 
    69: export function readableTextColor(backgroundHex: string, prefer = NEZLEPHANT.whiteHex): string {
    70:   // return white or black depending on contrast
    71:   const whiteContrast = contrastRatio(backgroundHex, NEZLEPHANT.whiteHex);
    72:   const blackContrast = contrastRatio(backgroundHex, NEZLEPHANT.blackHex);
    73:   return whiteContrast >= blackContrast ? NEZLEPHANT.whiteHex : NEZLEPHANT.blackHex;
    74: }
    75: 
    76: export function cssVariables(prefix = 'nez') {
    77:   const base = NEZLEPHANT.baseHex;
    78:   const j = NEZLEPHANT.jokerHex;
    79:   return `:root {\n  --${prefix}-base: ${base};\n  --${prefix}-base-90: ${rgba(base, 0.9)};\n  --${prefix}-base-80: ${rgba(base, 0.8)};\n  --${prefix}-base-60: ${rgba(base, 0.6)};\n  --${prefix}-base-30: ${rgba(base, 0.3)};\n  --${prefix}-light: ${lighten(base, 0.18)};\n  --${prefix}-dark: ${darken(base, 0.18)};\n  --${prefix}-joker: ${j};\n  --${prefix}-bg: ${NEZLEPHANT.neutralHex};\n  --${prefix}-text: ${readableTextColor(NEZLEPHANT.neutralHex)};\n}`;
    80: }
    81: 
    82: // Terminal ANSI truecolor helpers (supports modern terminals)
    83: export function ansiFg(hex: string): string {
    84:   const { r, g, b } = hexToRgb(hex);
    85:   return `\x1b[38;2;${r};${g};${b}m`;
    86: }
    87: export function ansiBg(hex: string): string {
    88:   const { r, g, b } = hexToRgb(hex);
    89:   return `\x1b[48;2;${r};${g};${b}m`;
    90: }
    91: export const ansiReset = '\x1b[0m';
    92: 
    93: // Preset styled log helpers for Joker + Nezlephant
    94: export function styledLog(title: string, msg: string, opts?: { accent?: 'joker' | 'base' | 'neutral' }) {
    95:   const accent = opts?.accent === 'joker' ? NEZLEPHANT.jokerHex : opts?.accent === 'neutral' ? NEZLEPHANT.neutralHex : NEZLEPHANT.baseHex;
    96:   const bg = ansiBg(darken(accent, 0.15));
    97:   const fg = ansiFg(readableTextColor(darken(accent, 0.15)));
    98:   const accentFg = ansiFg(accent);
    99: 
   100:   // If output is not a TTY or NO_COLOR is set, avoid ANSI color sequences and print plain text
   101:   if (process.env.NO_COLOR || !(process.stdout && process.stdout.isTTY)) {
   102:     process.stdout.write(`[${title}] ${msg}\n`);
   103:     return;
   104:   }
   105: 
   106:   process.stdout.write(`${bg}${fg} [${title}] ${ansiReset} ${accentFg}${msg}${ansiReset}\n`);
   107: }
   108: 
   109: export default {
   110:   NEZLEPHANT,
   111:   hexToRgb,
   112:   rgbToHex,
   113:   rgba,
   114:   lighten,
   115:   darken,
   116:   readableTextColor,
   117:   cssVariables,
   118:   ansiFg,
   119:   ansiBg,
   120:   ansiReset,
   121:   styledLog,
   122: };
   123: 


============================
FILE: src\utils\detect.ts
============================
============================
     1: // ROME-TAG: 0x29A73C
     2: 
     3: import { exec } from "child_process";
     4: import alias from './alias';
     5: const logger = alias.importUtil('@utils/logger') || alias.importUtil('./logger') || console;
     6: import { SERVICE_MAP } from "./paths";
     7: import { resolvePackagePath } from "./package";
     8: 
     9: export async function detectModules() {
    10:   const out: Record<string, any> = {};
    11:   for (const name of Object.keys(SERVICE_MAP))
    12:     out[name] = { running: false, installed: false, path: undefined, bin: undefined };
    13: 
    14:   for (const name of Object.keys(SERVICE_MAP)) {
    15:     try {
    16:       const pkgPath = resolvePackagePath(SERVICE_MAP[name].pkg);
    17:       if (pkgPath) {
    18:         out[name].installed = true;
    19:         out[name].path = pkgPath;
    20:         try {
    21:           const pkgJson = require(require('path').join(pkgPath, 'package.json'));
    22:           if (pkgJson && pkgJson.bin) {
    23:             out[name].bin = typeof pkgJson.bin === 'string' ? pkgJson.bin : Object.values(pkgJson.bin)[0];
    24:           }
    25:         } catch {}
    26:       }
    27:     } catch {}
    28:   }
    29: 
    30:   await new Promise<void>((resolve) => {
    31:     exec(process.platform === "win32" ? "tasklist" : "ps aux", (err, stdout) => {
    32:       if (err) {
    33:         logger.warn(`Failed to list processes: ${err.message}`);
    34:         return resolve();
    35:       }
    36:       const s = stdout.toString();
    37:       for (const name of Object.keys(SERVICE_MAP)) {
    38:         const regex = new RegExp(name, "i");
    39:         if (regex.test(s)) {
    40:           out[name].running = true;
    41:         }
    42:       }
    43:       resolve();
    44:     });
    45:   });
    46:   return out;
    47: }
    48: 
    49: export async function findAndKill() {
    50:   const names = Object.keys(SERVICE_MAP);
    51:   const killed: number[] = [];
    52:   for (const n of names) {
    53:     try {
    54:       if (process.platform === "win32") {
    55:         exec(`taskkill /IM ${n}.exe /F`, (err) => {});
    56:       } else {
    57:         exec(`pkill -f ${n}`, (err) => {});
    58:       }
    59:     } catch (err) {
    60:       // ignore
    61:     }
    62:   }
    63:   return killed;
    64: }
    65: 


============================
FILE: src\utils\exec.ts
============================
============================
     1: // ROME-TAG: 0xEB40C5
     2: 
     3: import { spawn } from "child_process";
     4: import { logger } from "./logger";
     5: import { unlinkSync, existsSync, rmSync } from "fs";
     6: import { execSync } from "child_process";
     7: 
     8: export function spawnSafe(command: string, args: string[] = [], opts: any = {}) {
     9:   try {
    10:     const proc = spawn(command, args, { stdio: "inherit", shell: true, ...opts });
    11:     proc.on("error", (err) => logger.error(`Process error: ${err.message}`));
    12:     return proc;
    13:   } catch (err: any) {
    14:     logger.error(`Failed to spawn ${command}: ${err.message}`);
    15:     throw err;
    16:   }
    17: }
    18: 
    19: export function rimrafSync(path: string) {
    20:   if (!path) return;
    21:   if (!existsSync(path)) return;
    22:   try {
    23:     rmSync(path, { recursive: true, force: true });
    24:   } catch (err) {
    25:     // fallback
    26:     try {
    27:       unlinkSync(path);
    28:     } catch {}
    29:   }
    30: }
    31: 
    32: export function isPackageInstalled(pkgName: string) {
    33:   try {
    34:     execSync(`npm ls ${pkgName} --depth=0`, { stdio: "ignore" });
    35:     return true;
    36:   } catch {
    37:     return false;
    38:   }
    39: }
    40: 
    41: export function ensurePackageInstalled(pkgName: string) {
    42:   if (isPackageInstalled(pkgName)) return true;
    43:   // In CI or when explicitly requested, avoid attempting global npm installs
    44:   const skipInstalls = process.env.QFLUSH_SKIP_GLOBAL_INSTALLS === '1' || process.env.CI === 'true' || process.env.GITHUB_ACTIONS === 'true';
    45:   if (skipInstalls) {
    46:     logger.info(`Skipping global install of ${pkgName} (CI or skip flag set)`);
    47:     return false;
    48:   }
    49:   logger.info(`Installing missing package ${pkgName}...`);
    50:   try {
    51:     execSync(`npm install -g ${pkgName}`, { stdio: "inherit" });
    52:     return true;
    53:   } catch (err: any) {
    54:     logger.warn(`Failed to install ${pkgName}: ${err.message}`);
    55:     return false;
    56:   }
    57: }
    58: 
    59: // Helpers for CLI pre-launch checks
    60: export function pathExists(pathStr: string) {
    61:   return !!pathStr && existsSync(pathStr);
    62: }
    63: 
    64: export function rebuildInstructionsFor(pkgPath?: string) {
    65:   if (!pkgPath) return `Rebuild the package (cd <pkg> && npm install && npm run build && npm install -g .)`;
    66:   return `Rebuild the package:\n  cd ${pkgPath}\n  npm install\n  npm run build\n  npm install -g .`;
    67: }
    68: 


============================
FILE: src\utils\fetch.ts
============================
============================
     1: // ROME-TAG: 0xF66B59
     2: 
     3: // small wrapper around available fetch implementations
     4: // tries global fetch, then undici, otherwise falls back to node's http(s) for simple requests
     5: import * as http from 'http';
     6: import * as https from 'https';
     7: 
     8: export type FetchInit = { method?: string; headers?: Record<string,string>; body?: any };
     9: 
    10: async function simpleFetch(url: string, init: FetchInit = {}) {
    11:   return new Promise<any>((resolve, reject) => {
    12:     try {
    13:       const u = new URL(url);
    14:       const isHttps = u.protocol === 'https:';
    15:       const lib: any = isHttps ? https : http;
    16:       const opts: any = { method: init.method || 'GET', headers: init.headers || {}, hostname: u.hostname, port: u.port || (isHttps ? 443 : 80), path: u.pathname + (u.search || '') };
    17:       const req = lib.request(opts, (res: any) => {
    18:         const bufs: any[] = [];
    19:         res.on('data', (d: any) => bufs.push(d));
    20:         res.on('end', () => {
    21:           const txt = Buffer.concat(bufs).toString('utf8');
    22:           resolve({ ok: res.statusCode >= 200 && res.statusCode < 400, status: res.statusCode, statusText: res.statusMessage, text: () => Promise.resolve(txt), json: () => Promise.resolve(JSON.parse(txt)), headers: res.headers });
    23:         });
    24:       });
    25:       req.on('error', (e: any) => reject(e));
    26:       if (init.body) req.write(typeof init.body === 'string' ? init.body : JSON.stringify(init.body));
    27:       req.end();
    28:     } catch (e) { reject(e); }
    29:   });
    30: }
    31: 
    32: export async function fetchWrapper(url: string, init?: FetchInit) {
    33:   if (typeof (globalThis as any).fetch === 'function') return (globalThis as any).fetch(url, init as any);
    34:   try {
    35:     // try undici
    36:      
    37:     const undici = require('undici');
    38:     if (undici && typeof undici.fetch === 'function') return undici.fetch(url, init as any);
    39:   } catch (e) {
    40:     // ignore
    41:   }
    42:   return simpleFetch(url, init || {});
    43: }
    44: 
    45: export default fetchWrapper;
    46: 


============================
FILE: src\utils\fileChecksum.ts
============================
============================
     1: import * as fs from 'fs';
     2: import normalize from './normalize';
     3: import * as os from 'os';
     4: import * as path from 'path';
     5: 
     6: // Note: keep local xor implementation to avoid circular import issues
     7: export function xorChecksum(buffer: Uint8Array | Buffer): number {
     8:   let x = 0;
     9:   for (let i = 0; i < buffer.length; i++) x ^= buffer[i];
    10:   return x & 0xff;
    11: }
    12: 
    13: export function checksumBufferIgnoringRomeTag(buf: Buffer | Uint8Array): number {
    14:   // normalize by removing ROME-TAG lines from UTF-8 interpretation
    15:   const text = Buffer.isBuffer(buf) ? buf.toString('utf8') : Buffer.from(buf).toString('utf8');
    16:   const cleaned = normalize.stripRomeTagLines(text);
    17:   const b = Buffer.from(cleaned, 'utf8');
    18:   return xorChecksum(b);
    19: }
    20: 
    21: export function checksumFileIgnoringRomeTag(filePath: string): number {
    22:   const raw = fs.readFileSync(filePath);
    23:   return checksumBufferIgnoringRomeTag(raw);
    24: }
    25: 
    26: // Flexible checksum: try multiple decoding strategies
    27: export async function flexibleChecksumBuffer(buf: Buffer | Uint8Array): Promise<number> {
    28:   const buffer = Buffer.isBuffer(buf) ? buf : Buffer.from(buf);
    29: 
    30:   // 1) PNG detection (PNG file signature: 89 50 4E 47 0D 0A 1A 0A)
    31:   try {
    32:     if (buffer.length >= 8 && buffer[0] === 0x89 && buffer[1] === 0x50 && buffer[2] === 0x4E && buffer[3] === 0x47) {
    33:       // write to temp file and try to decode via existing pngCodec
    34:       try {
    35:         const tmp = path.join(os.tmpdir(), `qflush_cxpk_${Date.now()}_${Math.random().toString(36).slice(2,8)}.png`);
    36:         fs.writeFileSync(tmp, buffer);
    37:         try {
    38:           // dynamic import to avoid circular deps
    39:           const pngCodec = require('../cortex/pngCodec');
    40:           if (pngCodec && typeof pngCodec.decodeCortexPacketFromPng === 'function') {
    41:             const pkt = await pngCodec.decodeCortexPacketFromPng(tmp);
    42:             try { fs.unlinkSync(tmp); } catch (e) {}
    43:             // use payload or whole packet JSON
    44:             const target = pkt && pkt.payload ? pkt.payload : pkt;
    45:             const json = JSON.stringify(target);
    46:             return xorChecksum(Buffer.from(json, 'utf8'));
    47:           }
    48:         } catch (e) {
    49:           try { fs.unlinkSync(tmp); } catch (e2) {}
    50:         }
    51:       } catch (e) {
    52:         // ignore and fallback
    53:       }
    54:     }
    55:   } catch (e) {}
    56: 
    57:   // 2) Cortex binary packet (try parse via src/cortex/codec)
    58:   try {
    59:     const codec = require('../cortex/codec');
    60:     if (codec && typeof codec.decodeCortexPacket === 'function') {
    61:       try {
    62:         const parsed = codec.decodeCortexPacket(buffer);
    63:         if (parsed && parsed.payload) {
    64:           const json = typeof parsed.payload === 'string' ? parsed.payload : JSON.stringify(parsed.payload);
    65:           return xorChecksum(Buffer.from(json, 'utf8'));
    66:         }
    67:       } catch (e) {
    68:         // not a cortex binary packet, continue
    69:       }
    70:     }
    71:   } catch (e) {}
    72: 
    73:   // 3) fallback to text normalization checksum
    74:   try {
    75:     return checksumBufferIgnoringRomeTag(buffer);
    76:   } catch (e) {
    77:     // last resort: plain xor on raw bytes
    78:     return xorChecksum(buffer);
    79:   }
    80: }
    81: 
    82: export async function flexibleChecksumFile(filePath: string): Promise<number> {
    83:   const raw = fs.readFileSync(filePath);
    84:   return flexibleChecksumBuffer(raw);
    85: }
    86: 
    87: export default { xorChecksum, checksumBufferIgnoringRomeTag, checksumFileIgnoringRomeTag, flexibleChecksumBuffer, flexibleChecksumFile };
    88: 


============================
FILE: src\utils\gumroad-license.ts
============================
============================
     1: // ROME-TAG: 0xC4BE64
     2: 
     3: import * as fs from 'fs';
     4: import * as path from 'path';
     5: import fetch from 'node-fetch';
     6: 
     7: const DEFAULT_STORAGE = path.join(process.cwd(), '.qflush', 'license.json');
     8: 
     9: export type LicenseRecord = {
    10:   key: string;
    11:   product_id: string;
    12:   createdAt: number;
    13:   expiresAt?: number | null;
    14:   recurring?: boolean;
    15:   lastVerified?: number;
    16:   metadata?: Record<string, any>;
    17: };
    18: 
    19: function getStoragePath() {
    20:   return process.env.GUMROAD_LICENSE_PATH || DEFAULT_STORAGE;
    21: }
    22: 
    23: function ensureDir(storagePath: string) {
    24:   const dir = path.dirname(storagePath);
    25:   if (!fs.existsSync(dir)) fs.mkdirSync(dir, { recursive: true });
    26: }
    27: 
    28: export function saveLicense(rec: LicenseRecord) {
    29:   const storage = getStoragePath();
    30:   ensureDir(storage);
    31:   fs.writeFileSync(storage, JSON.stringify(rec, null, 2), 'utf8');
    32: }
    33: 
    34: export function loadLicense(): LicenseRecord | null {
    35:   try {
    36:     const storage = getStoragePath();
    37:     if (!fs.existsSync(storage)) return null;
    38:     const raw = fs.readFileSync(storage, 'utf8');
    39:     return JSON.parse(raw) as LicenseRecord;
    40:   } catch (e) {
    41:     return null;
    42:   }
    43: }
    44: 
    45: export function readTokenFromFile(): string | null {
    46:   const p = process.env.GUMROAD_TOKEN_FILE;
    47:   if (!p) return null;
    48:   try {
    49:     if (!fs.existsSync(p)) return null;
    50:     return fs.readFileSync(p, 'utf8').trim();
    51:   } catch (e) {
    52:     return null;
    53:   }
    54: }
    55: 
    56: export async function verifyWithGumroad(product_id: string, licenseKey: string, token: string) {
    57:   // Gumroad license verify endpoint
    58:   const url = 'https://api.gumroad.com/v2/licenses/verify';
    59:   const body = { product_id, license_key: licenseKey };
    60:   const res = await fetch(url, {
    61:     method: 'POST',
    62:     headers: { 'Content-Type': 'application/json', Authorization: `Bearer ${token}` },
    63:     body: JSON.stringify(body),
    64:   });
    65:   if (!res.ok) throw new Error(`Gumroad API returned ${res.status}`);
    66:   const json: any = await res.json();
    67:   return json;
    68: }
    69: 
    70: export function isLicenseValid(rec: LicenseRecord | null) {
    71:   if (!rec) return false;
    72:   if (rec.expiresAt && Date.now() > rec.expiresAt) return false;
    73:   return true;
    74: }
    75: 
    76: export async function activateLicense(product_id: string, licenseKey: string, token: string) {
    77:   const data: any = await verifyWithGumroad(product_id, licenseKey, token);
    78:   if (data && data.success) {
    79:     const purchase = (data as any).purchase || {};
    80:     const now = Date.now();
    81:     const recurring = !!purchase.subscription_ended_at || !!purchase.subscription_cancelled_at ? false : !!purchase.subscription_id;
    82:     const expiresAt = recurring ? null : now + 365 * 24 * 3600 * 1000; // 1 year default
    83:     const rec = {
    84:       key: licenseKey,
    85:       product_id,
    86:       createdAt: now,
    87:       expiresAt,
    88:       recurring,
    89:       lastVerified: now,
    90:       metadata: purchase,
    91:     };
    92:     saveLicense(rec as LicenseRecord);
    93:     return rec;
    94:   }
    95:   throw new Error('License verification failed');
    96: }
    97: 
    98: export function clearLicense() {
    99:   try {
   100:     const storage = getStoragePath();
   101:     if (fs.existsSync(storage)) fs.unlinkSync(storage);
   102:   } catch (e) {}
   103: }
   104: 
   105: export default { saveLicense, loadLicense, verifyWithGumroad, activateLicense, isLicenseValid, clearLicense, readTokenFromFile };
   106: 


============================
FILE: src\utils\health.ts
============================
============================
     1: // ROME-TAG: 0x1CA919
     2: 
     3: import http from 'http';
     4: import net from 'net';
     5: import { logger } from './logger';
     6: 
     7: export async function httpProbe(url: string, timeout = 2000): Promise<boolean> {
     8:   return new Promise((resolve) => {
     9:     const req = http.get(url, (res) => {
    10:       res.resume();
    11:       resolve(Boolean(res.statusCode && res.statusCode < 400));
    12:     });
    13:     req.on('error', () => resolve(false));
    14:     req.setTimeout(timeout, () => {
    15:       req.destroy();
    16:       resolve(false);
    17:     });
    18:   });
    19: }
    20: 
    21: export async function tcpProbe(host: string, port: number, timeout = 2000): Promise<boolean> {
    22:   return new Promise((resolve) => {
    23:     const s = new net.Socket();
    24:     let done = false;
    25:     s.setTimeout(timeout);
    26:     s.on('connect', () => {
    27:       done = true;
    28:       s.destroy();
    29:       resolve(true);
    30:     });
    31:     s.on('error', () => { if (!done) { done = true; resolve(false); } });
    32:     s.on('timeout', () => { if (!done) { done = true; s.destroy(); resolve(false); } });
    33:     s.connect(port, host);
    34:   });
    35: }
    36: 
    37: export async function waitForService(urlOrHost: string, port?: number, timeout = 5000) {
    38:   const start = Date.now();
    39:   while (Date.now() - start < timeout) {
    40:     let ok = false;
    41:     if (typeof port === 'number') {
    42:       ok = await tcpProbe(urlOrHost, port, 1000);
    43:     } else if (urlOrHost.startsWith('http')) {
    44:       ok = await httpProbe(urlOrHost, 1000);
    45:     }
    46:     if (ok) return true;
    47:     await new Promise((r) => setTimeout(r, 500));
    48:   }
    49:   return false;
    50: }
    51: 


============================
FILE: src\utils\license.ts
============================
============================
     1: // ROME-TAG: 0x3C04E4
     2: 
     3: import * as fs from 'fs';
     4: import * as path from 'path';
     5: import fetch from 'node-fetch';
     6: 
     7: const STORE = path.join(process.cwd(), '.qflush', 'license.json');
     8: 
     9: export type LicenseRecord = {
    10:   key: string;
    11:   product_id?: string;
    12:   valid?: boolean;
    13:   expires_at?: string | null;
    14:   verifiedAt?: number;
    15: };
    16: 
    17: function ensureDir() {
    18:   const dir = path.dirname(STORE);
    19:   if (!fs.existsSync(dir)) fs.mkdirSync(dir, { recursive: true });
    20: }
    21: 
    22: export function readLicense(): LicenseRecord | null {
    23:   try {
    24:     if (!fs.existsSync(STORE)) return null;
    25:     const raw = fs.readFileSync(STORE, 'utf8');
    26:     return JSON.parse(raw) as LicenseRecord;
    27:   } catch (e) {
    28:     return null;
    29:   }
    30: }
    31: 
    32: export function saveLicense(rec: LicenseRecord) {
    33:   try {
    34:     ensureDir();
    35:     fs.writeFileSync(STORE, JSON.stringify(rec, null, 2), 'utf8');
    36:     return true;
    37:   } catch (e) {
    38:     return false;
    39:   }
    40: }
    41: 
    42: async function verifyWithGumroad(key: string, productId?: string) {
    43:   const token = process.env.GUMROAD_TOKEN;
    44:   if (!token) throw new Error('GUMROAD_TOKEN not configured');
    45:   const url = `https://api.gumroad.com/v2/licenses/verify`;
    46:   const body = new URLSearchParams();
    47:   body.append('product_permalink', productId || '');
    48:   body.append('license_key', key);
    49: 
    50:   const res = await fetch(url, { method: 'POST', body, headers: { Authorization: `Bearer ${token}` } });
    51:   const json: any = await res.json();
    52:   return json;
    53: }
    54: 
    55: export async function activateLicense(key: string, productId?: string) {
    56:   const resp: any = await verifyWithGumroad(key, productId);
    57:   if (resp && (resp as any).success) {
    58:     const purchase = (resp as any).purchase || {};
    59:     const lic = { key, product_id: purchase.product_id || productId, valid: true, expires_at: purchase ? purchase.license_expires_at : null, verifiedAt: Date.now() } as LicenseRecord;
    60:     saveLicense(lic);
    61:     return { ok: true, license: lic, raw: resp };
    62:   }
    63:   // failure
    64:   const lic = { key, product_id: productId, valid: false, verifiedAt: Date.now() } as LicenseRecord;
    65:   saveLicense(lic);
    66:   return { ok: false, error: resp };
    67: }
    68: 
    69: export default { readLicense, saveLicense, activateLicense };
    70:

     1: // ROME-TAG: 0x0E71A8
     2: 
     3: import colors from './colors';
     4: 
     5: export const logger = {
     6:   info: (msg: string) => console.log(`\x1b[36m[QFLUSH]\x1b[0m ${msg}`),
     7:   warn: (msg: string) => console.log(`\x1b[33m[QFLUSH]\x1b[0m ${msg}`),
     8:   error: (msg: string) => console.error(`\x1b[31m[QFLUSH]\x1b[0m ${msg}`),
     9:   success: (msg: string) => console.log(`\x1b[32m[QFLUSH]\x1b[0m ${msg}`),
    10:   joker: (title: string, msg: string) => colors.styledLog(title, msg, { accent: 'joker' }),
    11:   nez: (title: string, msg: string) => colors.styledLog(title, msg, { accent: 'base' }),
    12:   neutral: (title: string, msg: string) => colors.styledLog(title, msg, { accent: 'neutral' }),
    13: };
    14: 
    15: export default logger;
    16:

FILE: src\utils\normalize.ts
============================
============================
     1: import * as fs from 'fs';
     2: 
     3: export function stripRomeTagLines(textOrBuffer: string | Buffer): string {
     4:   const txt = Buffer.isBuffer(textOrBuffer) ? textOrBuffer.toString('utf8') : textOrBuffer;
     5:   const lines = txt.split(/\r?\n/);
     6:   const out = lines.filter(l => !/^\s*\/\/\s*ROME-TAG:/i.test(l));
     7:   return out.join('\n');
     8: }
     9: 
    10: export function stripRomeTagFromFile(filePath: string): string {
    11:   const raw = fs.readFileSync(filePath, 'utf8');
    12:   return stripRomeTagLines(raw);
    13: }
    14: 
    15: export default { stripRomeTagLines, stripRomeTagFromFile };
    16: 


============================
FILE: src\utils\npz.ts
============================
============================
     1: // ROME-TAG: 0x1553F0
     2: 
     3: import { spawnSync } from 'child_process';
     4: import { existsSync } from 'fs';
     5: import * as path from 'path';
     6: import logger from './logger';
     7: import { SERVICE_MAP } from './paths';
     8: 
     9: export type ResolveResult = { gate: 'green' | 'yellow' | 'dlx' | 'fail'; cmd?: string; args?: string[]; cwd?: string };
    10: 
    11: function isWindows() {
    12:   return process.platform === 'win32';
    13: }
    14: 
    15: function findLocalBin(moduleName: string, cwd: string): string | null {
    16:   // try node_modules/.bin/<name> or <pkg>/bin
    17:   const localBin = path.join(cwd, 'node_modules', '.bin', moduleName + (isWindows() ? '.cmd' : ''));
    18:   if (existsSync(localBin)) return localBin;
    19:   // try package bin entry via require.resolve
    20:   try {
    21:     const pkgPath = require.resolve(moduleName, { paths: [cwd] });
    22:     return pkgPath;
    23:   } catch {
    24:     return null;
    25:   }
    26: }
    27: 
    28: function resolveViaModuleGate(pkgName: string): { cmd: string; args: string[]; cwd?: string } | null {
    29:   try {
    30:     const pkgPath = require.resolve(pkgName);
    31:     // run via node <pkgPath>
    32:     return { cmd: process.execPath, args: [pkgPath], cwd: path.dirname(pkgPath) };
    33:   } catch {
    34:     return null;
    35:   }
    36: }
    37: 
    38: export function npzResolve(nameOrPkg: string, opts: { cwd?: string } = {}): ResolveResult {
    39:   const cwd = opts.cwd || process.cwd();
    40: 
    41:   // Gate 0: if nameOrPkg matches a known SERVICE_MAP package, prefer local candidates in workspace
    42:   try {
    43:     for (const key of Object.keys(SERVICE_MAP)) {
    44:       if (SERVICE_MAP[key].pkg === nameOrPkg) {
    45:         const tries = SERVICE_MAP[key].candidates || [];
    46:         for (const t of tries) {
    47:           const candidatePath = path.join(cwd, t);
    48:           try {
    49:             if (!existsSync(candidatePath)) continue;
    50:             // prefer dist entry if exists
    51:             const distEntry = path.join(candidatePath, 'dist', 'index.js');
    52:             if (existsSync(distEntry)) {
    53:               logger.nez && logger.nez('NPZ:JOKER', `${nameOrPkg} -> local dist ${distEntry}`);
    54:               return { gate: 'green', cmd: process.execPath, args: [distEntry], cwd: path.dirname(distEntry) };
    55:             }
    56:             // otherwise if package.json with start script exists, prefer npm --prefix <candidate> run start
    57:             const pkgJsonPath = path.join(candidatePath, 'package.json');
    58:             if (existsSync(pkgJsonPath)) {
    59:               try {
    60:                 const pj = require(pkgJsonPath);
    61:                 if (pj && pj.scripts && pj.scripts.start) {
    62:                   logger.nez && logger.nez('NPZ:JOKER', `${nameOrPkg} -> local start script at ${candidatePath}`);
    63:                   return { gate: 'green', cmd: 'npm', args: ['--prefix', candidatePath, 'run', 'start'], cwd: candidatePath };
    64:                 }
    65:               } catch (e) {
    66:                 // ignore
    67:               }
    68:             }
    69:           } catch (e) {
    70:             // ignore candidate
    71:           }
    72:         }
    73:         break;
    74:       }
    75:     }
    76:   } catch (e) {
    77:     // ignore
    78:   }
    79: 
    80:   // Gate 1: GREEN - local bin
    81:   const local = findLocalBin(nameOrPkg, cwd);
    82:   if (local) {
    83:     logger.nez && logger.nez('NPZ:JOKER', `${nameOrPkg} -> ${local}`);
    84:     return { gate: 'green', cmd: local, args: [], cwd };
    85:   }
    86: 
    87:   // Gate 2: YELLOW - module resolution
    88:   const mod = resolveViaModuleGate(nameOrPkg);
    89:   if (mod) {
    90:     logger.nez && logger.nez('NPZ:JOKER', `${nameOrPkg} -> ${mod.cmd} ${mod.args.join(' ')}`);
    91:     return { gate: 'yellow', cmd: mod.cmd, args: mod.args, cwd: mod.cwd };
    92:   }
    93: 
    94:   // Gate 3: DLX - use npm exec as modern fallback, fallback to npx if needed
    95:   try {
    96:     // prefer `npm exec -- <pkg>` which is the modern replacement for npx (npm v7+)
    97:     // This will allow running installed or remote packages consistently.
    98:     logger.joker && logger.joker('NPZ:JOKER', `${nameOrPkg} -> npm exec`);
    99:     return { gate: 'dlx', cmd: 'npm', args: ['exec', '--', nameOrPkg], cwd };
   100:   } catch (err) {
   101:     // last-resort: npx
   102:     try {
   103:       logger.joker && logger.joker('NPZ:JOKER', `${nameOrPkg} -> npx`);
   104:       return { gate: 'dlx', cmd: 'npx', args: [nameOrPkg], cwd };
   105:     } catch (e) {
   106:       logger.warn && logger.warn(`[NPZ:JOKER][FAIL] ${nameOrPkg} cannot be resolved`);
   107:       return { gate: 'fail' };
   108:     }
   109:   }
   110: }
   111: 
   112: export function runResolved(res: ResolveResult): { ok: boolean; status?: number } {
   113:   if (!res.cmd) return { ok: false };
   114:   const args = res.args || [];
   115:   logger.nez && logger.nez('NPZ:JOKER', `running ${res.cmd} ${args.join(' ')}`);
   116:   try {
   117:     const r = spawnSync(res.cmd, args, { stdio: 'inherit', cwd: res.cwd || process.cwd(), shell: false });
   118:     return { ok: r.status === 0, status: r.status ?? undefined };
   119:   } catch (err) {
   120:     logger.error && logger.error(`[NPZ:JOKER] failed to run ${err}`);
   121:     return { ok: false };
   122:   }
   123: }
   124: 
   125: export default { npzResolve, runResolved };
   126: 


============================
FILE: src\utils\NPZ_README.md
============================
============================
     1: # NPZ Joker (Gotham Customs) v2.0
     2: 
     3: NPZ ("Joker") is the internal resolver/router used by qflush to start modules and proxy requests across multiple lanes (primary/backup). It provides:
     4: 
     5: - Gate-based resolver for binaries/modules: GREEN (local bin), YELLOW (module), DLX (npx), FAIL
     6: - HTTP proxy router with T0/T1/T2 flow: try primary, fallback, then replay primary with extra header
     7: - Douane (customs) checks before starting modules (env, files, ports)
     8: - Request tracking with `npz_id` and optional Redis store
     9: - Circuit breaker per-host per-lane and adaptive preferred lane ordering
    10: - Prometheus metrics and an admin API
    11: 
    12: ## v2.0 changes
    13: 
    14: - Namespaced keys and metrics via `NPZ_NAMESPACE` to avoid cross-app conflicts
    15: - Redis-backed store optional via `REDIS_URL`
    16: - Prometheus metrics and `/metrics` endpoint
    17: - Admin endpoints protected by `NPZ_ADMIN_TOKEN`
    18: - NPZ integrated as primary resolver for `qflush start` and as middleware in the daemon
    19: 
    20: Usage
    21: 
    22: - Middleware: `npzMiddleware()` to proxy requests via `/proxy` route
    23: - Admin: `/npz/inspect/:id`, `/npz/lanes`, `/npz/preferred/:host`, `/npz/circuit/:host` (protected by `NPZ_ADMIN_TOKEN` header or `?token=`)
    24: - Metrics: `/metrics` endpoint
    25: 
    26: Environment
    27: 
    28: - `REDIS_URL` to enable Redis-backed store
    29: - `NPZ_ADMIN_TOKEN` to protect admin endpoints
    30: - `qflushD_PORT` to set the daemon port
    31: 
    32: Files of interest
    33: 
    34: - `src/utils/npz.ts` - Joker resolver
    35: - `src/utils/npz-router.ts` - HTTP router with lanes and circuit breaker
    36: - `src/utils/npz-customs.ts` - customs scanners
    37: - `src/utils/npz-middleware.ts` - Express middleware for proxying and tracking
    38: - `src/utils/npz-store.ts` - unified store (file or redis)
    39: - `src/utils/npz-store-redis.ts` - Redis-backed store
    40: - `src/utils/npz-metrics.ts` - /metrics middleware
    41: - `src/utils/npz-admin.ts` - admin endpoints
    42: 
    43: Example
    44: 
    45: Start the daemon:
    46: 
    47: ```
    48: REDIS_URL=redis://127.0.0.1:6379 NPZ_ADMIN_TOKEN=secret node dist/daemon/qflushd.js
    49: ```
    50: 
    51: Proxy a request (example):
    52: 
    53: ```
    54: curl -v http://localhost:4500/proxy/api/health
    55: 
    56: 
    57: 
    58:

FILE: src\utils\npz-admin.ts
============================
============================
     1: // ROME-TAG: 0x332555
     2: 
     3: import express from 'express';
     4: import npzStore from './npz-store';
     5: import npzRouter from './npz-router';
     6: import engine from './npz-engine';
     7: import { stringify } from 'csv-stringify/sync';
     8: import { isAdminAuthorized } from './auth';
     9: 
    10: const router = express.Router();
    11: 
    12: function requireToken(req: any, res: any, next: any) {
    13:   if (!isAdminAuthorized(req)) return res.status(401).json({ error: 'unauthorized' });
    14:   next();
    15: }
    16: 
    17: router.use('/npz', requireToken);
    18: 
    19: router.get('/npz/inspect/:id', async (req: any, res: any) => {
    20:   const r = await npzStore.getRequestRecord(req.params.id);
    21:   res.json(r || { error: 'not found' });
    22: });
    23: 
    24: router.get('/npz/lanes', (req: any, res: any) => {
    25:   res.json(npzRouter.DEFAULT_LANES);
    26: });
    27: 
    28: router.get('/npz/preferred/:host', (req: any, res: any) => {
    29:   const host = req.params.host;
    30:   const pref = npzRouter.getPreferredLane(host);
    31:   res.json({ host, preferred: pref });
    32: });
    33: 
    34: router.get('/npz/circuit/:host', (req: any, res: any) => {
    35:   const host = req.params.host;
    36:   const state = npzRouter.getCircuitState(host);
    37:   res.json(state);
    38: });
    39: 
    40: // Admin scores endpoint
    41: router.get('/npz/scores', (req: any, res: any) => {
    42:   try {
    43:     const store = engine.getStore();
    44:     const items = Object.values(store).map((r: any) => ({ laneId: r.laneId, score: r.score, lastSuccess: r.lastSuccess, lastFailure: r.lastFailure }));
    45:     items.sort((a: any, b: any) => a.score - b.score);
    46:     res.json(items);
    47:   } catch (err) {
    48:     res.status(500).json({ error: String(err) });
    49:   }
    50: });
    51: 
    52: router.post('/npz/scores/reset', (req: any, res: any) => {
    53:   try {
    54:     engine.resetScores();
    55:     res.json({ ok: true });
    56:   } catch (err) {
    57:     res.status(500).json({ error: String(err) });
    58:   }
    59: });
    60: 
    61: router.get('/npz/scores.csv', (req: any, res: any) => {
    62:   try {
    63:     const store = engine.getStore();
    64:     const items = Object.values(store).map((r: any) => ({ laneId: r.laneId, score: r.score, lastSuccess: r.lastSuccess, lastFailure: r.lastFailure }));
    65:     items.sort((a: any, b: any) => a.score - b.score);
    66:     const csv = stringify(items, { header: true });
    67:     res.set('Content-Type', 'text/csv');
    68:     res.send(csv);
    69:   } catch (err) {
    70:     res.status(500).json({ error: String(err) });
    71:   }
    72: });
    73: 
    74: export default router;
    75:
