============================
FILE: tools\rome-lint.js
============================
============================
     1: #!/usr/bin/env node
     2: const fs = require('fs');
     3: const path = require('path');
     4: 
     5: const ROOT = path.join(__dirname, '..');
     6: const DIST_TAG = path.join(ROOT, 'dist', 'rome', 'rome-tag.js');
     7: let rome = null;
     8: try {
     9:   rome = require(DIST_TAG);
    10: } catch (e) {
    11:   // fallback to local JS if not built
    12:   try { rome = require('../src/rome/rome-tag'); } catch (e2) { console.error('rome-tag module not found; run npm run build'); process.exit(2); }
    13: }
    14: 
    15: const FIX = process.argv.includes('--fix');
    16: 
    17: function inferTypeFromPath(relPath) {
    18:   if (relPath.startsWith('src/daemon/')) return 'daemon';
    19:   if (relPath.startsWith('src/commands/')) return 'command';
    20:   if (relPath.startsWith('src/tests/')) return 'test';
    21:   if (relPath.startsWith('src/utils/')) return 'util';
    22:   if (relPath.includes('/lib/') || relPath.includes('/dist/')) return 'lib';
    23:   return 'file';
    24: }
    25: 
    26: function loadIndex() {
    27:   try {
    28:     const idxPath = path.join(process.cwd(), '.qflush', 'rome-index.json');
    29:     if (fs.existsSync(idxPath)) return JSON.parse(fs.readFileSync(idxPath,'utf8')||'{}');
    30:   } catch (e) {}
    31:   return {};
    32: }
    33: 
    34: function lintFile(absPath, index) {
    35:   const rel = path.relative(process.cwd(), absPath).replace(/\\/g,'/');
    36:   const relNorm = rel.replace(/^\.?\//,'');
    37:   const typeFromIndex = index && index[relNorm] && index[relNorm].type;
    38:   const type = typeFromIndex || inferTypeFromPath(relNorm);
    39: 
    40:   const content = fs.readFileSync(absPath,'utf8');
    41:   const lines = content.split(/\r?\n/);
    42: 
    43:   let existingTag = null;
    44:   let tagLineIndex = -1;
    45:   for (let i=0;i<Math.min(5, lines.length); i++) {
    46:     const parsed = rome.parseRomeTagComment(lines[i]);
    47:     if (parsed != null) { existingTag = parsed; tagLineIndex = i; break; }
    48:   }
    49: 
    50:   const computed = rome.computeRomeTag({ type, path: relNorm });
    51:   const expectedComment = rome.buildRomeTagComment(computed);
    52: 
    53:   if (existingTag == null || existingTag !== computed) {
    54:     if (FIX) {
    55:       if (tagLineIndex === -1) {
    56:         lines.unshift(expectedComment, '');
    57:       } else {
    58:         lines[tagLineIndex] = expectedComment;
    59:       }
    60:       fs.writeFileSync(absPath, lines.join('\n'), 'utf8');
    61:       console.log(`[FIX] ${relNorm} -> ${expectedComment}`);
    62:     } else {
    63:       console.warn(`[MISMATCH] ${relNorm}: expected ${expectedComment} found ${existingTag ? rome.toRomeTagHex(existingTag) : 'none'}`);
    64:     }
    65:   } else {
    66:     console.log(`[OK] ${relNorm} (${rome.toRomeTagHex(computed)})`);
    67:   }
    68: }
    69: 
    70: function walk(dir, index) {
    71:   const items = fs.readdirSync(dir);
    72:   for (const it of items) {
    73:     if (it === 'node_modules' || it === '.git') continue;
    74:     const full = path.join(dir,it);
    75:     const st = fs.statSync(full);
    76:     if (st.isDirectory()) walk(full,index);
    77:     else {
    78:       const ext = path.extname(it).toLowerCase();
    79:       if (!['.ts','.js','.tsx','.jsx','.json','.html'].includes(ext)) continue;
    80:       lintFile(full,index);
    81:     }
    82:   }
    83: }
    84: 
    85: const index = loadIndex();
    86: walk(path.join(process.cwd(),'src'), index);
    87: 
    88: console.log('done');
    89: 


============================
FILE: tools\rome-report.js
============================
============================
     1: #!/usr/bin/env node
     2: const fs = require('fs');
     3: const path = require('path');
     4: 
     5: const reportPath = path.join(process.cwd(), '.qflush', 'rome-lint-report.json');
     6: if (!fs.existsSync(reportPath)) {
     7:   console.error('report not found, run tools/rome-lint.js --report first');
     8:   process.exit(2);
     9: }
    10: const report = JSON.parse(fs.readFileSync(reportPath,'utf8'));
    11: 
    12: let html = `<!doctype html><html><head><meta charset="utf-8"><title>Rome Lint Report</title><style>body{font-family:system-ui,Segoe UI,Roboto,Arial}table{border-collapse:collapse;width:100%}td,th{border:1px solid #ddd;padding:8px}th{background:#f4f4f4}</style></head><body>`;
    13: html += `<h1>Rome Lint Report</h1>`;
    14: html += `<p>Summary: files=${report.summary.files} warnings=${report.summary.warnings} errors=${report.summary.errors} todos=${report.summary.todos}</p>`;
    15: 
    16: html += `<h2>Forbidden Imports</h2><table><tr><th>file</th><th>import</th></tr>`;
    17: for (const fi of report.forbiddenImports) html += `<tr><td>${fi.file}</td><td>${fi.import}</td></tr>`;
    18: html += `</table>`;
    19: 
    20: html += `<h2>Tag mismatches</h2><table><tr><th>file</th><th>expected</th><th>found</th></tr>`;
    21: for (const f of report.files.filter(x=>x.mismatchedTag)) html += `<tr><td>${f.path}</td><td>${f.expected||''}</td><td>${f.found||''}</td></tr>`;
    22: html += `</table>`;
    23: 
    24: html += `<h2>Todos</h2><ul>`;
    25: for (const t of report.todos) html += `<li>${t.file} @ ${t.index} -> ${t.match}</li>`;
    26: html += `</ul>`;
    27: 
    28: html += `</body></html>`;
    29: const out = path.join(process.cwd(), '.qflush', 'rome-report.html');
    30: fs.writeFileSync(out, html, 'utf8');
    31: console.log('Rome report generated at', out);
    32: 


============================
FILE: tools\run-tests-with-qflushd.js
============================
============================
     1: (async () => {
     2:   try {
     3:     const path = require('path');
     4:     const child_process = require('child_process');
     5:     const qflushdPath = path.join(process.cwd(), 'dist', 'daemon', 'qflushd.js');
     6:     let serverModule;
     7:     try {
     8:       serverModule = require(qflushdPath);
     9:     } catch (e) {
    10:       console.error('Failed to require qflushd at', qflushdPath, e);
    11:       process.exit(1);
    12:     }
    13: 
    14:     const start = serverModule.startServer || (serverModule.default && serverModule.default.startServer);
    15:     const stop = serverModule.stopServer || (serverModule.default && serverModule.default.stopServer);
    16:     if (typeof start !== 'function') {
    17:       console.error('startServer not found');
    18:       process.exit(1);
    19:     }
    20: 
    21:     console.log('Starting qflushd...');
    22:     await start(4500);
    23:     console.log('qflushd started on 4500');
    24: 
    25:     const vitestArgs = ['vitest', 'run', '--reporter', 'verbose', '--testTimeout', '60000'];
    26:     const runner = child_process.spawn('npx', vitestArgs, { stdio: 'inherit', shell: true });
    27:     runner.on('exit', async (code) => {
    28:       console.log('vitest exited with', code, 'stopping qflushd...');
    29:       try { if (typeof stop === 'function') await stop(); } catch (e) { console.error('stop failed', e); }
    30:       process.exit(code ?? 0);
    31:     });
    32:     runner.on('error', (err) => { console.error('vitest spawn failed', err); process.exit(1); });
    33:   } catch (e) {
    34:     console.error('run failed', e);
    35:     process.exit(1);
    36:   }
    37: })();

FILE: TRADEMARK.md
============================
============================
     1: FUNESTERIE TRADEMARK POLICY
     2: 
     3: The following names are protected:
     4: - "Funesterie™"
     5: - "FCL"
     6: - "Funesterie Config Language"
     7: - The Funesterie logo and pirate branding
     8: 
     9: You may NOT:
    10: ✗ Use these names for your own products
    11: ✗ Publish tools named “FCL” or “Funesterie Something”
    12: ✗ Create domains including Funesterie/FCL
    13: ✗ Use branding without permission
    14: 
    15: You may:
    16: ✓ Mention Funesterie™ in documentation
    17: ✓ Say “supports FCL” if technically accurate
    18: ✓ Link to official Funesterie repositories
    19:

============================
FILE: vitest.setup.js
============================
============================
     1: // Prevent tests from terminating the process when some legacy test files call process.exit()
     2: // Make it a no-op and log a warning instead so the test runner can continue.
     3: const originalExit = process.exit;
     4: process.exit = function(code) {
     5:   try {
     6:     console.warn('[vitest.setup] intercepted process.exit(', code, ')');
     7:   } catch (_) {}
     8:   return undefined;
     9: };
    10: // restore hook if needed
    11: process.on('exit', (code) => {
    12:   // noop
    13: });
    14: 
    15: // Force cortex mode for tests to avoid requiring HTTP daemon and ports
    16: process.env.QFLUSH_MODE = 'cortex';
    17: 
    18: // Start the compiled qflush daemon during tests when VITEST env var is set and mode allows it
    19: if (process.env.VITEST) {
    20:   try {
    21:     // default port used in CI/tests
    22:     const port = process.env.QFLUSHD_PORT ? Number(process.env.QFLUSHD_PORT) : 43421;
    23:     // ensure Redis disabled in test env unless explicitly enabled
    24:     if (!process.env.QFLUSH_ENABLE_REDIS) process.env.QFLUSH_ENABLE_REDIS = '0';
    25: 
    26:     // In cortex mode we prefer the PNG bus; only start the daemon if explicitly required by tests
    27:     if (process.env.QFLUSH_MODE !== 'cortex') {
    28:       const daemon = require('./dist/daemon/qflushd');
    29:       if (daemon && typeof daemon.startServer === 'function') {
    30:         // only start if not already running
    31:         try {
    32:           daemon.startServer(port);
    33:           console.warn('[vitest.setup] started qflush daemon on port', port);
    34:         } catch (e) {
    35:           console.warn('[vitest.setup] failed to start daemon:', String(e));
    36:         }
    37:       } else {
    38:         console.warn('[vitest.setup] compiled daemon does not export startServer (./dist/daemon/qflushd)');
    39:       }
    40:     } else {
    41:       console.warn('[vitest.setup] running tests in CORTEX mode (no HTTP daemon)');
    42:     }
    43:   } catch (e) {
    44:     // if dist file is missing or require fails, log for CI visibility; tests may still mock network calls
    45:     console.warn('[vitest.setup] could not require compiled daemon:', String(e));
    46:   }
    47: }
    48:
